Odisha has recorded 108 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 2,262; 50 people dead
Description: Rajasthan on Monday reported 77 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,262. With the nine deaths reported today, total 50 people have died in the state. Jaipur with 833 cases, Jodhpur with 375 cases, Kota with 165 cases, Ajmer with 124 cases and Tonk with 123 cases are the five worst affected districts.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 2,262; 50 people dead Rajasthan on Monday reported 77 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,262. With the nine deaths reported today, total 50 people have died in the state. Jaipur with 833 cases, Jodhpur with 375 cases, Kota with 165 cases, Ajmer with 124 cases and Tonk with 123 cases are the five worst affected districts.

Headline: India needs to develop an Indian version of Twitter: BJP MP Hegde to PM Modi
Description: BJP MP Anantkumar Hegde has written to PM Narendra Modi saying that India needs to develop an Indian version of Twitter to ensure 'sovereignty'. He added that Twitter promoted "digital colonisation" and "interference in free speech". His comments come after his account was blocked for tweeting about the Tablighi Jamaat and its "hidden agenda in India and around the world".
Text: India needs to develop an Indian version of Twitter: BJP MP Hegde to PM Modi BJP MP Anantkumar Hegde has written to PM Narendra Modi saying that India needs to develop an Indian version of Twitter to ensure 'sovereignty'. He added that Twitter promoted "digital colonisation" and "interference in free speech". His comments come after his account was blocked for tweeting about the Tablighi Jamaat and its "hidden agenda in India and around the world".

Headline: Over 80% wheat crop harvested in the country: Home Ministry
Description: More than 80% of the wheat crop was harvested in the country till April 26 and about 2,000 or 80% of the major 'mandis' (wholesale markets) are operational now, said Punya Salila Srivastava, a joint secretary in the Union Home Ministry. Over two crore people got employment in water conservation and irrigation works under the MGNREGA till now, she added.
Text: Over 80% wheat crop harvested in the country: Home Ministry More than 80% of the wheat crop was harvested in the country till April 26 and about 2,000 or 80% of the major 'mandis' (wholesale markets) are operational now, said Punya Salila Srivastava, a joint secretary in the Union Home Ministry. Over two crore people got employment in water conservation and irrigation works under the MGNREGA till now, she added.

Headline: Bail granted to 2 men who allegedly attacked Arnab and his wife
Description: Two men, who were arrested for allegedly attacking Republic TV Editor-in-chief Arnab Goswami and his wife in Mumbai, were produced in a court on Monday and granted bail on payment of ₹15,000 cash each. The alleged attack took place at midnight on April 22 while Goswami and his wife were on their way back home. The couple escaped unhurt.
Text: Bail granted to 2 men who allegedly attacked Arnab and his wife Two men, who were arrested for allegedly attacking Republic TV Editor-in-chief Arnab Goswami and his wife in Mumbai, were produced in a court on Monday and granted bail on payment of ₹15,000 cash each. The alleged attack took place at midnight on April 22 while Goswami and his wife were on their way back home. The couple escaped unhurt.

Headline: Balakot strike, Art 370 revocation will have lasting imprint: Pak Army Chief
Description: The Balakot air strike and revocation of Article 370 in J&K are two events that will have a lasting imprint on the geopolitical situation of South Asia, Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa said. Kashmir is a nuclear flashpoint, he added in an article published in 'Green Book 2020', a research journal of the Pakistan Army.
Text: Balakot strike, Art 370 revocation will have lasting imprint: Pak Army Chief The Balakot air strike and revocation of Article 370 in J&K are two events that will have a lasting imprint on the geopolitical situation of South Asia, Pakistan Army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa said. Kashmir is a nuclear flashpoint, he added in an article published in 'Green Book 2020', a research journal of the Pakistan Army.

Headline: Trump nominates Indian-American Manisha Singh as US envoy to OECD
Description: US President Donald Trump nominated Indian-American diplomat Manisha Singh as the country's next envoy to the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD). Singh is currently the Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs. Singh's private sector experience includes practising law at multinational law firms and working in-house at an investment bank.
Text: Trump nominates Indian-American Manisha Singh as US envoy to OECD US President Donald Trump nominated Indian-American diplomat Manisha Singh as the country's next envoy to the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD). Singh is currently the Assistant Secretary of State for Economic and Business Affairs. Singh's private sector experience includes practising law at multinational law firms and working in-house at an investment bank.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in 85 districts in 14 days; cases in India cross 28,000
Description: The government on Monday revealed that as many as 85 districts have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days, while 16 districts haven't reported a new case in last 28 days. Further, the total number of cases in India has risen to 28,380, while the death toll has surged to 886.
Text: No new coronavirus case in 85 districts in 14 days; cases in India cross 28,000 The government on Monday revealed that as many as 85 districts have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days, while 16 districts haven't reported a new case in last 28 days. Further, the total number of cases in India has risen to 28,380, while the death toll has surged to 886.

Headline: 33 healthcare workers test positive for coronavirus at Max hospital in New Delhi
Description: At least 33 healthcare workers at the Max Super Speciality Hospital in Delhi's Patparganj area have tested positive for coronavirus. Out of the 33 workers, two are doctors and 23 are nursing staff, while the remaining are technicians and support staff. All of them have been shifted to Max Hospital, Saket.
Text: 33 healthcare workers test positive for coronavirus at Max hospital in New Delhi At least 33 healthcare workers at the Max Super Speciality Hospital in Delhi's Patparganj area have tested positive for coronavirus. Out of the 33 workers, two are doctors and 23 are nursing staff, while the remaining are technicians and support staff. All of them have been shifted to Max Hospital, Saket.

Headline: Discussed extending lockdown post May 3 in the state: Meghalaya CM after PM meet
Description: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma has said that during a meeting with PM Narendra Modi through video conferencing he discussed extending the coronavirus lockdown in the state after May 3. Sangma tweeted that he also discussed giving relaxations in Green Zones or districts which have not been affected by coronavirus. Several CMs were present during the video conferencing session.
Text: Discussed extending lockdown post May 3 in the state: Meghalaya CM after PM meet Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma has said that during a meeting with PM Narendra Modi through video conferencing he discussed extending the coronavirus lockdown in the state after May 3. Sangma tweeted that he also discussed giving relaxations in Green Zones or districts which have not been affected by coronavirus. Several CMs were present during the video conferencing session.

Headline: PM said spike in COVID-19 cases could happen in June, July: Chhattisgarh Minister
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that a spike in coronavirus cases could happen in June and July, so all the activities must be done accordingly, Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has said. Deo was present along with Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel during a video conferencing session with PM Modi today.
Text: PM said spike in COVID-19 cases could happen in June, July: Chhattisgarh Minister Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that a spike in coronavirus cases could happen in June and July, so all the activities must be done accordingly, Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has said. Deo was present along with Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel during a video conferencing session with PM Modi today.

Headline: 5 Northeast states coronavirus-free, no new cases in other 3: Jitendra Singh
Description: Minister of State for the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER) Jitendra Singh on Monday said that five out of the eight states in the Northeast are coronavirus-free now. He said that those five states are Sikkim, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur and Tripura. He added that Assam, Meghalaya and Mizoram have not reported new cases in recent past.
Text: 5 Northeast states coronavirus-free, no new cases in other 3: Jitendra Singh Minister of State for the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER) Jitendra Singh on Monday said that five out of the eight states in the Northeast are coronavirus-free now. He said that those five states are Sikkim, Nagaland, Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur and Tripura. He added that Assam, Meghalaya and Mizoram have not reported new cases in recent past.

Headline: 1 cured of COVID-19 discharged, total cases now 3: Puducherry Minister
Description: Puducherry Health Minister Malladi Krishna Rao on Monday said that the number of coronavirus active cases in the Union Territory has fallen to three from four after a patient tested negative on Sunday. Rao said that the Union Territory had total eight cases and four had recovered earlier. The results of two of the three active cases are expected tomorrow.
Text: 1 cured of COVID-19 discharged, total cases now 3: Puducherry Minister Puducherry Health Minister Malladi Krishna Rao on Monday said that the number of coronavirus active cases in the Union Territory has fallen to three from four after a patient tested negative on Sunday. Rao said that the Union Territory had total eight cases and four had recovered earlier. The results of two of the three active cases are expected tomorrow.

Headline: Every 7th doctor in US is Indian and they're working as soldiers: AAPI Prez
Description: American Association of Physicians of Indian Origin (AAPI) President Dr Suresh Reddy has said that "every seventh doctor in the US is an Indian and they are at the front lines, working as soldiers and fighting the virus." He said that the US government officials have appreciated the work of Indian doctors and community members.
Text: Every 7th doctor in US is Indian and they're working as soldiers: AAPI Prez American Association of Physicians of Indian Origin (AAPI) President Dr Suresh Reddy has said that "every seventh doctor in the US is an Indian and they are at the front lines, working as soldiers and fighting the virus." He said that the US government officials have appreciated the work of Indian doctors and community members.

Headline: PM announces COVID warriors website to connect people with local authorities
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday announced that the government has launched covidwarriors.gov.in website which links volunteers of social organisations and representatives of local administration. PM Modi said that it includes doctors, nurses, ASHA workers, NCC and NSS officers. "These people are of immense help at the local level in preparing Crisis Management Plans and implementing them," he added.
Text: PM announces COVID warriors website to connect people with local authorities PM Narendra Modi on Sunday announced that the government has launched covidwarriors.gov.in website which links volunteers of social organisations and representatives of local administration. PM Modi said that it includes doctors, nurses, ASHA workers, NCC and NSS officers. "These people are of immense help at the local level in preparing Crisis Management Plans and implementing them," he added.

Headline: ICMR asks states to stop using COVID-19 rapid test kits from 2 Chinese companies
Description: In a new advisory, ICMR advised state governments to stop using coronavirus rapid antibody test kits from two Chinese manufacturers, Guangzhou Wondfo Biotech and Zhuhai Livzon Diagnostics. "The results have shown wide variation in...sensitivity, despite early promise of good performance for surveillance purposes," ICMR said. States have been advised to return them to be sent back to the suppliers.
Text: ICMR asks states to stop using COVID-19 rapid test kits from 2 Chinese companies In a new advisory, ICMR advised state governments to stop using coronavirus rapid antibody test kits from two Chinese manufacturers, Guangzhou Wondfo Biotech and Zhuhai Livzon Diagnostics. "The results have shown wide variation in...sensitivity, despite early promise of good performance for surveillance purposes," ICMR said. States have been advised to return them to be sent back to the suppliers.

Headline: Appeal to all to support Rajasthan's migrant workers returning home: CM
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that the state's native migrant workers will soon be returning home from other states. "These people suffered a lot during (coronavirus) lockdown. My appeal to all is please give moral support to our brothers and sisters returning home," said Gehlot on Twitter. "Following culture of Rajasthan...take proper care of the migrants," he added.
Text: Appeal to all to support Rajasthan's migrant workers returning home: CM Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that the state's native migrant workers will soon be returning home from other states. "These people suffered a lot during (coronavirus) lockdown. My appeal to all is please give moral support to our brothers and sisters returning home," said Gehlot on Twitter. "Following culture of Rajasthan...take proper care of the migrants," he added.

Headline: Details of procurement of COVID-19 equipment must be made public: Cong
Description: Congress has alleged that profiteering was being done in procurement of equipment like COVID-19 tests, PPEs for doctors and ventilators for patients and demanded that details of these be made public by government. Party spokesperson Manish Tewari said there's "absolute anarchy" in procurement of COVID-19 tests. "These transactions must be transparently placed in public domain," he said.
Text: Details of procurement of COVID-19 equipment must be made public: Cong Congress has alleged that profiteering was being done in procurement of equipment like COVID-19 tests, PPEs for doctors and ventilators for patients and demanded that details of these be made public by government. Party spokesperson Manish Tewari said there's "absolute anarchy" in procurement of COVID-19 tests. "These transactions must be transparently placed in public domain," he said.

Headline: KGMU becomes 1st govt hospital to launch plasma therapy for COVID-19
Description: King George's Medical University (KGMU) in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh has become the first government hospital in the country to successfully launch the plasma therapy treatment for COVID-19. The first plasma transfusion was conducted on a 58-year-old doctor from Orai. The plasma was extracted from the blood donated by an NRI woman doctor from Canada, the first coronavirus patient of Lucknow.
Text: KGMU becomes 1st govt hospital to launch plasma therapy for COVID-19 King George's Medical University (KGMU) in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh has become the first government hospital in the country to successfully launch the plasma therapy treatment for COVID-19. The first plasma transfusion was conducted on a 58-year-old doctor from Orai. The plasma was extracted from the blood donated by an NRI woman doctor from Canada, the first coronavirus patient of Lucknow.

Headline: Punjab policemen wear badge with name of Harjeet whose hand was chopped off in attack
Description: Expressing solidarity with coronavirus warrior policeman Harjeet Singh whose hand was severed by Nihangs, policemen across Punjab wore a badge with the name of Harjeet. "Let's show everyone that any attack on policemen and doctors, fighting COVID-19 on the frontline, like SI Harjeet Singh, will unite India together as one," Director General of Punjab Police Dinkar Gupta tweeted.
Text: Punjab policemen wear badge with name of Harjeet whose hand was chopped off in attack Expressing solidarity with coronavirus warrior policeman Harjeet Singh whose hand was severed by Nihangs, policemen across Punjab wore a badge with the name of Harjeet. "Let's show everyone that any attack on policemen and doctors, fighting COVID-19 on the frontline, like SI Harjeet Singh, will unite India together as one," Director General of Punjab Police Dinkar Gupta tweeted.

Headline: 60 Indian doctors dance to song 'Happy' amid coronavirus pandemic; video viral
Description: A video of 60 Indian doctors dancing to Pharrell Williams' song 'Happy' amid the coronavirus pandemic has gone viral. The video features healthcare professionals from Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, Delhi, Nagpur, Kanyakumari, and other cities. "We're here to remind you to look after your mental well being too, for the hope of a brighter morning propels us further," the video says.
Text: 60 Indian doctors dance to song 'Happy' amid coronavirus pandemic; video viral A video of 60 Indian doctors dancing to Pharrell Williams' song 'Happy' amid the coronavirus pandemic has gone viral. The video features healthcare professionals from Mumbai, Pune, Bengaluru, Delhi, Nagpur, Kanyakumari, and other cities. "We're here to remind you to look after your mental well being too, for the hope of a brighter morning propels us further," the video says.

Headline: Most Chief Ministers told PM that lockdown should continue: Puducherry CM
Description: Following Prime Minister Narendra Modi's video conference with Chief Ministers, Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy said that most of the Chief Ministers told the PM that the lockdown should continue beyond May 3. He added the CMs said that the economic activities should be started slowly and there should be cautious approach considering the way in which coronavirus cases are increasing.
Text: Most Chief Ministers told PM that lockdown should continue: Puducherry CM Following Prime Minister Narendra Modi's video conference with Chief Ministers, Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy said that most of the Chief Ministers told the PM that the lockdown should continue beyond May 3. He added the CMs said that the economic activities should be started slowly and there should be cautious approach considering the way in which coronavirus cases are increasing.

Headline: Lockdown should be extended with relaxations for economic activities: Goa CM
Description: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said the lockdown should be extended beyond May 3. "Lockdown...should be extended further, with relaxations for economic activities within the state," the CM said. Sawant, who participated in the video conference with PM Narendra Modi, added that many other states have also sought an extension of the lockdown at the meeting.
Text: Lockdown should be extended with relaxations for economic activities: Goa CM Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said the lockdown should be extended beyond May 3. "Lockdown...should be extended further, with relaxations for economic activities within the state," the CM said. Sawant, who participated in the video conference with PM Narendra Modi, added that many other states have also sought an extension of the lockdown at the meeting.

Headline: Lakhs and lakhs can't be quarantined by govt: WB CM Mamata allows home quarantine
Description: Talking about coronavirus situation in West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said, "If a person is tested positive for coronavirus and he has provision to isolate himself at his residence, the person can home quarantine himself." She added, "Lakhs and lakhs can't be quarantined, the government has its own limit." West Bengal has 504 active coronavirus cases.
Text: Lakhs and lakhs can't be quarantined by govt: WB CM Mamata allows home quarantine Talking about coronavirus situation in West Bengal, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said, "If a person is tested positive for coronavirus and he has provision to isolate himself at his residence, the person can home quarantine himself." She added, "Lakhs and lakhs can't be quarantined, the government has its own limit." West Bengal has 504 active coronavirus cases.

Headline: 55 new COVID-19 cases reported in Pune, total cases rise to 1,319
Description: The Pune Health Department on Monday said that the city reported 55 more COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases there to 1,319. According to Health Department officials, the total number of deaths in Pune stood at 80 after three recent casualties due to coronavirus. So far, over 8,000 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Maharashtra.
Text: 55 new COVID-19 cases reported in Pune, total cases rise to 1,319 The Pune Health Department on Monday said that the city reported 55 more COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases there to 1,319. According to Health Department officials, the total number of deaths in Pune stood at 80 after three recent casualties due to coronavirus. So far, over 8,000 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Maharashtra.

Headline: UP CM's 'Agra Model' will turn city into Wuhan: Akhilesh on Mayor's letter
Description: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday criticised UP government over its COVID-19 response by referring to Agra Mayor's letter to CM Yogi Adityanath on deteriorating situation in the city. "CM's much-hyped 'Agra Model' of fighting COVID-19 will, according to the Mayor, fail and make Agra (India's) Wuhan," said Yadav on Twitter. "Wake up government, wake up!" he added.
Text: UP CM's 'Agra Model' will turn city into Wuhan: Akhilesh on Mayor's letter SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday criticised UP government over its COVID-19 response by referring to Agra Mayor's letter to CM Yogi Adityanath on deteriorating situation in the city. "CM's much-hyped 'Agra Model' of fighting COVID-19 will, according to the Mayor, fail and make Agra (India's) Wuhan," said Yadav on Twitter. "Wake up government, wake up!" he added.

Headline: Migrant workers are homesick, Centre must arrange for them to go home: Sena
Description: Shiv Sena on Monday said it's the responsibility of central government to arrange trains and buses for migrant labourers to travel back home amid coronavirus lockdown. "These people are homesick and we cannot assess what would happen if they gather on streets," said an editorial in 'Saamana'. Some people in Maharashtra could "instigate" the workers for political gains, it added.
Text: Migrant workers are homesick, Centre must arrange for them to go home: Sena Shiv Sena on Monday said it's the responsibility of central government to arrange trains and buses for migrant labourers to travel back home amid coronavirus lockdown. "These people are homesick and we cannot assess what would happen if they gather on streets," said an editorial in 'Saamana'. Some people in Maharashtra could "instigate" the workers for political gains, it added.

Headline: Endangered Ganges River Dolphins spotted in Uttar Pradesh, video surfaces
Description: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Akash Deep Badhawan on Monday shared a video of two Ganges River Dolphins swimming in the Ganges in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. "Our national aquatic animal, once lived in the Ganga-Brahmaputra-Meghna river system, is now endangered," he tweeted. "Usually solo, sometimes they're found in small groups, especially Mother and calf," Badhawan further wrote.
Text: Endangered Ganges River Dolphins spotted in Uttar Pradesh, video surfaces Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Akash Deep Badhawan on Monday shared a video of two Ganges River Dolphins swimming in the Ganges in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. "Our national aquatic animal, once lived in the Ganga-Brahmaputra-Meghna river system, is now endangered," he tweeted. "Usually solo, sometimes they're found in small groups, especially Mother and calf," Badhawan further wrote.

Headline: FB user says 'PM-backed firm' selling COVID-19 kits for ₹4,500, govt says fake news
Description: A Facebook user claimed that PM Narendra Modi has given contract to a Gujarat firm to manufacture coronavirus testing kits and the company is selling them for ₹4,500. Responding to the tweet ICMR said, "This is Fake News. Price range approved by ICMR is ₹740-1,150 for RT-PCR and ₹528-795 for Rapid Test. No test has been procured at ₹4,500."
Text: FB user says 'PM-backed firm' selling COVID-19 kits for ₹4,500, govt says fake news A Facebook user claimed that PM Narendra Modi has given contract to a Gujarat firm to manufacture coronavirus testing kits and the company is selling them for ₹4,500. Responding to the tweet ICMR said, "This is Fake News. Price range approved by ICMR is ₹740-1,150 for RT-PCR and ₹528-795 for Rapid Test. No test has been procured at ₹4,500."

Headline: Won't lose a single rupee: Govt clarifies after cancelling Chinese rapid test kits
Description: After cancelling orders of coronavirus rapid test kits from two Chinese firms, the government clarified it had followed due process in procuring the kits and it "doesn't stand to lose a single rupee". The kits made by the companies were found to be "under-performing" by ICMR. Earlier, Congress demanded inquiry into alleged profiteering by some companies while importing the kits.
Text: Won't lose a single rupee: Govt clarifies after cancelling Chinese rapid test kits After cancelling orders of coronavirus rapid test kits from two Chinese firms, the government clarified it had followed due process in procuring the kits and it "doesn't stand to lose a single rupee". The kits made by the companies were found to be "under-performing" by ICMR. Earlier, Congress demanded inquiry into alleged profiteering by some companies while importing the kits.

Headline: No. of containment zones down from 1,036 to 805 in Mumbai
Description: The number of containment zones in Mumbai have come down from 1,036 to 805. The areas which did not report new COVID-19 cases in the last 14 days were removed from containment zones. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Narendra Modi interacted with the state Chief Ministers through video conference, and appreciated their joint efforts in ensuring that the lockdown rules were followed.
Text: No. of containment zones down from 1,036 to 805 in Mumbai The number of containment zones in Mumbai have come down from 1,036 to 805. The areas which did not report new COVID-19 cases in the last 14 days were removed from containment zones. Meanwhile, Prime Minister Narendra Modi interacted with the state Chief Ministers through video conference, and appreciated their joint efforts in ensuring that the lockdown rules were followed.

Headline: I demanded lockdown should continue, let it be for 1 more month: Odisha Minister
Description: Odisha Health Minister Naba Das, who attended a meeting on coronavirus with PM Narendra Modi via video conferencing on Monday, said, "I've demanded that lockdown should continue, otherwise we can't face these things in Odisha." "Let it be [for] one more month, then we will see what is going on," he added.
Text: I demanded lockdown should continue, let it be for 1 more month: Odisha Minister  Odisha Health Minister Naba Das, who attended a meeting on coronavirus with PM Narendra Modi via video conferencing on Monday, said, "I've demanded that lockdown should continue, otherwise we can't face these things in Odisha." "Let it be [for] one more month, then we will see what is going on," he added.

Headline: Imposing COVID cess on ultra-rich may make up for revenue loss: Kumaraswamy
Description: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Monday said that the loss of revenue due to coronavirus lockdown may be "offset partially by imposing COVID cess on the ultra-rich". "Economy won't bounce back [soon]. It's important to lower cost of living as the spending power of the consumer has depleted," said Kumaraswamy. "The government must cut the petrol/diesel prices," he added.
Text: Imposing COVID cess on ultra-rich may make up for revenue loss: Kumaraswamy Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Monday said that the loss of revenue due to coronavirus lockdown may be "offset partially by imposing COVID cess on the ultra-rich". "Economy won't bounce back [soon]. It's important to lower cost of living as the spending power of the consumer has depleted," said Kumaraswamy. "The government must cut the petrol/diesel prices," he added.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi rise to 2,918; 1,931 patients aged below 50
Description: As many as 293 cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,918. Out of all the cases, 1,931 patients are below the age of 50, while 469 are aged between 50 and 59, and 518 are aged 60 or above. The death toll in Delhi stands at 54.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Delhi rise to 2,918; 1,931 patients aged below 50 As many as 293 cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,918. Out of all the cases, 1,931 patients are below the age of 50, while 469 are aged between 50 and 59, and 518 are aged 60 or above. The death toll in Delhi stands at 54.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Maharashtra cross 8,000-mark, death toll surges to 342
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra has risen to 8,068 after 440 new cases were reported today. The death toll in the state has surged to 342 with 19 deaths reported today. As many as 112 COVID-19 patients were discharged today, taking the total number of recovered patients to 1,188.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Maharashtra cross 8,000-mark, death toll surges to 342 The total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra has risen to 8,068 after 440 new cases were reported today. The death toll in the state has surged to 342 with 19 deaths reported today. As many as 112 COVID-19 patients were discharged today, taking the total number of recovered patients to 1,188.

Headline: Have to give importance to economy along with fight against COVID-19: PM Modi
Description: During his interaction with CMs of various states, PM Narendra Modi said that we have to give importance to the economy as well as continue the fight against coronavirus. He emphasised on the importance of usage of technology as much as possible. He also said states should concentrate on converting Red Zones into Orange Zones and thereafter to Green Zones.
Text: Have to give importance to economy along with fight against COVID-19: PM Modi During his interaction with CMs of various states, PM Narendra Modi said that we have to give importance to the economy as well as continue the fight against coronavirus. He emphasised on the importance of usage of technology as much as possible. He also said states should concentrate on converting Red Zones into Orange Zones and thereafter to Green Zones.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 2,185; death toll at 41
Description: Rajasthan on Sunday reported 102 new coronavirus cases and seven deaths, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,185 including 41 deaths. Jaipur is the worst affected district in the state with 808 cases and 21 deaths. A total of 629 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 263 have been discharged from the hospitals.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 2,185; death toll at 41 Rajasthan on Sunday reported 102 new coronavirus cases and seven deaths, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,185 including 41 deaths. Jaipur is the worst affected district in the state with 808 cases and 21 deaths. A total of 629 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 263 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Headline: Couple gets married amid lockdown, families attend function via video conference
Description: A couple in Rajasthan's Jodhpur got married at a temple with the families witnessing the rituals via video conference. "My grandfather is ill and he wanted the wedding to happen on the date fixed before the lockdown," said groom Varun Dhadhania. The family also donated ₹4 lakh to PM National Relief Fund and ₹1.01 lakh to Rajasthan CM COVID-19 Fund.
Text: Couple gets married amid lockdown, families attend function via video conference A couple in Rajasthan's Jodhpur got married at a temple with the families witnessing the rituals via video conference. "My grandfather is ill and he wanted the wedding to happen on the date fixed before the lockdown," said groom Varun Dhadhania. The family also donated ₹4 lakh to PM National Relief Fund and ₹1.01 lakh to Rajasthan CM COVID-19 Fund.

Headline: 391 Assam students return home from Kota after 3-day bus journey
Description: As many as 391 Assam students stranded in Rajasthan's Kota returned back to their home state on Sunday after a three-day bus journey amid the lockdown. Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said they would be quarantined for 14 days as a precautionary measure. "I'm extremely grateful to Assam government and would like to thank them," a student said.
Text: 391 Assam students return home from Kota after 3-day bus journey As many as 391 Assam students stranded in Rajasthan's Kota returned back to their home state on Sunday after a three-day bus journey amid the lockdown. Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said they would be quarantined for 14 days as a precautionary measure. "I'm extremely grateful to Assam government and would like to thank them," a student said.

Headline: 369 J&K students stranded in Kota amid lockdown return home
Description: As many as 369 Jammu and Kashmir students, who were stranded in Rajasthan's Kota due to lockdown, have returned, J&K authorities said on Monday. They have been sent to their respective districts where they will be put under quarantine, the authorities added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, over 520 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in J&K.
Text: 369 J&K students stranded in Kota amid lockdown return home As many as 369 Jammu and Kashmir students, who were stranded in Rajasthan's Kota due to lockdown, have returned, J&K authorities said on Monday. They have been sent to their respective districts where they will be put under quarantine, the authorities added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, over 520 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in J&K.

Headline: People crowd near gate as biscuits tossed from outside at Agra quarantine centre
Description: Videos that have surfaced online show people at an Agra quarantine centre being forced to crowd near the gate to receive food and water. One video shows a man in protective gear tossing biscuit packets near the gate. "I...inspected the spot. Everything has been set right...I've asked a senior official to investigate," Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh said.
Text: People crowd near gate as biscuits tossed from outside at Agra quarantine centre Videos that have surfaced online show people at an Agra quarantine centre being forced to crowd near the gate to receive food and water. One video shows a man in protective gear tossing biscuit packets near the gate. "I...inspected the spot. Everything has been set right...I've asked a senior official to investigate," Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh said.

Headline: PM Modi to interact with CMs via video conference tomorrow morning
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will interact with Chief Ministers via video conferencing tomorrow morning to discuss the coronavirus situation in the country. This will be the third video conference of PM Modi with the CMs after the announcement of nationwide lockdown last month. The lockdown is scheduled to end on May 3.
Text: PM Modi to interact with CMs via video conference tomorrow morning Prime Minister Narendra Modi will interact with Chief Ministers via video conferencing tomorrow morning to discuss the coronavirus situation in the country. This will be the third video conference of PM Modi with the CMs after the announcement of nationwide lockdown last month. The lockdown is scheduled to end on May 3.

Headline: IITs, IIITs won't increase tuition fee in 2020-2021: HRD Minister
Description: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank said IITs and IIITs won't increase tuition fee for any course in 2020-21 academic year. "In case of IIITs, it has been decided that for those which are centrally-funded, the standard 10% hike...for UG programmes won't be implemented this year," he said. "I have requested them not to increase fees for other courses," Pokhriyal added.
Text: IITs, IIITs won't increase tuition fee in 2020-2021: HRD Minister HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank said IITs and IIITs won't increase tuition fee for any course in 2020-21 academic year. "In case of IIITs, it has been decided that for those which are centrally-funded, the standard 10% hike...for UG programmes won't be implemented this year," he said. "I have requested them not to increase fees for other courses," Pokhriyal added.

Headline: Help all without discrimination: Bhagwat to RSS workers on COVID-19 crisis
Description: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday told Sangh workers that the coronavirus relief work has to be done for all, without any discrimination. He said, "Everyone who needs help is our own. Helping our own is not a favour to them, but our duty." He added, "Even if someone did something wrong, do not consider everyone guilty."
Text: Help all without discrimination: Bhagwat to RSS workers on COVID-19 crisis Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday told Sangh workers that the coronavirus relief work has to be done for all, without any discrimination. He said, "Everyone who needs help is our own. Helping our own is not a favour to them, but our duty." He added, "Even if someone did something wrong, do not consider everyone guilty."

Headline: Karnataka coronavirus cases reach 503, 182 patients discharged
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has reached 503, after three new cases were registered in the last 24 hours. Karnataka has reported 19 deaths due to COVID-19 and 182 coronavirus patients have been discharged in the state. Out of the 302 active cases in the state, 296 are reported to be stable and six are in the ICU.
Text: Karnataka coronavirus cases reach 503, 182 patients discharged The number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has reached 503, after three new cases were registered in the last 24 hours. Karnataka has reported 19 deaths due to COVID-19 and 182 coronavirus patients have been discharged in the state. Out of the 302 active cases in the state, 296 are reported to be stable and six are in the ICU.

Headline: Gujarat Congress leader Badruddin Shaikh dies of COVID-19
Description: Badruddin Shaikh, a senior Congress corporator and former leader of opposition in the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC), succumbed to COVID-19 on Sunday, party leader Shaktisinh Gohil said. Shaikh had tested positive for coronavirus on April 15. As per a report, the Congress leader had hypertension, diabetes and had recently undergone heart surgery.
Text: Gujarat Congress leader Badruddin Shaikh dies of COVID-19 Badruddin Shaikh, a senior Congress corporator and former leader of opposition in the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC), succumbed to COVID-19 on Sunday, party leader Shaktisinh Gohil said. Shaikh had tested positive for coronavirus on April 15. As per a report, the Congress leader had hypertension, diabetes and had recently undergone heart surgery.

Headline: Pawar writes to PM on COVID-19 impact on Maharashtra; seeks 'generous' funds
Description: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday wrote to PM Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urging them to address the economic crisis caused due to COVID-19 in Maharashtra. Pawar sought a "generous financial package" for the state and requested for "additional grants of untied nature to the tune of ₹1 lakh crores for FY 2020-21".
Text: Pawar writes to PM on COVID-19 impact on Maharashtra; seeks 'generous' funds NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday wrote to PM Narendra Modi and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urging them to address the economic crisis caused due to COVID-19 in Maharashtra. Pawar sought a "generous financial package" for the state and requested for "additional grants of untied nature to the tune of ₹1 lakh crores for FY 2020-21".

Headline: Put pvt detectives under essential services to check fake goods: APDI to govt
Description: APDI has urged government to put private detectives and investigators in the category of those providing essential services amid lockdown, in order to check flooding of markets with counterfeit products. "The lockdown period so far has seen a steep jump in seizure of counterfeit products which pose health, safety and security risk to Indians," said APDI Chairman K Vikram Singh.
Text: Put pvt detectives under essential services to check fake goods: APDI to govt APDI has urged government to put private detectives and investigators in the category of those providing essential services amid lockdown, in order to check flooding of markets with counterfeit products. "The lockdown period so far has seen a steep jump in seizure of counterfeit products which pose health, safety and security risk to Indians," said APDI Chairman K Vikram Singh.

Headline: 55-yr-old farmer distributes 400 kg vegetables for free in Gujarat village
Description: A 55-year-old farmer, Kanti Amliyar, has been distributing vegetable packets for free at his village Usarvan in Gujarat. "It was anyway difficult to sell the produce this season. So I decided to help the fellow villagers," said Amliyar, who has distributed 400 kg vegetables so far. "If needed, we'll distribute our second round of produce as well," Amliyar added.
Text: 55-yr-old farmer distributes 400 kg vegetables for free in Gujarat village A 55-year-old farmer, Kanti Amliyar, has been distributing vegetable packets for free at his village Usarvan in Gujarat. "It was anyway difficult to sell the produce this season. So I decided to help the fellow villagers," said Amliyar, who has distributed 400 kg vegetables so far. "If needed, we'll distribute our second round of produce as well," Amliyar added.

Headline: Gujarat's high coronavirus death rate may be due to Wuhan's L strain: Doctor
Description: The high coronavirus death rate in Gujarat could be due to the presence of L strain of the virus in majority of the cases in the state, according to Dr Atul Patel, Infectious Disease Specialist at the Sterling Hospital in Gujarat. "There are two strains of coronavirus, L is the original Wuhan strain which leads to early death," he said.
Text: Gujarat's high coronavirus death rate may be due to Wuhan's L strain: Doctor The high coronavirus death rate in Gujarat could be due to the presence of L strain of the virus in majority of the cases in the state, according to Dr Atul Patel, Infectious Disease Specialist at the Sterling Hospital in Gujarat. "There are two strains of coronavirus, L is the original Wuhan strain which leads to early death," he said.

Headline: Need to follow mantra of 'do gaz doori', lockdown saved thousands of lives: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi, during his interaction with Chief Ministers, said the lockdown has yielded positive results as the country has managed to save thousands of lives. He added that the impact of coronavirus will remain visible in coming months. Reiterating the mantra of "do gaz doori", he said masks and face covers will become part of our daily lives.
Text: Need to follow mantra of 'do gaz doori', lockdown saved thousands of lives: PM PM Narendra Modi, during his interaction with Chief Ministers, said the lockdown has yielded positive results as the country has managed to save thousands of lives. He added that the impact of coronavirus will remain visible in coming months. Reiterating the mantra of "do gaz doori", he said masks and face covers will become part of our daily lives.

Headline: 25-yr-old man kills father, chops off his private parts while saying film dialogues
Description: A 25-year-old man in Nagpur killed his father by biting deep in the neck and then chopping off his private parts, police said. The man went into a violent rage without any provocation, his family said. "He was reciting Hindi film dialogues and exhibiting inexplicable behaviour," police added quoting family. It took five policemen to pin him down.
Text: 25-yr-old man kills father, chops off his private parts while saying film dialogues A 25-year-old man in Nagpur killed his father by biting deep in the neck and then chopping off his private parts, police said. The man went into a violent rage without any provocation, his family said. "He was reciting Hindi film dialogues and exhibiting inexplicable behaviour," police added quoting family. It took five policemen to pin him down.

Headline: We'll be forced to sport Jairam's hairstyle if barber shops remain shut: Yashwant
Description: Reacting to barber shops remaining closed amid the lockdown, ex-Union Minister Yashwant Sinha tweeted, "If lockdown continues and barber shops remain closed, all of us will be forced to sport the hairstyle of Jairam Ramesh." Reacting to his tweet, Punjab's Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu wrote, "All the Rishi-Munis supported long hair."
Text: We'll be forced to sport Jairam's hairstyle if barber shops remain shut: Yashwant Reacting to barber shops remaining closed amid the lockdown, ex-Union Minister Yashwant Sinha tweeted, "If lockdown continues and barber shops remain closed, all of us will be forced to sport the hairstyle of Jairam Ramesh." Reacting to his tweet, Punjab's Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu wrote, "All the Rishi-Munis supported long hair."

Headline: Will cooperate: Arnab on being asked to join probe in case against him
Description: Mumbai Police sent a notice to Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami asking him to join the probe of FIR registered against him over his statement on Congress chief Sonia Gandhi during a show recently. "As a law-abiding citizen I will cooperate with the investigation, subject myself to interrogation tomorrow morning," said Goswami in a statement.
Text: Will cooperate: Arnab on being asked to join probe in case against him Mumbai Police sent a notice to Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami asking him to join the probe of FIR registered against him over his statement on Congress chief Sonia Gandhi during a show recently. "As a law-abiding citizen I will cooperate with the investigation, subject myself to interrogation tomorrow morning," said Goswami in a statement.

Headline: CRPF jawan kills self with rifle in Maharashtra due to health, family issues
Description: A 30-year-old CRPF jawan shot himself with his service rifle on Sunday in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli, police said. The jawan was identified as Uttarakhand resident Deepak Kumar, an official said. "He shot himself in the chest with his INSAS rifle. A suicide note found at the spot cited health and family issues as triggers," the official added.
Text: CRPF jawan kills self with rifle in Maharashtra due to health, family issues A 30-year-old CRPF jawan shot himself with his service rifle on Sunday in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli, police said. The jawan was identified as Uttarakhand resident Deepak Kumar, an official said. "He shot himself in the chest with his INSAS rifle. A suicide note found at the spot cited health and family issues as triggers," the official added.

Headline: 12 killed in lightning strikes in Bihar; CM announces ₹4L ex-gratia to families
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday condoled the deaths of 12 people who were killed in lightning strikes in three different districts of Bihar. Nine of them were killed in Saran, two in Jamui and one in Bhojpur, said an official release. The CM has announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh to the families of the deceased, added the release.
Text: 12 killed in lightning strikes in Bihar; CM announces ₹4L ex-gratia to families Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday condoled the deaths of 12 people who were killed in lightning strikes in three different districts of Bihar. Nine of them were killed in Saran, two in Jamui and one in Bhojpur, said an official release. The CM has announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh to the families of the deceased, added the release.

Headline: Plea against Vir Das' 'Hasmukh' for allegedly maligning lawyers
Description: A plea seeking to restrain a streaming platform from airing its web series 'Hasmukh', starring Vir Das, has been filed in Delhi High Court. It alleges that the lawyers are referred to as thieves, scoundrels, goons and rapists in episode 4. "The said remarks have...impugned the image of lawyers in the eyes of millions of viewers," advocate Ashutosh Dubey said.
Text: Plea against Vir Das' 'Hasmukh' for allegedly maligning lawyers A plea seeking to restrain a streaming platform from airing its web series 'Hasmukh', starring Vir Das, has been filed in Delhi High Court. It alleges that the lawyers are referred to as thieves, scoundrels, goons and rapists in episode 4. "The said remarks have...impugned the image of lawyers in the eyes of millions of viewers," advocate Ashutosh Dubey said.

Headline: 3 militants killed in encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam
Description: An encounter broke out between militants and security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Monday, leaving three militants dead, defence spokesman Colonel Rajesh Kalia said. The encounter broke out after the militants fired upon a patrolling party of the security forces. The joint operation took place at Lower Munda, Kalia added.
Text: 3 militants killed in encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam An encounter broke out between militants and security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Monday, leaving three militants dead, defence spokesman Colonel Rajesh Kalia said. The encounter broke out after the militants fired upon a patrolling party of the security forces. The joint operation took place at Lower Munda, Kalia added.

Headline: Kanika Kapoor issues 1st statement after recovering from coronavirus
Description: Singer Kanika Kapoor, who has recovered from coronavirus, has issued a statement on the controversy surrounding her diagnosis. "I was duly screened at the...airport. There was no advisory on that day that stated that I need to quarantine myself," she wrote. "I attended a friend's lunch and dinner...There was no party hosted by me," Kanika added.
Text: Kanika Kapoor issues 1st statement after recovering from coronavirus Singer Kanika Kapoor, who has recovered from coronavirus, has issued a statement on the controversy surrounding her diagnosis. "I was duly screened at the...airport. There was no advisory on that day that stated that I need to quarantine myself," she wrote. "I attended a friend's lunch and dinner...There was no party hosted by me," Kanika added.

Headline: Jail for up to 3 years for blocking funerals of coronavirus victims in Tamil Nadu
Description: Blocking the "dignified" burial or cremation of people, who die of a notified disease in Tamil Nadu will now attract a three-year prison term, an ordinance promulgated by the state government said. The move comes in the wake of public protests against the burial of two doctors who died of COVID-19. The offence will also carry a fine.
Text: Jail for up to 3 years for blocking funerals of coronavirus victims in Tamil Nadu Blocking the "dignified" burial or cremation of people, who die of a notified disease in Tamil Nadu will now attract a three-year prison term, an ordinance promulgated by the state government said. The move comes in the wake of public protests against the burial of two doctors who died of COVID-19. The offence will also carry a fine.

Headline: Pune's Serum Institute to start manufacturing Oxford's COVID-19 vaccine in 3 weeks
Description: Pune-based Serum Institute of India has said it plans to start production of the coronavirus vaccine developed by Oxford University in next two to three weeks. "We expect the coronavirus vaccine to be out in the market by September-October, only if the trials are successful with the requisite safety and assured efficacy," SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said.
Text: Pune's Serum Institute to start manufacturing Oxford's COVID-19 vaccine in 3 weeks Pune-based Serum Institute of India has said it plans to start production of the coronavirus vaccine developed by Oxford University in next two to three weeks. "We expect the coronavirus vaccine to be out in the market by September-October, only if the trials are successful with the requisite safety and assured efficacy," SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said.

Headline: 12 coronavirus patients discharged in Noida today, 44 active cases remaining
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY has said that 12 more coronavirus patients were discharged in the district today. He added that the total number of cured patients has risen to 71, while there are 44 active cases remaining in the district. "Amongst discharged were 82-year-old lady and a 6-day-old baby from a Covid-19 positive mother," he further said.
Text: 12 coronavirus patients discharged in Noida today, 44 active cases remaining Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY has said that 12 more coronavirus patients were discharged in the district today. He added that the total number of cured patients has risen to 71, while there are 44 active cases remaining in the district. "Amongst discharged were 82-year-old lady and a 6-day-old baby from a Covid-19 positive mother," he further said.

Headline: Gurugram MNCs may have to work from home till July end: Govt official
Description: MNCs, BPOs and IT enabled services (ITES) in Gurugram may have to allow their employees to work from home till July end, said Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority CEO VS Kundu. Kundu, who is also Additional Chief Secretary of Haryana, Fisheries Department, added that several real estate projects have been allowed to resume construction but within the norms of social distancing.
Text: Gurugram MNCs may have to work from home till July end: Govt official MNCs, BPOs and IT enabled services (ITES) in Gurugram may have to allow their employees to work from home till July end, said Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority CEO VS Kundu. Kundu, who is also Additional Chief Secretary of Haryana, Fisheries Department, added that several real estate projects have been allowed to resume construction but within the norms of social distancing.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 26,917; recovery rate almost 22%
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 26,917, while the death toll has surged to 826. As many as 5,914 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The coronavirus recovery rate in India is currently at 21.97%. Maharashtra has reported the most number of coronavirus cases and deaths till now.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 26,917; recovery rate almost 22% The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 26,917, while the death toll has surged to 826. As many as 5,914 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The coronavirus recovery rate in India is currently at 21.97%. Maharashtra has reported the most number of coronavirus cases and deaths till now.

Headline: CBDT never asked IRS officers for suggestions on COVID-19 situation: I-T Dept
Description: The CBDT never asked the Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officers for their suggestions on tackling COVID-19 situation, the Income Tax Department said on Sunday. "No permission was sought by the officers…it's a violation of extant Conduct Rules," the department said. A report by around 50 IRS officers suggested 40% tax for those earning over ₹1 crore a year.
Text: CBDT never asked IRS officers for suggestions on COVID-19 situation: I-T Dept The CBDT never asked the Indian Revenue Service (IRS) officers for their suggestions on tackling COVID-19 situation, the Income Tax Department said on Sunday. "No permission was sought by the officers…it's a violation of extant Conduct Rules," the department said. A report by around 50 IRS officers suggested 40% tax for those earning over ₹1 crore a year.

Headline: Mamata Banerjee condoles death of COVID-19 +ve govt doctor in Kolkata
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee condoled death of a COVID-19 positive government doctor in Kolkata on Sunday. "We have lost Dr Biplab Kanti Dasgupta. We're deeply pained with his untimely demise. His sacrifice will make our COVID-19 warriors fight the deadly virus with even greater determination," said Banerjee. Dasgupta was Assistant Director of Health Services, Central Medical Stores, Kolkata.
Text: Mamata Banerjee condoles death of COVID-19 +ve govt doctor in Kolkata West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee condoled death of a COVID-19 positive government doctor in Kolkata on Sunday. His sacrifice will make our COVID-19 warriors fight the deadly virus with even greater determination," said Banerjee. Dasgupta was Assistant Director of Health Services, Central Medical Stores, Kolkata.

Headline: Gujarat coronavirus cases rise to 3,301; death toll rises to 151
Description: Gujarat on Sunday recorded 230 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 3,301, said a state health department bulletin. Eighteen people have died of the virus in the last 24 hours, taking Gujarat's coronavirus death toll to 151, said the bulletin. Of the new cases, 178 were recorded in Ahmedabad alone.
