Centre earlier constituted six IMCTs for on-spot assessment of COVID-19 situation.
Text: Centre sets up 4 IMCTs for Ahmedabad, Surat, Hyderabad & Chennai Home Ministry has set up four Inter-Ministerial Central Teams (IMCTs), each headed by an additional secretary-level officer for Ahmedabad, Surat, Hyderabad and Chennai. “Coronavirus situation is especially serious in [these districts] which are considered...among hotspots zones....across India,” Ministry said. Centre earlier constituted six IMCTs for on-spot assessment of COVID-19 situation.

Headline: FIR against ex-IAS Kannan for not resuming duty amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: An FIR has been registered against ex-IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan under the Epidemic Diseases Act and Disaster Management Act, for not joining duty as directed by the government amid the coronavirus pandemic. Kannan, who had resigned in August 2019, tweeted, "Though I wholeheartedly volunteer to serve wherever I'm required...let me tell you this again, not rejoining IAS! Got it?"
Text: FIR against ex-IAS Kannan for not resuming duty amid COVID-19 pandemic An FIR has been registered against ex-IAS officer Kannan Gopinathan under the Epidemic Diseases Act and Disaster Management Act, for not joining duty as directed by the government amid the coronavirus pandemic. Kannan, who had resigned in August 2019, tweeted, "Though I wholeheartedly volunteer to serve wherever I'm required...let me tell you this again, not rejoining IAS! Got it?"

Headline: 4 cr users could be without phones by May-end due to curbs: ICEA
Description: India Cellular and Electronics Association claimed that an estimated 4 crore Indian users will be without mobile phones by May-end if restrictions on their sale continue. It said at present over 2.5 crore users are with non-functional phones due to non-availability of new devices or repair of their existing devices. ICEA has urged government to allow sale of electronic devices.
Text: 4 cr users could be without phones by May-end due to curbs: ICEA India Cellular and Electronics Association claimed that an estimated 4 crore Indian users will be without mobile phones by May-end if restrictions on their sale continue. It said at present over 2.5 crore users are with non-functional phones due to non-availability of new devices or repair of their existing devices. ICEA has urged government to allow sale of electronic devices.

Headline: Not necessary at this stage to freeze DA & DR hikes: Manmohan Singh
Description: Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh called the Central government's decision to put on hold the hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) to employees and Dearness Relief (DR) to pensioners till July 2021 "unnecessary". "I sincerely believe it is not necessary at this stage to impose hardships on government servants and also on the armed forces people," he added.
Text: Not necessary at this stage to freeze DA & DR hikes: Manmohan Singh Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh called the Central government's decision to put on hold the hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) to employees and Dearness Relief (DR) to pensioners till July 2021 "unnecessary". "I sincerely believe it is not necessary at this stage to impose hardships on government servants and also on the armed forces people," he added.

Headline: 226 patients recover in Uttar Pradesh, total COVID-19 cases reach 1,621
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 1,621 after it reported 111 new cases today, the state health department said. While 25 people have died of coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh, 226 people have been discharged after recovery. Agra remains the state's worst-hit district with a total of 346 cases, while capital Lucknow has reported 174 cases.
Text: 226 patients recover in Uttar Pradesh, total COVID-19 cases reach 1,621 The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 1,621 after it reported 111 new cases today, the state health department said. While 25 people have died of coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh, 226 people have been discharged after recovery. Agra remains the state's worst-hit district with a total of 346 cases, while capital Lucknow has reported 174 cases.

Headline: 29 new COVID-19 cases reported in Karnataka, total rises to 474
Description: Karnataka reported 29 new coronavirus cases on Friday, taking the total to 474, the state health department said. The state has reported 18 deaths so far, while 152 patients have recovered. Of the 304 active cases, 299 patients are stable while five are in the ICU. Bengaluru Urban is the worst-hit district with 120 positive cases, including four deaths.
Text: 29 new COVID-19 cases reported in Karnataka, total rises to 474 Karnataka reported 29 new coronavirus cases on Friday, taking the total to 474, the state health department said. The state has reported 18 deaths so far, while 152 patients have recovered. Of the 304 active cases, 299 patients are stable while five are in the ICU. Bengaluru Urban is the worst-hit district with 120 positive cases, including four deaths.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi breach 2,500 mark, active cases stand at 1,604
Description: As many as 138 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Delhi on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,514. The total number of active cases stands at 1,604, while the death toll has surged to 53. Further, as many as 857 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Delhi till now.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Delhi breach 2,500 mark, active cases stand at 1,604 As many as 138 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Delhi on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,514. The total number of active cases stands at 1,604, while the death toll has surged to 53. Further, as many as 857 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Delhi till now.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat crosses 2,800; death toll at 127
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat rose to 2,815 after 191 new cases were reported. Gujarat has reported 15 more coronavirus fatalities, taking the death toll to 127, the state health department. Of the total cases, 2,394 patients are stable, 29 are on ventilator, while 265 have recovered. Ahmedabad reported 169 new cases, taking the total to 1,821.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat crosses 2,800; death toll at 127 The total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat rose to 2,815 after 191 new cases were reported. Gujarat has reported 15 more coronavirus fatalities, taking the death toll to 127, the state health department. Of the total cases, 2,394 patients are stable, 29 are on ventilator, while 265 have recovered. Ahmedabad reported 169 new cases, taking the total to 1,821.

Headline: Govt allows all shops barring those in malls to open with 50% employees
Description: The government has allowed all non-essential shops to open with 50% employees. It further said that wearing of masks and social distancing would be mandatory in the shops. The prohibition on shops in malls and market complexes within the limits of municipal corporations would remain in place. It further clarified that the relaxations aren't applicable in hotspots and containment zones.
Text: Govt allows all shops barring those in malls to open with 50% employees The government has allowed all non-essential shops to open with 50% employees. It further said that wearing of masks and social distancing would be mandatory in the shops. The prohibition on shops in malls and market complexes within the limits of municipal corporations would remain in place. It further clarified that the relaxations aren't applicable in hotspots and containment zones.

Headline: May not be possible to completely lift lockdown: Punjab CM
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday said it may not be possible to lift the lockdown completely anytime soon as the state has seen three peaks in COVID-19 curve in the past 40 days. Singh added he would take experts' advice to formulate Punjab's lockdown exit strategy. Punjab has reported 298 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: May not be possible to completely lift lockdown: Punjab CM Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday said it may not be possible to lift the lockdown completely anytime soon as the state has seen three peaks in COVID-19 curve in the past 40 days. Singh added he would take experts' advice to formulate Punjab's lockdown exit strategy. Punjab has reported 298 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: 4 central teams to assess COVID-19 situation in Gujarat, T'gana, TN: Govt
Description: Union Home Ministry on Friday said four Inter-Ministerial Central Teams (IMCTs) have been constituted to assess COVID-19 situation in three states. The teams will be headed by an additional secretary-level officer and will visit Ahmedabad and Surat in Gujarat, Hyderabad in Telangana and Chennai in Tamil Nadu. Six IMCTs earlier visited Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and West Bengal.
Text: 4 central teams to assess COVID-19 situation in Gujarat, T'gana, TN: Govt Union Home Ministry on Friday said four Inter-Ministerial Central Teams (IMCTs) have been constituted to assess COVID-19 situation in three states. The teams will be headed by an additional secretary-level officer and will visit Ahmedabad and Surat in Gujarat, Hyderabad in Telangana and Chennai in Tamil Nadu. Six IMCTs earlier visited Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and West Bengal.

Headline: Kerala woman free of COVID-19 after 45 days in hospital and 19 tests
Description: A 62-year-old woman who tested positive for coronavirus 19 successive times in Kerala's Pathanamthitta has tested negative. "She was tested negative twice. We will discharge her soon," said the Pathanamthitta district medical officer. She had contracted the disease after she came in contact with a family who had returned from Italy.
Text: Kerala woman free of COVID-19 after 45 days in hospital and 19 tests A 62-year-old woman who tested positive for coronavirus 19 successive times in Kerala's Pathanamthitta has tested negative. "She was tested negative twice. We will discharge her soon," said the Pathanamthitta district medical officer. She had contracted the disease after she came in contact with a family who had returned from Italy.

Headline: Help bring back bodies of those who didn't die of COVID-19 in Gulf: Kerala to PM
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to PM Narendra Modi for bringing back bodies of Non-Resident Keralites who died of reasons other than COVID-19 in Gulf countries. The letter says that although Indian government has agreed that transportation of mortal remains in non-coronavirus death cases don't require 'No Objection Certificates' from Home Ministry, Indian embassies are insisting on it.
Text: Help bring back bodies of those who didn't die of COVID-19 in Gulf: Kerala to PM Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to PM Narendra Modi for bringing back bodies of Non-Resident Keralites who died of reasons other than COVID-19 in Gulf countries. The letter says that although Indian government has agreed that transportation of mortal remains in non-coronavirus death cases don't require 'No Objection Certificates' from Home Ministry, Indian embassies are insisting on it.

Headline: All 160 mediapersons tested by Delhi govt test negative for COVID-19
Description: All 160 mediapersons, including journalists, photographers and camerapersons who underwent COVID-19 tests in Delhi on Wednesday have tested negative for the virus. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reacted to test results of the mediapersons by saying, "I pray for your safety and good health. You are also our frontline corona(virus) warriors." He added, "God bless you all."
Text: All 160 mediapersons tested by Delhi govt test negative for COVID-19 All 160 mediapersons, including journalists, photographers and camerapersons who underwent COVID-19 tests in Delhi on Wednesday have tested negative for the virus. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal reacted to test results of the mediapersons by saying, "I pray for your safety and good health. You are also our frontline corona(virus) warriors." He added, "God bless you all."

Headline: Gandhinagar begins screening vegetable vendors for COVID-19 symptoms
Description: The municipal corporation of Gandhinagar in Gujarat has launched an initiative to screen all the 200 vegetable vendors in the city to check for coronavirus symptoms. The campaign was launched earlier this week and will continue till Saturday. "One vegetable vendor comes in contact with around 100 [people] in a day," said Gandhinagar Deputy Municipal Commissioner, PC Dave.
Text: Gandhinagar begins screening vegetable vendors for COVID-19 symptoms The municipal corporation of Gandhinagar in Gujarat has launched an initiative to screen all the 200 vegetable vendors in the city to check for coronavirus symptoms. The campaign was launched earlier this week and will continue till Saturday. "One vegetable vendor comes in contact with around 100 [people] in a day," said Gandhinagar Deputy Municipal Commissioner, PC Dave.

Headline: How many coronavirus suspects are being monitored by the government?
Description: The government on Friday revealed that around 9.45 lakh coronavirus suspects are being monitored under the Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP). It said that only 13 people were under surveillance on January 23, while the the number increased to 90,459 on March 19. Prompt sampling of these people are taken upon detection of symptoms, the government added.
Text: How many coronavirus suspects are being monitored by the government? The government on Friday revealed that around 9.45 lakh coronavirus suspects are being monitored under the Integrated Disease Surveillance Programme (IDSP). It said that only 13 people were under surveillance on January 23, while the the number increased to 90,459 on March 19. Prompt sampling of these people are taken upon detection of symptoms, the government added.

Headline: Total coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu rise to 1,755; death toll at 22
Description: Tamil Nadu on Friday recorded 72 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 1,755, said the state's health department. Two people died of coronavirus in Tamil Nadu on Friday, taking the state's death toll to 22. The state has recorded a total of 866 coronavirus recoveries and 114 patients were discharged on Friday alone.
Text: Total coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu rise to 1,755; death toll at 22 Tamil Nadu on Friday recorded 72 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 1,755, said the state's health department. Two people died of coronavirus in Tamil Nadu on Friday, taking the state's death toll to 22. The state has recorded a total of 866 coronavirus recoveries and 114 patients were discharged on Friday alone.

Headline: TN Police force 'violators' into ambulance with 'COVID-19 patient' in awareness video
Description: Tamil Nadu Police have shared a staged video to spread awareness about lockdown rules, wherein they force men violating lockdown rules by being outside and not wearing masks into an ambulance with a fake coronavirus patient. The men can then be seen scrambling to avoid physical contact with the 'patient' and attempting to escape the ambulance.
Text: TN Police force 'violators' into ambulance with 'COVID-19 patient' in awareness video Tamil Nadu Police have shared a staged video to spread awareness about lockdown rules, wherein they force men violating lockdown rules by being outside and not wearing masks into an ambulance with a fake coronavirus patient. The men can then be seen scrambling to avoid physical contact with the 'patient' and attempting to escape the ambulance.

Headline: 28 arrested in UP's Shamli for holding panchayat to boycott resident
Description: The UP police have arrested 28 of 34 people accused of violating lockdown rules and participating in a panchayat meeting in Shamli district to boycott a resident named Khurshid Qureshi. The accused were reportedly angry after Qureshi cancelled his son's marriage. However, Qureshi's family said it was cancelled as they couldn't get permission to hold the ceremony amid the lockdown.
Text: 28 arrested in UP's Shamli for holding panchayat to boycott resident The UP police have arrested 28 of 34 people accused of violating lockdown rules and participating in a panchayat meeting in Shamli district to boycott a resident named Khurshid Qureshi. The accused were reportedly angry after Qureshi cancelled his son's marriage. However, Qureshi's family said it was cancelled as they couldn't get permission to hold the ceremony amid the lockdown.

Headline: Bihar reports 9 fresh COVID-19 cases, state total reaches 223
Description: Bihar has reported nine more cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 223, the state health department has stated. There have been two deaths due to coronavirus in the state, while 46 patients have been cured or discharged. Meanwhile, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India has crossed 24,500.
Text: Bihar reports 9 fresh COVID-19 cases, state total reaches 223 Bihar has reported nine more cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 223, the state health department has stated. There have been two deaths due to coronavirus in the state, while 46 patients have been cured or discharged. Meanwhile, the total number of COVID-19 cases in India has crossed 24,500.

Headline: WhatsApp group helps airlift 'seriously ill' IT professional from UK to Kerala
Description: A WhatsApp group, led by former Supreme Court judge Kurian Joseph and former Union Minister KJ Alphons, has helped airlift a 37-year-old "seriously ill" IT professional from a UK hospital to Kerala. After being contacted by a UK Mayor, the group obtained requisite permissions from central departments and Kerala government within two days. The man's family was airlifted alongside him.
Text: WhatsApp group helps airlift 'seriously ill' IT professional from UK to Kerala A WhatsApp group, led by former Supreme Court judge Kurian Joseph and former Union Minister KJ Alphons, has helped airlift a 37-year-old "seriously ill" IT professional from a UK hospital to Kerala. After being contacted by a UK Mayor, the group obtained requisite permissions from central departments and Kerala government within two days. The man's family was airlifted alongside him.

Headline: COVID-19 patient, six others booked for violating lockdown in Gujarat
Description: Seven people, including a COVID-19 patient, have been booked for allegedly flouting lockdown norms and travelling from Gujarat's Surat to Chokari village, the Vadodara police said on Friday. The 30-year-old COVID-19 patient was admitted to a hospital on Wednesday after developing coronavirus symptoms. Meanwhile, the other accused who travelled with him have been quarantined.
Text: COVID-19 patient, six others booked for violating lockdown in Gujarat Seven people, including a COVID-19 patient, have been booked for allegedly flouting lockdown norms and travelling from Gujarat's Surat to Chokari village, the Vadodara police said on Friday. The 30-year-old COVID-19 patient was admitted to a hospital on Wednesday after developing coronavirus symptoms. Meanwhile, the other accused who travelled with him have been quarantined.

Headline: Stand with those arrested: Jamia body to admin on students booked under UAPA
Description: Jamia Coordination Committee has urged University administration to speak up against Delhi Police for arresting two students and charging them under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) in the Delhi riots case. "We urge administration to stand with their students in this moment of crisis," said the Committee. "These arrests have little ground...charges have no rhyme or reason," it added.
Text: Stand with those arrested: Jamia body to admin on students booked under UAPA Jamia Coordination Committee has urged University administration to speak up against Delhi Police for arresting two students and charging them under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) in the Delhi riots case. "We urge administration to stand with their students in this moment of crisis," said the Committee. "These arrests have little ground...charges have no rhyme or reason," it added.

Headline: Sale of liquor still banned: Govt clarifies order allowing shops to open
Description: Clarifying its order allowing the opening of shops, Home Ministry said all shops in rural areas, except those in malls, can open. In urban areas, all standalone shops can open but shops in markets, market complexes and malls must be closed. It also clarified that e-commerce companies can sell only essential goods, while sale of liquor continues to be prohibited.
Text: Sale of liquor still banned: Govt clarifies order allowing shops to open Clarifying its order allowing the opening of shops, Home Ministry said all shops in rural areas, except those in malls, can open. In urban areas, all standalone shops can open but shops in markets, market complexes and malls must be closed. It also clarified that e-commerce companies can sell only essential goods, while sale of liquor continues to be prohibited.

Headline: Rajinikanth fan kills Vijay fan over fight on COVID-19 funds
Description: Yuvraj, a 22-year-old fan of Thalapathy Vijay, was allegedly killed by Rajinikanth's fan Dinesh Babu over an argument regarding which actor contributed more to the coronavirus relief funds. Reportedly, the two friends were in an inebriated condition when the incident happened in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram on Thursday. Yuvraj died on spot due to head injury after Dinesh pushed him down.
Text: Rajinikanth fan kills Vijay fan over fight on COVID-19 funds Yuvraj, a 22-year-old fan of Thalapathy Vijay, was allegedly killed by Rajinikanth's fan Dinesh Babu over an argument regarding which actor contributed more to the coronavirus relief funds. Reportedly, the two friends were in an inebriated condition when the incident happened in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram on Thursday. Yuvraj died on spot due to head injury after Dinesh pushed him down.

Headline: WB govt needs to increase COVID-19 tests to 2500-5000 per day: IMCT
Description: The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) on Friday recommended the West Bengal government to increase COVID-19 tests to 2500-5000 per day. "WB government needs to submit a report...for the long waiting time of COVID tests. For some patients...wait time is more than five days," IMCT wrote in a letter. West Bengal has reported 571 coronavirus cases so far, including 18 deaths.
Text: WB govt needs to increase COVID-19 tests to 2500-5000 per day: IMCT The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) on Friday recommended the West Bengal government to increase COVID-19 tests to 2500-5000 per day. "WB government needs to submit a report...for the long waiting time of COVID tests. For some patients...wait time is more than five days," IMCT wrote in a letter. West Bengal has reported 571 coronavirus cases so far, including 18 deaths.

Headline: Bihar students stranded in Kota launch hunger strike against Nitish govt
Description: Students from Bihar stranded in Rajasthan's Kota due to the coronavirus lockdown have launched a hunger strike in protest against the Nitish Kumar government. Over 11,000 students from Bihar are stuck in the city. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that he offered to send the students back home but the Bihar and West Bengal governments are "reluctant" to evacuate them.
Text: Bihar students stranded in Kota launch hunger strike against Nitish govt Students from Bihar stranded in Rajasthan's Kota due to the coronavirus lockdown have launched a hunger strike in protest against the Nitish Kumar government. Over 11,000 students from Bihar are stuck in the city. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that he offered to send the students back home but the Bihar and West Bengal governments are "reluctant" to evacuate them.

Headline: KFC India to donate 1 million meals amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: KFC India on Thursday announced that it has pledged to donate 1 million meals to help the needy amid the ongoing nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. "These meals support migrant workers and daily wage earners, who are struggling to...afford meals during the lockdown. Together in this fight against COVID-19, we'll get through stronger & better," KFC India tweeted.
Text: KFC India to donate 1 million meals amid COVID-19 lockdown KFC India on Thursday announced that it has pledged to donate 1 million meals to help the needy amid the ongoing nationwide COVID-19 lockdown. "These meals support migrant workers and daily wage earners, who are struggling to...afford meals during the lockdown. Together in this fight against COVID-19, we'll get through stronger & better," KFC India tweeted.

Headline: 9 CRPF personnel test positive for COVID-19 in Delhi
Description: Nine CRPF personnel tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi on Friday, officials have stated. The personnel underwent tests after a head constable who was working as a nursing assistant was declared positive for COVID-19 a few days back. The head constable, who was deployed in Kupwara of Jammu and Kashmir, had come to Noida on leave.
Text: 9 CRPF personnel test positive for COVID-19 in Delhi Nine CRPF personnel tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi on Friday, officials have stated. The personnel underwent tests after a head constable who was working as a nursing assistant was declared positive for COVID-19 a few days back. The head constable, who was deployed in Kupwara of Jammu and Kashmir, had come to Noida on leave.

Headline: Will quit IAS once lockdown is lifted: Haryana woman officer
Description: Rani Nagar, an IAS officer of the 2014 batch of Haryana cadre, on Thursday posted on social media that she has decided to quit IAS once the lockdown is lifted. She said that there's a "constant threat" to her life. Rani added that she had lodged a complaint against a Haryana government official and some Chandigarh Police officers in 2019.
Text: Will quit IAS once lockdown is lifted: Haryana woman officer Rani Nagar, an IAS officer of the 2014 batch of Haryana cadre, on Thursday posted on social media that she has decided to quit IAS once the lockdown is lifted. She said that there's a "constant threat" to her life. Rani added that she had lodged a complaint against a Haryana government official and some Chandigarh Police officers in 2019.

Headline: 2 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Pulwama
Description: At least two terrorists and one "hardcore associate of terrorists" were killed in a pre-dawn encounter with security forces in Awantipora area in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Saturday. The incident took place after a joint force of 50 Rashtriya Rifles (Kumaon Regiment) of the Indian Army, 130 battalion of CRPF and J&K Police launched a cordon and search operation.
Text: 2 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Pulwama At least two terrorists and one "hardcore associate of terrorists" were killed in a pre-dawn encounter with security forces in Awantipora area in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Saturday. The incident took place after a joint force of 50 Rashtriya Rifles (Kumaon Regiment) of the Indian Army, 130 battalion of CRPF and J&K Police launched a cordon and search operation.

Headline: Tamil Nadu announces total lockdown in five cities from April 26
Description: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami announced a total lockdown in Chennai, Madurai, and Coimbatore for four days starting from 6 am on April 26 to 9 pm on April 29. The municipal corporations of Salem and Tiruppur will follow complete lockdown from 6 am on April 26 to 9 pm on April 28. Pharmacies will be allowed to function.
Text: Tamil Nadu announces total lockdown in five cities from April 26 Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami announced a total lockdown in Chennai, Madurai, and Coimbatore for four days starting from 6 am on April 26 to 9 pm on April 29. The municipal corporations of Salem and Tiruppur will follow complete lockdown from 6 am on April 26 to 9 pm on April 28. Pharmacies will be allowed to function.

Headline: Coronavirus cases doubling rate in India improves to 10 days; total cases now 23,452
Description: The government today said that the doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India has improved to 10 days. The total number of cases in the country has risen to 23,452, while the death toll has surged to 723. The recovery rate in India is now 20.52%. As many as 15 districts haven't reported any fresh case since last 28 days.
Text: Coronavirus cases doubling rate in India improves to 10 days; total cases now 23,452 The government today said that the doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India has improved to 10 days. The total number of cases in the country has risen to 23,452, while the death toll has surged to 723. The recovery rate in India is now 20.52%. As many as 15 districts haven't reported any fresh case since last 28 days.

Headline: Franklin Templeton shuts 6 debt funds worth ₹31,000 cr, 1st for a mutual fund
Description: Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund has voluntarily decided to wind up six yield-oriented managed credit funds with nearly ₹31,000 crore in assets under management citing "severe market dislocation and illiquidity" caused by the coronavirus. This is a first for an Indian mutual fund. "The decision was taken to protect value for investors via a managed sale of the portfolio," it said.
Text: Franklin Templeton shuts 6 debt funds worth ₹31,000 cr, 1st for a mutual fund Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund has voluntarily decided to wind up six yield-oriented managed credit funds with nearly ₹31,000 crore in assets under management citing "severe market dislocation and illiquidity" caused by the coronavirus. This is a first for an Indian mutual fund. "The decision was taken to protect value for investors via a managed sale of the portfolio," it said.

Headline: How did UP manage to bring back 4 lakh workers in 4 days amid lockdown?
Description: Uttar Pradesh brought back 4 lakh workers in 4 days from Delhi border using around 2,700 buses last month amid coronavirus lockdown, according to UPSRTC's MD. On March 28 and 29, 2,000 buses carrying workers had left for destination. However, gathering at the border was so huge that on March 30 and 31 around 700 additional buses were deployed.
Text: How did UP manage to bring back 4 lakh workers in 4 days amid lockdown? Uttar Pradesh brought back 4 lakh workers in 4 days from Delhi border using around 2,700 buses last month amid coronavirus lockdown, according to UPSRTC's MD. On March 28 and 29, 2,000 buses carrying workers had left for destination. However, gathering at the border was so huge that on March 30 and 31 around 700 additional buses were deployed.

Headline: We have been able to save India from going into Stage 3 till now: Harsh Vardhan
Description: Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Friday said the government has been able to save India from going into Stage 3 of the coronavirus pandemic till now. "We have already completed 5.5 lakh tests...The positive cases are not rising by more than 3-4%," he added. "We have all the information related to clusters and infected areas," the Health Minister said.
Text: We have been able to save India from going into Stage 3 till now: Harsh Vardhan Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Friday said the government has been able to save India from going into Stage 3 of the coronavirus pandemic till now. "We have already completed 5.5 lakh tests...The positive cases are not rising by more than 3-4%," he added. "We have all the information related to clusters and infected areas," the Health Minister said.

Headline: Faulty test kits will be returned; haven't paid for them yet: Govt
Description: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday said faulty antibody testing kits will be returned to the countries they were procured from, including China. "We haven't paid for the kits yet," said Vardhan while addressing a video conference with state health ministers. This came after ICMR advised states to not use the rapid testing kits for COVID-19 over inaccurate results.
Text: Faulty test kits will be returned; haven't paid for them yet: Govt Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday said faulty antibody testing kits will be returned to the countries they were procured from, including China. "We haven't paid for the kits yet," said Vardhan while addressing a video conference with state health ministers. This came after ICMR advised states to not use the rapid testing kits for COVID-19 over inaccurate results.

Headline: 4-month-old baby who tested +ve for coronavirus dies in Kerala
Description: A four-month-old baby who tested positive for coronavirus two days ago died in a hospital in Kerala's Kozhikode on Friday morning. State Health Minister KK Shailaja confirmed the baby's death and stated that she had congenital heart disease and stunted growth problems. Her parents, as well as five doctors who treated her, have been quarantined.
Text: 4-month-old baby who tested +ve for coronavirus dies in Kerala A four-month-old baby who tested positive for coronavirus two days ago died in a hospital in Kerala's Kozhikode on Friday morning. State Health Minister KK Shailaja confirmed the baby's death and stated that she had congenital heart disease and stunted growth problems. Her parents, as well as five doctors who treated her, have been quarantined.

Headline: 2 coronavirus +ve patients mistakenly released from quarantine centre in UP
Description: Two coronavirus positive patients were discharged from a quarantine centre in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad on Thursday over confusion due to similar names. They were later brought back to the quarantine centre, Moradabad Chief Medical Officer MC Garg said. He further said that investigation into the matter is underway.
Text: 2 coronavirus +ve patients mistakenly released from quarantine centre in UP Two coronavirus positive patients were discharged from a quarantine centre in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad on Thursday over confusion due to similar names. They were later brought back to the quarantine centre, Moradabad Chief Medical Officer MC Garg said. He further said that investigation into the matter is underway.

Headline: Coronavirus cases would have reached 1 lakh by now if not for lockdown: Govt
Description: The government on Friday said that India has around 23,000 coronavirus cases till now, adding that the number of cases would have been around one lakh if lockdown would not have been imposed. Dr VK Paul, member of NITI Aayog added that effects of the lockdown will show till the first or second week of May.
Text: Coronavirus cases would have reached 1 lakh by now if not for lockdown: Govt The government on Friday said that India has around 23,000 coronavirus cases till now, adding that the number of cases would have been around one lakh if lockdown would not have been imposed. Dr VK Paul, member of NITI Aayog added that effects of the lockdown will show till the first or second week of May.

Headline: Doubling rate of COVID-19 cases was 3 days on March 21, now it's 10 days: Govt
Description: The doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India was three days on March 21, while it has now reached 10 days, the government revealed on Friday. Dr VK Paul, member of NITI Aayog, said that travel restrictions, large scale surveillance and lockdown has helped in reducing the doubling rate and has saved lives.
Text: Doubling rate of COVID-19 cases was 3 days on March 21, now it's 10 days: Govt The doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India was three days on March 21, while it has now reached 10 days, the government revealed on Friday. Dr VK Paul, member of NITI Aayog, said that travel restrictions, large scale surveillance and lockdown has helped in reducing the doubling rate and has saved lives.

Headline: Insensitive, inhuman: Rahul on Centre's freeze on DA over COVID-19
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised central government over suspension of hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) to employees and Dearness Relief to pensioners till next year, amid COVID-19 crisis. Calling the decision "insensitive and inhuman", Rahul suggested that government could instead suspend "bullet train project and Central Vista beautification project" worth "lakhs and crores" of rupees.
Text: Insensitive, inhuman: Rahul on Centre's freeze on DA over COVID-19 Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised central government over suspension of hike in Dearness Allowance (DA) to employees and Dearness Relief to pensioners till next year, amid COVID-19 crisis. Calling the decision "insensitive and inhuman", Rahul suggested that government could instead suspend "bullet train project and Central Vista beautification project" worth "lakhs and crores" of rupees.

Headline: Make plan to bring back UP migrant workers from other states: CM to officials
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday instructed nodal officers to draw up an action plan to bring back the state's native migrant workers who are stranded in other states amid coronavirus lockdown. The workers will have to be screened, tested and transported to UP state borders, after which government will transport them to their respective districts, said a government statement.
Text: Make plan to bring back UP migrant workers from other states: CM to officials UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday instructed nodal officers to draw up an action plan to bring back the state's native migrant workers who are stranded in other states amid coronavirus lockdown. The workers will have to be screened, tested and transported to UP state borders, after which government will transport them to their respective districts, said a government statement.

Headline: China opens 'green channel' for Indian air cargo transport amid pandemic
Description: Sun Weidong, the Chinese Ambassador to India, tweeted on Friday that China has opened 'green channel' for Indian air cargo transport amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that China has approved 35 cargo flights carrying medical supplies such as PPEs, ventilators and testing kits to India. "We will continue to support India fighting against COVID-19," he further wrote.
Text: China opens 'green channel' for Indian air cargo transport amid pandemic Sun Weidong, the Chinese Ambassador to India, tweeted on Friday that China has opened 'green channel' for Indian air cargo transport amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that China has approved 35 cargo flights carrying medical supplies such as PPEs, ventilators and testing kits to India. "We will continue to support India fighting against COVID-19," he further wrote.

Headline: Two arrested for attacking health workers in Bengaluru test +ve
Description: Two people among the 121 arrested for violence against health workers in Bengaluru's Padarayanapura have tested positive for coronavirus. The two, who were lodged in jail, have been shifted to a hospital. The violence had erupted after locals, who were secondary contacts of a deceased Covid-19 patient, refused to accompany the team sent to take them to a quarantine facility.
Text: Two arrested for attacking health workers in Bengaluru test +ve Two people among the 121 arrested for violence against health workers in Bengaluru's Padarayanapura have tested positive for coronavirus. The two, who were lodged in jail, have been shifted to a hospital. The violence had erupted after locals, who were secondary contacts of a deceased Covid-19 patient, refused to accompany the team sent to take them to a quarantine facility.

Headline: How has doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India slowed down after lockdown?
Description: The government on Friday said that the decision of lockdown was timely and has helped the coronavirus curve to flatten. During the first week of lockdown, the doubling time was 5.2 days, while it was 4.2 after the second week. It improved to 6 in the third week and in the fourth week, it was reduced to 8.6 days.
Text: How has doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India slowed down after lockdown? The government on Friday said that the decision of lockdown was timely and has helped the coronavirus curve to flatten. During the first week of lockdown, the doubling time was 5.2 days, while it was 4.2 after the second week. It improved to 6 in the third week and in the fourth week, it was reduced to 8.6 days.

Headline: Not clear why COVID-19 test result should take 5 days: Central team to WB govt
Description: The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) that visited West Bengal to assess COVID-19 situation wrote to state Chief Secretary seeking clarification from state government over five-day waiting period for COVID-19 test results. "It's not clear why test results should take such a long time...there's danger of COVID-19 negative [person getting infected] in hospital while awaiting result," it said.
Text: Not clear why COVID-19 test result should take 5 days: Central team to WB govt The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) that visited West Bengal to assess COVID-19 situation wrote to state Chief Secretary seeking clarification from state government over five-day waiting period for COVID-19 test results. "It's not clear why test results should take such a long time...there's danger of COVID-19 negative [person getting infected] in hospital while awaiting result," it said.

Headline: Deeply grateful to SC for defending my freedom as journalist: Arnab
Description: Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami on Friday said he was "delighted" that the Supreme Court (SC) has given him protection from arrest. "I'm deeply grateful to [SC] for also upholding my constitutional right to report and broadcast and for defending my freedom of expression and my freedom as a journalist," said Goswami. All FIRs, except one, were stayed against Goswami.
Text: Deeply grateful to SC for defending my freedom as journalist: Arnab Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami on Friday said he was "delighted" that the Supreme Court (SC) has given him protection from arrest. "I'm deeply grateful to [SC] for also upholding my constitutional right to report and broadcast and for defending my freedom of expression and my freedom as a journalist," said Goswami. All FIRs, except one, were stayed against Goswami.

Headline: Live fish gets stuck in Kerala man's throat for an hour, removed after surgery
Description: Krishnan, a 60-year-old man from Kerala's Thrissur, accidentally swallowed a live fish that got stuck in his throat for an hour. The man had caught 'Pearl Spot' fish and in order to catch another, he kept it between his teeth to free his hands. After a surgery involving four doctors, four house surgeons and three nurses, the fish was removed.
Text: Live fish gets stuck in Kerala man's throat for an hour, removed after surgery Krishnan, a 60-year-old man from Kerala's Thrissur, accidentally swallowed a live fish that got stuck in his throat for an hour. The man had caught 'Pearl Spot' fish and in order to catch another, he kept it between his teeth to free his hands. After a surgery involving four doctors, four house surgeons and three nurses, the fish was removed.

Headline: Inspiring: Himachal CM after Hyd policeman pays man's hospital bill
Description: A Hyderabad policeman paid ₹20,000 medical bill for a man from Himachal Pradesh, suffering from appendix pain, stranded in Telangana due to coronavirus lockdown. Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur praised him, "Your deed is an inspiration to all persons involved in the fight against COVID-19." "We won't forget the help of the inspector in our life," said man's family.
Text: Inspiring: Himachal CM after Hyd policeman pays man's hospital bill A Hyderabad policeman paid ₹20,000 medical bill for a man from Himachal Pradesh, suffering from appendix pain, stranded in Telangana due to coronavirus lockdown. Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur praised him, "Your deed is an inspiration to all persons involved in the fight against COVID-19." "We won't forget the help of the inspector in our life," said man's family.

Headline: CISF constable posted at Delhi airport tests +ve for COVID-19
Description: A Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) constable posted at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport has tested positive for COVID-19. Reportedly, the patient has been shifted to an isolation ward in Jhajjar, Haryana. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Delhi has so far reported 2,376 coronavirus positive cases, including 808 cured or discharged cases and 50 deaths.
Text: CISF constable posted at Delhi airport tests +ve for COVID-19 A Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) constable posted at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport has tested positive for COVID-19. Reportedly, the patient has been shifted to an isolation ward in Jhajjar, Haryana. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Delhi has so far reported 2,376 coronavirus positive cases, including 808 cured or discharged cases and 50 deaths.

Headline: PM Modi, Sitharaman to meet today to finalise second stimulus package
Description: PM Narendra Modi and Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will meet on Friday to finalise the second stimulus package for the poor and needy, amid the coronavirus lockdown. Reportedly, the announcement regarding the details of the package is likely to be made soon. Earlier in March, Sitharaman had announced a ₹1.70 lakh crore economic stimulus package.
Text: PM Modi, Sitharaman to meet today to finalise second stimulus package PM Narendra Modi and Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will meet on Friday to finalise the second stimulus package for the poor and needy, amid the coronavirus lockdown. Reportedly, the announcement regarding the details of the package is likely to be made soon. Earlier in March, Sitharaman had announced a ₹1.70 lakh crore economic stimulus package.

Headline: Number of COVID-19 cases in Indore exceed 1,000, death toll at 55
Description: As many as 84 more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, taking the tally in the city to 1,029, the Chief Medical and Health Officer of the city has stated. Further, 55 coronavirus patients have died in Indore so far. According to government data, there are nearly 1,700 cases of COVID-19 in Madhya Pradesh.
Text: Number of COVID-19 cases in Indore exceed 1,000, death toll at 55 As many as 84 more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, taking the tally in the city to 1,029, the Chief Medical and Health Officer of the city has stated. Further, 55 coronavirus patients have died in Indore so far. According to government data, there are nearly 1,700 cases of COVID-19 in Madhya Pradesh.

Headline: Centre, RBI must come out of Lakshman Rekha: WB Finance Minister
Description: West Bengal Finance Minister Amit Mitra said that the Centre must announce a package of 6% of GDP as suggested by CM Mamata Banerjee to PM Narendra Modi. "The Union government...Reserve Bank of India must come out of their "Lakshman Rekha" and take bold decisions, not incremental measures," Mitra added. "A substantial stimulus is a must," he further said.
Text: Centre, RBI must come out of Lakshman Rekha: WB Finance Minister West Bengal Finance Minister Amit Mitra said that the Centre must announce a package of 6% of GDP as suggested by CM Mamata Banerjee to PM Narendra Modi. "The Union government...Reserve Bank of India must come out of their "Lakshman Rekha" and take bold decisions, not incremental measures," Mitra added. "A substantial stimulus is a must," he further said.

Headline: All hands on deck need of the hour: Delhi HC on COVID-19 crisis
Description: Delhi High Court (HC) has said that when India is struggling to control COVID-19, "it's need of the hour that all hands are on deck". It said this while hearing a plea on food shortage problem faced by migrant and daily wage workers in relief camps. HC bench suggested to Delhi government to appoint nodal officers to address the problem.
Text: All hands on deck need of the hour: Delhi HC on COVID-19 crisis Delhi High Court (HC) has said that when India is struggling to control COVID-19, "it's need of the hour that all hands are on deck". It said this while hearing a plea on food shortage problem faced by migrant and daily wage workers in relief camps. HC bench suggested to Delhi government to appoint nodal officers to address the problem.

Headline: Sikh devotees stranded in Maharashtra Gurudwara sent home
Description: Maharashtra government with Centre's help on Thursday sent 330 Sikh devotees, who were stranded in Sachkhand Gurudwara in Nanded, back home to Punjab and Haryana. The decision was taken after approval by Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Reportedly, at least 3,000 pilgrims are stuck for over a month and the safe return of remaining devotees is also being arranged.
Text: Sikh devotees stranded in Maharashtra Gurudwara sent home Maharashtra government with Centre's help on Thursday sent 330 Sikh devotees, who were stranded in Sachkhand Gurudwara in Nanded, back home to Punjab and Haryana. The decision was taken after approval by Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Reportedly, at least 3,000 pilgrims are stuck for over a month and the safe return of remaining devotees is also being arranged.

Headline: Char Dham temples to reopen amid lockdown, no pilgrim to be allowed
Description: The Char Dham temples in Uttarakhand will reopen amid the coronavirus lockdown but pilgrims won't be allowed to visit, state Tourism and Culture Minister Satpal Maharaj said. Only priests who have to perform the pujas and temple committee officials will be allowed, he added. Gangotri and Yamunotri temples will open on April 26 while Kedarnath will open on April 29.
Text: Char Dham temples to reopen amid lockdown, no pilgrim to be allowed The Char Dham temples in Uttarakhand will reopen amid the coronavirus lockdown but pilgrims won't be allowed to visit, state Tourism and Culture Minister Satpal Maharaj said. Only priests who have to perform the pujas and temple committee officials will be allowed, he added. Gangotri and Yamunotri temples will open on April 26 while Kedarnath will open on April 29.

Headline: I'm elected, you are nominated: WB CM Mamata to Governor
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has accused Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of forgetting that she's the "elected CM of a proud Indian state" whereas he's a nominated governor. Dhankhar, who has earlier voiced concern over the state's handling of the coronavirus pandemic, called her letter "factually wrong" and added, "If I go by your response, I should be in 'sleep mode'."
Text: I'm elected, you are nominated: WB CM Mamata to Governor West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has accused Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar of forgetting that she's the "elected CM of a proud Indian state" whereas he's a nominated governor. Dhankhar, who has earlier voiced concern over the state's handling of the coronavirus pandemic, called her letter "factually wrong" and added, "If I go by your response, I should be in 'sleep mode'."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 1,964; death toll at 28
Description: Rajasthan on Thursday reported 76 new coronavirus cases and one death, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,964 including 28 deaths. Jaipur is the worst-affected district in the state with 740 cases and 14 deaths. A total of 451 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 158 have been discharged from the hospitals.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 1,964; death toll at 28 Rajasthan on Thursday reported 76 new coronavirus cases and one death, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,964 including 28 deaths. Jaipur is the worst-affected district in the state with 740 cases and 14 deaths. A total of 451 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 158 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Headline: Total number of COVID-19 cases in Uttar Pradesh crosses 1,500; death toll at 24
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 1,510 on Thursday after the state reported 61 new cases, the state health department said. The number of coronavirus patients who have been discharged rose to 206, while 24 people have died of the virus in the state. Agra remains the worst-affected district in the state with 336 cases.
Text: Total number of COVID-19 cases in Uttar Pradesh crosses 1,500; death toll at 24 The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 1,510 on Thursday after the state reported 61 new cases, the state health department said. The number of coronavirus patients who have been discharged rose to 206, while 24 people have died of the virus in the state. Agra remains the worst-affected district in the state with 336 cases.

Headline: COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru Urban crosses 100, total cases in Karnataka now 445
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka's worst-hit Bengaluru Urban district reached 101 on Thursday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 445, the state health department said. The recovered cases in the state have reached 145, while the death toll stands at 17. Mysuru district has reported 88 cases.
Text: COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru Urban crosses 100, total cases in Karnataka now 445 The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka's worst-hit Bengaluru Urban district reached 101 on Thursday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 445, the state health department said. The recovered cases in the state have reached 145, while the death toll stands at 17. Mysuru district has reported 88 cases.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 778 new coronavirus cases in last 24 hours, total rises to 6,427
Description: As many as 778 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 6,427. Further, 14 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, with the total death toll surging to 283. Out of the 778 new cases, 522 were reported in Mumbai.
Text: Maharashtra reports 778 new coronavirus cases in last 24 hours, total rises to 6,427 As many as 778 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 6,427. Further, 14 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, with the total death toll surging to 283. Out of the 778 new cases, 522 were reported in Mumbai.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in Delhi rises to 50; 52% deceased were aged above 60
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus has risen to 50 in Delhi, with 52.1% of the deceased being aged above 60. Out of all the deaths, 84% patients had underlying health conditions. Further, the cases in Delhi have reached 2,376 after 128 new cases were reported today. Meanwhile, as many as 808 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Delhi.
Text: Coronavirus death toll in Delhi rises to 50; 52% deceased were aged above 60 The death toll due to coronavirus has risen to 50 in Delhi, with 52.1% of the deceased being aged above 60. Out of all the deaths, 84% patients had underlying health conditions. Further, the cases in Delhi have reached 2,376 after 128 new cases were reported today. Meanwhile, as many as 808 COVID-19 patients have recovered in Delhi.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 36 new COVID-19 cases, total reaches 2,000
Description: Rajasthan has reported 36 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally in the state to 2,000, the state health department said on Friday. Of the new cases, 18 were reported in Kota, 13 in Jaipur, four in Jhalawar and one in Bharatpur. As many as 27 people have died due to COVID-19 in the state.
Text: Rajasthan reports 36 new COVID-19 cases, total reaches 2,000 Rajasthan has reported 36 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally in the state to 2,000, the state health department said on Friday. Of the new cases, 18 were reported in Kota, 13 in Jaipur, four in Jhalawar and one in Bharatpur. As many as 27 people have died due to COVID-19 in the state.

Headline: We've tried plasma therapy on 4 patients, results are encouraging so far: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said, "We have tried plasma therapy on 4 patients at Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan Hospital. Till now the results are encouraging." "We will continue the trials for the next two or three days...We will then request the Centre for permission to treat coronavirus patients, who are serious, with plasma therapy," he added.
Text: We've tried plasma therapy on 4 patients, results are encouraging so far: Kejriwal Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said, "We have tried plasma therapy on 4 patients at Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan Hospital. Till now the results are encouraging." "We will continue the trials for the next two or three days...We will then request the Centre for permission to treat coronavirus patients, who are serious, with plasma therapy," he added.

Headline: IIT Delhi's coronavirus testing method approved by ICMR
Description: IIT Delhi has become the first academic institute to obtain ICMR approval for real-time PCR-based COVID-19 diagnostic assay with 100% specificity. Using comparative sequence analyses, the team identified unique regions (short stretches of RNA sequences) in the COVID-19/SARS COV-2 genome. These regions are not present in other human coronaviruses, providing an opportunity to detect COVID-19.
Text: IIT Delhi's coronavirus testing method approved by ICMR IIT Delhi has become the first academic institute to obtain ICMR approval for real-time PCR-based COVID-19 diagnostic assay with 100% specificity. Using comparative sequence analyses, the team identified unique regions (short stretches of RNA sequences) in the COVID-19/SARS COV-2 genome. These regions are not present in other human coronaviruses, providing an opportunity to detect COVID-19.

Headline: Over 3,200 arrested in Noida, Greater Noida in 1 month for defying lockdown
Description: Over 3,200 people were arrested across Noida and Greater Noida during the period of one month for violating lockdown restrictions, according to police data from March 23 till 7 pm of April 22. Nearly 3,700 people were booked while 944 FIRs were filed. UP had announced a lockdown in 15 districts from March 23-25 before a country-wide lockdown was announced.
Text: Over 3,200 arrested in Noida, Greater Noida in 1 month for defying lockdown  Over 3,200 people were arrested across Noida and Greater Noida during the period of one month for violating lockdown restrictions, according to police data from March 23 till 7 pm of April 22. Nearly 3,700 people were booked while 944 FIRs were filed. UP had announced a lockdown in 15 districts from March 23-25 before a country-wide lockdown was announced.

Headline: Covid-19 has thrown up new challenges, taught us new things: PM
Description: Addressing village heads on Panchayati Raj Diwas on Friday, PM Narendra Modi stated, "Coronavirus has taught us that we have to be self-reliant because otherwise, we won't be able to deal with such problems." PM Modi added, "The coronavirus pandemic has thrown up new challenges which we have never faced before, but it has also made us learn new things."
Text: Covid-19 has thrown up new challenges, taught us new things: PM Addressing village heads on Panchayati Raj Diwas on Friday, PM Narendra Modi stated, "Coronavirus has taught us that we have to be self-reliant because otherwise, we won't be able to deal with such problems." PM Modi added, "The coronavirus pandemic has thrown up new challenges which we have never faced before, but it has also made us learn new things."

Headline: Delhi Police raid Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad's farmhouse in UP
Description: The Delhi Police on Thursday raided the farmhouse of absconding Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad in Shamli district, Uttar Pradesh. An FIR was registered against Saad and others under the Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897 in connection with the mid-March congregation held at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi. So far, the Delhi Police has issued two notices to Saad.
Text: Delhi Police raid Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad's farmhouse in UP The Delhi Police on Thursday raided the farmhouse of absconding Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad in Shamli district, Uttar Pradesh. An FIR was registered against Saad and others under the Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897 in connection with the mid-March congregation held at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi. So far, the Delhi Police has issued two notices to Saad.

Headline: 11 Indian nationals die due to Covid-19 in Saudi Arabia
Description: Eleven Indian nationals have died due to Covid-19 in Saudi Arabia as of April 22, the Indian Embassy in Saudi Arabia stated in a press release on Wednesday. It further added, "The Embassy also reiterates the need for the community to remain calm and avoid spreading of rumours that may create panic."
Text: 11 Indian nationals die due to Covid-19 in Saudi Arabia Eleven Indian nationals have died due to Covid-19 in Saudi Arabia as of April 22, the Indian Embassy in Saudi Arabia stated in a press release on Wednesday. It further added, "The Embassy also reiterates the need for the community to remain calm and avoid spreading of rumours that may create panic."

Headline: Tripura becomes coronavirus free after 2nd patient tests -ve: CM
Description: Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb on Thursday tweeted that the state has become coronavirus free after the second patient has been found negative after consecutive tests. "I request everyone to maintain social distancing...follow government guidelines," he added. "I thank all the doctors, healthcare staffs, all front line warriors and public for making Tripura a corona free state," CM tweeted.
Text: Tripura becomes coronavirus free after 2nd patient tests -ve: CM Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb on Thursday tweeted that the state has become coronavirus free after the second patient has been found negative after consecutive tests. "I request everyone to maintain social distancing...follow government guidelines," he added. "I thank all the doctors, healthcare staffs, all front line warriors and public for making Tripura a corona free state," CM tweeted.

Headline: Telangana reports 27 new coronavirus cases, total reaches 970
Description: Telangana has reported 27 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally in the state to 970, state Health Minister Eatala Rajender has stated. Over 260 coronavirus patients have been discharged, while 25 patients have passed away in the state. Meanwhile, Rajender added that there are nine labs in the state for COVID-19 tests.
Text: Telangana reports 27 new coronavirus cases, total reaches 970 Telangana has reported 27 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally in the state to 970, state Health Minister Eatala Rajender has stated. Over 260 coronavirus patients have been discharged, while 25 patients have passed away in the state. Meanwhile, Rajender added that there are nine labs in the state for COVID-19 tests.

Headline: How many coronavirus cases did India, Italy, UK, US, Turkey report after 5 lakh tests?
Description: The government said that India crossed 5 lakh coronavirus tests on Wednesday, out of which over 20,000 people tested positive. It added US reached 5 lakh tests on March 26 and reported around 80,000 positive cases. Italy and UK reported 1 lakh and 1.2 lakh cases respectively after 5 lakh tests each, while Turkey reported 80,000 positive cases.
Text: How many coronavirus cases did India, Italy, UK, US, Turkey report after 5 lakh tests? The government said that India crossed 5 lakh coronavirus tests on Wednesday, out of which over 20,000 people tested positive. It added US reached 5 lakh tests on March 26 and reported around 80,000 positive cases. Italy and UK reported 1 lakh and 1.2 lakh cases respectively after 5 lakh tests each, while Turkey reported 80,000 positive cases.

Headline: SC stays all FIRs against Arnab Goswami except one, orders security for him
Description: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed all FIRs except one which was registered in Nagpur against Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami. The FIRs were registered over his remarks on TV related to the Palghar lynching case and against Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi. The Supreme Court also directed Mumbai Police Commissioner to provide security to Arnab and Republic TV.
Text: SC stays all FIRs against Arnab Goswami except one, orders security for him The Supreme Court on Friday stayed all FIRs except one which was registered in Nagpur against Republic TV Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami. The FIRs were registered over his remarks on TV related to the Palghar lynching case and against Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi. The Supreme Court also directed Mumbai Police Commissioner to provide security to Arnab and Republic TV.

Headline: 2 arrested in Palghar lynching case linked to BJP: Congress leader
Description: Congress spokesperson Sachin Sawant claimed that two men arrested in the Palghar lynching case were directly linked to BJP. Sawant said that 25-year-old Ishwar Bandhu Nikole, who has been arrested, is a member of BJP's booth committee for Gadchinchale village. Another man who has been arrested, Bhau Sathe, is also a member of the BJP's village booth committee, Sawant alleged.
Text: 2 arrested in Palghar lynching case linked to BJP: Congress leader Congress spokesperson Sachin Sawant claimed that two men arrested in the Palghar lynching case were directly linked to BJP. Sawant said that 25-year-old Ishwar Bandhu Nikole, who has been arrested, is a member of BJP's booth committee for Gadchinchale village. Another man who has been arrested, Bhau Sathe, is also a member of the BJP's village booth committee, Sawant alleged.

Headline: Police complaint filed against Kangana for supporting Rangoli
Description: A police complaint has been filed against Kangana Ranaut by advocate Ali Kaashif Khan Deshmukh for supporting sister Rangoli Chandel after Twitter suspended her account over alleged hate speech against a community. "One sister calls for genocide...other sister not just [supports] her...but also gives...label of terrorist to a sect," his complaint read. The complaint has been filed in Mumbai.
Text: Police complaint filed against Kangana for supporting Rangoli A police complaint has been filed against Kangana Ranaut by advocate Ali Kaashif Khan Deshmukh for supporting sister Rangoli Chandel after Twitter suspended her account over alleged hate speech against a community. "One sister calls for genocide...other sister not just [supports] her...but also gives...label of terrorist to a sect," his complaint read. The complaint has been filed in Mumbai.

Headline: Man thrashed for coughing, dies after falling into gutter during assault
Description: A 34-year-old man, who was allegedly attacked on suspicion of having coronavirus on Wednesday morning, died after falling into a gutter during the assault in Thane district, Maharashtra. The police said that the deceased, Ganesh Gupta, was assaulted by a few passersby when he coughed after stepping out of his home to purchase some essentials.
Text: Man thrashed for coughing, dies after falling into gutter during assault A 34-year-old man, who was allegedly attacked on suspicion of having coronavirus on Wednesday morning, died after falling into a gutter during the assault in Thane district, Maharashtra. The police said that the deceased, Ganesh Gupta, was assaulted by a few passersby when he coughed after stepping out of his home to purchase some essentials.

Headline: Deplorable: BJP MLA on Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj's lockdown remarks
Description: Siddharth Shirole, BJP MLA from Pune's Shivajinagar constituency, tweeted that Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj's remarks on lockdown are "deplorable." "It's deplorable that Bajaj is willing to sacrifice the life of our elders...and vulnerable for the so-called [his version of] greater good," he said. "Maybe an MD can choose between life of his employees and profit...but government can't," Shirole added.
Text: Deplorable: BJP MLA on Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj's lockdown remarks Siddharth Shirole, BJP MLA from Pune's Shivajinagar constituency, tweeted that Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj's remarks on lockdown are "deplorable." "It's deplorable that Bajaj is willing to sacrifice the life of our elders...and vulnerable for the so-called [his version of] greater good," he said. "Maybe an MD can choose between life of his employees and profit...but government can't," Shirole added.

Headline: Instead of tackling coronavirus, BJP spreading virus of hatred: Sonia
Description: Congress president Sonia Gandhi has said that BJP is spreading the virus of communal prejudice and hatred, instead of tackling coronavirus unitedly. "Grave damage is being done...our party, we will have to work hard to repair that damage," Gandhi added. "We've repeatedly urged the PM...there is no alternative to testing, tracing and quarantine," she further said.
Text: Instead of tackling coronavirus, BJP spreading virus of hatred: Sonia Congress president Sonia Gandhi has said that BJP is spreading the virus of communal prejudice and hatred, instead of tackling coronavirus unitedly. "Grave damage is being done...our party, we will have to work hard to repair that damage," Gandhi added. "We've repeatedly urged the PM...there is no alternative to testing, tracing and quarantine," she further said.

Headline: Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad tests COVID-19 positive
Description: NCP leader and Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad tested coronavirus positive on Thursday. He had admitted himself to a private hospital in Thane for a precautionary check-up after being under self-quarantine with family when his security staff had tested positive. It is suspected that Awhad got infected after he met a coronavirus positive police inspector earlier in April.
Text: Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad tests COVID-19 positive NCP leader and Maharashtra Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad tested coronavirus positive on Thursday. He had admitted himself to a private hospital in Thane for a precautionary check-up after being under self-quarantine with family when his security staff had tested positive. It is suspected that Awhad got infected after he met a coronavirus positive police inspector earlier in April.

Headline: Centre must provide food, livelihood to the poor: Rahul Gandhi
Description: Congress' Rahul Gandhi tweeted that the Central government must provide food and livelihood to the poor amid lockdown. "Those who earn their daily living...suffering from starvation. No problem is solved with anger...hatred," he said. Rahul tweeted the same sharing a report claiming the United Nations saying that the number of people dying due to starvation may increase due to coronavirus.
Text: Centre must provide food, livelihood to the poor: Rahul Gandhi Congress' Rahul Gandhi tweeted that the Central government must provide food and livelihood to the poor amid lockdown. "Those who earn their daily living...suffering from starvation. No problem is solved with anger...hatred," he said. Rahul tweeted the same sharing a report claiming the United Nations saying that the number of people dying due to starvation may increase due to coronavirus.

Headline: Reducing Maha's COVID-19 mortality rate is govt's focus: CM Uddhav
Description: Amid rising coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said that both, reducing mortality rate of patients and improving doubling rate of cases, are his government's focus. Thackeray said so during an interaction with coronavirus review teams and added that the doubling rate of cases is seven days, which has to be increased to more than 10 days.
Text: Reducing Maha's COVID-19 mortality rate is govt's focus: CM Uddhav Amid rising coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said that both, reducing mortality rate of patients and improving doubling rate of cases, are his government's focus. Thackeray said so during an interaction with coronavirus review teams and added that the doubling rate of cases is seven days, which has to be increased to more than 10 days.

Headline: Delhi Police arrests 5 persons with restricted drug worth ₹3 crore
Description: The Delhi Police has arrested five drug peddlers including two women with 332 grams of amphetamine medicine which is restricted for sale. Reportedly the estimated cost of the drug is around ₹3 crore in the international market. Dwarka district DCP on Thursday said that the police came to know about drug peddlers at 7 pm on Wednesday.
Text: Delhi Police arrests 5 persons with restricted drug worth ₹3 crore The Delhi Police has arrested five drug peddlers including two women with 332 grams of amphetamine medicine which is restricted for sale. Reportedly the estimated cost of the drug is around ₹3 crore in the international market. Dwarka district DCP on Thursday said that the police came to know about drug peddlers at 7 pm on Wednesday.

Headline: No. of cured coronavirus patients more than active patients in Noida for 1st time: DM
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY today revealed that the number of cured coronavirus patients is more than the number of active patients in the district for the first time. He added that 54 patients have been cured, while 49 cases are active. "We have to be extremely cautious as the virus growth is exponential and recovery is linear."
Text: No. of cured coronavirus patients more than active patients in Noida for 1st time: DM Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY today revealed that the number of cured coronavirus patients is more than the number of active patients in the district for the first time. He added that 54 patients have been cured, while 49 cases are active. "We have to be extremely cautious as the virus growth is exponential and recovery is linear."

Headline: IMCT denies it projected COVID-19 cases in Mumbai to reach 6.5 lakh by mid-May
Description: The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) has refuted media reports claiming that it has projected coronavirus cases in Mumbai to touch 42,604 by April 30 and 6.5 lakh by mid-May. In a statement issued from Mumbai on Thursday, IMCT said that no such projection has been made. The Maharashtra government had earlier urged the public not to panic over it.
Text: IMCT denies it projected COVID-19 cases in Mumbai to reach 6.5 lakh by mid-May The Inter-Ministerial Central Team (IMCT) has refuted media reports claiming that it has projected coronavirus cases in Mumbai to touch 42,604 by April 30 and 6.5 lakh by mid-May. In a statement issued from Mumbai on Thursday, IMCT said that no such projection has been made. The Maharashtra government had earlier urged the public not to panic over it.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in 78 districts in 14 days; total cases in India now 21,700
Description: The government on Thursday revealed that as many as 78 districts have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days, while 12 districts haven't reported a new case in last 28 days. Further, the total number of cases in India have risen to 21,700, while the death toll has surged to 686.
Text: No new coronavirus case in 78 districts in 14 days; total cases in India now 21,700 The government on Thursday revealed that as many as 78 districts have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days, while 12 districts haven't reported a new case in last 28 days. Further, the total number of cases in India have risen to 21,700, while the death toll has surged to 686.

Headline: %age of +ve coronavirus cases not rising despite 24-fold increase in testing: Govt
Description: The government on Thursday said that since lockdown, the growth in positive cases of coronavirus is not exponential. It added that despite a 24-fold increase in testing during lockdown, the percentage of positive cases is not rising. "The percentage of positive cases as a ratio of testing is more or less the same as that a month back," it stated.
Text: %age of +ve coronavirus cases not rising despite 24-fold increase in testing: Govt The government on Thursday said that since lockdown, the growth in positive cases of coronavirus is not exponential. It added that despite a 24-fold increase in testing during lockdown, the percentage of positive cases is not rising. "The percentage of positive cases as a ratio of testing is more or less the same as that a month back," it stated.

Headline: Odisha announces 60-hr shutdown in Balasore, Bhadrak & Jajpur from 10 pm tonight
Description: Odisha government has announced a 60-hour complete shutdown in Balasore, Bhadrak and Jajpur from 10 pm tonight to curb the spread of coronavirus. The three districts have reported combined 33 positive coronavirus cases. "Police will be constrained to prosecute and take other legal action against those violating the shutdown," Odisha DGP tweeted.
Text: Odisha announces 60-hr shutdown in Balasore, Bhadrak & Jajpur from 10 pm tonight Odisha government has announced a 60-hour complete shutdown in Balasore, Bhadrak and Jajpur from 10 pm tonight to curb the spread of coronavirus. The three districts have reported combined 33 positive coronavirus cases. "Police will be constrained to prosecute and take other legal action against those violating the shutdown," Odisha DGP tweeted.

Headline: Entire Muslim community can't be held responsible for one group's crime: Naqvi
Description: Reacting to the instances of Muslims being blamed for the increase in COVID-19 cases after Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi, Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said the entire community cannot be held responsible for one group's "crime". Naqvi said, "Whatever that organisation did, criminal negligence or crime...most Muslims have condemned it and called for action against it."
Text: Entire Muslim community can't be held responsible for one group's crime: Naqvi Reacting to the instances of Muslims being blamed for the increase in COVID-19 cases after Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi, Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Thursday said the entire community cannot be held responsible for one group's "crime". Naqvi said, "Whatever that organisation did, criminal negligence or crime...most Muslims have condemned it and called for action against it."

Headline: Gross under-testing: NRI doctors write to Mamata over COVID-19
Description: A group of non-resident Bengali medical professionals have written a letter to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressing concerns over the state government's handling of the COVID-19 situation. They said that the issues of "gross under-testing" in West Bengal and the "misreporting of data on the cause of death" in COVID-19 patients were the "most disturbing" to them.
Text: Gross under-testing: NRI doctors write to Mamata over COVID-19 A group of non-resident Bengali medical professionals have written a letter to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressing concerns over the state government's handling of the COVID-19 situation. They said that the issues of "gross under-testing" in West Bengal and the "misreporting of data on the cause of death" in COVID-19 patients were the "most disturbing" to them.

Headline: Two discharged after COVID-19 treatment test positive again in Gujarat
Description: Two COVID-19 patients who were discharged from a hospital in Gujarat's Patan district after they had tested negative, have tested positive for a second time.
