Text: Railways makes contactless cubicle to treat suspected COVID-19 patients Indian Railways' Hubballi workshop has produced a contactless cubicle for doctors to treat suspected COVID-19 patients. The cubicle will enable a doctor to put hands through two flexible gloves protruding out of the cubicle to reach the patient. After each medical test, the gloves will be changed and the exterior and interior of the chamber will be sanitised.

Headline: 2 brothers in Karnataka sell their land to help needy amid lockdown
Description: Two brothers in Karnataka's Kolar, Tajamul Pasha and Muzamil Pasha, sold their land and raised ₹25 lakh from it to help the needy amid the lockdown. Besides distributing ration packets containing essentials, the two brothers have also set up a community kitchen for those who can't cook at home. So far, they have delivered free groceries to over 2,800 families.
Text: 2 brothers in Karnataka sell their land to help needy amid lockdown Two brothers in Karnataka's Kolar, Tajamul Pasha and Muzamil Pasha, sold their land and raised ₹25 lakh from it to help the needy amid the lockdown. Besides distributing ration packets containing essentials, the two brothers have also set up a community kitchen for those who can't cook at home. So far, they have delivered free groceries to over 2,800 families.

Headline: Indian doctor gets 100-car salute in US for service amid coronavirus, video viral
Description: A video showing locals giving a 100-car salute to Indian doctor Uma Madhusudhan, who works at US' South Windsor Hospital, has gone viral. In the video, police vehicles, fire brigade trucks and private vehicles can be seen going past through her house to honour her for service amid coronavirus. Dr Uma can be seen waving at vehicles from her lawn.
Text: Indian doctor gets 100-car salute in US for service amid coronavirus, video viral A video showing locals giving a 100-car salute to Indian doctor Uma Madhusudhan, who works at US' South Windsor Hospital, has gone viral. In the video, police vehicles, fire brigade trucks and private vehicles can be seen going past through her house to honour her for service amid coronavirus. Dr Uma can be seen waving at vehicles from her lawn.

Headline: Arnab Goswami has gone insane, his attack on Sonia Gandhi condemnable: Ashok Gehlot
Description: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has criticised Republic TV's Arnab Goswami for accusing Congress President Sonia Gandhi of being silent on the Palghar mob lynching incident. "Attack on mrs Sonia Gandhi by Arnab Goswami is highly condemnable. He has gone insane and crossed all limits," Gehlot tweeted. "He should be ashamed of himself," he further said.
Text: Arnab Goswami has gone insane, his attack on Sonia Gandhi condemnable: Ashok Gehlot Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has criticised Republic TV's Arnab Goswami for accusing Congress President Sonia Gandhi of being silent on the Palghar mob lynching incident. "Attack on mrs Sonia Gandhi by Arnab Goswami is highly condemnable. He has gone insane and crossed all limits," Gehlot tweeted. "He should be ashamed of himself," he further said.

Headline: India gives 23 tonnes of essential medicines to Nepal to fight COVID-19
Description: India has sent 23 tonnes of essential medicines, including 3.2 lakh doses of Paracetamol and 2.5 lakh doses of Hydroxychloroquine, to Nepal to fight coronavirus pandemic. Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli thanked his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi for the "generous support". "The initiative manifests the continuing cooperation between India and Nepal in all situations," the Indian Embassy said.
Text: India gives 23 tonnes of essential medicines to Nepal to fight COVID-19 India has sent 23 tonnes of essential medicines, including 3.2 lakh doses of Paracetamol and 2.5 lakh doses of Hydroxychloroquine, to Nepal to fight coronavirus pandemic. Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli thanked his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi for the "generous support". "The initiative manifests the continuing cooperation between India and Nepal in all situations," the Indian Embassy said.

Headline: E-comm firms asked to make list of essentials they want to supply: Report
Description: DPIIT has asked e-commerce companies to submit a list of limited items they consider essential for people amid lockdown, ET reported. The list, once made, will be further sent to Home Ministry for consideration. Earlier, government had announced that supply of non-essential goods by e-commerce companies will remain prohibited during the period of coronavirus lockdown.
Text: E-comm firms asked to make list of essentials they want to supply: Report DPIIT has asked e-commerce companies to submit a list of limited items they consider essential for people amid lockdown, ET reported. The list, once made, will be further sent to Home Ministry for consideration. Earlier, government had announced that supply of non-essential goods by e-commerce companies will remain prohibited during the period of coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: AIIMS Delhi to deploy robots at its COVID-19 ward to limit virus spread
Description: AIIMS Delhi will start using robots manufactured by robotics firm Milagrow at its COVID-19 ward to control the spread of the virus among hospital staff and doctors. AIIMS will deploy two robots, Milagrow IMap 9.0 and Humanoid ELF. Milagrow IMap 9.0 can disinfect floors without human intervention while Humanoid ELF lets doctors monitor and interact with patients remotely without contact.
Text: AIIMS Delhi to deploy robots at its COVID-19 ward to limit virus spread AIIMS Delhi will start using robots manufactured by robotics firm Milagrow at its COVID-19 ward to control the spread of the virus among hospital staff and doctors. AIIMS will deploy two robots, Milagrow IMap 9.0 and Humanoid ELF. Milagrow IMap 9.0 can disinfect floors without human intervention while Humanoid ELF lets doctors monitor and interact with patients remotely without contact.

Headline: 4 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir
Description: Security forces killed four terrorists in a gun battle in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district, officials said on Wednesday. The terrorists were killed after security forces launched a joint operation in Melhoora village of the district late on Tuesday. The operation started after the security forces received information about the presence of the terrorists in the area.
Text: 4 terrorists killed in encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir Security forces killed four terrorists in a gun battle in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district, officials said on Wednesday. The terrorists were killed after security forces launched a joint operation in Melhoora village of the district late on Tuesday. The operation started after the security forces received information about the presence of the terrorists in the area.

Headline: Bihar govt to give aid of ₹1,000 each to families with no ration cards
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said an aid of ₹1,000 each will be given to families that don't have ration cards but were identified by self-help groups of Jeevika. Later, they'll be issued ration cards after verification of documents, he added. The aid will be provided to families in urban areas after identifying them through a survey, Kumar said.
Text: Bihar govt to give aid of ₹1,000 each to families with no ration cards Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said an aid of ₹1,000 each will be given to families that don't have ration cards but were identified by self-help groups of Jeevika. Later, they'll be issued ration cards after verification of documents, he added. The aid will be provided to families in urban areas after identifying them through a survey, Kumar said.

Headline: Up to 7-year jail, ₹5L fine for those guilty of violence against health workers: Govt
Description: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday announced that the government has brought an ordinance under which any attack on health workers will be a cognizable and non-bailable offence. He added those found guilty of attack on health workers would face an imprisonment of up to seven years and a fine of up to ₹5 lakh.
Text: Up to 7-year jail, ₹5L fine for those guilty of violence against health workers: Govt Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Wednesday announced that the government has brought an ordinance under which any attack on health workers will be a cognizable and non-bailable offence. He added those found guilty of attack on health workers would face an imprisonment of up to seven years and a fine of up to ₹5 lakh.

Headline: Railways giving 10,000 water bottles/day to Delhi police personnel on COVID-19 duty
Description: Indian Railways has started providing 10,000 Rail Neer water bottles per day to Delhi police personnel who have been out on duty in the fight against COVID-19. Braving hot summers, these policemen have worked round the clock to not only ensure that lockdown is implemented but also accompany the doctors and paramedics in various locations, the Indian Railways said.
Text: Railways giving 10,000 water bottles/day to Delhi police personnel on COVID-19 duty Indian Railways has started providing 10,000 Rail Neer water bottles per day to Delhi police personnel who have been out on duty in the fight against COVID-19. Braving hot summers, these policemen have worked round the clock to not only ensure that lockdown is implemented but also accompany the doctors and paramedics in various locations, the Indian Railways said.

Headline: 30 Tablighi Jamaat attendees, including 16 foreigners, arrested in UP
Description: An Allahabad University professor and 16 foreigners are among the 30 participants of the mid-March Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi who have been arrested, authorities in UP stated. The professor was arrested for allegedly arranging shelter for Indonesian Jamaat members in a mosque and not informing police about their presence. One of the Indonesians had earlier tested positive for coronavirus.
Text: 30 Tablighi Jamaat attendees, including 16 foreigners, arrested in UP An Allahabad University professor and 16 foreigners are among the 30 participants of the mid-March Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi who have been arrested, authorities in UP stated. The professor was arrested for allegedly arranging shelter for Indonesian Jamaat members in a mosque and not informing police about their presence. One of the Indonesians had earlier tested positive for coronavirus.

Headline: Chandigarh University to give 10% reservation to children of COVID-19 warriors
Description: Chandigarh University has announced COVID-19 Warriors Scholarship scheme worth ₹5 crore for the children of the frontline workers. Under the scheme, 10% seats in all UG and PG programs would be reserved for the wards of COVID-19 warriors, Chancellor Satnam Singh Sandhu said. Moreover, students admitted in this category would also be eligible for a 10% fee rebate, Sandhu added.
Text: Chandigarh University to give 10% reservation to children of COVID-19 warriors Chandigarh University has announced COVID-19 Warriors Scholarship scheme worth ₹5 crore for the children of the frontline workers. Under the scheme, 10% seats in all UG and PG programs would be reserved for the wards of COVID-19 warriors, Chancellor Satnam Singh Sandhu said. Moreover, students admitted in this category would also be eligible for a 10% fee rebate, Sandhu added.

Headline: Indian Medical Association withdraws protest as Amit Shah assures doctors' safety
Description: The Indian Medical Association has withdrawn its protest following a virtual meeting with Home Minister Amit Shah and Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan. During the meeting, Shah assured doctors of security and said the government is with them. Earlier, IMA had announced "white alert" wherein doctors would light candles to urge the Centre to enact a law against healthcare violence.
Text: Indian Medical Association withdraws protest as Amit Shah assures doctors' safety The Indian Medical Association has withdrawn its protest following a virtual meeting with Home Minister Amit Shah and Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan. During the meeting, Shah assured doctors of security and said the government is with them. Earlier, IMA had announced "white alert" wherein doctors would light candles to urge the Centre to enact a law against healthcare violence.

Headline: 94 new Covid-19 cases, 5 more deaths reported in Gujarat
Description: Gujarat has reported 94 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally to 2,272 in the state, the state health department has stated. Further, the death toll has risen to 95 after five more Covid-19 patients passed away in the state. The state health department added that 144 Covid-19 patients have been cured or discharged.
Text: 94 new Covid-19 cases, 5 more deaths reported in Gujarat Gujarat has reported 94 fresh cases of coronavirus, taking the tally to 2,272 in the state, the state health department has stated. Further, the death toll has risen to 95 after five more Covid-19 patients passed away in the state. The state health department added that 144 Covid-19 patients have been cured or discharged.

Headline: Daily 4 pm media briefing by Health Ministry on coronavirus cancelled for today
Description: The daily 4 pm briefing by Union Health Ministry on coronavirus has been cancelled for today. It has been cancelled as there is a cabinet meeting and the subsequent briefing this evening which will carry the Health Ministry related information, said ANI quoting government sources. Additional information will be given in press releases today, it added.
Text: Daily 4 pm media briefing by Health Ministry on coronavirus cancelled for today The daily 4 pm briefing by Union Health Ministry on coronavirus has been cancelled for today. It has been cancelled as there is a cabinet meeting and the subsequent briefing this evening which will carry the Health Ministry related information, said ANI quoting government sources. Additional information will be given in press releases today, it added.

Headline: 5 more Covid-19 cases reported in Bihar, total reaches 131
Description: Five more cases of coronavirus have been reported in Bihar, taking the tally in the state to 131, the state health department has announced. Three of the new cases were reported from Patna, while one each was reported from Biharsharif and East Champaran district. Over 40 people have been cured or discharged in the state.
Text: 5 more Covid-19 cases reported in Bihar, total reaches 131 Five more cases of coronavirus have been reported in Bihar, taking the tally in the state to 131, the state health department has announced. Three of the new cases were reported from Patna, while one each was reported from Biharsharif and East Champaran district. Over 40 people have been cured or discharged in the state.

Headline: 2,186 cases in Delhi so far, 27 in ICU and 5 on ventilator: Minister
Description: There have been a total of 2,186 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 75 positive cases of coronavirus were reported on Tuesday, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has stated. Jain added that 611 patients have recovered, while 27 people are in the ICU and five are on the ventilator.
Text: 2,186 cases in Delhi so far, 27 in ICU and 5 on ventilator: Minister There have been a total of 2,186 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 75 positive cases of coronavirus were reported on Tuesday, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has stated. Jain added that 611 patients have recovered, while 27 people are in the ICU and five are on the ventilator.

Headline: Civil Aviation Ministry HQ to be sealed after employee tests COVID-19 positive
Description: The Ministry of Civil Aviation on Wednesday informed that one of its employees has tested COVID-19 positive in Delhi. The Ministry has asked all those who had come in contact with the coronavirus positive employee to go into self-isolation. The Ministry headquarters in Delhi will be sealed "as per the prescribed protocol", Union Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said.
Text: Civil Aviation Ministry HQ to be sealed after employee tests COVID-19 positive The Ministry of Civil Aviation on Wednesday informed that one of its employees has tested COVID-19 positive in Delhi. The Ministry has asked all those who had come in contact with the coronavirus positive employee to go into self-isolation. The Ministry headquarters in Delhi will be sealed "as per the prescribed protocol", Union Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said.

Headline: West Bengal writes to Centre, assures cooperation to central teams
Description: West Bengal government has written a letter to Centre, saying it will abide by its orders related to the ongoing lockdown and assured full cooperation to the two visiting central teams assessing the ground situation in the state. West Bengal Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha wrote he had two meetings with one team and was also in touch with the other.
Text: West Bengal writes to Centre, assures cooperation to central teams West Bengal government has written a letter to Centre, saying it will abide by its orders related to the ongoing lockdown and assured full cooperation to the two visiting central teams assessing the ground situation in the state. West Bengal Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha wrote he had two meetings with one team and was also in touch with the other.

Headline: AMU doctor suspended after Aligarh district's 1st death due to Covid-19
Description: A doctor at Aligarh Muslim University's Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College was suspended for medical negligence following the district's first death due to Covid-19. Aligarh DM Chandra Bhushan Singh said the doctor hid the patient's information from authorities. The district health department said that they weren't informed about the case on time, which could've caused the exposure of some people.
Text: AMU doctor suspended after Aligarh district's 1st death due to Covid-19 A doctor at Aligarh Muslim University's Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College was suspended for medical negligence following the district's first death due to Covid-19. Aligarh DM Chandra Bhushan Singh said the doctor hid the patient's information from authorities. The district health department said that they weren't informed about the case on time, which could've caused the exposure of some people.

Headline: Constable posted at Maharashtra CM’s official residence tests COVID-19 +ve
Description: A police constable posted at Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's official residence 'Varsha' has tested positive for coronavirus, Mumbai Police said. "A woman constable has tested COVID-19 positive. We have hospitalised her while contact-tracing is going on," a senior official said. While 'Varsha', is the official residence allotted to Maharashtra CM, Thackeray stays at his family home 'Matoshree'.
Text: Constable posted at Maharashtra CM’s official residence tests COVID-19 +ve A police constable posted at Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's official residence 'Varsha' has tested positive for coronavirus, Mumbai Police said. "A woman constable has tested COVID-19 positive. We have hospitalised her while contact-tracing is going on," a senior official said. While 'Varsha', is the official residence allotted to Maharashtra CM, Thackeray stays at his family home 'Matoshree'.

Headline: South Korean firm making COVID-19 rapid test kits in Haryana
Description: A company based in South Korea named SD Biosensor has started production of Rapid Testing Kits for coronavirus in its Haryana's Manesar facility which has a capacity of 5,00,000 rapid test kits per week. The Indian Embassy in South Korea tweeted that this will be further enhanced in the coming weeks to meet the growing demand for medical equipments.
Text: South Korean firm making COVID-19 rapid test kits in Haryana A company based in South Korea named SD Biosensor has started production of Rapid Testing Kits for coronavirus in its Haryana's Manesar facility which has a capacity of 5,00,000 rapid test kits per week. The Indian Embassy in South Korea tweeted that this will be further enhanced in the coming weeks to meet the growing demand for medical equipments.

Headline: Please stay indoors: WB CM makes announcement from car in Kolkata
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday visited several areas in Kolkata and urged people to stay indoors amid the coronavirus pandemic. Mamata, who spoke into a microphone from inside her car, stated, "I would request all my brothers and sisters to please stay indoors...We have never witnessed such a lockdown, but it is needed to fight this disease."
Text: Please stay indoors: WB CM makes announcement from car in Kolkata West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday visited several areas in Kolkata and urged people to stay indoors amid the coronavirus pandemic. Mamata, who spoke into a microphone from inside her car, stated, "I would request all my brothers and sisters to please stay indoors...We have never witnessed such a lockdown, but it is needed to fight this disease."

Headline: On Earth Day, PM Modi gives a shout out to all COVID-19 warriors
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday tweeted, "On International Day of Mother Earth, we all express gratitude to our planet for the abundance of care and compassion. Let us pledge to work towards a cleaner, healthier and more prosperous planet." PM Modi added, "A shout out to all those working at the forefront to defeat COVID-19."
Text: On Earth Day, PM Modi gives a shout out to all COVID-19 warriors Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday tweeted, "On International Day of Mother Earth, we all express gratitude to our planet for the abundance of care and compassion. Let us pledge to work towards a cleaner, healthier and more prosperous planet." PM Modi added, "A shout out to all those working at the forefront to defeat COVID-19."

Headline: Officer suspended for issuing pass to BJP MLA to bring daughter back from Kota
Description: A sub-divisional officer in Bihar's Nawada district was suspended for issuing a travel pass to BJP MLA Anil Singh who travelled to Kota to bring back his 17-year-old daughter. He had obtained the pass on April 15 and left for Kota a day later. Singh claimed that his daughter had gone into depression as she was alone in Kota.
Text: Officer suspended for issuing pass to BJP MLA to bring daughter back from Kota A sub-divisional officer in Bihar's Nawada district was suspended for issuing a travel pass to BJP MLA Anil Singh who travelled to Kota to bring back his 17-year-old daughter. He had obtained the pass on April 15 and left for Kota a day later. Singh claimed that his daughter had gone into depression as she was alone in Kota.

Headline: 553 new coronavirus cases, 19 deaths in Maharashtra in 24 hours
Description: As many as 553 fresh coronavirus cases have been reported in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 5,229, the state government has said. Further, the death toll in the state has risen to 251 after 19 more deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours, the state government added.
Text: 553 new coronavirus cases, 19 deaths in Maharashtra in 24 hours As many as 553 fresh coronavirus cases have been reported in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 5,229, the state government has said. Further, the death toll in the state has risen to 251 after 19 more deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours, the state government added.

Headline: Indore Police make lockdown violators do frog jumps in middle of road
Description: The Indore Police made people perform jumping jacks and frog jumps as a punishment for violating the nationwide lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic. A video of the incident shows the violators exercising in the middle of a road. Earlier, the Pune Police had made lockdown violators perform yoga, while the Thane Police had performed aarti of the violators.
Text: Indore Police make lockdown violators do frog jumps in middle of road The Indore Police made people perform jumping jacks and frog jumps as a punishment for violating the nationwide lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic. A video of the incident shows the violators exercising in the middle of a road. Earlier, the Pune Police had made lockdown violators perform yoga, while the Thane Police had performed aarti of the violators.

Headline: India co-sponsors UN resolution calling for fair access to COVID-19 vaccines
Description: India is among 179 nations that co-sponsored a UN General Assembly resolution that called for a "fair, transparent and equitable" access to essential medical supplies and future COVID-19 vaccines to all nations. "We are facilitating the sourcing of global supplies of multilateral agencies such as UNICEF in the face of COVID-19," India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Syed Akbaruddin said.
Text: India co-sponsors UN resolution calling for fair access to COVID-19 vaccines India is among 179 nations that co-sponsored a UN General Assembly resolution that called for a "fair, transparent and equitable" access to essential medical supplies and future COVID-19 vaccines to all nations. "We are facilitating the sourcing of global supplies of multilateral agencies such as UNICEF in the face of COVID-19," India's Permanent Representative to the UN, Syed Akbaruddin said.

Headline: Arrange trains for migrant workers stuck in Maharashtra: CM urges Centre
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said Centre must take steps to arrange special trains for migrant workers stuck in Maharashtra for their native places. If Centre is anticipating a rise in COVID-19 spread between April 30 and May 15, then it must consider this, he added. Thackeray also requested the Centre to issue guidelines regarding this by April end.
Text: Arrange trains for migrant workers stuck in Maharashtra: CM urges Centre Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said Centre must take steps to arrange special trains for migrant workers stuck in Maharashtra for their native places. If Centre is anticipating a rise in COVID-19 spread between April 30 and May 15, then it must consider this, he added. Thackeray also requested the Centre to issue guidelines regarding this by April end.

Headline: Kids' lockers being used to store dead people's ash in Chandigarh as ashes pile up
Description: In Chandigarh, children's lockers from Sector 23 sports complex are being used to keep ash urns of the dead that are piling up at cremation grounds. "As sports complexes are shut down at the moment and children are not coming, we thought of using the lockers...They will be used only till the lockdown," Sports Department Secretary KK Yadav said.
Text: Kids' lockers being used to store dead people's ash in Chandigarh as ashes pile up In Chandigarh, children's lockers from Sector 23 sports complex are being used to keep ash urns of the dead that are piling up at cremation grounds. "As sports complexes are shut down at the moment and children are not coming, we thought of using the lockers...They will be used only till the lockdown," Sports Department Secretary KK Yadav said.

Headline: 101 people arrested within 8 hrs; no Muslim in the list: Maha govt on Palghar incident
Description: Speaking about Palghar lynching incident video, Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh said, "There was a sound heard in the video 'Oye Bas', people...called it 'Shoaib Bas'." "People tried to bring communal angle," he added. Stating that 101 people were arrested within 8 hours of the incident, Deshmukh said, "There's no Muslim in that list."
Text: 101 people arrested within 8 hrs; no Muslim in the list: Maha govt on Palghar incident Speaking about Palghar lynching incident video, Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh said, "There was a sound heard in the video 'Oye Bas', people...called it 'Shoaib Bas'." "People tried to bring communal angle," he added. Stating that 101 people were arrested within 8 hours of the incident, Deshmukh said, "There's no Muslim in that list."

Headline: Ex-JNU student Umar Khalid, 2 others charged for instigating Delhi riots
Description: The Delhi Police has booked former JNU student Umar Khalid and two Jamia Millia Islamia students under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act for allegedly hatching a premeditated conspiracy to incite the communal riots in northeast Delhi in February. The three have also been booked for offences of rioting, sedition, murder and promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion.
Text: Ex-JNU student Umar Khalid, 2 others charged for instigating Delhi riots The Delhi Police has booked former JNU student Umar Khalid and two Jamia Millia Islamia students under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act for allegedly hatching a premeditated conspiracy to incite the communal riots in northeast Delhi in February. The three have also been booked for offences of rioting, sedition, murder and promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion.

Headline: 3 COVID-19 suspects report themselves via Aarogya Setu app in UP
Description: Three coronavirus suspects have reported themselves to the government in Uttar Pradesh through the Aarogya Setu app. The app provided them with options to contact helpline for testing or pass the information to the Health Ministry as their risk level was high. The suspects informed the Health Ministry which then informed the state government.
Text: 3 COVID-19 suspects report themselves via Aarogya Setu app in UP Three coronavirus suspects have reported themselves to the government in Uttar Pradesh through the Aarogya Setu app. The app provided them with options to contact helpline for testing or pass the information to the Health Ministry as their risk level was high. The suspects informed the Health Ministry which then informed the state government.

Headline: Total number of COVID-19 cases in Gujarat rises to 2,178; death toll reaches 90
Description: Gujarat on Tuesday recorded 112 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 2,178, said the state's health department. Thirteen people died of the virus in Gujarat on Tuesday, the health department added, taking the state's coronavirus death toll to 90. Ahmedabad recorded the highest number of coronavirus cases today with 75 new cases.
Text: Total number of COVID-19 cases in Gujarat rises to 2,178; death toll reaches 90 Gujarat on Tuesday recorded 112 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 2,178, said the state's health department. Thirteen people died of the virus in Gujarat on Tuesday, the health department added, taking the state's coronavirus death toll to 90. Ahmedabad recorded the highest number of coronavirus cases today with 75 new cases.

Headline: Delhi-Noida border to be completely closed with some exceptions: District Magistrate
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY today announced that Delhi-Noida border will be completely closed with exceptions as a preventive measure to fight coronavirus. He added the decision was taken in the larger public interest as per the advice by the medical department. Authorities working for COVID-19 relief, vehicles transporting goods, ambulance and media persons will be exempted.
Text: Delhi-Noida border to be completely closed with some exceptions: District Magistrate Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate Suhas LY today announced that Delhi-Noida border will be completely closed with exceptions as a preventive measure to fight coronavirus. He added the decision was taken in the larger public interest as per the advice by the medical department. Authorities working for COVID-19 relief, vehicles transporting goods, ambulance and media persons will be exempted.

Headline: 159 new coronavirus cases reported in Rajasthan today, total rises to 1,735
Description: Rajasthan on Tuesday reported 159 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases to 1,735, and the death toll in the state to 26. Jaipur is the worst-hit district in the state with total 657 cases and 14 deaths. Notably, 274 patients have recovered in the state and 97 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Jaipur is the worst-hit district in the state with total 657 cases and 14 deaths. Notably, 274 patients have recovered in the state and 97 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Headline: Number of containment zones in Delhi raised to 87
Description: The total number of containment zones in Delhi rose to 87 on Tuesday after the addition of three new containment zones in the city. The three new containment zones are- Gali No 2, 3 and 4 of Devli Extension, Shiv Mandir Wali Gali, Harsh Vihar, Hari Nagar Extension and Gali No 3, Krishna Puri, Main Road Mandawali.
Text: Number of containment zones in Delhi raised to 87 The total number of containment zones in Delhi rose to 87 on Tuesday after the addition of three new containment zones in the city. The three new containment zones are- Gali No 2, 3 and 4 of Devli Extension, Shiv Mandir Wali Gali, Harsh Vihar, Hari Nagar Extension and Gali No 3, Krishna Puri, Main Road Mandawali.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Telangana cross 900; 194 patients recover
Description: Telangana health department said on Tuesday that 56 new coronavirus cases were reported in the state, taking the total to 928 with 23 deaths. Of the 928 cases, 711 are active while 194 patients have recovered. The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation area reported 19 new cases, taking the total there to 448, while Suryapet reported 26 new infections.
