Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in worst-hit state Maharashtra crosses 5,200
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India's worst-hit state, Maharashtra, reached 5,218 on Tuesday as 552 more people tested positive, the state health department said. It added that 150 patients were discharged from the hospital today, taking the total number of recovered patients in the state to 722. Mumbai Municipal Corporation area has reported 3,451 cases.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in worst-hit state Maharashtra crosses 5,200 The total number of coronavirus cases in India's worst-hit state, Maharashtra, reached 5,218 on Tuesday as 552 more people tested positive, the state health department said. It added that 150 patients were discharged from the hospital today, taking the total number of recovered patients in the state to 722. Mumbai Municipal Corporation area has reported 3,451 cases.

Headline: Govt to conduct telephonic COVID-19 survey, people to receive calls from '1921'
Description: The government announced to conduct a telephonic survey to gather citizen feedback on prevalence and distribution of COVID-19 symptoms. Citizens will receive a call from the number '1921'. "People are informed that it's a genuine survey...Please be aware of any other calls from pranksters or calls from any other number in the guise of such similar survey," the government said.
Text: Govt to conduct telephonic COVID-19 survey, people to receive calls from '1921' The government announced to conduct a telephonic survey to gather citizen feedback on prevalence and distribution of COVID-19 symptoms. Citizens will receive a call from the number '1921'. "People are informed that it's a genuine survey...Please be aware of any other calls from pranksters or calls from any other number in the guise of such similar survey," the government said.

Headline: Doctor among 12 new Covid-19 cases in J&K
Description: A doctor at the Government Medical College in Baramulla is among the 12 fresh Covid-19 cases reported in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, a senior health official stated. His family and at least 19 others at the hospital have been quarantined, the official added. Meanwhile, J&K government spokesperson Rohit Kansal said the total number of cases now stands at 380.
Text: Doctor among 12 new Covid-19 cases in J&K A doctor at the Government Medical College in Baramulla is among the 12 fresh Covid-19 cases reported in Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, a senior health official stated. His family and at least 19 others at the hospital have been quarantined, the official added. Meanwhile, J&K government spokesperson Rohit Kansal said the total number of cases now stands at 380.

Headline: Martyr status, ₹50L for healthcare staff who die fighting COVID-19: Odisha CM
Description: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has announced ₹50 lakh for all government and private healthcare workers and members of support services who lose their lives in the fight against COVID-19. Patnaik said that they would be treated as martyrs. He added that the families of all government personnel (medical and others) would continue to get full salary till the retirement date.
Text: Martyr status, ₹50L for healthcare staff who die fighting COVID-19: Odisha CM Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has announced ₹50 lakh for all government and private healthcare workers and members of support services who lose their lives in the fight against COVID-19. Patnaik said that they would be treated as martyrs. He added that the families of all government personnel (medical and others) would continue to get full salary till the retirement date.

Headline: 26 journalists of a TV channel among 76 new COVID-19 cases in TN
Description: As many as 26 journalists working with a Tamil TV channel are among the 76 new confirmed cases of COVID-19 reported in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday. An official representing the Tamil Nadu Directorate of Public Health said that all 26 journalists have been isolated in government facilities in Chennai. Over 1,590 coronavirus cases have been reported in the state.
Text: 26 journalists of a TV channel among 76 new COVID-19 cases in TN As many as 26 journalists working with a Tamil TV channel are among the 76 new confirmed cases of COVID-19 reported in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday. An official representing the Tamil Nadu Directorate of Public Health said that all 26 journalists have been isolated in government facilities in Chennai. Over 1,590 coronavirus cases have been reported in the state.

Headline: Bihar policeman made to do 50 sit-ups for stopping agriculture officer's vehicle
Description: A policeman in Bihar's Araria district was made to do 50 sit-ups by an agriculture officer after he stopped his vehicle and asked him to show the mandatory pass amid the ongoing coronavirus lockdown. The agriculture officer also said that he could have sent him to jail had he not been in a hurry to attend a video conference.
Text: Bihar policeman made to do 50 sit-ups for stopping agriculture officer's vehicle A policeman in Bihar's Araria district was made to do 50 sit-ups by an agriculture officer after he stopped his vehicle and asked him to show the mandatory pass amid the ongoing coronavirus lockdown. The agriculture officer also said that he could have sent him to jail had he not been in a hurry to attend a video conference.

Headline: Bakeries can open if selling bread or biscuits, not cakes: Chandigarh admin
Description: Amid lockdown to control the spread of coronavirus, the Chandigarh administration on Tuesday said that "all bakeries will be allowed to function but only if they sell just bread or biscuits and not cakes". Bread and biscuits are considered essential supplies while cakes are non-essential commodities. Chandigarh was declared a coronavirus containment zone on Saturday.
Text: Bakeries can open if selling bread or biscuits, not cakes: Chandigarh admin Amid lockdown to control the spread of coronavirus, the Chandigarh administration on Tuesday said that "all bakeries will be allowed to function but only if they sell just bread or biscuits and not cakes". Bread and biscuits are considered essential supplies while cakes are non-essential commodities. Chandigarh was declared a coronavirus containment zone on Saturday.

Headline: 2 Chhattisgarh workers walking home amid lockdown run over by train
Description: Two labourers, who had sat down to have breakfast on a railway track, were run over by a freight train on Tuesday in Chhattisgarh's Korea district. Four labourers had started walking 130 km from Pendra to their villages in Surajpur district on Monday amid the nationwide lockdown. The other two workers had gone to fetch water when the incident occurred.
Text: 2 Chhattisgarh workers walking home amid lockdown run over by train Two labourers, who had sat down to have breakfast on a railway track, were run over by a freight train on Tuesday in Chhattisgarh's Korea district. Four labourers had started walking 130 km from Pendra to their villages in Surajpur district on Monday amid the nationwide lockdown. The other two workers had gone to fetch water when the incident occurred.

Headline: 14-storey building converted into COVID-19 hospital in Hyderabad in 20 days
Description: A 14-storey building at the Gachibowli sports complex in Hyderabad has been converted into a COVID-19 hospital in less than 20 days. The building was constructed in 2007 for the World Military Games. The hospital will later be converted into a multispeciality hospital with PG institutions focused on providing medical services and research, state minister KT Rama Rao said.
Text: 14-storey building converted into COVID-19 hospital in Hyderabad in 20 days A 14-storey building at the Gachibowli sports complex in Hyderabad has been converted into a COVID-19 hospital in less than 20 days. The building was constructed in 2007 for the World Military Games. The hospital will later be converted into a multispeciality hospital with PG institutions focused on providing medical services and research, state minister KT Rama Rao said.

Headline: Maharashtra govt revokes lockdown relaxations for Mumbai, Pune
Description: The Maharashtra government on Tuesday revoked the lockdown relaxations for the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and the Pune Metropolitan Region. The lockdown relaxations have been revoked due to the number of people commuting and the imminent threat of the spread of the coronavirus pandemic, an official order read.
Text: Maharashtra govt revokes lockdown relaxations for Mumbai, Pune The Maharashtra government on Tuesday revoked the lockdown relaxations for the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) and the Pune Metropolitan Region. The lockdown relaxations have been revoked due to the number of people commuting and the imminent threat of the spread of the coronavirus pandemic, an official order read.

Headline: 5-star hotels for doctors, dharamshalas for support staff: Delhi govt revises order
Description: The Delhi government on Tuesday issued a revised order stating that doctors treating COVID-19 patients will be provided four and five-star accommodations, nurses and paramedics are entitled to hotel accommodations while supporting staff will be put up in dharamshalas. They are meant to be put up in these accommodations during a 14-day duty period, followed by a 14-day quarantine period.
Text: 5-star hotels for doctors, dharamshalas for support staff: Delhi govt revises order The Delhi government on Tuesday issued a revised order stating that doctors treating COVID-19 patients will be provided four and five-star accommodations, nurses and paramedics are entitled to hotel accommodations while supporting staff will be put up in dharamshalas. They are meant to be put up in these accommodations during a 14-day duty period, followed by a 14-day quarantine period.

Headline: Punjab CM writes to Centre, seeks interim COVID-19 compensation of ₹3,000 cr
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has written to Home Minister Amit Shah seeking interim compensation of ₹3,000 crore for April on account of COVID-19 pandemic. "Detailed assessment of loss and requirement of funds for relief and rehabilitation will be submitted in due course," said Singh in the letter. He also demanded immediate release of state's GST arrears of ₹4,400 crore.
Text: Punjab CM writes to Centre, seeks interim COVID-19 compensation of ₹3,000 cr Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has written to Home Minister Amit Shah seeking interim compensation of ₹3,000 crore for April on account of COVID-19 pandemic. "Detailed assessment of loss and requirement of funds for relief and rehabilitation will be submitted in due course," said Singh in the letter. He also demanded immediate release of state's GST arrears of ₹4,400 crore.

Headline: Coronavirus positive policeman does pushups in isolation ward, video goes viral
Description: A video of a Punjab Police constable, who had tested positive for coronavirus, doing pushups in an isolation ward in Ferozepur has gone viral. Reacting to the video, a user tweeted, "Salute warrior...India needs officers like you. What a spirit." Punjab's Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu also shared the video.
Text: Coronavirus positive policeman does pushups in isolation ward, video goes viral A video of a Punjab Police constable, who had tested positive for coronavirus, doing pushups in an isolation ward in Ferozepur has gone viral. Reacting to the video, a user tweeted, "Salute warrior...India needs officers like you. What a spirit." Punjab's Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu also shared the video.

Headline: 13 new coronavirus cases in Bihar, state total rises to 126: Govt
Description: Bihar on Tuesday recorded 13 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 126, said state's Principal Secretary (Health) Sanjay Kumar. Out of the new cases, seven cases were reported in Munger, four in Buxar and one each in Patna and Rohtas, said Kumar. The state has reported two coronavirus deaths so far.
Text: 13 new coronavirus cases in Bihar, state total rises to 126: Govt Bihar on Tuesday recorded 13 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases there to 126, said state's Principal Secretary (Health) Sanjay Kumar. Out of the new cases, seven cases were reported in Munger, four in Buxar and one each in Patna and Rohtas, said Kumar. The state has reported two coronavirus deaths so far.

Headline: What are the age groups of coronavirus cases and deaths reported in Delhi so far?
Description: The Delhi government today revealed 1,393 coronavirus patients in national capital are aged less than 50, while 344 cases belong to 50-59 age group and 408 are aged 60 or above. Meanwhile, 10 (21.3%) of 47 deaths were of patients aged less than 50, 12 (25.5%) of the deceased were aged between 50-59, while remaining 25 were 60 or above.
Text: What are the age groups of coronavirus cases and deaths reported in Delhi so far? The Delhi government today revealed 1,393 coronavirus patients in national capital are aged less than 50, while 344 cases belong to 50-59 age group and 408 are aged 60 or above. Meanwhile, 10 (21.3%) of 47 deaths were of patients aged less than 50, 12 (25.5%) of the deceased were aged between 50-59, while remaining 25 were 60 or above.

Headline: Will provide assistance to India: China on faulty rapid testing kits for COVID-19
Description: Spokesperson of Chinese Embassy in India on Wednesday tweeted, "Noticed reports concerning rapid testing kits. China attaches great importance to...quality of exported medical products." "Will keep close communication with Indian concerned agency and provide necessary assistance," the statement read. On Tuesday, ICMR advised states not to use rapid testing kits for 2 days over inaccurate results.
Text: Will provide assistance to India: China on faulty rapid testing kits for COVID-19 Spokesperson of Chinese Embassy in India on Wednesday tweeted, "Noticed reports concerning rapid testing kits. China attaches great importance to...quality of exported medical products." "Will keep close communication with Indian concerned agency and provide necessary assistance," the statement read. On Tuesday, ICMR advised states not to use rapid testing kits for 2 days over inaccurate results.

Headline: Mumbai Police shares 'Gully Boy' meme urging people to stay at home
Description: Mumbai Police on Tuesday shared a 'Gully Boy' meme to caution people against stepping out of their homes during the lockdown. They tweeted a picture of actress Alia Bhatt's character in the film and wrote, "That face when he says he's going out for a walk during lockdown." "Abort mission. We repeat - Abort Mission! #StayHome #StaySafe," the caption read.
Text: Mumbai Police shares 'Gully Boy' meme urging people to stay at home Mumbai Police on Tuesday shared a 'Gully Boy' meme to caution people against stepping out of their homes during the lockdown. They tweeted a picture of actress Alia Bhatt's character in the film and wrote, "That face when he says he's going out for a walk during lockdown." "Abort mission. We repeat - Abort Mission! #StayHome #StaySafe," the caption read.

Headline: India falls two places on World Press Freedom Index; ranks 142
Description: India has dropped two places in the 2020 World Press Freedom Index, ranking 142 out of 180 countries. "The coordinated hate campaigns waged on social networks against journalists who dare to speak or write about subjects that annoy Hindutva followers are alarming," the analysis said. "The campaigns are particularly virulent when the targets are women," it added.
Text: India falls two places on World Press Freedom Index; ranks 142 India has dropped two places in the 2020 World Press Freedom Index, ranking 142 out of 180 countries. "The coordinated hate campaigns waged on social networks against journalists who dare to speak or write about subjects that annoy Hindutva followers are alarming," the analysis said. "The campaigns are particularly virulent when the targets are women," it added.

Headline: Dwayne Bravo shares teaser of his next song dedicated to MS Dhoni
Description: CSK took to Twitter to share a video of West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo giving a teaser of his upcoming song dedicated to MS Dhoni. In the video, Bravo calls Dhoni his 'brother from another mother' before singing, "MS Dhoni. MS Dhoni, No. 7. MS Dhoni, No. 7. All of Ranchi, shouting Dhoni. All of India, shouting Mahi."
Text: Dwayne Bravo shares teaser of his next song dedicated to MS Dhoni CSK took to Twitter to share a video of West Indies all-rounder Dwayne Bravo giving a teaser of his upcoming song dedicated to MS Dhoni. In the video, Bravo calls Dhoni his 'brother from another mother' before singing, "MS Dhoni. MS Dhoni, No. 7. MS Dhoni, No. 7. All of Ranchi, shouting Dhoni. All of India, shouting Mahi."

Headline: IIT-Kanpur's night vision drone camera used to monitor hotspot in UP
Description: IIT-Kanpur-manufactured night vision drone camera was used in Kanpur Nagar to monitor a locked down COVID-19 hotspot area. A video was shared by the DM of Kanpur Nagar, Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari, on Twitter showing the drone monitoring a locked down spot in Beckanganj police station area. MoS for Communications Sanjay Dhotre praised the move.
Text: IIT-Kanpur's night vision drone camera used to monitor hotspot in UP IIT-Kanpur-manufactured night vision drone camera was used in Kanpur Nagar to monitor a locked down COVID-19 hotspot area. A video was shared by the DM of Kanpur Nagar, Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari, on Twitter showing the drone monitoring a locked down spot in Beckanganj police station area. MoS for Communications Sanjay Dhotre praised the move.

Headline: Govt launches dedicated Twitter acc for real-time solutions to COVID-19 queries
Description: The government has created a dedicated Twitter account called '@CovidIndiaSeva' to give real-time solutions to COVID-19 related queries. The platform is only for broader queries and doesn't require users to share health records. The move aims to enable transparent e-governance delivery at large scales. It will also be the official communication channel for the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare.
Text: Govt launches dedicated Twitter acc for real-time solutions to COVID-19 queries The government has created a dedicated Twitter account called '@CovidIndiaSeva' to give real-time solutions to COVID-19 related queries. The platform is only for broader queries and doesn't require users to share health records. The move aims to enable transparent e-governance delivery at large scales. It will also be the official communication channel for the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare.

Headline: Report on launching beta version of video conferencing app fake: Govt
Description: The government has clarified that a report about it launching a beta version of its "soon-to-be-launched" video conferencing app is fake. "Government has neither launched nor endorsed any video conferencing app," it said. A news portal apologised for the error and said its technology desk "incorrectly reported" that 'Say Namaste' app of a Mumbai-based startup, was backed by the government.
Text: Report on launching beta version of video conferencing app fake: Govt The government has clarified that a report about it launching a beta version of its "soon-to-be-launched" video conferencing app is fake. "Government has neither launched nor endorsed any video conferencing app," it said. A news portal apologised for the error and said its technology desk "incorrectly reported" that 'Say Namaste' app of a Mumbai-based startup, was backed by the government.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu near 1,600; death toll rises to 18
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases has risen to 1,596 in Tamil Nadu after 76 new infections were reported today, the state health department said. The death toll rose to 18 after one death was reported on Tuesday. Of the new cases, 55 were reported in Chennai, taking the district's total to 358. The state has tested over 53,000 samples.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu near 1,600; death toll rises to 18 The total number of coronavirus cases has risen to 1,596 in Tamil Nadu after 76 new infections were reported today, the state health department said. The death toll rose to 18 after one death was reported on Tuesday. Of the new cases, 55 were reported in Chennai, taking the district's total to 358. The state has tested over 53,000 samples.

Headline: Who is Lav Agarwal, Health Ministry's Joint Secy & IIT grad who briefs on COVID-19?
Description: Lav Agarwal, the 48-year-old Joint Secretary at Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, has been addressing the press conferences on the country's COVID-19 response for more than 40 days. A 1996 batch IAS officer of Andhra Pradesh cadre, Agarwal studied mechanical engineering at IIT Delhi. He cracked the civil services exam in 1996 with an all-India rank of 21.
Text: Who is Lav Agarwal, Health Ministry's Joint Secy & IIT grad who briefs on COVID-19? Lav Agarwal, the 48-year-old Joint Secretary at Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, has been addressing the press conferences on the country's COVID-19 response for more than 40 days. A 1996 batch IAS officer of Andhra Pradesh cadre, Agarwal studied mechanical engineering at IIT Delhi. He cracked the civil services exam in 1996 with an all-India rank of 21.

Headline: Total 418 coronavirus cases reported in Karnataka, 129 people recover
Description: Karnataka reported 10 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total to 418, the state health department said on Tuesday. The total includes 17 deaths and 129 recoveries. Out of the 272 active cases, 267 are in isolation at hospitals, while five are in ICU. Bengaluru Urban reported most cases at 89, while Mysuru district has 86.
Text: Total 418 coronavirus cases reported in Karnataka, 129 people recover Karnataka reported 10 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total to 418, the state health department said on Tuesday. The total includes 17 deaths and 129 recoveries. Out of the 272 active cases, 267 are in isolation at hospitals, while five are in ICU. Bengaluru Urban reported most cases at 89, while Mysuru district has 86.

Headline: India reports record 705 COVID-19 recoveries in one day, death toll crosses 600
Description: The government on Tuesday said that as many as 705 coronavirus patients recovered on Monday, which is the highest number of recoveries in a day in India so far. The recovery rate in India has risen to 17.48%, it added. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in India are now 18,985, while the death toll has surged to 603.
Text: India reports record 705 COVID-19 recoveries in one day, death toll crosses 600 The government on Tuesday said that as many as 705 coronavirus patients recovered on Monday, which is the highest number of recoveries in a day in India so far. The recovery rate in India has risen to 17.48%, it added. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in India are now 18,985, while the death toll has surged to 603.

Headline: Maharashtra couple dig well outside house in 21 days, find water at 25 feet
Description: Amid the ongoing lockdown, Gajanan Pakmode and his wife Pushpa from Maharashtra's Karkheda village dug a 25-feet deep well outside their house in 21 days. Gajanan said that on the 21st day, they found water at 25 feet. Gajanan added that he started digging the well with his wife since he couldn't go out due to the lockdown.
Text: Maharashtra couple dig well outside house in 21 days, find water at 25 feet Amid the ongoing lockdown, Gajanan Pakmode and his wife Pushpa from Maharashtra's Karkheda village dug a 25-feet deep well outside their house in 21 days. Gajanan said that on the 21st day, they found water at 25 feet. Gajanan added that he started digging the well with his wife since he couldn't go out due to the lockdown.

Headline: Abuse must stop: IMA seeks central law on violence against healthcare workers
Description: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has called for protests and demanded a "special central law against violence on doctors, nurses, healthcare workers and hospitals by ordinance". "Abuse and violence should stop immediately", said a letter by IMA president and secretary general. This came after Chennai locals attacked hospital staff during burial of a doctor who died of COVID-19 on Sunday.
Text: Abuse must stop: IMA seeks central law on violence against healthcare workers The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has called for protests and demanded a "special central law against violence on doctors, nurses, healthcare workers and hospitals by ordinance". "Abuse and violence should stop immediately", said a letter by IMA president and secretary general. This came after Chennai locals attacked hospital staff during burial of a doctor who died of COVID-19 on Sunday.

Headline: 12-yr-old girl dies while trying to walk 150 km from Telangana to Chhattisgarh
Description: A 12-year-old girl died while making a 150-kilometre trip on foot from Telangana to Chhattisgarh. "The distance between the place in Telangana where she worked and Bijapur is 150 kilometres and she died some 50 kilometres away from her native village in Chhattisgarh...Prima facie, it seems she died of electrolyte imbalance," BR Pujari, Bijapur Chief Medical and Health Officer, said.
Text: 12-yr-old girl dies while trying to walk 150 km from Telangana to Chhattisgarh A 12-year-old girl died while making a 150-kilometre trip on foot from Telangana to Chhattisgarh. "The distance between the place in Telangana where she worked and Bijapur is 150 kilometres and she died some 50 kilometres away from her native village in Chhattisgarh...Prima facie, it seems she died of electrolyte imbalance," BR Pujari, Bijapur Chief Medical and Health Officer, said.

Headline: 5 COVID-19 vaccine candidates in human trial phase, has never happened before: ICMR
Description: R Gangakhedkar from Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Tuesday said, "Coronavirus is a new disease and in just 3.5 months, science has shown progress and developed tests for the disease." "Five vaccine candidates have gone into human trial phase out of 70 vaccine candidates. It has never happened before in case of any other disease," he added.
Text: 5 COVID-19 vaccine candidates in human trial phase, has never happened before: ICMR R Gangakhedkar from Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) on Tuesday said, "Coronavirus is a new disease and in just 3.5 months, science has shown progress and developed tests for the disease." "Five vaccine candidates have gone into human trial phase out of 70 vaccine candidates. It has never happened before in case of any other disease," he added.

Headline: Rajasthan stops rapid antibody tests for COVID-19, seeks guidance from ICMR
Description: Rajasthan government has stopped rapid antibody tests for detecting coronavirus, state Health Minister Raghu Sharma said on Tuesday. "We did rapid tests on 168 confirmed cases and only 5.4% of them tested positive for antibodies. So, we have decided to stop the tests for now and sought guidance from the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR)," Sharma said.
Text: Rajasthan stops rapid antibody tests for COVID-19, seeks guidance from ICMR Rajasthan government has stopped rapid antibody tests for detecting coronavirus, state Health Minister Raghu Sharma said on Tuesday. "We did rapid tests on 168 confirmed cases and only 5.4% of them tested positive for antibodies. So, we have decided to stop the tests for now and sought guidance from the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR)," Sharma said.

Headline: Why didn't central teams visit states with higher cases than Bengal?: TMC
Description: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Tuesday called visit of Inter-Ministerial Central Teams (IMCTs) to West Bengal for assessment of COVID-19 situation as "adventure tourism", saying, "CM (Mamata Banerjee) was told about the team's visit three hours after it landed". He also questioned why IMCTs didn't visit states like Gujarat, Tamil Nadu and UP that have higher number of coronavirus cases.
Text: Why didn't central teams visit states with higher cases than Bengal?: TMC TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Tuesday called visit of Inter-Ministerial Central Teams (IMCTs) to West Bengal for assessment of COVID-19 situation as "adventure tourism", saying, "CM (Mamata Banerjee) was told about the team's visit three hours after it landed". He also questioned why IMCTs didn't visit states like Gujarat, Tamil Nadu and UP that have higher number of coronavirus cases.

Headline: Grocery delivery in Bengaluru by Karnataka govt through orders on WhatsApp
Description: Karnataka government and BBMP will facilitate doorstep delivery of groceries and medicines in Bengaluru amid lockdown over a phone call or on WhatsApp on number 08061914960. People can share their grocery list on a call or on WhatsApp and delivery time will be sent to them after confirmation. Around 5,000 delivery agents are being roped in by the government.
Text: Grocery delivery in Bengaluru by Karnataka govt through orders on WhatsApp Karnataka government and BBMP will facilitate doorstep delivery of groceries and medicines in Bengaluru amid lockdown over a phone call or on WhatsApp on number 08061914960. People can share their grocery list on a call or on WhatsApp and delivery time will be sent to them after confirmation. Around 5,000 delivery agents are being roped in by the government.

Headline: 47 at AMU medical college quarantined after patient tests COVID-19 +ve
Description: Forty-seven staff members of Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College attached to Aligarh Muslim University were quarantined after they came in contact with a coronavirus patient, an official said on Tuesday. Chief Superintendent of the AMU hospital Prof Shahid Siddiqui said the staff members, including eight doctors, had inadvertently came in contact with the man, who was brought there on Monday.
Text: 47 at AMU medical college quarantined after patient tests COVID-19 +ve Forty-seven staff members of Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College attached to Aligarh Muslim University were quarantined after they came in contact with a coronavirus patient, an official said on Tuesday. Chief Superintendent of the AMU hospital Prof Shahid Siddiqui said the staff members, including eight doctors, had inadvertently came in contact with the man, who was brought there on Monday.

Headline: 1 bathroom for 20; white pillow is now black: Constable on Delhi quarantine centre
Description: A Delhi Police constable, who has coronavirus, has shared a video complaining about the lack of facilities and medical care at Chaudhary Brahm Prakash Ayurved Charak Sansthan where he's quarantined. "There are 20 people on one floor and just one bathroom...The white pillow has turned black," he said. "We aren't provided medicines for fever, sore throat," the constable added.
Text: 1 bathroom for 20; white pillow is now black: Constable on Delhi quarantine centre A Delhi Police constable, who has coronavirus, has shared a video complaining about the lack of facilities and medical care at Chaudhary Brahm Prakash Ayurved Charak Sansthan where he's quarantined. "There are 20 people on one floor and just one bathroom...The white pillow has turned black," he said. "We aren't provided medicines for fever, sore throat," the constable added.

Headline: Hindi news portal uses pic of IAS officer in news on suicide, he says 'I'm shocked'
Description: Reacting to a Hindi news portal publishing a news about suicide of a Bhilai Steel Plant manager with his picture, Kabirdham District Collector Awanish Sharan said, "The news is not remotely related to me, but it shows my photo." He added that he was shocked and sad to see that the news was not corrected for 18 hours.
Text: Hindi news portal uses pic of IAS officer in news on suicide, he says 'I'm shocked' Reacting to a Hindi news portal publishing a news about suicide of a Bhilai Steel Plant manager with his picture, Kabirdham District Collector Awanish Sharan said, "The news is not remotely related to me, but it shows my photo." He added that he was shocked and sad to see that the news was not corrected for 18 hours.

Headline: Got best treatment, can't forget love Kerala gave: Recovered Italian tourist
Description: A tourist from Italy, who tested positive on March 13 while visiting Kerala, was discharged from hospital on Monday after making a full recovery from COVID-19. "It's heartening that I got the best possible treatment...I can never forget the love Kerala has given me," the tourist said. He also left a handwritten note of gratitude for the health workers.
Text: Got best treatment, can't forget love Kerala gave: Recovered Italian tourist A tourist from Italy, who tested positive on March 13 while visiting Kerala, was discharged from hospital on Monday after making a full recovery from COVID-19. "It's heartening that I got the best possible treatment...I can never forget the love Kerala has given me," the tourist said. He also left a handwritten note of gratitude for the health workers.

Headline: ICMR advises states not to use rapid testing kits for 2 days over inaccurate results
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has advised all the states not to use rapid testing kits for two days after variations were reported in results. "Kits will be tested and validated by on-ground teams and we will give advisory in the next 2 days," ICMR's R Gangakhedkar said. Earlier today, Rajasthan had stopped rapid testing, citing low efficiency.
Text: ICMR advises states not to use rapid testing kits for 2 days over inaccurate results The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has advised all the states not to use rapid testing kits for two days after variations were reported in results. "Kits will be tested and validated by on-ground teams and we will give advisory in the next 2 days," ICMR's R Gangakhedkar said. Earlier today, Rajasthan had stopped rapid testing, citing low efficiency.

Headline: MP farmer dies after alleged police assault; 6 policemen suspended
Description: A 50-year-old farmer, who was allegedly beaten up by police for lockdown violation, died on Monday in MP's Jabalpur, leading to suspension of six policemen. Action was taken against the personnel after the victim named them in a video that surfaced on social media, said Sanjeev Uikey, Additional SP, Jabalpur. A probe has been launched into the incident, said Uikey.
Text: MP farmer dies after alleged police assault; 6 policemen suspended A 50-year-old farmer, who was allegedly beaten up by police for lockdown violation, died on Monday in MP's Jabalpur, leading to suspension of six policemen. Action was taken against the personnel after the victim named them in a video that surfaced on social media, said Sanjeev Uikey, Additional SP, Jabalpur. A probe has been launched into the incident, said Uikey.

Headline: West Bengal govt not letting Central teams make ground-level assessment: Centre
Description: The Home Ministry has said that it received feedback that the West Bengal government is not cooperating with the Inter-Ministerial Central teams visiting the state to assess the COVID-19 situation. The teams in Kolkata and Jalpaiguri are being prevented from visiting the areas and are not being allowed make a ground-level assessment, Joint Secretary (Home Affairs) Punya Salila Srivastava said.
Text: West Bengal govt not letting Central teams make ground-level assessment: Centre The Home Ministry has said that it received feedback that the West Bengal government is not cooperating with the Inter-Ministerial Central teams visiting the state to assess the COVID-19 situation. The teams in Kolkata and Jalpaiguri are being prevented from visiting the areas and are not being allowed make a ground-level assessment, Joint Secretary (Home Affairs) Punya Salila Srivastava said.

Headline: 5 arrested for pelting stones at medical team in Moradabad test +ve for COVID-19
Description: Five people arrested for pelting stones at a medical team and police in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad have tested positive for coronavirus, Chief Medical Officer Dr MC Garg said. The medical team and police officials had gone to take family members of a person who had died of COVID-19 to a quarantine facility.
Text: 5 arrested for pelting stones at medical team in Moradabad test +ve for COVID-19 Five people arrested for pelting stones at a medical team and police in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad have tested positive for coronavirus, Chief Medical Officer Dr MC Garg said. The medical team and police officials had gone to take family members of a person who had died of COVID-19 to a quarantine facility.

Headline: 62-yr-old Kerala woman tests COVID-19 +ve 19 times after 42 days in hospital
Description: A 62-year-old woman in Kerala who has been in the hospital for the last 42 days has tested positive for coronavirus 19 successive times. "She contracted coronavirus after coming in contact with an Italy-returned family. She is not showing many symptoms," Pathanamthitta district medical officer said. The advice of the state medical board has been sought in the case.
Text: 62-yr-old Kerala woman tests COVID-19 +ve 19 times after 42 days in hospital A 62-year-old woman in Kerala who has been in the hospital for the last 42 days has tested positive for coronavirus 19 successive times. "She contracted coronavirus after coming in contact with an Italy-returned family. She is not showing many symptoms," Pathanamthitta district medical officer said. The advice of the state medical board has been sought in the case.

Headline: Indians in US can't be brought back: SC on evacuation plea
Description: Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday refused to pass an order on a petition seeking evacuation of Indians stranded in the US amid coronavirus pandemic. "They (Indians in US) cannot be brought in, no matter how much we want," said the SC bench. "Assistance is being given to them. US government is extending visas. Let's wait for some time," it added.
Text: Indians in US can't be brought back: SC on evacuation plea Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday refused to pass an order on a petition seeking evacuation of Indians stranded in the US amid coronavirus pandemic. "They (Indians in US) cannot be brought in, no matter how much we want," said the SC bench. "Assistance is being given to them. US government is extending visas. Let's wait for some time," it added.

Headline: Delhi MPs, MLAs to get 2k food coupons each for distributing to poor: CM
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said all MPs and MLAs in Delhi will get 2,000 food coupons each for distributing among the poor amid coronavirus lockdown. The coupons can be used to get 5 kg free ration per person, said Kejriwal. These will be given to people who don't have ration cards or any other government ID cards, he added.
Text: Delhi MPs, MLAs to get 2k food coupons each for distributing to poor: CM Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said all MPs and MLAs in Delhi will get 2,000 food coupons each for distributing among the poor amid coronavirus lockdown. The coupons can be used to get 5 kg free ration per person, said Kejriwal. These will be given to people who don't have ration cards or any other government ID cards, he added.

Headline: Pawar condemns Palghar mob lynching, says no time to play politics
Description: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has condemned the mob lynching that took place in Palghar district. Pawar said, "Some people are talking and raising questions about law and order situation even when the incident occurred due to some rumours. It is not time to play politics." He added, "This is when we all should stand united and fight the coronavirus pandemic."
Text: Pawar condemns Palghar mob lynching, says no time to play politics NCP chief Sharad Pawar has condemned the mob lynching that took place in Palghar district. Pawar said, "Some people are talking and raising questions about law and order situation even when the incident occurred due to some rumours. It is not time to play politics." He added, "This is when we all should stand united and fight the coronavirus pandemic."

Headline: Why govt not passing benefit of reduced oil prices: Congress
Description: Congress has asked the government why it wasn't reducing the prices of petrol and diesel. Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Prices of crude oil have fallen to unexpected levels in the world, yet why is petrol in our country sold at ₹69, diesel at ₹62." Randeep Surjewala tweeted, "WTI crude oil price plunges below $0 per barrel! Why is Modi Government mum?"
Text: Why govt not passing benefit of reduced oil prices: Congress Congress has asked the government why it wasn't reducing the prices of petrol and diesel. Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Prices of crude oil have fallen to unexpected levels in the world, yet why is petrol in our country sold at ₹69, diesel at ₹62." Randeep Surjewala tweeted, "WTI crude oil price plunges below $0 per barrel! Why is Modi Government mum?"

Headline: SC asks Centre, J&K to respond to plea seeking 4G internet restoration
Description: Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday asked central government and J&K administration to file detailed response on a petition seeking restoration of 4G mobile internet services in the Union Territory. The response has to be filed by Sunday, after assessment of ground situation in J&K, said the SC bench. The matter has been scheduled for further hearing on Monday.
Text: SC asks Centre, J&K to respond to plea seeking 4G internet restoration Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday asked central government and J&K administration to file detailed response on a petition seeking restoration of 4G mobile internet services in the Union Territory. The response has to be filed by Sunday, after assessment of ground situation in J&K, said the SC bench. The matter has been scheduled for further hearing on Monday.

Headline: India heaven for Muslims: Naqvi on OIC's 'Islamophobic campaign in India' remark
Description: India is "heaven for Muslims" and their social, economic and religious rights are secure, Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said. "India's Muslims are prosperous and those trying to vitiate the atmosphere can't be their friends," he added. This comes after the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) said that it "condemns the unrelenting vicious Islamophobic campaign in India".
Text: India heaven for Muslims: Naqvi on OIC's 'Islamophobic campaign in India' remark India is "heaven for Muslims" and their social, economic and religious rights are secure, Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said. "India's Muslims are prosperous and those trying to vitiate the atmosphere can't be their friends," he added. This comes after the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) said that it "condemns the unrelenting vicious Islamophobic campaign in India".

Headline: MP policeman dies of COVID-19; govt announces ₹50 lakh aid, job to daughter
Description: A police official in Madhya Pradesh’s Ujjain passed away due to COVID-19 led respiratory complications at a hospital in Indore on Tuesday. Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced monetary assistance of ₹50 lakh for his family and a job at the post of sub-inspector to the policeman’s daughter. The state government will award him Karmaveer Medal posthumously, Chouhan said.
Text: MP policeman dies of COVID-19; govt announces ₹50 lakh aid, job to daughter A police official in Madhya Pradesh’s Ujjain passed away due to COVID-19 led respiratory complications at a hospital in Indore on Tuesday. Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced monetary assistance of ₹50 lakh for his family and a job at the post of sub-inspector to the policeman’s daughter. The state government will award him Karmaveer Medal posthumously, Chouhan said.

Headline: Family member of Rashtrapati Bhavan employee tests +ve for coronavirus
Description: A family member of a Rashtrapati Bhavan employee has tested positive for coronavirus at a quarantine facility at Delhi's Mandir Marg. The employee along with the family is a resident of Pocket 1, Schedule A area of the President's Estate. All other family members including the employee of the President's Secretariat have tested negative.
Text: Family member of Rashtrapati Bhavan employee tests +ve for coronavirus A family member of a Rashtrapati Bhavan employee has tested positive for coronavirus at a quarantine facility at Delhi's Mandir Marg. The employee along with the family is a resident of Pocket 1, Schedule A area of the President's Estate. All other family members including the employee of the President's Secretariat have tested negative.

Headline: Thane police perform aarti of people taking morning walk amid lockdown
Description: The Maharashtra police performed aarti of people who violated the nationwide lockdown to take a morning walk on the streets of Thane on Tuesday. A video of the incident, which also shows a police officer clapping, has emerged online. Earlier, the Pune police had made lockdown violators perform yoga and exercise in the middle of a street.
Text: Thane police perform aarti of people taking morning walk amid lockdown The Maharashtra police performed aarti of people who violated the nationwide lockdown to take a morning walk on the streets of Thane on Tuesday. A video of the incident, which also shows a police officer clapping, has emerged online. Earlier, the Pune police had made lockdown violators perform yoga and exercise in the middle of a street.

Headline: Punjab's Rajpura reports 5 new COVID 19 cases; all asymptomatic
Description: Five new Covid-19 cases have been reported in Punjab's Rajpura, all of which are asymptomatic and have come from the same source, state Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu has stated. There are a total of 245 Covid-19 cases in Punjab, of which 38 patients have been cured and 16 have passed away.
Text: Punjab's Rajpura reports 5 new COVID 19 cases; all asymptomatic Five new Covid-19 cases have been reported in Punjab's Rajpura, all of which are asymptomatic and have come from the same source, state Special Chief Secretary KBS Sidhu has stated. There are a total of 245 Covid-19 cases in Punjab, of which 38 patients have been cured and 16 have passed away.

Headline: Shouldn't ban Maha liquor stores if distancing is followed: Minister
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said that "there should not be any ban on liquor shops in the state" if proper social distancing norms are maintained amid coronavirus outbreak. In the state, where the liquor shops are closed since last month, the health minister did not provide further details on its opening. Maharashtra has over 4,660 coronavirus cases.
Text: Shouldn't ban Maha liquor stores if distancing is followed: Minister Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said that "there should not be any ban on liquor shops in the state" if proper social distancing norms are maintained amid coronavirus outbreak. In the state, where the liquor shops are closed since last month, the health minister did not provide further details on its opening. Maharashtra has over 4,660 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Govt making sanitiser for rich from poor people's share of rice: Rahul
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised central government's decision to allow the use of surplus rice to make hand sanitiser amid coronavirus spread. "When will the poor of India wake up? You are dying of hunger and they are busy in cleaning hands of the rich by making sanitiser from your share of rice," said Gandhi on Twitter.
Text: Govt making sanitiser for rich from poor people's share of rice: Rahul Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised central government's decision to allow the use of surplus rice to make hand sanitiser amid coronavirus spread. "When will the poor of India wake up? You are dying of hunger and they are busy in cleaning hands of the rich by making sanitiser from your share of rice," said Gandhi on Twitter.

Headline: 59-year-old sub-inspector tests +ve in UP's Bijnor district
Description: A 59-year-old sub-inspector tested positive for coronavirus in UP's Bijnor district on Sunday, the Nahtaur SHO has stated. Samples of 40 policemen have been sent for testing while samples of the remaining 32 will be collected soon. The sub-inspector contracted coronavirus when he went to a village to take nine migrant workers, who had returned from Delhi, to be quarantined.
Text: 59-year-old sub-inspector tests +ve in UP's Bijnor district A 59-year-old sub-inspector tested positive for coronavirus in UP's Bijnor district on Sunday, the Nahtaur SHO has stated. Headline: Will do that: Delhi CM on tweet asking for mass tests on mediapersons
Description: Responding to Twitter user Anurag Dhanda after he requested Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal to arrange mass COVID-19 tests for mediapersons on the lines of the tests carried out in Mumbai, Kejriwal tweeted, "Sure. We will do that." Dhanda had tweeted, "Yesterday 53 Journalists were found Corona Positive in Mumbai. All of them were asymptomatic."

We will do that." Dhanda had tweeted, "Yesterday 53 Journalists were found Corona Positive in Mumbai. All of them were asymptomatic."

Headline: 7 new coronavirus cases reported in Nagpur district, total reaches 88
Description: Seven new Covid-19 cases were reported in Nagpur district on Tuesday, taking the total number of positive cases to 88, authorities have stated. There are over 4,600 cases of Covid-19 in Maharashtra, of which 572 people have been cured and 232 people have passed away. Maharashtra has the highest number of coronavirus cases in India.
Text: 7 new coronavirus cases reported in Nagpur district, total reaches 88 Seven new Covid-19 cases were reported in Nagpur district on Tuesday, taking the total number of positive cases to 88, authorities have stated. There are over 4,600 cases of Covid-19 in Maharashtra, of which 572 people have been cured and 232 people have passed away. Maharashtra has the highest number of coronavirus cases in India.

Headline: Tejashwi urges Nitish to test Bihar journalists for coronavirus
Description: Leader of Opposition in Bihar Assembly Tejashwi Yadav has requested Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to test the journalists in the state for coronavirus. Yadav tweeted, "Hon'ble CM is requested to test the journalists for coronavirus who are disseminating awareness and information about COVID-19 to the citizens. Like other corona warriors, they should also be ensured proper security and facilities."
Text: Tejashwi urges Nitish to test Bihar journalists for coronavirus Leader of Opposition in Bihar Assembly Tejashwi Yadav has requested Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to test the journalists in the state for coronavirus. Like other corona warriors, they should also be ensured proper security and facilities."

Headline: Teacher climbs tree for internet connectivity to teach students amid lockdown
Description: A teacher in West Bengal's Ahanda village, Subrata Pati, climbs up a tree for internet connectivity required to teach his students amid lockdown. Pati, who shifted to his village from Kolkata amid COVID-19 outbreak, said he wants to fulfil his responsibilities as a teacher during the crisis. He sits on a tree-top platform made of bamboo, gunny sacks and hay.
Text: Teacher climbs tree for internet connectivity to teach students amid lockdown A teacher in West Bengal's Ahanda village, Subrata Pati, climbs up a tree for internet connectivity required to teach his students amid lockdown. Pati, who shifted to his village from Kolkata amid COVID-19 outbreak, said he wants to fulfil his responsibilities as a teacher during the crisis. He sits on a tree-top platform made of bamboo, gunny sacks and hay.

Headline: Residence proof must outside homes, no moving beyond 3 km: T'gana DGP
Description: Telangana Director General of Police (DGP) M Mahender Reddy said it's mandatory for people to carry their residence proofs while stepping out to purchase essential items. This has been done to ensure people don't move beyond three kilometres of their houses. "People who want to go to hospitals should go to nearest hospitals....those [visiting] super speciality hospitals....exempted," Reddy added.
Text: Residence proof must outside homes, no moving beyond 3 km: T'gana DGP Telangana Director General of Police (DGP) M Mahender Reddy said it's mandatory for people to carry their residence proofs while stepping out to purchase essential items. This has been done to ensure people don't move beyond three kilometres of their houses. "People who want to go to hospitals should go to nearest hospitals....those [visiting] super speciality hospitals....exempted," Reddy added.

Headline: 10,000 litres free water every month for all Bengaluru households: BBMP
Description: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike on Monday announced that every Bengaluru household will get up to 10,000 litres free Cauvery water every month. "Domestic consumers using over 10,000 litres shall pay their bills as usual," a BBMP official said. The decision was taken after considering the economic burden COVID-19 outbreak has caused to small families, Revenue Minister R Ashoka said.
Text: 10,000 litres free water every month for all Bengaluru households: BBMP The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike on Monday announced that every Bengaluru household will get up to 10,000 litres free Cauvery water every month. "Domestic consumers using over 10,000 litres shall pay their bills as usual," a BBMP official said. The decision was taken after considering the economic burden COVID-19 outbreak has caused to small families, Revenue Minister R Ashoka said.

Headline: Chandigarh man orders home delivery of 2 burgers from Panchkula, arrested
Description: Two men comprising of one customer who placed the home delivery order of two burgers in Chandigarh and the manager of the burger shop in Panchkula were arrested for defying coronavirus curfew orders. The home delivery of burger is allowed in Panchkula but the Chandigarh administration does not permit city residents to place home delivery orders out of Chandigarh.
Text: Chandigarh man orders home delivery of 2 burgers from Panchkula, arrested Two men comprising of one customer who placed the home delivery order of two burgers in Chandigarh and the manager of the burger shop in Panchkula were arrested for defying coronavirus curfew orders. The home delivery of burger is allowed in Panchkula but the Chandigarh administration does not permit city residents to place home delivery orders out of Chandigarh.

Headline: Assam gives ₹2K each to 86K locals stranded outside the state
Description: Assam government on Monday deposited ₹2,000 each to the bank accounts of 86,000 people from the state stranded in other parts of India amid COVID-19 lockdown. Assam's Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said 99,758 people were identified for the assistance and 86,000 people received the money. He added that the remaining others would get it within the next few days.
Text: Assam gives ₹2K each to 86K locals stranded outside the state Assam government on Monday deposited ₹2,000 each to the bank accounts of 86,000 people from the state stranded in other parts of India amid COVID-19 lockdown. Assam's Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said 99,758 people were identified for the assistance and 86,000 people received the money. He added that the remaining others would get it within the next few days.

Headline: Andhra reports 35 new cases, state count rises to 757
Description: Andhra Pradesh has reported 35 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 757, the state government has said. Ten of the cases were reported in Kurnool district, and nine in Guntur district. The total death toll in Andhra has risen to 22, while 96 people have been discharged from hospitals after completing treatment.
Text: Andhra reports 35 new cases, state count rises to 757 Andhra Pradesh has reported 35 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 757, the state government has said. Ten of the cases were reported in Kurnool district, and nine in Guntur district. The total death toll in Andhra has risen to 22, while 96 people have been discharged from hospitals after completing treatment.

Headline: Pollution in Yamuna down by 30% in Delhi: Delhi Pollution Control Committee
Description: Pollution in the Yamuna dipped by up to 30% in the first week of April, an assessment by the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) revealed. Wastewater quality in drains has also improved by up to 80%, DPCC further revealed. It's a result of more freshwater flow in Yamuna and fewer pollutants in drains during the lockdown, an official said.
Text: Pollution in Yamuna down by 30% in Delhi: Delhi Pollution Control Committee Pollution in the Yamuna dipped by up to 30% in the first week of April, an assessment by the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) revealed. Wastewater quality in drains has also improved by up to 80%, DPCC further revealed. It's a result of more freshwater flow in Yamuna and fewer pollutants in drains during the lockdown, an official said.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 52 new Covid-19 cases, total crosses 1,600
Description: Rajasthan recorded 52 fresh coronavirus cases on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,628, Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Rohit Kumar Singh said. Thirty-four of the new cases were reported from Jaipur while five were reported from Jodhpur. Rajasthan has so far seen 25 deaths due to the virus, with Jaipur accounting for 13 deaths.
Text: Rajasthan reports 52 new Covid-19 cases, total crosses 1,600 Rajasthan recorded 52 fresh coronavirus cases on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,628, Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Rohit Kumar Singh said. Thirty-four of the new cases were reported from Jaipur while five were reported from Jodhpur. Rajasthan has so far seen 25 deaths due to the virus, with Jaipur accounting for 13 deaths.

Headline: 3 policemen posted in Delhi's Nabi Karim containment zone test +ve
Description: The Delhi Police has stated that three of its police personnel who were posted in Nabi Karim area, which is one of the 84 containment zones in the capital city, have tested positive for coronavirus. A total of 2,081 people have tested positive for Covid-19 in Delhi, of which 431 have been cured and 47 have passed away.
Text: 3 policemen posted in Delhi's Nabi Karim containment zone test +ve The Delhi Police has stated that three of its police personnel who were posted in Nabi Karim area, which is one of the 84 containment zones in the capital city, have tested positive for coronavirus. A total of 2,081 people have tested positive for Covid-19 in Delhi, of which 431 have been cured and 47 have passed away.

Headline: Shivraj Singh Chouhan expands Cabinet month after taking oath as MP CM
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday expanded the state Cabinet, nearly a month after taking oath as the Chief Minister. Narottam Mishra, Tulsi Silawat, Kamal Patel, Govind Singh Rajput and Meena Singh took the oath of office as ministers. Silawat and Rajput are former Congress MLAs who resigned and joined BJP along with several other MLAs.
Text: Shivraj Singh Chouhan expands Cabinet month after taking oath as MP CM Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday expanded the state Cabinet, nearly a month after taking oath as the Chief Minister. Narottam Mishra, Tulsi Silawat, Kamal Patel, Govind Singh Rajput and Meena Singh took the oath of office as ministers. Silawat and Rajput are former Congress MLAs who resigned and joined BJP along with several other MLAs.

Headline: Add transgender as separate category in job applications: Govt to its depts
Description: The government has asked all its departments to include 'Transgender' as a separate category of gender for recruitment in civil services and other posts. The move is based on the provisions of the Transgender Persons (Protection of Rights) Act, notified in December last year. The Act also provides for grievance redressal mechanism in each establishment.
Text: Add transgender as separate category in job applications: Govt to its depts The government has asked all its departments to include 'Transgender' as a separate category of gender for recruitment in civil services and other posts. The move is based on the provisions of the Transgender Persons (Protection of Rights) Act, notified in December last year. The Act also provides for grievance redressal mechanism in each establishment.

Headline: SC petition seeks full refund for flight tickets cancelled due to lockdown
Description: A petition has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking directions that airlines should provide full refunds for tickets cancelled due to the lockdown. The petition filed by the Pravasi Legal Cell alleged the practice of airlines providing mandatory 'credit shell' violates DGCA guidelines. Accepting the 'credit shell' is the prerogative of the passengers as per rules, the plea added.
Text: SC petition seeks full refund for flight tickets cancelled due to lockdown A petition has been filed in the Supreme Court seeking directions that airlines should provide full refunds for tickets cancelled due to the lockdown. The petition filed by the Pravasi Legal Cell alleged the practice of airlines providing mandatory 'credit shell' violates DGCA guidelines. Accepting the 'credit shell' is the prerogative of the passengers as per rules, the plea added.

Headline: Arnab Goswami resigns from Editors Guild of India on live TV
Description: Arnab Goswami resigned from the Editors Guild of India for its silence on lynching of three people in Maharashtra's Palghar. "I, on live television, resign from Editors Guild of India for its absolute compromise on editorial ethics, for being an organisation that is only operating in self interest," he said. "It is a group of has-beens," he further said.
Text: Arnab Goswami resigns from Editors Guild of India on live TV Arnab Goswami resigned from the Editors Guild of India for its silence on lynching of three people in Maharashtra's Palghar. "It is a group of has-beens," he further said.

Headline: Financial resources depleting, will take loan & reach out: Prakash
Description: Actor Prakash Raj on Monday tweeted that he will take a loan to help people and added that he can always earn again. "My financial resources depleting...but will take a loan and continue reaching out...I know I can always earn again...if humanity survives these difficult times," he wrote. "Let's fight this together...let's give back to life...a #prakashrajfoundation initiative," Prakash added.

"My financial resources depleting...but will take a loan and continue reaching out...I know I can always earn again...if humanity survives these difficult times," he wrote. "Let's fight this together...let's give back to life...a #prakashrajfoundation initiative," Prakash added.

Headline: Delhi govt hospitals asked to form media cells to monitor social media
Description: Delhi government asked its hospitals to set up media cells to tackle messages on social media regarding functioning of government hospitals. "The concerned hospital needs to either rebut the information or take corrective action to avoid reoccurrence of such incidences," it said. Earlier, a girl had alleged that her COVID-19 positive father wasn't getting proper treatment in a government hospital.
Text: Delhi govt hospitals asked to form media cells to monitor social media Delhi government asked its hospitals to set up media cells to tackle messages on social media regarding functioning of government hospitals. "The concerned hospital needs to either rebut the information or take corrective action to avoid reoccurrence of such incidences," it said. Earlier, a girl had alleged that her COVID-19 positive father wasn't getting proper treatment in a government hospital.

Headline: West Bengal to ramp up testing from 425 to 600 per day: TMC leader
Description: TMC leader Sudip Bandyopadhyay has said that West Bengal will ramp up testing, from 425 to 600 per day. The total number of cases in the state is 392, of which 73 people have been discharged from hospitals while 12 people have passed away. Meanwhile, the total number of cases in India have crossed 18,500.
Text: West Bengal to ramp up testing from 425 to 600 per day: TMC leader TMC leader Sudip Bandyopadhyay has said that West Bengal will ramp up testing, from 425 to 600 per day. The total number of cases in the state is 392, of which 73 people have been discharged from hospitals while 12 people have passed away. Meanwhile, the total number of cases in India have crossed 18,500.

Headline: 2 cases filed in Mathura over Facebook posts targeting Rahul Gandhi
Description: The Uttar Pradesh police have registered two separate FIRs over alleged objectionable posts shared on Facebook targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. The FIRs were lodged based on complaints filed by UP Congress leader Mukesh Dhangar and advocate Umesh Sharma, president of Mahanagar Congress Committee, Mathura. The police said they are searching for both the accused.
Text: 2 cases filed in Mathura over Facebook posts targeting Rahul Gandhi The Uttar Pradesh police have registered two separate FIRs over alleged objectionable posts shared on Facebook targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. The FIRs were lodged based on complaints filed by UP Congress leader Mukesh Dhangar and advocate Umesh Sharma, president of Mahanagar Congress Committee, Mathura. The police said they are searching for both the accused.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi rise to 2,081, containment zones raised to 84
Description: As many as 78 more coronavirus cases were reported in Delhi in last 24 hours, taking the total cases in the national capital to 2,081. Out of all the cases, 1,603 are active, while 431 people have recovered and 47 have succumbed to the virus. Further, the total number of containment zones in Delhi has been raised to 84.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Delhi rise to 2,081, containment zones raised to 84 As many as 78 more coronavirus cases were reported in Delhi in last 24 hours, taking the total cases in the national capital to 2,081. Out of all the cases, 1,603 are active, while 431 people have recovered and 47 have succumbed to the virus. Further, the total number of containment zones in Delhi has been raised to 84.

Headline: 466 new coronavirus cases, 9 deaths reported in Maharashtra today
Description: As many as 466 new coronavirus cases and nine more deaths were confirmed in Maharashtra today. The total number of cases in the state has risen to 4,666, while the number of deaths in Maharashtra has surged to 232. Further, the total number of patients who have been cured stands at 572. As many as 65 patients were discharged today.
Text: 466 new coronavirus cases, 9 deaths reported in Maharashtra today As many as 466 new coronavirus cases and nine more deaths were confirmed in Maharashtra today. The total number of cases in the state has risen to 4,666, while the number of deaths in Maharashtra has surged to 232. Further, the total number of patients who have been cured stands at 572. As many as 65 patients were discharged today.

Headline: It's not clear: Mamata writes to PM Modi, asks for reasons for deploying IMCTs
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has written to PM Narendra Modi regarding the Centre's decision to send inter-ministerial central teams (IMCTs) to the state to review coronavirus lockdown, calling it "not desirable". Mamata added, "The basis on which Centre is proposing to deploy IMCTs in select districts across India including few in WB under Disaster Management Act, 2005 is unclear."
Text: It's not clear: Mamata writes to PM Modi, asks for reasons for deploying IMCTs West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has written to PM Narendra Modi regarding the Centre's decision to send inter-ministerial central teams (IMCTs) to the state to review coronavirus lockdown, calling it "not desirable". Mamata added, "The basis on which Centre is proposing to deploy IMCTs in select districts across India including few in WB under Disaster Management Act, 2005 is unclear."

Headline: 8-month pregnant health care professional attends patients in Chhattisgarh
Description: Santoshi Manikpuri, a health care professional in Chhattisgarh's Kondagaon, has been attending to patients even in the 8th month of her pregnancy. "I'm happy to do my work and that I'm getting to serve the country in a time like this," Manikpuri said. As per the official data, over 18,000 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the country so far.
Text: 8-month pregnant health care professional attends patients in Chhattisgarh Santoshi Manikpuri, a health care professional in Chhattisgarh's Kondagaon, has been attending to patients even in the 8th month of her pregnancy. "I'm happy to do my work and that I'm getting to serve the country in a time like this," Manikpuri said. As per the official data, over 18,000 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the country so far.

Headline: First COVID-19 patient treated with plasma therapy in Delhi shows improvement
Description: The first patient who was administered plasma therapy on compassionate grounds at Delhi's Max Hospital has shown positive results and was weaned off ventilator support on April 18, the hospital said on Monday. The 49-year-old patient was administered fresh plasma as a treatment on April 14. He is now doing well and his two consecutive COVID-19 tests have come negative.
Text: First COVID-19 patient treated with plasma therapy in Delhi shows improvement The first patient who was administered plasma therapy on compassionate grounds at Delhi's Max Hospital has shown positive results and was weaned off ventilator support on April 18, the hospital said on Monday. The 49-year-old patient was administered fresh plasma as a treatment on April 14. He is now doing well and his two consecutive COVID-19 tests have come negative.

Headline: 47 new COVID-19 cases in West Bengal; active cases now at 245
Description: West Bengal on Monday recorded 47 new coronavirus cases, taking the number of active cases there to 245, said the state's department of health and family welfare. Coronavirus death toll in West Bengal remained at 12, while the state has reported 73 recoveries so far. West Bengal has 226 people admitted in hospital isolation.
Text: 47 new COVID-19 cases in West Bengal; active cases now at 245 West Bengal on Monday recorded 47 new coronavirus cases, taking the number of active cases there to 245, said the state's department of health and family welfare. Coronavirus death toll in West Bengal remained at 12, while the state has reported 73 recoveries so far. West Bengal has 226 people admitted in hospital isolation.

Headline: Doctors, hospitals to light candle at 9pm on Apr 22 in protest against violence: IMA
Description: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) today announced that all doctors and hospitals will light a candle at 9 pm on April 22 in protest against violence against doctors. "Our legitimate needs for safe workplaces have to be met," the IMA said. "If govt fails to enact Central Law on violence against doctors...we'll declare Black Day on April 23," it added.
Text: Doctors, hospitals to light candle at 9pm on Apr 22 in protest against violence: IMA The Indian Medical Association (IMA) today announced that all doctors and hospitals will light a candle at 9 pm on April 22 in protest against violence against doctors. "Our legitimate needs for safe workplaces have to be met," the IMA said. "If govt fails to enact Central Law on violence against doctors...we'll declare Black Day on April 23," it added.

Headline: Countries must trace every contact, so-called lockdowns can't end COVID-19 alone: WHO
Description: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus today said that countries must now ensure they can detect, test, isolate and care for every coronavirus case, and trace every contact. He added, "We want to re-emphasise that easing restrictions is not the end of the epidemic...So-called lockdowns can help to take the heat out of a country's epidemic...but they cannot end it alone."
Text: Countries must trace every contact, so-called lockdowns can't end COVID-19 alone: WHO WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus today said that countries must now ensure they can detect, test, isolate and care for every coronavirus case, and trace every contact. He added, "We want to re-emphasise that easing restrictions is not the end of the epidemic...So-called lockdowns can help to take the heat out of a country's epidemic...but they cannot end it alone."

Headline: 11 labourers try to return to Odisha on bicycles amid COVID-19 lockdown, held
Description: Gujarat's police arrested 11 migrant workers at a powerloom factory in Surat who were going back to their native places in Odisha on bicycles amid coronavirus lockdown. "They wanted to go back...as they were facing shortage of food and money. We provided them food and also carried out medical examination before they were dropped back in Surat," an official said.
Text: 11 labourers try to return to Odisha on bicycles amid COVID-19 lockdown, held Gujarat's police arrested 11 migrant workers at a powerloom factory in Surat who were going back to their native places in Odisha on bicycles amid coronavirus lockdown. "They wanted to go back...as they were facing shortage of food and money. We provided them food and also carried out medical examination before they were dropped back in Surat," an official said.

Headline: Railways to make 1 lakh coveralls by May 31 for COVID-19 frontline staff
Description: Indian Railways is planning to make 1 lakh coveralls by May 31 for the country's frontline staff battling the COVID-19 outbreak. While raw material for 60,000 coveralls have already been distributed among all zonal railways, the same for another 40,000 has been requisitioned and will reach by April-end. Including GST, the railway coverall costs ₹447 per piece.
Text: Railways to make 1 lakh coveralls by May 31 for COVID-19 frontline staff Indian Railways is planning to make 1 lakh coveralls by May 31 for the country's frontline staff battling the COVID-19 outbreak. While raw material for 60,000 coveralls have already been distributed among all zonal railways, the same for another 40,000 has been requisitioned and will reach by April-end. Including GST, the railway coverall costs ₹447 per piece.

Headline: 6 foreigners found living in Rishikesh cave for a month after running out of money
Description: Uttarakhand police have found six foreigners living in a cave near the Ganga in Lakshman Jhula area in Rishikesh after running out of money. "They were...brought to the police station where they said they had shifted to the cave on March 24," said police. "They've been now shifted to a quarantine centre...None of them have shown...symptoms of COVID-19," police added.
Text: 6 foreigners found living in Rishikesh cave for a month after running out of money Uttarakhand police have found six foreigners living in a cave near the Ganga in Lakshman Jhula area in Rishikesh after running out of money. "They were...brought to the police station where they said they had shifted to the cave on March 24," said police. "They've been now shifted to a quarantine centre...None of them have shown...symptoms of COVID-19," police added.

Headline: Manipur is now coronavirus free, both patients fully recovered: CM
Description: Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh on Sunday said that the two coronavirus patients in the state have "fully recovered" and have tested negative for the virus. "I am glad to share that Manipur is now corona(virus) free," said Singh on Twitter. "There are no fresh cases of the virus in the state," he added.
Text: Manipur is now coronavirus free, both patients fully recovered: CM Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh on Sunday said that the two coronavirus patients in the state have "fully recovered" and have tested negative for the virus. "I am glad to share that Manipur is now corona(virus) free," said Singh on Twitter. "There are no fresh cases of the virus in the state," he added.

Headline: Bihar kids say they eat frogs due to no food in viral video, govt calls it fake
Description: A video of children in Bihar claiming that they have been forced to eat frogs as there is no food available has gone viral on social media. The children were interviewed by a media portal. "The claim is false as inquired by Jehanabad DM, there is sufficient food in the homes of the children," the government said.
Text: Bihar kids say they eat frogs due to no food in viral video, govt calls it fake A video of children in Bihar claiming that they have been forced to eat frogs as there is no food available has gone viral on social media. The children were interviewed by a media portal. "The claim is false as inquired by Jehanabad DM, there is sufficient food in the homes of the children," the government said.

Headline: 98 new coronavirus cases reported in Rajasthan today, total crosses 1,500
Description: Rajasthan on Monday reported 98 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases to 1,576, and two more deaths, taking the death toll in the state to 25. Jaipur is the worst-hit district in the state with 585 total cases and 13 deaths. Notably, 205 patients have recovered in the state and 97 have been discharged from the hospitals.
Text: 98 new coronavirus cases reported in Rajasthan today, total crosses 1,500 Rajasthan on Monday reported 98 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases to 1,576, and two more deaths, taking the death toll in the state to 25. Jaipur is the worst-hit district in the state with 585 total cases and 13 deaths. Notably, 205 patients have recovered in the state and 97 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar reach 100; 43 patients recover
Description: Three new coronavirus cases were recorded in Gautam Buddha Nagar district, Uttar Pradesh on Monday taking the total number of cases there to 100. Forty-three patients have recovered so far, leaving the district with 57 active cases. The new coronavirus patients are all female with one being a Greater Noida resident and the other two residing in Noida.
Text: Coronavirus cases in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar reach 100; 43 patients recover Three new coronavirus cases were recorded in Gautam Buddha Nagar district, Uttar Pradesh on Monday taking the total number of cases there to 100. Forty-three patients have recovered so far, leaving the district with 57 active cases. The new coronavirus patients are all female with one being a Greater Noida resident and the other two residing in Noida.

Headline: At least 53 journalists in Mumbai test positive for coronavirus
Description: At least 53 journalists from Mumbai have tested positive for coronavirus, a city civic official said on Monday. This comes after the BMC took the swab samples of 171 Mumbai-based journalists for COVID-19 tests at a health check-up camp. These journalists will be kept in isolation and quarantine wards of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).
Text: At least 53 journalists in Mumbai test positive for coronavirus At least 53 journalists from Mumbai have tested positive for coronavirus, a city civic official said on Monday. This comes after the BMC took the swab samples of 171 Mumbai-based journalists for COVID-19 tests at a health check-up camp. These journalists will be kept in isolation and quarantine wards of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).
