Headline: 18 more test COVID-19 positive in MP's Indore, total cases in district now 915
Description: As many as 18 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, district's Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia said on Tuesday. With the new cases, the total number of COVID-19 cases in Indore has reached 915, Jadia added. As per the government data, more than 1,450 cases have been recorded in Madhya Pradesh till date.
Text: 18 more test COVID-19 positive in MP's Indore, total cases in district now 915 As many as 18 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, district's Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia said on Tuesday. With the new cases, the total number of COVID-19 cases in Indore has reached 915, Jadia added. As per the government data, more than 1,450 cases have been recorded in Madhya Pradesh till date.

Headline: Himachal govt's monthly revenue down by 90%: CM Thakur
Description: Himachal Pradesh's CM Jairam Thakur has said that his government's monthly revenue has fallen by 90% in wake of the economic crisis brought on by coronavirus. The total government revenue, tax plus non-tax, for the first 20 days of this month was expected to be ₹400 to ₹450 crore but only turned out to be only ₹40 to ₹50 crore.
Text: Himachal govt's monthly revenue down by 90%: CM Thakur Himachal Pradesh's CM Jairam Thakur has said that his government's monthly revenue has fallen by 90% in wake of the economic crisis brought on by coronavirus. The total government revenue, tax plus non-tax, for the first 20 days of this month was expected to be ₹400 to ₹450 crore but only turned out to be only ₹40 to ₹50 crore.

Headline: Bihar reports 17 new coronavirus cases from Nalanda, state total rises to 113
Description: Bihar on Monday reported 17 new coronavirus cases from Biharsharif in Nalanda district, taking the total number of cases in the state to 113. According to Principal Secretary, Health Department, Sanjay Kumar, these people had come in contact with a COVID-19 positive patient. Notably, Siwan with 29 coronavirus cases is the worst affected district in the state.
Text: Bihar reports 17 new coronavirus cases from Nalanda, state total rises to 113 Bihar on Monday reported 17 new coronavirus cases from Biharsharif in Nalanda district, taking the total number of cases in the state to 113. According to Principal Secretary, Health Department, Sanjay Kumar, these people had come in contact with a COVID-19 positive patient. Notably, Siwan with 29 coronavirus cases is the worst affected district in the state.

Headline: Govt to convert surplus rice into ethanol for hand sanitisers
Description: The government on Monday allowed the use of surplus rice available with Food Corporation of India (FCI) to be converted into ethanol in order to manufacture alcohol-based hand sanitisers and also for blending with petrol. The decision was taken at a meeting of the National Biofuel Coordination Committee (NBCC). The FCI has 30.97 million tonnes of rice in its godowns.
Text: Govt to convert surplus rice into ethanol for hand sanitisers The government on Monday allowed the use of surplus rice available with Food Corporation of India (FCI) to be converted into ethanol in order to manufacture alcohol-based hand sanitisers and also for blending with petrol. The decision was taken at a meeting of the National Biofuel Coordination Committee (NBCC). The FCI has 30.97 million tonnes of rice in its godowns.

Headline: DBT approves funding for three companies for developing COVID-19 vaccine
Description: The Department of Biotechnology has so far short-listed three companies for funding the development of a vaccine for COVID-19. The three companies are Cadila Healthcare Ltd, Bharat Biotech International Ltd and Serum Institute of India Private Limited. The DBT has been designated the central coordination agency for the development of a vaccine for COVID-19.
Text: DBT approves funding for three companies for developing COVID-19 vaccine The Department of Biotechnology has so far short-listed three companies for funding the development of a vaccine for COVID-19. The three companies are Cadila Healthcare Ltd, Bharat Biotech International Ltd and Serum Institute of India Private Limited. The DBT has been designated the central coordination agency for the development of a vaccine for COVID-19.

Headline: 2 policemen donate blood to help woman deliver baby in Noida
Description: Two policemen in Noida, UP donated blood after getting an emergency call from husband of a pregnant woman who needed the blood while delivering her baby. On Sunday evening, the woman's husband called police saying two units of blood were required. The policemen, Anjul Tyagi and Lala Ram then reached the hospital and donated one unit of blood each.
Text: 2 policemen donate blood to help woman deliver baby in Noida Two policemen in Noida, UP donated blood after getting an emergency call from husband of a pregnant woman who needed the blood while delivering her baby. On Sunday evening, the woman's husband called police saying two units of blood were required. The policemen, Anjul Tyagi and Lala Ram then reached the hospital and donated one unit of blood each.

Headline: Badrinath temple in Uttarakhand to open on May 15
Description: The date for opening of portals of Badrinath temple in Uttarakhand has been revised in view of the nationwide coronavirus lockdown, said state tourism and culture Minister Satpal Maharaj on Monday. The shrine will be opened at 4.30 am on May 15, said Maharaj. Two people tested positive for coronavirus in Dehradun on Monday.
Text: Badrinath temple in Uttarakhand to open on May 15 The date for opening of portals of Badrinath temple in Uttarakhand has been revised in view of the nationwide coronavirus lockdown, said state tourism and culture Minister Satpal Maharaj on Monday. The shrine will be opened at 4.30 am on May 15, said Maharaj. Two people tested positive for coronavirus in Dehradun on Monday.

Headline: After UP, 5 more states to evacuate Kota students: Raj CM Ashok Gehlot
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said Madhya Pradesh, Bengal, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh and Assam are ready to evacuate students from Kota. Gehlot added that Rajasthan earlier spoke to Union Home Ministry about the "mental tension" that students were going through, away from homes. This comes after UP government sent 300 buses to bring back about 9,000 students from Kota, amid coronavirus lockdown.
Text: After UP, 5 more states to evacuate Kota students: Raj CM Ashok Gehlot Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said Madhya Pradesh, Bengal, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh and Assam are ready to evacuate students from Kota. Gehlot added that Rajasthan earlier spoke to Union Home Ministry about the "mental tension" that students were going through, away from homes. This comes after UP government sent 300 buses to bring back about 9,000 students from Kota, amid coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: Don't charge GST on COVID-19 equipment: Rahul Gandhi to Centre
Description: Congress MP from Wayanad Rahul Gandhi on Monday asked the central government not to charge any Goods and Services Tax (GST) on 'small and big' equipment related to COVID-19 treatment. "To collect GST on sanitisers, soaps, masks, gloves etc from the people suffering from disease and poverty. It is incorrect. We will stand by the #GSTFreeCorona demand," Rahul added.
Text: Don't charge GST on COVID-19 equipment: Rahul Gandhi to Centre Congress MP from Wayanad Rahul Gandhi on Monday asked the central government not to charge any Goods and Services Tax (GST) on 'small and big' equipment related to COVID-19 treatment. "To collect GST on sanitisers, soaps, masks, gloves etc from the people suffering from disease and poverty. It is incorrect. We will stand by the #GSTFreeCorona demand," Rahul added.

Headline: Mumbai Police distributes foodgrain packets in Worli's Janata Colony
Description: Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Zone-V, Mumbai, Niyati Thaker Dave and her team distributed about 2,000 foodgrain packets in Worli's Janta Colony, which has been declared a containment zone by BMC. "Janata Colony...one of Mumbai's densely populated slum pockets and mostly daily wage earners live here," said the DCP. Mumbai's Worli area has been completely sealed amid rising COVID-19 cases.
Text: Mumbai Police distributes foodgrain packets in Worli's Janata Colony Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Zone-V, Mumbai, Niyati Thaker Dave and her team distributed about 2,000 foodgrain packets in Worli's Janta Colony, which has been declared a containment zone by BMC. "Janata Colony...one of Mumbai's densely populated slum pockets and mostly daily wage earners live here," said the DCP. Mumbai's Worli area has been completely sealed amid rising COVID-19 cases.

Headline: Indian-origin man appointed to top US science board by Trump
Description: US President Donald Trump on Monday appointed Indian-American Sudarsanam Babu as a member of the National Science Board for a six-year term, the White House said on Monday. Babu, who earned his Master of Technology from IIT-Madras and holds a PhD from Cambridge University, is the third Indian American to be part of the board.
Text: Indian-origin man appointed to top US science board by Trump US President Donald Trump on Monday appointed Indian-American Sudarsanam Babu as a member of the National Science Board for a six-year term, the White House said on Monday. Babu, who earned his Master of Technology from IIT-Madras and holds a PhD from Cambridge University, is the third Indian American to be part of the board.

Headline: Doubling rate of coronavirus cases improves to 7.5 days, total cases now 17,656
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Monday said the doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India has improved to 7.5 days. He added that before lockdown, the doubling rate was 3.4 days. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 17,656 and the death toll has surged to 559.
Text: Doubling rate of coronavirus cases improves to 7.5 days, total cases now 17,656 Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Monday said the doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India has improved to 7.5 days. He added that before lockdown, the doubling rate was 3.4 days. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 17,656 and the death toll has surged to 559.

Headline: China calls India's new FDI policy 'discriminatory'; seeks revision
Description: China has sought a revision of India's new FDI policy wherein companies or individuals from countries sharing land borders with India can invest only after receiving government approval. "We hope India would revise relevant discriminatory practices," spokesperson of Chinese Embassy in India said. The amended policy aims at "preventing opportunistic takeovers of Indian companies due to COVID-19".
Text: China calls India's new FDI policy 'discriminatory'; seeks revision China has sought a revision of India's new FDI policy wherein companies or individuals from countries sharing land borders with India can invest only after receiving government approval. "We hope India would revise relevant discriminatory practices," spokesperson of Chinese Embassy in India said. The amended policy aims at "preventing opportunistic takeovers of Indian companies due to COVID-19".

Headline: I miss the unpredictable nature of IPL now: SRK reacts to joke on KKR
Description: After consultant Ramesh Srivats joked that KKR would've been all over the place in IPL 2020 had the tournament been going on, KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Damn...I miss the unpredictable and capricious nature of IPL tournament now!!!" Srivats also said that CSK would have qualified for knockouts, while RCB would have started to lose every game "by now".
Text: I miss the unpredictable nature of IPL now: SRK reacts to joke on KKR After consultant Ramesh Srivats joked that KKR would've been all over the place in IPL 2020 had the tournament been going on, KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Damn...I miss the unpredictable and capricious nature of IPL tournament now!!!" Srivats also said that CSK would have qualified for knockouts, while RCB would have started to lose every game "by now".

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Karnataka cross 400, 112 patients discharged
Description: Karnataka has reported 18 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 408 including 16 deaths and 112 people who are discharged. Out of the 280 active cases in the state, 278 are in isolation at designated hospitals while two patients are in the ICU. Karnataka has tested 23,460 samples.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Karnataka cross 400, 112 patients discharged Karnataka has reported 18 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 408 including 16 deaths and 112 people who are discharged. Out of the 280 active cases in the state, 278 are in isolation at designated hospitals while two patients are in the ICU. Karnataka has tested 23,460 samples.

Headline: Which are the 11 districts where condition of coronavirus spread is serious?
Description: The government has said condition of coronavirus spread is serious or getting serious in 11 districts across four states. They include Rajasthan's Jaipur, MP's Indore, Maharashtra's Mumbai and Pune, and West Bengal's Kolkata, Howrah, North 24 Parganas, Medinipur East, Jalpaiguri, Darjeeling and Kalimpong. Six Inter-Ministerial Central teams will assess situation in the areas, the government added.
Text: Which are the 11 districts where condition of coronavirus spread is serious? The government has said condition of coronavirus spread is serious or getting serious in 11 districts across four states. They include Rajasthan's Jaipur, MP's Indore, Maharashtra's Mumbai and Pune, and West Bengal's Kolkata, Howrah, North 24 Parganas, Medinipur East, Jalpaiguri, Darjeeling and Kalimpong. Six Inter-Ministerial Central teams will assess situation in the areas, the government added.

Headline: Kerala following Centre's lockdown rules; restaurants, barber shops won't open: CM
Description: After Centre wrote to Kerala objecting against the state relaxing lockdown rules including opening restaurants and bus travel amid lockdown, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said, "There has been no confrontation between state govt and Centre. Kerala is following directions issued by Centre." He added, "Barber shops will not be opened and restaurants will only provide online delivery."
Text: Kerala following Centre's lockdown rules; restaurants, barber shops won't open: CM After Centre wrote to Kerala objecting against the state relaxing lockdown rules including opening restaurants and bus travel amid lockdown, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said, "There has been no confrontation between state govt and Centre. Kerala is following directions issued by Centre." He added, "Barber shops will not be opened and restaurants will only provide online delivery."

Headline: 2 journalists test positive for coronavirus in Chennai
Description: Two journalists tested positive for coronavirus in Chennai, Tamil Nadu on Sunday. Around 50 people living in the building where one of the journalists resides have been quarantined as city corporation stopped entry and exit from the building. While one reporter has been admitted to Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital, the other is being treated at Government Stanley Hospital.
Text: 2 journalists test positive for coronavirus in Chennai Two journalists tested positive for coronavirus in Chennai, Tamil Nadu on Sunday. Around 50 people living in the building where one of the journalists resides have been quarantined as city corporation stopped entry and exit from the building. While one reporter has been admitted to Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital, the other is being treated at Government Stanley Hospital.

Headline: Kanpur police announce ₹10,000 reward for information on 'hiding' Tablighis
Description: Kanpur police has announced ₹10,000 cash for those who help authorities in tracing Tablighi Jamaat members "hiding despite repeated appeals to come forward" for COVID-19 testing, IG (Kanpur range) Mohit Agarwal said. He added that if they self report to authorities, no action will be taken against them but strict action will be taken if they fail to do so.
Text: Kanpur police announce ₹10,000 reward for information on 'hiding' Tablighis Kanpur police has announced ₹10,000 cash for those who help authorities in tracing Tablighi Jamaat members "hiding despite repeated appeals to come forward" for COVID-19 testing, IG (Kanpur range) Mohit Agarwal said. He added that if they self report to authorities, no action will be taken against them but strict action will be taken if they fail to do so.

Headline: 25 coronavirus patients admitted to hospital after 6 hrs out on road, video viral
Description: Nearly 25 coronavirus patients were forced to spend around six hours out on a road after they were denied admission at the Ahmedabad Civil Hospital. One of the patients took a video, which later went viral, asking for help from the authorities. State principal secretary (health) Jayanti Ravi said the patients were admitted after officials resolved the issue.
Text: 25 coronavirus patients admitted to hospital after 6 hrs out on road, video viral Nearly 25 coronavirus patients were forced to spend around six hours out on a road after they were denied admission at the Ahmedabad Civil Hospital. One of the patients took a video, which later went viral, asking for help from the authorities. State principal secretary (health) Jayanti Ravi said the patients were admitted after officials resolved the issue.

Headline: What is the doubling rate of coronavirus cases across various states and UTs?
Description: The government on Monday revealed that the doubling rate of India's coronavirus cases, which was 3.4 days before lockdown, is now 7.5 days. Delhi has a doubling rate of 8.5, Karnataka 9.2, Telangana 9.4, Andhra Pradesh 10.6, J&K 11.5, Punjab 13.1, Chhattisgarh 13.3, Tamil Nadu 14 and Bihar 16.4. Meanwhile, Odisha has a doubling rate of 39.8 and Kerala 72.2.
Text: What is the doubling rate of coronavirus cases across various states and UTs? The government on Monday revealed that the doubling rate of India's coronavirus cases, which was 3.4 days before lockdown, is now 7.5 days. Delhi has a doubling rate of 8.5, Karnataka 9.2, Telangana 9.4, Andhra Pradesh 10.6, J&K 11.5, Punjab 13.1, Chhattisgarh 13.3, Tamil Nadu 14 and Bihar 16.4. Meanwhile, Odisha has a doubling rate of 39.8 and Kerala 72.2.

Headline: Chennai locals attack staff at burial of doctor who died of COVID-19; 20 held
Description: Chennai locals resisted the burial of a doctor who died of coronavirus on Sunday while undergoing treatment at a private hospital. Some locals attacked hospital staff with wooden logs and stones and damaged the ambulance carrying the body. The ambulance driver and a health worker sustained injuries to their heads and 20 people were arrested in connection to the incident.
Text: Chennai locals attack staff at burial of doctor who died of COVID-19; 20 held Chennai locals resisted the burial of a doctor who died of coronavirus on Sunday while undergoing treatment at a private hospital. Some locals attacked hospital staff with wooden logs and stones and damaged the ambulance carrying the body. The ambulance driver and a health worker sustained injuries to their heads and 20 people were arrested in connection to the incident.

Headline: Arrests based on forensic evidence: Police on Delhi riots, Jamia violence
Description: Delhi Police on Monday released a statement saying that the investigations in Jamia Millia Islamia violence and Delhi riots were done "sincerely, impartially". All the arrests in both cases were "based on analysis of scientific and forensic evidence", said the police statement. Police won't "be deterred by false propaganda, rumours by vested elements who try to twist facts", it added.
Text: Arrests based on forensic evidence: Police on Delhi riots, Jamia violence Delhi Police on Monday released a statement saying that the investigations in Jamia Millia Islamia violence and Delhi riots were done "sincerely, impartially". All the arrests in both cases were "based on analysis of scientific and forensic evidence", said the police statement. Police won't "be deterred by false propaganda, rumours by vested elements who try to twist facts", it added.

Headline: Coronavirus mortality rate in the world is 5.75, in Kerala it is 0.58: CM Vijayan
Description: Referring to coronavirus situation in Kerala, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said, "Situation in Kerala could have gone out of hand but with proper contact tracing, we were able to contain & overcome it." He added, "The mortality rate in the world is 5.75, it is 2.8-3 in India, & 0.58 in Kerala." Kerala has reported 408 coronavirus cases and three deaths.
Text: Coronavirus mortality rate in the world is 5.75, in Kerala it is 0.58: CM Vijayan Referring to coronavirus situation in Kerala, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said, "Situation in Kerala could have gone out of hand but with proper contact tracing, we were able to contain & overcome it." He added, "The mortality rate in the world is 5.75, it is 2.8-3 in India, & 0.58 in Kerala." Kerala has reported 408 coronavirus cases and three deaths.

Headline: Maharashtra's Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad declared containment zones till April 27
Description: Municipal corporations of Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad in Maharashtra declared areas within their limits as containment zones and sealed them till April 27 to control spread of coronavirus. Entry and exit in both corporation limits has been prohibited, except for those involved in essential services. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar had on Sunday ordered strict implementation of lockdown in both places.
Text: Maharashtra's Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad declared containment zones till April 27 Municipal corporations of Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad in Maharashtra declared areas within their limits as containment zones and sealed them till April 27 to control spread of coronavirus. Entry and exit in both corporation limits has been prohibited, except for those involved in essential services. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar had on Sunday ordered strict implementation of lockdown in both places.

Headline: Baby born to COVID-19 infected couple tests +ve for virus in Rajasthan
Description: A baby born to a COVID-19 positive couple in Nagaur, Rajasthan, has also reportedly tested positive for the virus, said the district chief medical and health officer Dr Sukumar Kashyap. Other family members of the baby are also COVID-19 patients, said Dr Kashyap. The baby was born on Saturday and her COVID-19 test report came on Sunday.
Text: Baby born to COVID-19 infected couple tests +ve for virus in Rajasthan A baby born to a COVID-19 positive couple in Nagaur, Rajasthan, has also reportedly tested positive for the virus, said the district chief medical and health officer Dr Sukumar Kashyap. Other family members of the baby are also COVID-19 patients, said Dr Kashyap. The baby was born on Saturday and her COVID-19 test report came on Sunday.

Headline: Restrictions won't be relaxed in K'taka, lockdown to continue till May 3
Description: Karnataka government on Monday announced that the strict lockdown measures in effect in the state will continue till May 3. "There will be meetings held by the central government after which the task force in the state will discuss lifting certain restrictions over the next week. As of now, the lockdown measures will continue," state minister JC Madhuswamy said.
Text: Restrictions won't be relaxed in K'taka, lockdown to continue till May 3 Karnataka government on Monday announced that the strict lockdown measures in effect in the state will continue till May 3. "There will be meetings held by the central government after which the task force in the state will discuss lifting certain restrictions over the next week. As of now, the lockdown measures will continue," state minister JC Madhuswamy said.

Headline: Some people pushing secular-communal narrative: Javadekar on COVID-19 fight
Description: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Monday said that a "secular-communal narrative" is being deliberately pushed by some people in fight against coronavirus. Javadekar was quoted by PTI as saying, "India is one country, one people. Government doesn't discriminate." He accused central government's critics of peddling "utter falsehoods", adding that government is against "fake news of all kinds".
Text: Some people pushing secular-communal narrative: Javadekar on COVID-19 fight Union Minister Prakash Javadekar on Monday said that a "secular-communal narrative" is being deliberately pushed by some people in fight against coronavirus. Javadekar was quoted by PTI as saying, "India is one country, one people. Government doesn't discriminate." He accused central government's critics of peddling "utter falsehoods", adding that government is against "fake news of all kinds".

Headline: 80 out of 100 coronavirus patients have no or mild symptoms: ICMR
Description: Eighty out of 100 COVID-19 patients have no or mild symptoms of the disease, the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said on Monday. Further, 15% of those infected get converted into severe cases and 5% into critical cases, the Health Ministry said. No new cases have been reported from 59 districts in the last 14 days, the ministry added.
Text: 80 out of 100 coronavirus patients have no or mild symptoms: ICMR Eighty out of 100 COVID-19 patients have no or mild symptoms of the disease, the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said on Monday. Further, 15% of those infected get converted into severe cases and 5% into critical cases, the Health Ministry said. No new cases have been reported from 59 districts in the last 14 days, the ministry added.

Headline: Relaxations should not be treated as lifting of lockdown: Maharashtra CM
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said relaxation in the lockdown norms doesn't mean that the lockdown has been lifted in the state. "We have just tried to revolve the wheel of the economy," he added. "Some people are treating relaxations as the lifting of lockdown. If they continue to behave like this we'll take strict measures," Thackeray further said.
Text: Relaxations should not be treated as lifting of lockdown: Maharashtra CM Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said relaxation in the lockdown norms doesn't mean that the lockdown has been lifted in the state. "We have just tried to revolve the wheel of the economy," he added. "Some people are treating relaxations as the lifting of lockdown. If they continue to behave like this we'll take strict measures," Thackeray further said.

Headline: Home Minister calls Maharashtra CM to enquire about Palghar lynching
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah called up Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday to enquire about the lynching of three people in Maharashtra's Palghar last week. According to the police, the mob mistook the three to be thieves and lynched them. Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath also spoke to Thackeray and sought action against the accused.
Text: Home Minister calls Maharashtra CM to enquire about Palghar lynching Home Minister Amit Shah called up Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday to enquire about the lynching of three people in Maharashtra's Palghar last week. According to the police, the mob mistook the three to be thieves and lynched them. Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath also spoke to Thackeray and sought action against the accused.

Headline: Report claims Arunachalis killed cobra to eat, Rijiju asks media to verify stories
Description: Reacting to a report saying that tribals in Arunachal Pradesh, killed King Cobra for meal after no rice left amid lockdown, MP from Arunachal Kiren Rijiju asked the news outlet to "not make stories without verification." He tweeted, "To say...there's no rice left for people leading to killing of cobra is rubbish! No one hunts snakes for consumption in Arunachal."
Text: Report claims Arunachalis killed cobra to eat, Rijiju asks media to verify stories Reacting to a report saying that tribals in Arunachal Pradesh, killed King Cobra for meal after no rice left amid lockdown, MP from Arunachal Kiren Rijiju asked the news outlet to "not make stories without verification." He tweeted, "To say...there's no rice left for people leading to killing of cobra is rubbish! No one hunts snakes for consumption in Arunachal."

Headline: Kashmiri photojournalist Masrat Zahra booked for 'anti-national posts' on FB
Description: Srinagar-based Kashmiri photojournalist Masrat Zahra has been booked by J&K Police under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for allegedly uploading "anti-national posts" on Facebook. A police statement said that Zahra is "believed to be uploading photographs which can provoke the public to disturb law and order...and posts that tantamount to [glorifying] anti-national activities".
Text: Kashmiri photojournalist Masrat Zahra booked for 'anti-national posts' on FB Srinagar-based Kashmiri photojournalist Masrat Zahra has been booked by J&K Police under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for allegedly uploading "anti-national posts" on Facebook. A police statement said that Zahra is "believed to be uploading photographs which can provoke the public to disturb law and order...and posts that tantamount to [glorifying] anti-national activities".

Headline: Thackeray asks Shah for action against communal twist to Palghar lynchings
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to take action against those giving communal colour to the lynching of two sadhus and a driver by a mob in Palghar district. Thackeray said he received a call on Monday from Amit Shah who himself said there is no communal angle to the Palghar mob lynching incident.
Text: Thackeray asks Shah for action against communal twist to Palghar lynchings Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to take action against those giving communal colour to the lynching of two sadhus and a driver by a mob in Palghar district. Thackeray said he received a call on Monday from Amit Shah who himself said there is no communal angle to the Palghar mob lynching incident.

Headline: Don't give communal angle to Palghar mob lynching: Maha Home Minister
Description: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has said that he has ordered a high-level inquiry into Palghar mob lynching incident in which two sadhus and a driver were killed. Deshmukh said that the attackers and the killed men did not belong to different religions, and the police is ordered to take strict action against those creating communal dispute on social media.
Text: Don't give communal angle to Palghar mob lynching: Maha Home Minister Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has said that he has ordered a high-level inquiry into Palghar mob lynching incident in which two sadhus and a driver were killed. Deshmukh said that the attackers and the killed men did not belong to different religions, and the police is ordered to take strict action against those creating communal dispute on social media.

Headline: Strongly condemn it: Farhan on mob lynching of Hindu monks
Description: Farhan Akhtar has condemned the mob lynching of two Hindu monks and a driver by a local tribal community in Maharashtra's Palghar district. "Strongly condemn the violence that took...lives of 3 people in Palghar," Farhan wrote about the April 17 incident. "Mob rule should have no place in our society and I hope the murderers have been arrested," he added.
Text: Strongly condemn it: Farhan on mob lynching of Hindu monks Farhan Akhtar has condemned the mob lynching of two Hindu monks and a driver by a local tribal community in Maharashtra's Palghar district. "Strongly condemn the violence that took...lives of 3 people in Palghar," Farhan wrote about the April 17 incident. "Mob rule should have no place in our society and I hope the murderers have been arrested," he added.

Headline: Indian businessman jailed in Hong Kong for breaking quarantine rules
Description: An Indian businessman, Deepak Kumar, has been jailed for four weeks after he pleaded guilty to leaving a quarantine site without permission from the officials, a local report said. He had attempted to leave Hong Kong while being ordered to quarantine at a hotel, it added. Kumar is reportedly the first non-resident to be jailed for such an offence.
Text: Indian businessman jailed in Hong Kong for breaking quarantine rules An Indian businessman, Deepak Kumar, has been jailed for four weeks after he pleaded guilty to leaving a quarantine site without permission from the officials, a local report said. He had attempted to leave Hong Kong while being ordered to quarantine at a hotel, it added. Kumar is reportedly the first non-resident to be jailed for such an offence.

Headline: Azadpur Mandi to remain open for 24 hours from tomorrow: Delhi govt
Description: Delhi Minister Gopal Rai on Monday said that Azadpur Mandi will remain open for 24 hours from tomorrow. "From 6 am till 10 pm, vegetables and fruits will be sold, while from 10 pm till 6 am, truck movement will be allowed," he added. "Every four hours, entry of 1,000 people will be allowed in the market," Rai further said.
Text: Azadpur Mandi to remain open for 24 hours from tomorrow: Delhi govt Delhi Minister Gopal Rai on Monday said that Azadpur Mandi will remain open for 24 hours from tomorrow. "From 6 am till 10 pm, vegetables and fruits will be sold, while from 10 pm till 6 am, truck movement will be allowed," he added. "Every four hours, entry of 1,000 people will be allowed in the market," Rai further said.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 2,000-mark, death toll at 45
Description: As many as 110 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,003. Out of all the 2,003 cases, 1,668 are active, while 290 people have recovered. The death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi stands at 45. A total of 24,387 people have been tested in Delhi.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 2,000-mark, death toll at 45 As many as 110 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 2,003. Out of all the 2,003 cases, 1,668 are active, while 290 people have recovered. The death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi stands at 45. A total of 24,387 people have been tested in Delhi.

Headline: US has tested more people for coronavirus than India, 9 nations combined: Trump
Description: The US, which has nearly 7.6 lakh cases, has carried out more tests for coronavirus than 10 other countries combined, President Donald Trump has said. Trump named France, United Kingdom, South Korea, Japan, Singapore, India, Austria, Australia, Sweden and Canada. Stating that the country has tested over 40 lakh people, Trump further said, "That's a record anywhere in the world."
Text: US has tested more people for coronavirus than India, 9 nations combined: Trump The US, which has nearly 7.6 lakh cases, has carried out more tests for coronavirus than 10 other countries combined, President Donald Trump has said. Trump named France, United Kingdom, South Korea, Japan, Singapore, India, Austria, Australia, Sweden and Canada. Stating that the country has tested over 40 lakh people, Trump further said, "That's a record anywhere in the world."

Headline: Won't take part in father's last rites to follow lockdown, wanted to meet him: UP CM
Description: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has said he'll not take part in last rites of his father Anand Singh Bisht tomorrow to ensure enforcement of lockdown and to defeat coronavirus in the state. "I wanted to meet him...but due to lockdown I couldn't," he added. He also urged others to not gather in large numbers for his father's last rites.
Text: Won't take part in father's last rites to follow lockdown, wanted to meet him: UP CM Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has said he'll not take part in last rites of his father Anand Singh Bisht tomorrow to ensure enforcement of lockdown and to defeat coronavirus in the state. "I wanted to meet him...but due to lockdown I couldn't," he added. He also urged others to not gather in large numbers for his father's last rites.

Headline: Swiggy, Zomato banned in Telangana as state extends lockdown till May 7
Description: Food delivery apps including Swiggy and Zomato have been disallowed to provide their services in Telangana from tomorrow as Chief Minister K Chandrashekhar Rao announced to extend lockdown in the state till May 7. He urged people to cook meals at home. However, companies delivering groceries such as BigBasket and Grofers will be allowed to ply in the state.
Text: Swiggy, Zomato banned in Telangana as state extends lockdown till May 7 Food delivery apps including Swiggy and Zomato have been disallowed to provide their services in Telangana from tomorrow as Chief Minister K Chandrashekhar Rao announced to extend lockdown in the state till May 7. He urged people to cook meals at home. However, companies delivering groceries such as BigBasket and Grofers will be allowed to ply in the state.

Headline: UP CM Yogi Adityanath's father Anand Singh Bisht passes away
Description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's father Anand Singh Bisht passed away at AIIMS, Delhi on Monday. Following his death, Union Cabinet Minister for Textiles and Women & Child Development Smriti Irani tweeted, "May his soul rest in peace." Former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Kamal Nath tweeted, "My condolences to the family."
Text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath's father Anand Singh Bisht passes away Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's father Anand Singh Bisht passed away at AIIMS, Delhi on Monday. Following his death, Union Cabinet Minister for Textiles and Women & Child Development Smriti Irani tweeted, "May his soul rest in peace." Former Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Kamal Nath tweeted, "My condolences to the family."

Headline: Railways transports 1,150 tonnes of medical items amid lockdown
Description: The Indian Railways has transported about 1,150 tonnes of medical items across the country through its time-tabled Parcel Special Trains amid the coronavirus-induced lockdown. These trains allow the transportation of essential items such as medical equipment, medical supplies, food, oil and dairy products. As of April 14, it had earned nearly ₹7.54 crore from operating the service.
Text: Railways transports 1,150 tonnes of medical items amid lockdown The Indian Railways has transported about 1,150 tonnes of medical items across the country through its time-tabled Parcel Special Trains amid the coronavirus-induced lockdown. These trains allow the transportation of essential items such as medical equipment, medical supplies, food, oil and dairy products. As of April 14, it had earned nearly ₹7.54 crore from operating the service.

Headline: Govt constitutes 6 teams to make on-spot assessment of COVID-19 situation
Description: Union Government has constituted six Inter-Ministerial Central Teams to assess the situation regarding lockdown violations, social distancing norms and attack on doctors in various states, and submit a report to the Centre. The teams will also make on-spot assessment of the COVID-19 situation in the states and issue necessary directions to state authorities for its redressal, the government said.
Text: Govt constitutes 6 teams to make on-spot assessment of COVID-19 situation Union Government has constituted six Inter-Ministerial Central Teams to assess the situation regarding lockdown violations, social distancing norms and attack on doctors in various states, and submit a report to the Centre. The teams will also make on-spot assessment of the COVID-19 situation in the states and issue necessary directions to state authorities for its redressal, the government said.

Headline: Man threatens to commit suicide at Delhi hospital, spits at rescuers
Description: A video shows a man threatening to commit suicide by jumping off the third floor of Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital on Sunday. The man, who claimed to be a coronavirus patient, also spat at firemen trying to rescue him. BN Singh, Medical Superintendent at Safdarjung Hospital, said he is a patient with orthopaedic problems and psychiatric illness.
Text: Man threatens to commit suicide at Delhi hospital, spits at rescuers A video shows a man threatening to commit suicide by jumping off the third floor of Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital on Sunday. The man, who claimed to be a coronavirus patient, also spat at firemen trying to rescue him. BN Singh, Medical Superintendent at Safdarjung Hospital, said he is a patient with orthopaedic problems and psychiatric illness.

Headline: 24 people including govt officials test COVID-19 positive in Andhra Pradesh
Description: As many as 24 people tested positive for COVID-19 in Andhra Pradesh's Srikalahasti on Sunday, Srikalahasti Municipal Commissioner B Sreekanth said. Out of 24 new COVID-19 positive cases, eight are employees of police, municipality and revenue departments. "We conducted random sampling across the district, but no front line worker is infected in other areas," a senior official said.
Text: 24 people including govt officials test COVID-19 positive in Andhra Pradesh As many as 24 people tested positive for COVID-19 in Andhra Pradesh's Srikalahasti on Sunday, Srikalahasti Municipal Commissioner B Sreekanth said. Out of 24 new COVID-19 positive cases, eight are employees of police, municipality and revenue departments. "We conducted random sampling across the district, but no front line worker is infected in other areas," a senior official said.

Headline: Manipur is now coronavirus free, both patients have fully recovered: CM
Description: Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh on Sunday night tweeted that the state is now coronavirus free as the two patients have "fully recovered and have tested negative". "There are no fresh cases of COVID-19 in the state," he said. "This has been possible because of the cooperation of public and medical staff and strict enforcement of lockdown," Singh added.
Text: Manipur is now coronavirus free, both patients have fully recovered: CM Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh on Sunday night tweeted that the state is now coronavirus free as the two patients have "fully recovered and have tested negative". "There are no fresh cases of COVID-19 in the state," he said. "This has been possible because of the cooperation of public and medical staff and strict enforcement of lockdown," Singh added.

Headline: Maharashtra records most coronavirus cases in a day by a state/UT as 552 test +ve
Description: Maharashtra today reported as many as 552 coronavirus cases, which is the highest number of cases reported by a state or a Union Territory in a single day. The total number of cases in the state has risen to 4,200 out of which 507 patients have been treated and discharged. A total of 223 COVID-19 patients have died in Maharashtra.
Text: Maharashtra records most coronavirus cases in a day by a state/UT as 552 test +ve Maharashtra today reported as many as 552 coronavirus cases, which is the highest number of cases reported by a state or a Union Territory in a single day. The total number of cases in the state has risen to 4,200 out of which 507 patients have been treated and discharged. A total of 223 COVID-19 patients have died in Maharashtra.

Headline: 7 new coronavirus cases recorded in Bihar; state total rises to 93
Description: Seven new coronavirus cases were recorded in Bihar on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 93, said state Principal Secretary (Health) Sanjay Kumar. Out of the new cases, six are male and one female, said Kumar on Twitter. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday held a COVID-19 review meeting with officials of various departments.
Text: 7 new coronavirus cases recorded in Bihar; state total rises to 93 Seven new coronavirus cases were recorded in Bihar on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 93, said state Principal Secretary (Health) Sanjay Kumar. Out of the new cases, six are male and one female, said Kumar on Twitter. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday held a COVID-19 review meeting with officials of various departments.

Headline: Kerala reopens restaurants, allows travel amid extended lockdown; Centre objects
Description: Centre has written a letter to Kerala government, urging it to revise its guidelines after it allowed opening of activities, prohibited under Consolidated Revised Guidelines during extended lockdown. "These activities include opening restaurants, bus travel...for shorter distance, pillion riding on scooters," Centre added. "This amounts to dilution of guidelines issued by MHA," it stated.
Text: Kerala reopens restaurants, allows travel amid extended lockdown; Centre objects Centre has written a letter to Kerala government, urging it to revise its guidelines after it allowed opening of activities, prohibited under Consolidated Revised Guidelines during extended lockdown. "These activities include opening restaurants, bus travel...for shorter distance, pillion riding on scooters," Centre added. "This amounts to dilution of guidelines issued by MHA," it stated.

Headline: UP hospital apologises for ad saying no entry to Muslims without COVID-19 test
Description: The Valentis Cancer Hospital in UP's Meerut has apologised for publishing an advertisement saying it would admit Muslim patients and their caretakers only after they test COVID-19 negative. "It was an appeal to all to follow government guidelines so that everyone stays safe," a senior doctor at Valentis said. "We apologise as some words hurt people's sentiments," the doctor added.
Text: UP hospital apologises for ad saying no entry to Muslims without COVID-19 test The Valentis Cancer Hospital in UP's Meerut has apologised for publishing an advertisement saying it would admit Muslim patients and their caretakers only after they test COVID-19 negative. "It was an appeal to all to follow government guidelines so that everyone stays safe," a senior doctor at Valentis said. "We apologise as some words hurt people's sentiments," the doctor added.

Headline: Husband hasn't visited us in last 15 days: Wife of doctor treating COVID-19 patients
Description: Shraddha Muley, the wife of Dr Sushant Muley who works at the COVID-19 ward of Govt Medical College & Hospital in Maharashtra's Nagpur, told ANI that her husband hasn't visited the family in last 15 days. "When my son insists on seeing his father, I connect them over a video call," she said. "We're proud of my husband," she added.
Text: Husband hasn't visited us in last 15 days: Wife of doctor treating COVID-19 patients Shraddha Muley, the wife of Dr Sushant Muley who works at the COVID-19 ward of Govt Medical College & Hospital in Maharashtra's Nagpur, told ANI that her husband hasn't visited the family in last 15 days. "When my son insists on seeing his father, I connect them over a video call," she said. "We're proud of my husband," she added.

Headline: 2 BJP MLAs booked in Rajasthan for hate speeches amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: The Rajasthan Police has booked two BJP MLAs, Madan Dilawar and Ashok Lahoti, on charges of making provocative remarks against a community, outraging religious feelings and spreading rumours. The two MLAs had reportedly shared videos of their hate speeches against a particular community. "To intimidate and pressurise us, cases are being registered," Ashok Lahoti said.
Text: 2 BJP MLAs booked in Rajasthan for hate speeches amid COVID-19 crisis The Rajasthan Police has booked two BJP MLAs, Madan Dilawar and Ashok Lahoti, on charges of making provocative remarks against a community, outraging religious feelings and spreading rumours. The two MLAs had reportedly shared videos of their hate speeches against a particular community. "To intimidate and pressurise us, cases are being registered," Ashok Lahoti said.

Headline: Limited economic activities to begin in MP; no relaxation in Indore, Bhopal
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said that limited economic and industrial activities will begin in parts of the state from Monday. "All that will function under strict pursuance of the safety and social distancing guidelines of the central government," Chouhan added. However, strict lockdown will be enforced in Indore, Bhopal, Ujjain and some other red zone districts.
Text: Limited economic activities to begin in MP; no relaxation in Indore, Bhopal Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said that limited economic and industrial activities will begin in parts of the state from Monday. "All that will function under strict pursuance of the safety and social distancing guidelines of the central government," Chouhan added. However, strict lockdown will be enforced in Indore, Bhopal, Ujjain and some other red zone districts.

Headline: Over 100 locals attack health workers, police in Bengaluru; video of mob surfaces
Description: A quarantine team of health workers and policemen was allegedly attacked last evening in Padarayanapura, Bengaluru by over 100 locals. A video of the mob creating a ruckus has surfaced online. The officials went there to quarantine 58 people, believed to have come in contact with three coronavirus patients. Multiple FIRs were filed and over 50 people have been arrested.
Text: Over 100 locals attack health workers, police in Bengaluru; video of mob surfaces A quarantine team of health workers and policemen was allegedly attacked last evening in Padarayanapura, Bengaluru by over 100 locals. A video of the mob creating a ruckus has surfaced online. The officials went there to quarantine 58 people, believed to have come in contact with three coronavirus patients. Multiple FIRs were filed and over 50 people have been arrested.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 17,000; death toll reaches 543
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Monday that the total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 17,265. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus in India has reached 543. Out of the total cases, 14,175 cases are active, while 2,547 cases have been cured, discharged or migrated.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India cross 17,000; death toll reaches 543 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Monday that the total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 17,265. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus in India has reached 543. Out of the total cases, 14,175 cases are active, while 2,547 cases have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: COVID-19 situation serious in Mumbai, Kolkata, Jaipur, Indore: Govt
Description: The government on Monday said COVID-19 situation is "especially serious" in Mumbai, Pune, Indore, Jaipur, Kolkata and parts of West Bengal. The government will send six teams for on-spot assessment of these places, they added. The situation in West Bengal's Howrah, Purba Medinipur, North 24 Parganas, Darjeeling, Kalimpong and Jalpaiguri is also serious, the government further said.
Text: COVID-19 situation serious in Mumbai, Kolkata, Jaipur, Indore: Govt The government on Monday said COVID-19 situation is "especially serious" in Mumbai, Pune, Indore, Jaipur, Kolkata and parts of West Bengal. The government will send six teams for on-spot assessment of these places, they added. The situation in West Bengal's Howrah, Purba Medinipur, North 24 Parganas, Darjeeling, Kalimpong and Jalpaiguri is also serious, the government further said.

Headline: Judge orders to give ration to minor boy who stole for sick mother in Bihar
Description: A minor boy from a poor family, who was arrested for stealing, was provided with ration, clothes and other essentials by a local court in Bihar's Nalanda on Sunday. The judge said that the boy has been given a chance to improve. The boy said, "My mother was sick and we had no food. I wanted to feed her something."
Text: Judge orders to give ration to minor boy who stole for sick mother in Bihar A minor boy from a poor family, who was arrested for stealing, was provided with ration, clothes and other essentials by a local court in Bihar's Nalanda on Sunday. The judge said that the boy has been given a chance to improve. The boy said, "My mother was sick and we had no food. I wanted to feed her something."

Headline: Artistes ask Delhi Police to release arrested CAA protestors
Description: Various film personalities have released a statement alleging that Delhi Police has been on a "witch-hunt" against students and activists who protested against CAA amid the lockdown. In their statement, the 29 signatories claimed that the protestors are being implicated in cases related to communal violence in Delhi. They further demanded the release of the arrested students and activists.
Text: Artistes ask Delhi Police to release arrested CAA protestors Various film personalities have released a statement alleging that Delhi Police has been on a "witch-hunt" against students and activists who protested against CAA amid the lockdown. In their statement, the 29 signatories claimed that the protestors are being implicated in cases related to communal violence in Delhi. They further demanded the release of the arrested students and activists.

Headline: Scammers create fake website, Facebook page offering liquor delivery in Kerala
Description: Scammers have created a fake website of Kerala State Beverages Corporation (KSBC) to lure consumers to buy alcohol amid lockdown. The website included the original logo and listed a variety of brands of liquor. A fake Facebook page called 'Consumerfed' has also been created, offering home delivery of liquor. The police have launched an investigation after complaints were registered.
Text: Scammers create fake website, Facebook page offering liquor delivery in Kerala Scammers have created a fake website of Kerala State Beverages Corporation (KSBC) to lure consumers to buy alcohol amid lockdown. The website included the original logo and listed a variety of brands of liquor. A fake Facebook page called 'Consumerfed' has also been created, offering home delivery of liquor. The police have launched an investigation after complaints were registered.

Headline: Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha secretariats to resume work from Monday
Description: The Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha secretariats will resume work from the Parliament complex from Monday, April 20, amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. According to official orders, all officers of the rank of joint secretary and above of both secretariats will join office from Monday. All officials are to follow social distancing norms and other precautionary measures, said the orders.
Text: Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha secretariats to resume work from Monday The Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha secretariats will resume work from the Parliament complex from Monday, April 20, amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. According to official orders, all officers of the rank of joint secretary and above of both secretariats will join office from Monday. All officials are to follow social distancing norms and other precautionary measures, said the orders.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in 54 districts in 14 days; total cases in India cross 16,000
Description: The government on Sunday revealed that as many as 54 districts in 23 states have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days. Further, the total number of cases in India has risen to 16,116, while the death toll has surged to 519. Meanwhile, as many as 2,302 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.
Text: No new coronavirus case in 54 districts in 14 days; total cases in India cross 16,000 The government on Sunday revealed that as many as 54 districts in 23 states have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days. Further, the total number of cases in India has risen to 16,116, while the death toll has surged to 519. Meanwhile, as many as 2,302 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Telangana rise to 858, Siddipet among 4 districts free of virus
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday announced that the total number of coronavirus cases in the state has risen to 858, while the death toll has surged to 21. He further said that 186 COVID-19 patients have recovered from the virus in the state. Further, four districts including Siddipet, Warangal Rural, Yadadri Bhuvanagiri and Wanaparthy are now COVID-19 free.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Telangana rise to 858, Siddipet among 4 districts free of virus Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday announced that the total number of coronavirus cases in the state has risen to 858, while the death toll has surged to 21. He further said that 186 COVID-19 patients have recovered from the virus in the state. Further, four districts including Siddipet, Warangal Rural, Yadadri Bhuvanagiri and Wanaparthy are now COVID-19 free.

Headline: Pregnant woman allegedly told to clean up blood at hospital; loses baby
Description: A 30-year-old pregnant woman was allegedly asked to clean up her blood, accused of spreading coronavirus and beaten up with slippers after she was taken to a hospital in Jharkhand. Rizwana Khatun said she was then taken to a nursing home, where she came to know her child had died. She wrote a letter to CM Hemant Soren.
Text: Pregnant woman allegedly told to clean up blood at hospital; loses baby A 30-year-old pregnant woman was allegedly asked to clean up her blood, accused of spreading coronavirus and beaten up with slippers after she was taken to a hospital in Jharkhand. Rizwana Khatun said she was then taken to a nursing home, where she came to know her child had died. She wrote a letter to CM Hemant Soren.

Headline: Biryani, samosa, pizza demanded by Delhi containment zones' residents
Description: Delhi district officials deployed in coronavirus containment zones and quarantine centres have said that a number of residents flooded them with demands like chicken biryani, mutton, pizza, sweets and samosas. "We don't fulfil frivolous demands. Field officials have been told to ignore unusual demands," a senior official said. The Delhi government has identified 76 containment zones.
Text: Biryani, samosa, pizza demanded by Delhi containment zones' residents Delhi district officials deployed in coronavirus containment zones and quarantine centres have said that a number of residents flooded them with demands like chicken biryani, mutton, pizza, sweets and samosas. "We don't fulfil frivolous demands. Field officials have been told to ignore unusual demands," a senior official said. The Delhi government has identified 76 containment zones.

Headline: ₹50L compensation to family of MP policeman who died of COVID-19: CM
Description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday paid tribute to a policeman who died of coronavirus in Indore and also announced ₹50 lakh compensation for his family. The deceased Devendra Kumar was undergoing treatment and had tested COVID-19 negative, said Chouhan. "But late last night, suddenly, sad news of his death was received at 2:00 am," he added.
Text: ₹50L compensation to family of MP policeman who died of COVID-19: CM Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday paid tribute to a policeman who died of coronavirus in Indore and also announced ₹50 lakh compensation for his family. The deceased Devendra Kumar was undergoing treatment and had tested COVID-19 negative, said Chouhan. "But late last night, suddenly, sad news of his death was received at 2:00 am," he added.

Headline: Home is the new office, Internet is the new meeting room: PM on lockdown
Description: In a LinkedIn post titled 'Life in the era of COVID-19', Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday wrote, "These days, home is the new office. The Internet is the new meeting room." He added, "I have also been adapting to these changes. Most meetings, be it with minister colleagues, officials and world leaders, are now via video conferencing."
Text: Home is the new office, Internet is the new meeting room: PM on lockdown In a LinkedIn post titled 'Life in the era of COVID-19', Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday wrote, "These days, home is the new office. The Internet is the new meeting room." He added, "I have also been adapting to these changes. Most meetings, be it with minister colleagues, officials and world leaders, are now via video conferencing."

Headline: Youth on sanitisation duty beaten, made to ingest sanitiser in UP; dies
Description: A youth on sanitisation duty amid coronavirus spread was allegedly beaten up and sanitiser spray was forced into his mouth in Motipura village in Rampur, UP. The incident took place on April 14 and the victim died three days later at a hospital, said Rampur Additional SP Arun Singh. FIR has been filed against five people from Motipura, said Singh.
Text: Youth on sanitisation duty beaten, made to ingest sanitiser in UP; dies A youth on sanitisation duty amid coronavirus spread was allegedly beaten up and sanitiser spray was forced into his mouth in Motipura village in Rampur, UP. The incident took place on April 14 and the victim died three days later at a hospital, said Rampur Additional SP Arun Singh. FIR has been filed against five people from Motipura, said Singh.

Headline: UP hospital ad calls Hindus 'miser', demands -ve COVID-19 report from Muslims
Description: The Valentis Cancer Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut issued an apology after an advertisement said Muslim patients would only be admitted if they tested negative for coronavirus. The advertisement also termed Hindu and Jain families 'miser' and asked them to donate to PM-CARES Fund. The hospital issued an apology after police intervention and criticism it received on social media.
Text: UP hospital ad calls Hindus 'miser', demands -ve COVID-19 report from Muslims The Valentis Cancer Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut issued an apology after an advertisement said Muslim patients would only be admitted if they tested negative for coronavirus. The advertisement also termed Hindu and Jain families 'miser' and asked them to donate to PM-CARES Fund. The hospital issued an apology after police intervention and criticism it received on social media.

Headline: Telangana first state to extend lockdown till May 7, no relaxation from April 20
Description: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao has announced that the lockdown in the state has been extended till May 7. He added that the relaxations proposed by Central government from April 20 would not be imposed in Telangana. He further urged people not to order food online, adding Swiggy and Zomato services will be banned from Monday.
Text: Telangana first state to extend lockdown till May 7, no relaxation from April 20 Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao has announced that the lockdown in the state has been extended till May 7. He added that the relaxations proposed by Central government from April 20 would not be imposed in Telangana. He further urged people not to order food online, adding Swiggy and Zomato services will be banned from Monday.

Headline: Tamil Nadu records 105 new COVID-19 cases; state total rises to 1,477
Description: Tamil Nadu reported 105 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,477, said the state's health and family welfare department. Tamil Nadu has 1,048 active coronavirus cases while coronavirus death toll in the state remained at 15. A total of 46 coronavirus patients were treated and discharged on Sunday.
Text: Tamil Nadu records 105 new COVID-19 cases; state total rises to 1,477 Tamil Nadu reported 105 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,477, said the state's health and family welfare department. Tamil Nadu has 1,048 active coronavirus cases while coronavirus death toll in the state remained at 15. A total of 46 coronavirus patients were treated and discharged on Sunday.

Headline: Fight against COVID-19 biggest invisible war in our lifetime: Rajnath Singh
Description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday called the fight against coronavirus "possibly the biggest invisible war in our lifetime". "(It's) a war against humanity and [has] various impacts on health and economic security of the nation. We're fighting the crisis on a war footing," said Singh in a PTI interview. India has recorded over 16,000 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: Fight against COVID-19 biggest invisible war in our lifetime: Rajnath Singh Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Sunday called the fight against coronavirus "possibly the biggest invisible war in our lifetime". "(It's) a war against humanity and [has] various impacts on health and economic security of the nation. We're fighting the crisis on a war footing," said Singh in a PTI interview. India has recorded over 16,000 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Karnataka near 400, 16 deaths reported so far
Description: Six new cases of coronavirus were reported in the last 24 hours in Karnataka, taking the total number of cases in the state to 390. Karnataka has reported 16 deaths due to COVID-19 so far, while 111 people have been discharged from the hospitals in the state. Of the 263 active COVID-19 cases, three patients are in the ICU.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Karnataka near 400, 16 deaths reported so far Six new cases of coronavirus were reported in the last 24 hours in Karnataka, taking the total number of cases in the state to 390. Karnataka has reported 16 deaths due to COVID-19 so far, while 111 people have been discharged from the hospitals in the state. Of the 263 active COVID-19 cases, three patients are in the ICU.

Headline: Corruptors trying to build relationship with cricketers amid lockdown: ICC
Description: ICC's Anti-Corruption Unit head Alex Marshall has revealed that "known corrupters" are trying to build relations with cricketers by exploiting their increased presence on social media amid the coronavirus pandemic. "They can exploit the relationship at a later date," he added. "We have reached out to our members, players and their wider networks to highlight this issue," he further said.
Text: Corruptors trying to build relationship with cricketers amid lockdown: ICC ICC's Anti-Corruption Unit head Alex Marshall has revealed that "known corrupters" are trying to build relations with cricketers by exploiting their increased presence on social media amid the coronavirus pandemic. "They can exploit the relationship at a later date," he added. "We have reached out to our members, players and their wider networks to highlight this issue," he further said.

Headline: 2 men step out amid lockdown and make TikTok video demeaning police; both held
Description: Police in Maharashtra's Dongri arrested two men aged 24 and 19 for allegedly stepping out of their houses and recording a TikTok video. They were also paraded in Bhendi Bazaar area as the two were making fun of police in the video. Police found them with the help of their TikTok accounts and arrested them after the video went viral.
Text: 2 men step out amid lockdown and make TikTok video demeaning police; both held Police in Maharashtra's Dongri arrested two men aged 24 and 19 for allegedly stepping out of their houses and recording a TikTok video. They were also paraded in Bhendi Bazaar area as the two were making fun of police in the video. Police found them with the help of their TikTok accounts and arrested them after the video went viral.

Headline: 198 active coronavirus cases in West Bengal; 66 discharged: Govt
Description: West Bengal on Sunday recorded several new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of active cases in the state to 198, said the state's health and family welfare department. A total of 66 coronavirus patients have been cured and discharged, while coronavirus death toll in the state remained at 12. Over 500 people are in hospital isolation, said the department.
Text: 198 active coronavirus cases in West Bengal; 66 discharged: Govt West Bengal on Sunday recorded several new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of active cases in the state to 198, said the state's health and family welfare department. A total of 66 coronavirus patients have been cured and discharged, while coronavirus death toll in the state remained at 12. Over 500 people are in hospital isolation, said the department.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar reach 97, 38 cured
Description: Two coronavirus cases were reported in Noida on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar to 97. The new cases were detected from Sector 8 and Kendriya Vihar in Sector 82 areas of the city. The district administration said that 38 of the 97 patients have been cured and discharged from hospitals so far.
Text: Coronavirus cases in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar reach 97, 38 cured Two coronavirus cases were reported in Noida on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar to 97. The new cases were detected from Sector 8 and Kendriya Vihar in Sector 82 areas of the city. The district administration said that 38 of the 97 patients have been cured and discharged from hospitals so far.

Headline: Tihar frees 2,962 inmates to decongest jail amid coronavirus pandemic
Description: Delhi State Legal Services Authority on Saturday said that the Tihar jail has released 2,962 prisoners since March 23 on bail/parole for eight weeks to decongest the prison in view of the coronavirus pandemic. Tihar jail authorities would now release inmates suffering from cancer, hepatitis B or C, asthma, tuberculosis and other ailments on interim bail for 45 days.
Text: Tihar frees 2,962 inmates to decongest jail amid coronavirus pandemic Delhi State Legal Services Authority on Saturday said that the Tihar jail has released 2,962 prisoners since March 23 on bail/parole for eight weeks to decongest the prison in view of the coronavirus pandemic. Tihar jail authorities would now release inmates suffering from cancer, hepatitis B or C, asthma, tuberculosis and other ailments on interim bail for 45 days.

Headline: Don't book tickets for journeys after May 3: DGCA as some airlines begin booking
Description: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has asked airlines to refrain from booking tickets for journeys after May 3, saying it has noted several airlines have started booking. It added no decision has been taken yet to commence the operation of domestic/international flights w.e.f May 4. Airlines will be given sufficient notice and time for restarting operations, it added.
Text: Don't book tickets for journeys after May 3: DGCA as some airlines begin booking The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has asked airlines to refrain from booking tickets for journeys after May 3, saying it has noted several airlines have started booking. It added no decision has been taken yet to commence the operation of domestic/international flights w.e.f May 4. Airlines will be given sufficient notice and time for restarting operations, it added.

Headline: Not testing asymptomatic persons can be disastrous: Fadnavis to Maha CM
Description: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis urged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to test asymptomatic persons for COVID-19, saying that not doing so can be "disastrous". "According to a Maharashtra Medical Education Department report, 63% to 79% COVID-19 cases in the state are asymptomatic," said Fadnavis. "Request to CM...follow ICMR testing protocols. Ensure actual reporting of positive cases," he added.
Text: Not testing asymptomatic persons can be disastrous: Fadnavis to Maha CM BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis urged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to test asymptomatic persons for COVID-19, saying that not doing so can be "disastrous". "According to a Maharashtra Medical Education Department report, 63% to 79% COVID-19 cases in the state are asymptomatic," said Fadnavis. "Request to CM...follow ICMR testing protocols. Ensure actual reporting of positive cases," he added.

Headline: Pregnant woman walks 5 km in search of hospital, gives birth to baby in empty plot
Description: A pregnant woman and her husband walked over 5 km in search of a hospital in Bengaluru seeking medical help. The woman and her husband met a doctor couple- a general physician and a dentist, in Doddabommasandra. The woman went into premature labour and delivered the baby in an empty plot, where she had gone to relieve herself.
Text: Pregnant woman walks 5 km in search of hospital, gives birth to baby in empty plot A pregnant woman and her husband walked over 5 km in search of a hospital in Bengaluru seeking medical help. The woman and her husband met a doctor couple- a general physician and a dentist, in Doddabommasandra. The woman went into premature labour and delivered the baby in an empty plot, where she had gone to relieve herself.

Headline: Kerala district launches Tiranga vehicle for rapid screening of COVID-19
Description: Kerala's Pathanamthitta district has launched a vehicle called 'Tiranga' (Total India Remote Analysis Nirogya Abhiyaan) for rapid screening of COVID-19 symptoms. The vehicle is equipped with an infrared thermometer for thermal scanning, a two-way microphone system and a mobile camera. The vehicle would conduct screening in the containment zones, buffer zones and in the camps for migrant workers.
Text: Kerala district launches Tiranga vehicle for rapid screening of COVID-19 Kerala's Pathanamthitta district has launched a vehicle called 'Tiranga' (Total India Remote Analysis Nirogya Abhiyaan) for rapid screening of COVID-19 symptoms. The vehicle is equipped with an infrared thermometer for thermal scanning, a two-way microphone system and a mobile camera. The vehicle would conduct screening in the containment zones, buffer zones and in the camps for migrant workers.

Headline: Dehradun, Haridwar, Nainital districts designated as red zones in Uttarakhand
Description: Dehradun, Haridwar and Nainital in Uttarakhand are kept in the red zone with 85% of the total coronavirus cases reported from these districts. A total of 42 persons have tested positive for COVID-19 in Uttarakhand including 20 in Dehradun, nine in Nainital, seven in Haridwar, four in Udham Singh Nagar and one each in Pauri Garhwal and Almora districts.
Text: Dehradun, Haridwar, Nainital districts designated as red zones in Uttarakhand Dehradun, Haridwar and Nainital in Uttarakhand are kept in the red zone with 85% of the total coronavirus cases reported from these districts. A total of 42 persons have tested positive for COVID-19 in Uttarakhand including 20 in Dehradun, nine in Nainital, seven in Haridwar, four in Udham Singh Nagar and one each in Pauri Garhwal and Almora districts.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 1,478, death toll at 23
Description: Rajasthan on Sunday reported 127 new coronavirus cases and two deaths, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,478 including 23 deaths. Jaipur is the worst affected district in the state with 535 cases and 13 deaths. A total of 205 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 97 have been discharged from the hospitals.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 1,478, death toll at 23 Rajasthan on Sunday reported 127 new coronavirus cases and two deaths, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,478 including 23 deaths. Jaipur is the worst affected district in the state with 535 cases and 13 deaths. A total of 205 people have recovered from COVID-19 in the state and 97 have been discharged from the hospitals.

Headline: COVID-19 doesn't see race, religion, caste or borders before striking: PM Modi
Description: Talking about the coronavirus pandemic, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "COVID-19 does not see race, religion, colour, caste, creed, language or borders before striking." He added, "Our response and conduct thereafter should attach primacy to unity and brotherhood." He further said, "We are in this together...The future will be about togetherness and resilience."
Text: COVID-19 doesn't see race, religion, caste or borders before striking: PM Modi Talking about the coronavirus pandemic, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "COVID-19 does not see race, religion, colour, caste, creed, language or borders before striking." He added, "Our response and conduct thereafter should attach primacy to unity and brotherhood." He further said, "We are in this together...The future will be about togetherness and resilience."

Headline: Make plan to bring UP's migrant workers back home: Priyanka to state govt
Description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday urged the Uttar Pradesh government to make a plan to bring back migrant workers stranded in other parts of India amid coronavirus lockdown. "These workers are our own. It's our responsibility to help them. We can't leave them like this. We have to find a way out," said Priyanka on Twitter.
Text: Make plan to bring UP's migrant workers back home: Priyanka to state govt Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday urged the Uttar Pradesh government to make a plan to bring back migrant workers stranded in other parts of India amid coronavirus lockdown. "These workers are our own. It's our responsibility to help them. We can't leave them like this. We have to find a way out," said Priyanka on Twitter.

Headline: Activists in Karnataka go on hunger strike for action plan for migrants
Description: Activists of All India Central Council of Trade Unions in Karnataka are observing a hunger strike and virtual dharna on Sunday, demanding that the government form the migrant workers' action plan. They demanded that workers be given a one-time ₹10,000 allowance, dry ration and free cooking gas. They added that the government should arrange free transportation to send workers home.
Text: Activists in Karnataka go on hunger strike for action plan for migrants Activists of All India Central Council of Trade Unions in Karnataka are observing a hunger strike and virtual dharna on Sunday, demanding that the government form the migrant workers' action plan. They demanded that workers be given a one-time ₹10,000 allowance, dry ration and free cooking gas. They added that the government should arrange free transportation to send workers home.

Headline: Govt launches 'Kisan Rath' app to help farmers amid COVID-19
Description: The government has launched a new app solely for farmers called 'Kisan Rath Mobile App' to help them identify transport facilities for the movement of farm produce during COVID-19. The app will help in transportation of produce from farm gate to the market and between markets as well. It will also ensure smooth supply linkages among farmers.
Text: Govt launches 'Kisan Rath' app to help farmers amid COVID-19 The government has launched a new app solely for farmers called 'Kisan Rath Mobile App' to help them identify transport facilities for the movement of farm produce during COVID-19. The app will help in transportation of produce from farm gate to the market and between markets as well. It will also ensure smooth supply linkages among farmers.
