Headline: We're going to start some financial activities from tomorrow: Maharashtra CM
Description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said that the state government will start some financial activities from Monday. "We're starting some business activities in a limited way," the CM added. "If we don't run our economy now, we'll have financial crisis after we come out of the coronavirus crisis," Thackeray further said.
Text: We're going to start some financial activities from tomorrow: Maharashtra CM Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said that the state government will start some financial activities from Monday. "We're starting some business activities in a limited way," the CM added. "If we don't run our economy now, we'll have financial crisis after we come out of the coronavirus crisis," Thackeray further said.

Headline: No relaxation in lockdown norms in Delhi, will review situation after a week: CM
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that there will be no relaxation in the lockdown norms in the national capital from April 20. "We have decided to keep people of Delhi safe...We will review the situation again after a week," Kejriwal added. "Coronavirus is spreading rapidly in Delhi but it's still under control," the CM further said.
Text: No relaxation in lockdown norms in Delhi, will review situation after a week: CM Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that there will be no relaxation in the lockdown norms in the national capital from April 20. "We have decided to keep people of Delhi safe...We will review the situation again after a week," Kejriwal added. "Coronavirus is spreading rapidly in Delhi but it's still under control," the CM further said.

Headline: All 186 cases reported yesterday in Delhi didn't know they were infected: CM
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said all the 186 COVID-19 positive cases reported in the national capital on Saturday were asymptomatic. "They didn't know they had coronavirus. This is more worrying," he added. One of them was volunteering at one of Delhi government's food distribution centres so we have ordered rapid testing of everyone there, Kejriwal further said.
Text: All 186 cases reported yesterday in Delhi didn't know they were infected: CM Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said all the 186 COVID-19 positive cases reported in the national capital on Saturday were asymptomatic. "They didn't know they had coronavirus. This is more worrying," he added. One of them was volunteering at one of Delhi government's food distribution centres so we have ordered rapid testing of everyone there, Kejriwal further said.

Headline: All coronavirus patients in Goa recover, active cases in state now 0
Description: Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane today revealed all the seven coronavirus patients in the state have recovered, adding, "The active number of cases in Goa now stands at 0." He added, "Very grateful to our doctors & frontline workers who worked tirelessly & risked their lives to save others." He further thanked Goa CM Pramod Sawant for his "unabated support".
Text: All coronavirus patients in Goa recover, active cases in state now 0 Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane today revealed all the seven coronavirus patients in the state have recovered, adding, "The active number of cases in Goa now stands at 0." He added, "Very grateful to our doctors & frontline workers who worked tirelessly & risked their lives to save others." He further thanked Goa CM Pramod Sawant for his "unabated support".

Headline: 80 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, state's tally reaches 1,431
Description: As many as 80 new COVID-19 positive cases were reported in Rajasthan on Sunday, taking the cumulative positive tally in the state to 1,431, state's Health Department said. Out of the total, Jodhpur reported the highest number of cases (30), followed by Bharatpur (17). Bhilwara, Hanumangarh, Jaisalmer and Jhunjhunu have reported one new case each, the health department added.
Text: 80 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, state's tally reaches 1,431 As many as 80 new COVID-19 positive cases were reported in Rajasthan on Sunday, taking the cumulative positive tally in the state to 1,431, state's Health Department said. Out of the total, Jodhpur reported the highest number of cases (30), followed by Bharatpur (17). Bhilwara, Hanumangarh, Jaisalmer and Jhunjhunu have reported one new case each, the health department added.

Headline: Govt releases advisory against spraying of disinfectants on people
Description: The government released an advisory against spraying of disinfectants on people, saying, "Spraying people with chemical disinfectants is physically and psychologically harmful." It added, "Spraying of chlorine can lead to irritation of eyes and skin and potentially gastrointestinal effects." "Additionally use of such measures may...lead to a false sense of disinfection & safety," it read.
Text: Govt releases advisory against spraying of disinfectants on people The government released an advisory against spraying of disinfectants on people, saying, "Spraying people with chemical disinfectants is physically and psychologically harmful." It added, "Spraying of chlorine can lead to irritation of eyes and skin and potentially gastrointestinal effects." "Additionally use of such measures may...lead to a false sense of disinfection & safety," it read.

Headline: Supply of non-essential goods by e-commerce companies banned during lockdown: Govt
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs on Sunday announced that supply of non-essential goods by e-commerce companies will remain prohibited during the period of coronavirus lockdown. This comes after the Ministry issued guidelines saying e-commerce platforms and vehicles used by the operators will be allowed to function from April 20 during extended lockdown.
Text: Supply of non-essential goods by e-commerce companies banned during lockdown: Govt The Ministry of Home Affairs on Sunday announced that supply of non-essential goods by e-commerce companies will remain prohibited during the period of coronavirus lockdown. This comes after the Ministry issued guidelines saying e-commerce platforms and vehicles used by the operators will be allowed to function from April 20 during extended lockdown.

Headline: PM Modi joked it'll be difficult for me to stay at one place: VP on lockdown
Description: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu while sharing his daily routine during coronavirus lockdown in a Facebook post, said, "Soon after announcement of first lockdown, [PM Modi] said in jest that it'll be an ordeal for a person like me to remain at one place for a long time." Naidu revealed that he "loves to travel, meet and interact with people".
Text: PM Modi joked it'll be difficult for me to stay at one place: VP on lockdown Vice President Venkaiah Naidu while sharing his daily routine during coronavirus lockdown in a Facebook post, said, "Soon after announcement of first lockdown, [PM Modi] said in jest that it'll be an ordeal for a person like me to remain at one place for a long time." Naidu revealed that he "loves to travel, meet and interact with people".

Headline: Andhra woman labourer offers soft drinks to police, DGP thanks her
Description: After the video of a woman labourer in Andhra Pradesh offering soft drinks to police personnel on COVID-19 duty surfaced online, DGP Gautam Sawang personally thanked her for the gesture over a video call. "It's for people like you that government and police work day and night," he said. "For the way you offered cold drinks...we salute you," Sawang added.
Text: Andhra woman labourer offers soft drinks to police, DGP thanks her After the video of a woman labourer in Andhra Pradesh offering soft drinks to police personnel on COVID-19 duty surfaced online, DGP Gautam Sawang personally thanked her for the gesture over a video call. "It's for people like you that government and police work day and night," he said. "For the way you offered cold drinks...we salute you," Sawang added.

Headline: What are the guidelines to facilitate movement of migrant workers within states/UTs?
Description: The government has issued guidelines to facilitate movement of migrant workers within the states/UTs. They should be registered with concerned local authority and their skill mapping should be done for work. Asymptomatic migrants can be transported to their respective places of work within the states/UTs. There shall be no movement of labour outside the state/UT they are currently in.
Text: What are the guidelines to facilitate movement of migrant workers within states/UTs? The government has issued guidelines to facilitate movement of migrant workers within the states/UTs. They should be registered with concerned local authority and their skill mapping should be done for work. Asymptomatic migrants can be transported to their respective places of work within the states/UTs. There shall be no movement of labour outside the state/UT they are currently in.

Headline: Only a heartless govt will do nothing as poor run out of cash: Chidambaram
Description: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said "more and more people have run out of cash and are forced to stand in lines to collect free cooked food" amid coronavirus lockdown. "Only a heartless government will stand by and do nothing," said Chidambaram. "Why cannot government save them from hunger...by transferring cash to every poor family?" he asked.
Text: Only a heartless govt will do nothing as poor run out of cash: Chidambaram Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said "more and more people have run out of cash and are forced to stand in lines to collect free cooked food" amid coronavirus lockdown. "Only a heartless government will stand by and do nothing," said Chidambaram. "Why cannot government save them from hunger...by transferring cash to every poor family?" he asked.

Headline: Andhra, T'gana ask pharmacies to keep records of those buying fever, cold drugs
Description: Telangana and Andhra Pradesh governments have asked pharmacies to take details of anyone purchasing medicines for fever, cold and cough. The pharmacy owners should hand over a list daily to authorities who will maintain a directory of all such cases, trace them and get them tested. While Andhra Pradesh has recorded 603 cases, Telangana has recorded over 800 COVID-19 cases.
Text: Andhra, T'gana ask pharmacies to keep records of those buying fever, cold drugs Telangana and Andhra Pradesh governments have asked pharmacies to take details of anyone purchasing medicines for fever, cold and cough. The pharmacy owners should hand over a list daily to authorities who will maintain a directory of all such cases, trace them and get them tested. While Andhra Pradesh has recorded 603 cases, Telangana has recorded over 800 COVID-19 cases.

Headline: Policemen bring cake for 1-yr-old in Punjab, sing 'Happy Birthday'; video viral
Description: A video showing policemen bringing cake for a 1-year-old in Punjab's Mansa has gone viral on social media. In the video shared on Twitter by Punjab Police, the policemen can be heard singing 'Happy Birthday' for the child. Earlier, a video from US showed policemen wishing a boy on his birthday after his parents requested them.
Text: Policemen bring cake for 1-yr-old in Punjab, sing 'Happy Birthday'; video viral A video showing policemen bringing cake for a 1-year-old in Punjab's Mansa has gone viral on social media. In the video shared on Twitter by Punjab Police, the policemen can be heard singing 'Happy Birthday' for the child. Earlier, a video from US showed policemen wishing a boy on his birthday after his parents requested them.

Headline: 228 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Gujarat, death toll reaches 58
Description: Gujarat health officials on Sunday said five more deaths related to COVID-19 have been reported, taking the state's toll to 58. The health officials added that 228 new cases have been reported since Saturday evening, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 1,604. Over 90 people have recovered from COVID-19 in Gujarat so far.
Text: 228 new COVID-19 positive cases reported in Gujarat, death toll reaches 58 Gujarat health officials on Sunday said five more deaths related to COVID-19 have been reported, taking the state's toll to 58. The health officials added that 228 new cases have been reported since Saturday evening, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 1,604. Over 90 people have recovered from COVID-19 in Gujarat so far.

Headline: Very proud of Delhi Police: Shah on relief ops by the force amid lockdown
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday praised Delhi Police for what it called "the biggest Humanitarian Relief Operations by [the force] since its inception". "Very proud of Delhi Police. Together we'll win this battle," said Shah. Delhi Police said on Twitter that it has delivered five million food packets to the poor and homeless so far amid coronavirus lockdown.
Text: Very proud of Delhi Police: Shah on relief ops by the force amid lockdown Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday praised Delhi Police for what it called "the biggest Humanitarian Relief Operations by [the force] since its inception". "Very proud of Delhi Police. Together we'll win this battle," said Shah. Delhi Police said on Twitter that it has delivered five million food packets to the poor and homeless so far amid coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: UP to allow mills to pay sugar instead of cash to sugarcane farmers for 3 months
Description: The UP government has outlined an experiment where sugar mills can give sugar to willing sugarcane farmers instead of cash, to settle the farmers' dues. Principal Secretary of Sugar Industry and Cane Development Department, Sanjay Bhoosreddy said the arrangement comes as farmers and mills face liquidity crunch amid lockdown. Willing farmers can take one quintal sugar per month till June.
Text: UP to allow mills to pay sugar instead of cash to sugarcane farmers for 3 months The UP government has outlined an experiment where sugar mills can give sugar to willing sugarcane farmers instead of cash, to settle the farmers' dues. Principal Secretary of Sugar Industry and Cane Development Department, Sanjay Bhoosreddy said the arrangement comes as farmers and mills face liquidity crunch amid lockdown. Willing farmers can take one quintal sugar per month till June.

Headline: All Assam government departments to start functioning from April 21
Description: The Assam government on Saturday issued an order stating that all state government departments will start functioning from April 21. Officers of deputy secretary rank and above shall attend office regularly and other Grade-I and Grade-lI officers may attend office as required, the order said. The prescribed protocol of sanitisation and social distancing must be followed, the order further stated.
Text: All Assam government departments to start functioning from April 21 The Assam government on Saturday issued an order stating that all state government departments will start functioning from April 21. Officers of deputy secretary rank and above shall attend office regularly and other Grade-I and Grade-lI officers may attend office as required, the order said. The prescribed protocol of sanitisation and social distancing must be followed, the order further stated.

Headline: It is likely that JEE Main will be conducted in June: HRD Minister
Description: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal said it's likely that JEE Main will be conducted in June. "The Ministry is consulting stakeholders like the boards of examinations, IITs and other agencies...before announcing next dates," he said in an interview with The Indian Express. Pokhriyal also said that the government is trying its best to reach the vulnerable and marginalised students amid lockdown.
Text: It is likely that JEE Main will be conducted in June: HRD Minister HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal said it's likely that JEE Main will be conducted in June. "The Ministry is consulting stakeholders like the boards of examinations, IITs and other agencies...before announcing next dates," he said in an interview with The Indian Express. Pokhriyal also said that the government is trying its best to reach the vulnerable and marginalised students amid lockdown.

Headline: UP man cycles 850 km with friends for his wedding, all sent to quarantine
Description: A 24-year-old man named Sonu Kumar Chauhan covered 850 kilometres on cycle with his three friends from Ludhiana for his wedding scheduled for April 15 in Uttar Pradesh. He and his friends were stopped by authorities and sent to quarantine centre in Balrampur, Balrampur SP Dev Ranjan Verma said. Sonu's home was still 150 km away in UP's Pipra Rasulpur.
Text: UP man cycles 850 km with friends for his wedding, all sent to quarantine A 24-year-old man named Sonu Kumar Chauhan covered 850 kilometres on cycle with his three friends from Ludhiana for his wedding scheduled for April 15 in Uttar Pradesh. He and his friends were stopped by authorities and sent to quarantine centre in Balrampur, Balrampur SP Dev Ranjan Verma said. Sonu's home was still 150 km away in UP's Pipra Rasulpur.

Headline: Govt ITI Cuttack develops COVID-19 sample collection walk-in kiosk
Description: A team of Government Industrial Training Institute (ITI), Cuttack has developed a walk-in kiosk for the safe collection of samples. The kiosk is a mobile cubicle cabin which comes with a pair of gloves attached to it in the front through which the doctor can take samples of the suspected patient. The gloves used can be sanitised from the outside.
Text: Govt ITI Cuttack develops COVID-19 sample collection walk-in kiosk A team of Government Industrial Training Institute (ITI), Cuttack has developed a walk-in kiosk for the safe collection of samples. The kiosk is a mobile cubicle cabin which comes with a pair of gloves attached to it in the front through which the doctor can take samples of the suspected patient. The gloves used can be sanitised from the outside.

Headline: Thousands of migratory flamingos flock to Navi Mumbai creek; pics surface
Description: Thousands of migratory flamingo birds have flocked to Navi Mumbai in Maharashtra after delaying their annual migration to wetlands in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR). The Bombay Natural History Society (BNHS) estimates that their numbers in MMR are 25% more than last year. BNHS said that lower human activity during coronavirus lockdown has created ideal conditions for foraging in wetlands.
Text: Thousands of migratory flamingos flock to Navi Mumbai creek; pics surface Thousands of migratory flamingo birds have flocked to Navi Mumbai in Maharashtra after delaying their annual migration to wetlands in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR). The Bombay Natural History Society (BNHS) estimates that their numbers in MMR are 25% more than last year. BNHS said that lower human activity during coronavirus lockdown has created ideal conditions for foraging in wetlands.

Headline: I give you my word, will take you home: Uddhav Thackeray to migrants
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday told migrant labourers that state government would ensure that they are sent home. He said, "I give you my word that Maharashtra government will take you to your homes, the day this crisis ends. I believe that when you go back to your homes, you should go back happily and not out of fear."
Text: I give you my word, will take you home: Uddhav Thackeray to migrants Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday told migrant labourers that state government would ensure that they are sent home. He said, "I give you my word that Maharashtra government will take you to your homes, the day this crisis ends. I believe that when you go back to your homes, you should go back happily and not out of fear."

Headline: Govt asks airlines to take bookings after its decision on flight restrictions
Description: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has advised the airlines to open bookings only after a decision on lifting or easing restrictions on domestic and international flights is announced. Puri tweeted, "The Ministry of Civil Aviation clarifies that so far no decision has been taken to open domestic or international operations." All commercial passenger flights are suspended till May 3.
Text: Govt asks airlines to take bookings after its decision on flight restrictions Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has advised the airlines to open bookings only after a decision on lifting or easing restrictions on domestic and international flights is announced. Puri tweeted, "The Ministry of Civil Aviation clarifies that so far no decision has been taken to open domestic or international operations." All commercial passenger flights are suspended till May 3.

Headline: Viral pic shows 3 revenue dept officials posing with liquor bottles in MP, suspended
Description: Three revenue department officials have been suspended in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district after a picture showing them holding liquor bottles went viral on social media. Ajay Dhakad, Dharmendra Mehra, and Dayaram Arma, posted as patwaris, were suspended by SDM Bareli Brajendra Singh Rawat. The SDM suspended them on the instructions of Raisen collector Umashankar Bhargav.
Text: Viral pic shows 3 revenue dept officials posing with liquor bottles in MP, suspended Three revenue department officials have been suspended in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district after a picture showing them holding liquor bottles went viral on social media. Ajay Dhakad, Dharmendra Mehra, and Dayaram Arma, posted as patwaris, were suspended by SDM Bareli Brajendra Singh Rawat. The SDM suspended them on the instructions of Raisen collector Umashankar Bhargav.

Headline: Police arrest man for running controversial FB page as woman, force him to post pic
Description: Chhattisgarh Police arrested a man for running a fake Facebook page named 'Nisha Jindal' and disrupting communal harmony through it. The police forced the man to post his real picture with the caption, "I'm in police custody. I'm Nisha Jindal." "No fraud will be spared. Let us reveal all those elements who wish to mislead," Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel tweeted.
Text: Police arrest man for running controversial FB page as woman, force him to post pic Chhattisgarh Police arrested a man for running a fake Facebook page named 'Nisha Jindal' and disrupting communal harmony through it. The police forced the man to post his real picture with the caption, "I'm in police custody. I'm Nisha Jindal." "No fraud will be spared. Let us reveal all those elements who wish to mislead," Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel tweeted.

Headline: Uttar Pradesh Minister gives hair-cut to children amid lockdown, shares video
Description: Satish Dwivedi, MoS for Basic Education in Uttar Pradesh, shared a video on Twitter where he is seen giving a hair-cut to his son. The hair of my son and daughter had grown long and messy so I decided to give them a haircut, Dwivedi said. "It didn't go well for my...daughter but looked fine on my...son," he added.
Text: Uttar Pradesh Minister gives hair-cut to children amid lockdown, shares video Satish Dwivedi, MoS for Basic Education in Uttar Pradesh, shared a video on Twitter where he is seen giving a hair-cut to his son. The hair of my son and daughter had grown long and messy so I decided to give them a haircut, Dwivedi said. "It didn't go well for my...daughter but looked fine on my...son," he added.

Headline: 82 recoveries reported in TN today, total no. of coronavirus cases reaches 1,372
Description: Tamil Nadu reported 82 recoveries from coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of discharged patients in the state to 365. The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu has reached 1,372, with the state reporting 49 new coronavirus cases today. Tamil Nadu has tested 35,036 samples till Saturday.
Text: 82 recoveries reported in TN today, total no. of coronavirus cases reaches 1,372 Tamil Nadu reported 82 recoveries from coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of discharged patients in the state to 365. The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu has reached 1,372, with the state reporting 49 new coronavirus cases today. Tamil Nadu has tested 35,036 samples till Saturday.

Headline: 125 new coronavirus cases reported in Uttar Pradesh, total rises to 974
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 974 after the state reported 125 new cases on Saturday, the state health department said. Agra, the worst-affected district, has reported a total of 199 cases, whereas capital Lucknow has reported 163 cases. A total of 108 people have been discharged after recovery.
Text: 125 new coronavirus cases reported in Uttar Pradesh, total rises to 974 The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has reached 974 after the state reported 125 new cases on Saturday, the state health department said. Agra, the worst-affected district, has reported a total of 199 cases, whereas capital Lucknow has reported 163 cases. A total of 108 people have been discharged after recovery.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in 45 districts in 14 days; total cases in India now 14,792
Description: The government on Saturday revealed that as many as 45 districts in 23 states have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days. Further, the total number of cases in India have risen to 14,792, while the death toll has surged to 488. Meanwhile, as many as 2,015 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.
Text: No new coronavirus case in 45 districts in 14 days; total cases in India now 14,792 The government on Saturday revealed that as many as 45 districts in 23 states have not reported any new case of coronavirus in the last 14 days. Further, the total number of cases in India have risen to 14,792, while the death toll has surged to 488. Meanwhile, as many as 2,015 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Containment zones in Delhi raised to 76 after 8 new areas included today
Description: The total number of containment zones in Delhi has been increased to 76 after eight new areas were included in the list today. The new areas added include A-97, 98 & 99 near Buland Masjid, Shastri Park and T-606 Gali no. 18, Gautampuri. Further, Budh Nagar, Inderpuri and its adjoining area of Buffer Zone has also been included.
Text: Containment zones in Delhi raised to 76 after 8 new areas included today The total number of containment zones in Delhi has been increased to 76 after eight new areas were included in the list today. The new areas added include A-97, 98 & 99 near Buland Masjid, Shastri Park and T-606 Gali no. 18, Gautampuri. Further, Budh Nagar, Inderpuri and its adjoining area of Buffer Zone has also been included.

Headline: Karnataka reports total 384 coronavirus cases, recoveries cross 100
Description: Karnataka has reported 25 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 384, the state health department said. This includes 14 deaths and 104 recoveries. Bengaluru Urban remains the worst-affected district with a total of 89 positive cases, whereas Mysuru, the second worst-affected district, has reported a total of 80 positive cases.
Text: Karnataka reports total 384 coronavirus cases, recoveries cross 100 Karnataka has reported 25 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 384, the state health department said. This includes 14 deaths and 104 recoveries. Bengaluru Urban remains the worst-affected district with a total of 89 positive cases, whereas Mysuru, the second worst-affected district, has reported a total of 80 positive cases.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana crosses 800; death toll at 18
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana has reached 809, with the state reporting 43 new cases on Saturday. Out of the 43 new cases, 31 cases were reported in GHMC area. No recoveries or deaths from coronavirus were reported in the state today and the death toll stands at 18.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana crosses 800; death toll at 18 The total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana has reached 809, with the state reporting 43 new cases on Saturday. Out of the 43 new cases, 31 cases were reported in GHMC area. No recoveries or deaths from coronavirus were reported in the state today and the death toll stands at 18.

Headline: Delhi reports 186 new coronavirus cases today, total nears 1,900
Description: As many as 186 new coronavirus cases were reported in Delhi today, taking the total cases in the national capital to 1,893. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi stands at 43. Further, there are 1,643 active cases and 207 COVID-19 patients have recovered. A total of 22,283 people have been tested in Delhi till now.
Text: Delhi reports 186 new coronavirus cases today, total nears 1,900 As many as 186 new coronavirus cases were reported in Delhi today, taking the total cases in the national capital to 1,893. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi stands at 43. Further, there are 1,643 active cases and 207 COVID-19 patients have recovered. A total of 22,283 people have been tested in Delhi till now.

Headline: Total number of COVID-19 cases in Rajasthan rises to 1,351; death toll now 21
Description: Rajasthan has recorded 122 new coronavirus cases, taking total number of cases there to 1,351, said state health department. Rajasthan's coronavirus death toll has risen to 21. Of the new cases, 42 are in Bharatpur, 26 in Jodhpur, 25 in Jaipur, 17 in Nagaur, five in Kota, three in Ajmer, two in Tonk and one each in Banswara and Jaisalmer.
Text: Total number of COVID-19 cases in Rajasthan rises to 1,351; death toll now 21 Rajasthan has recorded 122 new coronavirus cases, taking total number of cases there to 1,351, said state health department. Rajasthan's coronavirus death toll has risen to 21. Of the new cases, 42 are in Bharatpur, 26 in Jodhpur, 25 in Jaipur, 17 in Nagaur, five in Kota, three in Ajmer, two in Tonk and one each in Banswara and Jaisalmer.

Headline: All necessary permissions were given: K'taka CM on Kumaraswamy's son's wedding
Description: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa defended former CM HD Kumaraswamy for conducting son Nikhil Gowda's wedding during coronavirus lockdown. "All the necessary permissions were given and the marriage was performed in a simple manner. There's no need to discuss about it," said Yediyurappa. "They had done it well within their limits for which I congratulate them," he added.
Text: All necessary permissions were given: K'taka CM on Kumaraswamy's son's wedding Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa defended former CM HD Kumaraswamy for conducting son Nikhil Gowda's wedding during coronavirus lockdown. "All the necessary permissions were given and the marriage was performed in a simple manner. There's no need to discuss about it," said Yediyurappa. "They had done it well within their limits for which I congratulate them," he added.

Headline: India's early measures reason for fewer COVID-19 cases: WHO Regional Director
Description: Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh, Regional Director, World Health Organization (WHO) South East Asia Region, has said that so far, the number of coronavirus cases in India is far fewer compared to other countries. "This can be attributed to early and aggressive measures," she added. "The topmost leadership is driving a whole-of-government and whole-of-society response to the pandemic," Singh stated.
Text: India's early measures reason for fewer COVID-19 cases: WHO Regional Director Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh, Regional Director, World Health Organization (WHO) South East Asia Region, has said that so far, the number of coronavirus cases in India is far fewer compared to other countries. "This can be attributed to early and aggressive measures," she added. "The topmost leadership is driving a whole-of-government and whole-of-society response to the pandemic," Singh stated.

Headline: Which states and Union Territories have reported the most COVID-19 deaths so far?
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Sunday that the death toll due to coronavirus in India has crossed 500, while the total cases have reached 15,712. Out of the total 507 people who've died, Maharashtra accounts for the most number of deaths at 211. This is followed by Madhya Pradesh (70), Gujarat (53) and Delhi (42).
Text: Which states and Union Territories have reported the most COVID-19 deaths so far? The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Sunday that the death toll due to coronavirus in India has crossed 500, while the total cases have reached 15,712. Out of the total 507 people who've died, Maharashtra accounts for the most number of deaths at 211. This is followed by Madhya Pradesh (70), Gujarat (53) and Delhi (42).

Headline: 12 Myanmar nationals held for illegally crossing border amid lockdown
Description: At least 12 Myanmar nationals have been arrested for illegally crossing the Indo-Myanmar border in Mizoram amid coronavirus lockdown. The foreign nationals were booked under The Foreigners Act, 1946 and jailed after completing 14 days of quarantine, said Mizoram Inspector General of Prisons Maria CT Zuali. The foreigners are mostly traders who entered the state without valid documents, Zuali said.
Text: 12 Myanmar nationals held for illegally crossing border amid lockdown At least 12 Myanmar nationals have been arrested for illegally crossing the Indo-Myanmar border in Mizoram amid coronavirus lockdown. The foreign nationals were booked under The Foreigners Act, 1946 and jailed after completing 14 days of quarantine, said Mizoram Inspector General of Prisons Maria CT Zuali. The foreigners are mostly traders who entered the state without valid documents, Zuali said.

Headline: 328 new coronavirus cases reported in Maharashtra today, 56% reported in Mumbai
Description: As many as 328 new coronavirus cases were reported in Maharashtra today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 3,648. Out of all the new cases, 56% (184) cases were reported in Mumbai followed by Pune (78 cases). Maharashtra has reported the most number of cases in India. India has reported over 14,700 cases so far.
Text: 328 new coronavirus cases reported in Maharashtra today, 56% reported in Mumbai  As many as 328 new coronavirus cases were reported in Maharashtra today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 3,648. Out of all the new cases, 56% (184) cases were reported in Mumbai followed by Pune (78 cases). Maharashtra has reported the most number of cases in India. India has reported over 14,700 cases so far.

Headline: Thank you for noticing my warning: Rahul to govt on change in FDI rules
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday reacted to change in FDI policy amid coronavirus pandemic by saying, "I thank government for taking note of my warning." "The massive economic slowdown has weakened many Indian corporates making them attractive targets for takeovers. Government mustn't allow foreign interests to take control of any Indian corporate at this time," Gandhi had earlier said.
Text: Thank you for noticing my warning: Rahul to govt on change in FDI rules Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday reacted to change in FDI policy amid coronavirus pandemic by saying, "I thank government for taking note of my warning." "The massive economic slowdown has weakened many Indian corporates making them attractive targets for takeovers. Government mustn't allow foreign interests to take control of any Indian corporate at this time," Gandhi had earlier said.

Headline: ₹1 cr to families of police, other officials who die on COVID-19 duty: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday extended the ₹1 crore compensation plan to include police force, civil defence volunteers, principals, teachers and all others dealing with coronavirus patients in case they die due to the infection. Delhi government had earlier announced the compensation for families of medical staff including doctors, nurses, lab technicians, as well as sanitation workers.
Text: ₹1 cr to families of police, other officials who die on COVID-19 duty: Kejriwal Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday extended the ₹1 crore compensation plan to include police force, civil defence volunteers, principals, teachers and all others dealing with coronavirus patients in case they die due to the infection. Delhi government had earlier announced the compensation for families of medical staff including doctors, nurses, lab technicians, as well as sanitation workers.

Headline: Maha allows 1.3L sugarcane cutters to return to native places within the state
Description: Maharashtra government has allowed 1.31 lakh migrant sugarcane workers to return to their native villages within the state after medical check-up amid coronavirus lockdown. The announcement was made by state Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde. Addressing sugarcane workers, Munde said, "Return home staying within the rules laid down by the government. Stay inside homes when you return."
Text: Maha allows 1.3L sugarcane cutters to return to native places within the state Maharashtra government has allowed 1.31 lakh migrant sugarcane workers to return to their native villages within the state after medical check-up amid coronavirus lockdown. The announcement was made by state Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde. Addressing sugarcane workers, Munde said, "Return home staying within the rules laid down by the government. Stay inside homes when you return."

Headline: India conducts 35,494 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in one day so far
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 35,494 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 2,154 samples tested positive. Further, 3,72,123 samples from 3,54,969 individuals have been tested in India so far.
Text: India conducts 35,494 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in one day so far The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 35,494 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 2,154 samples tested positive. Further, 3,72,123 samples from 3,54,969 individuals have been tested in India so far.

Headline: Identify daily wage workers who didn't get ₹1,000 relief money: UP CM
Description: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday directed officials to identify daily wage workers who haven't received ₹1,000 in their bank accounts. The state government has so far distributed ₹236.98 crore as sustenance allowance to 23.70 lakh labourers amid the lockdown. The UP government has made arrangements to give food grains to labourers, daily wagers, destitute and artisans, Adityanath said.
Text: Identify daily wage workers who didn't get ₹1,000 relief money: UP CM Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday directed officials to identify daily wage workers who haven't received ₹1,000 in their bank accounts. The state government has so far distributed ₹236.98 crore as sustenance allowance to 23.70 lakh labourers amid the lockdown. The UP government has made arrangements to give food grains to labourers, daily wagers, destitute and artisans, Adityanath said.

Headline: 26 members of Delhi family test positive for coronavirus
Description: As many as 26 members of a family in Delhi's Jahangirpuri tested positive for coronavirus, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced today. He added that the area where the family lives has been declared as a containment zone. The number of containment zones in the national capital has been raised to 76.
Text: 26 members of Delhi family test positive for coronavirus As many as 26 members of a family in Delhi's Jahangirpuri tested positive for coronavirus, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced today. He added that the area where the family lives has been declared as a containment zone. The number of containment zones in the national capital has been raised to 76.

Headline: Fight breaks out between female vegetable vendor, police in Mumbai; video surfaces
Description: A scuffle broke out between a female vegetable seller and Mumbai police after the vendor wasn't allowed to sell. The hawker was trying to sell vegetables in a containment zone in Mumbai's Mankhurd when the police asked her to clear the area. In the video, the woman can be seen hitting the police while the officials seize her handcart.
Text: Fight breaks out between female vegetable vendor, police in Mumbai; video surfaces A scuffle broke out between a female vegetable seller and Mumbai police after the vendor wasn't allowed to sell. The hawker was trying to sell vegetables in a containment zone in Mumbai's Mankhurd when the police asked her to clear the area. In the video, the woman can be seen hitting the police while the officials seize her handcart.

Headline: France to grant aid to most vulnerable people in India amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: France will grant special financial aid to protect the most vulnerable people in India amid COVID-19 crisis, French ambassador Emmanuel Lenain said. "It's during tough times the full significance of our partnership comes to the fore," he added. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron had telephonic conversation wherein they coordinated international initiatives, Lenain said.
Text: France to grant aid to most vulnerable people in India amid COVID-19 crisis France will grant special financial aid to protect the most vulnerable people in India amid COVID-19 crisis, French ambassador Emmanuel Lenain said. "It's during tough times the full significance of our partnership comes to the fore," he added. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron had telephonic conversation wherein they coordinated international initiatives, Lenain said.

Headline: Continue to be mission deployed: Navy after 26 sailors test +ve for COVID-19
Description: The Indian Navy said on Saturday that it continues to be "Mission Deployed and Combat Ready to meet any challenges in the maritime domain and committed to containing the spread of COVID-19". This comes after 26 sailors belonging to INS Angre, a shore establishment, tested positive for the virus.
Text: Continue to be mission deployed: Navy after 26 sailors test +ve for COVID-19 The Indian Navy said on Saturday that it continues to be "Mission Deployed and Combat Ready to meet any challenges in the maritime domain and committed to containing the spread of COVID-19". This comes after 26 sailors belonging to INS Angre, a shore establishment, tested positive for the virus.

Headline: Actor Ajaz Khan arrested in Mumbai for hate speech
Description: Actor Ajaz Khan has been arrested and a case has been registered against him at Khar Police Station on charges of defamation, hate speech and violation of prohibitory orders. This comes after the actor allegedly made communal remarks during a Facebook Live session. The former Bigg Boss contestant was also arrested for posting communal TikTok video in July last year.
Text: Actor Ajaz Khan arrested in Mumbai for hate speech Actor Ajaz Khan has been arrested and a case has been registered against him at Khar Police Station on charges of defamation, hate speech and violation of prohibitory orders. This comes after the actor allegedly made communal remarks during a Facebook Live session. The former Bigg Boss contestant was also arrested for posting communal TikTok video in July last year.

Headline: Stone pelting on doctors in UP matter of great shame: Javed
Description: Condemning stone pelting on a medical team in Haji Neb Masjid area of Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, Javed Akhtar tweeted, "I can't imagine how ignorant one has to be to attack those who are...[saving]...lives." "What has happened in Moradabad is a matter of great shame," he added. Javed further urged "the educated people" of Moradabad to contact and educate "such ignorants".
Text: Stone pelting on doctors in UP matter of great shame: Javed Condemning stone pelting on a medical team in Haji Neb Masjid area of Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, Javed Akhtar tweeted, "I can't imagine how ignorant one has to be to attack those who are...[saving]...lives." "What has happened in Moradabad is a matter of great shame," he added. Javed further urged "the educated people" of Moradabad to contact and educate "such ignorants".

Headline: U'khand govt tells colleges to start online classes from April 21
Description: Uttarakhand government has issued directions to start online classes in all government and non-government colleges and universities from April 21, amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. The online classes shall be conducted through platforms like Skype, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, Zoom, etc, said the order. The sessions should be recorded as well, it added.
Text: U'khand govt tells colleges to start online classes from April 21 Uttarakhand government has issued directions to start online classes in all government and non-government colleges and universities from April 21, amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. The online classes shall be conducted through platforms like Skype, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, Zoom, etc, said the order. The sessions should be recorded as well, it added.

Headline: MP govt announces honorarium of ₹10,000 for health workers
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said the state government will give an additional honorarium of ₹10,000 per month to the health workers who are directly engaged in treatment of coronavirus patients. If employees of other departments engaged in the service get infected, they will also be given ₹10,000 as service amount. Madhya Pradesh has reported 1,355 coronavirus cases.
Text: MP govt announces honorarium of ₹10,000 for health workers  Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said the state government will give an additional honorarium of ₹10,000 per month to the health workers who are directly engaged in treatment of coronavirus patients. If employees of other departments engaged in the service get infected, they will also be given ₹10,000 as service amount. Madhya Pradesh has reported 1,355 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Air India opens domestic flight bookings from May 4, int'l from June 1
Description: Air India has announced that it has opened bookings for select domestic flights for travel from May 4 and for international flights from June 1 onwards. The national carrier stopped accepting bookings on all domestic flights till May 3 and all international flights for travel till May 31 amid the lockdown due to coronavirus.
Text: Air India opens domestic flight bookings from May 4, int'l from June 1 Air India has announced that it has opened bookings for select domestic flights for travel from May 4 and for international flights from June 1 onwards. The national carrier stopped accepting bookings on all domestic flights till May 3 and all international flights for travel till May 31 amid the lockdown due to coronavirus.

Headline: Those found spitting, urinating in public places will be fined ₹1,000: NDMC
Description: Amid coronavirus spread in the national capital, the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) said that spitting and urinating in public places will be prohibited and a fine of ₹1,000 will be imposed on violators. Earlier, the Union Home Ministry had made spitting a punishable offence under the Disaster Management Act in its revised guidelines for lockdown.
Text: Those found spitting, urinating in public places will be fined ₹1,000: NDMC Amid coronavirus spread in the national capital, the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) said that spitting and urinating in public places will be prohibited and a fine of ₹1,000 will be imposed on violators. Earlier, the Union Home Ministry had made spitting a punishable offence under the Disaster Management Act in its revised guidelines for lockdown.

Headline: Shift non-coronavirus patients from dedicated hospitals by Sunday: Delhi govt
Description: The Delhi government has ordered officials to move all non-coronavirus patients from the dedicated hospitals to other facilities by Sunday. Delhi Chief Secretary Vijay Dev directed the divisional commissioner and the health secretary to ensure that non-coronavirus patients receive seamless treatment and are not ignored by healthcare service providers, an official said.
Text: Shift non-coronavirus patients from dedicated hospitals by Sunday: Delhi govt The Delhi government has ordered officials to move all non-coronavirus patients from the dedicated hospitals to other facilities by Sunday. Delhi Chief Secretary Vijay Dev directed the divisional commissioner and the health secretary to ensure that non-coronavirus patients receive seamless treatment and are not ignored by healthcare service providers, an official said.

Headline: Should mobilise scientists, engineers to work on solutions to crisis: Rahul
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted, "The Covid-19 pandemic is a huge challenge but it is also an opportunity." He added, "We need to mobilise our huge pool of scientists, engineers and data experts to work on innovative solutions needed during the crisis." Earlier, he had claimed that the pandemic must be strategically and dynamically handled.
Text: Should mobilise scientists, engineers to work on solutions to crisis: Rahul Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted, "The Covid-19 pandemic is a huge challenge but it is also an opportunity." He added, "We need to mobilise our huge pool of scientists, engineers and data experts to work on innovative solutions needed during the crisis." Earlier, he had claimed that the pandemic must be strategically and dynamically handled.

Headline: 176 new cases reported in Gujarat, total rises to 1,272
Description: Gujarat reported 176 fresh coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,272, the state government has said. Ahmedabad reported 143 of the new cases while Surat reported 13 new cases. Meanwhile, 48 people in the state have died due to the virus, while 88 patients have recovered.
Text: 176 new cases reported in Gujarat, total rises to 1,272 Gujarat reported 176 fresh coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,272, the state government has said. Ahmedabad reported 143 of the new cases while Surat reported 13 new cases. Meanwhile, 48 people in the state have died due to the virus, while 88 patients have recovered.

Headline: Death of 85-year-old not due to Covid-19, he was cured: Kerala govt
Description: The death of an 85-year-old man in Malappuram district cannot be ascribed to Covid-19, Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja said. The deceased, who was admitted to a hospital on April 2 after testing positive for Covid-19, was cured in two weeks and subsequently tested negative thrice. He died after developing kidney-related complications following his release from the hospital, Shailaja added.
Text: Death of 85-year-old not due to Covid-19, he was cured: Kerala govt The death of an 85-year-old man in Malappuram district cannot be ascribed to Covid-19, Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja said. The deceased, who was admitted to a hospital on April 2 after testing positive for Covid-19, was cured in two weeks and subsequently tested negative thrice. He died after developing kidney-related complications following his release from the hospital, Shailaja added.

Headline: 2 new COVID-19 cases in Meghalaya; total 10 active cases: CM
Description: Two more positive coronavirus cases have been detected in Meghalaya taking the total number of active cases in the state to 10, said CM Conrad Sangma on Saturday. Both the new cases are from the first patient's house, with one being a family member and the other a helper, said Sangma. One person has died of coronavirus in Meghalaya.
Text: 2 new COVID-19 cases in Meghalaya; total 10 active cases: CM Two more positive coronavirus cases have been detected in Meghalaya taking the total number of active cases in the state to 10, said CM Conrad Sangma on Saturday. Both the new cases are from the first patient's house, with one being a family member and the other a helper, said Sangma. One person has died of coronavirus in Meghalaya.

Headline: More than 70% reduction in heinous crimes in Delhi during lockdown: Police
Description: Delhi Police has said the national capital has witnessed more than 70% reduction in heinous crimes amid coronavirus lockdown. As per police data, 221 cases of heinous crimes were registered in 2019 from April 1 to April 15, while in 2020, 66 such cases have been registered. Reports of murder and rape cases have reduced by over 75%, police said.
Text: More than 70% reduction in heinous crimes in Delhi during lockdown: Police Delhi Police has said the national capital has witnessed more than 70% reduction in heinous crimes amid coronavirus lockdown. As per police data, 221 cases of heinous crimes were registered in 2019 from April 1 to April 15, while in 2020, 66 such cases have been registered. Reports of murder and rape cases have reduced by over 75%, police said.

Headline: Hospitals turning away patients will face action: Health Minister
Description: Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan has said action will be taken against healthcare personnel if any patient needing attention is turned away from hospitals without treatment amid coronavirus lockdown. "It's a testing time for everybody. Patients are venturing out with difficulty to reach hospital," said Vardhan on Friday. "We shouldn't turn them away on any flimsy pretext," he added.
Text: Hospitals turning away patients will face action: Health Minister Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan has said action will be taken against healthcare personnel if any patient needing attention is turned away from hospitals without treatment amid coronavirus lockdown. "It's a testing time for everybody. Patients are venturing out with difficulty to reach hospital," said Vardhan on Friday. "We shouldn't turn them away on any flimsy pretext," he added.

Headline: Karnataka reports 12 new Covid-19 cases, total reaches 371
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka reached 371 after 12 new cases were reported in less than 24 hours, the state government said on Saturday. Of the 12 new cases, 11 have contact history and one has a history of Severe Acute Respiratory Infections. Thirteen Covid-19 patients have died in the state, while 92 patients have been discharged.
Text: Karnataka reports 12 new Covid-19 cases, total reaches 371 The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka reached 371 after 12 new cases were reported in less than 24 hours, the state government said on Saturday. Of the 12 new cases, 11 have contact history and one has a history of Severe Acute Respiratory Infections. Thirteen Covid-19 patients have died in the state, while 92 patients have been discharged.

Headline: 12 lakh construction workers in Maharashtra to get ₹2k amid lockdown: Govt
Description: Maharashtra government will provide financial assistance of ₹2,000 to 12 lakh registered construction workers in the state. The money will be deposited in the beneficiaries' accounts through direct benefit transfer scheme, said state Labour Minister Dilip Walse Patil. The move is meant to provide relief to construction workers facing loss of source of income due to coronavirus lockdown.
Text: 12 lakh construction workers in Maharashtra to get ₹2k amid lockdown: Govt Maharashtra government will provide financial assistance of ₹2,000 to 12 lakh registered construction workers in the state. The money will be deposited in the beneficiaries' accounts through direct benefit transfer scheme, said state Labour Minister Dilip Walse Patil. The move is meant to provide relief to construction workers facing loss of source of income due to coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: Salute countries helping others fight COVID-19: UN chief on India
Description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres' spokesperson Stephane Dujarric on Friday said Guterres 'salutes' countries that are helping others in fight against COVID-19. Dujarric said this while responding to a question on Guterres' reaction to India's supply of medicines and other materials to other countries. Guterres has called for global solidarity in this struggle against the virus, he added.
Text: Salute countries helping others fight COVID-19: UN chief on India UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres' spokesperson Stephane Dujarric on Friday said Guterres 'salutes' countries that are helping others in fight against COVID-19. Dujarric said this while responding to a question on Guterres' reaction to India's supply of medicines and other materials to other countries. Guterres has called for global solidarity in this struggle against the virus, he added.

Headline: FDI from China, other neighbouring nations now requires govt approval
Description: The government on Saturday said that companies or individuals from countries sharing land borders with India can invest only after receiving government approval. The FDI policy was amended to prevent "opportunistic takeovers of Indian companies due to the current COVID-19 pandemic". This comes after China's central bank recently hiked its stake in India's largest mortgage lender HDFC to 1%.
Text: FDI from China, other neighbouring nations now requires govt approval The government on Saturday said that companies or individuals from countries sharing land borders with India can invest only after receiving government approval. The FDI policy was amended to prevent "opportunistic takeovers of Indian companies due to the current COVID-19 pandemic". This comes after China's central bank recently hiked its stake in India's largest mortgage lender HDFC to 1%.

Headline: Woman who delivered baby 2 days ago tests +ve in Jharkhand
Description: A woman who had delivered a baby two days ago at Sadar Hospital in Jharkhand's Ranchi tested positive for Covid-19 on Friday, said authorities. A doctor stated, "The baby is under proper care and all precautions are being taken...The baby was allowed to be fed by the mother after proper sanitization." The baby's samples will soon be sent for testing.
Text: Woman who delivered baby 2 days ago tests +ve in Jharkhand A woman who had delivered a baby two days ago at Sadar Hospital in Jharkhand's Ranchi tested positive for Covid-19 on Friday, said authorities. A doctor stated, "The baby is under proper care and all precautions are being taken...The baby was allowed to be fed by the mother after proper sanitization." The baby's samples will soon be sent for testing.

Headline: What are the age groups of coronavirus deaths reported in India so far?
Description: The government on Saturday revealed that 14.4% of the 480 coronavirus deaths in India were of the patients aged between 0 and 45. It added that 10.3% were in the age bracket of 45-60, while 33.1% were aged between 60 and 75. The remaining 42.2% deceased were aged above 75. Further, 83% of the patients who died had co-morbidities.
Text: What are the age groups of coronavirus deaths reported in India so far? The government on Saturday revealed that 14.4% of the 480 coronavirus deaths in India were of the patients aged between 0 and 45. It added that 10.3% were in the age bracket of 45-60, while 33.1% were aged between 60 and 75. The remaining 42.2% deceased were aged above 75. Further, 83% of the patients who died had co-morbidities.

Headline: Parents in UAE attend 15-year-old cancer-struck son's funeral in Kerala virtually
Description: Parents had to watch the funeral of their cancer-stricken son on Facebook as they could not accompany his body flown to Kerala due to travel restrictions. 15-year-old Jeuel G Jomay lost his seven-year-long battle with cancer on April 10. Jeuel's cousin said the family also had to obtain special permission for holding the funeral service during the lockdown back home.
Text: Parents in UAE attend 15-year-old cancer-struck son's funeral in Kerala virtually Parents had to watch the funeral of their cancer-stricken son on Facebook as they could not accompany his body flown to Kerala due to travel restrictions. 15-year-old Jeuel G Jomay lost his seven-year-long battle with cancer on April 10. Jeuel's cousin said the family also had to obtain special permission for holding the funeral service during the lockdown back home.

Headline: Appalling that doctors, nurses are being attacked: Shabana
Description: Shabana Azmi on Friday took to Twitter to condemn the attacks on healthcare workers who are working on the front line against coronavirus pandemic. "What is appalling is that doctors and nurses are being attacked by the very people they're trying to save #STOPTHISNOW," she wrote. "I beg you let's replace hate with humaneness [and] salute our heroes," Shabana added.
Text: Appalling that doctors, nurses are being attacked: Shabana Shabana Azmi on Friday took to Twitter to condemn the attacks on healthcare workers who are working on the front line against coronavirus pandemic. "What is appalling is that doctors and nurses are being attacked by the very people they're trying to save #STOPTHISNOW," she wrote. "I beg you let's replace hate with humaneness [and] salute our heroes," Shabana added.

Headline: Dharma Productions to donate to COVID-19 relief funds, NGOs
Description: Karan Johar has announced that Dharma Productions will "extend support to various causes initiated by the government and a host of NGOs" to help those affected by the coronavirus lockdown. The production house will donate to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund. Furthermore, they will also extend help to GOONJ and Zomato Feeding India, among others.
Text: Dharma Productions to donate to COVID-19 relief funds, NGOs Karan Johar has announced that Dharma Productions will "extend support to various causes initiated by the government and a host of NGOs" to help those affected by the coronavirus lockdown. The production house will donate to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund. Furthermore, they will also extend help to GOONJ and Zomato Feeding India, among others.

Headline: Jharkhand witnessing war-like situation due to coronavirus: HC
Description: The Jharkhand High Court on Friday expressed concern over the spread of coronavirus in different parts of the state, observing that a "war-like situation" has arisen. The bench, which was hearing several Public Interest Litigations on different aspects of COVID-19 pandemic, asked whether the government has a road map and sufficient manpower and resources to handle the situation.
Text: Jharkhand witnessing war-like situation due to coronavirus: HC The Jharkhand High Court on Friday expressed concern over the spread of coronavirus in different parts of the state, observing that a "war-like situation" has arisen. The bench, which was hearing several Public Interest Litigations on different aspects of COVID-19 pandemic, asked whether the government has a road map and sufficient manpower and resources to handle the situation.

Headline: Economy will be given momentum in phases amid lockdown in Maha: Ajit
Description: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Saturday said the state's economy will be given momentum in phases during COVID-19 lockdown. Pawar added the supply of essentials will remain uninterrupted and hospitals, pharmacies, pathology centres and ambulance services will remain functional. This comes after CM Uddhav Thackeray said that some industrial and commercial activities will resume from April 20.
Text: Economy will be given momentum in phases amid lockdown in Maha: Ajit Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar on Saturday said the state's economy will be given momentum in phases during COVID-19 lockdown. Pawar added the supply of essentials will remain uninterrupted and hospitals, pharmacies, pathology centres and ambulance services will remain functional. This comes after CM Uddhav Thackeray said that some industrial and commercial activities will resume from April 20.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh gets 1 lakh COVID-19 testing kits from South Korea
Description: The Andhra Pradesh government on Friday received one lakh rapid COVID-19 testing kits from South Korea which would be dispatched to all the 13 districts in the state in three days. These kits would allow doctors to test 10 lakh cases in the coming days, the government said. Tests can be performed within 10 minutes using these newly procured kits.
Text: Andhra Pradesh gets 1 lakh COVID-19 testing kits from South Korea The Andhra Pradesh government on Friday received one lakh rapid COVID-19 testing kits from South Korea which would be dispatched to all the 13 districts in the state in three days. These kits would allow doctors to test 10 lakh cases in the coming days, the government said. Tests can be performed within 10 minutes using these newly procured kits.

Headline: Humanity will surely overcome the coronavirus pandemic: PM Modi
Description: Humanity will surely overcome the coronavirus pandemic, PM Narendra Modi said while retweeting a tweet by the Indian Embassy in Switzerland. The Indian Tricolour sized over 1,000 metres was projected on Switzerland's Matterhorn Mountain, the tweet read. PM Modi also responded to tweets by ministries on the efforts made to help people amid the lockdown and said "kudos to all".
Text: Humanity will surely overcome the coronavirus pandemic: PM Modi Humanity will surely overcome the coronavirus pandemic, PM Narendra Modi said while retweeting a tweet by the Indian Embassy in Switzerland. The Indian Tricolour sized over 1,000 metres was projected on Switzerland's Matterhorn Mountain, the tweet read. PM Modi also responded to tweets by ministries on the efforts made to help people amid the lockdown and said "kudos to all".

Headline: Rahul Gandhi has shown how opposition should behave during crisis: Sena
Description: In its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena said Congress' Rahul Gandhi has created a model code of conduct on how opposition should behave when the country is in crisis. "Rahul recognised the coronavirus threat in advance...warned the government to take necessary steps," it added. Sena further said that the thoughts expressed by Rahul are like a brainstorming session for the government.
Text: Rahul Gandhi has shown how opposition should behave during crisis: Sena In its mouthpiece 'Saamana', Shiv Sena said Congress' Rahul Gandhi has created a model code of conduct on how opposition should behave when the country is in crisis. "Rahul recognised the coronavirus threat in advance...warned the government to take necessary steps," it added. Sena further said that the thoughts expressed by Rahul are like a brainstorming session for the government.

Headline: Over 2,200 stranded French citizens evacuated from India: Ambassador
Description: French Ambassador to India, Emmanuel Lenain, has said that over 2,200 French citizens who were stranded in India amid the coronavirus lockdown have been evacuated. We were able to organise their departure within a few weeks, "thanks to the excellent cooperation" of central and local authorities, he added. The French Embassy ran chartered buses to reach its people across cities.
Text: Over 2,200 stranded French citizens evacuated from India: Ambassador French Ambassador to India, Emmanuel Lenain, has said that over 2,200 French citizens who were stranded in India amid the coronavirus lockdown have been evacuated. We were able to organise their departure within a few weeks, "thanks to the excellent cooperation" of central and local authorities, he added. The French Embassy ran chartered buses to reach its people across cities.

Headline: Madhya Pradesh reports 1,355 Covid-19 cases, death toll at 69
Description: A total of 1,355 people have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh so far, the state health department said on Saturday. The health department added that 69 people have died due to Covid-19 in the state, including 47 patients who died in Indore. Further, 23,070 samples have been collected and the reports of 2,708 people are yet to come.
Text: Madhya Pradesh reports 1,355 Covid-19 cases, death toll at 69 A total of 1,355 people have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh so far, the state health department said on Saturday. The health department added that 69 people have died due to Covid-19 in the state, including 47 patients who died in Indore. Further, 23,070 samples have been collected and the reports of 2,708 people are yet to come.

Headline: Cong constitutes 11-member consultative group led by Manmohan Singh
Description: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has constituted a 11-member consultative group, led by former PM Manmohan Singh, to deliberate on matters of current concern and formulate party's views on various issues. The group also comprises former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi, chief spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala, General Secretary KC Venugopal and former union ministers P Chidambaram and Jairam Ramesh.
Text: Cong constitutes 11-member consultative group led by Manmohan Singh Congress President Sonia Gandhi has constituted a 11-member consultative group, led by former PM Manmohan Singh, to deliberate on matters of current concern and formulate party's views on various issues. The group also comprises former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi, chief spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala, General Secretary KC Venugopal and former union ministers P Chidambaram and Jairam Ramesh.

Headline: Sharjeel Imam charge-sheeted for giving seditious speech, abetting riots in Jamia
Description: JNU student Sharjeel Imam on Saturday was charge-sheeted in a Saket court for giving "seditious speech" and "abetting riots" in Jamia Millia University on December 15, 2019. Delhi Police said that based on evidence, sections 124A and 153A of the IPC (sedition and promoting enmity between classes) were invoked. Sharjeel was arrested in Bihar's Jehanabad on January 28.
Text: Sharjeel Imam charge-sheeted for giving seditious speech, abetting riots in Jamia JNU student Sharjeel Imam on Saturday was charge-sheeted in a Saket court for giving "seditious speech" and "abetting riots" in Jamia Millia University on December 15, 2019. Delhi Police said that based on evidence, sections 124A and 153A of the IPC (sedition and promoting enmity between classes) were invoked. Sharjeel was arrested in Bihar's Jehanabad on January 28.

Headline: NHAI to resume toll collection on national highways from April 20
Description: The Union Home Ministry has allowed the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to resume toll collection on national highways from April 20. "It has been further highlighted that user fee collection contributes to the government exchequer and also provides financial strength to NHAI in terms of budgetary support," the Home Ministry stated in a letter to NHAI.
Text: NHAI to resume toll collection on national highways from April 20 The Union Home Ministry has allowed the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to resume toll collection on national highways from April 20. "It has been further highlighted that user fee collection contributes to the government exchequer and also provides financial strength to NHAI in terms of budgetary support," the Home Ministry stated in a letter to NHAI.

Headline: Delhi coronavirus cases rise to 1,707 after 67 new cases reported today
Description: As many as 67 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in the national capital today, taking the total number of cases in Delhi to 1,707. The death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi stands at 42. As many as 21,409 people have been tested in Delhi, out of which 16,899 have tested negative, while results of 2,674 are pending.
Text: Delhi coronavirus cases rise to 1,707 after 67 new cases reported today As many as 67 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in the national capital today, taking the total number of cases in Delhi to 1,707. The death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi stands at 42. As many as 21,409 people have been tested in Delhi, out of which 16,899 have tested negative, while results of 2,674 are pending.

Headline: 98 new coronavirus cases reported in Rajasthan, total rises to 1,229
Description: Rajasthan reported 98 new cases of coronavirus on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,229, the state health department said. Jodhpur district reported 38 new cases today, with the total number of cases rising to 154 there. The death toll from coronavirus in Rajasthan stands at 17, while 93 people have been discharged.
Text: 98 new coronavirus cases reported in Rajasthan, total rises to 1,229 Rajasthan reported 98 new cases of coronavirus on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,229, the state health department said. Jodhpur district reported 38 new cases today, with the total number of cases rising to 154 there. The death toll from coronavirus in Rajasthan stands at 17, while 93 people have been discharged.

Headline: 21 Indian Navy personnel test positive for coronavirus in Mumbai
Description: Twenty-one Indian Navy personnel have tested positive for coronavirus in Mumbai. This number includes 20 sailors of INS Angre, the Indian Navy said. Most of them are asymptomatic and have been traced to a single sailor who tested positive on April 7. All primary contacts, though asymptomatic, have been tested for COVID-19, the Navy added.
Text: 21 Indian Navy personnel test positive for coronavirus in Mumbai Twenty-one Indian Navy personnel have tested positive for coronavirus in Mumbai. This number includes 20 sailors of INS Angre, the Indian Navy said. Most of them are asymptomatic and have been traced to a single sailor who tested positive on April 7. All primary contacts, though asymptomatic, have been tested for COVID-19, the Navy added.

Headline: Visually-challenged woman allegedly raped in MP; family stuck in Raj amid lockdown
Description: A 53-year-old visually-challenged woman was allegedly raped in her house by an unidentified man in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Friday, police said. The woman's husband and other family members are stuck in Rajasthan due to the nationwide coronavirus lockdown. According to the police complaint filed by the woman, she was asleep when the man entered her room and raped her.
Text: Visually-challenged woman allegedly raped in MP; family stuck in Raj amid lockdown A 53-year-old visually-challenged woman was allegedly raped in her house by an unidentified man in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Friday, police said. The woman's husband and other family members are stuck in Rajasthan due to the nationwide coronavirus lockdown. According to the police complaint filed by the woman, she was asleep when the man entered her room and raped her.

Headline: 3 Covid-19 strains found in India, may affect vaccine's efficacy: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research on Friday stated that three strains of coronavirus have been detected in the country so far but the virus "does not seem to mutate too often". The ICMR said this will have no bearing on the efficacy of a drug but may affect the efficacy of a vaccine, as and when they are developed.
Text: 3 Covid-19 strains found in India, may affect vaccine's efficacy: ICMR The Indian Council of Medical Research on Friday stated that three strains of coronavirus have been detected in the country so far but the virus "does not seem to mutate too often". The ICMR said this will have no bearing on the efficacy of a drug but may affect the efficacy of a vaccine, as and when they are developed.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 41 new Covid-19 cases, total reaches 1,270
Description: Rajasthan reported 41 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,270, the state health department has stated. The death toll from the virus has risen to 19 after two people passed away in Jaipur. One of the deceased had chronic kidney disease while the second one was suffering from acute diabetes.
Text: Rajasthan reports 41 new Covid-19 cases, total reaches 1,270 Rajasthan reported 41 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,270, the state health department has stated. The death toll from the virus has risen to 19 after two people passed away in Jaipur. One of the deceased had chronic kidney disease while the second one was suffering from acute diabetes.

Headline: India conducts 31,083 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in one day so far
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 31,083 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 1,443 samples tested positive. Further, 3,35,123 samples from 3,18,449 individuals have been tested in India so far.
Text: India conducts 31,083 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in one day so far The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 31,083 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 1,443 samples tested positive. Further, 3,35,123 samples from 3,18,449 individuals have been tested in India so far.

Headline: Mamata warns of armed policemen in red zones if lockdown violated
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has warned that armed policemen will be deployed in high-risk clusters of Kolkata, Howrah, Hooghly and North 24 Parganas districts if people defy lockdown norms. At a meeting with district magistrates and superintendents of police, she stated, "In red zones, lockdown should be properly monitored...Police can deliver food at doorsteps...We have no other alternative."
Text: Mamata warns of armed policemen in red zones if lockdown violated West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has warned that armed policemen will be deployed in high-risk clusters of Kolkata, Howrah, Hooghly and North 24 Parganas districts if people defy lockdown norms. At a meeting with district magistrates and superintendents of police, she stated, "In red zones, lockdown should be properly monitored...Police can deliver food at doorsteps...We have no other alternative."

Headline: Work from home may become new norm post Covid-19: RS Prasad
Description: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said he believes that "the world is going to become a different world post-Covid-19," and added, "Work from home may become the new norm." Prasad added, "I have asked my department to work with a robust mechanism so that India's work from home model is economical and beneficial."
Text: Work from home may become new norm post Covid-19: RS Prasad Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said he believes that "the world is going to become a different world post-Covid-19," and added, "Work from home may become the new norm." Prasad added, "I have asked my department to work with a robust mechanism so that India's work from home model is economical and beneficial."

Headline: Centre extends visas of stranded foreigners till May 3 amid lockdown
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Friday extended regular and e-visas of all foreigners stranded in India due to the coronavirus lockdown till May 3.
