The MHA also said that, with the exception of diplomats and UN officials, the visa granted to foreigners who are supposed to travel to India will remain suspended till May 3.
Text: Centre extends visas of stranded foreigners till May 3 amid lockdown The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) on Friday extended regular and e-visas of all foreigners stranded in India due to the coronavirus lockdown till May 3. The MHA also said that, with the exception of diplomats and UN officials, the visa granted to foreigners who are supposed to travel to India will remain suspended till May 3.

Headline: 31 fresh coronavirus cases in Andhra, total crosses 600
Description: Andhra Pradesh reported 31 fresh coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 603, the state government has said. Fifteen people in the state have died due to the virus, while 42 patients have been discharged. Meanwhile, the total number of Covid-19 cases in India has crossed 14,000.
Text: 31 fresh coronavirus cases in Andhra, total crosses 600 Andhra Pradesh reported 31 fresh coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 603, the state government has said. Fifteen people in the state have died due to the virus, while 42 patients have been discharged. Meanwhile, the total number of Covid-19 cases in India has crossed 14,000.

Headline: Deeply disturbing: VP on news of people opposing COVID-19 victim's funeral
Description: Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu on Friday said he was "deeply disturbed" by news that people in Meghalaya had opposed funeral of a doctor who died of COVID-19, fearing spread of the virus. "Such incidents are a blot on the society's consciousness and of great concern for all of us, irrespective of party, religion and region," said Naidu.
Text: Deeply disturbing: VP on news of people opposing COVID-19 victim's funeral Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu on Friday said he was "deeply disturbed" by news that people in Meghalaya had opposed funeral of a doctor who died of COVID-19, fearing spread of the virus. "Such incidents are a blot on the society's consciousness and of great concern for all of us, irrespective of party, religion and region," said Naidu.

Headline: India announces online COVID-19 training programme for SAARC countries
Description: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) is conducting web-based live training seminars for healthcare workers in SAARC and other neighbouring countries on COVID-19 management strategies and related issues. This involves 45 to 60 minute-long interactive sessions that will help exchange best practices and connect healthcare workers across SAARC nations. AIIMS-Raipur held the first session on Friday.
Text: India announces online COVID-19 training programme for SAARC countries Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) is conducting web-based live training seminars for healthcare workers in SAARC and other neighbouring countries on COVID-19 management strategies and related issues. This involves 45 to 60 minute-long interactive sessions that will help exchange best practices and connect healthcare workers across SAARC nations. AIIMS-Raipur held the first session on Friday.

Headline: Indian flag projected on Switzerland's Matterhorn mountain to show solidarity
Description: Switzerland's iconic Matterhorn mountain was illuminated with the Indian flag "to express solidarity and give hope and strength to all Indians". "The world is fighting COVID-19 together. Humanity will surely overcome this pandemic," Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded to the gesture. The flags of the US, the UK, Italy, Japan and Germany were also beamed onto the mountain.
Text: Indian flag projected on Switzerland's Matterhorn mountain to show solidarity Switzerland's iconic Matterhorn mountain was illuminated with the Indian flag "to express solidarity and give hope and strength to all Indians". "The world is fighting COVID-19 together. Humanity will surely overcome this pandemic," Prime Minister Narendra Modi responded to the gesture. The flags of the US, the UK, Italy, Japan and Germany were also beamed onto the mountain.

Headline: 18-yr-old man hangs self after not getting enough likes on TikTok videos: Police
Description: An 18-year-old man from Noida allegedly hanged himself to death at his home as he was depressed over not getting enough likes on his TikTok videos, police said on Friday. "It seems that for the past few days, he had been troubled that there weren't enough likes on his videos. He had even shared this with his father," police added.
Text: 18-yr-old man hangs self after not getting enough likes on TikTok videos: Police An 18-year-old man from Noida allegedly hanged himself to death at his home as he was depressed over not getting enough likes on his TikTok videos, police said on Friday. "It seems that for the past few days, he had been troubled that there weren't enough likes on his videos. He had even shared this with his father," police added.

Headline: Police complaint filed against Rangoli Chandel in Mumbai
Description: After Twitter suspended Rangoli Chandel's account over her tweet regarding the Moradabad stone-pelting incident, advocate Ali Kaashif Khan has filed a written complaint against her at Mumbai's Amboli Police Station. "Rangoli...stooped too low...for cheap publicity," Khan said. "She should...educate herself that there are many factors by which [coronavirus] is spreading in the...world," he added.
Text: Police complaint filed against Rangoli Chandel in Mumbai After Twitter suspended Rangoli Chandel's account over her tweet regarding the Moradabad stone-pelting incident, advocate Ali Kaashif Khan has filed a written complaint against her at Mumbai's Amboli Police Station. "Rangoli...stooped too low...for cheap publicity," Khan said. "She should...educate herself that there are many factors by which [coronavirus] is spreading in the...world," he added.

Headline: Security guard booked for infecting family with COVID-19, tests negative
Description: A 54-year-old security guard, against whom an FIR was registered at the Defence Colony police station for allegedly infecting three members of a family with coronavirus in south Delhi, has tested negative, officials said on Friday. During the inquiry, police learned that the guard had visited the Tablighi Jamaat's Nizamuddin Markaz and was also said to be unwell.
Text: Security guard booked for infecting family with COVID-19, tests negative A 54-year-old security guard, against whom an FIR was registered at the Defence Colony police station for allegedly infecting three members of a family with coronavirus in south Delhi, has tested negative, officials said on Friday. During the inquiry, police learned that the guard had visited the Tablighi Jamaat's Nizamuddin Markaz and was also said to be unwell.

Headline: 5k tests to be conducted in Bhubaneswar in next 7 days: Odisha govt
Description: Odisha government said it will be conducting 5,000 tests during the next seven days in Bhubaneswar, which has become a COVID-19 hotspot in the state. Out of Odisha's 60 COVID-19 positive cases, 46 have been reported from Bhubaneswar, said state Chief Secretary Asit Kumar Tripathy. No new coronavirus cases have been reported in Odisha in last two days, he added.
Text: 5k tests to be conducted in Bhubaneswar in next 7 days: Odisha govt Odisha government said it will be conducting 5,000 tests during the next seven days in Bhubaneswar, which has become a COVID-19 hotspot in the state. Out of Odisha's 60 COVID-19 positive cases, 46 have been reported from Bhubaneswar, said state Chief Secretary Asit Kumar Tripathy. No new coronavirus cases have been reported in Odisha in last two days, he added.

Headline: Rahul Gandhi sends essentials, masks, sanitisers to Amethi amid lockdown
Description: Congress' Rahul Gandhi sent five trucks of rice and wheat, one truck of pulses, cooking oil, spices and other essential items for the people of his former Lok Sabha constituency UP's Amethi, Congress district unit president Anil Singh said. A total of 50,000 masks and 20,000 sanitisers were also sent, Singh added. This comes amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown.
Text: Rahul Gandhi sends essentials, masks, sanitisers to Amethi amid lockdown Congress' Rahul Gandhi sent five trucks of rice and wheat, one truck of pulses, cooking oil, spices and other essential items for the people of his former Lok Sabha constituency UP's Amethi, Congress district unit president Anil Singh said. A total of 50,000 masks and 20,000 sanitisers were also sent, Singh added. This comes amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: Injustice to lockdown: Nitish on UP buses to bring back Kota students
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that UP government's decision to send 300 buses to bring back about 9,000 students from Rajasthan's Kota is "injustice with the principle of lockdown". This comes after 300 students from Kota arrived in Patna and Bihar Chief Secretary Deepak Kumar said, "Such travel...was avoidable...if you allow students, on what grounds can you stop migrant labourers?"
Text: Injustice to lockdown: Nitish on UP buses to bring back Kota students Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that UP government's decision to send 300 buses to bring back about 9,000 students from Rajasthan's Kota is "injustice with the principle of lockdown". This comes after 300 students from Kota arrived in Patna and Bihar Chief Secretary Deepak Kumar said, "Such travel...was avoidable...if you allow students, on what grounds can you stop migrant labourers?"

Headline: Gujarat man arrested for trying to ferry 47 labourers to MP in a truck
Description: Police in Rajkot's Gondal Taluka booked a 39-year-old truck driver named Mohan Rathod for ferrying 47 labourers in the vehicle in an attempt to transport them to Madhya Pradesh amid COVID-19 lockdown. "The driver was charging Rs 3,000 per person for the trip," Gujarat Director General of Police Shivanand Jha said. He was booked and arrested on the spot.
Text: Gujarat man arrested for trying to ferry 47 labourers to MP in a truck Police in Rajkot's Gondal Taluka booked a 39-year-old truck driver named Mohan Rathod for ferrying 47 labourers in the vehicle in an attempt to transport them to Madhya Pradesh amid COVID-19 lockdown. "The driver was charging Rs 3,000 per person for the trip," Gujarat Director General of Police Shivanand Jha said. He was booked and arrested on the spot.

Headline: DU Kerala students' body writes to Kejriwal over rent issues amid lockdown
Description: Delhi University Kerala students' body wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal stating they are being pressed to pay rents by their landlords amid coronavirus lockdown. "Several calls are of threatening nature. Many students [can't] pay...livelihood of their parents has suffered due to the lockdown," the letter states. The letter added that students from Northeast India are also facing similar issues.
Text: DU Kerala students' body writes to Kejriwal over rent issues amid lockdown Delhi University Kerala students' body wrote to CM Arvind Kejriwal stating they are being pressed to pay rents by their landlords amid coronavirus lockdown. "Several calls are of threatening nature. Many students [can't] pay...livelihood of their parents has suffered due to the lockdown," the letter states. The letter added that students from Northeast India are also facing similar issues.

Headline: Haryana govt extends suspension of toll collection till May 3
Description: Amid COVID-19 lockdown, the Haryana government has decided to further extend the temporary suspension of fee collection at 15 toll points in the state being run on a Build-operate-transfer (BOT) basis till May 3. The state government had earlier temporarily closed the collection of toll tax on all these toll points from March 30 to April 14.
Text: Haryana govt extends suspension of toll collection till May 3 Amid COVID-19 lockdown, the Haryana government has decided to further extend the temporary suspension of fee collection at 15 toll points in the state being run on a Build-operate-transfer (BOT) basis till May 3. The state government had earlier temporarily closed the collection of toll tax on all these toll points from March 30 to April 14.

Headline: PMO holds meeting on easing lockdown after April 20
Description: The Prime Minister's Office (PMO) on Friday held a meeting with officials of seven ministries over easing the on-going lockdown in select districts of India after April 20. The meeting, chaired by PM Narendra Modi's Principal Secretary PK Mishra, focused primarily on getting workers back to factories and on planning the effective implementation of the guidelines for relaxing the lockdown.
Text: PMO holds meeting on easing lockdown after April 20 The Prime Minister's Office (PMO) on Friday held a meeting with officials of seven ministries over easing the on-going lockdown in select districts of India after April 20. The meeting, chaired by PM Narendra Modi's Principal Secretary PK Mishra, focused primarily on getting workers back to factories and on planning the effective implementation of the guidelines for relaxing the lockdown.

Headline: Delhi govt drafting rules for food delivery persons amid COVID-19 spread
Description: The Delhi government has started drafting safety norms for delivery firms and stand-alone restaurants to prevent further spread of coronavirus. Delhi Chief Secretary, Vijay Dev, on Friday directed the state health department to prepare a mandatory standard operating procedure (SoP). The guidelines are reportedly expected to be released early next week.
Text: Delhi govt drafting rules for food delivery persons amid COVID-19 spread The Delhi government has started drafting safety norms for delivery firms and stand-alone restaurants to prevent further spread of coronavirus. Delhi Chief Secretary, Vijay Dev, on Friday directed the state health department to prepare a mandatory standard operating procedure (SoP). The guidelines are reportedly expected to be released early next week.

Headline: Kerala institute develops test kit that can confirm COVID-19 in 2 hrs: Govt
Description: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday tweeted that Kerala-based Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences & Technology has developed a test kit that can confirm COVID-19 in two hours at a low cost. "Detection time...10 minutes...sample to result in time...less than 2 hours," he added. Harsh Vardhan tweeted that 30 samples can be tested in a single batch.
Text: Kerala institute develops test kit that can confirm COVID-19 in 2 hrs: Govt Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Friday tweeted that Kerala-based Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences & Technology has developed a test kit that can confirm COVID-19 in two hours at a low cost. "Detection time...10 minutes...sample to result in time...less than 2 hours," he added. Harsh Vardhan tweeted that 30 samples can be tested in a single batch.

Headline: Granting bails shouldn't be expensive, inexecutable: Bombay HC
Description: While ordering the release of accused, booked in multiple dacoity and fraud cases, the Bombay High Court ruled that granting bails should not be made inexecutable, expensive and inconvenient. The accused were earlier granted bail by lower courts but they could not execute it due to financial issues. It would be necessary to adopt a humanitarian approach, HC added.
Text: Granting bails shouldn't be expensive, inexecutable: Bombay HC While ordering the release of accused, booked in multiple dacoity and fraud cases, the Bombay High Court ruled that granting bails should not be made inexecutable, expensive and inconvenient. The accused were earlier granted bail by lower courts but they could not execute it due to financial issues. It would be necessary to adopt a humanitarian approach, HC added.

Headline: Uttar Pradesh reports total 849 coronavirus cases, death toll at 14
Description: Uttar Pradesh reported 44 new cases of coronavirus on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 849. The death toll from coronavirus in the state stands at 14, while 82 people have been discharged from hospital after recovery. More than 24,000 samples have been collected for testing in Uttar Pradesh.
Text: Uttar Pradesh reports total 849 coronavirus cases, death toll at 14 Uttar Pradesh reported 44 new cases of coronavirus on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 849. The death toll from coronavirus in the state stands at 14, while 82 people have been discharged from hospital after recovery. More than 24,000 samples have been collected for testing in Uttar Pradesh.

Headline: Food will be given to needy even if they don't have ID: UP CM
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday said that food will be provided to the needy even if they don't have an Aadhaar card, ration card or BPL card. "Persons in shelter homes will also be given food," he added. Yogi further said that even if a person is a non-resident, food will be made available amid the coronavirus lockdown.
Text: Food will be given to needy even if they don't have ID: UP CM UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday said that food will be provided to the needy even if they don't have an Aadhaar card, ration card or BPL card. "Persons in shelter homes will also be given food," he added. Yogi further said that even if a person is a non-resident, food will be made available amid the coronavirus lockdown.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu cross 1,300-mark; 29,673 people tested so far
Description: Tamil Nadu on Friday reported 56 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases to 1,323. Chennai, the worst-hit district, reported 11 new cases taking the total to 228, while Thanjavur reported 17 new cases. Meanwhile, 29,673 people have been tested for the virus in the state till now. Tamil Nadu has reported 15 coronavirus deaths.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu cross 1,300-mark; 29,673 people tested so far Tamil Nadu on Friday reported 56 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases to 1,323. Chennai, the worst-hit district, reported 11 new cases taking the total to 228, while Thanjavur reported 17 new cases. Meanwhile, 29,673 people have been tested for the virus in the state till now. Tamil Nadu has reported 15 coronavirus deaths.

Headline: Don't evict tenants, postpone rent by 3 months: Maharashtra govt to landlords
Description: The Maharashtra government issued instructions to landlords/house owners to postpone rent collection by at least three months. "During this period, no tenant should be evicted from the rented house due to non-payment of rent," the state government tweeted. "Tenants are finding it difficult to pay the (rent) regularly in the times of financial crisis," Additional Chief Secretary Sanjay Kumar said.
Text: Don't evict tenants, postpone rent by 3 months: Maharashtra govt to landlords The Maharashtra government issued instructions to landlords/house owners to postpone rent collection by at least three months. "During this period, no tenant should be evicted from the rented house due to non-payment of rent," the state government tweeted. "Tenants are finding it difficult to pay the (rent) regularly in the times of financial crisis," Additional Chief Secretary Sanjay Kumar said.

Headline: Doubling rate of coronavirus cases 6.2 days from 3 days, total cases now 13,835
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Friday said the doubling rate of coronavirus cases has been 6.2 days for the last seven days. He added that before lockdown, the doubling rate was 3 days. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 13,835 and the death toll has surged to 452.
Text: Doubling rate of coronavirus cases 6.2 days from 3 days, total cases now 13,835 Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Friday said the doubling rate of coronavirus cases has been 6.2 days for the last seven days. He added that before lockdown, the doubling rate was 3 days. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 13,835 and the death toll has surged to 452.

Headline: Number of containment zones in Delhi rises to 66 with 6 new additions
Description: Six more areas were declared coronavirus containment zones in Delhi today, taking the total number of containment zones in the national capital to 66. Additions include affected area around H.No. 859/20, L-II, Sangam Vihar, in and around B-333 and C-105, Hari Nagar and in and around RZ-168, K2 Block, Nihal Vihar. Four family members tested COVID-19 positive in Sangam Vihar.
Text: Number of containment zones in Delhi rises to 66 with 6 new additions Six more areas were declared coronavirus containment zones in Delhi today, taking the total number of containment zones in the national capital to 66. Additions include affected area around H.No. 859/20, L-II, Sangam Vihar, in and around B-333 and C-105, Hari Nagar and in and around RZ-168, K2 Block, Nihal Vihar. Four family members tested COVID-19 positive in Sangam Vihar.

Headline: Number of COVID-19 cases in Karnataka reaches 359; 44 new cases reported
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka  reached 359 after 44 new cases were reported, the state government said on Friday. The total number includes 13 deaths and 88 patients who have recovered. Bengaluru Urban district has reported the highest number of cases at 86, while Mysuru has reported 73 cases. The state has tested over 17,000 samples.
Text: Number of COVID-19 cases in Karnataka reaches 359; 44 new cases reported The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka  reached 359 after 44 new cases were reported, the state government said on Friday. The total number includes 13 deaths and 88 patients who have recovered. Bengaluru Urban district has reported the highest number of cases at 86, while Mysuru has reported 73 cases. The state has tested over 17,000 samples.

Headline: Hundreds defy lockdown to attend bull's funeral in Tamil Nadu
Description: Hundreds violated coronavirus lockdown to pay their last respects to a Jallikattu bull that died on Sunday, April 12, in a village near Alanganallur in Madurai, Tamil Nadu. The bull was reportedly covered in flowers as villagers gathered around it and participated in its funeral procession. Several people who attended the funeral have been booked, said District Collector TG Vinay.
Text: Hundreds defy lockdown to attend bull's funeral in Tamil Nadu Hundreds violated coronavirus lockdown to pay their last respects to a Jallikattu bull that died on Sunday, April 12, in a village near Alanganallur in Madurai, Tamil Nadu. The bull was reportedly covered in flowers as villagers gathered around it and participated in its funeral procession. Several people who attended the funeral have been booked, said District Collector TG Vinay.

Headline: Ration dealer rapes woman who approached him for free ration in UP
Description: A ration dealer in UP's Shamli was arrested for allegedly raping a 23-year-old woman who approached him for free ration from government amid coronavirus lockdown. The woman went to the dealer after her savings dried up but he refused to help her. He later went to the woman's house on the pretext of giving her ration and raped her.
Text: Ration dealer rapes woman who approached him for free ration in UP A ration dealer in UP's Shamli was arrested for allegedly raping a 23-year-old woman who approached him for free ration from government amid coronavirus lockdown. The woman went to the dealer after her savings dried up but he refused to help her. He later went to the woman's house on the pretext of giving her ration and raped her.

Headline: Policemen enforcing lockdown hurt in attack by locals in Rajasthan: Police
Description: Three police constables were injured in an attack by a group of locals while on patrol to enforce coronavirus lockdown in Kasai Mohalla area in Tonk district of Rajasthan on Friday. The injured constables have been hospitalised and police have detained some people for interrogation in the matter, said Vipin Sharma, Additional SP, Tonk. Further investigation is underway, he added.
Text: Policemen enforcing lockdown hurt in attack by locals in Rajasthan: Police Three police constables were injured in an attack by a group of locals while on patrol to enforce coronavirus lockdown in Kasai Mohalla area in Tonk district of Rajasthan on Friday. The injured constables have been hospitalised and police have detained some people for interrogation in the matter, said Vipin Sharma, Additional SP, Tonk. Further investigation is underway, he added.

Headline: MP to be the first state to get test kits sent from China: Official
Description: MP will reportedly get 50,000 rapid test kits from China as Indore recorded 47 coronavirus deaths on Thursday. MP will be the first state in India to get the kits because of the situation in Indore, state Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Mohammad Suleman was quoted as saying by Indian Express. Centre will start distributing the kits from Friday, he added.
Text: MP to be the first state to get test kits sent from China: Official MP will reportedly get 50,000 rapid test kits from China as Indore recorded 47 coronavirus deaths on Thursday. MP will be the first state in India to get the kits because of the situation in Indore, state Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Mohammad Suleman was quoted as saying by Indian Express. Centre will start distributing the kits from Friday, he added.

Headline: K'taka policeman travels 430 km on bike to deliver medicines to cancer patient
Description: Amid the ongoing lockdown over the coronavirus pandemic, Karnataka police Head Constable S Kumaraswamy travelled 430 km on a bike from Bengaluru to Dharwad to provide medicines to a cancer patient. "Kudos to Shri S Kumaraswamy, Head Constable. Bengaluru police commissioner appreciated his good deed," Bengaluru City Police tweeted.
Text: K'taka policeman travels 430 km on bike to deliver medicines to cancer patient Amid the ongoing lockdown over the coronavirus pandemic, Karnataka police Head Constable S Kumaraswamy travelled 430 km on a bike from Bengaluru to Dharwad to provide medicines to a cancer patient. "Kudos to Shri S Kumaraswamy, Head Constable. Bengaluru police commissioner appreciated his good deed," Bengaluru City Police tweeted.

Headline: Only 1 coronavirus case reported in Kerala today; overall 255 patients recover
Description: The Kerala government today said that only one confirmed case of coronavirus was reported in the state today. It added that 10 more people recovered from coronavirus in the state today. A total of 255 coronavirus patients (64.6%) have recovered in the state, while the number of active cases stand at 138. Kerala has reported two coronavirus deaths so far.
Text: Only 1 coronavirus case reported in Kerala today; overall 255 patients recover The Kerala government today said that only one confirmed case of coronavirus was reported in the state today. It added that 10 more people recovered from coronavirus in the state today. A total of 255 coronavirus patients (64.6%) have recovered in the state, while the number of active cases stand at 138. Kerala has reported two coronavirus deaths so far.

Headline: Modi govt delayed lockdown for swearing-in BJP govt in MP: Yechury
Description: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury on Friday alleged that Modi government delayed announcement of COVID-19 lockdown so that the BJP government could be sworn-in in MP. "BJP's lust for power has exposed millions to become victims," said Yechury on Twitter. "Its insatiable, unprincipled greed is directly responsible for this worsening public health emergency," he added.
Text: Modi govt delayed lockdown for swearing-in BJP govt in MP: Yechury CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury on Friday alleged that Modi government delayed announcement of COVID-19 lockdown so that the BJP government could be sworn-in in MP. "BJP's lust for power has exposed millions to become victims," said Yechury on Twitter. "Its insatiable, unprincipled greed is directly responsible for this worsening public health emergency," he added.

Headline: 40 more identified in Moradabad attack on quarantine team: UP Police
Description: The Uttar Pradesh Police on Thursday said that, with the help of CCTV footage and videos, they have identified 40 more people who were involved in an attack on health workers and police personnel in Moradabad. Earlier, 17 people had been arrested under the National Security Act. Three policemen, three medical workers and a doctor were injured in the attack.
Text: 40 more identified in Moradabad attack on quarantine team: UP Police The Uttar Pradesh Police on Thursday said that, with the help of CCTV footage and videos, they have identified 40 more people who were involved in an attack on health workers and police personnel in Moradabad. Earlier, 17 people had been arrested under the National Security Act. Three policemen, three medical workers and a doctor were injured in the attack.

Headline: 5 lakh testing kits arrive from China, another 6.5 lakh on the way
Description: The first consignment of 5 lakh rapid COVID-19 testing kits arrived in India from China on Thursday. Further, Indian Ambassador to China Vikram Misri tweeted that another 6.5 lakh testing kits, including Rapid Antibody Tests and RNA Extraction Kits, have been dispatched to India from the Guangzhou Airport in China.
Text: 5 lakh testing kits arrive from China, another 6.5 lakh on the way The first consignment of 5 lakh rapid COVID-19 testing kits arrived in India from China on Thursday. Further, Indian Ambassador to China Vikram Misri tweeted that another 6.5 lakh testing kits, including Rapid Antibody Tests and RNA Extraction Kits, have been dispatched to India from the Guangzhou Airport in China.

Headline: Which states and Union Territories have lower doubling rate of coronavirus cases?
Description: The government today revealed that the national doubling rate of coronavirus cases is 6.2 days. It added the doubling rate is lower than the national rate in 19 states and Union Territories. They are Kerala, Uttarakhand, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Chandigarh, Ladakh, Puducherry, Bihar, Odisha, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Karnataka, J&K, Punjab, Assam and Tripura.
Text: Which states and Union Territories have lower doubling rate of coronavirus cases? The government today revealed that the national doubling rate of coronavirus cases is 6.2 days. It added the doubling rate is lower than the national rate in 19 states and Union Territories. They are Kerala, Uttarakhand, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Chandigarh, Ladakh, Puducherry, Bihar, Odisha, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Karnataka, J&K, Punjab, Assam and Tripura.

Headline: Tamil Nadu man holds 'corona feast', arrested after sharing video on Facebook
Description: A 29-year-old man was arrested in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur after he organised a "corona feast" amid lockdown and shared a video on Facebook, police said. The accused said the "feast" had been organised 'just for fun', police added. A few others were booked under IPC section 269, section 3 of Epidemic Diseases Act and Section 67 of the IT Act.
Text: Tamil Nadu man holds 'corona feast', arrested after sharing video on Facebook A 29-year-old man was arrested in Tamil Nadu's Thanjavur after he organised a "corona feast" amid lockdown and shared a video on Facebook, police said. The accused said the "feast" had been organised 'just for fun', police added. A few others were booked under IPC section 269, section 3 of Epidemic Diseases Act and Section 67 of the IT Act.

Headline: 8 COVID-19 cases in Army; 1 recovered, back on duty: Army Chief
Description: Indian Army Chief General MM Naravane on Friday said eight positive coronavirus cases have been reported in the Army so far. Out of the eight, two are doctors and one is a nursing assistant, while four other infected personnel are responding well to the treatment, said Naravane. One person, diagnosed in Ladakh, has fully recovered and joined duty, he added.
Text: 8 COVID-19 cases in Army; 1 recovered, back on duty: Army Chief Indian Army Chief General MM Naravane on Friday said eight positive coronavirus cases have been reported in the Army so far. Out of the eight, two are doctors and one is a nursing assistant, while four other infected personnel are responding well to the treatment, said Naravane. One person, diagnosed in Ladakh, has fully recovered and joined duty, he added.

Headline: Empathise with parents: HRD Minister urges pvt schools to rethink fee hike
Description: Union HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal on Friday urged private schools to reconsider annual fee hike and collection of fees for three months together amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. "I request all schools to join hands in fight against coronavirus, empathise with parents amid this global disaster," said Pokhriyal. He also urged schools to provide timely salaries to teachers and other staff.
Text: Empathise with parents: HRD Minister urges pvt schools to rethink fee hike Union HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal on Friday urged private schools to reconsider annual fee hike and collection of fees for three months together amid nationwide coronavirus lockdown. "I request all schools to join hands in fight against coronavirus, empathise with parents amid this global disaster," said Pokhriyal. He also urged schools to provide timely salaries to teachers and other staff.

Headline: UP govt to send 250 buses to bring over 7k students back from Kota
Description: Uttar Pradesh government on Friday decided to send 250 buses to Kota, Rajasthan to bring back 7,500 coaching institute students of the state amid coronavirus lockdown. The move came after a social media campaign called 'Send Us Back Home' was started by the students stranded in Kota city amid coronavirus pandemic. Rajasthan has reported 1,193 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: UP govt to send 250 buses to bring over 7k students back from Kota Uttar Pradesh government on Friday decided to send 250 buses to Kota, Rajasthan to bring back 7,500 coaching institute students of the state amid coronavirus lockdown. The move came after a social media campaign called 'Send Us Back Home' was started by the students stranded in Kota city amid coronavirus pandemic. Rajasthan has reported 1,193 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Delhi man attempts suicide by jumping off an overbridge amid lockdown
Description: A man allegedly tried to commit suicide by jumping off an overbridge in northwest Delhi on Friday but was rescued by police, amid lockdown. A video of the incident has surfaced online which is showing the man hanging from the overbridge and a truck deployed beneath him for his safety. Police suspect that there were domestic issues at his home.
Text: Delhi man attempts suicide by jumping off an overbridge amid lockdown A man allegedly tried to commit suicide by jumping off an overbridge in northwest Delhi on Friday but was rescued by police, amid lockdown. A video of the incident has surfaced online which is showing the man hanging from the overbridge and a truck deployed beneath him for his safety. Police suspect that there were domestic issues at his home.

Headline: Andhra reports 38 new cases of coronavirus, total reaches 572
Description: Andhra Pradesh has reported 38 new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 572, the state health department has said. There have been a total of 14 deaths in Andhra due to coronavirus, while 35 people have been discharged. Meanwhile, the total number of cases in India crossed 13,000.

Headline: Donate ₹35,000 each to PM-CARES: J'khand HC while granting bail to 6
Description: The Jharkhand High Court has granted bail to former BJP MP Som Marandi and five others on the condition that they shall donate ₹35,000 each to the PM-CARES fund. Justice Anubha Rawat Choudhary also directed the petitioners to download the Aarogya Setu App after getting released. The six petitioners had been booked for holding a 'rail roko agitation' in 2012.

Justice Anubha Rawat Choudhary also directed the petitioners to download the Aarogya Setu App after getting released. The six petitioners had been booked for holding a 'rail roko agitation' in 2012.

Headline: IITs boycotting rankings can be detrimental: Global ranking body
Description: Responding to seven IITs boycotting Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings this year, the global ranking body said it could be "detrimental to those institutions, and to India as a whole". The body added that "transparency is at the heart of everything" it does. The seven IITs decided to boycott the global rankings over "transparency" issues in the process.
Text: IITs boycotting rankings can be detrimental: Global ranking body Responding to seven IITs boycotting Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings this year, the global ranking body said it could be "detrimental to those institutions, and to India as a whole". The body added that "transparency is at the heart of everything" it does. The seven IITs decided to boycott the global rankings over "transparency" issues in the process.

Headline: Man booked for assaulting policewoman on lockdown duty in Thane
Description: A case was registered against a man for allegedly assaulting a lady police personnel deployed in Maharashtra's Thane, amid the coronavirus lockdown. The accused was driving a car rashly and when she intercepted him, he allegedly started abusing and manhandling, thereby injuring her. He was charged under Section 353 (assaulting public servant) and other relevant sections of the IPC.
Text: Man booked for assaulting policewoman on lockdown duty in Thane A case was registered against a man for allegedly assaulting a lady police personnel deployed in Maharashtra's Thane, amid the coronavirus lockdown. The accused was driving a car rashly and when she intercepted him, he allegedly started abusing and manhandling, thereby injuring her. He was charged under Section 353 (assaulting public servant) and other relevant sections of the IPC.

Headline: RBI's steps will improve liquidity, help small businesses, poor: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi has said that the measures announced by the RBI will greatly enhance liquidity and improve credit supply. It would help "small businesses, MSMEs, farmers and the poor" as well as states, the PM added. The RBI cut the reverse repo rate by 25 basis points to 3.75% and increased Ways and Means Advances of states by 60%.
Text: RBI's steps will improve liquidity, help small businesses, poor: PM PM Narendra Modi has said that the measures announced by the RBI will greatly enhance liquidity and improve credit supply. It would help "small businesses, MSMEs, farmers and the poor" as well as states, the PM added. The RBI cut the reverse repo rate by 25 basis points to 3.75% and increased Ways and Means Advances of states by 60%.

Headline: 33 of 92 coronavirus patients have recovered in Gautam Buddha Nagar: DM
Description: Suhas LY, District Magistrate of Gautam Buddha Nagar has said that a total of 33 out of 92 coronavirus cases have recovered after 9 patients were cured and discharged on Thursday. "Now 59 active COVID-19 cases remain in GB Nagar. All our corona warriors shall continue to do our best," he added. Uttar Pradesh has over 800 coronavirus cases.
Text: 33 of 92 coronavirus patients have recovered in Gautam Buddha Nagar: DM Suhas LY, District Magistrate of Gautam Buddha Nagar has said that a total of 33 out of 92 coronavirus cases have recovered after 9 patients were cured and discharged on Thursday. "Now 59 active COVID-19 cases remain in GB Nagar. All our corona warriors shall continue to do our best," he added. Uttar Pradesh has over 800 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Private schools cannot hike fees during lockdown, orders Delhi govt
Description: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia has announced that private schools cannot hike fees without taking prior approval from the government. Sisodia said students unable to pay fees should not be restricted from attending online classes, and added, "No fee, except tuition fee, shall be charged." Private schools must also pay salaries to both contractual and full-time staff during the lockdown.
Text: Private schools cannot hike fees during lockdown, orders Delhi govt Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia has announced that private schools cannot hike fees without taking prior approval from the government. Sisodia said students unable to pay fees should not be restricted from attending online classes, and added, "No fee, except tuition fee, shall be charged." Private schools must also pay salaries to both contractual and full-time staff during the lockdown.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Gujarat cross 1,000, death toll reaches 38
Description: Gujarat has reported 92 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,021, the state health department stated on Friday. There have been 38 deaths in the state due to coronavirus, while 74 patients have been discharged. Notably, Maharashtra has the highest number of cases in India, at 3,205, followed by Delhi and Tamil Nadu.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Gujarat cross 1,000, death toll reaches 38 Gujarat has reported 92 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,021, the state health department stated on Friday. There have been 38 deaths in the state due to coronavirus, while 74 patients have been discharged. Notably, Maharashtra has the highest number of cases in India, at 3,205, followed by Delhi and Tamil Nadu.

Headline: 1,640 coronavirus cases in Delhi so far, 34 in ICU and 6 on ventilator: Minister
Description: There are a total of 1,640 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 62 positive cases were reported yesterday, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. There have been 38 deaths in Delhi till now, while 34 people are in ICU and 6 are on ventilator. The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 13,387.
Text: 1,640 coronavirus cases in Delhi so far, 34 in ICU and 6 on ventilator: Minister There are a total of 1,640 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 62 positive cases were reported yesterday, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said. There have been 38 deaths in Delhi till now, while 34 people are in ICU and 6 are on ventilator. The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 13,387.

Headline: What are the new activities exempted by govt from lockdown restrictions?
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs has released a list of new activities that have been exempted from lockdown restrictions. The government has allowed several construction activities in rural areas and has permitted non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) and Cooperative Credit Societies to function. It has also allowed plantation and harvesting of bamboo, coconut, areca nut, cocoa and spices.
Text: What are the new activities exempted by govt from lockdown restrictions? The Ministry of Home Affairs has released a list of new activities that have been exempted from lockdown restrictions. The government has allowed several construction activities in rural areas and has permitted non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) and Cooperative Credit Societies to function. It has also allowed plantation and harvesting of bamboo, coconut, areca nut, cocoa and spices.

Headline: We are exporting medicines to others, Pak exporting terror: Indian Army
Description: Army Chief General MM Naravane has said, "While we are busy not only helping our own citizens but rest of the world by sending medical teams and exporting medicines, on the other hand, Pakistan is...exporting terror." "It is very unfortunate that at a time when the whole world...is fighting coronavirus, our neighbour continues to foment trouble for us," he added.
Text: We are exporting medicines to others, Pak exporting terror: Indian Army Army Chief General MM Naravane has said, "While we are busy not only helping our own citizens but rest of the world by sending medical teams and exporting medicines, on the other hand, Pakistan is...exporting terror." "It is very unfortunate that at a time when the whole world...is fighting coronavirus, our neighbour continues to foment trouble for us," he added.

Headline: Can't evacuate Indians from overseas amid lockdown: Centre to Madras HC
Description: The Centre has informed the Madras High Court that it was not possible for it to organise any evacuation of Indian nationals from any foreign country in the current COVID-19 lockdown situation. The submission was made in a counter to a PIL seeking steps to bring about 350 Indians stranded in Malaysia after visiting the country on tourist visa.
Text:
Can't evacuate Indians from overseas amid lockdown: Centre to Madras HC 
The Centre has informed the Madras High Court that it was not possible for it to organise any evacuation of Indian nationals from any foreign country in the current COVID-19 lockdown situation. The submission was made in a counter to a PIL seeking steps to bring about 350 Indians stranded in Malaysia after visiting the country on tourist visa.

Headline: Former K'taka CM Kumaraswamy's son gets married amid lockdown, pics surface
Description: Ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy's son Nikhil Gowda got married amid the coronavirus lockdown, with pictures from the ceremony surfacing online. Nikhil tied the knot with Revathi, the grand-niece of former Congress Minister for Housing M Krishnappa. Kumaraswamy had shifted venue from Bengaluru to a farmhouse in Ramanagara and had said the wedding will be attended by nearly 60 family members.
Text: Former K'taka CM Kumaraswamy's son gets married amid lockdown, pics surface Ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy's son Nikhil Gowda got married amid the coronavirus lockdown, with pictures from the ceremony surfacing online. Nikhil tied the knot with Revathi, the grand-niece of former Congress Minister for Housing M Krishnappa. Kumaraswamy had shifted venue from Bengaluru to a farmhouse in Ramanagara and had said the wedding will be attended by nearly 60 family members.

Headline: Laughing strategically, rolling on floor dynamically: BJP mocks Rahul
Description: BJP spokesman Sambit Patra on Thursday took a jibe at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for claiming lockdown isn't a solution and the coronavirus pandemic must be strategically and dynamically handled. Patra tweeted, "I am laughing STRATEGICALLY and rolling on the floor DYNAMICALLY." BJP's BL Santhosh also asked Rahul why some Congress-led states extended the lockdown before the Centre's announcement.
Text: Laughing strategically, rolling on floor dynamically: BJP mocks Rahul BJP spokesman Sambit Patra on Thursday took a jibe at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for claiming lockdown isn't a solution and the coronavirus pandemic must be strategically and dynamically handled. Patra tweeted, "I am laughing STRATEGICALLY and rolling on the floor DYNAMICALLY." BJP's BL Santhosh also asked Rahul why some Congress-led states extended the lockdown before the Centre's announcement.

Headline: 40 J&K policemen quarantined after sub-inspector's son tests +ve
Description: Around 40 Jammu and Kashmir policemen have been quarantined after the son of a sub-inspector tested positive for Covid-19 in Kupwara district, authorities stated. "We have sent samples of the police officer for testing. Further action will be taken as per the reports," an official added. The sub-inspector's son has a history of contact with another coronavirus patient.
Text: 40 J&K policemen quarantined after sub-inspector's son tests +ve Around 40 Jammu and Kashmir policemen have been quarantined after the son of a sub-inspector tested positive for Covid-19 in Kupwara district, authorities stated. "We have sent samples of the police officer for testing. Further action will be taken as per the reports," an official added. The sub-inspector's son has a history of contact with another coronavirus patient.

Headline: Attach property of those attacking health workers, police: UP CM
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Thursday ordered that the cost of damaged property be recovered from miscreants who attack health workers and policemen during the coronavirus pandemic. Further, the accused persons' properties should be seized if they fail to pay the cost of the damage incurred. Yogi made the statement a day after a quarantine team was attacked in Moradabad.
Text: Attach property of those attacking health workers, police: UP CM UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Thursday ordered that the cost of damaged property be recovered from miscreants who attack health workers and policemen during the coronavirus pandemic. Further, the accused persons' properties should be seized if they fail to pay the cost of the damage incurred. Yogi made the statement a day after a quarantine team was attacked in Moradabad.

Headline: Karnataka reports 38 new COVID-19 cases, total reaches 353
Description: Karnataka has reported 38 new coronavirus cases in less than 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 353, the state government has said. Thirteen people have died due to COVID-19 in the state, while 82 patients have been discharged. Notably, the total number of cases in India has crossed 13,000.
Text: Karnataka reports 38 new COVID-19 cases, total reaches 353 Karnataka has reported 38 new coronavirus cases in less than 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 353, the state government has said. Thirteen people have died due to COVID-19 in the state, while 82 patients have been discharged. Notably, the total number of cases in India has crossed 13,000.

Headline: Extremely serious about users' security: Zoom on govt calling it unsafe
Description: Responding to the government calling it unsafe and not secure for video conferencing, Zoom said it "takes user security extremely seriously". It further mentioned a large number of global institutions, including government agencies, have done "exhaustive security reviews" of its user, network and data centre layers. All these organisations continued to use Zoom after reviewing, it added.
Text: Extremely serious about users' security: Zoom on govt calling it unsafe Responding to the government calling it unsafe and not secure for video conferencing, Zoom said it "takes user security extremely seriously". It further mentioned a large number of global institutions, including government agencies, have done "exhaustive security reviews" of its user, network and data centre layers. All these organisations continued to use Zoom after reviewing, it added.

Headline: 3 lynched by 200 tribals in Maharashtra after being mistaken for thieves
Description: Three unidentified people who were travelling in a van were lynched by 200 tribals in Maharashtra's Palghar on Thursday night, police said. According to the police, the mob mistook the occupants of the vehicle to be thieves and lynched them. The driver managed to call the police and a team rushed to the spot, police added.
Text: 3 lynched by 200 tribals in Maharashtra after being mistaken for thieves Three unidentified people who were travelling in a van were lynched by 200 tribals in Maharashtra's Palghar on Thursday night, police said. According to the police, the mob mistook the occupants of the vehicle to be thieves and lynched them. The driver managed to call the police and a team rushed to the spot, police added.

Headline: Two terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Shopian
Description: Two terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces at Dairoo village in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Friday morning. A cordon and search operation had been launched by a joint team of police, Army and CRPF. Hiding terrorists had fired at the security forces when they zeroed in towards the suspected spot, leading to the encounter.
Text: Two terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Shopian Two terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces at Dairoo village in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Friday morning. A cordon and search operation had been launched by a joint team of police, Army and CRPF. Hiding terrorists had fired at the security forces when they zeroed in towards the suspected spot, leading to the encounter.

Headline: U'khand allows wedding ceremonies in lockdown with 5 people on each side
Description: The Uttarakhand government on Thursday decided to allow marriage ceremonies in the state during the lockdown, with the condition that a maximum of five people could participate from the bride and groom's side each. District Magistrate's permission would be required for the ceremony and it would be performed inside the house, where social distancing will have to be maintained.
Text: U'khand allows wedding ceremonies in lockdown with 5 people on each side The Uttarakhand government on Thursday decided to allow marriage ceremonies in the state during the lockdown, with the condition that a maximum of five people could participate from the bride and groom's side each. District Magistrate's permission would be required for the ceremony and it would be performed inside the house, where social distancing will have to be maintained.

Headline: 12 lakh Maha construction workers to get ₹2K each from labour welfare fund
Description: Maharashtra government announced that nearly 12 lakh construction workers in the state will get ₹2,000 each from the labour welfare fund, amid coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, the government had planned to give ₹5,000 in two instalments of ₹2,500 each. Lockdown guidelines state that industrial and construction activities will be allowed in rural and semi-urban areas in more than 20 districts.
Text: 12 lakh Maha construction workers to get ₹2K each from labour welfare fund Maharashtra government announced that nearly 12 lakh construction workers in the state will get ₹2,000 each from the labour welfare fund, amid coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, the government had planned to give ₹5,000 in two instalments of ₹2,500 each. Lockdown guidelines state that industrial and construction activities will be allowed in rural and semi-urban areas in more than 20 districts.

Headline: 180 people made to sit on road for 4 hrs for defying lockdown norms in Pune
Description: As many as 180 people were made to sit on the road for over four hours at Swargate area in Pune on Thursday for violating coronavirus lockdown norms. Shabbir Sayyed, Police Inspector (Crime), Swargate police station said these people were made to sit to make them realise the grave situation and the risk they pose. Maharashtra has 3,205 coronavirus cases.

Maharashtra has 3,205 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Free 1 month ration for those without ration card: Chhattisgarh CM
Description: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has announced that those without a ration card will get ration free for one month, amid coronavirus lockdown. This comes after the state government announced that those with ration card will get free ration for two months. "In these hard times...government wants to ensure that no one goes to sleep with an empty stomach," Baghel said.
Text: Free 1 month ration for those without ration card: Chhattisgarh CM Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has announced that those without a ration card will get ration free for one month, amid coronavirus lockdown. This comes after the state government announced that those with ration card will get free ration for two months. "In these hard times...government wants to ensure that no one goes to sleep with an empty stomach," Baghel said.

Headline: Will continue to follow Bhilwara model & flatten the curve: Raj CM
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that the state will continue to follow the Bhilwara model and flatten the curve eventually. He added that the state administration would ensure that eight districts with zero COVID-19 cases so far would remain unaffected. On Jaipur, which has reported 480+ cases, Gehlot said that coronavirus initially spread due to carelessness of international travellers.
Text: Will continue to follow Bhilwara model & flatten the curve: Raj CM Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that the state will continue to follow the Bhilwara model and flatten the curve eventually. On Jaipur, which has reported 480+ cases, Gehlot said that coronavirus initially spread due to carelessness of international travellers.

Headline: Kerala mom travels across 6 states for 3 days to meet ill son in Rajasthan
Description: A 50-year-old Kerala woman travelled across six states for three days for almost 2,700 km to meet her son in Rajasthan, a BSF personnel, who was suffering from muscle inflammation. The woman was accompanied by her daughter-in-law and a relative. Notably, necessary passes were issued by the authorities considering the nationwide lockdown and a cab was arranged through a helpline.
Text: Kerala mom travels across 6 states for 3 days to meet ill son in Rajasthan A 50-year-old Kerala woman travelled across six states for three days for almost 2,700 km to meet her son in Rajasthan, a BSF personnel, who was suffering from muscle inflammation. The woman was accompanied by her daughter-in-law and a relative. Notably, necessary passes were issued by the authorities considering the nationwide lockdown and a cab was arranged through a helpline.

Headline: T'gana constable stitches 3,000 masks amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: B Amareshwari, Personal Security Officer (PSO) to the Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan, has stitched 3,000 cloth masks for the needy as India is on lockdown till May 3. "I work every alternate day, so I stitch on my days off. I stitch masks after duty every day too," she said. Amareshwari added that her target is to stitch 5,000 masks.
Text: T'gana constable stitches 3,000 masks amid COVID-19 pandemic B Amareshwari, Personal Security Officer (PSO) to the Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan, has stitched 3,000 cloth masks for the needy as India is on lockdown till May 3. "I work every alternate day, so I stitch on my days off. I stitch masks after duty every day too," she said. Amareshwari added that her target is to stitch 5,000 masks.

Headline: COVID-19 is a state subject & national pandemic: WB Chief Secretary
Description: West Bengal Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha said that COVID-19 is a state subject and a national pandemic. "In order to battle the pandemic, Centre and state have been working together...[it can't be that] Centre is issuing instructions and state isn't following them," he added. Rajiva further said that 3.47 lakh PPEs and 2.23 lakh N95 masks have been distributed.
Text: COVID-19 is a state subject & national pandemic: WB Chief Secretary West Bengal Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha said that COVID-19 is a state subject and a national pandemic. "In order to battle the pandemic, Centre and state have been working together...[it can't be that] Centre is issuing instructions and state isn't following them," he added. Rajiva further said that 3.47 lakh PPEs and 2.23 lakh N95 masks have been distributed.

Headline: SDM makes Sikkim HC judge's car turn back from state border
Description: Rangpo SDM Prem Kamal Rai on Tuesday stopped Sikkim High Court Justice Bhaskar Pradhan's official vehicle from crossing the Sikkim border. Justice Pradhan had obtained an e-pass to bring his family to Sikkim from WB. Rai stated, "No vehicles were allowed to cross Sikkim borders...The driver had a word with the judge on his phone and agreed to move back."
Text: SDM makes Sikkim HC judge's car turn back from state border Rangpo SDM Prem Kamal Rai on Tuesday stopped Sikkim High Court Justice Bhaskar Pradhan's official vehicle from crossing the Sikkim border. Rai stated, "No vehicles were allowed to cross Sikkim borders...The driver had a word with the judge on his phone and agreed to move back."

Headline: Over 100 people gather for a fair at K'taka's Kalaburagi amid lockdown
Description: Over a hundred people gathered in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district on Thursday to take out a chariot procession, as part of Siddalingeshwara fair, amid COVID-19 lockdown. A case has been registered against 20 people and temple management under Sections 188, 143, 269 of the IPC. Kalaburagi has been identified as a hotspot and had reported the first coronavirus death in India.
Text: Over 100 people gather for a fair at K'taka's Kalaburagi amid lockdown Over a hundred people gathered in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district on Thursday to take out a chariot procession, as part of Siddalingeshwara fair, amid COVID-19 lockdown. A case has been registered against 20 people and temple management under Sections 188, 143, 269 of the IPC. Kalaburagi has been identified as a hotspot and had reported the first coronavirus death in India.

Headline: You & your colleagues are doing a great job: Tharoor to Harsh Vardhan
Description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Friday appreciated Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan for doing a "great job" in "difficult circumstances" amid COVID-19 outbreak. This comes after Tharoor questioned the Health Ministry as to why his constituency Thiruvananthapuram was listed as a hotspot in a tweet. Harsh Vardhan replied that there are 170 hotspot and 207 non-hotspot districts.
Text: You & your colleagues are doing a great job: Tharoor to Harsh Vardhan Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Friday appreciated Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan for doing a "great job" in "difficult circumstances" amid COVID-19 outbreak. Headline: Scared of assaults, not infection: AIIMS doctors' body to Amit Shah
Description: AIIMS Resident Doctors Association (RDA) wrote to Home Minister Amit Shah appealing for the implementation of 'The Health Services Personnel and Clinical Establishments (Prohibition of Violence and Damage to Property) Bill.' Mentioning seven cases of assault on doctors, the letter stated, "We...are not as scared of infections as we are of being assaulted...by the very community we treat."
Text: Scared of assaults, not infection: AIIMS doctors' body to Amit Shah AIIMS Resident Doctors Association (RDA) wrote to Home Minister Amit Shah appealing for the implementation of 'The Health Services Personnel and Clinical Establishments (Prohibition of Violence and Damage to Property) Bill.' Mentioning seven cases of assault on doctors, the letter stated, "We...are not as scared of infections as we are of being assaulted...by the very community we treat."

Headline: Tamil Nadu reports 25 new COVID-19 cases, total rises to 1,267
Description: Tamil Nadu has reported 25 new coronavirus cases on Thursday, taking the total to 1,267, the state government said. It has confirmed 15 deaths while 180 people have recovered. The state has tested over 26,000 samples for coronavirus. Chennai, the worst-hit district in the state, reported three new cases of coronavirus on Thursday, taking the total to 217.
Text: Tamil Nadu reports 25 new COVID-19 cases, total rises to 1,267 Tamil Nadu has reported 25 new coronavirus cases on Thursday, taking the total to 1,267, the state government said. It has confirmed 15 deaths while 180 people have recovered. The state has tested over 26,000 samples for coronavirus. Chennai, the worst-hit district in the state, reported three new cases of coronavirus on Thursday, taking the total to 217.

Headline: No new confirmed coronavirus case in Himachal on Thursday, total cases at 35
Description: A total of 178 people were tested for coronavirus in Himachal Pradesh today, out of which 168 tested negative, while results are awaited for the remaining 10. The total number of coronavirus cases in the state stands at 35 including 12 discharged patients. Eighteen of the cases are active, while one person in the state has died of coronavirus.

The total number of coronavirus cases in the state stands at 35 including 12 discharged patients. Eighteen of the cases are active, while one person in the state has died of coronavirus.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra crosses 3200; death roll at 194
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra crossed 3200 after the state reported 286 cases on Thursday, the state health department said. As many as seven deaths were reported in Maharashtra today, taking the death toll in the state to 194. A total of 300 people have been discharged after full recovery.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra crosses 3200; death roll at 194 The total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra crossed 3200 after the state reported 286 cases on Thursday, the state health department said. As many as seven deaths were reported in Maharashtra today, taking the death toll in the state to 194. A total of 300 people have been discharged after full recovery.

Headline: 55 new coronavirus cases reported in Rajasthan, total rises to 1,131
Description: Rajasthan has reported 55 new cases of coronavirus on Thursday, bringing the total number of cases to 1,131, the state health department said. Bharatpur reported 23 new cases on Thursday. Meanwhile, Jaipur reported three new cases, taking the total number of cases there to 486. The state has received over 40,000 samples so far.

Bharatpur reported 23 new cases on Thursday. Meanwhile, Jaipur reported three new cases, taking the total number of cases there to 486. The state has received over 40,000 samples so far.

Headline: Shaheen Bagh becomes COVID-19 hotspot, containment zones in Delhi rise to 60
Description: Shaheen Bagh was on Thursday added to the list of Delhi's 'containment zones'. Street no 6, A block, Abul Fazal enclave and Street numbers 3-5, East Ram Nagar, Shahdara were also added to the list, taking the total number of containment zones in Delhi to 60. Sixty-two new cases and six deaths were reported in Delhi in last 24 hours.
Text: Shaheen Bagh becomes COVID-19 hotspot, containment zones in Delhi rise to 60 Shaheen Bagh was on Thursday added to the list of Delhi's 'containment zones'. Street no 6, A block, Abul Fazal enclave and Street numbers 3-5, East Ram Nagar, Shahdara were also added to the list, taking the total number of containment zones in Delhi to 60. Sixty-two new cases and six deaths were reported in Delhi in last 24 hours.

Headline: Gujarat reports total 929 coronavirus cases, death toll at 36
Description: Gujarat has reported 58 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases to 929, the state health department said on Thursday. The state has confirmed 36 deaths related to the virus so far while 73 have recovered. Ahmedabad has reported 53 new cases on Thursday, taking the total number of cases in the city to 545, the department added.
Text: Gujarat reports total 929 coronavirus cases, death toll at 36 Gujarat has reported 58 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases to 929, the state health department said on Thursday. The state has confirmed 36 deaths related to the virus so far while 73 have recovered. Ahmedabad has reported 53 new cases on Thursday, taking the total number of cases in the city to 545, the department added.

Headline: 62 new coronavirus cases reported in Delhi today, total cases rise to 1,640
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 1,640 after 62 new cases were reported on Thursday. Meanwhile, the death toll in the national capital stands at 38. Further, a total of 18,784 samples have been tested for coronavirus in Delhi, out of which 14,692 are negative and results of 2,251 samples are pending.
Text: 62 new coronavirus cases reported in Delhi today, total cases rise to 1,640 The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 1,640 after 62 new cases were reported on Thursday. Meanwhile, the death toll in the national capital stands at 38. Further, a total of 18,784 samples have been tested for coronavirus in Delhi, out of which 14,692 are negative and results of 2,251 samples are pending.

Headline: Because of few jokers, COVID-19 is spreading: Salman on those violating lockdown
Description: Salman Khan has condemned the attack on medical personnel and police officers amid coronavirus pandemic. "Doctors...are trying to save...lives and you pelted stones on them!" he stated. "Those getting detected with coronavirus are running away from the hospital," he added. Further criticising those violating the lockdown, he added, "Because of a few jokers, the virus is spreading."
Text: Because of few jokers, COVID-19 is spreading: Salman on those violating lockdown Salman Khan has condemned the attack on medical personnel and police officers amid coronavirus pandemic. "Doctors...are trying to save...lives and you pelted stones on them!" he stated. "Those getting detected with coronavirus are running away from the hospital," he added. Further criticising those violating the lockdown, he added, "Because of a few jokers, the virus is spreading."

Headline: Amid lockdown, WB govt allows sweet shops to open for 8 hours
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday allowed sweet shops to open for 8 hours in a day, from 8 am to 4 pm, amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, the state government had allowed sweet shops to operate for 4 hours from 12 pm to 4 pm every day.
Text: Amid lockdown, WB govt allows sweet shops to open for 8 hours West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday allowed sweet shops to open for 8 hours in a day, from 8 am to 4 pm, amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, the state government had allowed sweet shops to operate for 4 hours from 12 pm to 4 pm every day.

Headline: Health officials to visit every house in Haryana to screen every resident: CM
Description: Haryana Chief Minister ML Khattar today announced that the health department teams in the state will visit every house and screen each person amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that if symptoms of coronavirus are found, then their samples will be taken for testing. Haryana has reported 214 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: Health officials to visit every house in Haryana to screen every resident: CM Haryana Chief Minister ML Khattar today announced that the health department teams in the state will visit every house and screen each person amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that if symptoms of coronavirus are found, then their samples will be taken for testing. Haryana has reported 214 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Children use bricks to show importance of social distancing; PM shares video
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared a video wherein some children could be seen highlighting the importance of social distancing in the fight against coronavirus. A child could be seen dropping one brick which results in the entire group of bricks to fall. "What children said playfully is a key lesson in staying safe from the coronavirus pandemic," PM tweeted.
Text: Children use bricks to show importance of social distancing; PM shares video Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared a video wherein some children could be seen highlighting the importance of social distancing in the fight against coronavirus. A child could be seen dropping one brick which results in the entire group of bricks to fall. "What children said playfully is a key lesson in staying safe from the coronavirus pandemic," PM tweeted.

Headline: 3 patients who fled said they were disturbed in isolation facility: Indore CSP
Description: Eight people, including six coronavirus patients and two suspects, escaped from an isolation facility in Indore. Three patients were traced and hospitalised. CSP Punit Gehlot said that the three said they were disturbed after staying in the isolation facility for last 17 days and when they came to know they were going to be hospitalised, they fled out of fear.
Text: 3 patients who fled said they were disturbed in isolation facility: Indore CSP Eight people, including six coronavirus patients and two suspects, escaped from an isolation facility in Indore. Three patients were traced and hospitalised. CSP Punit Gehlot said that the three said they were disturbed after staying in the isolation facility for last 17 days and when they came to know they were going to be hospitalised, they fled out of fear.

Headline: 45% districts without a COVID-19 case, 27 districts with no new case in 14 days: Govt
Description: The government on Thursday announced that 45% (325) of all the districts in India have not reported any case of coronavirus. It added that 27 districts have not reported any new case during the last 14 days, while Puducherry's Mahe district has not reported any confirmed case for the last 28 days.
Text: 45% districts without a COVID-19 case, 27 districts with no new case in 14 days: Govt The government on Thursday announced that 45% (325) of all the districts in India have not reported any case of coronavirus. It added that 27 districts have not reported any new case during the last 14 days, while Puducherry's Mahe district has not reported any confirmed case for the last 28 days.

Headline: 68-yr-old UP man suffering from cold declared COVID-19 +ve after lab error
Description: A 68-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh's Amroha, who was suffering from the common cold and sore throat, was wrongly declared coronavirus positive after a misprint by an Aligarh lab. Following his report, his eight family members were screened but found to be negative. Moradabad's Chief Medical Officer said the man's name was wrongly added to the list of positive cases.
Text: 68-yr-old UP man suffering from cold declared COVID-19 +ve after lab error A 68-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh's Amroha, who was suffering from the common cold and sore throat, was wrongly declared coronavirus positive after a misprint by an Aligarh lab. Following his report, his eight family members were screened but found to be negative. Moradabad's Chief Medical Officer said the man's name was wrongly added to the list of positive cases.

Headline: Bengaluru civic agency designates 32 wards as COVID-19 hotspots
Description: With 71 coronavirus cases being reported in Bengaluru apart from three deaths, the city's civic agency has declared 32 municipal wards as COVID-19 hotspots, municipal officials said. Bengaluru Mayor M Goutham Kumar said these 32 wards of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) have been completely sealed and an extensive health check-up campaign has been taken up in these areas.
Text: Bengaluru civic agency designates 32 wards as COVID-19 hotspots With 71 coronavirus cases being reported in Bengaluru apart from three deaths, the city's civic agency has declared 32 municipal wards as COVID-19 hotspots, municipal officials said. Bengaluru Mayor M Goutham Kumar said these 32 wards of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) have been completely sealed and an extensive health check-up campaign has been taken up in these areas.

Headline: Govt to bear medical cost of journalists contracting coronavirus: TN CM
Description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Thursday said that the government would bear all the medical expenses incurred if journalists contracted the coronavirus. He further said that the government would provide an ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh in the event of their "unfortunate death". Palaniswami added, "This will apply to the accredited journalists."
Text: Govt to bear medical cost of journalists contracting coronavirus: TN CM Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Thursday said that the government would bear all the medical expenses incurred if journalists contracted the coronavirus. He further said that the government would provide an ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh in the event of their "unfortunate death". Palaniswami added, "This will apply to the accredited journalists."

Headline: Man defies lockdown to host son's birthday party in UP, booked by police
Description: The Gorakhpur police on Thursday registered a case against a man who defied lockdown norms by hosting a birthday party for his 10-year-old son at his apartment on Wednesday night. Fifty others who joined the event were also booked after a video of the party circulated on social media. The police also seized some chairs used in the event.
Text: Man defies lockdown to host son's birthday party in UP, booked by police The Gorakhpur police on Thursday registered a case against a man who defied lockdown norms by hosting a birthday party for his 10-year-old son at his apartment on Wednesday night. Fifty others who joined the event were also booked after a video of the party circulated on social media. The police also seized some chairs used in the event.

Headline: WHO, India to use polio surveillance network to fight COVID-19
Description: The WHO and India's Health Ministry have initiated a systematic engagement of the organisation's polio surveillance network for coronavirus response, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. They'll be tapping into "best practices and resources that helped India win its war against polio", he added. The WHO field staff will continue to support immunisation and elimination of other diseases.
Text: WHO, India to use polio surveillance network to fight COVID-19 The WHO and India's Health Ministry have initiated a systematic engagement of the organisation's polio surveillance network for coronavirus response, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said. They'll be tapping into "best practices and resources that helped India win its war against polio", he added. The WHO field staff will continue to support immunisation and elimination of other diseases.

Headline: Gujarat govt lab decodes whole genome sequence of coronavirus: CMO
Description: The Gujarat Chief Minister's Office has said that the scientists at the Gujarat Biotechnology Research Centre (GBRC) have reported the whole genome sequence of the novel coronavirus. The CMO said that GBRC has become the country's first state government laboratory to do it. It added that this would be "helpful in tracking origin, drug targets, vaccine and association with virulence".
Text: Gujarat govt lab decodes whole genome sequence of coronavirus: CMO The Gujarat Chief Minister's Office has said that the scientists at the Gujarat Biotechnology Research Centre (GBRC) have reported the whole genome sequence of the novel coronavirus. The CMO said that GBRC has become the country's first state government laboratory to do it. It added that this would be "helpful in tracking origin, drug targets, vaccine and association with virulence".

Headline: Coronavirus is a rich man's disease: Tamil Nadu CM
Description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami called coronavirus a "rich man's disease", adding that the virus was brought to the state by the rich who travelled abroad. "Poor people don't have it. You can...talk to them. One should get scared of the rich person only," Palaniswami added. "We will turn all positive cases into negative," he further said.
Text: Coronavirus is a rich man's disease: Tamil Nadu CM Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami called coronavirus a "rich man's disease", adding that the virus was brought to the state by the rich who travelled abroad. "Poor people don't have it. You can...talk to them. One should get scared of the rich person only," Palaniswami added. "We will turn all positive cases into negative," he further said.

Headline: Money laundering case filed against Tablighi Jamaat chief by ED
