Description: The Enforcement Directorate has registered a money laundering case against Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad Kandhalvi, trusts linked to the Jamaat and others, officials said on Thursday. The officials said the case has been filed by the agency based on a Delhi Police FIR. A separate case for culpable homicide was also registered by the Delhi Police against Saad.
Text: Money laundering case filed against Tablighi Jamaat chief by ED The Enforcement Directorate has registered a money laundering case against Tablighi Jamaat chief Maulana Saad Kandhalvi, trusts linked to the Jamaat and others, officials said on Thursday. The officials said the case has been filed by the agency based on a Delhi Police FIR. A separate case for culpable homicide was also registered by the Delhi Police against Saad.

Headline: Airlines to refund tickets booked during lockdown on request: Govt
Description: Directorate General of Civil Aviation has said that passengers who booked flight tickets during the first lockdown for travel between March 25 and May 3 can get full refund by the airlines on request. The first lockdown lasted from March 25 to April 14. The airlines would process the refund within three weeks from the date of the cancellation request.
Text: Airlines to refund tickets booked during lockdown on request: Govt Directorate General of Civil Aviation has said that passengers who booked flight tickets during the first lockdown for travel between March 25 and May 3 can get full refund by the airlines on request. The first lockdown lasted from March 25 to April 14. The airlines would process the refund within three weeks from the date of the cancellation request.

Headline: Policeman Harjeet Singh whose hand was chopped off by Nihangs promoted
Description: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh took to Twitter to reveal he has promoted ASI Harjeet Singh as Sub Inspector for displaying "exemplary courage" in the Patiala Sabzi Mandi attack where Nihangs chopped off his hand. "He has shown great devotion to duty and poise in face of grave provocation which will inspire Punjab Police and all Punjabis...I salute him," he added.
Text: Policeman Harjeet Singh whose hand was chopped off by Nihangs promoted Punjab CM Amarinder Singh took to Twitter to reveal he has promoted ASI Harjeet Singh as Sub Inspector for displaying "exemplary courage" in the Patiala Sabzi Mandi attack where Nihangs chopped off his hand. "He has shown great devotion to duty and poise in face of grave provocation which will inspire Punjab Police and all Punjabis...I salute him," he added.

Headline: Kerala's COVID-19 mortality rate below 0.5% compared to world's 5%: Govt
Description: The mortality rate due to coronavirus in Kerala is below 0.5% whereas it's over 5% in the world, Health Minister KK Shailaja said. "In some places, it is even more than 10%," she added. Further, Shailaja said the discharging/cure rate is "very high" in Kerala because of "systematic work". Kerala has confirmed 394 cases with two deaths so far.
Text: Kerala's COVID-19 mortality rate below 0.5% compared to world's 5%: Govt The mortality rate due to coronavirus in Kerala is below 0.5% whereas it's over 5% in the world, Health Minister KK Shailaja said. "In some places, it is even more than 10%," she added. Further, Shailaja said the discharging/cure rate is "very high" in Kerala because of "systematic work". Kerala has confirmed 394 cases with two deaths so far.

Headline: COVID-19 hotspot Chandigarh to test all with influenza, flu-like symptoms
Description: Chandigarh, which has officially been declared a hotspot for coronavirus pandemic, will expand its testing criteria to those identified with influenza or flu-like symptoms, including fever, cough, sore throat and a runny nose. "Door-to-door screening is already being conducted to identify such individuals," Arun Kumar Gupta, Health Secretary for the UT said.
Text: COVID-19 hotspot Chandigarh to test all with influenza, flu-like symptoms Chandigarh, which has officially been declared a hotspot for coronavirus pandemic, will expand its testing criteria to those identified with influenza or flu-like symptoms, including fever, cough, sore throat and a runny nose. "Door-to-door screening is already being conducted to identify such individuals," Arun Kumar Gupta, Health Secretary for the UT said.

Headline: COVID-19 crisis temporary brake, things will improve: Javadekar
Description: Union Minister of Information and Broadcasting Prakash Javadekar has said that the coronavirus crisis will be just a temporary "brake", adding that the government is trying to save lives even as it keeps an eye on the economy. "Things will improve. The country that manages to save its people will move ahead," Javadekar said.
Text: COVID-19 crisis temporary brake, things will improve: Javadekar Union Minister of Information and Broadcasting Prakash Javadekar has said that the coronavirus crisis will be just a temporary "brake", adding that the government is trying to save lives even as it keeps an eye on the economy. "Things will improve. The country that manages to save its people will move ahead," Javadekar said.

Headline: 7 IITs boycott Times Higher Education World University Rankings
Description: Seven IITs including IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi have decided not to participate in Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings this year. In a joint release, the IITs said they were dissatisfied with lack of transparency in ranking parameters. They said they would reconsider their decision next year if THE convinces them about the parameters and transparency in process.
Text: 7 IITs boycott Times Higher Education World University Rankings Seven IITs including IIT Bombay and IIT Delhi have decided not to participate in Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings this year. In a joint release, the IITs said they were dissatisfied with lack of transparency in ranking parameters. They said they would reconsider their decision next year if THE convinces them about the parameters and transparency in process.

Headline: India reports more than 5,000 coronavirus cases in 5 days, total cases rise to 12,759
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 12,759 after over 5,000 cases were reported in last five days. Meanwhile, the coronavirus death toll in India has risen to 420, while 1,515 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. Earlier today, the Health Ministry revealed that 941 new cases and 37 deaths were reported on Wednesday.
Text: India reports more than 5,000 coronavirus cases in 5 days, total cases rise to 12,759 The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 12,759 after over 5,000 cases were reported in last five days. Meanwhile, the coronavirus death toll in India has risen to 420, while 1,515 COVID-19 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. Earlier today, the Health Ministry revealed that 941 new cases and 37 deaths were reported on Wednesday.

Headline: Uttarakhand's Chamoli deploys 'Food Vans' for homeless, migrants
Description: Uttarakhand's Chamoli district deployed five mobile 'Food Vans' last week to provide the homeless and migrants with cooked and hygienic food. District Magistrate Swati Bhadauria said, "The vans have been deployed to provide for the most vulnerable who are unable to afford any meal. We aim that not a single person sleeps empty stomach." Over 1,000 people are served daily.
Text: Uttarakhand's Chamoli deploys 'Food Vans' for homeless, migrants Uttarakhand's Chamoli district deployed five mobile 'Food Vans' last week to provide the homeless and migrants with cooked and hygienic food. District Magistrate Swati Bhadauria said, "The vans have been deployed to provide for the most vulnerable who are unable to afford any meal. We aim that not a single person sleeps empty stomach." Over 1,000 people are served daily.

Headline: COVID-19 death toll rises to 13 in Karnataka; 34 new cases reported
Description: The Karnataka Health Department on Thursday said that a 66-year-old man in Bengaluru has died due to COVID-19, taking the state's death toll to 13. The man was on ventilator support since April 10 and died on April 15, it said. The Health Department further said that 34 new positive cases have been confirmed in the state.
Text: COVID-19 death toll rises to 13 in Karnataka; 34 new cases reported The Karnataka Health Department on Thursday said that a 66-year-old man in Bengaluru has died due to COVID-19, taking the state's death toll to 13. The man was on ventilator support since April 10 and died on April 15, it said. The Health Department further said that 34 new positive cases have been confirmed in the state.

Headline: Blunt instruments must not be used against Covid-19: Rahul Gandhi
Description: Stating that the lockdown is not a permanent solution to the coronavirus outbreak in India, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "My main suggestion is that blunt instruments must not be used. We must work strategically." He said the biggest weapon against coronavirus is testing and added, "Use testing...to create a map of India to see where the virus is moving."
Text: Blunt instruments must not be used against Covid-19: Rahul Gandhi Stating that the lockdown is not a permanent solution to the coronavirus outbreak in India, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "My main suggestion is that blunt instruments must not be used. We must work strategically." He said the biggest weapon against coronavirus is testing and added, "Use testing...to create a map of India to see where the virus is moving."

Headline: 65-year-old COVID-19 positive man dies in Agra
Description: A 65-year-old COVID-19 positive man passed away at a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, taking the total coronavirus related deaths in the district to five. "The deceased had chronic kidney disease with systematic hypertension for the last four years," Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh said on Thursday. Over 700 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Uttar Pradesh so far.
Text: 65-year-old COVID-19 positive man dies in Agra A 65-year-old COVID-19 positive man passed away at a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, taking the total coronavirus related deaths in the district to five. "The deceased had chronic kidney disease with systematic hypertension for the last four years," Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh said on Thursday. Over 700 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Uttar Pradesh so far.

Headline: All 11 coronavirus patients recover in Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Description: All 11 coronavirus patients have recovered from coronavirus in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Chetan Sanghi, Chief Secretary, Andaman and Nicobar Islands said. "However, the watch, caution and arrangements will continue as per GoI guidelines," Sanghi wrote on Twitter. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 12,380.
Text: All 11 coronavirus patients recover in Andaman and Nicobar Islands All 11 coronavirus patients have recovered from coronavirus in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Chetan Sanghi, Chief Secretary, Andaman and Nicobar Islands said. "However, the watch, caution and arrangements will continue as per GoI guidelines," Sanghi wrote on Twitter. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 12,380.

Headline: India tests 24 people for 1 positive coronavirus case; can't say we are testing less: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research today said that it can't be said that India is conducting less tests for coronavirus. "India tests 24 people for one positive case, Japan tests 11.7, Italy 6.7, US 5.3, and UK tests 4.3 people for one positive case," it explained. A total of 2,90,401 coronavirus tests have been done so far in India.
Text: India tests 24 people for 1 positive coronavirus case; can't say we are testing less: ICMR The Indian Council of Medical Research today said that it can't be said that India is conducting less tests for coronavirus. "India tests 24 people for one positive case, Japan tests 11.7, Italy 6.7, US 5.3, and UK tests 4.3 people for one positive case," it explained. A total of 2,90,401 coronavirus tests have been done so far in India.

Headline: What are COVID-19 non-hotspot areas, which states & UTs have most of these districts?
Description: The Health Ministry has defined coronavirus non-hotspot areas as those which have reported few coronavirus cases till date but could emerge as potential hotspots. Uttar Pradesh has the most such districts (28) and is followed by Telangana (19) and Madhya Pradesh (17). Further, Maharashtra has 15, Gujarat has 14 and Rajasthan has 13 non-hotspot districts.
Text: What are COVID-19 non-hotspot areas, which states & UTs have most of these districts? The Health Ministry has defined coronavirus non-hotspot areas as those which have reported few coronavirus cases till date but could emerge as potential hotspots. Uttar Pradesh has the most such districts (28) and is followed by Telangana (19) and Madhya Pradesh (17). Further, Maharashtra has 15, Gujarat has 14 and Rajasthan has 13 non-hotspot districts.

Headline: Total number of Covid-19 cases in Maharashtra crosses 3,000
Description: Maharashtra has reported 165 more coronavirus cases, taking the total number of coronavirus cases in the state to 3,081, the State Health Department has stated. Of the new cases, 107 were reported in Mumbai on Thursday. Notably, Maharashtra has the highest number of coronavirus cases among all the states in the country.
Text: Total number of Covid-19 cases in Maharashtra crosses 3,000 Maharashtra has reported 165 more coronavirus cases, taking the total number of coronavirus cases in the state to 3,081, the State Health Department has stated. Of the new cases, 107 were reported in Mumbai on Thursday. Notably, Maharashtra has the highest number of coronavirus cases among all the states in the country.

Headline: China sends 6.5 lakh test kits to India, to send 20 lakh kits in next 15 days
Description: China has dispatched 6.5 lakh test kits to India to help fight the coronavirus pandemic. The kits include Rapid Antibody Tests and RNA Extraction Kits, India's Ambassador to China, Vikram Misri tweeted. Over 20 lakh test kits being procured from China will be sent to India in the next 15 days, Misri told PTI.
Text: China sends 6.5 lakh test kits to India, to send 20 lakh kits in next 15 days China has dispatched 6.5 lakh test kits to India to help fight the coronavirus pandemic. The kits include Rapid Antibody Tests and RNA Extraction Kits, India's Ambassador to China, Vikram Misri tweeted. Over 20 lakh test kits being procured from China will be sent to India in the next 15 days, Misri told PTI.

Headline: Strongly support India's policy response to COVID-19 pandemic: IMF
Description: The IMF has said it "strongly supports" India's policy response to coronavirus pandemic, including the fiscal stimulus package and "proactive decision" to pursue a lockdown despite economic slowdown. IMF also supports the RBI's policy responses to support financial stability, Asia-Pacific Director Chang Yong Rhee added. On March 26, the Finance Ministry unveiled a 1.7 lakh crore economic package.
Text: Strongly support India's policy response to COVID-19 pandemic: IMF The IMF has said it "strongly supports" India's policy response to coronavirus pandemic, including the fiscal stimulus package and "proactive decision" to pursue a lockdown despite economic slowdown. IMF also supports the RBI's policy responses to support financial stability, Asia-Pacific Director Chang Yong Rhee added. On March 26, the Finance Ministry unveiled a 1.7 lakh crore economic package.

Headline: Pizza delivery boy who tested COVID-19 +ve in Delhi also delivered for Zomato
Description: Zomato said a Delhi restaurant partner's employee tested positive for COVID-19 and some of the orders delivered by the employee were placed on Zomato. "We're not sure whether the rider was infected at the time of delivery," Zomato added. Zomato's response relates to the pizza delivery boy who tested positive for COVID-19, following which residents in 72 homes were quarantined.
Text: Pizza delivery boy who tested COVID-19 +ve in Delhi also delivered for Zomato Zomato said a Delhi restaurant partner's employee tested positive for COVID-19 and some of the orders delivered by the employee were placed on Zomato. "We're not sure whether the rider was infected at the time of delivery," Zomato added. Zomato's response relates to the pizza delivery boy who tested positive for COVID-19, following which residents in 72 homes were quarantined.

Headline: I disagree with PM a lot but today we need to fight COVID-19 together: Rahul
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that right now we all must unite and fight together against coronavirus. "I disagree with PM Narendra Modi on a lot of issues but now is not the time to fight with each other," he added. "The mindset should be that we will fight against COVID-19 till the end," Gandhi further said.
Text: I disagree with PM a lot but today we need to fight COVID-19 together: Rahul Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that right now we all must unite and fight together against coronavirus. "I disagree with PM Narendra Modi on a lot of issues but now is not the time to fight with each other," he added. "The mindset should be that we will fight against COVID-19 till the end," Gandhi further said.

Headline: IAF chopper carrying Covid-19 samples makes emergency landing
Description: An Indian Air Force chopper had to make an emergency landing at Hindon air base after it developed a technical snag while on its way to Chandigarh on Thursday. The helicopter was carrying Covid-19 test samples from Leh. The IAF stated, "Recovery aircraft was launched immediately from Hindon. The aircraft was rectified and recovered back promptly and safely at Hindon."
Text: IAF chopper carrying Covid-19 samples makes emergency landing An Indian Air Force chopper had to make an emergency landing at Hindon air base after it developed a technical snag while on its way to Chandigarh on Thursday. The helicopter was carrying Covid-19 test samples from Leh. The IAF stated, "Recovery aircraft was launched immediately from Hindon. The aircraft was rectified and recovered back promptly and safely at Hindon."

Headline: Ex-Commando, injured in 26/11 attacks, auctions his medals for COVID-19 funds
Description: Praveen Teotia, an ex-marine commando who was injured during Mumbai terror attacks, has decided to auction 40 of his marathon medals to raise funds for the fight against COVID-19. Teotia has already sold two medals and has deposited ₹2 lakh received through it in PM-CARES Fund. "I'm...hoping to inspire others to contribute in whatever little way they can," Teotia said.
Text: Ex-Commando, injured in 26/11 attacks, auctions his medals for COVID-19 funds Praveen Teotia, an ex-marine commando who was injured during Mumbai terror attacks, has decided to auction 40 of his marathon medals to raise funds for the fight against COVID-19. Teotia has already sold two medals and has deposited ₹2 lakh received through it in PM-CARES Fund. "I'm...hoping to inspire others to contribute in whatever little way they can," Teotia said.

Headline: 2 arrested for spitting in public place, defying lockdown orders in Rajasthan
Description: The Rajasthan Police has arrested two men for spitting in a public place and violating lockdown norms in Bharatpur district. The two men were chewing tobacco and spat in a public place on Tuesday and they were roaming around without masks, the police said. The state and Central government have banned spitting in public places amid the COVID-19 outbreak.
Text: 2 arrested for spitting in public place, defying lockdown orders in Rajasthan The Rajasthan Police has arrested two men for spitting in a public place and violating lockdown norms in Bharatpur district. The two men were chewing tobacco and spat in a public place on Tuesday and they were roaming around without masks, the police said. The state and Central government have banned spitting in public places amid the COVID-19 outbreak.

Headline: For 1st time in 167 yrs, passenger trains stopped for your safety: Railways
Description: The Ministry of Railways on Thursday tweeted, "Today, 167 years ago with the zeal of 'never to stop', the wheels of the first passenger train from Mumbai to Thane started rolling. For the first time, passenger services are stopped for your safety." It added, "Stay indoor and make the nation victorious." Passenger trains are suspended till May 3 amid lockdown.
Text: For 1st time in 167 yrs, passenger trains stopped for your safety: Railways The Ministry of Railways on Thursday tweeted, "Today, 167 years ago with the zeal of 'never to stop', the wheels of the first passenger train from Mumbai to Thane started rolling. For the first time, passenger services are stopped for your safety." It added, "Stay indoor and make the nation victorious." Passenger trains are suspended till May 3 amid lockdown.

Headline: Guj head constable tests +ve for COVID-19 after nabbing infected theft accused
Description: A 35-year-old head constable in Gujarat's Vadodara tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. He had on Tuesday nabbed a theft accused who had later tested positive for the virus. According to the police, the 52-year-old theft accused along with an accomplice had stolen pan masala worth ₹4,265 from a provision store.
Text: Guj head constable tests +ve for COVID-19 after nabbing infected theft accused A 35-year-old head constable in Gujarat's Vadodara tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. He had on Tuesday nabbed a theft accused who had later tested positive for the virus. According to the police, the 52-year-old theft accused along with an accomplice had stolen pan masala worth ₹4,265 from a provision store.

Headline: 6 injured as Bihar locals attack police sent to spread Covid-19 awareness
Description: The locals of Harsidhi village in Bihar's East Champaran district blocked and attacked a medical and police team that had gone there to spread awareness about coronavirus. SDO Dhirendra Mishra said, "We had received complaints that people were not practising social distancing and not following the lockdown guidelines." Five police personnel and a health official were injured in the attack.
Text: 6 injured as Bihar locals attack police sent to spread Covid-19 awareness The locals of Harsidhi village in Bihar's East Champaran district blocked and attacked a medical and police team that had gone there to spread awareness about coronavirus. SDO Dhirendra Mishra said, "We had received complaints that people were not practising social distancing and not following the lockdown guidelines." Five police personnel and a health official were injured in the attack.

Headline: Lockdown is like pause button, will not defeat virus: Rahul Gandhi
Description: Addressing the media via video on Thursday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "I have been speaking to experts...A lockdown is like a pause button, it is in no way a solution to the problem." Rahul added, "Lockdown allows time and space to put in medical resources, ramp up testing, prepare hospitals...to fight the virus before it picks up again."
Text: Lockdown is like pause button, will not defeat virus: Rahul Gandhi Addressing the media via video on Thursday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "I have been speaking to experts...A lockdown is like a pause button, it is in no way a solution to the problem." Rahul added, "Lockdown allows time and space to put in medical resources, ramp up testing, prepare hospitals...to fight the virus before it picks up again."

Headline: 19 more Covid-19 cases in Agra, total reaches 167 in district
Description: Nineteen more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Agra, taking the total number of cases in the district to 167, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh has stated. There have been a total of 735 positive cases in Uttar Pradesh, of which 51 people have recovered and 11 people have lost their lives.
Text: 19 more Covid-19 cases in Agra, total reaches 167 in district Nineteen more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Agra, taking the total number of cases in the district to 167, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh has stated. There have been a total of 735 positive cases in Uttar Pradesh, of which 51 people have recovered and 11 people have lost their lives.

Headline: Pune Police make lockdown violators do yoga on street
Description: The Pune Police on Thursday said they made people perform yoga in the middle of the street in Bibvewadi area for violating the lockdown to go for a morning walk. A video also shows police personnel making the violators exercise on the road. The police also registered FIRs against some people for violating the lockdown.
Text: Pune Police make lockdown violators do yoga on street The Pune Police on Thursday said they made people perform yoga in the middle of the street in Bibvewadi area for violating the lockdown to go for a morning walk. A video also shows police personnel making the violators exercise on the road. The police also registered FIRs against some people for violating the lockdown.

Headline: Europe remains 'in the eye' of coronavirus storm: WHO
Description: The World Health Organization's European office on Thursday said that despite some "optimistic signs" in some of the countries worst hit by the coronavirus, the number of cases was rising and approaching one million in the continent alone. "We remain in the eye of the storm," WHO Regional Director for Europe Hans Kluge said.
Text: Europe remains 'in the eye' of coronavirus storm: WHO The World Health Organization's European office on Thursday said that despite some "optimistic signs" in some of the countries worst hit by the coronavirus, the number of cases was rising and approaching one million in the continent alone. "We remain in the eye of the storm," WHO Regional Director for Europe Hans Kluge said.

Headline: Zoom not a safe platform for video conferencing, says govt; issues guidelines
Description: The government has said Zoom is not a secure and safe platform for video conferencing for private individuals. Earlier, CERT-In had stated that unguarded usage of the digital application can be vulnerable to cyber attacks, including leakage of sensitive office information to criminals. The government issued guidelines for those who still want to use the app, explaining security configurations.
Text: Zoom not a safe platform for video conferencing, says govt; issues guidelines The government has said Zoom is not a secure and safe platform for video conferencing for private individuals. Earlier, CERT-In had stated that unguarded usage of the digital application can be vulnerable to cyber attacks, including leakage of sensitive office information to criminals. The government issued guidelines for those who still want to use the app, explaining security configurations.

Headline: Consulted 12-13 doctors in family: Kumaraswamy defends son's wedding tomorrow
Description: Former Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy defended his decision to go ahead with son Nikhil's wedding amid the lockdown, saying he consulted 12-13 doctors in his family. "Ramanagara district is Green Zone and Bengaluru was declared Red Zone. So, I had decided to get the marriage done in Ramanagara itself," he said. The wedding is scheduled to take place tomorrow.
Text: Consulted 12-13 doctors in family: Kumaraswamy defends son's wedding tomorrow Former Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy defended his decision to go ahead with son Nikhil's wedding amid the lockdown, saying he consulted 12-13 doctors in his family. "Ramanagara district is Green Zone and Bengaluru was declared Red Zone. So, I had decided to get the marriage done in Ramanagara itself," he said. The wedding is scheduled to take place tomorrow.

Headline: UP police perform last rites of woman who had no family
Description: Police officers in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur performed the last rites of an elderly woman who passed away on Wednesday. Saharanpur SSP Dinesh Kumar Prabhu tweeted, "Since she had no one left in her family, my men became her family and carried her for cremation." The woman, whose husband had passed away four years ago, had been unwell for some time.
Text: UP police perform last rites of woman who had no family Police officers in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur performed the last rites of an elderly woman who passed away on Wednesday. Saharanpur SSP Dinesh Kumar Prabhu tweeted, "Since she had no one left in her family, my men became her family and carried her for cremation." The woman, whose husband had passed away four years ago, had been unwell for some time.

Headline: We'll do no such thing: Govt on news claiming it'll drop money from helicopters
Description: PIB Fact Check has rubbished news reports claiming the government will drop money from helicopters amid the lockdown and said, "The government will do no such thing". Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao recently advocated the use of 'helicopter money'. Under this policy, a central bank creates money and gives it directly to households or to the government.
Text: We'll do no such thing: Govt on news claiming it'll drop money from helicopters PIB Fact Check has rubbished news reports claiming the government will drop money from helicopters amid the lockdown and said, "The government will do no such thing". Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao recently advocated the use of 'helicopter money'. Under this policy, a central bank creates money and gives it directly to households or to the government.

Headline: 19-yr-old pizza delivery boy in Delhi tests COVID-19 +ve, 72 houses quarantined
Description: As many as 72 houses across South Delhi have been put under quarantine after a 19-year-old pizza delivery employee tested positive for COVID-19. Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said all the people in the 72 houses will be tested in next 2-3 days. He further said that 17 other delivery boys linked with him have been placed under institutional quarantine.
Text: 19-yr-old pizza delivery boy in Delhi tests COVID-19 +ve, 72 houses quarantined As many as 72 houses across South Delhi have been put under quarantine after a 19-year-old pizza delivery employee tested positive for COVID-19. Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said all the people in the 72 houses will be tested in next 2-3 days. He further said that 17 other delivery boys linked with him have been placed under institutional quarantine.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana reaches 650; death toll at 18
Description: Telangana has reported six new coronavirus cases till 8:30 pm on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 650, which includes 514 active cases. Eight coronavirus patients were cured and discharged in the state today, taking the total number of cured patients to 118. The death toll from coronavirus in Telangana stands at 18.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Telangana reaches 650; death toll at 18 Telangana has reported six new coronavirus cases till 8:30 pm on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 650, which includes 514 active cases. Eight coronavirus patients were cured and discharged in the state today, taking the total number of cured patients to 118. The death toll from coronavirus in Telangana stands at 18.

Headline: Delhi reports 17 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 1,578; death toll at 32
Description: Delhi reported as many as 17 new cases of coronavirus in last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 1,578. Meanwhile, the death toll in Delhi is 32. A total of 41 patients have recovered or migrated. Further, 16,605 tests have been conducted in Delhi, out of which 13,865 came as negative.
Text: Delhi reports 17 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 1,578; death toll at 32 Delhi reported as many as 17 new cases of coronavirus in last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 1,578. Meanwhile, the death toll in Delhi is 32. A total of 41 patients have recovered or migrated. Further, 16,605 tests have been conducted in Delhi, out of which 13,865 came as negative.

Headline: Uttar Pradesh reports 67 new coronavirus cases, state total rises to 727
Description: Uttar Pradesh has reported 67 new coronavirus cases in various districts till 6 pm on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 727. Seven coronavirus patients were declared recovered and discharged today, taking the total number of recovered cases to 57. Notably, Uttar Pradesh has reported 11 deaths due to coronavirus so far.
Text: Uttar Pradesh reports 67 new coronavirus cases, state total rises to 727 Uttar Pradesh has reported 67 new coronavirus cases in various districts till 6 pm on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 727. Seven coronavirus patients were declared recovered and discharged today, taking the total number of recovered cases to 57. Notably, Uttar Pradesh has reported 11 deaths due to coronavirus so far.

Headline: 17 arrested in UP's Moradabad for attack on quarantine team
Description: Seventeen people were arrested in UP's Moradabad after health workers and policemen were attacked while trying to quarantine the family of a patient who died of coronavirus. Three policemen, three medical workers and a doctor were injured in the attack. CM Yogi Adityanath said NSA would be invoked and the cost of property damage would be recovered from the accused.
Text: 17 arrested in UP's Moradabad for attack on quarantine team Seventeen people were arrested in UP's Moradabad after health workers and policemen were attacked while trying to quarantine the family of a patient who died of coronavirus. Three policemen, three medical workers and a doctor were injured in the attack. CM Yogi Adityanath said NSA would be invoked and the cost of property damage would be recovered from the accused.

Headline: Robots to serve food to COVID-19 patients at 2 hospitals in Jharkhand
Description: In Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, robots will serve food and give medicine to COVID-19 patients at two hospitals in order to protect doctors and health workers from getting the virus. The remote-controlled COBOT-Robotics is developed by District Deputy Development Commissioner Aditya Ranjan and will provide food and medicine to patients without human intervention.
Text: Robots to serve food to COVID-19 patients at 2 hospitals in Jharkhand In Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, robots will serve food and give medicine to COVID-19 patients at two hospitals in order to protect doctors and health workers from getting the virus. The remote-controlled COBOT-Robotics is developed by District Deputy Development Commissioner Aditya Ranjan and will provide food and medicine to patients without human intervention.

Headline: Mizoram Class 12 remaining exams to resume on April 22: State govt
Description: Mizoram government has decided to resume examination for Class 12 from April 22, state Education Minister Lalchhandama Ralte said on Wednesday. "The examination will...continue till April 24 in three remaining subjects in 84 centres across the state," Ralte added. The state government has also launched virtual classes on TV to bridge the gap in the education system, he further said.
Text: Mizoram Class 12 remaining exams to resume on April 22: State govt Mizoram government has decided to resume examination for Class 12 from April 22, state Education Minister Lalchhandama Ralte said on Wednesday. "The examination will...continue till April 24 in three remaining subjects in 84 centres across the state," Ralte added. The state government has also launched virtual classes on TV to bridge the gap in the education system, he further said.

Headline: Report says PM didn't consult 21-member taskforce over lockdown, ICMR denies
Description: A news magazine has claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not consult the 21-member scientific coronavirus taskforce before extending the lockdown. "The fact is that the task force met 14 times in the last month and all decisions taken involve the members of the task force," the ICMR clarified. "Please avoid such conjectures," it added.
Text: Report says PM didn't consult 21-member taskforce over lockdown, ICMR denies A news magazine has claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not consult the 21-member scientific coronavirus taskforce before extending the lockdown. "The fact is that the task force met 14 times in the last month and all decisions taken involve the members of the task force," the ICMR clarified. "Please avoid such conjectures," it added.

Headline: Hundreds of migrant workers gather in Surat for 2nd consecutive day
Description: About 300 migrant workers gathered in Pandol industrial area in Surat at around 4 pm over "some petty issues related to the food being served to them", said Assistant Commissioner of Police DJ Chavda. Hundreds of migrant workers had gathered on Tuesday too in Varachha area of the city demanding that they be allowed to go to their native states.
Text: Hundreds of migrant workers gather in Surat for 2nd consecutive day About 300 migrant workers gathered in Pandol industrial area in Surat at around 4 pm over "some petty issues related to the food being served to them", said Assistant Commissioner of Police DJ Chavda. Hundreds of migrant workers had gathered on Tuesday too in Varachha area of the city demanding that they be allowed to go to their native states.

Headline: Which states and Union Territories have the most coronavirus hotspot districts?
Description: The government has identified 170 coronavirus hotspot districts, where the number of cases is high. Tamil Nadu has the most number of hotspot districts (22) and is followed by Maharashtra (14). Further, Uttar Pradesh has 13, Rajasthan has 12, Andhra Pradesh has 11 and Delhi has 10 hotspot districts. J&K, Karnataka and Punjab have eight hotspot districts each.
Text: Which states and Union Territories have the most coronavirus hotspot districts? The government has identified 170 coronavirus hotspot districts, where the number of cases is high. Tamil Nadu has the most number of hotspot districts (22) and is followed by Maharashtra (14). Further, Uttar Pradesh has 13, Rajasthan has 12, Andhra Pradesh has 11 and Delhi has 10 hotspot districts. J&K, Karnataka and Punjab have eight hotspot districts each.

Headline: 25 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, state's total reaches 1,101
Description: Rajasthan Health Department said 25 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in the state on Thursday. The health department added that out of the 25 cases, one has been reported from Ajmer, one from Bikaner, two from Jhunjhunu, 10 from Jodhpur and 11 from Tonk. With this, the total number of positive cases in the state has reached 1,101.
Text: 25 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, state's total reaches 1,101 Rajasthan Health Department said 25 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in the state on Thursday. The health department added that out of the 25 cases, one has been reported from Ajmer, one from Bikaner, two from Jhunjhunu, 10 from Jodhpur and 11 from Tonk. With this, the total number of positive cases in the state has reached 1,101.

Headline: Kerala man carries ill father in arms for 1 km after police stops auto
Description: A man in Kerala had to carry his ailing father in arms for around one kilometre after the auto-rickshaw carrying them was allegedly stopped by police, citing lockdown guidelines. The man has alleged that even after he produced hospital documents, police refused to let him pass. The man was reportedly taking his father back home when the incident took place.
Text: Kerala man carries ill father in arms for 1 km after police stops auto A man in Kerala had to carry his ailing father in arms for around one kilometre after the auto-rickshaw carrying them was allegedly stopped by police, citing lockdown guidelines. The man has alleged that even after he produced hospital documents, police refused to let him pass. The man was reportedly taking his father back home when the incident took place.

Headline: Medical staff to work every alternate week at state-run hospitals: Mamata
Description: Doctors, nurses and other medical staff in state-run hospitals in West Bengal will get a week-long holiday every alternate week, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Wednesday. "The doctors, nurses and other medical staff are not getting any rest...This will boost their energy level," she added. Banerjee also holds the portfolio of state health minister.
Text: Medical staff to work every alternate week at state-run hospitals: Mamata Doctors, nurses and other medical staff in state-run hospitals in West Bengal will get a week-long holiday every alternate week, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Wednesday. "The doctors, nurses and other medical staff are not getting any rest...This will boost their energy level," she added. Banerjee also holds the portfolio of state health minister.

Headline: 40 children aged 3 to 17 years test COVID-19 positive in Andhra Pradesh
Description: At least 40 children in the age group of 3 to 17 years have tested positive for COVID-19 in Andhra Pradesh. Officials said all the children contracted the virus from family members who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Delhi's Nizamuddin in March. In Telangana, 25 children tested positive for the virus, a health official said.
Text: 40 children aged 3 to 17 years test COVID-19 positive in Andhra Pradesh At least 40 children in the age group of 3 to 17 years have tested positive for COVID-19 in Andhra Pradesh. Officials said all the children contracted the virus from family members who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Delhi's Nizamuddin in March. In Telangana, 25 children tested positive for the virus, a health official said.

Headline: Patient makes vulgar remarks on female doctor in Delhi hospital; doctors manhandled
Description: In a letter, doctors from Delhi's Lok Nayak Hospital which is treating people with COVID-19, alleged that a patient passed vulgar comments on a female doctor. "When objected upon by the accompanying doctor, the patient gathered a large number of other patients...and started threatening the doctors," the letter added. "The healthcare workers had to...hide inside [the duty room]," it read.
Text: Patient makes vulgar remarks on female doctor in Delhi hospital; doctors manhandled In a letter, doctors from Delhi's Lok Nayak Hospital which is treating people with COVID-19, alleged that a patient passed vulgar comments on a female doctor. "When objected upon by the accompanying doctor, the patient gathered a large number of other patients...and started threatening the doctors," the letter added. "The healthcare workers had to...hide inside [the duty room]," it read.

Headline: Deaths due to coronavirus in India double in 6 days to more than 400
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to 414 after doubling in six days, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Thursday. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases has surged to 12,380 in the country. Out of all the cases, 10,477 cases are active, while 1,489 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated till now.
Text: Deaths due to coronavirus in India double in 6 days to more than 400 The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to 414 after doubling in six days, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Thursday. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases has surged to 12,380 in the country. Out of all the cases, 10,477 cases are active, while 1,489 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated till now.

Headline: UPSC chairman, members take 30% pay cut for 1 year
Description: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) on Wednesday announced that its chairman and members have decided to take a 30% cut in their basic pay for the next year. In addition to this, all officers and staff members of the Commission have volunteered to donate one-day salary to the PM-CARES Fund to support the fight against the coronavirus pandemic.
Text: UPSC chairman, members take 30% pay cut for 1 year The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) on Wednesday announced that its chairman and members have decided to take a 30% cut in their basic pay for the next year. In addition to this, all officers and staff members of the Commission have volunteered to donate one-day salary to the PM-CARES Fund to support the fight against the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: 94 health department officials in Madhya Pradesh have coronavirus
Description: The Madhya Pradesh government on Wednesday said that the number of health department officials and personnel tested positive for COVID-19 in the state has gone up to 94. The health department reported its first case on April 2 when the managing director in the National Health Mission tested positive. On Saturday, the principal secretary in the department also tested positive.
Text: 94 health department officials in Madhya Pradesh have coronavirus The Madhya Pradesh government on Wednesday said that the number of health department officials and personnel tested positive for COVID-19 in the state has gone up to 94. The health department reported its first case on April 2 when the managing director in the National Health Mission tested positive. On Saturday, the principal secretary in the department also tested positive.

Headline: UP govt orders 55 crore Khadi face masks for rural residents
Description: UP government has ordered 55 crore Khadi face masks amid COVID-19 spread. The state government has decided to provide face masks to every rural resident on a no-profit basis, UP's Khadi & Village Industries Minister Sidharth Nath Singh said. "The Khadi department has provided 7 lakh meter Khadi to rural development department, which would get face masks prepared," he added.
Text: UP govt orders 55 crore Khadi face masks for rural residents UP government has ordered 55 crore Khadi face masks amid COVID-19 spread. The state government has decided to provide face masks to every rural resident on a no-profit basis, UP's Khadi & Village Industries Minister Sidharth Nath Singh said. "The Khadi department has provided 7 lakh meter Khadi to rural development department, which would get face masks prepared," he added.

Headline: Amritsar police counsel people violating Covid-19 lockdown
Description: The Amritsar police said they have been counselling people who are violating the coronavirus lockdown. The police stated, "We made such people realise that what they are doing is wrong. We made them understand how this can spread coronavirus. We are doing this on every check post." There are 186 cases of Covid-19 in Punjab.
Text: Amritsar police counsel people violating Covid-19 lockdown The Amritsar police said they have been counselling people who are violating the coronavirus lockdown. The police stated, "We made such people realise that what they are doing is wrong. We made them understand how this can spread coronavirus. We are doing this on every check post." There are 186 cases of Covid-19 in Punjab.

Headline: Trade centre in Chennai converted into 550-bed COVID-19 quarantine ward
Description: In Tamil Nadu, the Greater Chennai Corporation Commissioner G Prakash on Tuesday launched a 550-bed institutional quarantine ward at Nandambakkam Trade Centre Complex. The exhibit hall has been modified into a quarantine ward with isolated cubicles to treat coronavirus patients. These makeshift cubicles come equipped with steel-framed beds, electrical fittings, a table and plastic chairs.
Text: Trade centre in Chennai converted into 550-bed COVID-19 quarantine ward In Tamil Nadu, the Greater Chennai Corporation Commissioner G Prakash on Tuesday launched a 550-bed institutional quarantine ward at Nandambakkam Trade Centre Complex. The exhibit hall has been modified into a quarantine ward with isolated cubicles to treat coronavirus patients. These makeshift cubicles come equipped with steel-framed beds, electrical fittings, a table and plastic chairs.

Headline: UPSC to decide on fresh dates for civil services interviews after May 3
Description: The Union Public Service Commission on Wednesday said it will decide on fresh dates for the remaining Civil Services- 2019 Personality Tests after May 3. It added, "Dates for the Civil Services- 2020 (Prelim), Engineering Services (Main) and the Geologist Services (Main) Examinations had already been announced. Any rescheduling in these examinations...will be notified on the website of the UPSC."
Text: UPSC to decide on fresh dates for civil services interviews after May 3 The Union Public Service Commission on Wednesday said it will decide on fresh dates for the remaining Civil Services- 2019 Personality Tests after May 3. It added, "Dates for the Civil Services- 2020 (Prelim), Engineering Services (Main) and the Geologist Services (Main) Examinations had already been announced. Any rescheduling in these examinations...will be notified on the website of the UPSC."

Headline: Andhra HC quashes order to make English compulsory in state govt schools
Description: Andhra Pradesh High Court has quashed the YSR Congress government's orders which made English medium education compulsory in schools. The court ruled that the government cannot force the students to study only in a particular medium. "The choice of selecting the medium should be left to the students and hence, the existing Telugu medium schools should continue," the court said.
Text: Andhra HC quashes order to make English compulsory in state govt schools Andhra Pradesh High Court has quashed the YSR Congress government's orders which made English medium education compulsory in schools. The court ruled that the government cannot force the students to study only in a particular medium. "The choice of selecting the medium should be left to the students and hence, the existing Telugu medium schools should continue," the court said.

Headline: Stop adding religious colour: India to US panel for sharing 'misguided' reports
Description: India criticised the US Commission on International Religious Freedom for sharing "misguided" reports claiming COVID-19 patients were segregated based on their religion in a hospital in Ahmedabad. "USCIRF must stop adding religious colour to our national goal of fighting the pandemic," MEA Spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said. Gujarat government had called the reports "absolutely baseless".
Text: Stop adding religious colour: India to US panel for sharing 'misguided' reports India criticised the US Commission on International Religious Freedom for sharing "misguided" reports claiming COVID-19 patients were segregated based on their religion in a hospital in Ahmedabad. "USCIRF must stop adding religious colour to our national goal of fighting the pandemic," MEA Spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said. Gujarat government had called the reports "absolutely baseless".

Headline: 50-year-old man in Bhopal accidentally drinks acid stored in beer bottle, dies
Description: A 50-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal died after he accidentally consumed some acid stored in a beer bottle, a police official said. The incident took place on Monday when the man drank the acid mistaking it for beer. His condition soon deteriorated and he was rushed to a hospital, where he died on Wednesday, the official added.
Text: 50-year-old man in Bhopal accidentally drinks acid stored in beer bottle, dies A 50-year-old man in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal died after he accidentally consumed some acid stored in a beer bottle, a police official said. The incident took place on Monday when the man drank the acid mistaking it for beer. His condition soon deteriorated and he was rushed to a hospital, where he died on Wednesday, the official added.

Headline: Rohtak court opens at night, man marries Mexican girl he met on a language app
Description: A court in Haryana's Rohtak was opened on the night of April 13 amid lockdown for a man's marriage, under the Special Marriage Act, to a Mexican girl he met on a language learning app. They met on the app in 2017 and got engaged in 2018. The girl and her mother arrived in India for the wedding in February.
Text: Rohtak court opens at night, man marries Mexican girl he met on a language app A court in Haryana's Rohtak was opened on the night of April 13 amid lockdown for a man's marriage, under the Special Marriage Act, to a Mexican girl he met on a language learning app. They met on the app in 2017 and got engaged in 2018. The girl and her mother arrived in India for the wedding in February.

Headline: Stones pelted at ambulance carrying medical team, police car in UP's Moradabad
Description: Stones were pelted at an ambulance carrying a team of medical personnel and a police car when they went to Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad to escort the family members of a person who had died of COVID-19 to a quarantine facility. Stating that some medical personnel received injuries, SSP Amit Pathak said that strict action will be taken against the accused.
Text: Stones pelted at ambulance carrying medical team, police car in UP's Moradabad Stones were pelted at an ambulance carrying a team of medical personnel and a police car when they went to Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad to escort the family members of a person who had died of COVID-19 to a quarantine facility. Stating that some medical personnel received injuries, SSP Amit Pathak said that strict action will be taken against the accused.

Headline: Tamil Nadu reports 38 new COVID-19 cases, total rises to 1,242
Description: Tamil Nadu has reported 38 new cases of coronavirus on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases to 1,242, the state health department said. Of the total cases, 1,113 came from a single source event at Delhi and their contacts, the department added. The state has tested over 21,000 people for coronavirus and has reported 14 deaths so far.
Text: Tamil Nadu reports 38 new COVID-19 cases, total rises to 1,242 Tamil Nadu has reported 38 new cases of coronavirus on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases to 1,242, the state health department said. Of the total cases, 1,113 came from a single source event at Delhi and their contacts, the department added. The state has tested over 21,000 people for coronavirus and has reported 14 deaths so far.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 71 new coronavirus cases, state total reaches 1,076
Description: Rajasthan reported 71 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases there to 1,076. Out of the 71 cases reported today, 30 were reported from the worst-affected Jaipur district, taking the total number of cases in the district to 483. Kota reported 27 cases, Jodhpur reported 10 cases, Dausa, Jhunjhunu, Nagaur and Tonk reported one case each.
Text: Rajasthan reports 71 new coronavirus cases, state total reaches 1,076 Rajasthan reported 71 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases there to 1,076. Out of the 71 cases reported today, 30 were reported from the worst-affected Jaipur district, taking the total number of cases in the district to 483. Kota reported 27 cases, Jodhpur reported 10 cases, Dausa, Jhunjhunu, Nagaur and Tonk reported one case each.

Headline: Which pvt establishments will be allowed to operate during extended lockdown?
Description: Print and electronic media, including broadcasting, DTH and cable services, will continue to operate. Companies involved in IT and IT-enabled services can function at 50% strength beginning April 20. Hotels, homestays, lodges and motels, which are accomodating tourists and persons stranded due to lockdown, will be allowed to function.
Text: Which pvt establishments will be allowed to operate during extended lockdown? Print and electronic media, including broadcasting, DTH and cable services, will continue to operate. Companies involved in IT and IT-enabled services can function at 50% strength beginning April 20. Hotels, homestays, lodges and motels, which are accomodating tourists and persons stranded due to lockdown, will be allowed to function.

Headline: 1,076 coronavirus cases confirmed in 24 hours, overall recovery rate 11.41%: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Wednesday said that 1,076 coronavirus cases have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He further said that out of all the cases reported till date, 11.41% patients have recovered, adding that, "This rate has been increasing in the past few days."
Text: 1,076 coronavirus cases confirmed in 24 hours, overall recovery rate 11.41%: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Wednesday said that 1,076 coronavirus cases have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He further said that out of all the cases reported till date, 11.41% patients have recovered, adding that, "This rate has been increasing in the past few days."

Headline: Active coronavirus cases in India cross 10,000; death toll reaches 392
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday that the number of active coronavirus cases in India has risen to 10,197. Meanwhile, 392 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total 11,933 cases, 1,344 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 76 foreign nationals.
Text: Active coronavirus cases in India cross 10,000; death toll reaches 392 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday that the number of active coronavirus cases in India has risen to 10,197. Meanwhile, 392 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total 11,933 cases, 1,344 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 76 foreign nationals.

Headline: 1st COVID-19 positive patient of Tripura recovers
Description: Tripura's first COVID-19 positive patient who was under treatment at the GB Hospital of Agartala was discharged on Wednesday, said Debasish Basu, Secretary, Health and Family Welfare Department. The patient was discharged after his three consecutive tests came out negative, Basu added. According to the official data, the country has so far recorded over 11,000  COVID-19 cases.
Text: 1st COVID-19 positive patient of Tripura recovers Tripura's first COVID-19 positive patient who was under treatment at the GB Hospital of Agartala was discharged on Wednesday, said Debasish Basu, Secretary, Health and Family Welfare Department. The patient was discharged after his three consecutive tests came out negative, Basu added. According to the official data, the country has so far recorded over 11,000  COVID-19 cases.

Headline: Odisha's Ganjam imposes ₹500 fine for spitting in public places
Description: Authorities in Odisha's Ganjam district have banned spitting in public places to check the spread of coronavirus and warned that those violating the ban will be fined ₹500. Calling for the use of masks, Ganjam District Collector Vijay Amruta Kulange said, "We have started the initiative to strengthen the fight against coronavirus and to prevent its spread."
Text: Odisha's Ganjam imposes ₹500 fine for spitting in public places Authorities in Odisha's Ganjam district have banned spitting in public places to check the spread of coronavirus and warned that those violating the ban will be fined ₹500. Calling for the use of masks, Ganjam District Collector Vijay Amruta Kulange said, "We have started the initiative to strengthen the fight against coronavirus and to prevent its spread."

Headline: India sees 83% decline in driving, 75% decline in walking: Apple Maps data
Description: Mobility trends released by Apple showed a decline of 83% in driving and 75% decline in walking in India amid coronavirus pandemic. Delhi and Mumbai showed a decline of over 80% in both driving and walking. Apple had released a mobility data trends tool from Apple Maps to help governments and local authorities get anonymous movement data amid coronavirus pandemic.
Text: India sees 83% decline in driving, 75% decline in walking: Apple Maps data Mobility trends released by Apple showed a decline of 83% in driving and 75% decline in walking in India amid coronavirus pandemic. Delhi and Mumbai showed a decline of over 80% in both driving and walking. Apple had released a mobility data trends tool from Apple Maps to help governments and local authorities get anonymous movement data amid coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: UK thanks India as country gets 1st batch of 28 lakh paracetamol packs
Description: UK International Trade Secretary Liz Truss has thanked the officials in India as the first consignment of 28 lakh packets of paracetamol from India is set to be distributed in UK's supermarkets. "This will mean nearly 3 million more packets of paracetamol on British supermarket shelves," said Truss. The shipment followed India's decision to lift export restrictions on essential drugs.
Text: UK thanks India as country gets 1st batch of 28 lakh paracetamol packs UK International Trade Secretary Liz Truss has thanked the officials in India as the first consignment of 28 lakh packets of paracetamol from India is set to be distributed in UK's supermarkets. "This will mean nearly 3 million more packets of paracetamol on British supermarket shelves," said Truss. The shipment followed India's decision to lift export restrictions on essential drugs.

Headline: COVID-19 hasn't entered 400 districts, next 2-3 weeks crucial: Harsh Vardhan
Description: Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan said on Wednesday that coronavirus hasn't entered around 400 districts in India. "We have been able to pinpoint where the virus is," he said in a video conference. "The next two-three weeks are going to be the most crucial in handling the COVID-19 pandemic particularly in India," the Health Minister added.
Text: COVID-19 hasn't entered 400 districts, next 2-3 weeks crucial: Harsh Vardhan Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan said on Wednesday that coronavirus hasn't entered around 400 districts in India. "We have been able to pinpoint where the virus is," he said in a video conference. "The next two-three weeks are going to be the most crucial in handling the COVID-19 pandemic particularly in India," the Health Minister added.

Headline: Shelters, old age homes to remain functional amid extended lockdown
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs has permitted the operation of homes and shelters for children, the disabled, the mentally challenged, and senior citizens, among others, amid the extended lockdown. Further, the MHA has stated that the distribution of food and nutrition once every 15 days at the doorsteps of beneficiaries under the Anganwadi system is to continue.
Text: Shelters, old age homes to remain functional amid extended lockdown The Ministry of Home Affairs has permitted the operation of homes and shelters for children, the disabled, the mentally challenged, and senior citizens, among others, amid the extended lockdown. Further, the MHA has stated that the distribution of food and nutrition once every 15 days at the doorsteps of beneficiaries under the Anganwadi system is to continue.

Headline: Virus transmitting from bats to humans rare event, happens once in 1000 years: ICMR
Description: Indian Council of Medical Research's R Gangakhedkar has said virus transmitting from bats to humans is rare event and happens once in 1,000 years. He added, "As per research in China, it was found that coronavirus might have transmitted to humans due to mutation or bats might have transmitted it to pangolins, from where it might have transmitted to humans."
Text: Virus transmitting from bats to humans rare event, happens once in 1000 years: ICMR Indian Council of Medical Research's R Gangakhedkar has said virus transmitting from bats to humans is rare event and happens once in 1,000 years. He added, "As per research in China, it was found that coronavirus might have transmitted to humans due to mutation or bats might have transmitted it to pangolins, from where it might have transmitted to humans."

Headline: Highway dhabas, truck repair shops to be allowed from April 20
Description: All highway dhabas, truck repair shops and goods traffic will be allowed to operate from April 20, as per the government directive on the relaxation of the lockdown in areas that have not been demarcated 'containment zones'. Further, air transport will be allowed for cargo movement, as well as relief and evacuation.
Text: Highway dhabas, truck repair shops to be allowed from April 20 All highway dhabas, truck repair shops and goods traffic will be allowed to operate from April 20, as per the government directive on the relaxation of the lockdown in areas that have not been demarcated 'containment zones'. Further, air transport will be allowed for cargo movement, as well as relief and evacuation.

Headline: MP govt to deposit ₹1,000 in migrant labourers' bank accounts: CM
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday announced that ₹1,000 would be credited in the accounts of migrant labourers who are stranded in other states due to the lockdown. "In case more money is required, it shall be credited in bank accounts," he said. "In the times of trouble, the government stands in solidarity with you all," Chouhan added.
Text: MP govt to deposit ₹1,000 in migrant labourers' bank accounts: CM Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday announced that ₹1,000 would be credited in the accounts of migrant labourers who are stranded in other states due to the lockdown. "In case more money is required, it shall be credited in bank accounts," he said. "In the times of trouble, the government stands in solidarity with you all," Chouhan added.

Headline: Migrant worker fainted outside my house, spotted through CCTV: Mohammad Shami
Description: Pacer Mohammad Shami has revealed a migrant worker going to Bihar from Rajasthan fainted outside his house in Lucknow. "I saw in my home CCTV camera...So I provided him with food and helped him out," Shami added. "The highway is also near my house so I can see people having a tough time," he further said.
Text: Migrant worker fainted outside my house, spotted through CCTV: Mohammad Shami Pacer Mohammad Shami has revealed a migrant worker going to Bihar from Rajasthan fainted outside his house in Lucknow. "I saw in my home CCTV camera...So I provided him with food and helped him out," Shami added. "The highway is also near my house so I can see people having a tough time," he further said.

Headline: There is no community transmission, we are seeing local outbreaks: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said that there is no community transmission of coronavirus in the country so far. "What we are seeing are some local outbreaks or some clusters," he added. Various containment measures are being taken to stop the chain of transmission in those clusters, he further said.
Text: There is no community transmission, we are seeing local outbreaks: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said that there is no community transmission of coronavirus in the country so far. "What we are seeing are some local outbreaks or some clusters," he added. Various containment measures are being taken to stop the chain of transmission in those clusters, he further said.

Headline: Flight carrying 50,000 PPE kits from China lands in Guwahati, Himanta shares pic
Description: Blue Dart Air Cargo flight carrying medical goods including 50,000 Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits from China's Guangzhou landed in Guwahati today. Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma shared a picture of himself receiving the flight, writing, "Another big reason to cheer! Keeping life first as the motive, we're glad to have imported 50,000 PPE kits from China!"
Text: Flight carrying 50,000 PPE kits from China lands in Guwahati, Himanta shares pic Blue Dart Air Cargo flight carrying medical goods including 50,000 Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits from China's Guangzhou landed in Guwahati today. Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma shared a picture of himself receiving the flight, writing, "Another big reason to cheer! Keeping life first as the motive, we're glad to have imported 50,000 PPE kits from China!"

Headline: 170 districts declared as coronavirus hotspots, 207 non-hotspots so far: Govt
Description: Health Ministry today said the districts are being classified into coronaviurs hotspots, non-hotspots and green zone districts. It added that 170 districts have been declared as hotspots. Further, 207 districts have been declared as non-hotspots, where the government wants to implement cluster containment plan as they could turn into potenial hotspots. Green zone districts are those with no case.
Text: 170 districts declared as coronavirus hotspots, 207 non-hotspots so far: Govt Health Ministry today said the districts are being classified into coronaviurs hotspots, non-hotspots and green zone districts. It added that 170 districts have been declared as hotspots. Further, 207 districts have been declared as non-hotspots, where the government wants to implement cluster containment plan as they could turn into potenial hotspots. Green zone districts are those with no case.

Headline: Arunachal Pradesh's only COVID-19 patient's third test comes negative
Description: Arunachal Pradesh's first and only coronavirus patient on Wednesday tested negative after conducting the third test, state's CM Pema Khandu announced. "He was kept in isolation for 13 days under the observation of doctors. Repeat sample is being collected today again," he tweeted. The man had attended the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin in Delhi.
Text: Arunachal Pradesh's only COVID-19 patient's third test comes negative Arunachal Pradesh's first and only coronavirus patient on Wednesday tested negative after conducting the third test, state's CM Pema Khandu announced. "He was kept in isolation for 13 days under the observation of doctors. Repeat sample is being collected today again," he tweeted. The man had attended the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin in Delhi.

Headline: DRDO develops COVID-19 sample collection booth to cut down on PPEs
Description: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed a COVID Sample Collection Kiosk (COVSACK), costing nearly ₹1 lakh, for taking samples from suspected coronavirus patients. Patient under test walks into the kiosk and a nasal or oral swab is taken by a healthcare professional from outside through the built-in gloves. This reduces the requirement of PPE change by healthcare workers.
Text: DRDO develops COVID-19 sample collection booth to cut down on PPEs Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed a COVID Sample Collection Kiosk (COVSACK), costing nearly ₹1 lakh, for taking samples from suspected coronavirus patients. Patient under test walks into the kiosk and a nasal or oral swab is taken by a healthcare professional from outside through the built-in gloves. This reduces the requirement of PPE change by healthcare workers.

Headline: Man coughs while playing ludo in UP, friend shoots at him after argument
Description: A man was shot at and critically injured in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar district by his friend after an altercation. The altercation happened after the man started coughing while playing ludo. The accused asked him, "Corona dega kya? (Do you want to give me coronavirus?)", before firing at him. "A hunt has been launched to nab the accused," police said.
Text: Man coughs while playing ludo in UP, friend shoots at him after argument A man was shot at and critically injured in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar district by his friend after an altercation. The altercation happened after the man started coughing while playing ludo. The accused asked him, "Corona dega kya? (Do you want to give me coronavirus?)", before firing at him. "A hunt has been launched to nab the accused," police said.

Headline: Surrogate baby born in Surat flown in air ambulance to parents in Bengaluru
Description: A surrogate baby born amid the coronavirus lockdown in a hospital in Gujarat's Surat was flown in an air ambulance to her parents living in Bengaluru. The child was born through IVF on March 29 but her parents met her after 17 days. The doctors were in touch with the parents through video calls since the child's birth.
Text: Surrogate baby born in Surat flown in air ambulance to parents in Bengaluru A surrogate baby born amid the coronavirus lockdown in a hospital in Gujarat's Surat was flown in an air ambulance to her parents living in Bengaluru. The child was born through IVF on March 29 but her parents met her after 17 days. The doctors were in touch with the parents through video calls since the child's birth.

Headline: Mamata must be shown the door for not enforcing lockdown: WB Guv
Description: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has accused the state government of failing to enforce the lockdown and claimed that CM Mamata Banerjee should "be shown the door" for failing to ensure social distancing. Notably, the Union Ministry of Home Affairs has previously issued two advisories asking the West Bengal government to ensure that the lockdown is followed completely.
Text: Mamata must be shown the door for not enforcing lockdown: WB Guv West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has accused the state government of failing to enforce the lockdown and claimed that CM Mamata Banerjee should "be shown the door" for failing to ensure social distancing. Notably, the Union Ministry of Home Affairs has previously issued two advisories asking the West Bengal government to ensure that the lockdown is followed completely.

Headline: Chhattisgarh to adopt pool sample testing for COVID-19: Health Minister
Description: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has said the state has initiated measures to start pool sample testing for coronavirus in at least one of the labs in the next two days. This would help us in increasing testing by "manifold" and will reduce the number of kits used, he added. Chhattisgarh has reported 33 cases of coronavirus so far.
Text: Chhattisgarh to adopt pool sample testing for COVID-19: Health Minister Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has said the state has initiated measures to start pool sample testing for coronavirus in at least one of the labs in the next two days. This would help us in increasing testing by "manifold" and will reduce the number of kits used, he added. Chhattisgarh has reported 33 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: E-commerce firms, their vehicles allowed to operate during extended lockdown
Description: The Ministry of Home Affairs guidelines state that the e-commerce platforms and vehicles used by the operators will be allowed to function from April 20 during the extended lockdown. The guidelines also said that the platforms would require necessary permissions. However, the relaxation will not be applied in containment zones demarcated by the States, UTs or district administrations.
Text: E-commerce firms, their vehicles allowed to operate during extended lockdown The Ministry of Home Affairs guidelines state that the e-commerce platforms and vehicles used by the operators will be allowed to function from April 20 during the extended lockdown. The guidelines also said that the platforms would require necessary permissions. However, the relaxation will not be applied in containment zones demarcated by the States, UTs or district administrations.

Headline: What new guidelines have been issued for workplaces amid extended lockdown?
Description: Government has issued guidelines for workplaces amid extended coronavirus lockdown. The directive states that all workplaces shall have adequate arrangements for temperature screening and provide sanitisers. "Workplaces shall have a gap of one hour between shifts and will stagger the lunch break...to ensure social distancing," it added. Large meetings should be prohibited, the directive stated.
Text: What new guidelines have been issued for workplaces amid extended lockdown? Government has issued guidelines for workplaces amid extended coronavirus lockdown. The directive states that all workplaces shall have adequate arrangements for temperature screening and provide sanitisers. "Workplaces shall have a gap of one hour between shifts and will stagger the lunch break...to ensure social distancing," it added. Large meetings should be prohibited, the directive stated.

Headline: Government offices to reopen with senior staff from April 20
Description: All central ministries and departments and their subordinate offices will start functioning from April 20 with 100% attendance of officials in the rank of Deputy Secretary and above, as per new norms issued by the government on Wednesday. Further, 33% of the rest of the staff are to be present in the offices.
Text: Government offices to reopen with senior staff from April 20 All central ministries and departments and their subordinate offices will start functioning from April 20 with 100% attendance of officials in the rank of Deputy Secretary and above, as per new norms issued by the government on Wednesday. Further, 33% of the rest of the staff are to be present in the offices.

Headline: Aarogya Setu becomes fastest app to reach 5 crore users, beats Pokémon GO
Description: India's COVID-19 contact-tracing app Aarogya Setu has become the world's fastest app to reach 5 crore users, achieving the milestone in 13 days. Of these, 1.1 crore downloads were recorded on Tuesday after PM Modi urged people to install the app in his address to the nation. Aarogya Setu beat 'Pokémon GO', which hit 5 crore downloads in 19 days.
Text: Aarogya Setu becomes fastest app to reach 5 crore users, beats Pokémon GO India's COVID-19 contact-tracing app Aarogya Setu has become the world's fastest app to reach 5 crore users, achieving the milestone in 13 days. Of these, 1.1 crore downloads were recorded on Tuesday after PM Modi urged people to install the app in his address to the nation. Aarogya Setu beat 'Pokémon GO', which hit 5 crore downloads in 19 days.

Headline: 7 new Covid-19 hotspots in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar district
Description: Seven new areas in Gautam Buddha Nagar district in Uttar Pradesh have emerged as Covid-19 hotspots, as per a notice issued by the district administration. The hotspots include Sector 50 Noida and Kulesra Greater Noida. Meanwhile, two other areas have been completely removed from the list of hotspots as they only have one case each.
Text: 7 new Covid-19 hotspots in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar district Seven new areas in Gautam Buddha Nagar district in Uttar Pradesh have emerged as Covid-19 hotspots, as per a notice issued by the district administration. The hotspots include Sector 50 Noida and Kulesra Greater Noida. Meanwhile, two other areas have been completely removed from the list of hotspots as they only have one case each.

Headline: In which cases is movement of people allowed from April 20 amid extended lockdown?
Description: As per government's guidelines for extended lockdown, from April 20, private vehicles for emergency services, including medical care and for procuring essential commodities will be allowed. One passenger besides driver can be permitted in backseat in 4-wheelers. However, in 2-wheelers, only driver will be permitted.
