People going to work and back in exempted categories will also be allowed to move.
Text: In which cases is movement of people allowed from April 20 amid extended lockdown? As per government's guidelines for extended lockdown, from April 20, private vehicles for emergency services, including medical care and for procuring essential commodities will be allowed. One passenger besides driver can be permitted in backseat in 4-wheelers. However, in 2-wheelers, only driver will be permitted. People going to work and back in exempted categories will also be allowed to move.

Headline: Meghalaya's 1st COVID-19 patient dies, 6 of his family members test positive
Description: John L Sailo Ryntathiang, a 69-year-old doctor who was till now the only COVID-19 patient in Meghalaya, died on Wednesday morning, CM Conrad Sangma said. The CM added that six members of the doctor's family have now tested positive for the virus. As per reports, the 69-year-old tested positive for COVID-19 on Monday.
Text: Meghalaya's 1st COVID-19 patient dies, 6 of his family members test positive John L Sailo Ryntathiang, a 69-year-old doctor who was till now the only COVID-19 patient in Meghalaya, died on Wednesday morning, CM Conrad Sangma said. The CM added that six members of the doctor's family have now tested positive for the virus. As per reports, the 69-year-old tested positive for COVID-19 on Monday.

Headline: MGNREGA projects to resume, workers must maintain social distance: Govt
Description: Under the revised guidelines amid extended lockdown, the government has allowed the resumption of projects under MGNREGA. As per guidelines, all necessary precautions such as maintaining social distancing and wearing masks will have to be followed so that the virus does not spread in the rural areas. Irrigation and water conservation works have to be given priority, the guidelines read.
Text: MGNREGA projects to resume, workers must maintain social distance: Govt Under the revised guidelines amid extended lockdown, the government has allowed the resumption of projects under MGNREGA. As per guidelines, all necessary precautions such as maintaining social distancing and wearing masks will have to be followed so that the virus does not spread in the rural areas. Irrigation and water conservation works have to be given priority, the guidelines read.

Headline: Banks and ATMs will remain functional amid extended lockdown: Govt
Description: According to the revised guidelines issued for the extended lockdown, the government has listed out the financial services that can remain functional. RBI and its regulated financial markets and entities, bank branches and ATMs, IT vendors for banking operations, among others will remain functional. Capital and debt markets as notified by SEBI will also remain functional, the guidelines read.
Text: Banks and ATMs will remain functional amid extended lockdown: Govt According to the revised guidelines issued for the extended lockdown, the government has listed out the financial services that can remain functional. RBI and its regulated financial markets and entities, bank branches and ATMs, IT vendors for banking operations, among others will remain functional. Capital and debt markets as notified by SEBI will also remain functional, the guidelines read.

Headline: What is pooled testing, recommended by ICMR to increase coronavirus tests?
Description: ICMR has issued an advisory for using pooled samples for testing of COVID-19 to increase number of tests. Pooled testing algorithm involves PCR screening of a specimen pool comprising multiple individual specimens, followed by individual testing only if a pool screens positive. If there's no positive result, all samples in the pool are considered negative, resulting in substantial cost savings.
Text: What is pooled testing, recommended by ICMR to increase coronavirus tests? ICMR has issued an advisory for using pooled samples for testing of COVID-19 to increase number of tests. Pooled testing algorithm involves PCR screening of a specimen pool comprising multiple individual specimens, followed by individual testing only if a pool screens positive. If there's no positive result, all samples in the pool are considered negative, resulting in substantial cost savings.

Headline: 29 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, total cases now 1,034
Description: Rajasthan Health Department said 29 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in the state till Wednesday morning. Out of the 29 cases, 15 are from Jaipur, seven each are from Jodhpur and Kota, the health department added. With these cases, the total number of positive cases in the state has now increased to 1,034, it further said.
Text: 29 new COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan, total cases now 1,034 Rajasthan Health Department said 29 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in the state till Wednesday morning. Out of the 29 cases, 15 are from Jaipur, seven each are from Jodhpur and Kota, the health department added. With these cases, the total number of positive cases in the state has now increased to 1,034, it further said.

Headline: 5 new COVID-19 cases in Dharavi, total reaches 60: BMC
Description: Five fresh cases of coronavirus have been reported in Mumbai's Dharavi, taking the total number of positive cases in the area to 60, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) stated on Wednesday. The BMC added, "Contact-tracing of high-risk contacts of new patients is under progress." Seven people have died due to the virus in Dharavi.
Text: 5 new COVID-19 cases in Dharavi, total reaches 60: BMC Five fresh cases of coronavirus have been reported in Mumbai's Dharavi, taking the total number of positive cases in the area to 60, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) stated on Wednesday. The BMC added, "Contact-tracing of high-risk contacts of new patients is under progress." Seven people have died due to the virus in Dharavi.

Headline: Reports of separate wards for patients of different religions baseless: Gujarat
Description: Gujarat Health and Family Welfare Department on Wednesday rejected the reports which claimed that there were separate wards for coronavirus patients of different religions in Civil Hospital Ahmedabad. The government said, "Patients are kept in different wards based on their medical condition, severity of the symptoms and age, purely based on the advice of treating doctors."
Text: Reports of separate wards for patients of different religions baseless: Gujarat Gujarat Health and Family Welfare Department on Wednesday rejected the reports which claimed that there were separate wards for coronavirus patients of different religions in Civil Hospital Ahmedabad. The government said, "Patients are kept in different wards based on their medical condition, severity of the symptoms and age, purely based on the advice of treating doctors."

Headline: Gujarat CM self-isolates after MLA he met tests positive for coronavirus
Description: Amid the coronavirus pandemic, Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani on Wednesday self-isolated himself after one of the MLAs he met tested COVID-19 positive. "Medical experts...tested him today and have confirmed that CM has no symptoms for now. But as per safety measures, no outsider is allowed at his residence," said Ashwani Kumar, Secretary to the CM.
Text: Gujarat CM self-isolates after MLA he met tests positive for coronavirus Amid the coronavirus pandemic, Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani on Wednesday self-isolated himself after one of the MLAs he met tested COVID-19 positive. "Medical experts...tested him today and have confirmed that CM has no symptoms for now. But as per safety measures, no outsider is allowed at his residence," said Ashwani Kumar, Secretary to the CM.

Headline: Govt allows IT, IT-enabled services to function with 50% staff from April 20
Description: The government in its new guidelines released on Wednesday stated that all IT, IT-enabled services will be allowed to function from April 20 with up to 50% strength. "Digital economy is critical to the services sector and is important for national growth. Accordingly, e-commerce operations, operations of IT and IT-enabled services...are all permitted activities now," the guidelines read.
Text: Govt allows IT, IT-enabled services to function with 50% staff from April 20 The government in its new guidelines released on Wednesday stated that all IT, IT-enabled services will be allowed to function from April 20 with up to 50% strength. "Digital economy is critical to the services sector and is important for national growth. Accordingly, e-commerce operations, operations of IT and IT-enabled services...are all permitted activities now," the guidelines read.

Headline: Govt gives tips for mental health of elderly amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has released tips for ensuring the mental health of elderly amid coronavirus pandemic. The government asked the people to spend quality time with family, involve in activities like gardening and cooking to help reduce anxiety and spend time listening to music and reading books. It also advised elderly to exercise and do yoga.
Text: Govt gives tips for mental health of elderly amid COVID-19 crisis The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has released tips for ensuring the mental health of elderly amid coronavirus pandemic. The government asked the people to spend quality time with family, involve in activities like gardening and cooking to help reduce anxiety and spend time listening to music and reading books. It also advised elderly to exercise and do yoga.

Headline: Notice to 2 Jaipur hospitals for denying care to patient from hotspot area
Description: Authorities in Rajasthan's Jaipur issued show-cause notices to two hospitals after they allegedly denied medical care to a patient coming from Ramganj, a COVID-19 hotspot area. The hospitals will have to respond to the notice within three days. Strict action will be taken under the National Disaster Management Act and Rajasthan Epidemic Diseases Act, 1957, a senior health official said.
Text: Notice to 2 Jaipur hospitals for denying care to patient from hotspot area Authorities in Rajasthan's Jaipur issued show-cause notices to two hospitals after they allegedly denied medical care to a patient coming from Ramganj, a COVID-19 hotspot area. The hospitals will have to respond to the notice within three days. Strict action will be taken under the National Disaster Management Act and Rajasthan Epidemic Diseases Act, 1957, a senior health official said.

Headline: Govt permits resumption of some industries in rural areas after April 20
Description: The government on Wednesday said it will allow the opening up of some industries in rural areas after April 20 amid the extended lockdown. The government said it will also allow farm activities, construction of roads and buildings, irrigation projects, and works under MNREGA "to provide an impetus to the rural economy".
Text: Govt permits resumption of some industries in rural areas after April 20 The government on Wednesday said it will allow the opening up of some industries in rural areas after April 20 amid the extended lockdown. The government said it will also allow farm activities, construction of roads and buildings, irrigation projects, and works under MNREGA "to provide an impetus to the rural economy".

Headline: Religious places to remain closed, religious gatherings prohibited till May 3
Description: As per the revised guidelines issued for extended lockdown on Wednesday, all religious places will remain closed for public and religious congregations will be strictly prohibited until May 3. In the case of funerals, a gathering of over 20 won't be permitted for the period, the guidelines read. Wearing face cover has been made compulsory in public places and workplaces.
Text: Religious places to remain closed, religious gatherings prohibited till May 3 As per the revised guidelines issued for extended lockdown on Wednesday, all religious places will remain closed for public and religious congregations will be strictly prohibited until May 3. In the case of funerals, a gathering of over 20 won't be permitted for the period, the guidelines read. Wearing face cover has been made compulsory in public places and workplaces.

Headline: Bengaluru Commissioner seeks public opinion on how to manage migrant workers
Description: After thousands of migrant workers gathered at Bandra railway station in Mumbai, Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao  sought opinion from the public on how to  prevent such a situation in Bengaluru. Former Karnataka Chief Secretary Ratna Prabha suggested that these workers could be grouped on the basis of the state they belong to and be engaged in creative activities.
Text: Bengaluru Commissioner seeks public opinion on how to manage migrant workers After thousands of migrant workers gathered at Bandra railway station in Mumbai, Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao  sought opinion from the public on how to  prevent such a situation in Bengaluru. Former Karnataka Chief Secretary Ratna Prabha suggested that these workers could be grouped on the basis of the state they belong to and be engaged in creative activities.

Headline: Over 3,000 jurists, artistes condemn FIR against journo Siddharth Varadarajan
Description: About 3,500 jurists, academics, actors, writers, among others have condemned the UP government and police for filing an FIR against journalist Siddharth Varadarajan. In a joint statement, they called the FIR against Varadarajan an attack on press freedom. "This attack... especially during COVID-19 crisis, endangers not just free speech, but the public's right to information," the statement said.
Text: Over 3,000 jurists, artistes condemn FIR against journo Siddharth Varadarajan About 3,500 jurists, academics, actors, writers, among others have condemned the UP government and police for filing an FIR against journalist Siddharth Varadarajan. In a joint statement, they called the FIR against Varadarajan an attack on press freedom. "This attack... especially during COVID-19 crisis, endangers not just free speech, but the public's right to information," the statement said.

Headline: Man held for social media posts that allegedly led to Bandra migrants' protest
Description: The Navi Mumbai Police has arrested a man named Vinay Dubey, for allegedly instigating migrant workers to protest at Bandra station on Tuesday. Dubey had uploaded a video on social media demanding that the state government arrange trains for migrants to return home. He also tweeted about it and called for a protest if trains aren't arranged till April 18.
Text: Man held for social media posts that allegedly led to Bandra migrants' protest The Navi Mumbai Police has arrested a man named Vinay Dubey, for allegedly instigating migrant workers to protest at Bandra station on Tuesday. Dubey had uploaded a video on social media demanding that the state government arrange trains for migrants to return home. He also tweeted about it and called for a protest if trains aren't arranged till April 18.

Headline: Normal monsoon expected this year, says government
Description: Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary Madhavan Rajeevan said that India will witness a normal monsoon this year. Rajeevan added, "Quantitatively the monsoon rainfall, during the monsoon season 2020, is expected to be 100% of its long period average with an error of +5 or -5% due to model error." The onset of the southwest monsoon over Kerala remains June 1.
Text: Normal monsoon expected this year, says government Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary Madhavan Rajeevan said that India will witness a normal monsoon this year. Rajeevan added, "Quantitatively the monsoon rainfall, during the monsoon season 2020, is expected to be 100% of its long period average with an error of +5 or -5% due to model error." The onset of the southwest monsoon over Kerala remains June 1.

Headline: Let's not cross Laxman Rekha: Actress who played Sita on lockdown
Description: Sharing a video on Instagram on Tuesday, Dipika Chikhlia who played the role of Sita in Ramanand Sagar's TV serial 'Ramayan', reiterated what PM Narendra Modi said about coronavirus lockdown. Dipika called the pandemic an 'agni-pariksha' and the lockdown 'Laxman Rekha' and urged fans to follow the lockdown guidelines. This comes amid 'Ramayan' rerun on Doordarshan during the lockdown.
Text: Let's not cross Laxman Rekha: Actress who played Sita on lockdown Sharing a video on Instagram on Tuesday, Dipika Chikhlia who played the role of Sita in Ramanand Sagar's TV serial 'Ramayan', reiterated what PM Narendra Modi said about coronavirus lockdown. Dipika called the pandemic an 'agni-pariksha' and the lockdown 'Laxman Rekha' and urged fans to follow the lockdown guidelines. This comes amid 'Ramayan' rerun on Doordarshan during the lockdown.

Headline: Cinema halls, malls, gyms and bars to remain closed till May 3
Description: All cinema halls, malls, assembly halls, shopping complexes, gyms, sports complexes, swimming pools, entertainment parks, bars and auditoriums will remain closed till May 3. All educational institutions and coaching centres will continue to remain shut. Taxis, autos and services of cab aggregators are also prohibited. Domestic and international air travel of passengers is also prohibited.
Text: Cinema halls, malls, gyms and bars to remain closed till May 3 All cinema halls, malls, assembly halls, shopping complexes, gyms, sports complexes, swimming pools, entertainment parks, bars and auditoriums will remain closed till May 3. All educational institutions and coaching centres will continue to remain shut. Taxis, autos and services of cab aggregators are also prohibited. Domestic and international air travel of passengers is also prohibited.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Punjab rise to 184, SAS Nagar worst-hit district
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab has risen to 184 after eight more patients were tested positive on Tuesday. SAS Nagar is the worst-hit district in the state with 56 cases and is followed by Jalandhar (25) and Pathankot (22). The total death toll in the state has surged to 13. Four patients are on oxygen support.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Punjab rise to 184, SAS Nagar worst-hit district The total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab has risen to 184 after eight more patients were tested positive on Tuesday. SAS Nagar is the worst-hit district in the state with 56 cases and is followed by Jalandhar (25) and Pathankot (22). The total death toll in the state has surged to 13. Four patients are on oxygen support.

Headline: 51 new cases of coronavirus confirmed in Delhi today, total reaches 1,561
Description: As many as 51 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 1,561. Delhi has reported 30 coronavirus deaths so far, while 16,282 samples have been tested in Delhi so far. Meanwhile, 1,080 cases out of the total 1,561 have been categorised under 'special operations'.
Text: 51 new cases of coronavirus confirmed in Delhi today, total reaches 1,561 As many as 51 new cases of coronavirus were confirmed in Delhi on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 1,561. Delhi has reported 30 coronavirus deaths so far, while 16,282 samples have been tested in Delhi so far. Meanwhile, 1,080 cases out of the total 1,561 have been categorised under 'special operations'.

Headline: When is an area considered a COVID-19 hotspot?
Description: A geographical area where six or more people test positive for coronavirus is considered a COVID-19 hotspot. In such areas, stepping out from home including visits to grocery stores, pharmacies, ATM and bank are prohibited, however, home delivery of groceries and other essentials is allowed. Declaring hotspots helps authorities to identify and treat infected people and prevent community spread.
Text: When is an area considered a COVID-19 hotspot? A geographical area where six or more people test positive for coronavirus is considered a COVID-19 hotspot. In such areas, stepping out from home including visits to grocery stores, pharmacies, ATM and bank are prohibited, however, home delivery of groceries and other essentials is allowed. Declaring hotspots helps authorities to identify and treat infected people and prevent community spread.

Headline: Govt issues new guidelines for extended lockdown; mask made mandatory in workplaces
Description: Government has issued revised guidelines for extended lockdown wherein wearing of face cover has been made compulsory in public places and workplaces. "Spitting in public spaces shall be punishable with fine," the directive added. "There should be...ban on sale of liquor, gutka, tobacco," it read. The directive states that no gathering of 5 or more people will be allowed.
Text: Govt issues new guidelines for extended lockdown; mask made mandatory in workplaces Government has issued revised guidelines for extended lockdown wherein wearing of face cover has been made compulsory in public places and workplaces. "Spitting in public spaces shall be punishable with fine," the directive added. "There should be...ban on sale of liquor, gutka, tobacco," it read. The directive states that no gathering of 5 or more people will be allowed.

Headline: 38 wards declared as coronavirus hotspots across 6 zones of Bengaluru
Description: Bengaluru's local civic body BBMP has identified 38 wards as hotspots across 6 zones in the city. "This number can change depending on whether or not people from other wards test positive in the days to come,” said Randeep Dev, Special Commissioner, BBMP.  In south zone of the city, as many as 12 wards have been identified as hotspots.
Text: 38 wards declared as coronavirus hotspots across 6 zones of Bengaluru Bengaluru's local civic body BBMP has identified 38 wards as hotspots across 6 zones in the city. "This number can change depending on whether or not people from other wards test positive in the days to come,” said Randeep Dev, Special Commissioner, BBMP.  In south zone of the city, as many as 12 wards have been identified as hotspots.

Headline: Maharashtra reports 350 new coronavirus cases in 24 hours, total rises to 2,684
Description: As many as 350 new coronavirus cases were confirmed in Maharashtra in last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,684. The death toll in the state surged to 178 after 18 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. A total of 259  COVID-19 patients have been cured in the state till now.
Text: Maharashtra reports 350 new coronavirus cases in 24 hours, total rises to 2,684 As many as 350 new coronavirus cases were confirmed in Maharashtra in last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 2,684. The death toll in the state surged to 178 after 18 new deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. A total of 259  COVID-19 patients have been cured in the state till now.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 11,000; death toll reaches 377
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 11,439. Meanwhile, 377 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 9,756 cases are active, while 1,306 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 76 foreign nationals.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India cross 11,000; death toll reaches 377 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 11,439. Meanwhile, 377 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 9,756 cases are active, while 1,306 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 76 foreign nationals.

Headline: Which activities are permitted from April 20 during the extended lockdown?
Description: Agriculture activities including fisheries and animal husbandry will be operational. MNREGA works will be allowed with social distancing. All goods traffic, shops for truck repairs and highway dhabas are permitted to function. Other activities that are allowed include IT and ITeS with 50% strength, e-commerce companies, and services provided by electricians, plumbers, carpenters and mechanics.
Text: Which activities are permitted from April 20 during the extended lockdown? Agriculture activities including fisheries and animal husbandry will be operational. MNREGA works will be allowed with social distancing. All goods traffic, shops for truck repairs and highway dhabas are permitted to function. Other activities that are allowed include IT and ITeS with 50% strength, e-commerce companies, and services provided by electricians, plumbers, carpenters and mechanics.

Headline: Manipur govt deposits ₹2,000 each in accounts of locals stranded outside state
Description: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Tuesday said the state government till Monday deposited ₹2,000 each in the bank accounts of about 2,700 locals stranded in different states due to the lockdown. He said almost 17,000 people from Manipur are stranded in different parts of the country. As per the official data, Manipur has so far recorded two COVID-19 cases.
Text: Manipur govt deposits ₹2,000 each in accounts of locals stranded outside state Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Tuesday said the state government till Monday deposited ₹2,000 each in the bank accounts of about 2,700 locals stranded in different states due to the lockdown. He said almost 17,000 people from Manipur are stranded in different parts of the country. As per the official data, Manipur has so far recorded two COVID-19 cases.

Headline: Meghalaya traces 2,000 contacts of state's 1st COVID-19 patient within 18 hrs: CM
Description: Meghalaya has traced 2,000 contacts of the state's first coronavirus patient within 18 hours, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said on Tuesday. "Preliminary investigation suggests one of the relatives of the concerned person had a travel history to one of the infected countries and he was back in Shillong before the 14-day quarantine period was over," Sangma added.
Text: Meghalaya traces 2,000 contacts of state's 1st COVID-19 patient within 18 hrs: CM Meghalaya has traced 2,000 contacts of the state's first coronavirus patient within 18 hours, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said on Tuesday. "Preliminary investigation suggests one of the relatives of the concerned person had a travel history to one of the infected countries and he was back in Shillong before the 14-day quarantine period was over," Sangma added.

Headline: Experts say COVID-19 curve won't flatten before September: Punjab CM
Description: Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh on Tuesday said that he has been informed by the experts that the COVID-19 curve would not flatten in India before the month of September. "We cannot keep people in lockdown till then. But even after the lockdown ends, we will take precautions that the virus does not spread exponentially," he added.
Text: Experts say COVID-19 curve won't flatten before September: Punjab CM Punjab Chief Minister Amarinder Singh on Tuesday said that he has been informed by the experts that the COVID-19 curve would not flatten in India before the month of September. "We cannot keep people in lockdown till then. But even after the lockdown ends, we will take precautions that the virus does not spread exponentially," he added.

Headline: Workers in Bandra expected lockdown to end today: Maha Home Minister
Description: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Tuesday said that the gathering of migrant workers at Bandra station was the result of the "manner in which the (coronavirus) lockdown has been extended". "People stuck in Mumbai were expecting that lockdown will end and they'll be allowed to go home but they were disappointed with PM Narendra Modi's address today," added Deshmukh.
Text: Workers in Bandra expected lockdown to end today: Maha Home Minister Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Tuesday said that the gathering of migrant workers at Bandra station was the result of the "manner in which the (coronavirus) lockdown has been extended". "People stuck in Mumbai were expecting that lockdown will end and they'll be allowed to go home but they were disappointed with PM Narendra Modi's address today," added Deshmukh.

Headline: Coronaviruses found in two bat species in India: ICMR
Description: Researchers of Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) have detected coronaviruses among two species of bats in India, Pteropus and Rousettus, it said in a journal. The study was carried out from samples collected between 2018 and 2019. "Detection of potentially pathogenic CoVs in Indian bats stresses the need for enhanced screening for novel viruses in them," the journal read.
Text: Coronaviruses found in two bat species in India: ICMR Researchers of Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) have detected coronaviruses among two species of bats in India, Pteropus and Rousettus, it said in a journal. The study was carried out from samples collected between 2018 and 2019. "Detection of potentially pathogenic CoVs in Indian bats stresses the need for enhanced screening for novel viruses in them," the journal read.

Headline: Mumbai Police files FIR against 1,000 people over Bandra incident
Description: Mumbai Police has registered an FIR against 800 to 1,000 unidentified people in connection with the gathering of migrants in Bandra in defiance of the lockdown norms, causing a public health scare. A case was registered at Bandra police station under the sections 143, 147, 149, 186, 188 of the IPC and section 3 of The Epidemic Diseases Act.
Text: Mumbai Police files FIR against 1,000 people over Bandra incident Mumbai Police has registered an FIR against 800 to 1,000 unidentified people in connection with the gathering of migrants in Bandra in defiance of the lockdown norms, causing a public health scare. A case was registered at Bandra police station under the sections 143, 147, 149, 186, 188 of the IPC and section 3 of The Epidemic Diseases Act.

Headline: Decline in calls regarding domestic violence in COVID-19 lockdown: DCW
Description: The Delhi Commission For Women (DCW) helpline has seen a decline in the number of calls pertaining to domestic violence and crimes against women during the coronavirus lockdown, the panel said. "No definite conclusion can be drawn as it can be assumed that the victims might be hesitant in reporting the crimes due to fear," the panel added.
Text: Decline in calls regarding domestic violence in COVID-19 lockdown: DCW The Delhi Commission For Women (DCW) helpline has seen a decline in the number of calls pertaining to domestic violence and crimes against women during the coronavirus lockdown, the panel said. "No definite conclusion can be drawn as it can be assumed that the victims might be hesitant in reporting the crimes due to fear," the panel added.

Headline: Lockdown extension in India's interest, will be strictly enforced: Yogi
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday welcomed the extension of the lockdown till May 3. Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Kumar Awasthi said, "The CM said the extension is in the interest of the health and future of the country. He said the lockdown will be strictly enforced in UP and 23 crore people of the state will defeat coronavirus."
Text: Lockdown extension in India's interest, will be strictly enforced: Yogi UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday welcomed the extension of the lockdown till May 3. Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Kumar Awasthi said, "The CM said the extension is in the interest of the health and future of the country. He said the lockdown will be strictly enforced in UP and 23 crore people of the state will defeat coronavirus."

Headline: 69 pregnant women put in home quarantine after radiologist tests COVID-19 +ve
Description: Pune district authorities have issued home quarantine orders for 69 pregnant women from rural areas after their radiologist tested positive for coronavirus. "The pregnant women are asymptomatic and we've given them strict instructions about home quarantine," Ayush Prasad, CEO of Pune Zilla Parishad said. The radiologist, who is in his 30s, is stable, doctors said.
Text: 69 pregnant women put in home quarantine after radiologist tests COVID-19 +ve Pune district authorities have issued home quarantine orders for 69 pregnant women from rural areas after their radiologist tested positive for coronavirus. "The pregnant women are asymptomatic and we've given them strict instructions about home quarantine," Ayush Prasad, CEO of Pune Zilla Parishad said. The radiologist, who is in his 30s, is stable, doctors said.

Headline: Govt shares tips to clean and sanitise home-made masks every day
Description: Government shared tips suggested by K VijayRaghavan, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India, to sanitise home-made masks. "Wash mask with soap and warm water, leave it to dry in the Sun for at least five hours," guidelines said. "If there's no access to Sun, add salt to water and boil mask in it for 15 minutes," it added.
Text: Govt shares tips to clean and sanitise home-made masks every day Government shared tips suggested by K VijayRaghavan, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India, to sanitise home-made masks. "Wash mask with soap and warm water, leave it to dry in the Sun for at least five hours," guidelines said. "If there's no access to Sun, add salt to water and boil mask in it for 15 minutes," it added.

Headline: Don't believe rumours about bus arrangements: Kejriwal to migrant workers
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday appealed to migrant workers to follow coronavirus lockdown orders till May 3 by staying where they are. Kejriwal urged them to not fall prey to rumours about bus arrangements for travelling to their home states. He added that the government has made adequate arrangements to provide food, medicines and essentials to everyone.
Text: Don't believe rumours about bus arrangements: Kejriwal to migrant workers Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday appealed to migrant workers to follow coronavirus lockdown orders till May 3 by staying where they are. Kejriwal urged them to not fall prey to rumours about bus arrangements for travelling to their home states. He added that the government has made adequate arrangements to provide food, medicines and essentials to everyone.

Headline: Navi Mumbai Police vans turned into mobile sanitisation units
Description: The Navi Mumbai Police recently tweeted that it has converted a few force vans into mobile sanitisation hubs for its personnel. The police force has also been helping authorities in the distribution of food, medicines and other essentials. Meanwhile, on Tuesday, the Navi Mumbai Police Commissioner had ordered a preliminary medical examination of police personnel deployed at certain check posts.
Text: Navi Mumbai Police vans turned into mobile sanitisation units The Navi Mumbai Police recently tweeted that it has converted a few force vans into mobile sanitisation hubs for its personnel. The police force has also been helping authorities in the distribution of food, medicines and other essentials. Meanwhile, on Tuesday, the Navi Mumbai Police Commissioner had ordered a preliminary medical examination of police personnel deployed at certain check posts.

Headline: 76 new COVID-19 cases reported in Indore, total cases rise to 438
Description: With 76 new COVID-19 cases reported on Tuesday, the total number of positive cases in Madhya Pradesh's Indore reached 438. Two COVID-19 deaths were also reported, taking the district's toll to 37, Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia said. However, 11 out of 76 patients are from other regions and have tested positive here, a medical official said.
Text: 76 new COVID-19 cases reported in Indore, total cases rise to 438 With 76 new COVID-19 cases reported on Tuesday, the total number of positive cases in Madhya Pradesh's Indore reached 438. Two COVID-19 deaths were also reported, taking the district's toll to 37, Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia said. However, 11 out of 76 patients are from other regions and have tested positive here, a medical official said.

Headline: Pak's attack on Indian fishing boats contravention of established norms: India
Description:
India on Tuesday said that Pakistani maritime forces carried out an attack on two Indian boats off the coast of Gujarat two days ago in "contravention of all established norms and practices". 
An Indian fisherman was injured in the attack. The Ministry of External Affairs asked Pakistan to instruct its forces to refrain from such acts of "unprovoked violence".
Text:
Pak's attack on Indian fishing boats contravention of established norms: India India on Tuesday said that Pakistani maritime forces carried out an attack on two Indian boats off the coast of Gujarat two days ago in "contravention of all established norms and practices". 
An Indian fisherman was injured in the attack. The Ministry of External Affairs asked Pakistan to instruct its forces to refrain from such acts of "unprovoked violence".

Headline: 60 held in J'khand for spreading rumours, hatred on social media amid lockdown
Description: Jharkhand Police has booked 118 people for allegedly spreading rumours and hatred on social media amid the nationwide lockdown, DGP Mandava V Rao tweeted on Tuesday. Of the 118, 60 people have been sent to jail, the officer added. "In our fight against coronavirus pandemic, we have been systematically eradicating this hate virus on social media," Rao said.
Text: 60 held in J'khand for spreading rumours, hatred on social media amid lockdown Jharkhand Police has booked 118 people for allegedly spreading rumours and hatred on social media amid the nationwide lockdown, DGP Mandava V Rao tweeted on Tuesday. Of the 118, 60 people have been sent to jail, the officer added. "In our fight against coronavirus pandemic, we have been systematically eradicating this hate virus on social media," Rao said.

Headline: Bihar CM orders door-to-door screening in COVID-19 affected districts
Description: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Tuesday directed officials to start door-to-door screening in Siwan, Begusarai, Nalanda and Nawada districts to identify coronavirus infected people. The door-to-door screening will also be carried out in a three-kilometre radius of the residence of the 66 COVID- 19 positive patients of the state, he said.
Text: Bihar CM orders door-to-door screening in COVID-19 affected districts Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Tuesday directed officials to start door-to-door screening in Siwan, Begusarai, Nalanda and Nawada districts to identify coronavirus infected people. The door-to-door screening will also be carried out in a three-kilometre radius of the residence of the 66 COVID- 19 positive patients of the state, he said.

Headline: 6 arrested for illegally ferrying 498 liquor bottles in Andhra Pradesh
Description: During a search operation carried out in Janardhanavaram village in Andhra Pradesh, police seized 498 liquor bottles and arrested 6 persons. "We received a tip-off about liquor bottles being transported illegally. Accordingly, our team went to a place in Janardhanavaram village at around 4 am," a police official said. The three motorcycles used by the accused were also seized.
Text: 6 arrested for illegally ferrying 498 liquor bottles in Andhra Pradesh During a search operation carried out in Janardhanavaram village in Andhra Pradesh, police seized 498 liquor bottles and arrested 6 persons. "We received a tip-off about liquor bottles being transported illegally. Accordingly, our team went to a place in Janardhanavaram village at around 4 am," a police official said. The three motorcycles used by the accused were also seized.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India crosses 350, cases rise to 10,815
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 10,815, while the death toll has surged to 353. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 1,190. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 9,272.
Text: Coronavirus death toll in India crosses 350, cases rise to 10,815  The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 10,815, while the death toll has surged to 353. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 1,190. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 9,272.

Headline: Total 657 coronavirus cases reported in Uttar Pradesh, death toll rises to 8
Description: Uttar Pradesh has reported a total of 657 coronavirus cases, said state Principal Secretary (Health), Amit Mohan Prasad on Tuesday. Three more people died of the virus in UP, taking the state's coronavirus death toll to eight. Forty-nine COVID-19 patients have been cured and discharged in the state, Prasad added.
Text: Total 657 coronavirus cases reported in Uttar Pradesh, death toll rises to 8 Uttar Pradesh has reported a total of 657 coronavirus cases, said state Principal Secretary (Health), Amit Mohan Prasad on Tuesday. Three more people died of the virus in UP, taking the state's coronavirus death toll to eight. Forty-nine COVID-19 patients have been cured and discharged in the state, Prasad added.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 969, Jaipur worst-hit with 441 cases
Description: Rajasthan has reported 72 new coronavirus cases till 2 pm on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 969. Out of the 72 cases reported today, 71 were reported from the worst-affected Jaipur district, taking the total number of cases in the district to 441. The other COVID-19 positive case was reported from Jhunjhunu district.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Rajasthan reach 969, Jaipur worst-hit with 441 cases Rajasthan has reported 72 new coronavirus cases till 2 pm on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 969. Out of the 72 cases reported today, 71 were reported from the worst-affected Jaipur district, taking the total number of cases in the district to 441. The other COVID-19 positive case was reported from Jhunjhunu district.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka rises to 260; death toll at 10
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has risen to 260, the state health department said on Tuesday. The death toll from the virus in Karnataka has risen to 10, while 71 people have been discharged from the hospital. Bengaluru Urban district has reported the highest number of cases at 69, while Mysuru has reported 48 cases.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka rises to 260; death toll at 10 The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has risen to 260, the state health department said on Tuesday. The death toll from the virus in Karnataka has risen to 10, while 71 people have been discharged from the hospital. Bengaluru Urban district has reported the highest number of cases at 69, while Mysuru has reported 48 cases.

Headline: Tamil Nadu reports 31 new COVID-19 cases, lowest daily increase in 15 days
Description: Tamil Nadu reported its lowest daily increase in coronavirus cases in 15 days as 31 more tested positive on Tuesday, taking the total state tally to 1,204. The number of children below 10 years of age having COVID-19 in the state is 33. As many as 81 coronavirus patients in the state have been discharged while 12 have died.
Text: Tamil Nadu reports 31 new COVID-19 cases, lowest daily increase in 15 days Tamil Nadu reported its lowest daily increase in coronavirus cases in 15 days as 31 more tested positive on Tuesday, taking the total state tally to 1,204. The number of children below 10 years of age having COVID-19 in the state is 33. As many as 81 coronavirus patients in the state have been discharged while 12 have died.

Headline: He was collecting milk for dogs: Police on video of man collecting milk from road
Description: A video of a man collecting milk spilt on the road being consumed by stray dogs amid lockdown in Uttar Pradesh's Agra recently went viral. The SHO of Etmaduddaula police station, Udayveer Singh Malik, told Hindustan Times that the man, believed to be mentally unstable, is fond of feeding the dogs and was collecting milk to feed the stray dogs.
Text: He was collecting milk for dogs: Police on video of man collecting milk from road A video of a man collecting milk spilt on the road being consumed by stray dogs amid lockdown in Uttar Pradesh's Agra recently went viral. The SHO of Etmaduddaula police station, Udayveer Singh Malik, told Hindustan Times that the man, believed to be mentally unstable, is fond of feeding the dogs and was collecting milk to feed the stray dogs.

Headline: PM Modi's lockdown address like Hamlet without Prince of Denmark: Congress
Description: Congress National Spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi's address saying it was "hollow on specifics". "PM's address without single specific and without guidelines is like Hamlet without Prince of Denmark," said Singhvi on Twitter. "No financial package, no details, no concrete item (in PM's address). Lockdown is good but can't be (an) end in itself," he added.
Text: PM Modi's lockdown address like Hamlet without Prince of Denmark: Congress Congress National Spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi's address saying it was "hollow on specifics". "PM's address without single specific and without guidelines is like Hamlet without Prince of Denmark," said Singhvi on Twitter. "No financial package, no details, no concrete item (in PM's address). Lockdown is good but can't be (an) end in itself," he added.

Headline: Hundreds of migrant labourers gather in Bandra demanding to go back; dispersed
Description: Hundreds of migrant labourers gathered in Mumbai's Bandra, demanding permission to return to their native states on Tuesday. They were later dispersed after police and local leaders intervened and asked them to vacate. Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray blamed the Centre for the incident, saying it is unable to take a call on arranging a way back home for migrant labourers.
Text: Hundreds of migrant labourers gather in Bandra demanding to go back; dispersed Hundreds of migrant labourers gathered in Mumbai's Bandra, demanding permission to return to their native states on Tuesday. They were later dispersed after police and local leaders intervened and asked them to vacate. Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray blamed the Centre for the incident, saying it is unable to take a call on arranging a way back home for migrant labourers.

Headline: Unacceptable: Harbhajan Singh on migrant workers gathering at Bandra station
Description: Migrant workers gathered at Bandra railway station in Mumbai, demanding transportation facilities to return to their native places after lockdown was extended till May 3. Reacting to it, Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Curfew is the only option to keep everyone inside..what happened in Bandra today is unacceptable.. people not understanding the situation..putting their life and many others in danger."
Text: Unacceptable: Harbhajan Singh on migrant workers gathering at Bandra station Migrant workers gathered at Bandra railway station in Mumbai, demanding transportation facilities to return to their native places after lockdown was extended till May 3. Reacting to it, Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Curfew is the only option to keep everyone inside..what happened in Bandra today is unacceptable.. people not understanding the situation..putting their life and many others in danger."

Headline: Not just praise, states need monetary aid: Kerala Minister on PM's address
Description: Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi for not announcing any additional financial package to help states deal with coronavirus outbreak. "PM, in his address, praised the states for effective dealing of [COVID-19]. States just don't require praise alone, but financial assistance," said Isaac. States are forced to cut salaries and halt development, he added.
Text: Not just praise, states need monetary aid: Kerala Minister on PM's address Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi for not announcing any additional financial package to help states deal with coronavirus outbreak. "PM, in his address, praised the states for effective dealing of [COVID-19]. States just don't require praise alone, but financial assistance," said Isaac. States are forced to cut salaries and halt development, he added.

Headline: India to be fastest growing major economy, grow 1.9% in FY21: IMF
Description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has projected India to be the world's fastest-growing major economy with a 1.9% growth in 2020-21. It predicted growth of 1.2% for China this year, the slowest expansion in more than four decades. The Washington-based lender forecast India to bounce back next fiscal with 7.4% growth while China is expected to grow 9.2% in 2021.
Text: India to be fastest growing major economy, grow 1.9% in FY21: IMF The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has projected India to be the world's fastest-growing major economy with a 1.9% growth in 2020-21. It predicted growth of 1.2% for China this year, the slowest expansion in more than four decades. The Washington-based lender forecast India to bounce back next fiscal with 7.4% growth while China is expected to grow 9.2% in 2021.

Headline: Could've been done through a single tweet: Owaisi on PM's address
Description: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi saying his addresses to the nation "are things that can be done through a single tweet". PM Modi has "ignored plight of a vast majority of Indians" by extending coronavirus lockdown, said Owaisi. "A lockdown without thinking about the hungry and deprived is cruelty of the highest form," he added.
Text: Could've been done through a single tweet: Owaisi on PM's address AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi saying his addresses to the nation "are things that can be done through a single tweet". PM Modi has "ignored plight of a vast majority of Indians" by extending coronavirus lockdown, said Owaisi. "A lockdown without thinking about the hungry and deprived is cruelty of the highest form," he added.

Headline: Lockdown extension a necessity, let's cooperate with authorities: Omar
Description: Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Tuesday reacted to PM Narendra Modi's announcement of lockdown extension by saying, "Given the threat we face from COVID-19, it's a necessity." "Let's do everything we can to cooperate with authorities to avoid further extension in May," said Omar. He also urged people to help the society's poor and weaker sections "financially or otherwise".
Text: Lockdown extension a necessity, let's cooperate with authorities: Omar Former J&K CM Omar Abdullah on Tuesday reacted to PM Narendra Modi's announcement of lockdown extension by saying, "Given the threat we face from COVID-19, it's a necessity." "Let's do everything we can to cooperate with authorities to avoid further extension in May," said Omar. He also urged people to help the society's poor and weaker sections "financially or otherwise".

Headline: Such events weaken fight against COVID-19: Shah to Uddhav over Bandra incident
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah called Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and expressed concern after hundreds of migrant workers protested at Mumbai's Bandra station, demanding permission to return home. He said that "such events weaken India's fight" against coronavirus and the administration needs to stay vigilant to avoid them. Shah also offered his full support to the Maharashtra government.
Text: Such events weaken fight against COVID-19: Shah to Uddhav over Bandra incident Home Minister Amit Shah called Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and expressed concern after hundreds of migrant workers protested at Mumbai's Bandra station, demanding permission to return home. He said that "such events weaken India's fight" against coronavirus and the administration needs to stay vigilant to avoid them. Shah also offered his full support to the Maharashtra government.

Headline: WHO praises India's extension of lockdown, calls it 'timely and tough'
Description: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Tuesday praised "India's timely and tough actions" to fight the COVID-19 pandemic as Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the extension of lockdown till May 3. "Despite huge and multiple challenges, India has been demonstrating unwavering commitment in its fight against the pandemic," said WHO's South-East Asia Regional Director Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh.
Text: WHO praises India's extension of lockdown, calls it 'timely and tough' The World Health Organization (WHO) on Tuesday praised "India's timely and tough actions" to fight the COVID-19 pandemic as Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the extension of lockdown till May 3. "Despite huge and multiple challenges, India has been demonstrating unwavering commitment in its fight against the pandemic," said WHO's South-East Asia Regional Director Dr Poonam Khetrapal Singh.

Headline: Maharashtra Health Ministry sets up experts' panels on coronavirus
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Tuesday said that two committees of experts were formed to analyse data and recommend measures to curb the spread of coronavirus. Tope said one committee would analyse the data generated by the health as well Mumbai civic body's medical department. The other panel would make recommendations for the rest of the state, added Tope.
Text: Maharashtra Health Ministry sets up experts' panels on coronavirus Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Tuesday said that two committees of experts were formed to analyse data and recommend measures to curb the spread of coronavirus. Tope said one committee would analyse the data generated by the health as well Mumbai civic body's medical department. The other panel would make recommendations for the rest of the state, added Tope.

Headline: Need 28 days to ascertain COVID-19's chain of transmission: Govt on 40-day lockdown
Description: On being asked the rationale behind 40-day lockdown, Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said the major goal is to ascertain how to break coronavirus' chain of transmission. "If a particular area doesn't report a case in 28 days...then we can confirm chain of transmission has stopped there." "That is why we are promoting social distancing with lockdown," he added.
Text: Need 28 days to ascertain COVID-19's chain of transmission: Govt on 40-day lockdown On being asked the rationale behind 40-day lockdown, Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said the major goal is to ascertain how to break coronavirus' chain of transmission. "If a particular area doesn't report a case in 28 days...then we can confirm chain of transmission has stopped there." "That is why we are promoting social distancing with lockdown," he added.

Headline: 8 attack Anganwadi worker who asked them to stay home after trip
Description: An Anganwadi worker, who had asked eight youths who returned from Bengaluru to Bidarahalli tanda in Karnataka to stay inside home and not roam on the streets, was assaulted by them, The New Indian Express reported. Shashikala Bai had to be admitted to the general hospital at Honnali for her injuries. Police have registered a case and started the probe.
Text: 8 attack Anganwadi worker who asked them to stay home after trip An Anganwadi worker, who had asked eight youths who returned from Bengaluru to Bidarahalli tanda in Karnataka to stay inside home and not roam on the streets, was assaulted by them, The New Indian Express reported. Shashikala Bai had to be admitted to the general hospital at Honnali for her injuries. Police have registered a case and started the probe.

Headline: Metro services to remain suspended till May 3: Govt
Description: The government on Tuesday announced suspension of the metro services hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the extension of nationwide lockdown till May 3. "With today's announcement of extending complete lockdown in the country till May 3, metro rail services will continue to be suspended till May 3," said DS Mishra, Secretary of Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.
Text: Metro services to remain suspended till May 3: Govt The government on Tuesday announced suspension of the metro services hours after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the extension of nationwide lockdown till May 3. "With today's announcement of extending complete lockdown in the country till May 3, metro rail services will continue to be suspended till May 3," said DS Mishra, Secretary of Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs.

Headline: News about troops' deployment in Gujarat is fake: Army
Description: Indian Army on Tuesday said media reports claiming its troops were deployed in Gujarat amid coronavirus lockdown were "fake and incorrect". It also rejected reports about the purported instructions being passed on to its personnel on leave and those retiring from service. "Media is requested to confirm such inputs from authorised sources only [before] publication," said the Army on Twitter.
Text: News about troops' deployment in Gujarat is fake: Army Indian Army on Tuesday said media reports claiming its troops were deployed in Gujarat amid coronavirus lockdown were "fake and incorrect". It also rejected reports about the purported instructions being passed on to its personnel on leave and those retiring from service. "Media is requested to confirm such inputs from authorised sources only [before] publication," said the Army on Twitter.

Headline: Lockdown doesn't mean lockup, don't worry: Maharashtra CM to migrant labourers
Description: After thousands of migrant labourers gathered at Bandra station demanding to go back after the lockdown was extended, Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said, "Nobody wants that you stay in lockup without your will. Lockdown doesn't mean lockup." He added, "The day when lockdown will be lifted, not only me, but Centre also will make arrangements for you."
Text: Lockdown doesn't mean lockup, don't worry: Maharashtra CM to migrant labourers After thousands of migrant labourers gathered at Bandra station demanding to go back after the lockdown was extended, Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said, "Nobody wants that you stay in lockup without your will. Lockdown doesn't mean lockup." He added, "The day when lockdown will be lifted, not only me, but Centre also will make arrangements for you."

Headline: Hyd man posts TikTok video of giving alcohol to labourers to go viral, arrested
Description: A Hyderabad man was arrested on Sunday for making a TikTok video of distributing alcohol to daily wage labourers. The man, who also uploaded the video on other platforms, made the video to go viral on social media, an official said. The man, whose accomplice was also arrested, claimed he wanted to help people with withdrawal symptoms.
Text: Hyd man posts TikTok video of giving alcohol to labourers to go viral, arrested A Hyderabad man was arrested on Sunday for making a TikTok video of distributing alcohol to daily wage labourers. The man, who also uploaded the video on other platforms, made the video to go viral on social media, an official said. The man, whose accomplice was also arrested, claimed he wanted to help people with withdrawal symptoms.

Headline: US approves sale of missiles, torpedoes worth $155 million to India
Description:
US government has approved the sale of missiles and torpedoes to India for $155 million.
The sale of 10 AGM-84L Harpoon Block II air-launched missiles is estimated to cost $92 million, while 16 MK 54 All Up Round Lightweight Torpedoes and three MK 54 Exercise Torpedoes are estimated to cost $63 million, the Defense Security Cooperation Agency told the Congress.
Text:
US approves sale of missiles, torpedoes worth $155 million to India US government has approved the sale of missiles and torpedoes to India for $155 million.
The sale of 10 AGM-84L Harpoon Block II air-launched missiles is estimated to cost $92 million, while 16 MK 54 All Up Round Lightweight Torpedoes and three MK 54 Exercise Torpedoes are estimated to cost $63 million, the Defense Security Cooperation Agency told the Congress.

Headline: Used N95 masks worth over ₹50L seized, 3 held in Palghar: Police
Description: At least 25,000 used N95 masks worth ₹51.34 lakh were seized in Maharashtra's Palghar district and three people were arrested, police said. The masks were allegedly washed, ironed and packed in boxes for resale, Inspector Sidhhava Jaibhaye of local crime branch said. A case was registered under the Essential Commodities Act, Epidemics Act, and COVID Act, among others, she added.
Text: Used N95 masks worth over ₹50L seized, 3 held in Palghar: Police At least 25,000 used N95 masks worth ₹51.34 lakh were seized in Maharashtra's Palghar district and three people were arrested, police said. The masks were allegedly washed, ironed and packed in boxes for resale, Inspector Sidhhava Jaibhaye of local crime branch said. A case was registered under the Essential Commodities Act, Epidemics Act, and COVID Act, among others, she added.

Headline: 32 cr poor people given support of ₹29,352 cr under PM Garib Kalyan Package
Description: Over 32 crore poor people have been given direct cash support of ₹29,352 crore under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package amid the coronavirus lockdown, the Ministry of Finance said. It added that 5.29 crore beneficiaries have been given free food grains under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Ann Yojana and 3,985 metric tonnes of pulses have been dispatched to states.
Text: 32 cr poor people given support of ₹29,352 cr under PM Garib Kalyan Package Over 32 crore poor people have been given direct cash support of ₹29,352 crore under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package amid the coronavirus lockdown, the Ministry of Finance said. It added that 5.29 crore beneficiaries have been given free food grains under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Ann Yojana and 3,985 metric tonnes of pulses have been dispatched to states.

Headline: 1,211 coronavirus cases confirmed in India in 24 hours, highest in a day: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 1,211 new cases of coronavirus were reported in India in last 24 hours, which is the biggest single-day jump so far. He added that 31 coronavirus deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of deaths to 339.
Text: 1,211 coronavirus cases confirmed in India in 24 hours, highest in a day: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 1,211 new cases of coronavirus were reported in India in last 24 hours, which is the biggest single-day jump so far. He added that 31 coronavirus deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of deaths to 339.

Headline: Bihar bans spitting at public places; ₹200 fine or 6-month jail for offenders
Description: Bihar Health Department has issued orders banning spitting at public places in view of health and infectious disease hazards, including coronavirus. The violation of the order is punishable with ₹200 fine or six-month imprisonment under Indian Penal Code provisions. "There is threat of spread of several serious diseases such as COVID-19, encephalitis and tuberculosis," the order stated.
Text: Bihar bans spitting at public places; ₹200 fine or 6-month jail for offenders Bihar Health Department has issued orders banning spitting at public places in view of health and infectious disease hazards, including coronavirus. The violation of the order is punishable with ₹200 fine or six-month imprisonment under Indian Penal Code provisions. "There is threat of spread of several serious diseases such as COVID-19, encephalitis and tuberculosis," the order stated.

Headline: Hi-tech Japanese machines used to sanitise Covid-19 affected areas in Delhi
Description: Delhi government has begun a sanitisation drive in the coronavirus affected and high-risk areas using machines from Japan. Sharing the pictures, CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "60 machines, including 10 hi-tech Japanese machines, have been deployed." MLA Raghav Chadha said the machines are flexible and can adjust through narrow lanes, adding ppm sodium hypochlorite solution is being used to sanitise.
Text: Hi-tech Japanese machines used to sanitise Covid-19 affected areas in Delhi Delhi government has begun a sanitisation drive in the coronavirus affected and high-risk areas using machines from Japan. Sharing the pictures, CM Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "60 machines, including 10 hi-tech Japanese machines, have been deployed." MLA Raghav Chadha said the machines are flexible and can adjust through narrow lanes, adding ppm sodium hypochlorite solution is being used to sanitise.

Headline: Andhra reports 34 new cases of coronavirus, total reaches 473
Description: Andhra Pradesh has reported 34 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 473, the state government has said. Two more people have died due to the virus, taking the total death toll in Andhra to nine. Meanwhile, 14 people have been discharged from hospitals after completing treatment.
Text: Andhra reports 34 new cases of coronavirus, total reaches 473 Andhra Pradesh has reported 34 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 473, the state government has said. Two more people have died due to the virus, taking the total death toll in Andhra to nine. Meanwhile, 14 people have been discharged from hospitals after completing treatment.

Headline: We appreciate 'data, science & sentiment' behind extended lockdown: FICCI
Description: Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) President Dr Sangita Reddy said the organisation fully appreciates the data, science and sentiment behind the extended lockdown till May 3. "It's in the best interest of India...for some more...plan for a graded opening up," she added. "We'll continue to take measures to...bring the economy back on track," Reddy further said.
Text: We appreciate 'data, science & sentiment' behind extended lockdown: FICCI Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) President Dr Sangita Reddy said the organisation fully appreciates the data, science and sentiment behind the extended lockdown till May 3. "It's in the best interest of India...for some more...plan for a graded opening up," she added. "We'll continue to take measures to...bring the economy back on track," Reddy further said.

Headline: All domestic, international flight operations to remain suspended till May 3
Description: Ministry of Civil Aviation announced on Tuesday that all domestic and international scheduled airlines operations will remain suspended till 11:59 pm on May 3. This comes after PM Narendra Modi announced the extension of the nationwide lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has crossed 10,000.
Text: All domestic, international flight operations to remain suspended till May 3 Ministry of Civil Aviation announced on Tuesday that all domestic and international scheduled airlines operations will remain suspended till 11:59 pm on May 3. This comes after PM Narendra Modi announced the extension of the nationwide lockdown to contain the spread of coronavirus. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in India has crossed 10,000.

Headline: BJP claims 'full marks' for lockdown citing Oxford study, university clarifies
Description: After a study by Oxford University researchers found that India's lockdown measures were the strictest with a score of 100, the BJP claimed the country scored "full marks". The university's Blavatnik School of Government replied to the tweet, saying the 'stringency index' shouldn't be interpreted as measuring the effectiveness of a country's response and there were no 'marks' as such.
Text: BJP claims 'full marks' for lockdown citing Oxford study, university clarifies After a study by Oxford University researchers found that India's lockdown measures were the strictest with a score of 100, the BJP claimed the country scored "full marks". The university's Blavatnik School of Government replied to the tweet, saying the 'stringency index' shouldn't be interpreted as measuring the effectiveness of a country's response and there were no 'marks' as such.

Headline: What can, cannot be allowed after April 20 to be announced tomorrow: Javadekar
Description: Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday termed the lockdown as a "game-changer" in the fight against coronavirus. "He (PM Modi) has a plan afoot, which will be announced tomorrow, about what can be allowed and what cannot be allowed after April 20. However, he has essentially appealed to continue the lockdown," Javadekar told ANI.
Text: What can, cannot be allowed after April 20 to be announced tomorrow: Javadekar Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar on Tuesday termed the lockdown as a "game-changer" in the fight against coronavirus. "He (PM Modi) has a plan afoot, which will be announced tomorrow, about what can be allowed and what cannot be allowed after April 20. However, he has essentially appealed to continue the lockdown," Javadekar told ANI.

Headline: Karnataka minister shares pic of himself swimming at home, criticised
Description: Karnataka Medical Education Minister Sudhakar K, who is in charge of the state war room against COVID-19, recently tweeted a picture of himself swimming with his family in a pool at his bungalow. After being accused of being insensitive by some people, Sudhakar deleted the tweet but responded that he had hardly spent time with his family in two months.
Text: Karnataka minister shares pic of himself swimming at home, criticised Karnataka Medical Education Minister Sudhakar K, who is in charge of the state war room against COVID-19, recently tweeted a picture of himself swimming with his family in a pool at his bungalow. After being accused of being insensitive by some people, Sudhakar deleted the tweet but responded that he had hardly spent time with his family in two months.

Headline: Quarantine literally means 40-day isolation: Sachin Bansal on lockdown extension
Description: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal tweeted that "quarantine" literally meant "40 days isolation". This follows the announcement that the 21-day lockdown will be extended by 19 days. "Quarantine" comes from Italian words "quaranta giorni", meaning 40 days, designating the practice where ships arriving at Venice in 14th century were required to be isolated, to protect cities against plague epidemics.
Text: Quarantine literally means 40-day isolation: Sachin Bansal on lockdown extension Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal tweeted that "quarantine" literally meant "40 days isolation". This follows the announcement that the 21-day lockdown will be extended by 19 days. "Quarantine" comes from Italian words "quaranta giorni", meaning 40 days, designating the practice where ships arriving at Venice in 14th century were required to be isolated, to protect cities against plague epidemics.

Headline: 100 hostels to be converted into shelters for homeless: K'taka govt to HC
Description: The Karnataka government on Monday submitted to the High Court that it has directed the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to provide shelter for migrant workers and the homeless. The Urban Development Department and the Ministry of Social Welfare have identified 100 hostels with 9000 beds which can be converted into temporary shelters for the poor.
Text: 100 hostels to be converted into shelters for homeless: K'taka govt to HC The Karnataka government on Monday submitted to the High Court that it has directed the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to provide shelter for migrant workers and the homeless. The Urban Development Department and the Ministry of Social Welfare have identified 100 hostels with 9000 beds which can be converted into temporary shelters for the poor.

Headline: CEC, ECs to take 30% salary cut for one year to fund fight against COVID-19
Description: The Election Commission on Monday said that Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora and Election Commissioners Ashok Lavasa and Sushil Chandra had volunteered to take a 30% reduction in their basic salaries for one year in order to contribute to the efforts against COVID-19. Earlier, PM, President, Vice President and Governors had decided to take 30% salary cut for a year.
Text: CEC, ECs to take 30% salary cut for one year to fund fight against COVID-19 The Election Commission on Monday said that Chief Election Commissioner Sunil Arora and Election Commissioners Ashok Lavasa and Sushil Chandra had volunteered to take a 30% reduction in their basic salaries for one year in order to contribute to the efforts against COVID-19. Earlier, PM, President, Vice President and Governors had decided to take 30% salary cut for a year.

Headline: JP Nadda thanks Sonia for extending Cong's support in fight against COVID-19
Description: BJP President JP Nadda on Tuesday thanked Congress chief Sonia Gandhi for urging people to stay indoors and observe lockdown regulations amid COVID-19 outbreak. "Thank you Sonia ji, take care of your health," Nadda tweeted. Gandhi, in a video message, assured people of Congress' support and expressed confidence that with strong morale, India will emerge victorious against the crisis soon.
Text: JP Nadda thanks Sonia for extending Cong's support in fight against COVID-19 BJP President JP Nadda on Tuesday thanked Congress chief Sonia Gandhi for urging people to stay indoors and observe lockdown regulations amid COVID-19 outbreak. "Thank you Sonia ji, take care of your health," Nadda tweeted. Gandhi, in a video message, assured people of Congress' support and expressed confidence that with strong morale, India will emerge victorious against the crisis soon.

Headline: Adequate stock of essentials, no need to worry: Shah on lockdown extension
Description: After the announcement of extension of coronavirus lockdown till May 3, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday assured people that the country has adequate stock of food, medicines and other essential commodities. "No citizen should worry about that," said Shah. "I also request the affluent people to come forward and help the poor living in their vicinity," he added.
Text: Adequate stock of essentials, no need to worry: Shah on lockdown extension After the announcement of extension of coronavirus lockdown till May 3, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday assured people that the country has adequate stock of food, medicines and other essential commodities. "No citizen should worry about that," said Shah. "I also request the affluent people to come forward and help the poor living in their vicinity," he added.

Headline: All trains cancelled till May 3, e-ticket holders to get refunds automatically
Description: The Indian Railways on Tuesday suspended all passenger trains till May 3 after PM Narendra Modi announced the extension of nationwide lockdown by another 19 days. The e-ticket holders don't need to cancel their tickets and they will be refunded automatically, IRCTC said. According to reports, no advance booking of train tickets will be allowed until further notice.
Text: All trains cancelled till May 3, e-ticket holders to get refunds automatically The Indian Railways on Tuesday suspended all passenger trains till May 3 after PM Narendra Modi announced the extension of nationwide lockdown by another 19 days. The e-ticket holders don't need to cancel their tickets and they will be refunded automatically, IRCTC said. According to reports, no advance booking of train tickets will be allowed until further notice.

Headline: 20 control rooms set up for wage-related issues, workers' plight
Description: Labour Ministry on Tuesday said it has set up 20 control rooms on pan-India basis to address wage-related grievances and to mitigate the problems faced by migrant workers amid the lockdown. Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced extension of the lockdown till May 3 with conditional relaxation from April 20 in some areas on the basis of evaluation of the situation.
Text: 20 control rooms set up for wage-related issues, workers' plight Labour Ministry on Tuesday said it has set up 20 control rooms on pan-India basis to address wage-related grievances and to mitigate the problems faced by migrant workers amid the lockdown. Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced extension of the lockdown till May 3 with conditional relaxation from April 20 in some areas on the basis of evaluation of the situation.

Headline: Mumbai Police to use drones, AI to enforce social distancing
Description: Mumbai Police will deploy artificial intelligence (AI) and drones to keep an eye on densely-populated neighbourhoods so that the social distancing is strictly enforced to prevent spread of coronavirus. Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was given a demonstration at  Worli in the presence of Mumbai's Joint Commissioner of Police Vinoy Choubey. Maharashtra has reported 2,334 coronavirus cases.
Text: Mumbai Police to use drones, AI to enforce social distancing Mumbai Police will deploy artificial intelligence (AI) and drones to keep an eye on densely-populated neighbourhoods so that the social distancing is strictly enforced to prevent spread of coronavirus. Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was given a demonstration at  Worli in the presence of Mumbai's Joint Commissioner of Police Vinoy Choubey. Maharashtra has reported 2,334 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Movement passes issued for essential services valid till May 3: Delhi Police
Description: Movement passes earlier issued by Delhi Police to those providing essential services will be valid till May 3, amid extension of nationwide coronavirus lockdown. "E-passes issued by Delhi government will be honoured by all police personnel on duty," said a police order. The passes must be accompanied by original message of use on mobile phone and ID proof, it added.
Text: Movement passes issued for essential services valid till May 3: Delhi Police Movement passes earlier issued by Delhi Police to those providing essential services will be valid till May 3, amid extension of nationwide coronavirus lockdown. "E-passes issued by Delhi government will be honoured by all police personnel on duty," said a police order. The passes must be accompanied by original message of use on mobile phone and ID proof, it added.

Headline: Indian Navy develops air evacuation pod to airlift COVID-19 patient
Description: Indian Navy's Southern Command in Kochi has developed an air evacuation pod to airlift any COVID-19 patient while minimising the chances of spreading the infection. The pod has been developed locally and with available stretchers. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, India has now over 10,000 cases of COVID-19 and has recorded 339 virus-related deaths so far.
