Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday said that under Delhi government's Operation SHIELD, a total of 43 coronavirus containment areas have been sealed. The most containment areas are in South-East Delhi (12) and East Delhi (9). Meanwhile, Shahdara has five containment areas, West Delhi has four, South and Central Delhi have three each and New Delhi has two.

Headline: 31 more coronavirus cases surface in UP, total count rises to 483
Description: As many as 31 more coronavirus cases were confirmed in Uttar Pradesh on Sunday, taking the count in the state to 483. The state has so far reported five deaths- one each from Basti, Meerut, Varanasi, Agra and Bulandshahar. Among the most affected districts, Agra (104) is followed by Gautam Buddha Nagar (64), Meerut (51), Lucknow (32) and Sarangpur (28).
Text: 31 more coronavirus cases surface in UP, total count rises to 483 As many as 31 more coronavirus cases were confirmed in Uttar Pradesh on Sunday, taking the count in the state to 483. The state has so far reported five deaths- one each from Basti, Meerut, Varanasi, Agra and Bulandshahar. Among the most affected districts, Agra (104) is followed by Gautam Buddha Nagar (64), Meerut (51), Lucknow (32) and Sarangpur (28).

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 9,000; death toll surpasses 300
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 9,152, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Monday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to the virus has surged to 308 in the country. Out of all the cases, 7,987 cases are active, while 857 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated till now.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India cross 9,000; death toll surpasses 300 The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 9,152, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Monday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to the virus has surged to 308 in the country. Out of all the cases, 7,987 cases are active, while 857 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated till now.

Headline: PM Modi to address the nation at 10 am tomorrow
Description: PM Narendra Modi will address the nation at 10 am on Tuesday, the last day of the 21-day lockdown. PM Modi had held a video conference with CMs regarding lockdown on Saturday following which several state governments extended it. After the meeting, PM Modi had said there was a consensus among the states on extending the lockdown by two weeks.
Text: PM Modi to address the nation at 10 am tomorrow PM Narendra Modi will address the nation at 10 am on Tuesday, the last day of the 21-day lockdown. PM Modi had held a video conference with CMs regarding lockdown on Saturday following which several state governments extended it. After the meeting, PM Modi had said there was a consensus among the states on extending the lockdown by two weeks.

Headline: Uruguay woman argues with Delhi Police after being stopped while cycling, video surfaces
Description: A woman from Uruguay was stopped by police for not wearing a mask while cycling in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. In a video that surfaced, the woman can be seen arguing with police, saying, "You can’t say anything to me. You can’t ask me to wear a mask.” The woman was identified as Valentina Obispo, Head of Administration at Uruguay embassy.
Text: Uruguay woman argues with Delhi Police after being stopped while cycling, video surfaces A woman from Uruguay was stopped by police for not wearing a mask while cycling in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. In a video that surfaced, the woman can be seen arguing with police, saying, "You can’t say anything to me. You can’t ask me to wear a mask.” The woman was identified as Valentina Obispo, Head of Administration at Uruguay embassy.

Headline: 15,583 coronavirus samples tested in India today, 544 come out as positive
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that 15,583 samples were tested for coronavirus on Sunday, out of which 544 returned as positive. It added that a total of 1,95,748 samples from 1,81,028 individuals have been tested in India as on April 12, 9 pm. India had conducted record 17,143 tests on Saturday.
Text: 15,583 coronavirus samples tested in India today, 544 come out as positive The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that 15,583 samples were tested for coronavirus on Sunday, out of which 544 returned as positive. It added that a total of 1,95,748 samples from 1,81,028 individuals have been tested in India as on April 12, 9 pm. India had conducted record 17,143 tests on Saturday.

Headline: 44 Indian evacuees from Iran return home after 30 days in isolation
Description: As many as 44 Indian evacuees from Iran who were quarantined at the Indian Navy's facility in Mumbai have returned to their homes in J&K and Ladakh. All of them spent 30 days in the facility commencing March 13, ending with each testing negative on March 28. Their stay was extended as there were no means of travelling amid lockdown.
Text: 44 Indian evacuees from Iran return home after 30 days in isolation As many as 44 Indian evacuees from Iran who were quarantined at the Indian Navy's facility in Mumbai have returned to their homes in J&K and Ladakh. All of them spent 30 days in the facility commencing March 13, ending with each testing negative on March 28. Their stay was extended as there were no means of travelling amid lockdown.

Headline: Reopen industrial sectors based on red, amber & green COVID-19 zones, suggests CII
Description: Industry chamber CII has suggested reopening various sectors based on classification of geographies as red, amber and green, depending upon the incidence of COVID-19 cases. "The principle should be that we look at opening up in concentric circles around the red zones," it said. Textiles and apparels, pharmaceuticals, food processing and automobiles are some of the sectors suggested for restart.
Text: Reopen industrial sectors based on red, amber & green COVID-19 zones, suggests CII Industry chamber CII has suggested reopening various sectors based on classification of geographies as red, amber and green, depending upon the incidence of COVID-19 cases. "The principle should be that we look at opening up in concentric circles around the red zones," it said. Textiles and apparels, pharmaceuticals, food processing and automobiles are some of the sectors suggested for restart.

Headline: Coronavirus suspect jumps to death from quarantine facility in Greater Noida
Description: A 32-year-old man who was under observation for coronavirus jumped to death from the seventh floor of a Greater Noida private college in Uttar Pradesh where he was put in quarantine, officials said on Sunday. His test results were awaited, District Magistrate Suhas LY said. The District Magistrate also said that he has ordered a magisterial inquiry into the matter.
Text: Coronavirus suspect jumps to death from quarantine facility in Greater Noida A 32-year-old man who was under observation for coronavirus jumped to death from the seventh floor of a Greater Noida private college in Uttar Pradesh where he was put in quarantine, officials said on Sunday. His test results were awaited, District Magistrate Suhas LY said. The District Magistrate also said that he has ordered a magisterial inquiry into the matter.

Headline: Ahmedabad residents shower flowers on policemen on duty amid lockdown
Description: Residents of Shah-e-Alam area in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Sunday applauded police personnel by clapping and showering flower petals on them. The incident took place when a police team was in the area for routine patrolling amid the nationwide lockdown. As per reports, the police was attacked by stone pelters in the same area during NRC-CAA protests a few months back.
Text: Ahmedabad residents shower flowers on policemen on duty amid lockdown Residents of Shah-e-Alam area in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Sunday applauded police personnel by clapping and showering flower petals on them. The incident took place when a police team was in the area for routine patrolling amid the nationwide lockdown. As per reports, the police was attacked by stone pelters in the same area during NRC-CAA protests a few months back.

Headline: Loco Pilot in B'luru distributes 120 food packets daily to needy amid lockdown
Description: A Loco Pilot and his friend in Bengaluru cook and distribute about 120 food packets daily to the needy amid the nationwide lockdown. "Public is overwhelmed with gratitude and bless us," Loco Pilot B Ravi said. Ravi and his friend have been doing this since April 7 and plan on continuing it as long as they can sustain it.
Text: Loco Pilot in B'luru distributes 120 food packets daily to needy amid lockdown A Loco Pilot and his friend in Bengaluru cook and distribute about 120 food packets daily to the needy amid the nationwide lockdown. "Public is overwhelmed with gratitude and bless us," Loco Pilot B Ravi said. Ravi and his friend have been doing this since April 7 and plan on continuing it as long as they can sustain it.

Headline: What is Agra Model that led to COVID-19 cluster containment in India's 1st cluster?
Description: In India's first COVID-19 cluster Agra, containment strategy included identifying the area within 3 km of the epicentre as containment zone. Over 1,200 teams conducted door-to-door survey of 9.3 lakh people. The strategy, now known as 'Agra Model', also saw Smart City Control Room being converted into 'war room', where a central helpline was established.
Text: What is Agra Model that led to COVID-19 cluster containment in India's 1st cluster? In India's first COVID-19 cluster Agra, containment strategy included identifying the area within 3 km of the epicentre as containment zone. Over 1,200 teams conducted door-to-door survey of 9.3 lakh people. The strategy, now known as 'Agra Model', also saw Smart City Control Room being converted into 'war room', where a central helpline was established.

Headline: 36 people arrested for defying COVID-19 lockdown curbs in Noida
Description: Thirty six people were arrested in Noida and Greater Noida on Sunday for allegedly defying the restrictions imposed amid the COVID-19 lockdown, police said. Gautam Buddha Nagar is under a 21-day lockdown since March 25 like the rest of the country and is also among the 15 districts in Uttar Pradesh where coronavirus hotspots have been completely sealed off.
Text: 36 people arrested for defying COVID-19 lockdown curbs in Noida Thirty six people were arrested in Noida and Greater Noida on Sunday for allegedly defying the restrictions imposed amid the COVID-19 lockdown, police said. Gautam Buddha Nagar is under a 21-day lockdown since March 25 like the rest of the country and is also among the 15 districts in Uttar Pradesh where coronavirus hotspots have been completely sealed off.

Headline: 22 new COVID-19 positive cases, 1 death reported in Madhya Pradesh's Indore
Description: As many as 22 new positive cases of COVID-19 and one death was reported on Monday from Madhya Pradesh's Indore, city's Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia said. With this, the total number of positive cases in Indore rose to 328 and the death toll increased to 33, Jadia added. Two coronavirus-related deaths were reported from Indore on Sunday.
Text: 22 new COVID-19 positive cases, 1 death reported in Madhya Pradesh's Indore As many as 22 new positive cases of COVID-19 and one death was reported on Monday from Madhya Pradesh's Indore, city's Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadia said. With this, the total number of positive cases in Indore rose to 328 and the death toll increased to 33, Jadia added. Two coronavirus-related deaths were reported from Indore on Sunday.

Headline: Coronavirus patient booked for 'attempt to murder' after spitting at doctor in TN
Description: A 40-year-old coronavirus patient was booked for "attempt to murder" on Sunday after he allegedly spat on a doctor treating him at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu. The patient also removed his mask and threw it at the doctor. It was a serious crime under present conditions with restrictions in force to prevent the spread of coronavirus, police said.
Text: Coronavirus patient booked for 'attempt to murder' after spitting at doctor in TN A 40-year-old coronavirus patient was booked for "attempt to murder" on Sunday after he allegedly spat on a doctor treating him at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu. The patient also removed his mask and threw it at the doctor. It was a serious crime under present conditions with restrictions in force to prevent the spread of coronavirus, police said.

Headline: Allow more activities if lockdown extended, suggests Commerce Ministry
Description: Commerce and Industry Ministry has suggested that more industrial activities should be allowed with "safeguards" once "decision regarding extension...of lockdown" is taken. It suggested that industries, including those making heavy electrical items and telecom equipment, should be allowed to start with minimum manpower. "These...activities are essential to improve...economic activity," it added.
Text: Allow more activities if lockdown extended, suggests Commerce Ministry Commerce and Industry Ministry has suggested that more industrial activities should be allowed with "safeguards" once "decision regarding extension...of lockdown" is taken. It suggested that industries, including those making heavy electrical items and telecom equipment, should be allowed to start with minimum manpower. "These...activities are essential to improve...economic activity," it added.

Headline: Andhra MLA dines with sanitation workers, appreciates their services
Description: Bhumana Karunakar Reddy, MLA of Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati, on Sunday dined with sanitation workers of Tirupati Municipal Corporation and appreciated the services being rendered by them amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Reddy interacted with the workers and then sat on the roadside and had his lunch along with them. "They're doing tremendous service in the fight against coronavirus," the MLA added.
Text: Andhra MLA dines with sanitation workers, appreciates their services Bhumana Karunakar Reddy, MLA of Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati, on Sunday dined with sanitation workers of Tirupati Municipal Corporation and appreciated the services being rendered by them amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Reddy interacted with the workers and then sat on the roadside and had his lunch along with them. "They're doing tremendous service in the fight against coronavirus," the MLA added.

Headline: Bulgarian football coach praises Kerala govt's handling of COVID-19
Description: A football coach from Bulgaria, Dimitar Pantev, who was home quarantined in Kerala praised the state government for its handling of COVID-19 cases. "I'm dumbstruck to hear about the spread and the disaster coronavirus has created in Europe and I feel blessed that I was in Kerala," Pantev said. I was never worried or felt like going home, he added.
Text: Bulgarian football coach praises Kerala govt's handling of COVID-19 A football coach from Bulgaria, Dimitar Pantev, who was home quarantined in Kerala praised the state government for its handling of COVID-19 cases. "I'm dumbstruck to hear about the spread and the disaster coronavirus has created in Europe and I feel blessed that I was in Kerala," Pantev said. I was never worried or felt like going home, he added.

Headline: 3-week lockdown reasonable start, don't know if it'll be enough: Ex-US official
Description: A three-week lockdown is reasonable starting point to contain COVID-19 in a country like India, Indian-American epidemiologist Rajeev Venkayya said. Venkayya, who was Special Assistant to President for Biodefense at White House during George Bush's administration, however said it's difficult to say how much more time India would require. "I don't know if three weeks will be enough," he stated.
Text: 3-week lockdown reasonable start, don't know if it'll be enough: Ex-US official A three-week lockdown is reasonable starting point to contain COVID-19 in a country like India, Indian-American epidemiologist Rajeev Venkayya said. Venkayya, who was Special Assistant to President for Biodefense at White House during George Bush's administration, however said it's difficult to say how much more time India would require. "I don't know if three weeks will be enough," he stated.

Headline: 2 more coronavirus cases in Assam, state total reaches 30
Description: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has tweeted about two new coronavirus cases in the state. Sarma on Monday said one person from Dhubri, connected with Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi, tested positive for COVID-19, taking the total number of cases to 30. He also tweeted about a patient from Nagaland who tested positive for COVID-19 in Guwahati on Sunday.
Text: 2 more coronavirus cases in Assam, state total reaches 30 Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has tweeted about two new coronavirus cases in the state. Sarma on Monday said one person from Dhubri, connected with Tablighi Jamaat meet in Delhi, tested positive for COVID-19, taking the total number of cases to 30. He also tweeted about a patient from Nagaland who tested positive for COVID-19 in Guwahati on Sunday.

Headline: Andhra govt to give 3 face masks to each citizen to curb COVID-19 spread
Description: Andhra Pradesh government has decided to distribute over 16 crore face masks to all citizens in the state, with each of its 5.3 crore citizens getting three face masks to protect them from coronavirus infection. The decision was taken during a high-level review meeting chaired by CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy at his residence on Sunday.
Text: Andhra govt to give 3 face masks to each citizen to curb COVID-19 spread Andhra Pradesh government has decided to distribute over 16 crore face masks to all citizens in the state, with each of its 5.3 crore citizens getting three face masks to protect them from coronavirus infection. The decision was taken during a high-level review meeting chaired by CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy at his residence on Sunday.

Headline: 2 test positive for coronavirus, 36 patients recover in Kerala today
Description: Kerala on Sunday reported 2 new coronavirus cases, one each from Pathanamthitta and Kannur, taking the total number of active cases in the state to 194. State Health Minister KK Shailaja said that it was indeed a happy day for Kerala as only two COVID-19 cases were confirmed whereas 36 people recovered from the infection today.
Text: 2 test positive for coronavirus, 36 patients recover in Kerala today Kerala on Sunday reported 2 new coronavirus cases, one each from Pathanamthitta and Kannur, taking the total number of active cases in the state to 194. State Health Minister KK Shailaja said that it was indeed a happy day for Kerala as only two COVID-19 cases were confirmed whereas 36 people recovered from the infection today.

Headline: MP Guv was right in ordering floor test as govt didn't have majority: SC
Description: The Supreme Court on Monday held valid Madhya Pradesh Governor Lalji Tandon's decision to order a floor test after the resignation of 22 Congress MLAs. A floor test was necessary as the government had lost the majority, the SC added. The resignation of 22 MLAs led to the fall of the Kamal Nath-led Congress government in Madhya Pradesh.
Text: MP Guv was right in ordering floor test as govt didn't have majority: SC The Supreme Court on Monday held valid Madhya Pradesh Governor Lalji Tandon's decision to order a floor test after the resignation of 22 Congress MLAs. A floor test was necessary as the government had lost the majority, the SC added. The resignation of 22 MLAs led to the fall of the Kamal Nath-led Congress government in Madhya Pradesh.

Headline: Woman throws her 5 children into Ganga river after alleged argument with husband
Description: A woman threw her five children into Ganga river after allegedly arguing with her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, police said. The police said that the woman has confessed to the crime. The body of an 11-year-old girl has been recovered from the river so far, while the search operation for the other four bodies is underway, police added.
Text: Woman throws her 5 children into Ganga river after alleged argument with husband A woman threw her five children into Ganga river after allegedly arguing with her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi, police said. The police said that the woman has confessed to the crime. The body of an 11-year-old girl has been recovered from the river so far, while the search operation for the other four bodies is underway, police added.

Headline: Delhi hit by earthquake of magnitude 2.7; 2nd earthquake in 24 hours
Description: Earthquake tremors were felt in Delhi and its adjoining areas on Monday afternoon. The epicentre of the earthquake, which had a magnitude of 2.7 on Richter scale, was 9 km north of Delhi. This was the second earthquake to hit Delhi in 24 hours. On Sunday evening, an earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hit the Delhi-NCR region.
Text: Delhi hit by earthquake of magnitude 2.7; 2nd earthquake in 24 hours Earthquake tremors were felt in Delhi and its adjoining areas on Monday afternoon. The epicentre of the earthquake, which had a magnitude of 2.7 on Richter scale, was 9 km north of Delhi. This was the second earthquake to hit Delhi in 24 hours. On Sunday evening, an earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hit the Delhi-NCR region.

Headline: Delhi govt to sanitise city's red, orange zones from Monday: CM Kejriwal
Description: The Delhi government will start a sanitisation drive in the city's COVID-19 containment zones, declared as red zones and the high-risk zones, identified as orange zones from Monday, CM Arvind Kejriwal said. According to the government, 34 hotspots in Delhi have been identified as COVID-19 containment zones. Kejriwal added he was concerned about the increasing number of coronavirus cases.
Text: Delhi govt to sanitise city's red, orange zones from Monday: CM Kejriwal The Delhi government will start a sanitisation drive in the city's COVID-19 containment zones, declared as red zones and the high-risk zones, identified as orange zones from Monday, CM Arvind Kejriwal said. According to the government, 34 hotspots in Delhi have been identified as COVID-19 containment zones. Kejriwal added he was concerned about the increasing number of coronavirus cases.

Headline: No new coronavirus case in Uttarakhand for 4th day in a row, total cases remain at 35
Description: The Uttarakhand Health Department on Sunday revealed that no new positive case was reported in the state for the fourth day in a row. It added that the total number of cases in the state remains at 35. As many as 93 tests for coronavirus were conducted today, with all returning negative. Seven COVID-19 patients have recovered in Uttarakhand.
Text: No new coronavirus case in Uttarakhand for 4th day in a row, total cases remain at 35 The Uttarakhand Health Department on Sunday revealed that no new positive case was reported in the state for the fourth day in a row. It added that the total number of cases in the state remains at 35. As many as 93 tests for coronavirus were conducted today, with all returning negative. Seven COVID-19 patients have recovered in Uttarakhand.

Headline: 7.5-hour wrist surgery of policeman attacked by Nihangs successful: Punjab CM
Description: After Nihangs chopped off a policeman's hands in Patiala, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh tweeted, "I'm happy to share that a 7 1/2 hour long surgery has been successfully completed in PGI to repair...severed wrist of ASI Harjeet Singh." He added, "I thank...entire team of doctors and support staff for their painstaking effort. Wishing ASI Harjeet Singh a speedy recovery"
Text: 7.5-hour wrist surgery of policeman attacked by Nihangs successful: Punjab CM After Nihangs chopped off a policeman's hands in Patiala, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh tweeted, "I'm happy to share that a 7 1/2 hour long surgery has been successfully completed in PGI to repair...severed wrist of ASI Harjeet Singh." He added, "I thank...entire team of doctors and support staff for their painstaking effort. Wishing ASI Harjeet Singh a speedy recovery"

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in UK crosses 10,000 as 737 more die in 24 hours
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in the UK has risen to 10,612 after 737 more patients died in the last 24 hours. UK has become the fifth country after Italy, Spain, France and US to report over 10,000 coronavirus deaths. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in the UK has risen to 84,279.
Text: Coronavirus death toll in UK crosses 10,000 as 737 more die in 24 hours The death toll due to coronavirus in the UK has risen to 10,612 after 737 more patients died in the last 24 hours. UK has become the fifth country after Italy, Spain, France and US to report over 10,000 coronavirus deaths. Meanwhile, the total number of coronavirus cases in the UK has risen to 84,279.

Headline: Pan Masala' delivered through drone in Gujarat during lockdown, 2 detained
Description: Two people were detained by the police after a video showing pan masala being delivered through a drone in Gujarat's Morbi went viral. The video went viral after it was uploaded on the TikTok app. More than 500 confirmed cases of coronavirus have been registered in Gujarat, with Ahmedabad accounting for most cases.
Text: Pan Masala' delivered through drone in Gujarat during lockdown, 2 detained Two people were detained by the police after a video showing pan masala being delivered through a drone in Gujarat's Morbi went viral. The video went viral after it was uploaded on the TikTok app. More than 500 confirmed cases of coronavirus have been registered in Gujarat, with Ahmedabad accounting for most cases.

Headline: Kanika's building in Lucknow not sealed, DM says 'she is healthy now'
Description: Lucknow District Administration has been questioned by locals for not sealing the society where singer Kanika Kapoor, who had COVID-19, lives. However, Lucknow District Magistrate Abhishek Prakash said Kanika is healthy and therefore it wasn't sealed. When asked why an area, where another patient who recovered lives, was sealed, Prakash added, "There were symptoms in her...family members."
Text: Kanika's building in Lucknow not sealed, DM says 'she is healthy now' Lucknow District Administration has been questioned by locals for not sealing the society where singer Kanika Kapoor, who had COVID-19, lives. However, Lucknow District Magistrate Abhishek Prakash said Kanika is healthy and therefore it wasn't sealed. When asked why an area, where another patient who recovered lives, was sealed, Prakash added, "There were symptoms in her...family members."

Headline: Bengal govt makes it mandatory to wear face masks in public
Description: West Bengal government has made it mandatory to wear face masks in public places amid coronavirus spread. In the absence of masks, mouth and nose may be covered with any other available piece of cloth including "folded or rolled dupatta, gamcha, handkerchief or any material that acts as a protective cover", said an order by state Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha.
Text: Bengal govt makes it mandatory to wear face masks in public West Bengal government has made it mandatory to wear face masks in public places amid coronavirus spread. In the absence of masks, mouth and nose may be covered with any other available piece of cloth including "folded or rolled dupatta, gamcha, handkerchief or any material that acts as a protective cover", said an order by state Chief Secretary Rajiva Sinha.

Headline: Resurgence of COVID-19 cases in China, Japan, Korea cause of concern for us too: Govt
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Sunday said that the resurgence of coronavirus cases in China, Japan and Korea is a cause of concern for India too. "So we need to make sure that we continue to follow our containment and social distancing measures like we are following today," he added.
Text: Resurgence of COVID-19 cases in China, Japan, Korea cause of concern for us too: Govt The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Sunday said that the resurgence of coronavirus cases in China, Japan and Korea is a cause of concern for India too. "So we need to make sure that we continue to follow our containment and social distancing measures like we are following today," he added.

Headline: 2 family members of COVID-19 patient test +ve in Chandigarh, total 21 cases
Description: Chandigarh Health Department on Sunday said that two new cases of coronavirus were reported today, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 21. The two new cases reported today are the family members of a 40-year-old man who was detected positive for coronavirus on Friday. Notably, seven coronavirus patients have recovered in Chandigarh.
Text: 2 family members of COVID-19 patient test +ve in Chandigarh, total 21 cases Chandigarh Health Department on Sunday said that two new cases of coronavirus were reported today, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 21. The two new cases reported today are the family members of a 40-year-old man who was detected positive for coronavirus on Friday. Notably, seven coronavirus patients have recovered in Chandigarh.

Headline: PhD scholar lies to parents, travels 1,500 km to UP to help with COVID-19 testing
Description: Ramakrishna, a 29-year-old PhD scholar at Lucknow's King George's Medical University's microbiology department, was helping parents with farming in Telangana when his guide requested him to return to help with coronavirus testing. Ramakrishna lied to parents that he was going to Hyderabad at a friend's place to write a thesis. He travelled 1,500 km to Lucknow to help with testing.
Text: PhD scholar lies to parents, travels 1,500 km to UP to help with COVID-19 testing Ramakrishna, a 29-year-old PhD scholar at Lucknow's King George's Medical University's microbiology department, was helping parents with farming in Telangana when his guide requested him to return to help with coronavirus testing. Ramakrishna lied to parents that he was going to Hyderabad at a friend's place to write a thesis. He travelled 1,500 km to Lucknow to help with testing.

Headline: 16 COVID-19 deaths reported in Mumbai in one day; youngest patient was 39, oldest 68
Description: Mumbai on Sunday reported 16 deaths due to coronavirus, taking the total death toll in the city to 91. Out of the 16 new deaths, the youngest patient was aged 39, while the oldest was 68. Only two patients had no underlying health conditions. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in the city has risen to 1,399.
Text: 16 COVID-19 deaths reported in Mumbai in one day; youngest patient was 39, oldest 68 Mumbai on Sunday reported 16 deaths due to coronavirus, taking the total death toll in the city to 91. Out of the 16 new deaths, the youngest patient was aged 39, while the oldest was 68. Only two patients had no underlying health conditions. Further, the total number of coronavirus cases in the city has risen to 1,399.

Headline: SC to hear petition against setting up of PM-CARES Fund tomorrow
Description: The Supreme Court would hear a PIL seeking quashing of the central government's decision of setting up of the PM-CARES Fund on Monday. "Impugned trust has not either been created by Parliament/state legislator within Article 267. It is neither passed by Parliament nor approved by the President of India. There is no ordinance/gazette notification in this regard," the PIL said.
Text: SC to hear petition against setting up of PM-CARES Fund tomorrow The Supreme Court would hear a PIL seeking quashing of the central government's decision of setting up of the PM-CARES Fund on Monday. "Impugned trust has not either been created by Parliament/state legislator within Article 267. It is neither passed by Parliament nor approved by the President of India. There is no ordinance/gazette notification in this regard," the PIL said.

Headline: 40+ candidate vaccines for COVID-19 under development across the world: ICMR
Description: During a press conference, the Indian Council of Medical Research said that more than 40 candidate vaccines for coronavirus are under development across the world. It further said that no candidate vaccine has entered the next stage so far. It added that India doesn't have a candidate vaccine so far but it is trying to develop.
Text: 40+ candidate vaccines for COVID-19 under development across the world: ICMR During a press conference, the Indian Council of Medical Research said that more than 40 candidate vaccines for coronavirus are under development across the world. It further said that no candidate vaccine has entered the next stage so far. It added that India doesn't have a candidate vaccine so far but it is trying to develop.

Headline: Only 20% COVID-19 patients in India require critical care, no need to panic: Govt
Description: Briefing about the COVID-19 situation in India, Ministry of Health's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "Though the number of cases has increased from 979 on March 29 to 8,356 today, the number of patients requiring oxygen support or critical care is only 20%." He added the government is "over-prepared in managing the situation" and there is "no need to panic".
Text: Only 20% COVID-19 patients in India require critical care, no need to panic: Govt  Briefing about the COVID-19 situation in India, Ministry of Health's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "Though the number of cases has increased from 979 on March 29 to 8,356 today, the number of patients requiring oxygen support or critical care is only 20%." He added the government is "over-prepared in managing the situation" and there is "no need to panic".

Headline: No data to suggest pets can spread coronavirus, having pets at home safe: AIIMS Director
Description: Delhi AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria on Sunday said that there is no data to suggest that pet animals can spread coronavirus. He added that the spread of coronavirus is mainly from human to human. He further said, "Chances of its spread from pets to humans is very very unlikely. So having pets at home is safe."
Text: No data to suggest pets can spread coronavirus, having pets at home safe: AIIMS Director Delhi AIIMS Director Randeep Guleria on Sunday said that there is no data to suggest that pet animals can spread coronavirus. He added that the spread of coronavirus is mainly from human to human. He further said, "Chances of its spread from pets to humans is very very unlikely. So having pets at home is safe."

Headline: Karnataka reports 17 new COVID-19 cases, total no. of cases rises to 232
Description: Karnataka has reported 17 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 232. Bengaluru Urban with 52 active cases is the worst affected district. Out of the 172 active cases in Karnataka, 168 patients including a pregnant woman are in isolation at designated hospitals, while four patients are in ICU.
Text: Karnataka reports 17 new COVID-19 cases, total no. of cases rises to 232 Karnataka has reported 17 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the state to 232. Bengaluru Urban with 52 active cases is the worst affected district. Out of the 172 active cases in Karnataka, 168 patients including a pregnant woman are in isolation at designated hospitals, while four patients are in ICU.

Headline: Gujarat reports 23 new coronavirus cases, total cases cross 500
Description: Gujarat reported 23 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, with the total number of cases there crossing 500 with a tally of 516, said the state's health department. Of the new cases, 16 were reported in Ahmedabad. The state has reported at least 22 deaths due to coronavirus and 44 patients have been discharged.
Text: Gujarat reports 23 new coronavirus cases, total cases cross 500 Gujarat reported 23 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, with the total number of cases there crossing 500 with a tally of 516, said the state's health department. Of the new cases, 16 were reported in Ahmedabad. The state has reported at least 22 deaths due to coronavirus and 44 patients have been discharged.

Headline: Follow SC directions on migrant workers' welfare at relief camps: Centre to states
Description: Union Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has written to states and Union Territories asking them to ensure compliance to Supreme Court (SC) directions on welfare of migrant labourers housed at relief shelters. SC ordered proper arrangements for food, clean drinking water and sanitation at all shelters. It further directed that adequate medical facilities be made available at all such shelters.
Text: Follow SC directions on migrant workers' welfare at relief camps: Centre to states Union Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has written to states and Union Territories asking them to ensure compliance to Supreme Court (SC) directions on welfare of migrant labourers housed at relief shelters. SC ordered proper arrangements for food, clean drinking water and sanitation at all shelters. It further directed that adequate medical facilities be made available at all such shelters.

Headline: India gifting 5 lakh tablets of hydroxychloroquine to Afghanistan
Description: Embassy of India in Kabul today announced India is gifting 5 lakh tablets of hydroxychloroquine to Afghanistan for health professionals and COVID-19 positive cases. It also added that 251 containers carrying 5,022 MT of wheat out of total gift of 75,000 MT set sail today from Kandla Port to Chabahar Port and will ensure food security amid the pandemic.
Text: India gifting 5 lakh tablets of hydroxychloroquine to Afghanistan Embassy of India in Kabul today announced India is gifting 5 lakh tablets of hydroxychloroquine to Afghanistan for health professionals and COVID-19 positive cases. It also added that 251 containers carrying 5,022 MT of wheat out of total gift of 75,000 MT set sail today from Kandla Port to Chabahar Port and will ensure food security amid the pandemic.

Headline: Andhra bans spitting of chewing tobacco in public over risk of COVID-19 spread
Description: Andhra Pradesh government on Sunday prohibited consumption of smokeless or chewable tobacco products and spitting them in public places, amid spread of coronavirus in India. ICMR had earlier appealed to people to refrain from spitting in public as it increases the risk of spread of the infection. Spitting in public has also been banned by state government in Telangana.
Text: Andhra bans spitting of chewing tobacco in public over risk of COVID-19 spread Andhra Pradesh government on Sunday prohibited consumption of smokeless or chewable tobacco products and spitting them in public places, amid spread of coronavirus in India. ICMR had earlier appealed to people to refrain from spitting in public as it increases the risk of spread of the infection. Spitting in public has also been banned by state government in Telangana.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Haryana reach 181, Nuh most affected district
Description: Haryana reported 16 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 181. Nuh, which reported seven new cases today, is the most affected district with total 45 COVID-19 cases. Yamunanagar reported three cases, Faridabad and Kurukshetra reported two cases each and one case each was reported from Jind and Karnal.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Haryana reach 181, Nuh most affected district Haryana reported 16 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 181. Nuh, which reported seven new cases today, is the most affected district with total 45 COVID-19 cases. Yamunanagar reported three cases, Faridabad and Kurukshetra reported two cases each and one case each was reported from Jind and Karnal.

Headline: Parliament was run to topple Cong govt in Madhya Pradesh: Kamal Nath
Description: Congress leader Kamal Nath on Sunday said, "Parliament was run only to ensure that Madhya Pradesh Assembly could run and the Congress government be toppled." He said the BJP has fooled the people of Madhya Pradesh as there was no council of ministers or a Health or Home Minister in the state amid the crisis due to the coronavirus outbreak.
Text: Parliament was run to topple Cong govt in Madhya Pradesh: Kamal Nath Congress leader Kamal Nath on Sunday said, "Parliament was run only to ensure that Madhya Pradesh Assembly could run and the Congress government be toppled." He said the BJP has fooled the people of Madhya Pradesh as there was no council of ministers or a Health or Home Minister in the state amid the crisis due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Headline: Minor among three killed in Pakistan shelling along LoC in Kashmir
Description: Three civilians including a minor and a woman were killed as the Pakistani army violated the ceasefire by resorting to firing of small arms and mortar shelling along the LoC in Kashmir's Kupwara district on Sunday. The deceased were identified as Shameena Begum, Javeed Khan and Zayan, an 8-year-old boy. SSP Kupwara Ambarkar Shriram Dinkar confirmed the killing of civilians.
Text: Minor among three killed in Pakistan shelling along LoC in Kashmir Three civilians including a minor and a woman were killed as the Pakistani army violated the ceasefire by resorting to firing of small arms and mortar shelling along the LoC in Kashmir's Kupwara district on Sunday. The deceased were identified as Shameena Begum, Javeed Khan and Zayan, an 8-year-old boy. SSP Kupwara Ambarkar Shriram Dinkar confirmed the killing of civilians.

Headline: Stay where you are: Envoy to stranded Indian students in US
Description: India's Ambassador to the US Taranjit Singh Sandhu urged the stranded Indian students in the US to stay where they are and assured them help amid the coronavirus pandemic. He also said that the students can make their travel plans to India once the situation improves. Sandhu interacted with some of the students during an Instagram live session.
Text: Stay where you are: Envoy to stranded Indian students in US India's Ambassador to the US Taranjit Singh Sandhu urged the stranded Indian students in the US to stay where they are and assured them help amid the coronavirus pandemic. He also said that the students can make their travel plans to India once the situation improves. Sandhu interacted with some of the students during an Instagram live session.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 8,447
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 8,447. It further said that the total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 765. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 7,409.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 8,447 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 8,447. It further said that the total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 765. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 7,409.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu cross 1,000; death toll at 11
Description: As many as 106 patients tested positive for coronavirus in Tamil Nadu today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,075. The death toll due to coronavirus in Tamil Nadu stands at 11, while the number of patients who have recovered from the virus is 50. India has reported over 8,400 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu cross 1,000; death toll at 11 As many as 106 patients tested positive for coronavirus in Tamil Nadu today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,075. The death toll due to coronavirus in Tamil Nadu stands at 11, while the number of patients who have recovered from the virus is 50. India has reported over 8,400 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: 909 COVID-19 cases, 34 deaths reported, 74 patients recovered in last 24 hrs: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 909 coronavirus cases and 34 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that 74 patients have been cured in India in the last 24 hours, while 139 patients recovered two days ago. A total of 716 patients have recovered, he added.
Text: 909 COVID-19 cases, 34 deaths reported, 74 patients recovered in last 24 hrs: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 909 coronavirus cases and 34 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that 74 patients have been cured in India in the last 24 hours, while 139 patients recovered two days ago. A total of 716 patients have recovered, he added.

Headline: 25-yr-old TikTok user who made fun of masks in videos tests positive for coronavirus
Description: A 25-year-old man, who in a TikTok video ridiculed use of masks for protection against COVID-19, has tested positive for the disease in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar. Authorities at the hospital where he's admitted seized his mobile phone as he kept posting more videos from the isolation facility. "His condition is stable," Government Bundelkhand Medical College Dean Dr GS Patel said.
Text: 25-yr-old TikTok user who made fun of masks in videos tests positive for coronavirus A 25-year-old man, who in a TikTok video ridiculed use of masks for protection against COVID-19, has tested positive for the disease in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar. Authorities at the hospital where he's admitted seized his mobile phone as he kept posting more videos from the isolation facility. "His condition is stable," Government Bundelkhand Medical College Dean Dr GS Patel said.

Headline: Earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hits Delhi-NCR, tremors felt
Description: Earthquake tremors were felt in Delhi and the National Capital Region on Sunday evening. Initial reports suggested that there was no loss of life or property. The epicentre of the earthquake, recorded  3.5 on Richter scale, was in East Delhi, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.
Text: Earthquake of magnitude 3.5 hits Delhi-NCR, tremors felt Earthquake tremors were felt in Delhi and the National Capital Region on Sunday evening. Initial reports suggested that there was no loss of life or property. The epicentre of the earthquake, recorded  3.5 on Richter scale, was in East Delhi, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

Headline: CAF jawan hitchhikes over 1,100 km to reach village after mother's death
Description: Chhattisgarh Armed Force (CAF) jawan, Santosh Yadav, travelled over 1,100 km in three days using goods trains, trucks and riverboat, to reach his village in UP after his mother's death. Yadav said he was stopped at several places by authorities but was allowed to proceed on humanitarian grounds. "I couldn't leave my father alone in such a situation," he added.
Text: CAF jawan hitchhikes over 1,100 km to reach village after mother's death Chhattisgarh Armed Force (CAF) jawan, Santosh Yadav, travelled over 1,100 km in three days using goods trains, trucks and riverboat, to reach his village in UP after his mother's death. Yadav said he was stopped at several places by authorities but was allowed to proceed on humanitarian grounds. "I couldn't leave my father alone in such a situation," he added.

Headline: Count Rajasthan firm donations to CM Relief Fund under CSR: Gehlot to PM
Description: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi to give the funds donated by the companies and industries in the state to the Rajasthan CM Relief Fund COVID-19 Mitigation Fund the status of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) activity. Gehlot said, "This would help Rajasthan in fighting COVID-19 pandemic with its firm resolve and commitment."
Text: Count Rajasthan firm donations to CM Relief Fund under CSR: Gehlot to PM Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi to give the funds donated by the companies and industries in the state to the Rajasthan CM Relief Fund COVID-19 Mitigation Fund the status of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) activity. Gehlot said, "This would help Rajasthan in fighting COVID-19 pandemic with its firm resolve and commitment."

Headline: Commissioner in Andhra Pradesh joins work few days after giving birth
Description: The Commissioner of Andhra Pradesh's Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation, Srijana Gummalla, returned to work within few days of giving birth. Srijana said she was aware of the importance of being at work during these difficult times (COVID-19 outbreak) therefore she joined back without taking maternity leave. "My role is just a small part in this humongous effort," she added.
Text: Commissioner in Andhra Pradesh joins work few days after giving birth The Commissioner of Andhra Pradesh's Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation, Srijana Gummalla, returned to work within few days of giving birth. Srijana said she was aware of the importance of being at work during these difficult times (COVID-19 outbreak) therefore she joined back without taking maternity leave. "My role is just a small part in this humongous effort," she added.

Headline: Not enough to have lockdown, intense testing needed: Kerala Minister
Description: Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac has said that although lockdown is important, it is not enough for 'stamping out' coronavirus. "Equally important is that we should have intense testing, tracing and isolating (of people with coronavirus infection)," Isaac was quoted as saying by PTI. Several states have extended lockdown till April 30 amid rise in coronavirus cases.
Text: Not enough to have lockdown, intense testing needed: Kerala Minister Kerala Finance Minister Thomas Isaac has said that although lockdown is important, it is not enough for 'stamping out' coronavirus. "Equally important is that we should have intense testing, tracing and isolating (of people with coronavirus infection)," Isaac was quoted as saying by PTI. Several states have extended lockdown till April 30 amid rise in coronavirus cases.

Headline: Medical team taken hostage by family while screening for COVID-19 in J&K
Description: A medical team was kept hostage inside a house by family of a person who was to be screened for COVID-19 in Budgam district of Jammu and Kashmir. The person's family members didn't allow the team to conduct the screening. A police team reached the area to rescue the medical practitioners, but was attacked with stones, leaving three officials injured.
Text: Medical team taken hostage by family while screening for COVID-19 in J&K A medical team was kept hostage inside a house by family of a person who was to be screened for COVID-19 in Budgam district of Jammu and Kashmir. The person's family members didn't allow the team to conduct the screening. A police team reached the area to rescue the medical practitioners, but was attacked with stones, leaving three officials injured.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 96 new COVID-19 cases, state total nears 800
Description: Rajasthan reported 96 new COVID-19 cases till 2 pm on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 796. Jaipur reported 35 cases, Banswara reported 15, Tonk reported 11, Bikaner and Jodhpur reported eight cases each, Kota reported seven, Nagaur reported five, Hanumangarh reported two cases, and one case each was reported in Churu, Jaisalmer and Sikar.
Text: Rajasthan reports 96 new COVID-19 cases, state total nears 800 Rajasthan reported 96 new COVID-19 cases till 2 pm on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 796. Jaipur reported 35 cases, Banswara reported 15, Tonk reported 11, Bikaner and Jodhpur reported eight cases each, Kota reported seven, Nagaur reported five, Hanumangarh reported two cases, and one case each was reported in Churu, Jaisalmer and Sikar.

Headline: 4 Haryana districts including Gurugram declared COVID-19 'red zones'
Description: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday said that four of the state's districts having maximum number of COVID-19 cases are to be treated as 'red zones'. The four districts- Gurugram, Faridabad, Nuh and Palwal account for over 100 of the total 177 coronavirus cases in the state. Stricter restrictions will be placed in these districts to check virus spread.
Text: 4 Haryana districts including Gurugram declared COVID-19 'red zones' Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday said that four of the state's districts having maximum number of COVID-19 cases are to be treated as 'red zones'. The four districts- Gurugram, Faridabad, Nuh and Palwal account for over 100 of the total 177 coronavirus cases in the state. Stricter restrictions will be placed in these districts to check virus spread.

Headline: Delhi govt replaces 'Markaz' with 'Special Operations' in COVID-19 health bulletin
Description: The Delhi government has dropped the name 'Markaz Related' from its daily health bulletin of COVID-19 status and replaced it with 'Under Special Operations'. "Markaz operation wasn't only one but several others too," said Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain. This comes after Delhi Minorities Commission asked the Health Department to drop mention of Nizamuddin Markaz in its daily bulletins.
Text: Delhi govt replaces 'Markaz' with 'Special Operations' in COVID-19 health bulletin The Delhi government has dropped the name 'Markaz Related' from its daily health bulletin of COVID-19 status and replaced it with 'Under Special Operations'. "Markaz operation wasn't only one but several others too," said Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain. This comes after Delhi Minorities Commission asked the Health Department to drop mention of Nizamuddin Markaz in its daily bulletins.

Headline: Southern Railway converts 573 coaches into COVID-19 isolation wards
Description: Southern Railway has converted 573 coaches into isolation wards for COVID-19 patients. The features of the isolation coaches include cabins with 3 dustbins with foot-operated lids and garbage bags and one Indian-style lavatory converted into a bathroom. Indian Railways consulted the Armed Forces Medical Services, medical departments of various Zonal Railways and Ayushman Bharat for the project.
Text: Southern Railway converts 573 coaches into COVID-19 isolation wards Southern Railway has converted 573 coaches into isolation wards for COVID-19 patients. The features of the isolation coaches include cabins with 3 dustbins with foot-operated lids and garbage bags and one Indian-style lavatory converted into a bathroom. Indian Railways consulted the Armed Forces Medical Services, medical departments of various Zonal Railways and Ayushman Bharat for the project.

Headline: Today if we need 1,671 beds, we've 1.05 lakh beds in 601 COVID-19 hospitals: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "As per 9th April data, if we needed 1,100 beds we had 85,000 beds." "Today if we need 1,671 beds, we have 1 lakh 5 thousand beds in the dedicated 601 COVID-19 hospitals," he added. "Government is planning things in being over-prepared so as to manage...situation," Agarwal stated.
Text: Today if we need 1,671 beds, we've 1.05 lakh beds in 601 COVID-19 hospitals: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "As per 9th April data, if we needed 1,100 beds we had 85,000 beds." "Today if we need 1,671 beds, we have 1 lakh 5 thousand beds in the dedicated 601 COVID-19 hospitals," he added. "Government is planning things in being over-prepared so as to manage...situation," Agarwal stated.

Headline: Whole world says COVID-19 emerged in China: BJP MLA on 'Chinese virus' slogan
Description: BJP MLA T Raja Singh has responded to criticism by a Chinese embassy official over the former's 'Chinese virus go back' slogan. "Not only me but the whole world says coronavirus originated from Wuhan (China)," said Raja responding to Chinese counselor Liu Bing's letter. Calling coronavirus 'Chinese virus' "is an act of stigma", said Bing in his letter to Raja.
Text: Whole world says COVID-19 emerged in China: BJP MLA on 'Chinese virus' slogan BJP MLA T Raja Singh has responded to criticism by a Chinese embassy official over the former's 'Chinese virus go back' slogan. "Not only me but the whole world says coronavirus originated from Wuhan (China)," said Raja responding to Chinese counselor Liu Bing's letter. Calling coronavirus 'Chinese virus' "is an act of stigma", said Bing in his letter to Raja.

Headline: Enough food grains to feed over 81 cr poor for 9 months: Paswan
Description: Union Food and Public Distribution Minister Ram Vilas Paswan has said that central government has enough grains to feed over 81 crore Public Distribution System (PDS) beneficiaries for nine months. Government godowns have approximately 535 lakh metric tons of wheat and rice, which are two major grains supplied to poor, said Paswan. Several states have extended coronavirus lockdown till month-end.
Text: Enough food grains to feed over 81 cr poor for 9 months: Paswan Union Food and Public Distribution Minister Ram Vilas Paswan has said that central government has enough grains to feed over 81 crore Public Distribution System (PDS) beneficiaries for nine months. Government godowns have approximately 535 lakh metric tons of wheat and rice, which are two major grains supplied to poor, said Paswan. Several states have extended coronavirus lockdown till month-end.

Headline: 21 new coronavirus cases in J&K, total number in UT rises to 245
Description: Jammu and Kashmir reported 21 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 245, said Rohit Kansal, Principal Secretary (Planning), J&K. Of these, 17 cases were reported from Kashmir division and four were reported from Jammu division, said Kansal. The Union Territory currently has 235 active positive coronavirus cases.
Text: 21 new coronavirus cases in J&K, total number in UT rises to 245 Jammu and Kashmir reported 21 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 245, said Rohit Kansal, Principal Secretary (Planning), J&K. Of these, 17 cases were reported from Kashmir division and four were reported from Jammu division, said Kansal. The Union Territory currently has 235 active positive coronavirus cases.

Headline: Isolation wards set up at Corbett Tiger Reserve to save animals from COVID-19
Description: Authorities at Uttarakhand's Corbett Tiger Reserve have set up quarantine wards in its ranges for tigers, elephants and sniffer dog squads to protect them from coronavirus. This comes after a tiger tested COVID-19 positive in the US. Apart from wards, 40 video cameras and 450 still cameras have been installed to keep a tab on any abnormal behaviour by animals.
Text: Isolation wards set up at Corbett Tiger Reserve to save animals from COVID-19 Authorities at Uttarakhand's Corbett Tiger Reserve have set up quarantine wards in its ranges for tigers, elephants and sniffer dog squads to protect them from coronavirus. This comes after a tiger tested COVID-19 positive in the US. Apart from wards, 40 video cameras and 450 still cameras have been installed to keep a tab on any abnormal behaviour by animals.

Headline: 65-yr-old TN man cycles 140 km to take wife for her chemo session amid lockdown
Description: A 65-year-old man from a village in Tamil Nadu pedalled around 140 km on his bicycle to reach a hospital in Puducherry for his wife's chemotherapy session amid the lockdown. The couple started at around 4.45 am and reached JIPMER Hospital at about 10.15 pm on March 31. The couple were sent back home the next day in an ambulance.
Text: 65-yr-old TN man cycles 140 km to take wife for her chemo session amid lockdown A 65-year-old man from a village in Tamil Nadu pedalled around 140 km on his bicycle to reach a hospital in Puducherry for his wife's chemotherapy session amid the lockdown. The couple started at around 4.45 am and reached JIPMER Hospital at about 10.15 pm on March 31. The couple were sent back home the next day in an ambulance.

Headline: Aligarh doctors buy protective gear worth ₹1 lakh after raising funds
Description: Junior doctors at the Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College Hospital in Aligarh city of Uttar Pradesh have purchased protective gear worth ₹1 lakh. Shah Nawaz Iqbali, Vice President of the Resident Doctors' Association, said that the association raised funds through donations for purchasing critical protective gear like surgical masks and sanitisers in view of the threat posed by coronavirus.
Text: Aligarh doctors buy protective gear worth ₹1 lakh after raising funds Junior doctors at the Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College Hospital in Aligarh city of Uttar Pradesh have purchased protective gear worth ₹1 lakh. Shah Nawaz Iqbali, Vice President of the Resident Doctors' Association, said that the association raised funds through donations for purchasing critical protective gear like surgical masks and sanitisers in view of the threat posed by coronavirus.

Headline: 2 die of COVID-19 in MP's Indore; reports come positive after death
Description: Two people have died of COVID-19 in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, taking the death toll in the city to 32, officials said on Sunday. After the death of the two patients, aged 75 and 65 years, their sample test reports came positive, Indore's Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadiya said. Over 500 cases have been recorded in MP so far.
Text: 2 die of COVID-19 in MP's Indore; reports come positive after death Two people have died of COVID-19 in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, taking the death toll in the city to 32, officials said on Sunday. After the death of the two patients, aged 75 and 65 years, their sample test reports came positive, Indore's Chief Medical and Health Officer Praveen Jadiya said. Over 500 cases have been recorded in MP so far.

Headline: Govt launches YUKTI portal to address students' concerns amid lockdown
Description: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal on Sunday launched YUKTI (Young India Combating COVID with Knowledge, Technology and Innovation), a web portal to monitor and record the ministry's initiative amid the outbreak. YUKTI will help in issues related to student promotion policies, placements, and physical and mental well-being, he said. Its primary aim is to keep the academic community healthy, he added.
Text: Govt launches YUKTI portal to address students' concerns amid lockdown HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal on Sunday launched YUKTI (Young India Combating COVID with Knowledge, Technology and Innovation), a web portal to monitor and record the ministry's initiative amid the outbreak. YUKTI will help in issues related to student promotion policies, placements, and physical and mental well-being, he said. Its primary aim is to keep the academic community healthy, he added.

Headline: Union Minister Paswan gets beard shaved by son amid lockdown, shares video
Description: Ram Vilas Paswan, the Union Minister of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution, got his beard shaved by his son Chirag Paswan as salons remain closed amid coronavirus lockdown. He retweeted a video posted by his son that showed the minister being groomed. "Tough times but lockdown also has a brighter side...Never knew had these skills too," tweeted Chirag Paswan.
Text: Union Minister Paswan gets beard shaved by son amid lockdown, shares video Ram Vilas Paswan, the Union Minister of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution, got his beard shaved by his son Chirag Paswan as salons remain closed amid coronavirus lockdown. He retweeted a video posted by his son that showed the minister being groomed. "Tough times but lockdown also has a brighter side...Never knew had these skills too," tweeted Chirag Paswan.

Headline: Disgusted, angry over attacks on doctors amid pandemic: Ajay
Description: Ajay Devgn took to Twitter on Sunday to express his disappointment over the incidents of healthcare workers being attacked by people amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Disgusted and angry to read reports of 'educated' persons attacking doctors in their neighbourhood on baseless assumptions," he wrote. "Such insensitive people are the worst criminals," Ajay further wrote.
Text: Disgusted, angry over attacks on doctors amid pandemic: Ajay Ajay Devgn took to Twitter on Sunday to express his disappointment over the incidents of healthcare workers being attacked by people amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Disgusted and angry to read reports of 'educated' persons attacking doctors in their neighbourhood on baseless assumptions," he wrote. "Such insensitive people are the worst criminals," Ajay further wrote.

Headline: Ahmedabad Municipal Corp to fine people for not wearing face masks
Description: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation has made it compulsory to wear masks while stepping out in public, amid spread of coronavirus in India. The rule comes into effect from 6 am on April 13 and violators may have to pay a fine of up to ₹5,000. Failure to pay fine may result in a jail term, said Ahmedabad Municipal Commissioner Vijay Nehra.
Text: Ahmedabad Municipal Corp to fine people for not wearing face masks Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation has made it compulsory to wear masks while stepping out in public, amid spread of coronavirus in India. The rule comes into effect from 6 am on April 13 and violators may have to pay a fine of up to ₹5,000. Failure to pay fine may result in a jail term, said Ahmedabad Municipal Commissioner Vijay Nehra.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 8,000; death toll reaches 273
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 8,356, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Sunday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 273 in the country. Out of the total cases, 7,367 cases are active, while 716 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India cross 8,000; death toll reaches 273 The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 8,356, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Sunday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 273 in the country. Out of the total cases, 7,367 cases are active, while 716 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Railways delivers camel milk to 3-yr-old autistic boy after mother tweets to PM
Description: Railways transported 20 litres of camel milk in Mumbai after a woman tweeted to PM Narendra Modi about it for her 3.5-year-old autistic son. "My...child has food allergies...Help me get Camel Milk or its powder from Sadri (Rajasthan)," she'd tweeted. "We'll do whatever is needed to help people out," Chief Passenger Traffic Manager, North Western Railway, Tarun Jain told PTI.
Text: Railways delivers camel milk to 3-yr-old autistic boy after mother tweets to PM Railways transported 20 litres of camel milk in Mumbai after a woman tweeted to PM Narendra Modi about it for her 3.5-year-old autistic son. "My...child has food allergies...Help me get Camel Milk or its powder from Sadri (Rajasthan)," she'd tweeted. "We'll do whatever is needed to help people out," Chief Passenger Traffic Manager, North Western Railway, Tarun Jain told PTI.

Headline: Telangana extends lockdown till April 30 after coronavirus cases in state cross 500
Description: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao on Saturday announced that the ongoing lockdown has been extended in the state till April 30. This comes after the number of coronavirus cases in the state crossed 500, while the death toll stands at 14. He also announced that students from Class 1 to 9 would be promoted in the state.
Text: Telangana extends lockdown till April 30 after coronavirus cases in state cross 500 Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao on Saturday announced that the ongoing lockdown has been extended in the state till April 30. This comes after the number of coronavirus cases in the state crossed 500, while the death toll stands at 14. He also announced that students from Class 1 to 9 would be promoted in the state.

Headline: 51 more COVID-19 cases recorded in Rajasthan, state tally reaches 751
Description: At least 51 more cases of COVID-19 have been reported from Rajasthan on Sunday, taking the state's tally to 751, the state's health department said. Out of these, 15 cases are from Banswara, eight from Bikaner and one from Churu. Moreover, 15 cases were reported from Jaipur, one from Jaisalmer, eight from Jodhpur, one from Sikar and two from Hanumangarh.
Text: 51 more COVID-19 cases recorded in Rajasthan, state tally reaches 751 At least 51 more cases of COVID-19 have been reported from Rajasthan on Sunday, taking the state's tally to 751, the state's health department said. Out of these, 15 cases are from Banswara, eight from Bikaner and one from Churu. Moreover, 15 cases were reported from Jaipur, one from Jaisalmer, eight from Jodhpur, one from Sikar and two from Hanumangarh.

Headline: Students from Class 1 to 9 of all schools in Telangana to get promoted: CM
Description: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao announced that students from Class 1 to 9 of all public and private schools will be promoted to the next class. The decision was taken after a state Cabinet meeting on Saturday. The lockdown in the state has also been extended till April 30 as the positive cases reached over 500, the CM said.
Text: Students from Class 1 to 9 of all schools in Telangana to get promoted: CM Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao announced that students from Class 1 to 9 of all public and private schools will be promoted to the next class. The decision was taken after a state Cabinet meeting on Saturday. The lockdown in the state has also been extended till April 30 as the positive cases reached over 500, the CM said.

Headline: 4 more coronavirus cases confirmed in Himachal today, total rises to 32
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Himachal Pradesh has risen to 32 after four more cases were confirmed in the state today. As many as 954 people have been tested for coronavirus, out of which 922 have tested negative till date. Himachal Pradesh has reported one death due to coronavirus till now.
Text: 4 more coronavirus cases confirmed in Himachal today, total rises to 32 The total number of coronavirus cases in Himachal Pradesh has risen to 32 after four more cases were confirmed in the state today. As many as 954 people have been tested for coronavirus, out of which 922 have tested negative till date. Himachal Pradesh has reported one death due to coronavirus till now.

Headline: 10 new coronavirus cases reported in Kerala today, total rises to 373
Description: As many as 10 new coronavirus cases were reported in Kerala today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 373. Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said that the 10 new cases include seven from Kannur, one from Kozhikode and two from Kasaragod. He further said that 228 out of the 373 cases are active.
Text: 10 new coronavirus cases reported in Kerala today, total rises to 373 As many as 10 new coronavirus cases were reported in Kerala today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 373. Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said that the 10 new cases include seven from Kannur, one from Kozhikode and two from Kasaragod. He further said that 228 out of the 373 cases are active.

Headline: My boys are scared but can't say no to work; it needs me: ASHA worker amid COVID-19
Description: Ranjita Vimal, a 40-year-old ASHA worker, who's part of Delhi government's surveillance team for COVID-19 in Central Delhi, said her teenage sons are scared for her. "But I can't say no to my work; it needs me right now," she added. Ranjita has been conducting door-to-door surveys in Sadar Bazaar and Nabi Karim areas, two of Delhi's containment zones.
Text: My boys are scared but can't say no to work; it needs me: ASHA worker amid COVID-19 Ranjita Vimal, a 40-year-old ASHA worker, who's part of Delhi government's surveillance team for COVID-19 in Central Delhi, said her teenage sons are scared for her. "But I can't say no to my work; it needs me right now," she added. Ranjita has been conducting door-to-door surveys in Sadar Bazaar and Nabi Karim areas, two of Delhi's containment zones.

Headline: IndiGo employee dies of COVID-19 infection in Chennai
Description: IndiGo on Saturday said one of its staff passed away due to coronavirus infection in Chennai. "We are providing all support to the family and stand with them at this hour of deep grief," IndiGo said in its statement. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, over 270 have died due to COVID-19 in the country so far.
Text: IndiGo employee dies of COVID-19 infection in Chennai IndiGo on Saturday said one of its staff passed away due to coronavirus infection in Chennai. "We are providing all support to the family and stand with them at this hour of deep grief," IndiGo said in its statement. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, over 270 have died due to COVID-19 in the country so far.

Headline: Abandoned Kerala houseboats to be used as isolation wards in case of emergency
Description: Houseboats in Kerala's Alappuzha, which have been abandoned due to the lockdown, can be converted into isolation wards for COVID-19 patients in case of an emergency, Alappuzha District Collector M Anjana said. They will have around 1,500 to 2,000 beds which can be converted to isolation wards, Anjana added. Over 360 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Kerala so far.
Text: Abandoned Kerala houseboats to be used as isolation wards in case of emergency Houseboats in Kerala's Alappuzha, which have been abandoned due to the lockdown, can be converted into isolation wards for COVID-19 patients in case of an emergency, Alappuzha District Collector M Anjana said. They will have around 1,500 to 2,000 beds which can be converted to isolation wards, Anjana added. Over 360 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in Kerala so far.

Headline: 3 COVID-19 patients recover in Himachal Pradesh
Description: A health official in Himachal Pradesh said that three more COVID-19 patients in the state recovered from the infection on Saturday. All three patients are residents of Uttar Pradesh and had tested positive for the virus on April 4. With this, the total number of cases which have recovered from the infection in Himachal Pradesh reached nine.
Text: 3 COVID-19 patients recover in Himachal Pradesh A health official in Himachal Pradesh said that three more COVID-19 patients in the state recovered from the infection on Saturday. All three patients are residents of Uttar Pradesh and had tested positive for the virus on April 4. With this, the total number of cases which have recovered from the infection in Himachal Pradesh reached nine.

Headline: Provide police security to medical staff on COVID-19 duty: Centre to states
Description: Union Home Ministry has directed states and Union Territories and their respective police authorities to provide necessary security to doctors and other medical staff fighting COVID-19. Medical staff is to be protected during visits to hospitals for screening or quarantine centres where COVID-19 patients are admitted, said Joint Secretary (Home Affairs) Punya Salila Srivastava.
Text: Provide police security to medical staff on COVID-19 duty: Centre to states Union Home Ministry has directed states and Union Territories and their respective police authorities to provide necessary security to doctors and other medical staff fighting COVID-19. Medical staff is to be protected during visits to hospitals for screening or quarantine centres where COVID-19 patients are admitted, said Joint Secretary (Home Affairs) Punya Salila Srivastava.

Headline: Several employees of Taj Hotels test positive for coronavirus in Mumbai
Description: The Indian Hotels Company Ltd, which runs the Taj chain of properties, on Saturday said an unspecified number of its employees in Mumbai have tested positive for coronavirus, adding that 500 have been tested so far. Those who tested positive have been hospitalised, the company further said. Several Taj Hotels in Mumbai are currently hosting doctors and other health workers.
Text: Several employees of Taj Hotels test positive for coronavirus in Mumbai The Indian Hotels Company Ltd, which runs the Taj chain of properties, on Saturday said an unspecified number of its employees in Mumbai have tested positive for coronavirus, adding that 500 have been tested so far. Those who tested positive have been hospitalised, the company further said. Several Taj Hotels in Mumbai are currently hosting doctors and other health workers.

Headline: How does govt respond when a coronavirus case is confirmed?
Description: Udaipur District Magistrate IAS Anandhi told The Quint that whenever a coronavirus case is confirmed, government traces patient's travel history and contacts, and declares a curfew in marked containment zone. The patient's family and high-risk contacts are tested and door-to-door checks are conducted in the area. The area is sanitised using sodium hypochlorite and supply of essentials is ensured.
Text: How does govt respond when a coronavirus case is confirmed? Udaipur District Magistrate IAS Anandhi told The Quint that whenever a coronavirus case is confirmed, government traces patient's travel history and contacts, and declares a curfew in marked containment zone. The patient's family and high-risk contacts are tested and door-to-door checks are conducted in the area. The area is sanitised using sodium hypochlorite and supply of essentials is ensured.

Headline: India conducts 17,143 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in a day so far
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 17,143 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 600 samples tested positive. Further, 1,79,374 samples from 1,64,773 individuals have been tested in India so far.
Text: India conducts 17,143 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in a day so far The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 17,143 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 600 samples tested positive. Further, 1,79,374 samples from 1,64,773 individuals have been tested in India so far.

Headline: HCQ drug exported from India reaches US amid coronavirus crisis; pic surfaces
Description: A consignment of Hydroxychloroquine from India arrived at Newark airport on Sunday, India's Ambassador to the US, Taranjit Singh Sandhu tweeted. "Supporting our partners in the fight against #Covid19," he wrote while sharing a picture. Earlier, US President Donald Trump had thanked India for its decision to export the anti-malarial drug which is seen as a possible treatment for coronavirus.
Text: HCQ drug exported from India reaches US amid coronavirus crisis; pic surfaces A consignment of Hydroxychloroquine from India arrived at Newark airport on Sunday, India's Ambassador to the US, Taranjit Singh Sandhu tweeted. "Supporting our partners in the fight against #Covid19," he wrote while sharing a picture. Earlier, US President Donald Trump had thanked India for its decision to export the anti-malarial drug which is seen as a possible treatment for coronavirus.

Headline: Foreigners made to write 'sorry' 500 times for violating lockdown in Rishikesh
