Description: A group of 10 foreigners in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, was on Saturday made to write "sorry" 500 times for violating the lockdown guidelines. "'I did not follow the rules of lockdown so I am so sorry', each one of them wrote 500 times," Sub-Inspector Vinod Kumar Sharma said. The foreigners, from different countries, were caught loitering around in the Tapovan area.
Text: Foreigners made to write 'sorry' 500 times for violating lockdown in Rishikesh A group of 10 foreigners in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand, was on Saturday made to write "sorry" 500 times for violating the lockdown guidelines. "'I did not follow the rules of lockdown so I am so sorry', each one of them wrote 500 times," Sub-Inspector Vinod Kumar Sharma said. The foreigners, from different countries, were caught loitering around in the Tapovan area.

Headline: 72-year-old woman suspected of COVID-19 escapes from Bihar hospital
Description: A 72-year-old woman, suspected of COVID-19, escaped from Bihar's Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) on Sunday. PMCH administration has notified the police and investigation into the case has begun. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), the state has recorded 63 COVID-19 cases and one person has died due to the infection so far.
Text: 72-year-old woman suspected of COVID-19 escapes from Bihar hospital A 72-year-old woman, suspected of COVID-19, escaped from Bihar's Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) on Sunday. PMCH administration has notified the police and investigation into the case has begun. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), the state has recorded 63 COVID-19 cases and one person has died due to the infection so far.

Headline: Over 30 cr poor get ₹28,256-cr aid under PM Garib Kalyan Yojana: Govt
Description: More than 30 crore poor beneficiaries have been given ₹28,256 crore in financial assistance under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana to protect them from impact of the 21-day coronavirus lockdown, said Finance Ministry on Saturday. Government is in process of releasing 1.2 crore metric tons of food grain during April-June under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Ann Yojana, it added.
Text: Over 30 cr poor get ₹28,256-cr aid under PM Garib Kalyan Yojana: Govt More than 30 crore poor beneficiaries have been given ₹28,256 crore in financial assistance under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana to protect them from impact of the 21-day coronavirus lockdown, said Finance Ministry on Saturday. Government is in process of releasing 1.2 crore metric tons of food grain during April-June under Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Ann Yojana, it added.

Headline: Rajasthan govt to promote class 9 and 11 students to next class
Description: Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE) has decided to promote students of classes 1-8 as well as 9 and 11 to the next class, in view of the spread of coronavirus in India. The students will be promoted to the next class based on the marks scored by them in half-yearly exams and co-curricular performance, said an RBSE order.
Text: Rajasthan govt to promote class 9 and 11 students to next class Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE) has decided to promote students of classes 1-8 as well as 9 and 11 to the next class, in view of the spread of coronavirus in India. The students will be promoted to the next class based on the marks scored by them in half-yearly exams and co-curricular performance, said an RBSE order.

Headline: Ratan Tata shares article credited to him, says 'neither said, nor written by me'
Description: While sharing an article credited to him, Ratan Tata said, "This post has neither been said, nor written by me." "I urge you to verify media circulated on WhatsApp and social platforms. If I have something to say, I will say it on my official channels," he added. "Hope you are safe and do take care," he further said.
Text: Ratan Tata shares article credited to him, says 'neither said, nor written by me' While sharing an article credited to him, Ratan Tata said, "This post has neither been said, nor written by me." "I urge you to verify media circulated on WhatsApp and social platforms. If I have something to say, I will say it on my official channels," he added. "Hope you are safe and do take care," he further said.

Headline: Policeman's hand cut off by Nihangs in Punjab; group rammed car into barricade
Description: A policeman's hand was chopped off by Nihangs in Punjab's Patiala after the group rammed car into a police barricade. The group also injured other police officers and a Mandi Board official at Patiala's Sabzi Mandi. The Nihang group will be arrested and further action will be taken soon, Dinkar Gupta, Director General of Police (DGP) Punjab, said.
Text: Policeman's hand cut off by Nihangs in Punjab; group rammed car into barricade A policeman's hand was chopped off by Nihangs in Punjab's Patiala after the group rammed car into a police barricade. The group also injured other police officers and a Mandi Board official at Patiala's Sabzi Mandi. The Nihang group will be arrested and further action will be taken soon, Dinkar Gupta, Director General of Police (DGP) Punjab, said.

Headline: Jamia Coordination Committee member held in connection with CAA protest in NE Delhi
Description: Police have arrested Jamia Millia Islamia's Coordination Committee's media coordinator in connection with anti-CAA protest in Delhi's northeast district. The arrested person, Safoora Zargar, is accused of organising anti-CAA protest in Jaffrabad area, police said. Later, the protest allegedly led to violence between the protestors and supporters of CAA in February in which over 50 were killed.
Text: Jamia Coordination Committee member held in connection with CAA protest in NE Delhi Police have arrested Jamia Millia Islamia's Coordination Committee's media coordinator in connection with anti-CAA protest in Delhi's northeast district. The arrested person, Safoora Zargar, is accused of organising anti-CAA protest in Jaffrabad area, police said. Later, the protest allegedly led to violence between the protestors and supporters of CAA in February in which over 50 were killed.

Headline: Sonu Sood offers food to over 45,000 people in Mumbai daily
Description: Under an initiative called 'Shakti Annadanam', named after his late father, Sonu Sood has been distributing food to over 45,000 people on a daily basis in Mumbai amid the lockdown. "There are many who haven't had meals in days," Sonu said. "To help these people, I've started [the initiative]...I hope I...[can] help as many people as possible," he added.
Text: Sonu Sood offers food to over 45,000 people in Mumbai daily Under an initiative called 'Shakti Annadanam', named after his late father, Sonu Sood has been distributing food to over 45,000 people on a daily basis in Mumbai amid the lockdown. "There are many who haven't had meals in days," Sonu said. "To help these people, I've started [the initiative]...I hope I...[can] help as many people as possible," he added.

Headline: Sad to see health workers are being treated badly: Hema
Description: Sharing a video on Instagram, Hema Malini expressed her concern over the mistreatment of health workers, saying, "I'm very sad that [they] are being treated...badly...[and] restricted from entering their own building." She added that health workers are working to safeguard people from coronavirus. "Remember, opposing them is to play with the safety of the country and every citizen," Hema stated.
Text: Sad to see health workers are being treated badly: Hema Sharing a video on Instagram, Hema Malini expressed her concern over the mistreatment of health workers, saying, "I'm very sad that [they] are being treated...badly...[and] restricted from entering their own building." She added that health workers are working to safeguard people from coronavirus. "Remember, opposing them is to play with the safety of the country and every citizen," Hema stated.

Headline: Drones used in Delhi to spray disinfectants over slums, markets
Description: Municipal corporations in Delhi are using drones to spray disinfectants over slums, markets, high-rise buildings and other congested areas where water tankers and motorised pumps cannot go. Areas that have so far been sprayed with disinfectants using drones include Janakpuri, Nizamuddin, Palam, Sadar Bazar, and Haiderpur, among others. The disinfectant uses a solution of 1% sodium hypochlorite.
Text: Drones used in Delhi to spray disinfectants over slums, markets Municipal corporations in Delhi are using drones to spray disinfectants over slums, markets, high-rise buildings and other congested areas where water tankers and motorised pumps cannot go. Areas that have so far been sprayed with disinfectants using drones include Janakpuri, Nizamuddin, Palam, Sadar Bazar, and Haiderpur, among others. The disinfectant uses a solution of 1% sodium hypochlorite.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat rises to 468, death toll at 22
Description: Gujarat on Saturday reported 36 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of confirmed cases in the state to 468, said the state's health department. Coronavirus death toll in Gujarat rose to 22 after three people died of the virus there on Saturday, said the department. India has reported 7,529 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Gujarat rises to 468, death toll at 22 Gujarat on Saturday reported 36 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of confirmed cases in the state to 468, said the state's health department. Coronavirus death toll in Gujarat rose to 22 after three people died of the virus there on Saturday, said the department. India has reported 7,529 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: Bihar reports 1 coronavirus case in last 24 hours, total cases in state rise to 61
Description: The Bihar Health Department on Saturday said that one confirmed case of coronavirus has been reported in the state in the last 24 hours. It added that the total number of cases in the state has risen to 61. Further, a total of 6,250 samples have been tested in Bihar so far. Bihar has reported one death due to coronavirus.
Text: Bihar reports 1 coronavirus case in last 24 hours, total cases in state rise to 61 The Bihar Health Department on Saturday said that one confirmed case of coronavirus has been reported in the state in the last 24 hours. It added that the total number of cases in the state has risen to 61. Further, a total of 6,250 samples have been tested in Bihar so far. Bihar has reported one death due to coronavirus.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh crosses 400
Description: Andhra Pradesh reported 24 new coronavirus cases on Saturday taking total number of cases there to 405. Among the new cases, 17 were recorded in Guntur district, five were reported in Kurnool and one each in Kadapa and Prakasam districts, said a bulletin from the State Command Control Centre. Six people have died due to the virus in Andhra Pradesh.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh crosses 400 Andhra Pradesh reported 24 new coronavirus cases on Saturday taking total number of cases there to 405. Among the new cases, 17 were recorded in Guntur district, five were reported in Kurnool and one each in Kadapa and Prakasam districts, said a bulletin from the State Command Control Centre. Six people have died due to the virus in Andhra Pradesh.

Headline: 17 new coronavirus cases reported in Uttar Pradesh today, total rises to 448
Description: Uttar Pradesh has reported 17 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of cases to 448, the state health department said. At least 32 people have been discharged after recovery while four have died, the department added. Over 10,000 coronavirus tests have been done in the state so far, UP Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi said.
Text: 17 new coronavirus cases reported in Uttar Pradesh today, total rises to 448 Uttar Pradesh has reported 17 new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, taking the total number of cases to 448, the state health department said. At least 32 people have been discharged after recovery while four have died, the department added. Over 10,000 coronavirus tests have been done in the state so far, UP Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi said.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 117 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 678
Description: Rajasthan has reported 117 new coronavirus cases on Saturday, taking the total number of cases to  678, the state health department said. Jaipur reported 65 new cases, taking the total number of cases to 286. The state has tested over 23,000 samples. Earlier, CM Ashok Gehlot announced ₹50 lakh for family of every government employee who dies due to coronavirus.
Text: Rajasthan reports 117 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 678 Rajasthan has reported 117 new coronavirus cases on Saturday, taking the total number of cases to  678, the state health department said. Jaipur reported 65 new cases, taking the total number of cases to 286. The state has tested over 23,000 samples. Earlier, CM Ashok Gehlot announced ₹50 lakh for family of every government employee who dies due to coronavirus.

Headline: Lockdown in Maha till April 30, will extend again if people don't cooperate: CM
Description: Maharashtra has become the third state after Odisha and Punjab to extend the 21-day lockdown. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the lockdown has been extended till April 30, adding, "It may continue even after April 30 if people don't cooperate in preventing the outbreak." He added that details of protocols to be followed during extended lockdown would be announced later.
Text: Lockdown in Maha till April 30, will extend again if people don't cooperate: CM Maharashtra has become the third state after Odisha and Punjab to extend the 21-day lockdown. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said the lockdown has been extended till April 30, adding, "It may continue even after April 30 if people don't cooperate in preventing the outbreak." He added that details of protocols to be followed during extended lockdown would be announced later.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India reaches 242, cases rise to 7,529
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Saturday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 7,529, while the death toll has reached 242. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 653. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 6,634.
Text: Coronavirus death toll in India reaches 242, cases rise to 7,529 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Saturday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 7,529, while the death toll has reached 242. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 653. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 6,634.

Headline: Without lockdown, containment measures we would've had 8.2L cases by Apr 15: Govt
Description: The government on Saturday said that without lockdown and containment measures, the country would have recorded 8.2 lakh coronavirus cases by April 15. "Had we taken just containment measures, we would have had 1.2 lakh cases by April 15," the government added. However, the government clarified that this is a statistical analysis and not a study conducted by ICMR.
Text: Without lockdown, containment measures we would've had 8.2L cases by Apr 15: Govt The government on Saturday said that without lockdown and containment measures, the country would have recorded 8.2 lakh coronavirus cases by April 15. "Had we taken just containment measures, we would have had 1.2 lakh cases by April 15," the government added. However, the government clarified that this is a statistical analysis and not a study conducted by ICMR.

Headline: Officials attacked while taking COVID-19 patient to hospital in UP; 4 held
Description: A team of police and district officials was attacked on Saturday while attempting to take a COVID-19 patient to hospital in Meerut, UP. Four people have been arrested in connection to the incident, said UP Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi. A police official and a city magistrate were injured in the incident that took place in Jali Kothi area.
Text: Officials attacked while taking COVID-19 patient to hospital in UP; 4 held A team of police and district officials was attacked on Saturday while attempting to take a COVID-19 patient to hospital in Meerut, UP. Four people have been arrested in connection to the incident, said UP Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi. A police official and a city magistrate were injured in the incident that took place in Jali Kothi area.

Headline: Time to use ‘Namaste Trump’ soft power: Cong to PM on Indians losing jobs in US
Description: Congress on Friday urged central government to hold talks with US government to prevent job losses of Indians holding H-1B visas amid coronavirus pandemic. "Time for PM (Narendra Modi) to ensure our soft power of 'Namaste Trump' converts into fair treatment of H-1B visa holders in US," said Congress. About 75,000 Indians may face job terminations in US, it added.
Text: Time to use ‘Namaste Trump’ soft power: Cong to PM on Indians losing jobs in US Congress on Friday urged central government to hold talks with US government to prevent job losses of Indians holding H-1B visas amid coronavirus pandemic. "Time for PM (Narendra Modi) to ensure our soft power of 'Namaste Trump' converts into fair treatment of H-1B visa holders in US," said Congress. About 75,000 Indians may face job terminations in US, it added.

Headline: Kerala launches WhatsApp number to report domestic violence amid lockdown
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Saturday launched the WhatsApp number 9400080292 to report domestic violence in the state, amid coronavirus lockdown. The 24-hour helpline number comes in the wake of reports of increase in domestic violence cases, said CM Vijayan on Facebook. Child helpline number 1098 and women's helpline number 181 can also be used for lodging complaints, he added.
Text: Kerala launches WhatsApp number to report domestic violence amid lockdown Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Saturday launched the WhatsApp number 9400080292 to report domestic violence in the state, amid coronavirus lockdown. The 24-hour helpline number comes in the wake of reports of increase in domestic violence cases, said CM Vijayan on Facebook. Child helpline number 1098 and women's helpline number 181 can also be used for lodging complaints, he added.

Headline: Govt will announce guidelines for next 15 days in 1-2 days: K'taka CM on lockdown
Description: Following PM Narendra Modi's virtual meeting with CMs on coronavirus lockdown extension, Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa said, "PM Modi told us in next 1-2 days government will announce guidelines for next 15 days." "PM told us we must not compromise on lockdown," Yediyurappa further said. Earlier, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "PM Modi has taken correct decision to extend lockdown."
Text: Govt will announce guidelines for next 15 days in 1-2 days: K'taka CM on lockdown Following PM Narendra Modi's virtual meeting with CMs on coronavirus lockdown extension, Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa said, "PM Modi told us in next 1-2 days government will announce guidelines for next 15 days." "PM told us we must not compromise on lockdown," Yediyurappa further said. Earlier, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "PM Modi has taken correct decision to extend lockdown."

Headline: Motto was jaan hai to jahaan hai, now it's jaan bhi jahaan bhi: PM on lockdown exit
Description: During his interaction with CMs of all states to strategise exit plan from lockdown, PM Narendra Modi said there is a consensus among the states on extension of lockdown by another two weeks. He underlined that the motto of the government earlier was 'jaan hai to jahaan hai' but now is 'jaan bhi jahaan bhi', the Prime Minister's Office revealed.
Text: Motto was jaan hai to jahaan hai, now it's jaan bhi jahaan bhi: PM on lockdown exit During his interaction with CMs of all states to strategise exit plan from lockdown, PM Narendra Modi said there is a consensus among the states on extension of lockdown by another two weeks. He underlined that the motto of the government earlier was 'jaan hai to jahaan hai' but now is 'jaan bhi jahaan bhi', the Prime Minister's Office revealed.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Mumbai breach 1,100-mark, death toll rises to 75
Description: Mumbai on Saturday reported 189 new confirmed cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the city to 1,182. As many as 11 new deaths were also reported today, with the death toll surging to 75. Further, a total of 71 COVID-19 patients have been discharged in Mumbai till now. India has reported over 7,500 cases so far.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Mumbai breach 1,100-mark, death toll rises to 75 Mumbai on Saturday reported 189 new confirmed cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the city to 1,182. As many as 11 new deaths were also reported today, with the death toll surging to 75. Further, a total of 71 COVID-19 patients have been discharged in Mumbai till now. India has reported over 7,500 cases so far.

Headline: Schools in West Bengal to remain closed till June 10 over COVID-19: CM
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has announced that schools across the state will remain closed till June 10. Six more people have tested positive and there are 95 active cases in the state as of April 11, she added. Further, the CM said that she is in favour of extending the lockdown till April 30.
Text: Schools in West Bengal to remain closed till June 10 over COVID-19: CM West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has announced that schools across the state will remain closed till June 10. Six more people have tested positive and there are 95 active cases in the state as of April 11, she added. Further, the CM said that she is in favour of extending the lockdown till April 30.

Headline: Law prohibiting sex determination before birth has not been suspended: Govt
Description: Several media houses have reported that Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has suspended till June 30 the PC&PNDT Act which prohibits sex selection before or after conception. However, the government has clarified that the news is fake adding, "No such thing has been done by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare."
Text: Law prohibiting sex determination before birth has not been suspended: Govt Several media houses have reported that Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has suspended till June 30 the PC&PNDT Act which prohibits sex selection before or after conception. However, the government has clarified that the news is fake adding, "No such thing has been done by Ministry of Health and Family Welfare."

Headline: UN remark on 'stigmatisation' over COVID-19 highly objectionable: India
Description: JS Rajput, India's representative in UNESCO Executive Board said UN's call for Indian government to fight "stigmatisation of certain sects of people" over COVID-19 spread is "highly objectionable". "Such matters are being looked after by government, enlightened citizens and civil society in [India]," said Rajput. He further called global bodies "untenable and unsuitable" for managing the pandemic.
Text: UN remark on 'stigmatisation' over COVID-19 highly objectionable: India JS Rajput, India's representative in UNESCO Executive Board said UN's call for Indian government to fight "stigmatisation of certain sects of people" over COVID-19 spread is "highly objectionable". "Such matters are being looked after by government, enlightened citizens and civil society in [India]," said Rajput. He further called global bodies "untenable and unsuitable" for managing the pandemic.

Headline: BJP corporator held for hosting birthday party amid lockdown
Description: Ajay Bahira, a BJP corporator in Panvel Municipal Corporation, was arrested along with 11 others for violating the lockdown for organising his birthday party at his bungalow. "We received a complaint that a party was ongoing...following which we raided the house and found them celebrating without practising social distancing," said Ajaykumar Landge, senior inspector at Panvel Police Station.
Text: BJP corporator held for hosting birthday party amid lockdown Ajay Bahira, a BJP corporator in Panvel Municipal Corporation, was arrested along with 11 others for violating the lockdown for organising his birthday party at his bungalow. "We received a complaint that a party was ongoing...following which we raided the house and found them celebrating without practising social distancing," said Ajaykumar Landge, senior inspector at Panvel Police Station.

Headline: Consignment of rapid test kits ordered from China diverted to US: TN Chief Secy
Description: Tamil Nadu Chief Secretary K Shanmugam on Saturday said there's a delay in receiving rapid test kits ordered from China since a consignment meant for India was diverted to the US. "Since Tamil Nadu had placed orders early, they have promised to give us at least 50,000 kits from the next consignment and 50,000 more after that," he added.
Text: Consignment of rapid test kits ordered from China diverted to US: TN Chief Secy Tamil Nadu Chief Secretary K Shanmugam on Saturday said there's a delay in receiving rapid test kits ordered from China since a consignment meant for India was diverted to the US. "Since Tamil Nadu had placed orders early, they have promised to give us at least 50,000 kits from the next consignment and 50,000 more after that," he added.

Headline: News of HCQ stocks running out in Mumbai fake, govt allocated 34 lakh tablets: PIB
Description: A prominent news portal has claimed that hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) stocks in Mumbai have run out after India exported the drug to USA. The government called the news fake. "MoHFW has allocated 34 lakh tablets of HCQ to Maharashtra upto 9 April. So supply is much more than present requirement. It has also made its own procurement," it tweeted.
Text: News of HCQ stocks running out in Mumbai fake, govt allocated 34 lakh tablets: PIB A prominent news portal has claimed that hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) stocks in Mumbai have run out after India exported the drug to USA. The government called the news fake. "MoHFW has allocated 34 lakh tablets of HCQ to Maharashtra upto 9 April. So supply is much more than present requirement. It has also made its own procurement," it tweeted.

Headline: Vadodara installs helium balloons with cameras to check on lockdown violations
Description: The Vadodara district administration has installed a helium balloon attached with two cameras for surveillance on lockdown violators. The balloon, installed in the Tandalja area, also has a public address system attached to it. The administration has divided the city into four zones — red, orange, yellow and green, as part of a strategy to deal with the coronavirus pandemic.
Text: Vadodara installs helium balloons with cameras to check on lockdown violations The Vadodara district administration has installed a helium balloon attached with two cameras for surveillance on lockdown violators. The balloon, installed in the Tandalja area, also has a public address system attached to it. The administration has divided the city into four zones — red, orange, yellow and green, as part of a strategy to deal with the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 1,000 after doubling in 6 days
Description: As many as 166 cases of coronavirus were reported in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 1,069. Delhi had crossed 500 cases on April 5. A total of 11,709 samples have been tested for coronavirus in Delhi so far, out of which 10,218 tested negative, while results are pending for 464 samples.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 1,000 after doubling in 6 days As many as 166 cases of coronavirus were reported in Delhi today, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 1,069. Delhi had crossed 500 cases on April 5. A total of 11,709 samples have been tested for coronavirus in Delhi so far, out of which 10,218 tested negative, while results are pending for 464 samples.

Headline: There is no address to the nation by PM Modi today: Prasar Bharati
Description: Prasar Bharati News Services has clarified that there is no address to the nation by Prime Minister Narendra Modi today. Earlier, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said PM Modi decided to extend the nationwide lockdown, without disclosing how long the extension would be for. PM Modi on Saturday held a video conference call with Chief Ministers regarding the lockdown.
Text: There is no address to the nation by PM Modi today: Prasar Bharati Prasar Bharati News Services has clarified that there is no address to the nation by Prime Minister Narendra Modi today. Earlier, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said PM Modi decided to extend the nationwide lockdown, without disclosing how long the extension would be for. PM Modi on Saturday held a video conference call with Chief Ministers regarding the lockdown.

Headline: Reliance Power plant's fly ash pond develops breach in Madhya Pradesh, 2 dead
Description: Two people died and four others are missing after a dyke of a fly ash pond of Reliance Power's coal-fired power plant breached in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli district on Friday. "The bodies were found as far as five kilometres away from the ash dyke breach site," Singrauli District Collector KVS Choudary said, adding the four missing were also feared dead.
Text: Reliance Power plant's fly ash pond develops breach in Madhya Pradesh, 2 dead Two people died and four others are missing after a dyke of a fly ash pond of Reliance Power's coal-fired power plant breached in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli district on Friday. "The bodies were found as far as five kilometres away from the ash dyke breach site," Singrauli District Collector KVS Choudary said, adding the four missing were also feared dead.

Headline: India sends 15-member medical team to Kuwait to fight COVID-19
Description: A team of 15 Indian doctors and healthcare workers has arrived in Kuwait and will be staying there for two weeks to provide medical assistance in testing and treatment of coronavirus patients. The team was sent after leaders of both the countries agreed for a coordinated effort against global pandemic in a telephonic conversation, the Ministry of External Affairs said.
Text: India sends 15-member medical team to Kuwait to fight COVID-19 A team of 15 Indian doctors and healthcare workers has arrived in Kuwait and will be staying there for two weeks to provide medical assistance in testing and treatment of coronavirus patients. The team was sent after leaders of both the countries agreed for a coordinated effort against global pandemic in a telephonic conversation, the Ministry of External Affairs said.

Headline: Delhi court sends Davinder Singh to one-month judicial custody
Description: A Delhi court has sent suspended J&K DSP Davinder Singh to one-month judicial custody till May 6, after he was produced before the court on expiry of his 30 days' custodial interrogation. The police told the court the accused was not required for further interrogation. Earlier, Patiala House court sent Singh for custodial interrogation which was extended till April 10.
Text: Delhi court sends Davinder Singh to one-month judicial custody A Delhi court has sent suspended J&K DSP Davinder Singh to one-month judicial custody till May 6, after he was produced before the court on expiry of his 30 days' custodial interrogation. The police told the court the accused was not required for further interrogation. Earlier, Patiala House court sent Singh for custodial interrogation which was extended till April 10.

Headline: 1,000 coronavirus cases, 40 deaths reported in India in 1 day for first time: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday said that 1,035 coronavirus cases and 40 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. It is the first time that India has reported 40 deaths and more than 1,000 cases in a day so far. A total of 642 COVID-19 patients have recovered, Agarwal added.
Text: 1,000 coronavirus cases, 40 deaths reported in India in 1 day for first time: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday said that 1,035 coronavirus cases and 40 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. It is the first time that India has reported 40 deaths and more than 1,000 cases in a day so far. A total of 642 COVID-19 patients have recovered, Agarwal added.

Headline: PM has taken correct decision to extend lockdown: Kejriwal after PM's meet with CMs
Description: Following PM Narendra Modi's meeting with Chief Ministers regarding extension of lockdown, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "PM has taken correct decision to extend lockdown." He added, "Today, India's position is better than many developed countries because we started lockdown early. If it is stopped now, all gains would be lost. To consolidate, it's important to extend it."
Text: PM has taken correct decision to extend lockdown: Kejriwal after PM's meet with CMs Following PM Narendra Modi's meeting with Chief Ministers regarding extension of lockdown, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "PM has taken correct decision to extend lockdown." He added, "Today, India's position is better than many developed countries because we started lockdown early. If it is stopped now, all gains would be lost. To consolidate, it's important to extend it."

Headline: What is convalescent-plasma therapy that has been approved by ICMR for COVID-19?
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has given approval to SCTIMST, Kerala for carrying out convalescent-plasma therapy for COVID-19 patients. As part of the therapy, blood is drawn from a person who has recovered from coronavirus. The serum is separated and screened for virus-neutralizing antibodies. The convalescent serum is then administered to a COVID-19 patient.
Text: What is convalescent-plasma therapy that has been approved by ICMR for COVID-19? The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has given approval to SCTIMST, Kerala for carrying out convalescent-plasma therapy for COVID-19 patients. As part of the therapy, blood is drawn from a person who has recovered from coronavirus. The serum is separated and screened for virus-neutralizing antibodies. The convalescent serum is then administered to a COVID-19 patient.

Headline: 3 Covid-19 deaths in Delhi's Chandni Mahal in past 3 days
Description: At least three people have died of coronavirus in the Chandni Mahal area of Delhi in the past three days, authorities stated. Chandni Mahal was declared a containment zone after 52 Tablighi Jamaat members staying at 13 mosques in the area tested positive for Covid-19. "Interaction between people who tested positive and residents...cannot be ruled out," the authorities added.
Text: 3 Covid-19 deaths in Delhi's Chandni Mahal in past 3 days At least three people have died of coronavirus in the Chandni Mahal area of Delhi in the past three days, authorities stated. Chandni Mahal was declared a containment zone after 52 Tablighi Jamaat members staying at 13 mosques in the area tested positive for Covid-19. "Interaction between people who tested positive and residents...cannot be ruled out," the authorities added.

Headline: 92 +ve cases reported in Maharashtra today, total reaches 1,666
Description: The total number of positive coronavirus cases in Maharashtra rose to 1,666 on Saturday after 92 fresh cases were reported, said the state health department. As many as 72 of the fresh Covid-19 cases were reported in Mumbai. Notably, Maharashtra has the highest number of coronavirus cases among all the states in India.
Text: 92 +ve cases reported in Maharashtra today, total reaches 1,666 The total number of positive coronavirus cases in Maharashtra rose to 1,666 on Saturday after 92 fresh cases were reported, said the state health department. As many as 72 of the fresh Covid-19 cases were reported in Mumbai. Notably, Maharashtra has the highest number of coronavirus cases among all the states in India.

Headline: Tripura police distribute food items in remote areas, praised by CM
Description: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb has thanked security personnel for working round the clock to ensure the safety of people and distribute food items to the remotest areas of the state. Deb tweeted images of security personnel distributing essentials in remote areas, and added, "With such dedicated efforts we will definitely overcome this pandemic soon."
Text: Tripura police distribute food items in remote areas, praised by CM Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb has thanked security personnel for working round the clock to ensure the safety of people and distribute food items to the remotest areas of the state. Deb tweeted images of security personnel distributing essentials in remote areas, and added, "With such dedicated efforts we will definitely overcome this pandemic soon."

Headline: I am available 24x7: PM Modi tells CMs during Covid-19 meeting
Description: During a virtual meeting with Chief Ministers to decide on the lockdown, Prime Minister Narendra Modi told them, "I am available 24x7. Any chief minister can speak to me and give suggestions (on COVID-19) anytime. We should stand together shoulder-to-shoulder." PM Modi, along with several state CMs, was seen wearing a mask during the meeting.
Text: I am available 24x7: PM Modi tells CMs during Covid-19 meeting During a virtual meeting with Chief Ministers to decide on the lockdown, Prime Minister Narendra Modi told them, "I am available 24x7. Any chief minister can speak to me and give suggestions (on COVID-19) anytime. We should stand together shoulder-to-shoulder." PM Modi, along with several state CMs, was seen wearing a mask during the meeting.

Headline: Homeless man covers mouth, tells police to ensure social distance while giving food
Description: Kozhikode Rural Police in Kerala shared a video of a homeless man ensuring that policemen follow social distancing while giving him food amid lockdown due to coronavirus. The man could be seen waving the officers away when they came close to him and pointed to a spot to keep the food while covering his mouth with his shirt.
Text: Homeless man covers mouth, tells police to ensure social distance while giving food Kozhikode Rural Police in Kerala shared a video of a homeless man ensuring that policemen follow social distancing while giving him food amid lockdown due to coronavirus. The man could be seen waving the officers away when they came close to him and pointed to a spot to keep the food while covering his mouth with his shirt.

Headline: Delhi youth makes 3D printed face masks for medical staff
Description: A 20-year-old from Delhi has made face masks using 3D printers for healthcare workers and medical staff fighting against coronavirus. "My mother, who is a doctor, required these face shields in hospital," said Udit Kakar, explaining how he got the idea. "I want to make these shields available to as many doctors as possible," he added.
Text: Delhi youth makes 3D printed face masks for medical staff A 20-year-old from Delhi has made face masks using 3D printers for healthcare workers and medical staff fighting against coronavirus. "My mother, who is a doctor, required these face shields in hospital," said Udit Kakar, explaining how he got the idea. "I want to make these shields available to as many doctors as possible," he added.

Headline: Maha doctor saves newborn by taking him to hospital on bike amid lockdown
Description: A newborn in Alibaug, Maharashtra, who developed respiratory problems minutes after birth, was saved by a doctor who took him to hospital on his bike. The child's mother delivered the boy on Friday but he developed breathing problems soon after. Due to coronavirus lockdown, a paediatrician at the nursing home took the infant and admitted him to a neonatal ICU.
Text: Maha doctor saves newborn by taking him to hospital on bike amid lockdown A newborn in Alibaug, Maharashtra, who developed respiratory problems minutes after birth, was saved by a doctor who took him to hospital on his bike. The child's mother delivered the boy on Friday but he developed breathing problems soon after. Due to coronavirus lockdown, a paediatrician at the nursing home took the infant and admitted him to a neonatal ICU.

Headline: Migrant workers in Guj pelt stones, burn tyres demanding to go home; 80 detained
Description: Police have detained around 80 migrant workers in Gujarat's Surat after they allegedly resorted to violence and pelted stones on streets demanding to return to their native places amid the lockdown. "Out of anger, they torched some handcarts and tyres," ACP CK Patel said. He added that the workers complained the food served to them by NGO is tasteless.
Text: Migrant workers in Guj pelt stones, burn tyres demanding to go home; 80 detained Police have detained around 80 migrant workers in Gujarat's Surat after they allegedly resorted to violence and pelted stones on streets demanding to return to their native places amid the lockdown. "Out of anger, they torched some handcarts and tyres," ACP CK Patel said. He added that the workers complained the food served to them by NGO is tasteless.

Headline: Delhi, Punjab CMs ask PM Modi to extend lockdown during virtual meeting
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday held a virtual meeting with Chief Ministers to decide on the lockdown imposed over coronavirus outbreak in the country. During the meeting, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked PM Modi to extend the lockdown till April 30 across the country. Meanwhile, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh said the lockdown should at least be extended by a fortnight.
Text: Delhi, Punjab CMs ask PM Modi to extend lockdown during virtual meeting PM Narendra Modi on Saturday held a virtual meeting with Chief Ministers to decide on the lockdown imposed over coronavirus outbreak in the country. During the meeting, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked PM Modi to extend the lockdown till April 30 across the country. Meanwhile, Punjab CM Amarinder Singh said the lockdown should at least be extended by a fortnight.

Headline: Karnataka minister, wife clean roads in locality amid lockdown
Description: Karnataka Minister for Primary and Secondary Education S Suresh Kumar and his wife were praised on social media after they were seen sweeping roads in their locality on Friday, amid the lockdown. Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike Commissioner BH Anil Kumar said that the minister took the step after a sanitation worker deputed to clean the locality had injured her leg.
Text: Karnataka minister, wife clean roads in locality amid lockdown Karnataka Minister for Primary and Secondary Education S Suresh Kumar and his wife were praised on social media after they were seen sweeping roads in their locality on Friday, amid the lockdown. Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike Commissioner BH Anil Kumar said that the minister took the step after a sanitation worker deputed to clean the locality had injured her leg.

Headline: Centre writes to Bengal govt citing lockdown violations; seeks report
Description: Centre on Friday wrote to West Bengal government regarding "gradual dilution" of coronavirus lockdown in the state asking it to take strict action and furnish a report on the matter. Centre said that police have been allowing religious gatherings resulting in coronavirus spread. It also said markets are not regulated in some areas leading to violation of social distancing norms.
Text: Centre writes to Bengal govt citing lockdown violations; seeks report Centre on Friday wrote to West Bengal government regarding "gradual dilution" of coronavirus lockdown in the state asking it to take strict action and furnish a report on the matter. Centre said that police have been allowing religious gatherings resulting in coronavirus spread. It also said markets are not regulated in some areas leading to violation of social distancing norms.

Headline: Passengers should reach airport 2 hrs early with protective gear, proposes CISF
Description: CISF has prepared a new plan for air passengers after flight operations resume post lockdown. In the plan, CISF said passengers should reach the airport two hours before flight time, carrying protective gear like masks and gloves. "This plan has been sent to the Ministry of Civil Aviation for consideration," GA Ganapathy, Special Director (Airport) of CISF, told ANI.
Text: Passengers should reach airport 2 hrs early with protective gear, proposes CISF CISF has prepared a new plan for air passengers after flight operations resume post lockdown. In the plan, CISF said passengers should reach the airport two hours before flight time, carrying protective gear like masks and gloves. "This plan has been sent to the Ministry of Civil Aviation for consideration," GA Ganapathy, Special Director (Airport) of CISF, told ANI.

Headline: Mahindra replaces plates with banana leaves at factories, Kerala CM welcomes move
Description: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share how he replaced plates with banana leaves in his company's factories to help farmers. Mahindra said the idea was suggested by a retired journalist, Padma Ramnath. Welcoming the move, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan tweeted, "We hope that many more will emulate Anand Mahindra in adopting such eco-friendly and farmer-friendly methods."
Text: Mahindra replaces plates with banana leaves at factories, Kerala CM welcomes move Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share how he replaced plates with banana leaves in his company's factories to help farmers. Mahindra said the idea was suggested by a retired journalist, Padma Ramnath. Welcoming the move, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan tweeted, "We hope that many more will emulate Anand Mahindra in adopting such eco-friendly and farmer-friendly methods."

Headline: Terrorists escape from encounter site in J&K, weapons recovered
Description: Two to three terrorists escaped from the site of a gun battle with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district, the police said on Saturday. "Militants ran away in initial firing itself...Now a sniffer dog is being used for tracking down the escaped militants," the police added. A light machine gun and material for making an IED were recovered.
Text: Terrorists escape from encounter site in J&K, weapons recovered Two to three terrorists escaped from the site of a gun battle with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district, the police said on Saturday. "Militants ran away in initial firing itself...Now a sniffer dog is being used for tracking down the escaped militants," the police added. A light machine gun and material for making an IED were recovered.

Headline: I appreciate work doctors, nurses, others are doing: Aamir
Description: Aamir Khan posted a note on social media to express his gratitude towards the people who are working on the front line during the coronavirus pandemic. "Really appreciate the work...doctors, nurses, hospital staff members...and all the staff in the essential services, all across Mumbai and Maharashtra are doing," his note read. "For that matter, all across the country," Aamir added.
Text: I appreciate work doctors, nurses, others are doing: Aamir Aamir Khan posted a note on social media to express his gratitude towards the people who are working on the front line during the coronavirus pandemic. "Really appreciate the work...doctors, nurses, hospital staff members...and all the staff in the essential services, all across Mumbai and Maharashtra are doing," his note read. "For that matter, all across the country," Aamir added.

Headline: Ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi's mother gives ₹1 lakh to PM-CARES fund
Description: Former Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi's mother Shanti Gogoi on Friday donated ₹1 lakh to PM-CARES fund, a public charitable trust to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. Shanti Gogoi handed over the donation cheque to Dibrugarh Deputy Commissioner Pallav Gopal Jha. Notably, her husband Kesab Chandra Gogoi served as Assam's Chief Minister for two months in 1982.
Text: Ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi's mother gives ₹1 lakh to PM-CARES fund Former Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi's mother Shanti Gogoi on Friday donated ₹1 lakh to PM-CARES fund, a public charitable trust to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. Shanti Gogoi handed over the donation cheque to Dibrugarh Deputy Commissioner Pallav Gopal Jha. Notably, her husband Kesab Chandra Gogoi served as Assam's Chief Minister for two months in 1982.

Headline: People shower flowers on Agra Police on duty amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: Agra Police on Friday took to Twitter and posted a video showing police personnel conducting daily rounds, amid COVID-19 lockdown. In the video, people can be seen showering flower petals on police personnel and playing patriotic songs. "Nowadays...public is seeing Agra Police like [an angel]...Shamsabad Police welcomed something like this," Agra Police wrote along with the video.
Text: People shower flowers on Agra Police on duty amid COVID-19 lockdown Agra Police on Friday took to Twitter and posted a video showing police personnel conducting daily rounds, amid COVID-19 lockdown. In the video, people can be seen showering flower petals on police personnel and playing patriotic songs. "Nowadays...public is seeing Agra Police like [an angel]...Shamsabad Police welcomed something like this," Agra Police wrote along with the video.

Headline: Odisha petrol pumps launch 'no mask, no fuel' rule amid COVID-19
Description: Odisha's Utkal Petroleum Dealers Association on Friday launched 'No Mask, No Petrol/Diesel /CNG' rule at petrol pumps, in order to make people follow the government's health advisory amid COVID-19 pandemic. "Our workers are our hero...will protect them as well as our customers," an official said. This comes after the Odisha government made wearing masks at public places mandatory.
Text: Odisha petrol pumps launch 'no mask, no fuel' rule amid COVID-19  Odisha's Utkal Petroleum Dealers Association on Friday launched 'No Mask, No Petrol/Diesel /CNG' rule at petrol pumps, in order to make people follow the government's health advisory amid COVID-19 pandemic. "Our workers are our hero...will protect them as well as our customers," an official said. This comes after the Odisha government made wearing masks at public places mandatory.

Headline: Poor must get ₹5,000 in their accounts if lockdown is extended: Owaisi
Description: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that government should transfer ₹5,000 to the bank accounts of the poor if the nationwide lockdown is extended. "The poor are saying that if they don't die due to coronavirus, they shall die due to hunger," he added. PM Modi on Saturday held an online meeting with the Chief Ministers of all states.
Text: Poor must get ₹5,000 in their accounts if lockdown is extended: Owaisi AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that government should transfer ₹5,000 to the bank accounts of the poor if the nationwide lockdown is extended. "The poor are saying that if they don't die due to coronavirus, they shall die due to hunger," he added. PM Modi on Saturday held an online meeting with the Chief Ministers of all states.

Headline: 16-year-old coronavirus patient recovers in Chhattisgarh
Description: A 16-year-old boy who had earlier tested positive for coronavirus has recovered, Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has stated. The patient had been quarantined at a mosque in Katghora before he tested positive for coronavirus on April 4 and was subsequently shifted to AIIMS Raipur. According to official government figures, 18 people have tested positive for coronavirus in Chhattisgarh.
Text: 16-year-old coronavirus patient recovers in Chhattisgarh A 16-year-old boy who had earlier tested positive for coronavirus has recovered, Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has stated. The patient had been quarantined at a mosque in Katghora before he tested positive for coronavirus on April 4 and was subsequently shifted to AIIMS Raipur. According to official government figures, 18 people have tested positive for coronavirus in Chhattisgarh.

Headline: Lockdown can't be unilateral, one state can't stop virus: Sisodia
Description: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Friday said that the decision to extend the lockdown, amid coronavirus pandemic, can't be taken "unilaterally" as one state cannot stop the spread of the virus. "It has to be a concerted national effort," he added. "We will go by the Centre's decision on extending the lockdown," Sisodia further said.
Text: Lockdown can't be unilateral, one state can't stop virus: Sisodia Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Friday said that the decision to extend the lockdown, amid coronavirus pandemic, can't be taken "unilaterally" as one state cannot stop the spread of the virus. "It has to be a concerted national effort," he added. "We will go by the Centre's decision on extending the lockdown," Sisodia further said.

Headline: Haryana man arrested for making threat calls to Randeep Surjewala
Description: Police arrested a Haryana man for allegedly making threat calls to Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala who lives in Panchkula. This comes after Surjewala filed a complaint stating that the caller, claiming to be a gangster from Uttar Pradesh, threatened to kill him and his cousin. Police traced the mobile number from which calls were made and arrested the caller.
Text: Haryana man arrested for making threat calls to Randeep Surjewala Police arrested a Haryana man for allegedly making threat calls to Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala who lives in Panchkula. This comes after Surjewala filed a complaint stating that the caller, claiming to be a gangster from Uttar Pradesh, threatened to kill him and his cousin. Police traced the mobile number from which calls were made and arrested the caller.

Headline: Number of coronavirus containment zones in Delhi raised to 30
Description: As coronavirus cases in Delhi reach near the 1,000 mark, the government has increased the number of containment zones to 30. The additions include Nabi Karim, E-Pocket GTB Enclave, street numbers 18 to 22 of Zakir Nagar and nearby area of Abu Bakar Masjid. The areas will be sealed under Delhi government's Operation SHIELD.
Text: Number of coronavirus containment zones in Delhi raised to 30 As coronavirus cases in Delhi reach near the 1,000 mark, the government has increased the number of containment zones to 30. The additions include Nabi Karim, E-Pocket GTB Enclave, street numbers 18 to 22 of Zakir Nagar and nearby area of Abu Bakar Masjid. The areas will be sealed under Delhi government's Operation SHIELD.

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 7,447, death toll reaches 239
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Saturday stated that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 7,447, while the death toll has reached 239. Moreover, 643 people have been cured, discharged or migrated, the ministry's data revealed. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.
Text: Number of coronavirus cases in India rises to 7,447, death toll reaches 239 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Saturday stated that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 7,447, while the death toll has reached 239. Moreover, 643 people have been cured, discharged or migrated, the ministry's data revealed. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.

Headline: Kanika Kapoor to be questioned over FIR by Lucknow Police after lockdown
Description: Kanika Kapoor, who was discharged earlier this week after getting treated for coronavirus, will be questioned by Lucknow Police over an FIR filed against her for negligence. "Once the lockdown is over, we'll question Kanika...It's part of...routine practice followed after an FIR [is]...lodged," a senior official said. The FIR was filed against Kanika under IPC Sections 188, 269 and 270.
Text: Kanika Kapoor to be questioned over FIR by Lucknow Police after lockdown Kanika Kapoor, who was discharged earlier this week after getting treated for coronavirus, will be questioned by Lucknow Police over an FIR filed against her for negligence. "Once the lockdown is over, we'll question Kanika...It's part of...routine practice followed after an FIR [is]...lodged," a senior official said. The FIR was filed against Kanika under IPC Sections 188, 269 and 270.

Headline: Rajasthan govt to give ₹50 lakh to families of staff who die of COVID-19
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday announced a grant of ₹50 lakh for family of every state government employee who dies due to coronavirus while on duty. This includes gram sevaks, constables, contract workers, anganwadi workers, etc, said Gehlot. However, healthcare workers covered under central government's ₹50 lakh insurance cover, will not be included in this scheme.
Text: Rajasthan govt to give ₹50 lakh to families of staff who die of COVID-19 Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday announced a grant of ₹50 lakh for family of every state government employee who dies due to coronavirus while on duty. This includes gram sevaks, constables, contract workers, anganwadi workers, etc, said Gehlot. However, healthcare workers covered under central government's ₹50 lakh insurance cover, will not be included in this scheme.

Headline: India conducts 15,663 coronavirus tests on Friday, 2.76% test positive
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 15,663 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country on Friday, which is the second highest number of tests done in a day. Out of all the tests conducted today, 433 samples (2.76%) tested positive. India had conducted its highest number of daily coronavirus tests (16,002) on Thursday.
Text: India conducts 15,663 coronavirus tests on Friday, 2.76% test positive The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 15,663 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country on Friday, which is the second highest number of tests done in a day. Out of all the tests conducted today, 433 samples (2.76%) tested positive. India had conducted its highest number of daily coronavirus tests (16,002) on Thursday.

Headline: Enhance vigil along Pak, B'desh borders: Shah to BSF amid lockdown
Description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday directed BSF to enhance vigilance along India's borders with Pakistan and Bangladesh, especially along unfenced areas, to ensure no cross-border movement is allowed amid coronavirus lockdown. Shah reviewed the security arrangements along these borders with BSF officers. He also praised awareness and sanitisation efforts of BSF formations amid the outbreak.
Text: Enhance vigil along Pak, B'desh borders: Shah to BSF amid lockdown Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday directed BSF to enhance vigilance along India's borders with Pakistan and Bangladesh, especially along unfenced areas, to ensure no cross-border movement is allowed amid coronavirus lockdown. Shah reviewed the security arrangements along these borders with BSF officers. He also praised awareness and sanitisation efforts of BSF formations amid the outbreak.

Headline: ICMR validates TB testing machine to detect coronavirus
Description: Tuberculosis testing machine would be used for detecting coronavirus, the ICMR said on Friday. The apex medical research body informed, "ICMR has validated Truenat-TM beta CoV test on TruelabTM workstation and has recommended it as a screening test for coronavirus testing." It added, throat/nasal swabs will be collected in viral transport medium with virus lysis buffer provided along with kit.
Text: ICMR validates TB testing machine to detect coronavirus Tuberculosis testing machine would be used for detecting coronavirus, the ICMR said on Friday. The apex medical research body informed, "ICMR has validated Truenat-TM beta CoV test on TruelabTM workstation and has recommended it as a screening test for coronavirus testing." It added, throat/nasal swabs will be collected in viral transport medium with virus lysis buffer provided along with kit.

Headline: Punjab's Mansa police call Covid-19 patients to boost their confidence
Description: Police officers in Punjab's Mansa district are holding telephonic conversations with Covid-19 patients and others in home quarantine in a bid to boost their confidence to fight the disease. The police have formed self-help groups with psychologists and psychiatrists, and their numbers have been shared with patients. The move comes after 11 people tested positive in the district's Budhlada town.
Text: Punjab's Mansa police call Covid-19 patients to boost their confidence Police officers in Punjab's Mansa district are holding telephonic conversations with Covid-19 patients and others in home quarantine in a bid to boost their confidence to fight the disease. The police have formed self-help groups with psychologists and psychiatrists, and their numbers have been shared with patients. The move comes after 11 people tested positive in the district's Budhlada town.

Headline: Kerala gets approval from ICMR to test out plasma therapy for COVID-19
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has given its approval to the Kerala government to begin clinical trials of convalescent plasma therapy for COVID-19. The therapy uses antibodies that the immune system develops to fight infection, from the blood plasma of cured patients, to treat critically ill COVID-19 cases. This exploration is based on a study by China-based doctors.
Text: Kerala gets approval from ICMR to test out plasma therapy for COVID-19 The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has given its approval to the Kerala government to begin clinical trials of convalescent plasma therapy for COVID-19. The therapy uses antibodies that the immune system develops to fight infection, from the blood plasma of cured patients, to treat critically ill COVID-19 cases. This exploration is based on a study by China-based doctors.

Headline: 18-yr-old with fever deliberately spits on road; taken to hospital by police
Description: Amid COVID-19 spread, an 18-year-old youth was held and taken to a hospital by police when he was deliberately spitting on the road and on shutters of shops in Chandigarh. The youth was also coughing and sneezing and had symptoms of fever, police said. He was booked under relevant sections of the Epidemic Diseases Act and the Disaster Management Act.
Text: 18-yr-old with fever deliberately spits on road; taken to hospital by police Amid COVID-19 spread, an 18-year-old youth was held and taken to a hospital by police when he was deliberately spitting on the road and on shutters of shops in Chandigarh. The youth was also coughing and sneezing and had symptoms of fever, police said. He was booked under relevant sections of the Epidemic Diseases Act and the Disaster Management Act.

Headline: A friend in need is truly a friend indeed: Maldives thanks India for HCQ
Description: The Maldives thanked the Indian government for approving its request for potential coronavirus drug hydroxychloroquine. "A friend in need is truly a friend indeed!" Maldives' Foreign Minister Abdulla Shahid tweeted. Brazil, Israel and the US had also thanked India for approving the drug's exports. Notably, India is the world's largest producer of hydroxychloroquine, which mainly treats malaria.
Text: A friend in need is truly a friend indeed: Maldives thanks India for HCQ The Maldives thanked the Indian government for approving its request for potential coronavirus drug hydroxychloroquine. "A friend in need is truly a friend indeed!" Maldives' Foreign Minister Abdulla Shahid tweeted. Brazil, Israel and the US had also thanked India for approving the drug's exports. Notably, India is the world's largest producer of hydroxychloroquine, which mainly treats malaria.

Headline: Delhi reports 183 new coronavirus cases in one day as total crosses 900
Description: Delhi on Friday reported as many as 183 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 903. Further, the death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi rose to 14 after two deaths were reported today. As many as 42 COVID-19 patients are in ICU and seven are on ventilator, the government said.
Text: Delhi reports 183 new coronavirus cases in one day as total crosses 900 Delhi on Friday reported as many as 183 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 903. Further, the death toll due to coronavirus in Delhi rose to 14 after two deaths were reported today. As many as 42 COVID-19 patients are in ICU and seven are on ventilator, the government said.

Headline: UP govt gives ₹1,000 each to 4.8 lakh daily wage workers
Description: The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday transferred ₹1,000 each into the bank accounts of 4.8 lakh daily wage workers, including street vendors and auto drivers, as "maintenance allowance" amid the nationwide lockdown. According to an official release, the state had earlier transferred ₹1,000 each to the bank accounts of over 35 lakh labourers and 11 lakh construction workers.
Text: UP govt gives ₹1,000 each to 4.8 lakh daily wage workers The Uttar Pradesh government on Friday transferred ₹1,000 each into the bank accounts of 4.8 lakh daily wage workers, including street vendors and auto drivers, as "maintenance allowance" amid the nationwide lockdown. According to an official release, the state had earlier transferred ₹1,000 each to the bank accounts of over 35 lakh labourers and 11 lakh construction workers.

Headline: 26-yr-old COVID-19 patient in TN completes MBA course term from isolation ward
Description: A 26-year-old coronavirus patient in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore managed to write four exams from the isolation ward of the hospital and finish the second term of her MBA course she is pursuing in Spain. "The main motivation to finish all this was to be occupied while in isolation," she said. "Remaining idle was a terrible idea," she further said.
Text: 26-yr-old COVID-19 patient in TN completes MBA course term from isolation ward A 26-year-old coronavirus patient in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore managed to write four exams from the isolation ward of the hospital and finish the second term of her MBA course she is pursuing in Spain. "The main motivation to finish all this was to be occupied while in isolation," she said. "Remaining idle was a terrible idea," she further said.

Headline: Dilshad Garden 1st hotspot in Delhi to be declared coronavirus-free: Minister
Description: Dilshad Garden in east Delhi is the first Covid-19 hotspot to be declared infection-free as no new case has been reported there in the past 10 days, state Health Minister Satyendar Jain stated. Eight Covid-19 cases were identified as a result of Operation SHIELD, while every house in the area was screened and 81 potential cases were hospitalised, Jain added.
Text: Dilshad Garden 1st hotspot in Delhi to be declared coronavirus-free: Minister Dilshad Garden in east Delhi is the first Covid-19 hotspot to be declared infection-free as no new case has been reported there in the past 10 days, state Health Minister Satyendar Jain stated. Eight Covid-19 cases were identified as a result of Operation SHIELD, while every house in the area was screened and 81 potential cases were hospitalised, Jain added.

Headline: 110 people arrested in Kashmir for defying govt restrictions
Description: Over 100 people have been arrested and eight vehicles have been seized in three districts in Jammu and Kashmir for defying the government restrictions amid the Covid-19 pandemic, the police said on Friday. The police added that those who are violating the government restrictions will be dealt with strictly. There are 207 cases of coronavirus in J&K.
Text: 110 people arrested in Kashmir for defying govt restrictions Over 100 people have been arrested and eight vehicles have been seized in three districts in Jammu and Kashmir for defying the government restrictions amid the Covid-19 pandemic, the police said on Friday. The police added that those who are violating the government restrictions will be dealt with strictly. There are 207 cases of coronavirus in J&K.

Headline: India targets Pak's terror launch pads & weapons, shares drone footage of explosions
Description: Indian Army carried out precision targeting of gun areas, terrorist launch pads and ammunition in Pakistan in response to unprovoked ceasefire violation by them in Kupwara district, defence spokesperson in Srinagar said. The Indian Army also shared a drone footage, which showed multiples explosions. This comes days after five soldiers were martyred in an operation against terrorists along LoC.
Text: India targets Pak's terror launch pads & weapons, shares drone footage of explosions Indian Army carried out precision targeting of gun areas, terrorist launch pads and ammunition in Pakistan in response to unprovoked ceasefire violation by them in Kupwara district, defence spokesperson in Srinagar said. The Indian Army also shared a drone footage, which showed multiples explosions. This comes days after five soldiers were martyred in an operation against terrorists along LoC.

Headline: Over 200 Gujarat farmers give ₹2,000 each to PM CARES fund
Description: Over 200 farmers from Gujarat's Amreli and Bhavnagar have donated their Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) amount of ₹2,000 to PM CARES fund to fight the coronavirus outbreak. "The government takes care of farmers...now it's time for us to help," a farmer said. The Centre gives ₹6,000 to farmers in three equal instalments under Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi.
Text: Over 200 Gujarat farmers give ₹2,000 each to PM CARES fund Over 200 farmers from Gujarat's Amreli and Bhavnagar have donated their Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) amount of ₹2,000 to PM CARES fund to fight the coronavirus outbreak. "The government takes care of farmers...now it's time for us to help," a farmer said. The Centre gives ₹6,000 to farmers in three equal instalments under Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi.

Headline: Delhi govt shuts paid COVID-19 quarantine facility at Aerocity
Description: The Delhi government on Friday shut the paid COVID-19 quarantine centres in Aerocity near the Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport. "The Aerocity's paid quarantine facility saw the last batch of passengers check out on Thursday. With this, the paid quarantine achieved its purpose successfully with only five positive (asymptomatic) cases," District Magistrate (New Delhi) Tanvi Garg said.
Text: Delhi govt shuts paid COVID-19 quarantine facility at Aerocity The Delhi government on Friday shut the paid COVID-19 quarantine centres in Aerocity near the Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport. "The Aerocity's paid quarantine facility saw the last batch of passengers check out on Thursday. With this, the paid quarantine achieved its purpose successfully with only five positive (asymptomatic) cases," District Magistrate (New Delhi) Tanvi Garg said.

Headline: Govt exempts fishing, marine aquaculture operations from lockdown
Description: Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla on Friday exempted fishing, operations of the marine aquaculture industry, including feeding, maintenance, sale, marketing, processing, packaging and cold chain, from 21-day nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus spread. The government added that the district authorities will have to ensure that practices of social distancing and proper hygiene are enforced.
Text: Govt exempts fishing, marine aquaculture operations from lockdown Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla on Friday exempted fishing, operations of the marine aquaculture industry, including feeding, maintenance, sale, marketing, processing, packaging and cold chain, from 21-day nationwide lockdown due to coronavirus spread. The government added that the district authorities will have to ensure that practices of social distancing and proper hygiene are enforced.

Headline: K'taka BJP MLA celebrates birthday with supporters amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: Amid the ongoing lockdown to curb coronavirus spread, Karnataka BJP MLA M Jayaram was seen celebrating his birthday where many of his supporters also gathered. Denying that the legislator violated the lockdown, police said the birthday function was held in a compound at Ankalakuppe whereas free food was served in the temple vicinity at Manikuppa, which is an adjacent village.
Text: K'taka BJP MLA celebrates birthday with supporters amid COVID-19 lockdown Amid the ongoing lockdown to curb coronavirus spread, Karnataka BJP MLA M Jayaram was seen celebrating his birthday where many of his supporters also gathered. Denying that the legislator violated the lockdown, police said the birthday function was held in a compound at Ankalakuppe whereas free food was served in the temple vicinity at Manikuppa, which is an adjacent village.

Headline: 48-yr-old man booked for keeping hair salon open in Pune amid lockdown
Description: The Pune City Police has lodged an offence against Jabbar Sattar Shaikh, the owner of a hair salon that was found open on Thursday despite the COVID-19 lockdown orders. An offence was lodged against the 48-year-old at the Shivajinagar police station under Section 188 of the Indian Penal Code. Only essential services are allowed to remain open during the lockdown.
Text: 48-yr-old man booked for keeping hair salon open in Pune amid lockdown The Pune City Police has lodged an offence against Jabbar Sattar Shaikh, the owner of a hair salon that was found open on Thursday despite the COVID-19 lockdown orders. An offence was lodged against the 48-year-old at the Shivajinagar police station under Section 188 of the Indian Penal Code. Only essential services are allowed to remain open during the lockdown.

Headline: T'gana requests Centre to remove tax on medicines, equipment
Description: Telangana Health Minister Etela Rajendra on Friday requested the central government to remove the tax on medicines and medical equipment manufactured in India, amid the rising COVID-19 cases. Rajendra further demanded N95 masks, Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits and testing kits, as soon as possible. Telangana has reported 473 coronavirus cases and seven deaths so far.
Text: T'gana requests Centre to remove tax on medicines, equipment Telangana Health Minister Etela Rajendra on Friday requested the central government to remove the tax on medicines and medical equipment manufactured in India, amid the rising COVID-19 cases. Rajendra further demanded N95 masks, Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits and testing kits, as soon as possible. Telangana has reported 473 coronavirus cases and seven deaths so far.

Headline: Uddhav to be MLC for 2 months if Maha governor nominates him
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray will become Member of the Legislative Council (MLC) for 2 months if Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari nominates him. Notably, term of two vacant seats to the Upper House from Governor's quota ends on June 6. This comes after the state cabinet decided to recommend Uddhav's name as a nominated member of Legislative Council from Governor's quota.
Text: Uddhav to be MLC for 2 months if Maha governor nominates him Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray will become Member of the Legislative Council (MLC) for 2 months if Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari nominates him. Notably, term of two vacant seats to the Upper House from Governor's quota ends on June 6. This comes after the state cabinet decided to recommend Uddhav's name as a nominated member of Legislative Council from Governor's quota.

Headline: Ex-IAS Vinay Sheel Oberoi passes away, Smriti Irani pays tribute
Description: Vinay Sheel Oberoi, former IAS officer and Secretary in the Department of Higher Education in the HRD Ministry, passed away on Friday. BJP MP from UP's Amethi and former HRD Minister Smriti Irani paid tribute to him. "Vinay Sheel Oberoi....father figure, friend. Was blessed to serve with him in HRD...we lost him...his guidance...will stay with me forever," Irani tweeted.
Text: Ex-IAS Vinay Sheel Oberoi passes away, Smriti Irani pays tribute Vinay Sheel Oberoi, former IAS officer and Secretary in the Department of Higher Education in the HRD Ministry, passed away on Friday. BJP MP from UP's Amethi and former HRD Minister Smriti Irani paid tribute to him. "Vinay Sheel Oberoi....father figure, friend. Was blessed to serve with him in HRD...we lost him...his guidance...will stay with me forever," Irani tweeted.

Headline: Gurugram makes wearing face masks mandatory in public places
Description: The Gurugram district administration has made wearing face masks mandatory in public places. "All persons in public places like streets, hospital, offices, markets, etc. must be wearing 3-ply mask or cloth mask compulsorily," an official order read. Violators will be punishable under section 188 of the Indian Penal Code and will be strictly penalised, the order added.
Text: Gurugram makes wearing face masks mandatory in public places The Gurugram district administration has made wearing face masks mandatory in public places. "All persons in public places like streets, hospital, offices, markets, etc. must be wearing 3-ply mask or cloth mask compulsorily," an official order read. Violators will be punishable under section 188 of the Indian Penal Code and will be strictly penalised, the order added.

Headline: Uttar Pradesh reports 23 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 433
Description: Uttar Pradesh has reported 23 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 433. The highest number of cases have been reported in Agra at 88, followed by Gautam Buddha Nagar at 64 and Meerut at 44, according to the state health department. Four people have died of coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh.
Text: Uttar Pradesh reports 23 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 433 Uttar Pradesh has reported 23 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 433. The highest number of cases have been reported in Agra at 88, followed by Gautam Buddha Nagar at 64 and Meerut at 44, according to the state health department. Four people have died of coronavirus in Uttar Pradesh.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka crosses 200
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has reached 207 after it reported 10 new cases, the state government said on Friday. The total number includes six deaths and 34 patients who have been discharged. Bengaluru Urban district has reported the highest number of cases at 71, while Mysuru has reported 42 cases.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka crosses 200 The total number of coronavirus cases in Karnataka has reached 207 after it reported 10 new cases, the state government said on Friday. The total number includes six deaths and 34 patients who have been discharged. Bengaluru Urban district has reported the highest number of cases at 71, while Mysuru has reported 42 cases.

Headline: 77 new COVID-19 cases reported in Tamil Nadu today, total crosses 900
