Description: Tamil Nadu on Friday reported 77 more coronavirus cases, taking the total number of infections in the state to 911. A patient who was undergoing treatment in Tuticorin died on Friday, taking the death toll to nine. Chief Secretary K Shanmugam said the state government has begun monitoring all cases of Severe Acute Respiratory Infection (SARI) being reported in hospitals.
Text: 77 new COVID-19 cases reported in Tamil Nadu today, total crosses 900 Tamil Nadu on Friday reported 77 more coronavirus cases, taking the total number of infections in the state to 911. A patient who was undergoing treatment in Tuticorin died on Friday, taking the death toll to nine. Chief Secretary K Shanmugam said the state government has begun monitoring all cases of Severe Acute Respiratory Infection (SARI) being reported in hospitals.

Headline: Gujarat reports 70 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 378; death toll at 19
Description: Gujarat has reported 70 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 378, the state health department said on Friday. A total of 19 people have died and 33 patients have been discharged till date, the department added. Ahmedabad reported 44 new cases on Friday.
Text: Gujarat reports 70 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 378; death toll at 19 Gujarat has reported 70 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of cases in the state to 378, the state health department said on Friday. A total of 19 people have died and 33 patients have been discharged till date, the department added. Ahmedabad reported 44 new cases on Friday.

Headline: Coronavirus deaths in India cross 200 mark, cases rise to 6,761
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 6,761, while the death toll has reached 206. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 516. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 6,039.
Text: Coronavirus deaths in India cross 200 mark, cases rise to 6,761 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 6,761, while the death toll has reached 206. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 516. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 6,039.

Headline: We need 1 crore HCQ tablets in immediate future, we have 3.28 crore tablets: Govt
Description: Health Ministry on Friday said that Hydroxychloroquine need for India in the immediate future is 1 crore tablets. "I would like to update that even after exporting, we have a reserve supply of 3.28 crore tablets for our immediate need," it further said. The External Affairs Ministry also said domestic Hydroxychloroquine requirement will be the priority of the government.
Text: We need 1 crore HCQ tablets in immediate future, we have 3.28 crore tablets: Govt Health Ministry on Friday said that Hydroxychloroquine need for India in the immediate future is 1 crore tablets. "I would like to update that even after exporting, we have a reserve supply of 3.28 crore tablets for our immediate need," it further said. The External Affairs Ministry also said domestic Hydroxychloroquine requirement will be the priority of the government.

Headline: Punjab extends lockdown till May 1, second state after Odisha to do so
Description: Punjab has become the second state after Odisha to extend the lockdown till May 1 to contain the spread of coronavirus. The Punjab government said that the decision was taken unanimously by the Cabinet and added that "strict enforcement" of the lockdown and curfew will be done. Punjab has reported 130 coronavirus cases and 10 deaths till April 9.
Text: Punjab extends lockdown till May 1, second state after Odisha to do so Punjab has become the second state after Odisha to extend the lockdown till May 1 to contain the spread of coronavirus. The Punjab government said that the decision was taken unanimously by the Cabinet and added that "strict enforcement" of the lockdown and curfew will be done. Punjab has reported 130 coronavirus cases and 10 deaths till April 9.

Headline: NCW launches WhatsApp number to report domestic violence amid lockdown
Description: The National Commission for Women (NCW) on Friday launched the WhatsApp number 7217735372 for reporting domestic violence amid coronavirus lockdown. The number has been launched only for the duration of the lockdown till NCW's normal office resumes, it said. NCW had earlier reported rise in the number of domestic violence complaints since imposition of the nationwide lockdown over coronavirus.
Text: NCW launches WhatsApp number to report domestic violence amid lockdown The National Commission for Women (NCW) on Friday launched the WhatsApp number 7217735372 for reporting domestic violence amid coronavirus lockdown. The number has been launched only for the duration of the lockdown till NCW's normal office resumes, it said. NCW had earlier reported rise in the number of domestic violence complaints since imposition of the nationwide lockdown over coronavirus.

Headline: Around 250 Indians infected with COVID-19 in Singapore: Indian High Commission
Description: About 250 Indians, with nearly half of them staying in close contact in the dormitories for foreign workers, have tested positive for coronavirus in Singapore, PTI reported quoting the Indian High Commission. Almost all of the Indian coronavirus patients are mostly stable or improving, Indian High Commissioner Jawed Ashraf told PTI. Some of them are permanent residents, Ashraf added.
Text: Around 250 Indians infected with COVID-19 in Singapore: Indian High Commission About 250 Indians, with nearly half of them staying in close contact in the dormitories for foreign workers, have tested positive for coronavirus in Singapore, PTI reported quoting the Indian High Commission. Almost all of the Indian coronavirus patients are mostly stable or improving, Indian High Commissioner Jawed Ashraf told PTI. Some of them are permanent residents, Ashraf added.

Headline: When can a coronavirus patient be discharged in India?
Description: Coronavirus patients in India can be discharged only after evidence of chest radiographic clearance and viral clearance in respiratory samples after two specimens test negative for coronavirus. The first specimen, required to be negative, is taken 14 days after collection of first sample positive for COVID-19, while the second should be followed at least 24 hours after the negative sample.
Text: When can a coronavirus patient be discharged in India? Coronavirus patients in India can be discharged only after evidence of chest radiographic clearance and viral clearance in respiratory samples after two specimens test negative for coronavirus. The first specimen, required to be negative, is taken 14 days after collection of first sample positive for COVID-19, while the second should be followed at least 24 hours after the negative sample.

Headline: No community transmission of coronavirus in India yet: Govt on ICMR report
Description: Reacting to a study by ICMR on SARI patients, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said there is no community transmission of coronavirus in India yet. "Samples in the study were from...our VRDL labs, where cases are already there. Study didn't say that this was in a place where there were no cases," he added.
Text: No community transmission of coronavirus in India yet: Govt on ICMR report Reacting to a study by ICMR on SARI patients, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said there is no community transmission of coronavirus in India yet. "Samples in the study were from...our VRDL labs, where cases are already there. Study didn't say that this was in a place where there were no cases," he added.

Headline: WHO admits error, says 'cluster of cases in India, not community transmission'
Description: The World Health Organization (WHO) had, in a recent report, said India has entered the stage of community transmission for coronavirus. However, it today clarified an error in the report and said there are "cluster of cases" in India and not community transmission. The Health Ministry also stated in today's press conference that India hasn't reached community transmission stage.
Text: WHO admits error, says 'cluster of cases in India, not community transmission' The World Health Organization (WHO) had, in a recent report, said India has entered the stage of community transmission for coronavirus. However, it today clarified an error in the report and said there are "cluster of cases" in India and not community transmission. The Health Ministry also stated in today's press conference that India hasn't reached community transmission stage.

Headline: Total 60 COVID-19 cases in Bihar; 29 in Siwan district alone: Govt
Description: Two new coronavirus cases were reported in Bihar on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 60, said the state's Principal Health Secretary Sanjay Kumar. Out of the 60 cases reported in 11 Bihar districts, 29 were reported in Siwan district alone. The state has 42 active coronavirus cases, while 17 patients have recovered.
Text: Total 60 COVID-19 cases in Bihar; 29 in Siwan district alone: Govt Two new coronavirus cases were reported in Bihar on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 60, said the state's Principal Health Secretary Sanjay Kumar. Out of the 60 cases reported in 11 Bihar districts, 29 were reported in Siwan district alone. The state has 42 active coronavirus cases, while 17 patients have recovered.

Headline: Ban on selfies, photos while distributing food amid lockdown in Ajmer
Description: Taking selfies and photographs while distributing food to the needy amid coronavirus lockdown has been banned in Ajmer district of Rajasthan, said an order by the District Collector on Friday. The order has been issued to ensure that social distancing is followed to control the spread of the virus. Any violation may result in action under Section 188 of IPC.
Text: Ban on selfies, photos while distributing food amid lockdown in Ajmer Taking selfies and photographs while distributing food to the needy amid coronavirus lockdown has been banned in Ajmer district of Rajasthan, said an order by the District Collector on Friday. The order has been issued to ensure that social distancing is followed to control the spread of the virus. Any violation may result in action under Section 188 of IPC.

Headline: Mumbai reports its highest coronavirus cases in a day as total nears 1,000
Description: Mumbai on Friday reported its highest number of cases in a single day after 218 patients tested positive for the virus. The total number of cases in Mumbai has reached 993, while after 10 deaths on Monday, the total death toll reached 64. Out of the 218 positive cases today, 60% patients are asymptomatic, the public health department said.
Text: Mumbai reports its highest coronavirus cases in a day as total nears 1,000 Mumbai on Friday reported its highest number of cases in a single day after 218 patients tested positive for the virus. The total number of cases in Mumbai has reached 993, while after 10 deaths on Monday, the total death toll reached 64. Out of the 218 positive cases today, 60% patients are asymptomatic, the public health department said.

Headline: Pune Municipal Corp to give ₹1-cr aid to families of staff who die of COVID-19
Description: Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol on Friday announced ₹1 crore assistance for family of each Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) employee who dies due to COVID-19 while on duty. If a family member of the deceased employee needs a job, PMC will employ them and provide an assistance of ₹75 lakhs, said Mohol. Pune has reported 25 deaths due to coronavirus.
Text: Pune Municipal Corp to give ₹1-cr aid to families of staff who die of COVID-19 Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol on Friday announced ₹1 crore assistance for family of each Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) employee who dies due to COVID-19 while on duty. If a family member of the deceased employee needs a job, PMC will employ them and provide an assistance of ₹75 lakhs, said Mohol. Pune has reported 25 deaths due to coronavirus.

Headline: Umpire Anil stranded in village due to lockdown climbs trees to get mobile network
Description: ICC international panel umpire Anil Chaudhary, who is stranded in his ancestral village 80 km from Delhi amid lockdown, said he has to climb up trees to search for mobile network. "The biggest problem is network here...I can't talk to anyone or use the internet," he said. Chaudhary added that he needs internet to access ICC's online programmes for umpires.
Text: Umpire Anil stranded in village due to lockdown climbs trees to get mobile network ICC international panel umpire Anil Chaudhary, who is stranded in his ancestral village 80 km from Delhi amid lockdown, said he has to climb up trees to search for mobile network. "The biggest problem is network here...I can't talk to anyone or use the internet," he said. Chaudhary added that he needs internet to access ICC's online programmes for umpires.

Headline: Migrant worker donates ₹5k to Kerala CM's relief fund for COVID-19
Description: A migrant worker from Rajasthan contributed ₹5,000 to Kerala Chief Minister's Distress Relief Fund (CMDRF) to help the state government in its fight against coronavirus. Vinod Jangid, who is a 22-year-old tile worker, handed over the money at Neeleswaram police station in Kasaragod as he didn't know how to access the account number of CMDRF, said a police official.
Text: Migrant worker donates ₹5k to Kerala CM's relief fund for COVID-19 A migrant worker from Rajasthan contributed ₹5,000 to Kerala Chief Minister's Distress Relief Fund (CMDRF) to help the state government in its fight against coronavirus. Vinod Jangid, who is a 22-year-old tile worker, handed over the money at Neeleswaram police station in Kasaragod as he didn't know how to access the account number of CMDRF, said a police official.

Headline: 23 new coronavirus cases in J&K; total number rises to 207: Govt
Description: Jammu and Kashmir reported 23 new coronavirus cases on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 207. Out of these, 168 coronavirus cases are in Kashmir and 39 are in Jammu, said J&K Principal Secretary (Planning), Rohit Kansal. The Union Territory currently has 197 active positive cases and four people have died of coronavirus there.
Text: 23 new coronavirus cases in J&K; total number rises to 207: Govt Jammu and Kashmir reported 23 new coronavirus cases on Friday, taking the total number of cases in the Union Territory to 207. Out of these, 168 coronavirus cases are in Kashmir and 39 are in Jammu, said J&K Principal Secretary (Planning), Rohit Kansal. The Union Territory currently has 197 active positive cases and four people have died of coronavirus there.

Headline: TN policemen mistakenly enter Karnataka, ask state Home Minister 'who are you'
Description: Tamil Nadu policemen at Karnataka border mistakenly entered Karnataka and questioned Home Minister Basavaraj Bommai as he was assessing lockdown situation. The policemen asked Bommai "who are you" and where was he going amid lockdown. "Tamil Nadu police put up barricades in the Karnataka border. Immediately called Bengaluru Rural District SP and instructed him to evict barricades," Bommai tweeted.
Text: TN policemen mistakenly enter Karnataka, ask state Home Minister 'who are you' Tamil Nadu policemen at Karnataka border mistakenly entered Karnataka and questioned Home Minister Basavaraj Bommai as he was assessing lockdown situation. The policemen asked Bommai "who are you" and where was he going amid lockdown. "Tamil Nadu police put up barricades in the Karnataka border. Immediately called Bengaluru Rural District SP and instructed him to evict barricades," Bommai tweeted.

Headline: Not reducing employees' pension by 30%, media reports fake: Govt
Description: The government has issued a clarification after several media reports claimed that it may reduce employees' pension by 30% and terminate it for those above the age of 80 in the context of coronavirus. "This claim is fake. The government is doing no such thing!" Press Information Bureau tweeted, urging people to not fall for rumours.
Text: Not reducing employees' pension by 30%, media reports fake: Govt The government has issued a clarification after several media reports claimed that it may reduce employees' pension by 30% and terminate it for those above the age of 80 in the context of coronavirus. "This claim is fake. The government is doing no such thing!" Press Information Bureau tweeted, urging people to not fall for rumours.

Headline: PM shares Kailash's tweet, Sona says 'singer is #MeToo accused predator'
Description: Singer Sona Mohapatra responded to PM Narendra Modi after he retweeted a post by singer Kailash Kher and lauded the artists who're coming together to support PM-CARES fund. "PM sir, it's indeed time for everyone to come together in this period of crisis...but please note that the 'artist' whose tweet you chose to share is...multiple accused @IndiaMeToo predator," Sona wrote.
Text: PM shares Kailash's tweet, Sona says 'singer is #MeToo accused predator' Singer Sona Mohapatra responded to PM Narendra Modi after he retweeted a post by singer Kailash Kher and lauded the artists who're coming together to support PM-CARES fund. "PM sir, it's indeed time for everyone to come together in this period of crisis...but please note that the 'artist' whose tweet you chose to share is...multiple accused @IndiaMeToo predator," Sona wrote.

Headline: If you roam unnecessarily, we'll make you listen to Masakali 2.0: Jaipur Police
Description: The Twitter handle of Jaipur Police took a dig at song 'Masakali 2.0' and warned those violating lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic. "If you're unnecessarily roaming outside we'll put you in...room and play 'Masakali 2.0' on loop," they wrote. They also altered the lyrics of the song and wrote, "Mat udiyo, tu dariyo...Na kar manmani...Ghar mein hi rahiyo, naa kar naadani."
Text: If you roam unnecessarily, we'll make you listen to Masakali 2.0: Jaipur Police The Twitter handle of Jaipur Police took a dig at song 'Masakali 2.0' and warned those violating lockdown amid coronavirus pandemic. "If you're unnecessarily roaming outside we'll put you in...room and play 'Masakali 2.0' on loop," they wrote. They also altered the lyrics of the song and wrote, "Mat udiyo, tu dariyo...Na kar manmani...Ghar mein hi rahiyo, naa kar naadani."

Headline: Production of PPEs is being ramped up: PMO reviews efforts to tackle COVID-19
Description: The production of PPEs is being ramped up and capacity building for healthcare personnel is being ensured, the PM's Office was informed on Friday. The PM's Principal Secretary, PK Mishra, chaired a meeting to review efforts made by eleven Empowered Groups formed to tackle coronavirus. Officials also discussed the testing protocol under which 1,45,916 samples have been tested so far.
Text: Production of PPEs is being ramped up: PMO reviews efforts to tackle COVID-19 The production of PPEs is being ramped up and capacity building for healthcare personnel is being ensured, the PM's Office was informed on Friday. The PM's Principal Secretary, PK Mishra, chaired a meeting to review efforts made by eleven Empowered Groups formed to tackle coronavirus. Officials also discussed the testing protocol under which 1,45,916 samples have been tested so far.

Headline: 20,473 foreigners evacuated, will assess how to bring Indians from abroad: Govt
Description: The government has said that 20,473 foreign nationals have been evacuated from India, as of April 9. A decision on bringing Indians from abroad will be taken after assessing the coronavirus situation, Dammu Ravi, AS & Coordinator (COVID-19), MEA said. "Our ambassadors and high commissioners in these countries are in regular touch with Indians abroad," he added.
Text: 20,473 foreigners evacuated, will assess how to bring Indians from abroad: Govt The government has said that 20,473 foreign nationals have been evacuated from India, as of April 9. A decision on bringing Indians from abroad will be taken after assessing the coronavirus situation, Dammu Ravi, AS & Coordinator (COVID-19), MEA said. "Our ambassadors and high commissioners in these countries are in regular touch with Indians abroad," he added.

Headline: UK to send 12 more flights to evacuate stranded nationals from India
Description: The UK government has announced 12 additional charter flights to evacuate over 3,000 nationals stranded in India, including in Punjab, Gujarat and West Bengal, amid the coronavirus lockdown. Last week, it announced seven flights for evacuation. On Thursday, 317 people landed in the UK from Goa while 1,400 will be evacuated over the weekend from New Delhi and Mumbai.
Text: UK to send 12 more flights to evacuate stranded nationals from India The UK government has announced 12 additional charter flights to evacuate over 3,000 nationals stranded in India, including in Punjab, Gujarat and West Bengal, amid the coronavirus lockdown. Last week, it announced seven flights for evacuation. On Thursday, 317 people landed in the UK from Goa while 1,400 will be evacuated over the weekend from New Delhi and Mumbai.

Headline: 149 people held, 30 vehicles impounded for defying lockdown in Noida
Description: The police on Thursday arrested 149 people and impounded 30 vehicles across Noida and Greater Noida for allegedly defying the COVID-19 lockdown. "Seven FIRs were registered... A total of 445 vehicles were checked across 132 barrier points in the district and challans issued to 200 of them, while 30 were impounded," the police stated.
Text: 149 people held, 30 vehicles impounded for defying lockdown in Noida The police on Thursday arrested 149 people and impounded 30 vehicles across Noida and Greater Noida for allegedly defying the COVID-19 lockdown. "Seven FIRs were registered... A total of 445 vehicles were checked across 132 barrier points in the district and challans issued to 200 of them, while 30 were impounded," the police stated.

Headline: Delhi Police books 32 people for stepping out of homes without masks
Description: The Delhi Police on Friday stated that it has booked 32 people for stepping out of their homes without wearing masks in northwest Delhi. Two days ago, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had announced that facial masks have been made compulsory for anyone stepping out of their house amid the coronavirus pandemic.
Text: Delhi Police books 32 people for stepping out of homes without masks The Delhi Police on Friday stated that it has booked 32 people for stepping out of their homes without wearing masks in northwest Delhi. Two days ago, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had announced that facial masks have been made compulsory for anyone stepping out of their house amid the coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: 33 coronavirus deaths reported in India in 24 hours, most in a day so far: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 33 coronavirus deaths were reported in India in last 24 hours, which is the most number of deaths reported in a day so far. He added that 678 new cases were reported in last 24 hours. India has reported 6,412 coronavirus cases and 199 deaths so far.
Text: 33 coronavirus deaths reported in India in 24 hours, most in a day so far: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 33 coronavirus deaths were reported in India in last 24 hours, which is the most number of deaths reported in a day so far. He added that 678 new cases were reported in last 24 hours. India has reported 6,412 coronavirus cases and 199 deaths so far.

Headline: I thought I contracted coronavirus last month, tests were not available: Kriti
Description: Actress Kriti Kharbanda said she was down with flu last month, adding, "I was terrified I had contracted the virus but since test kits were not available in the country back then." "The doctors advised me to distance myself and monitor my symptoms. I was paranoid for the first three days, then, I started to feel better," she added.
Text: I thought I contracted coronavirus last month, tests were not available: Kriti Actress Kriti Kharbanda said she was down with flu last month, adding, "I was terrified I had contracted the virus but since test kits were not available in the country back then." "The doctors advised me to distance myself and monitor my symptoms. I was paranoid for the first three days, then, I started to feel better," she added.

Headline: TN hospital's medical staff staying on campus to protect their families
Description: Doctors and health workers working in the Covid-19 ward of Kilpauk Medical College in Chennai have been staying inside the campus after completing their work, in order to prevent potentially spreading coronavirus among their family members. The dean of the hospital said they "have been given the required protection gear...Still, they are staying back in order to protect their families."
Text: TN hospital's medical staff staying on campus to protect their families Doctors and health workers working in the Covid-19 ward of Kilpauk Medical College in Chennai have been staying inside the campus after completing their work, in order to prevent potentially spreading coronavirus among their family members. The dean of the hospital said they "have been given the required protection gear...Still, they are staying back in order to protect their families."

Headline: Drones used to spray disinfectants over sealed hotspots in Noida
Description: The Noida Authority has started using drones to spray disinfectants over some sealed coronavirus hotspots in the city. The authority has also installed two disinfectant tunnels for staff members, who are engaged in providing essential services to the public. These tunnels, which spray sodium hypochlorite solution, take around 30 seconds to disinfect a person who walks through it, officials said.
Text: Drones used to spray disinfectants over sealed hotspots in Noida The Noida Authority has started using drones to spray disinfectants over some sealed coronavirus hotspots in the city. The authority has also installed two disinfectant tunnels for staff members, who are engaged in providing essential services to the public. These tunnels, which spray sodium hypochlorite solution, take around 30 seconds to disinfect a person who walks through it, officials said.

Headline: Smriti Irani makes reusable mask from cloth using thread and needle, shares pics
Description: Textiles Minister Smriti Irani tweeted pictures of herself stitching face masks at home amid lockdown due to coronavirus. With the picture collage, which also acts as a step-wise guide on how to make masks, Irani wrote, "Reusable masks can also be made from needle and thread at home." She also attached Health Ministry's advisory link with the tweet.
Text: Smriti Irani makes reusable mask from cloth using thread and needle, shares pics Textiles Minister Smriti Irani tweeted pictures of herself stitching face masks at home amid lockdown due to coronavirus. With the picture collage, which also acts as a step-wise guide on how to make masks, Irani wrote, "Reusable masks can also be made from needle and thread at home." She also attached Health Ministry's advisory link with the tweet.

Headline: Northeast reports 1st Covid-19 fatality as retired BSF personnel dies
Description: The Northeast region recorded its first Covid-19 fatality on Friday after a 65-year-old retired BSF personnel died in Assam. State minister Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted, "My deep condolences and prayers for the bereaved family." The deceased, Faijul Haque Barbhyan, had attended the Jamaat meet at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi and had travelled to Saudi Arabia before that.
Text: Northeast reports 1st Covid-19 fatality as retired BSF personnel dies The Northeast region recorded its first Covid-19 fatality on Friday after a 65-year-old retired BSF personnel died in Assam. State minister Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted, "My deep condolences and prayers for the bereaved family." The deceased, Faijul Haque Barbhyan, had attended the Jamaat meet at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi and had travelled to Saudi Arabia before that.

Headline: Can gauge nation's seriousness: India as Pak last to contribute to SAARC fund
Description: India has said the "seriousness" of any nation can be "gauged by their behaviour" as Pakistan became the last one to contribute to the SAARC COVID-19 Emergency Response Fund. "Assistance in material and services has been extended to Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal and Sri Lanka. These countries...also made early commitments to the fund," MEA spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said.
Text: Can gauge nation's seriousness: India as Pak last to contribute to SAARC fund India has said the "seriousness" of any nation can be "gauged by their behaviour" as Pakistan became the last one to contribute to the SAARC COVID-19 Emergency Response Fund. "Assistance in material and services has been extended to Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal and Sri Lanka. These countries...also made early commitments to the fund," MEA spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said.

Headline: ADB assures ₹16,700 crore assistance for India to fight coronavirus
Description: Asian Development Bank (ADB) has assured $2.2 billion (over ₹16,700 crore) assistance for India to fight coronavirus. "ADB is committed to supporting India's emergency needs...We'll consider all financing options available with us to meet India's needs," President Masatsugu Asakawa said. Earlier, World Bank approved $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight the outbreak.
Text: ADB assures ₹16,700 crore assistance for India to fight coronavirus Asian Development Bank (ADB) has assured $2.2 billion (over ₹16,700 crore) assistance for India to fight coronavirus. "ADB is committed to supporting India's emergency needs...We'll consider all financing options available with us to meet India's needs," President Masatsugu Asakawa said. Earlier, World Bank approved $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight the outbreak.

Headline: IndiGo to suspend meal service, fill only 50% seats in airport buses
Description: In a mail to employees on Friday, IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta said the airline will resume operations "slowly at first" whenever the lockdown is lifted and will practise onboard social distancing measures. Dutta added, "We'll deep clean our aircraft more frequently, we'll...discontinue meal service for a brief period and we'll run our coaches at a maximum load of 50% capacity."
Text: IndiGo to suspend meal service, fill only 50% seats in airport buses In a mail to employees on Friday, IndiGo CEO Ronojoy Dutta said the airline will resume operations "slowly at first" whenever the lockdown is lifted and will practise onboard social distancing measures. Dutta added, "We'll deep clean our aircraft more frequently, we'll...discontinue meal service for a brief period and we'll run our coaches at a maximum load of 50% capacity."

Headline: 47 people locked inside their houses in MP for violating lockdown
Description: Forty-seven people were locked inside their houses with their families in two towns in MP's Chhatarpur district to prevent them from violating their home quarantine period of 14 days, authorities stated. The step was taken for people who left the district after March 30 and returned after getting treated in hospitals. The administration has been taking care of their needs.
Text: 47 people locked inside their houses in MP for violating lockdown Forty-seven people were locked inside their houses with their families in two towns in MP's Chhatarpur district to prevent them from violating their home quarantine period of 14 days, authorities stated. The step was taken for people who left the district after March 30 and returned after getting treated in hospitals. The administration has been taking care of their needs.

Headline: IIT-Ropar develops device to sanitise currency notes, groceries
Description: Indian Institute of Technology, Ropar has developed a trunk-shaped device based on ultraviolet germicidal irradiation technology. The device can be used to sanitise items brought from outside our homes including groceries and currency notes, amid spread of coronavirus. The device takes 30 minutes to sanitise the items and there's a 10 minute cooling off period before they can be used.
Text: IIT-Ropar develops device to sanitise currency notes, groceries Indian Institute of Technology, Ropar has developed a trunk-shaped device based on ultraviolet germicidal irradiation technology. The device can be used to sanitise items brought from outside our homes including groceries and currency notes, amid spread of coronavirus. The device takes 30 minutes to sanitise the items and there's a 10 minute cooling off period before they can be used.

Headline: Remember who said 'India First'? Tharoor as India sends HCQ to Israel
Description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has criticised PM Narendra Modi after the government supplied hydroxychloroquine to Israel to fight coronavirus. "Does anyone remember the man who said 'India First'?" Tharoor wrote on Twitter.  He also shared a report that said a shortage of the medication "forced Rajasthan government to return its entire stock" to the firm it was acquired from.
Text: Remember who said 'India First'? Tharoor as India sends HCQ to Israel Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has criticised PM Narendra Modi after the government supplied hydroxychloroquine to Israel to fight coronavirus. "Does anyone remember the man who said 'India First'?" Tharoor wrote on Twitter.  He also shared a report that said a shortage of the medication "forced Rajasthan government to return its entire stock" to the firm it was acquired from.

Headline: Maharashtra to put 5 prisons in Mumbai, Pune regions under lockdown
Description: The Maharashtra Home Department has issued orders for the complete lockdown of 5 prisons in Mumbai and Pune regions. These are Mumbai Central Prison, Thane Prison, Yerawada Prison, Byculla Prison and Kalyan Prison. "Prison staff will lock themselves up... and administer the prisons without stepping out," said Additional Director General (Prisons and Correctional Services) Sunil Ramanand.
Text: Maharashtra to put 5 prisons in Mumbai, Pune regions under lockdown The Maharashtra Home Department has issued orders for the complete lockdown of 5 prisons in Mumbai and Pune regions. These are Mumbai Central Prison, Thane Prison, Yerawada Prison, Byculla Prison and Kalyan Prison. "Prison staff will lock themselves up... and administer the prisons without stepping out," said Additional Director General (Prisons and Correctional Services) Sunil Ramanand.

Headline: 720 +ve cases in Delhi so far, 22 in ICU and 7 on ventilator: Minister
Description: There are a total of 720 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 22 are in the ICU and seven are on the ventilator, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain stated. There have been 12 deaths in Delhi till now, while 25 people have been cured or discharged. The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 6,412.
Text: 720 +ve cases in Delhi so far, 22 in ICU and 7 on ventilator: Minister There are a total of 720 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 22 are in the ICU and seven are on the ventilator, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain stated. There have been 12 deaths in Delhi till now, while 25 people have been cured or discharged. The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 6,412.

Headline: 5 new COVID-19 cases in Dharavi; 2 attended Tablighi event: BMC
Description: Five more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Mumbai's Dharavi taking the total number of cases there to 22, said Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Friday. Two out of the five new cases reported in the slum area are linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin in Delhi, said BMC. Maharashtra has reported total of 1,364 coronavirus cases.
Text: 5 new COVID-19 cases in Dharavi; 2 attended Tablighi event: BMC Five more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Mumbai's Dharavi taking the total number of cases there to 22, said Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Friday. Two out of the five new cases reported in the slum area are linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin in Delhi, said BMC. Maharashtra has reported total of 1,364 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Increasing COVID-19 testing in UP can be a lifesaver: Priyanka to CM Yogi
Description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday wrote to UP CM Yogi Adityanath suggesting ways to control the spread of coronavirus in the state. For UP, which has a huge population, increasing testing can prove to be a lifesaver, said Priyanka. Mild to moderately high-risk cases must be treated on a war-footing to save ICUs from pressure, she added.
Text: Increasing COVID-19 testing in UP can be a lifesaver: Priyanka to CM Yogi Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Thursday wrote to UP CM Yogi Adityanath suggesting ways to control the spread of coronavirus in the state. For UP, which has a huge population, increasing testing can prove to be a lifesaver, said Priyanka. Mild to moderately high-risk cases must be treated on a war-footing to save ICUs from pressure, she added.

Headline: Hope Mumbaikars are Raazi with Alia's advice to not go out in Gully: Police
Description: Alia Bhatt on Thursday thanked Mumbai Police for their efforts in protecting people amid the coronavirus pandemic and asked people to stay home for them. Responding to her tweet, Mumbai Police tweeted, "Mumbaikars, we hope you...are 'Raazi' with this [advice] of...@aliaa08 to not venture out in any 'Gully' unnecessarily and take care of 'Dear Zindagi'." Alia has retweeted their tweet.
Text: Hope Mumbaikars are Raazi with Alia's advice to not go out in Gully: Police Alia Bhatt on Thursday thanked Mumbai Police for their efforts in protecting people amid the coronavirus pandemic and asked people to stay home for them. Responding to her tweet, Mumbai Police tweeted, "Mumbaikars, we hope you...are 'Raazi' with this [advice] of...@aliaa08 to not venture out in any 'Gully' unnecessarily and take care of 'Dear Zindagi'." Alia has retweeted their tweet.

Headline: Akshay Kumar donates ₹3 cr to BMC for PPE, masks & test kits
Description: Akshay Kumar has donated ₹3 crore to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation to assist in the making of masks, personal protection equipment (PPE) and rapid testing kits to help combat coronavirus, film critic Taran Adarsh announced. Earlier, he had donated ₹25 crore to PM CARES Fund. On Thursday, Akshay through a video thanked essential workers for keeping people safe amid the pandemic.
Text: Akshay Kumar donates ₹3 cr to BMC for PPE, masks & test kits Akshay Kumar has donated ₹3 crore to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation to assist in the making of masks, personal protection equipment (PPE) and rapid testing kits to help combat coronavirus, film critic Taran Adarsh announced. Earlier, he had donated ₹25 crore to PM CARES Fund. On Thursday, Akshay through a video thanked essential workers for keeping people safe amid the pandemic.

Headline: Differently-abled BMC workers request civic body for leave amid lockdown
Description: The differently-abled workers of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) have written to the Municipal Commissioner of Mumbai Praveen Pardeshi and to the state government demanding leave, amid coronavirus lockdown. They said that they are finding it difficult to travel due to the lockdown. According to a labours' union in Mumbai, 1,200-1,300 differently-abled workers are employed in BMC.
Text: Differently-abled BMC workers request civic body for leave amid lockdown The differently-abled workers of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) have written to the Municipal Commissioner of Mumbai Praveen Pardeshi and to the state government demanding leave, amid coronavirus lockdown. They said that they are finding it difficult to travel due to the lockdown. According to a labours' union in Mumbai, 1,200-1,300 differently-abled workers are employed in BMC.

Headline: SC asks Centre, J&K to respond to plea on 4G internet amid COVID-19
Description: Supreme Court has asked the Centre and Jammu and Kashmir administration to respond to a plea filed by the Foundation for Media Professionals seeking directions to restore 4G internet services in the UT, amid COVID-19 spread. The plea stated it wanted to ensure the flow of information to citizens during the lockdown. Jammu and Kashmir has reported 158 COVID-19 cases.
Text: SC asks Centre, J&K to respond to plea on 4G internet amid COVID-19 Supreme Court has asked the Centre and Jammu and Kashmir administration to respond to a plea filed by the Foundation for Media Professionals seeking directions to restore 4G internet services in the UT, amid COVID-19 spread. The plea stated it wanted to ensure the flow of information to citizens during the lockdown. Jammu and Kashmir has reported 158 COVID-19 cases.

Headline: 100 days since first coronavirus case was reported: Kerala CM
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday said that it has been 100 days since the first COVID-19 case was reported, while sharing an update on the number of total cases there. Kerala has reported 357 confirmed coronavirus cases, out of which 258 are active and 97 have recovered, Vijayan said. Two people have died in Kerala due to the virus.
Text: 100 days since first coronavirus case was reported: Kerala CM Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday said that it has been 100 days since the first COVID-19 case was reported, while sharing an update on the number of total cases there. Kerala has reported 357 confirmed coronavirus cases, out of which 258 are active and 97 have recovered, Vijayan said. Two people have died in Kerala due to the virus.

Headline: Don't mention Markaz in bulletins: Delhi Minorities Commission to Health Dept
Description: Delhi Minorities Commission (DMC) Chairman Zafarul-Islam Khan wrote to the Delhi Health Department asking to stop naming Nizamuddin Markaz and drop any mention of "religious undertones" in its daily bulletins on coronavirus cases. "Such thoughtless classification is feeding into the Islamophobia agenda of the media...and has been...turned into a handle to attack Muslims," Khan said in his letter.
Text: Don't mention Markaz in bulletins: Delhi Minorities Commission to Health Dept Delhi Minorities Commission (DMC) Chairman Zafarul-Islam Khan wrote to the Delhi Health Department asking to stop naming Nizamuddin Markaz and drop any mention of "religious undertones" in its daily bulletins on coronavirus cases. "Such thoughtless classification is feeding into the Islamophobia agenda of the media...and has been...turned into a handle to attack Muslims," Khan said in his letter.

Headline: I can volunteer in fight against COVID-19 but not rejoin duties: Ex-IAS
Description: Kannan Gopinathan, who had quit the Indian Administrative Service (IAS) eight months ago over Article 370, has been asked by the government to re-join duties as IAS, amid coronavirus pandemic. "I offer to volunteer...but not rejoining IAS," he tweeted. "I extend all my services, in health...mind to the govt...[but] it will be as a free and responsible citizen," Gopinathan added.
Text: I can volunteer in fight against COVID-19 but not rejoin duties: Ex-IAS Kannan Gopinathan, who had quit the Indian Administrative Service (IAS) eight months ago over Article 370, has been asked by the government to re-join duties as IAS, amid coronavirus pandemic. "I offer to volunteer...but not rejoining IAS," he tweeted. "I extend all my services, in health...mind to the govt...[but] it will be as a free and responsible citizen," Gopinathan added.

Headline: Don't glorify T'gana mother's 1,400-km ride amid lockdown: Sambit Patra
Description: After a Telangana woman rode a scooter for 1,400 km to bring back her son stuck in Andhra Pradesh due to lockdown, BJP's Sambit Patra on Friday tweeted, "Every mother can go to any extent...but I differ in glorifying this...as a great act." He added that it may instigate other parents to "follow suit", defeating the purpose of lockdown.
Text: Don't glorify T'gana mother's 1,400-km ride amid lockdown: Sambit Patra After a Telangana woman rode a scooter for 1,400 km to bring back her son stuck in Andhra Pradesh due to lockdown, BJP's Sambit Patra on Friday tweeted, "Every mother can go to any extent...but I differ in glorifying this...as a great act." He added that it may instigate other parents to "follow suit", defeating the purpose of lockdown.

Headline: Citizens should remember fundamental duties amid COVID-19: Bombay HC
Description: The Aurangabad bench of Bombay High Court said that while the government must work towards combating coronavirus pandemic, the citizens should also remember their fundamental duties. "There are still some citizens who are committing a breach of directions and guidelines," the court said. "Some citizens are even indulging in acts of disturbance of social and communal harmony," it further stated.
Text: Citizens should remember fundamental duties amid COVID-19: Bombay HC The Aurangabad bench of Bombay High Court said that while the government must work towards combating coronavirus pandemic, the citizens should also remember their fundamental duties. "There are still some citizens who are committing a breach of directions and guidelines," the court said. "Some citizens are even indulging in acts of disturbance of social and communal harmony," it further stated.

Headline: Number of coronavirus cases in India exceeds 6,000, death toll reaches 199
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 6,412, while the death toll has reached 199. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 504. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.
Text: Number of coronavirus cases in India exceeds 6,000, death toll reaches 199 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 6,412, while the death toll has reached 199. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 504. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.

Headline: Number of +ve coronavirus cases in J&K rises to 184
Description: The number of people who have tested positive for coronavirus has risen to 184 in Jammu and Kashmir, a government spokesperson has stated. The spokesperson added that 32 of these cases have been reported in Jammu and 152 cases have been reported in Kashmir. As many as 24 fresh cases were reported in the Valley on Thursday, health officials stated.
Text: Number of +ve coronavirus cases in J&K rises to 184 The number of people who have tested positive for coronavirus has risen to 184 in Jammu and Kashmir, a government spokesperson has stated. The spokesperson added that 32 of these cases have been reported in Jammu and 152 cases have been reported in Kashmir. As many as 24 fresh cases were reported in the Valley on Thursday, health officials stated.

Headline: Telangana woman rides scooter for 1,400 km, brings back son stuck due to lockdown
Description: Telangana's 48-year-old Razia Begum covered nearly 1,400 km on a scooter over three days, after local police permission, to bring home her son after he got stuck in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore due to nationwide lockdown. She returned with her son on Wednesday evening. "It was fearsome in the nights with no traffic movement and people on roads," the woman said.
Text: Telangana woman rides scooter for 1,400 km, brings back son stuck due to lockdown Telangana's 48-year-old Razia Begum covered nearly 1,400 km on a scooter over three days, after local police permission, to bring home her son after he got stuck in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore due to nationwide lockdown. She returned with her son on Wednesday evening. "It was fearsome in the nights with no traffic movement and people on roads," the woman said.

Headline: Haryana to pay double salary to govt doctors, nurses, ambulance staff
Description: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday announced that the state would pay double salary to government doctors, nurses, paramedical staff, ambulance staff, testing lab staff and class IV staff at the forefront of the fight against coronavirus. Khattar stated that the double salary will be paid until the crisis is over, and described doctors as next to God.
Text: Haryana to pay double salary to govt doctors, nurses, ambulance staff Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday announced that the state would pay double salary to government doctors, nurses, paramedical staff, ambulance staff, testing lab staff and class IV staff at the forefront of the fight against coronavirus. Khattar stated that the double salary will be paid until the crisis is over, and described doctors as next to God.

Headline: Israel PM thanks PM Modi for sending Hydroxychloroquine, PM Modi responds
Description: Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday tweeted, "Thank you, my dear friend Narendra Modi, PM of India, for sending [Hydroxychloroquine] to Israel. All the citizens of Israel thank you!" Responding to Netanyahu, PM Modi tweeted, "India is ready to do whatever is possible to help our friends. Praying for the well-being and good health of the people of Israel."
Text: Israel PM thanks PM Modi for sending Hydroxychloroquine, PM Modi responds Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday tweeted, "Thank you, my dear friend Narendra Modi, PM of India, for sending [Hydroxychloroquine] to Israel. All the citizens of Israel thank you!" Responding to Netanyahu, PM Modi tweeted, "India is ready to do whatever is possible to help our friends. Praying for the well-being and good health of the people of Israel."

Headline: India conducts 16,002 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in a day so far
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 16,002 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 320 samples tested positive. Further, 1,44,910 samples from 1,30,792 individuals have been tested in India so far.
Text: India conducts 16,002 coronavirus tests today, highest tally in a day so far The Indian Council of Medical Research has said that as many as 16,002 coronavirus tests were conducted in the country today, which is the highest number of tests done in a day so far. Out of all the tests conducted today, 320 samples tested positive. Further, 1,44,910 samples from 1,30,792 individuals have been tested in India so far.

Headline: Muslim man allegedly beaten on suspicion of conspiracy to spread COVID-19: Police
Description: A 22-year-old man who had returned to his village in Bawana in Delhi after attending a Tablighi Jamaat conference in Bhopal was allegedly beaten up after some people accused him of conspiring to spread COVID-19, PTI reported quoting police officials. The victim, who's admitted to a hospital in Delhi as a coronavirus suspect, is stable and doing fine, police added.
Text: Muslim man allegedly beaten on suspicion of conspiracy to spread COVID-19: Police A 22-year-old man who had returned to his village in Bawana in Delhi after attending a Tablighi Jamaat conference in Bhopal was allegedly beaten up after some people accused him of conspiring to spread COVID-19, PTI reported quoting police officials. The victim, who's admitted to a hospital in Delhi as a coronavirus suspect, is stable and doing fine, police added.

Headline: Biker drags Mumbai policeman for 50m to escape checking during lockdown
Description: A 40-year-old policeman was injured after he was dragged for around 50 metres by a motorcyclist, who tried to evade checking in Mumbai on Thursday amid lockdown due to coronavirus, an official said. The policeman had tried to stop the biker after finding something suspicious about him, the official added. A video of the incident also surfaced online.
Text: Biker drags Mumbai policeman for 50m to escape checking during lockdown A 40-year-old policeman was injured after he was dragged for around 50 metres by a motorcyclist, who tried to evade checking in Mumbai on Thursday amid lockdown due to coronavirus, an official said. The policeman had tried to stop the biker after finding something suspicious about him, the official added. A video of the incident also surfaced online.

Headline: Locals applaud sanitation workers, offer them garlands in Ambala
Description: Locals in Haryana's Ambala showed their appreciation toward sanitation workers by applauding them and offering them garlands as they passed through a lane on Thursday, amid the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, locals in Bihar's Gaya had showered flower petals on sanitation workers while a resident of Punjab's Nabha had offered a garland of currency notes to a sanitation worker.
Text: Locals applaud sanitation workers, offer them garlands in Ambala Locals in Haryana's Ambala showed their appreciation toward sanitation workers by applauding them and offering them garlands as they passed through a lane on Thursday, amid the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, locals in Bihar's Gaya had showered flower petals on sanitation workers while a resident of Punjab's Nabha had offered a garland of currency notes to a sanitation worker.

Headline: 9 areas in Gurugram declared containment zones, sealed to prevent Covid-19 spread
Description: Gurugram District Administration has declared nine areas in the district as 'containment zones' to prevent coronavirus spread in adjoining areas. The movement in public of the inhabitants of the containment zones shall be absolutely restricted, the order issued by District Magistrate states. It further says that the delivery of essential items would be ensured at the doorstep.
Text: 9 areas in Gurugram declared containment zones, sealed to prevent Covid-19 spread Gurugram District Administration has declared nine areas in the district as 'containment zones' to prevent coronavirus spread in adjoining areas. The movement in public of the inhabitants of the containment zones shall be absolutely restricted, the order issued by District Magistrate states. It further says that the delivery of essential items would be ensured at the doorstep.

Headline: We didn't pick fights with Kohli to save IPL contracts but to keep him quiet: Paine
Description: Australia Test captain Tim Paine has responded to Michael Clarke's claim that Australian players sucked up to Virat Kohli to protect their IPL contracts. "We didn't want to provoke any fight with him because we think that's when he plays at his best," Paine said. He added that Australian bowlers weren't thinking about IPL contract while bowling to Kohli.
Text: We didn't pick fights with Kohli to save IPL contracts but to keep him quiet: Paine Australia Test captain Tim Paine has responded to Michael Clarke's claim that Australian players sucked up to Virat Kohli to protect their IPL contracts. "We didn't want to provoke any fight with him because we think that's when he plays at his best," Paine said. He added that Australian bowlers weren't thinking about IPL contract while bowling to Kohli.

Headline: 7 test positive for COVID-19 in Chhattisgarh's Korba district
Description: Seven people have tested positive for COVID-19 in Chhattisgarh's Korba district on Thursday. Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo said that the seven new patients, including five males and two females, lived together. State CM Bhupesh Baghel said that the affected areas in Katghora in Korba would be sealed and every person in those areas would be tested for COVID-19.
Text: 7 test positive for COVID-19 in Chhattisgarh's Korba district Seven people have tested positive for COVID-19 in Chhattisgarh's Korba district on Thursday. Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo said that the seven new patients, including five males and two females, lived together. State CM Bhupesh Baghel said that the affected areas in Katghora in Korba would be sealed and every person in those areas would be tested for COVID-19.

Headline: Viral audio clip claiming vendors spreading COVID-19 by licking vegetables fake: Govt
Description: A viral audio clip is circulating on social media claiming that vegetable sellers are spreading coronavirus by licking or spitting on vegetables and fruits. "The claim made in audio clip is false & intended to create disharmony in society," the government clarified. The government urged people to not believe in rumours and verify news related to coronavirus from official sources.
Text: Viral audio clip claiming vendors spreading COVID-19 by licking vegetables fake: Govt A viral audio clip is circulating on social media claiming that vegetable sellers are spreading coronavirus by licking or spitting on vegetables and fruits. "The claim made in audio clip is false & intended to create disharmony in society," the government clarified. The government urged people to not believe in rumours and verify news related to coronavirus from official sources.

Headline: Terrorists may use coronavirus outbreak as opportunity to attack: UN chief
Description: Stating that implications of the coronavirus outbreak are much more far-reaching, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said that terrorist groups may see a window of opportunity to attack while the attention of most governments is turned towards the pandemic. Guterres further said that the United Nations faces "its gravest test" since the organisation was founded 75 years ago.
Text: Terrorists may use coronavirus outbreak as opportunity to attack: UN chief Stating that implications of the coronavirus outbreak are much more far-reaching, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said that terrorist groups may see a window of opportunity to attack while the attention of most governments is turned towards the pandemic. Guterres further said that the United Nations faces "its gravest test" since the organisation was founded 75 years ago.

Headline: Walkthrough booth for Covid-19 testing set up in Punjab
Description: A walkthrough testing facility has been installed at the civil hospital in Sangrur district, Punjab. The testing pod, which is the size of a mobile booth, has a polycarbonate glass sheet behind which a doctor stands and collects the swab. More such portable booths will be put up at different parts of the district, DC Ghanshyam Thori stated.
Text: Walkthrough booth for Covid-19 testing set up in Punjab A walkthrough testing facility has been installed at the civil hospital in Sangrur district, Punjab. The testing pod, which is the size of a mobile booth, has a polycarbonate glass sheet behind which a doctor stands and collects the swab. More such portable booths will be put up at different parts of the district, DC Ghanshyam Thori stated.

Headline: Strength of federalism came to fore in COVID-19 fight: Jharkhand CM
Description: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren has said that the strength of federalism has come to the fore in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic with Chief Ministers coordinating with each other to help people stranded outside their states. Soren said, "The PM didn't ask the states while imposing the lockdown and now he's asking states for suggestions to open the lockdown."
Text: Strength of federalism came to fore in COVID-19 fight: Jharkhand CM Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren has said that the strength of federalism has come to the fore in the fight against the coronavirus pandemic with Chief Ministers coordinating with each other to help people stranded outside their states. Soren said, "The PM didn't ask the states while imposing the lockdown and now he's asking states for suggestions to open the lockdown."

Headline: J&K is and shall remain India's integral part: India on China's remarks at UN
Description: India has rejected the reference to Jammu and Kashmir in a statement made by a spokesperson of China's permanent mission to the United Nations. The government said that China is aware of India's position on the issue. "The Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir has been, is and shall continue to be an integral part of India," said the government.
Text: J&K is and shall remain India's integral part: India on China's remarks at UN India has rejected the reference to Jammu and Kashmir in a statement made by a spokesperson of China's permanent mission to the United Nations. The government said that China is aware of India's position on the issue. "The Union Territory of Jammu & Kashmir has been, is and shall continue to be an integral part of India," said the government.

Headline: Hyderabad store refuses entry to 2 Manipuri men, 3 detained
Description: Hyderabad Police have registered a case against the management of a supermarket and detained three employees after two men from Manipur were denied entry into the supermarket. They were asked to leave even after showing their identity cards. The incident was caught on camera and went viral on social media with Union Minister Kiren Rijiju also taking note of it.
Text: Hyderabad store refuses entry to 2 Manipuri men, 3 detained Hyderabad Police have registered a case against the management of a supermarket and detained three employees after two men from Manipur were denied entry into the supermarket. They were asked to leave even after showing their identity cards. The incident was caught on camera and went viral on social media with Union Minister Kiren Rijiju also taking note of it.

Headline: Prisoners in Haryana jail prepare meals, stitch masks amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: In Haryana's Sunaria jail, more than 1,000 prisoners are preparing meals for about 2,500 underprivileged people, besides stitching masks amid COVID-19 pandemic. "We've delivered about 2,000 masks to Sonepat police, 100 to a media organisation and 1,000 to an NGO in Dadri," Jail superintendent Suneel Sangwan said. "The inmates are following social distancing while working," he added.
Text: Prisoners in Haryana jail prepare meals, stitch masks amid COVID-19 pandemic In Haryana's Sunaria jail, more than 1,000 prisoners are preparing meals for about 2,500 underprivileged people, besides stitching masks amid COVID-19 pandemic. "We've delivered about 2,000 masks to Sonepat police, 100 to a media organisation and 1,000 to an NGO in Dadri," Jail superintendent Suneel Sangwan said. "The inmates are following social distancing while working," he added.

Headline: Govt removes customs duty, cess on import of ventilators, COVID-19 test kits
Description: The government on Thursday removed customs duty and health cess on ventilators, coronavirus testing kits and other medical supplies to increase the availability of these products to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. The basic customs duty exemption shall be available up to September 30 this year, the Finance Ministry said. India has already restricted exports of diagnostic kits.
Text: Govt removes customs duty, cess on import of ventilators, COVID-19 test kits The government on Thursday removed customs duty and health cess on ventilators, coronavirus testing kits and other medical supplies to increase the availability of these products to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. The basic customs duty exemption shall be available up to September 30 this year, the Finance Ministry said. India has already restricted exports of diagnostic kits.

Headline: Delhi HC suspends summer break to make up for work loss due to COVID-19 lockdown
Description: Delhi High Court has decided to suspend its summer vacation to make up for the loss of working hours due to the coronavirus pandemic lockdown. The decision was taken considering the hardship and difficulties being faced by litigants on account of the lockdown and consequent suspension of functioning of the courts that are currently hearing matters of extreme urgency only.
Text: Delhi HC suspends summer break to make up for work loss due to COVID-19 lockdown Delhi High Court has decided to suspend its summer vacation to make up for the loss of working hours due to the coronavirus pandemic lockdown. The decision was taken considering the hardship and difficulties being faced by litigants on account of the lockdown and consequent suspension of functioning of the courts that are currently hearing matters of extreme urgency only.

Headline: Rising COVID-19 cases worrisome, people defying lockdown: Maha minister
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that it's worrisome that the number of COVID-19 cases is not coming down in the state. "Despite our efforts, the lockdown is being defied by people under various excuses," he added. "We have decided to deploy additional staff from SRPF to strictly implement lockdown in the congested areas identified as containment zones," Tope said.
Text: Rising COVID-19 cases worrisome, people defying lockdown: Maha minister Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said that it's worrisome that the number of COVID-19 cases is not coming down in the state. "Despite our efforts, the lockdown is being defied by people under various excuses," he added. "We have decided to deploy additional staff from SRPF to strictly implement lockdown in the congested areas identified as containment zones," Tope said.

Headline: Intelligence Bureau staff donates ₹3.5 crore to PM-CARES fund
Description: The staff of Intelligence Bureau (IB) has donated a day's salary to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's PM-CARES fund to support India's fight against the coronavirus pandemic. The Director of IB, Arvind Kumar, handed over a cheque of ₹3.5 crore to Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday. India has confirmed over 5,800 coronavirus cases with 169 deaths.
Text: Intelligence Bureau staff donates ₹3.5 crore to PM-CARES fund The staff of Intelligence Bureau (IB) has donated a day's salary to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's PM-CARES fund to support India's fight against the coronavirus pandemic. The Director of IB, Arvind Kumar, handed over a cheque of ₹3.5 crore to Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday. India has confirmed over 5,800 coronavirus cases with 169 deaths.

Headline: Fantastic use of technology to combat coronavirus: PM on Aarogya Setu app
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday urged people to download Aarogya Setu app to contain coronavirus spread. Commenting on a user's tweet, PM wrote, "Tracks the spread of COVID-19...notifies you if someone around you is suffering......fantastic usage of technology to combat coronavirus." Replying to another user, PM Modi tweeted, "Aarogya Setu is more effective when more people around you download it."
Text: Fantastic use of technology to combat coronavirus: PM on Aarogya Setu app PM Narendra Modi on Thursday urged people to download Aarogya Setu app to contain coronavirus spread. Commenting on a user's tweet, PM wrote, "Tracks the spread of COVID-19...notifies you if someone around you is suffering......fantastic usage of technology to combat coronavirus." Replying to another user, PM Modi tweeted, "Aarogya Setu is more effective when more people around you download it."

Headline: He's a soldier: Priyanka on man who covered 1,500 km to help in COVID-19 tests
Description: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Thursday took to Twitter and praised a research student of Lucknow's King George's Medical University. The scholar, in the microbiology department, had travelled 1,500 km from his native place in Telangana to Lucknow to help in COVID-19 sample testing. "There are lakhs of such soldiers...let's honour...give encouragement to their enthusiasm," she said.
Text: He's a soldier: Priyanka on man who covered 1,500 km to help in COVID-19 tests Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Thursday took to Twitter and praised a research student of Lucknow's King George's Medical University. The scholar, in the microbiology department, had travelled 1,500 km from his native place in Telangana to Lucknow to help in COVID-19 sample testing. "There are lakhs of such soldiers...let's honour...give encouragement to their enthusiasm," she said.

Headline: Wearing face masks compulsory in Punjab now: CM Amarinder Singh
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday said that wearing face masks is now compulsory in public due to the COVID-19 spread. "Health Secretary is issuing a detailed advisory for the people. Just remember to wear a mask when you step out of home for any emergency/essentials," he tweeted. "A piece of clean cloth is all you need," Singh added.
Text: Wearing face masks compulsory in Punjab now: CM Amarinder Singh Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh on Friday said that wearing face masks is now compulsory in public due to the COVID-19 spread. "Health Secretary is issuing a detailed advisory for the people. Just remember to wear a mask when you step out of home for any emergency/essentials," he tweeted. "A piece of clean cloth is all you need," Singh added.

Headline: Goa to use Ayurveda to boost immunity of coronavirus patients: CM Sawant
Description: Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday said Goa will be the first state to integrate allopathy and Ayurveda to treat coronavirus patients and those who have been quarantined. "Ayurveda has no cure for COVID-19, but it can increase immunity," Sawant added. The treatment will be administered in consultation with doctors who are dealing with COVID-19 patients, he said.
Text: Goa to use Ayurveda to boost immunity of coronavirus patients: CM Sawant Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday said Goa will be the first state to integrate allopathy and Ayurveda to treat coronavirus patients and those who have been quarantined. "Ayurveda has no cure for COVID-19, but it can increase immunity," Sawant added. The treatment will be administered in consultation with doctors who are dealing with COVID-19 patients, he said.

Headline: 540 new coronavirus cases, 17 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt
Description: As many as 540 new cases of coronavirus and 17 new deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said. He added that 473 COVID-19 patients have been discharged from hospitals after recovering from the virus. He added that supplies of PPEs and ventilators have started coming in.
Text: 540 new coronavirus cases, 17 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt As many as 540 new cases of coronavirus and 17 new deaths were reported in India in the last 24 hours, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said. He added that 473 COVID-19 patients have been discharged from hospitals after recovering from the virus. He added that supplies of PPEs and ventilators have started coming in.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Kerala rise to 357, all 8 foreigners recovered: Kerala CM
Description: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday announced that the total number of coronavirus cases in the state has risen to 357 after 12 new cases were reported in the state. He added that eight foreigners who had tested positive for coronavirus in Kerala, including those who were critical, have tested negative and recovered.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Kerala rise to 357, all 8 foreigners recovered: Kerala CM Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday announced that the total number of coronavirus cases in the state has risen to 357 after 12 new cases were reported in the state. He added that eight foreigners who had tested positive for coronavirus in Kerala, including those who were critical, have tested negative and recovered.

Headline: 720 coronavirus cases reported in Delhi so far, 9,968 tests conducted
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 720 after 51 new cases were reported today, while 12 COVID-19 patients have died in the national capital so far. The Delhi Chief Minister's Office further revealed that 9,968 coronavirus tests have been conducted in Delhi, out of which 8,643 tested negative and 605 results are pending.
Text: 720 coronavirus cases reported in Delhi so far, 9,968 tests conducted The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 720 after 51 new cases were reported today, while 12 COVID-19 patients have died in the national capital so far. The Delhi Chief Minister's Office further revealed that 9,968 coronavirus tests have been conducted in Delhi, out of which 8,643 tested negative and 605 results are pending.

Headline: Karnataka police sets up fact-check website amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: Karnataka police launched the website, factcheck.ksp.gov.in, for people to verify videos and posts forwarded on social media. The website also debunked fake information targeting specific communities. The website has so far verified facts related to nine posts, including a video which falsely claimed that "Muslims purposefully sneezed to spread COVID-19 at the Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque in Delhi".
Text: Karnataka police sets up fact-check website amid COVID-19 pandemic Karnataka police launched the website, factcheck.ksp.gov.in, for people to verify videos and posts forwarded on social media. The website also debunked fake information targeting specific communities. The website has so far verified facts related to nine posts, including a video which falsely claimed that "Muslims purposefully sneezed to spread COVID-19 at the Hazrat Nizamuddin mosque in Delhi".

Headline: 96 people test positive for coronavirus in Tamil Nadu today, total rises to 834
Description: As many as 96 people tested positive for coronavirus in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 834. Tamil Nadu Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said that 84 out of the 96 who tested positive today are from "single source" event. Chennai has reported most number of cases in the state at 163.
Text: 96 people test positive for coronavirus in Tamil Nadu today, total rises to 834 As many as 96 people tested positive for coronavirus in Tamil Nadu on Wednesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 834. Tamil Nadu Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said that 84 out of the 96 who tested positive today are from "single source" event. Chennai has reported most number of cases in the state at 163.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India surge to 5,865, death toll rises to 169
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,865, while the death toll in the country surged to 169. Out of all the cases, 5,218 are active. Further, the number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 478. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India surge to 5,865, death toll rises to 169 The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,865, while the death toll in the country surged to 169. Out of all the cases, 5,218 are active. Further, the number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 478. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.

Headline: 9 of 11 coronavirus patients in Chhattisgarh discharged; 76k people under quarantine
Description: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday said that out of the total 11 coronavirus cases in the state, nine patients have recovered and have been discharged. He added that the 11th case was found last night after which contact tracing has started. Further, he said that 76,000 people in the state are under home quarantine.
Text: 9 of 11 coronavirus patients in Chhattisgarh discharged; 76k people under quarantine Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday said that out of the total 11 coronavirus cases in the state, nine patients have recovered and have been discharged. He added that the 11th case was found last night after which contact tracing has started. Further, he said that 76,000 people in the state are under home quarantine.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Himachal Pradesh rise to 28, Una most affected with 12
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Himachal Pradesh has risen to 28. As per the state's health department, 5,035 people have been put under surveillance, while a total of 773 people have been tested for the virus. With 12 cases, Una district is the most affected in Himachal Pradesh. The state has reported one coronavirus death till now.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Himachal Pradesh rise to 28, Una most affected with 12 The total number of coronavirus cases in Himachal Pradesh has risen to 28. As per the state's health department, 5,035 people have been put under surveillance, while a total of 773 people have been tested for the virus. With 12 cases, Una district is the most affected in Himachal Pradesh. The state has reported one coronavirus death till now.

Headline: News of Tablighi Jamaat members defecating in open in Saharanpur false: Police
Description: Saharanpur Police has denied news reports that Tablighi Jamaat members defecated in the open after they were denied non-vegetarian food. The reports had claimed that the incident happened in a quarantine centre in the city. "The claims made related to the above news on social media, newspapers and news channels were completely false," Saharanpur Police tweeted.
Text: News of Tablighi Jamaat members defecating in open in Saharanpur false: Police Saharanpur Police has denied news reports that Tablighi Jamaat members defecated in the open after they were denied non-vegetarian food. The reports had claimed that the incident happened in a quarantine centre in the city. "The claims made related to the above news on social media, newspapers and news channels were completely false," Saharanpur Police tweeted.

Headline: Karnataka to finalise lockdown exit strategy by April 13: Minister
Description: The Karnataka government is engaged in discussions with experts, specialists and stakeholders to decide on its lockdown exit strategy and will make a decision by April 13, Medical Education Minister Dr Sudhakar K stated. He said the decision will be made following talks with PM Narendra Modi, and added, "As of now, we have not taken any view on it."
Text: Karnataka to finalise lockdown exit strategy by April 13: Minister The Karnataka government is engaged in discussions with experts, specialists and stakeholders to decide on its lockdown exit strategy and will make a decision by April 13, Medical Education Minister Dr Sudhakar K stated. He said the decision will be made following talks with PM Narendra Modi, and added, "As of now, we have not taken any view on it."

Headline: CRPF sends essentials to different districts of J&K amid lockdown
Description: The CRPF on Thursday sent essential commodities to different districts of J&K including Baramulla and Anantnag amid the lockdown. "We're giving ration packets containing five kg rice, four kg flour, two kg sugar, one kg salt, two kg potatoes and one-litre milk to families," Rajesh Kumar, IG Operations said. Over 150 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in J&K so far.
Text: CRPF sends essentials to different districts of J&K amid lockdown The CRPF on Thursday sent essential commodities to different districts of J&K including Baramulla and Anantnag amid the lockdown.
