"We're giving ration packets containing five kg rice, four kg flour, two kg sugar, one kg salt, two kg potatoes and one-litre milk to families," Rajesh Kumar, IG Operations said. Over 150 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in J&K so far.

Headline: Jharkhand records 1st Covid-19 death as 72-yr-old man passes away
Description: Jharkhand reported its first death due to coronavirus on Wednesday night after a 72-year-old man died in Bokaro, Bokaro District Chief Medical Officer Ashok Kumar Pathak stated. Four family members of the deceased had earlier tested positive for the virus, said a report. Meanwhile, the state said that five more people had tested positive for coronavirus in Bokaro on Wednesday.
Text: Jharkhand records 1st Covid-19 death as 72-yr-old man passes away Jharkhand reported its first death due to coronavirus on Wednesday night after a 72-year-old man died in Bokaro, Bokaro District Chief Medical Officer Ashok Kumar Pathak stated. Four family members of the deceased had earlier tested positive for the virus, said a report. Meanwhile, the state said that five more people had tested positive for coronavirus in Bokaro on Wednesday.

Headline: T'gana issues guidelines for disposal of bodies of COVID-19 patients
Description: Telangana government has issued guidelines for hospitals for the disposal of dead bodies of Hindus/Christians who are suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19. Arvind Kumar, Principal Secretary, Municipal Administration and Urban Development said that body would be placed in a leak-proof zip bag and not more than three family members would be allowed to see it through a glass window.
Text: T'gana issues guidelines for disposal of bodies of COVID-19 patients Telangana government has issued guidelines for hospitals for the disposal of dead bodies of Hindus/Christians who are suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19. Arvind Kumar, Principal Secretary, Municipal Administration and Urban Development said that body would be placed in a leak-proof zip bag and not more than three family members would be allowed to see it through a glass window.

Headline: Coronavirus test positivity rate in India 3-5% in last 1 to 1.5 months: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research on Thursday said that the coronavirus test positivity rate ranges between 3-5% in the last 1 to 1.5 months. It added that the rate has not increased substantially. The ICMR further revealed that around 1,30,000 coronavirus tests have been done in India so far, out of which 5,734 samples have tested positive till date.
Text: Coronavirus test positivity rate in India 3-5% in last 1 to 1.5 months: ICMR The Indian Council of Medical Research on Thursday said that the coronavirus test positivity rate ranges between 3-5% in the last 1 to 1.5 months. It added that the rate has not increased substantially. The ICMR further revealed that around 1,30,000 coronavirus tests have been done in India so far, out of which 5,734 samples have tested positive till date.

Headline: Rajasthan to give ration to 6,000 displaced Pak families in state
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said that the state government would provide ration to nearly 6,000 displaced families from Pakistan. Gehlot said his government took this decision in view of a letter from Seemant Lok Sangathan President Hindu Singh Sodha. Gehlot added that he was told that many of these families had faced scarcity of ration due to lockdown.
Text: Rajasthan to give ration to 6,000 displaced Pak families in state Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said that the state government would provide ration to nearly 6,000 displaced families from Pakistan. Gehlot said his government took this decision in view of a letter from Seemant Lok Sangathan President Hindu Singh Sodha. Gehlot added that he was told that many of these families had faced scarcity of ration due to lockdown.

Headline: Lok Sabha MP stitches masks on sewing machine, says 'doing my bit for nation'
Description: Sangeeta Kumari Singh Deo, a BJP Lok Sabha MP from Odisha's Balangir constituency, took to Twitter on Thursday to share a picture showing her stitch masks on a sewing machine. "Doing my bit for the nation! Making masks for ourselves and for others who need it," she tweeted. She also requested others to help in any possible way.
Text: Lok Sabha MP stitches masks on sewing machine, says 'doing my bit for nation' Sangeeta Kumari Singh Deo, a BJP Lok Sabha MP from Odisha's Balangir constituency, took to Twitter on Thursday to share a picture showing her stitch masks on a sewing machine. "Doing my bit for the nation! Making masks for ourselves and for others who need it," she tweeted. She also requested others to help in any possible way.

Headline: What is Delhi govt's Operation SHIELD for coronavirus containment in 21 localities?
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal today announced Operation SHIELD for coronavirus containment in 21 localities. The immediate area will be sealed and people would be home quarantined. Further, people with coronavirus will be isolated and their contacts would be traced. Essential goods will be supplied to homes, local sanitisation will be carried out and door-to-door health check-ups will be conducted.
Text: What is Delhi govt's Operation SHIELD for coronavirus containment in 21 localities? Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal today announced Operation SHIELD for coronavirus containment in 21 localities. The immediate area will be sealed and people would be home quarantined. Further, people with coronavirus will be isolated and their contacts would be traced. Essential goods will be supplied to homes, local sanitisation will be carried out and door-to-door health check-ups will be conducted.

Headline: Punjab CM shares video of 81-yr-old diabetic with high BP who defeated COVID-19
Description: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has shared a video of an 81-year-old woman from Mohali who has recovered from COVID-19. "Kulwant Nirmal ji had pre-existing conditions like diabetes and hypertension but her will to fight overshadowed everything. She is now healthy and back home," wrote Singh. Nirmal asked people to not be afraid and follow government orders in the video.
Text: Punjab CM shares video of 81-yr-old diabetic with high BP who defeated COVID-19 Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has shared a video of an 81-year-old woman from Mohali who has recovered from COVID-19. "Kulwant Nirmal ji had pre-existing conditions like diabetes and hypertension but her will to fight overshadowed everything. She is now healthy and back home," wrote Singh. Nirmal asked people to not be afraid and follow government orders in the video.

Headline: Govt sanctions ₹15,000 crore package to combat coronavirus
Description: Centre has sanctioned ₹15,000 crore for the 'India COVID-19 Emergency Response and Health System Preparedness Package'. Out of the total funds, ₹7,774 crore will be utilised for COVID-19 emergency response and remaining for medium-term support over 1-4 years to be provided under the mission mode approach. The project will be implemented in three phases from January 2020 to March 2024.
Text: Govt sanctions ₹15,000 crore package to combat coronavirus Centre has sanctioned ₹15,000 crore for the 'India COVID-19 Emergency Response and Health System Preparedness Package'. Out of the total funds, ₹7,774 crore will be utilised for COVID-19 emergency response and remaining for medium-term support over 1-4 years to be provided under the mission mode approach. The project will be implemented in three phases from January 2020 to March 2024.

Headline: I've to now remember how to breathe: Indian-origin woman who survived COVID-19
Description: An Indian-origin woman living in the UK, who was infected with coronavirus, while speaking about her experience, said she "almost died". "Breathing used to be such a natural action but now I've to remember how to inhale and exhale," she added. The woman had started showing symptoms while in hospital, where she was admitted for operation for an oesophageal disease.
Text: I've to now remember how to breathe: Indian-origin woman who survived COVID-19 An Indian-origin woman living in the UK, who was infected with coronavirus, while speaking about her experience, said she "almost died". "Breathing used to be such a natural action but now I've to remember how to inhale and exhale," she added. The woman had started showing symptoms while in hospital, where she was admitted for operation for an oesophageal disease.

Headline: ₹35 lakh reward announced for team who treated Manipur's first COVID-19 patient
Description: Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh announced a reward of ₹35 lakh to the team of health professionals of the Jawaharlal Nehru Institute of Medical Sciences (JNIMS), who treated the state's first COVID-19 patient successfully. After testing positive for the virus on March 24, the 23-year-old girl tested negative last Monday. The patient had returned to Manipur from the UK.
Text: ₹35 lakh reward announced for team who treated Manipur's first COVID-19 patient Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh announced a reward of ₹35 lakh to the team of health professionals of the Jawaharlal Nehru Institute of Medical Sciences (JNIMS), who treated the state's first COVID-19 patient successfully. After testing positive for the virus on March 24, the 23-year-old girl tested negative last Monday. The patient had returned to Manipur from the UK.

Headline: Ordered 1.7 crore PPEs, 49,000 ventilators to fight COVID-19: Govt
Description: The Union Health Ministry has said 20 domestic manufacturers are making personal protective equipment (PPE) and the government has already placed orders for 1.7 crore PPEs. The Ministry added that orders of 49,000 ventilators have also been placed. Further, it said supply of PPEs, masks and ventilators have begun and there is no need to worry about their availability.
Text: Ordered 1.7 crore PPEs, 49,000 ventilators to fight COVID-19: Govt The Union Health Ministry has said 20 domestic manufacturers are making personal protective equipment (PPE) and the government has already placed orders for 1.7 crore PPEs. The Ministry added that orders of 49,000 ventilators have also been placed. Further, it said supply of PPEs, masks and ventilators have begun and there is no need to worry about their availability.

Headline: UP man kills himself, police says he was missing his wife stuck at parents' home
Description: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda district allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from the ceiling of his room as he was missing his wife who was stuck at her parents' place due to the lockdown, police said. The incident took place in Radha Kund locality on Wednesday, police said, adding that the deceased has been identified as Rakesh Soni.
Text: UP man kills himself, police says he was missing his wife stuck at parents' home A man in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda district allegedly committed suicide by hanging himself from the ceiling of his room as he was missing his wife who was stuck at her parents' place due to the lockdown, police said. The incident took place in Radha Kund locality on Wednesday, police said, adding that the deceased has been identified as Rakesh Soni.

Headline: 2 lakh migrants from 16 states housed in 711 camps in WB: Mamata
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that over 2 lakh migrant labourers and stranded people from 16 Indian states were being housed in 711 camps across the state. "They are being directly taken care of by state government along with a few NGOs. This arrangement since 1st April will continue until the need remains," said Mamata.
Text: 2 lakh migrants from 16 states housed in 711 camps in WB: Mamata West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said that over 2 lakh migrant labourers and stranded people from 16 Indian states were being housed in 711 camps across the state. "They are being directly taken care of by state government along with a few NGOs. This arrangement since 1st April will continue until the need remains," said Mamata.

Headline: 88% Indians say PM Modi should extend lockdown beyond April 14: Inshorts Poll
Description: According to a poll conducted by Inshorts, 88% Indians feel that PM Narendra Modi should extend the 21-day nationwide lockdown. The poll was conducted after PM Modi yesterday said that states, district administrations and experts have suggested extending the lockdown beyond April 14. More than 1.1 lakh app users participated in the poll.
Text: 88% Indians say PM Modi should extend lockdown beyond April 14: Inshorts Poll According to a poll conducted by Inshorts, 88% Indians feel that PM Narendra Modi should extend the 21-day nationwide lockdown. The poll was conducted after PM Modi yesterday said that states, district administrations and experts have suggested extending the lockdown beyond April 14. More than 1.1 lakh app users participated in the poll.

Headline: Free sanitary pads to be home delivered in Lucknow amid lockdown
Description: The Lucknow administration will provide free sanitary napkins, soaps and hand sanitisers to women at their doorsteps amid the coronavirus lockdown. District Magistrate Abhishek Prakash said this will be done through six 'Sakhi' vans and women who want to avail these items can call on a helpline number. Notably, sanitary napkins weren't listed as essential goods until March 29.
Text: Free sanitary pads to be home delivered in Lucknow amid lockdown The Lucknow administration will provide free sanitary napkins, soaps and hand sanitisers to women at their doorsteps amid the coronavirus lockdown. District Magistrate Abhishek Prakash said this will be done through six 'Sakhi' vans and women who want to avail these items can call on a helpline number. Notably, sanitary napkins weren't listed as essential goods until March 29.

Headline: Concerned about safety of Indians in UAE amid pandemic: Kerala CM to PM
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has written to PM Narendra Modi expressing concern over safety of 2.8 million Indians in UAE amid the coronavirus pandemic. The CM said he has received complaints about inadequate isolation and quarantine facilities in Dubai. He asked PM Modi to speak to the UAE government to ensure adequate food, medicines and emergency service facilities to Indians.
Text: Concerned about safety of Indians in UAE amid pandemic: Kerala CM to PM Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has written to PM Narendra Modi expressing concern over safety of 2.8 million Indians in UAE amid the coronavirus pandemic. The CM said he has received complaints about inadequate isolation and quarantine facilities in Dubai. He asked PM Modi to speak to the UAE government to ensure adequate food, medicines and emergency service facilities to Indians.

Headline: Telangana bans spitting in public places as measure to contain COVID-19 spread
Description: Telangana government on Wednesday imposed a ban on spitting in public places and institutions as a measure to contain the spread of COVID-19. "Spitting of paan/any chewable tobacco or non-tobacco product, etc, in public places and institutions is banned with immediate effect," an official notification read. "It's of utmost need to impose restrictions on unhealthy practices," it further read.
Text: Telangana bans spitting in public places as measure to contain COVID-19 spread Telangana government on Wednesday imposed a ban on spitting in public places and institutions as a measure to contain the spread of COVID-19. "Spitting of paan/any chewable tobacco or non-tobacco product, etc, in public places and institutions is banned with immediate effect," an official notification read. "It's of utmost need to impose restrictions on unhealthy practices," it further read.

Headline: Odisha extends lockdown till April 30, first state to do so
Description: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has announced that the lockdown in the state has been extended till April 30, becoming the first state in the country to do so. All educational institutions in Odisha will also remain closed till June 17, the state government announced. PM Narendra Modi had announced the nationwide lockdown till April 14.
Text: Odisha extends lockdown till April 30, first state to do so Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik has announced that the lockdown in the state has been extended till April 30, becoming the first state in the country to do so. All educational institutions in Odisha will also remain closed till June 17, the state government announced. PM Narendra Modi had announced the nationwide lockdown till April 14.

Headline: Doctor on COVID-19 duty in Bhopal lives in car to protect family from infection
Description: A doctor at JP Hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, Sachin Nayak, has started to live in his car to avoid spreading COVID-19 infection at home in case he caught it at work. He has stocked up his daily use items and books in the car itself. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan praised Nayak and tweeted, "Sachin ji, salute to your spirit."
Text: Doctor on COVID-19 duty in Bhopal lives in car to protect family from infection A doctor at JP Hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, Sachin Nayak, has started to live in his car to avoid spreading COVID-19 infection at home in case he caught it at work. He has stocked up his daily use items and books in the car itself. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan praised Nayak and tweeted, "Sachin ji, salute to your spirit."

Headline: Indore, Bhopal, Ujjain completely sealed to contain spread of coronavirus
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday ordered to completely seal Bhopal, Indore and Ujjain after rise in coronavirus cases. The CM's office also stated that there will be total lockdown in 14 other districts. Meanwhile, the state has reported around 229 cases of coronavirus and 13 deaths due to the virus, the Health Ministry stated.
Text: Indore, Bhopal, Ujjain completely sealed to contain spread of coronavirus Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday ordered to completely seal Bhopal, Indore and Ujjain after rise in coronavirus cases. The CM's office also stated that there will be total lockdown in 14 other districts. Meanwhile, the state has reported around 229 cases of coronavirus and 13 deaths due to the virus, the Health Ministry stated.

Headline: List of fruit & vegetable vendors serving in COVID-19 hotspots in Noida released
Description: Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate on Thursday released a list of fruit and vegetable vendors serving in coronavirus hotspots in Noida, that have been sealed. The list contains the names of the vendors as well as their contact numbers. Uttar Pradesh government announced on Wednesday that hotspots in 15 districts will be sealed and essentials will be delivered to homes.
Text: List of fruit & vegetable vendors serving in COVID-19 hotspots in Noida released Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate on Thursday released a list of fruit and vegetable vendors serving in coronavirus hotspots in Noida, that have been sealed. The list contains the names of the vendors as well as their contact numbers. Uttar Pradesh government announced on Wednesday that hotspots in 15 districts will be sealed and essentials will be delivered to homes.

Headline: Bihar govt to promote students from Class 1 to 9, 11 amid lockdown
Description: Bihar government on Wednesday announced that students from Class 1 to 9 and 11 will be promoted to the next grade amid the lockdown following the coronavirus pandemic. Many other states including UP, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh had earlier decided to promote students to the next grade without examinations. As per the official data, Bihar has recorded 38 COVID-19 cases so far.
Text: Bihar govt to promote students from Class 1 to 9, 11 amid lockdown Bihar government on Wednesday announced that students from Class 1 to 9 and 11 will be promoted to the next grade amid the lockdown following the coronavirus pandemic. Many other states including UP, Gujarat, Chhattisgarh had earlier decided to promote students to the next grade without examinations. As per the official data, Bihar has recorded 38 COVID-19 cases so far.

Headline: ICU in-charge skips mother's last rites to nurse coronavirus patients in Rajasthan
Description: Ramamurthy Meena, the ICU in-charge at the SMS hospital in Rajasthan's Jaipur, did not go for his mother's last rites as he was attending on coronavirus patients. He managed to see her cremation through a video call. "My mother passed away but I felt those who are alive and struggling need me more at this time," he said.
Text: ICU in-charge skips mother's last rites to nurse coronavirus patients in Rajasthan Ramamurthy Meena, the ICU in-charge at the SMS hospital in Rajasthan's Jaipur, did not go for his mother's last rites as he was attending on coronavirus patients. He managed to see her cremation through a video call. "My mother passed away but I felt those who are alive and struggling need me more at this time," he said.

Headline: Use an N95 mask, keep it in a bag & reuse after 4 days: AIIMS to doctors
Description: A day after asking doctors to reuse their masks four times, authorities from the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi issued a standard operating procedure for the same. After using an N95 mask for a day, it has to be numbered and kept in a bag for four days before reusing it, the standard operating procedure read.
Text: Use an N95 mask, keep it in a bag & reuse after 4 days: AIIMS to doctors A day after asking doctors to reuse their masks four times, authorities from the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi issued a standard operating procedure for the same. After using an N95 mask for a day, it has to be numbered and kept in a bag for four days before reusing it, the standard operating procedure read.

Headline: Notices issued to 3 pvt schools in Punjab for demanding fees amid lockdown
Description: Punjab Education Department on Wednesday issued notices to three private schools in Mohali for defying government orders and demanding fees amid lockdown. Punjab Education Minister Vijay Inder Singla said Doon International School, ATS Valley School and Lawerance Public Senior Secondary School were issued notices. Two other private schools were also issued notices on Tuesday regarding the same.
Text: Notices issued to 3 pvt schools in Punjab for demanding fees amid lockdown Punjab Education Department on Wednesday issued notices to three private schools in Mohali for defying government orders and demanding fees amid lockdown. Punjab Education Minister Vijay Inder Singla said Doon International School, ATS Valley School and Lawerance Public Senior Secondary School were issued notices. Two other private schools were also issued notices on Tuesday regarding the same.

Headline: PM gave enough hints on extending lockdown: TMC MP on all-party meet
Description: TMC MP Sudip Bandyopadhyay said that PM Narendra Modi, during an all-party meeting on Wednesday, dropped enough hints of extending the lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Bandyopadhyay added, "The PM said lifting the lockdown at one go is not advisable as several experts and states have suggested extending it. He said he will discuss the issue with the CMs".
Text: PM gave enough hints on extending lockdown: TMC MP on all-party meet TMC MP Sudip Bandyopadhyay said that PM Narendra Modi, during an all-party meeting on Wednesday, dropped enough hints of extending the lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Bandyopadhyay added, "The PM said lifting the lockdown at one go is not advisable as several experts and states have suggested extending it. He said he will discuss the issue with the CMs".

Headline: West Bengal govt urges private schools not to hike fees amid lockdown
Description: The West Bengal government on Wednesday urged private schools to refrain from increasing fees amid the nationwide lockdown due to COVID-19 outbreak. State Education Minister Partha Chatterjee said the government has received complaints from some parents regarding the same. Chatterjee also requested all institutions to consider the cases of those who are unable to pay the fees at such times.
Text: West Bengal govt urges private schools not to hike fees amid lockdown The West Bengal government on Wednesday urged private schools to refrain from increasing fees amid the nationwide lockdown due to COVID-19 outbreak. State Education Minister Partha Chatterjee said the government has received complaints from some parents regarding the same. Chatterjee also requested all institutions to consider the cases of those who are unable to pay the fees at such times.

Headline: Doctor dies from COVID-19 in Indore, CM says 'can never forget this great human'
Description: A doctor who tested positive for coronavirus has passed away in Madhya Pradesh's Indore.  Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan took to Twitter to condole the doctor's demise. "He was sacrificed while fighting the war against COVID-19 and protecting the priceless lives of others. A great man like you will never be forgotten," CM Chouhan tweeted.
Text: Doctor dies from COVID-19 in Indore, CM says 'can never forget this great human' A doctor who tested positive for coronavirus has passed away in Madhya Pradesh's Indore.  Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan took to Twitter to condole the doctor's demise. "He was sacrificed while fighting the war against COVID-19 and protecting the priceless lives of others. A great man like you will never be forgotten," CM Chouhan tweeted.

Headline: 32-yr-old MP man dies hours after submitting samples for Covid-19 test
Description: A 32-year-old man died at a hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur district on Wednesday, hours after submitting samples for coronavirus testing. An official said that the patient, who was admitted to the isolation ward, had trouble breathing and had fever, cough and cold. The samples were sent out for testing to determine if the patient was Covid-19 positive.
Text: 32-yr-old MP man dies hours after submitting samples for Covid-19 test A 32-year-old man died at a hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur district on Wednesday, hours after submitting samples for coronavirus testing. An official said that the patient, who was admitted to the isolation ward, had trouble breathing and had fever, cough and cold. The samples were sent out for testing to determine if the patient was Covid-19 positive.

Headline: UP ministers, legislators to take 30% salary cut for 1 year
Description: The Uttar Pradesh Cabinet on Wednesday approved a 30% reduction in salaries of ministers and state legislators for one year in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. UP Finance Minister Suresh Khanna said this will allow the ministers and state legislators to contribute a total of approximately ₹17.50 crore to the COVID Care Fund set up by CM Yogi Adityanath.
Text: UP ministers, legislators to take 30% salary cut for 1 year The Uttar Pradesh Cabinet on Wednesday approved a 30% reduction in salaries of ministers and state legislators for one year in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. UP Finance Minister Suresh Khanna said this will allow the ministers and state legislators to contribute a total of approximately ₹17.50 crore to the COVID Care Fund set up by CM Yogi Adityanath.

Headline: 55 new cases confirmed in Gujarat, 50 of them reported in Ahmedabad
Description: Fifty-five new positive cases of coronavirus have been reported in Gujarat, the state health department has stated. The department added that as many as 50 of the fresh cases have been reported in Ahmedabad, while two have been reported in Surat and one each has been reported in Dahod, Anand and Chhota Udepur.
Text: 55 new cases confirmed in Gujarat, 50 of them reported in Ahmedabad Fifty-five new positive cases of coronavirus have been reported in Gujarat, the state health department has stated. The department added that as many as 50 of the fresh cases have been reported in Ahmedabad, while two have been reported in Surat and one each has been reported in Dahod, Anand and Chhota Udepur.

Headline: Total COVID-19 positive cases in Rajasthan rises to 413: State govt
Description: Rajasthan has recorded 30 more COVID-19 cases on Thursday, taking the state's tally to 413, Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Rohit Kumar Singh said. All new cases have travel and contact history, Singh added. As per reports, seven cases each have been reported in Jhalawar, Tonk and Jhunjhunu, five in Jaisalmer, two in Banswara and one each in Barmer and Jodhpur.
Text: Total COVID-19 positive cases in Rajasthan rises to 413: State govt Rajasthan has recorded 30 more COVID-19 cases on Thursday, taking the state's tally to 413, Additional Chief Secretary (Health) Rohit Kumar Singh said. All new cases have travel and contact history, Singh added. As per reports, seven cases each have been reported in Jhalawar, Tonk and Jhunjhunu, five in Jaisalmer, two in Banswara and one each in Barmer and Jodhpur.

Headline: Bihar makes screening of influenza, respiratory illness patients mandatory
Description: Amid coronavirus spread, screening of patients having symptoms of influenza and severe acute respiratory illness in Bihar has been made mandatory. "All DMs and the CSs have been directed to ensure it without fail and request the private hospitals to assist and support in this medical urgency," Principal Secretary of Health Sanjay Kumar said.
Text: Bihar makes screening of influenza, respiratory illness patients mandatory Amid coronavirus spread, screening of patients having symptoms of influenza and severe acute respiratory illness in Bihar has been made mandatory. "All DMs and the CSs have been directed to ensure it without fail and request the private hospitals to assist and support in this medical urgency," Principal Secretary of Health Sanjay Kumar said.

Headline: ITBP hospital at Greater Noida declared Covid-19 hospital: DG ITBP
Description: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police hospital at Greater Noida has been declared a hospital for coronavirus patients by the MHA, ITBP Director General SS Deswal said. The 200-bed hospital has been vacated by other patients and training has been imparted to the staff for dealing with the disease. Meanwhile, ITBP's facility in Chhawla, Delhi is being used as a quarantine camp.
Text: ITBP hospital at Greater Noida declared Covid-19 hospital: DG ITBP The Indo-Tibetan Border Police hospital at Greater Noida has been declared a hospital for coronavirus patients by the MHA, ITBP Director General SS Deswal said. The 200-bed hospital has been vacated by other patients and training has been imparted to the staff for dealing with the disease. Meanwhile, ITBP's facility in Chhawla, Delhi is being used as a quarantine camp.

Headline: 5 people test +ve for coronavirus in MP's Khandwa
Description: Five people have tested positive for coronavirus in Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh and their contact tracing is underway, said District Collector Tanvi Sundriyal on Thursday. Sundriyal added that a curfew has been imposed in Khandwa to contain the spread of coronavirus. Notably, 229 people have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh so far, and there have been 13 deaths.
Text: 5 people test +ve for coronavirus in MP's Khandwa Five people have tested positive for coronavirus in Khandwa, Madhya Pradesh and their contact tracing is underway, said District Collector Tanvi Sundriyal on Thursday. Sundriyal added that a curfew has been imposed in Khandwa to contain the spread of coronavirus. Notably, 229 people have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh so far, and there have been 13 deaths.

Headline: No selfies while distributing food amid COVID-19 lockdown: Kota Collector
Description: After 10 coronavirus cases were reported in Kota, the district administration has put a ban on taking selfies while distributing food items to needy. "We have asked all subdivision officers to ensure that social distancing is being practised while distributing food packets," District Collector Omprakash Kasera said. He also instructed officers to take action against those who flout guidelines.
Text: No selfies while distributing food amid COVID-19 lockdown: Kota Collector After 10 coronavirus cases were reported in Kota, the district administration has put a ban on taking selfies while distributing food items to needy. "We have asked all subdivision officers to ensure that social distancing is being practised while distributing food packets," District Collector Omprakash Kasera said. He also instructed officers to take action against those who flout guidelines.

Headline: Chhattisgarh launches campaign for donations of essentials for poor
Description: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel launched a campaign, 'Donation on Wheels', where ration packets and other essentials are collected from the general public from their homes and delivered at the doorstep of people in need. Donors have been told to prepare ration packets and inform the district administration for collection. Baghel donated 500 packets of food grains and ₹11,000 on Wednesday.
Text: Chhattisgarh launches campaign for donations of essentials for poor Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel launched a campaign, 'Donation on Wheels', where ration packets and other essentials are collected from the general public from their homes and delivered at the doorstep of people in need. Donors have been told to prepare ration packets and inform the district administration for collection. Baghel donated 500 packets of food grains and ₹11,000 on Wednesday.

Headline: PM Modi replies to Trump after he thanks India for export of Hydroxychloroquine
Description: After US President Donald Trump thanked PM Narendra Modi for clearing the export of Hydroxychloroquine amid coronavirus pandemic, PM Modi replied to him. "Times like these bring friends closer. The India-US partnership is stronger than ever. India shall do everything possible to help humanity's fight against COVID-19," the PM tweeted. "We shall win this together," he added.
Text: PM Modi replies to Trump after he thanks India for export of Hydroxychloroquine After US President Donald Trump thanked PM Narendra Modi for clearing the export of Hydroxychloroquine amid coronavirus pandemic, PM Modi replied to him. "Times like these bring friends closer. The India-US partnership is stronger than ever. India shall do everything possible to help humanity's fight against COVID-19," the PM tweeted. "We shall win this together," he added.

Headline: Punjab govt opens new markets to avoid crowding amid lockdown
Description: In a bid to prevent crowding amid the coronavirus pandemic, the Punjab government has opened new markets across the state. The government stated that all these markets will have facilities like hand sanitisers, masks and soaps. According to government data, there are 101 cases of coronavirus in Punjab, and eight people have died from the virus.
Text: Punjab govt opens new markets to avoid crowding amid lockdown In a bid to prevent crowding amid the coronavirus pandemic, the Punjab government has opened new markets across the state. The government stated that all these markets will have facilities like hand sanitisers, masks and soaps. According to government data, there are 101 cases of coronavirus in Punjab, and eight people have died from the virus.

Headline: IIT Kharagpur raises ₹1 crore from staff, donates it to PM-CARES Fund
Description: IIT Kharagpur has donated ₹1 crore to the PM-CARES Fund set up by the government to contain the COVID-19 pandemic. The institution raised the money from the faculty, non-teaching staff, and other sources. "I'm glad to see people have come forward...and within a week we have been able to pledge the amount," IIT Kharagpur Director Virendra Tewari said.
Text: IIT Kharagpur raises ₹1 crore from staff, donates it to PM-CARES Fund IIT Kharagpur has donated ₹1 crore to the PM-CARES Fund set up by the government to contain the COVID-19 pandemic. The institution raised the money from the faculty, non-teaching staff, and other sources. "I'm glad to see people have come forward...and within a week we have been able to pledge the amount," IIT Kharagpur Director Virendra Tewari said.

Headline: I fear COVID-19 testing will drop: Biocon chief on SC order to make testing free
Description: Reacting to Supreme Court's order to make coronavirus testing free, Biocon MD Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said private labs could not be expected to operate on credit. "Humanitarian in intent but impractical to implement - I fear testing will plummet," she said. "These are small businesses they're providing testing at cost and not profiteering. How will they pay their staff?" Mazumdar-Shaw added.
Text: I fear COVID-19 testing will drop: Biocon chief on SC order to make testing free Reacting to Supreme Court's order to make coronavirus testing free, Biocon MD Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said private labs could not be expected to operate on credit. "Humanitarian in intent but impractical to implement - I fear testing will plummet," she said. "These are small businesses they're providing testing at cost and not profiteering. How will they pay their staff?" Mazumdar-Shaw added.

Headline: I didn't want to be coronavirus carrier: Kerala woman who stayed back in Wuhan
Description: After the lockdown was lifted in China's Wuhan after over 70 days, Anila P Ajayan, a Kerala woman who decided to stay back in the city, said she didn't want to be a coronavirus carrier to India. "The only noises I used to hear...for over three months were that of ambulance siren and radio messages in Chinese language," she added.
Text: I didn't want to be coronavirus carrier: Kerala woman who stayed back in Wuhan After the lockdown was lifted in China's Wuhan after over 70 days, Anila P Ajayan, a Kerala woman who decided to stay back in the city, said she didn't want to be a coronavirus carrier to India. "The only noises I used to hear...for over three months were that of ambulance siren and radio messages in Chinese language," she added.

Headline: Out of 669 +ve cases in Delhi, 426 from Nizamuddin Markaz: Minister
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Thursday said that there are 669 positive cases of coronavirus in the capital city, including 426 cases related to the Nizamuddin Markaz event that took place last month. As many as 21 Covid-19 patients in Delhi have been cured or discharged, while there have been nine deaths.
Text: Out of 669 +ve cases in Delhi, 426 from Nizamuddin Markaz: Minister Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on Thursday said that there are 669 positive cases of coronavirus in the capital city, including 426 cases related to the Nizamuddin Markaz event that took place last month. As many as 21 Covid-19 patients in Delhi have been cured or discharged, while there have been nine deaths.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 40 new coronavirus cases, total reaches 383
Description: Rajasthan on Wednesday reported 40 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 383. An intensive survey was conducted in Ramganj containment area of Jaipur district, which reported 23 new cases today. Six cases were reported in Bikaner, five in Kota, two in Jhalawar and one case each in Banswara, Jodhpur, Jhunjhunu and Karauli.
Text: Rajasthan reports 40 new coronavirus cases, total reaches 383 Rajasthan on Wednesday reported 40 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 383. An intensive survey was conducted in Ramganj containment area of Jaipur district, which reported 23 new cases today. Six cases were reported in Bikaner, five in Kota, two in Jhalawar and one case each in Banswara, Jodhpur, Jhunjhunu and Karauli.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 5,734; death toll reaches 166
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Thursday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,734. Meanwhile, 166 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 5,095 cases are active, while 473 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 71 foreign nationals.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 5,734; death toll reaches 166 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Thursday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,734. Meanwhile, 166 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 5,095 cases are active, while 473 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 71 foreign nationals.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh rise to 348, 11 out of 13 districts affected
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh has risen to 348 after 19 new cases were confirmed in the state on Wednesday. Out of all the 13 districts in the state, Srikakulam and Vizianagaram have not reported a single case of coronavirus.  Meanwhile, the most number of cases have been reported in Kurnool district (75).
Text: Coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh rise to 348, 11 out of 13 districts affected The total number of coronavirus cases in Andhra Pradesh has risen to 348 after 19 new cases were confirmed in the state on Wednesday. Out of all the 13 districts in the state, Srikakulam and Vizianagaram have not reported a single case of coronavirus.  Meanwhile, the most number of cases have been reported in Kurnool district (75).

Headline: Delhi reports 93 coronavirus cases in one day, all linked to Tablighi Jamaat
Description: As many as 93 people tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi today, with all of them linked with Tablighi Jamaat. The total number of cases in the national capital rose to 669, while the death toll stands at nine. Out of all the COVID-19 patients hospitalised, 28 are in ICU and six are on ventilator.
Text: Delhi reports 93 coronavirus cases in one day, all linked to Tablighi Jamaat As many as 93 people tested positive for coronavirus in Delhi today, with all of them linked with Tablighi Jamaat. The total number of cases in the national capital rose to 669, while the death toll stands at nine. Out of all the COVID-19 patients hospitalised, 28 are in ICU and six are on ventilator.

Headline: 117 more test positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra, total rises to 1,135
Description: Maharashtra reported 117 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 1,135, the health department said. The death toll from coronavirus in Maharashtra has risen to 72. Mumbai has reported the most number of cases at 714, while Pune has reported the second-highest number of cases at 166.
Text: 117 more test positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra, total rises to 1,135 Maharashtra reported 117 new coronavirus cases on Wednesday, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 1,135, the health department said. The death toll from coronavirus in Maharashtra has risen to 72. Mumbai has reported the most number of cases at 714, while Pune has reported the second-highest number of cases at 166.

Headline: 20 areas already sealed in Delhi, nobody can enter or exit them: Deputy CM
Description: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that a total of 20 areas have already been sealed in Delhi amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Nobody will be allowed to enter or exit from these areas," Sisodia added. "Many cases were reported from Sadar area, so it is being contained and sealed," he further said.
Text: 20 areas already sealed in Delhi, nobody can enter or exit them: Deputy CM Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Wednesday said that a total of 20 areas have already been sealed in Delhi amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Nobody will be allowed to enter or exit from these areas," Sisodia added. "Many cases were reported from Sadar area, so it is being contained and sealed," he further said.

Headline: Violators run on seeing drone in Kerala, police post video with cricket commentary
Description: Kerala Police have shared a video showing lockdown violators in the state running back to their homes after spotting surveillance drones. People in fields and on beaches can be seen running as soon as the drones fly over them. The police have edited the audio with the 'Tracer Bullet' commentary by Ravi Shastri, Sunil Gavaskar, Sanjay Manjrekar and Ian Botham.
Text: Violators run on seeing drone in Kerala, police post video with cricket commentary Kerala Police have shared a video showing lockdown violators in the state running back to their homes after spotting surveillance drones. People in fields and on beaches can be seen running as soon as the drones fly over them. The police have edited the audio with the 'Tracer Bullet' commentary by Ravi Shastri, Sunil Gavaskar, Sanjay Manjrekar and Ian Botham.

Headline: Thank you PM Modi for helping not just India but humanity: Trump on HCQ trade move
Description: After India said it will supply hydroxychloroquine to "some nations" that have been badly affected by coronavirus pandemic, US President Donald Trump tweeted, "Extraordinary times require even closer cooperation between friends." He added, "Thank you India...for the decision on HCQ...Thank you PM Narendra Modi for your strong leadership in helping not just India, but humanity...in this fight!"
Text: Thank you PM Modi for helping not just India but humanity: Trump on HCQ trade move After India said it will supply hydroxychloroquine to "some nations" that have been badly affected by coronavirus pandemic, US President Donald Trump tweeted, "Extraordinary times require even closer cooperation between friends." He added, "Thank you India...for the decision on HCQ...Thank you PM Narendra Modi for your strong leadership in helping not just India, but humanity...in this fight!"

Headline: 1,000 Bhopal police personnel moved to hotels, guesthouses after +ve cases
Description: Over 1,000 police personnel in Bhopal have been relocated to hotels and guesthouses over the last two days after 11 police personnel, including an IPS officer, and five of their relatives contracted Covid-19. The police said they believe that some personnel contracted the virus while tracing members of different Jamaats who participated in a religious congregation in Delhi last month.
Text: 1,000 Bhopal police personnel moved to hotels, guesthouses after +ve cases Over 1,000 police personnel in Bhopal have been relocated to hotels and guesthouses over the last two days after 11 police personnel, including an IPS officer, and five of their relatives contracted Covid-19. The police said they believe that some personnel contracted the virus while tracing members of different Jamaats who participated in a religious congregation in Delhi last month.

Headline: No need for panic buying, essentials will be delivered: GB Nagar DM
Description: District Magistrate of Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar Suhas Lalinakere Yathiraj on Wednesday said that the decision to seal the hotspots was taken to control the spread of COVID-19. He said, "There is no need of panic buying, all essential items will be delivered at your doorstep. Do not believe in rumours. Please stay indoors."
Text: No need for panic buying, essentials will be delivered: GB Nagar DM District Magistrate of Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar Suhas Lalinakere Yathiraj on Wednesday said that the decision to seal the hotspots was taken to control the spread of COVID-19. He said, "There is no need of panic buying, all essential items will be delivered at your doorstep. Do not believe in rumours. Please stay indoors."

Headline: Kerala doctor stopped from entering flat, collector warns of action
Description: A doctor was stopped from entering his flat in Edachira, near Kakkanad in Kerala on Monday. This comes a few days after a nurse was asked to vacate her apartment in the same building. Ernakulam district collector S Suhas took note of the issue and warned of stringent action against people and associations under the Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897.
Text: Kerala doctor stopped from entering flat, collector warns of action A doctor was stopped from entering his flat in Edachira, near Kakkanad in Kerala on Monday. This comes a few days after a nurse was asked to vacate her apartment in the same building. Ernakulam district collector S Suhas took note of the issue and warned of stringent action against people and associations under the Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897.

Headline: Brazil President thanks PM Modi for export of raw materials for Hydroxychloroquine
Description: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro has thanked PM Narendra Modi for allowing the export of raw materials to Brazil to produce Hydroxychloroquine amid coronavirus. "As an outcome of my direct conversation with Prime Minister of India, we will receive, by Saturday, raw materials to continue our production of Hydroxychloroquine," he said. "I thank him...for this timely assistance," Bolsonaro added.
Text: Brazil President thanks PM Modi for export of raw materials for Hydroxychloroquine Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro has thanked PM Narendra Modi for allowing the export of raw materials to Brazil to produce Hydroxychloroquine amid coronavirus. "As an outcome of my direct conversation with Prime Minister of India, we will receive, by Saturday, raw materials to continue our production of Hydroxychloroquine," he said. "I thank him...for this timely assistance," Bolsonaro added.

Headline: BJP MP booked for allegedly beating up official for delay in food distribution
Description: Kannauj police on Wednesday lodged an FIR against local BJP MP Subrat Pathak and his supporters for allegedly barging into the house of a tehsildar and assaulting him for the delay in distribution of foodgrain to 600 people whose names were recommended by Pathak. Tehsildar alleged that they beat him with sticks in front of his wife and eight-year-old daughter.
Text: BJP MP booked for allegedly beating up official for delay in food distribution Kannauj police on Wednesday lodged an FIR against local BJP MP Subrat Pathak and his supporters for allegedly barging into the house of a tehsildar and assaulting him for the delay in distribution of foodgrain to 600 people whose names were recommended by Pathak. Tehsildar alleged that they beat him with sticks in front of his wife and eight-year-old daughter.

Headline: 938 COVID-19 deaths reported in UK in biggest 1-day jump, death toll crosses 7,000
Description: As many as 938 people died of coronavirus in the UK in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest daily jump in the number of deaths so far. The total death toll in the country has risen to 7,097. Further, a total of 232,708 people have been tested in the UK so far, out of which 60,733 tested positive.
Text: 938 COVID-19 deaths reported in UK in biggest 1-day jump, death toll crosses 7,000 As many as 938 people died of coronavirus in the UK in the last 24 hours, marking the biggest daily jump in the number of deaths so far. The total death toll in the country has risen to 7,097. Further, a total of 232,708 people have been tested in the UK so far, out of which 60,733 tested positive.

Headline: Goa's 1st COVID-19 patient recovers, to be discharged soon: Health Minister
Description: Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane on Wednesday said the first COVID-19 patient in the state has recovered and will be discharged soon. "The patient will further be kept under monitored quarantine for 14 days as per protocol before final discharge," Rane added. This has brought the total number of COVID-19 positive cases in the state to six, he said.
Text: Goa's 1st COVID-19 patient recovers, to be discharged soon: Health Minister Goa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane on Wednesday said the first COVID-19 patient in the state has recovered and will be discharged soon. "The patient will further be kept under monitored quarantine for 14 days as per protocol before final discharge," Rane added. This has brought the total number of COVID-19 positive cases in the state to six, he said.

Headline: 10 hospitalised after trying TikTok 'home remedy' against coronavirus in Andhra
Description: Around 10 members of two families were hospitalised in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor after they tried a "home remedy" against coronavirus stated in TikTok videos. "[They] watched videos on TikTok which said drinking juice of ummetha would keep coronavirus away," a sub-inspector said. District Health Officer has appealed not to follow 'home remedies' that haven't been verified by medical experts.
Text: 10 hospitalised after trying TikTok 'home remedy' against coronavirus in Andhra Around 10 members of two families were hospitalised in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor after they tried a "home remedy" against coronavirus stated in TikTok videos. "[They] watched videos on TikTok which said drinking juice of ummetha would keep coronavirus away," a sub-inspector said. District Health Officer has appealed not to follow 'home remedies' that haven't been verified by medical experts.

Headline: Man arrested for hitting 2 female Delhi doctors, saying they're 'spreading Covid-19'
Description: Delhi Police registered a case and arrested a 44-year-old man on Wednesday night for allegedly physically assaulting two women resident doctors of Safdarjung Hospital. "We were buying fruits when a man started to shout at us to maintain distance. He blamed us for spreading coronavirus and hit us," one of the doctors said.
Text: Man arrested for hitting 2 female Delhi doctors, saying they're 'spreading Covid-19' Delhi Police registered a case and arrested a 44-year-old man on Wednesday night for allegedly physically assaulting two women resident doctors of Safdarjung Hospital. "We were buying fruits when a man started to shout at us to maintain distance. He blamed us for spreading coronavirus and hit us," one of the doctors said.

Headline: Submit report on steps taken to fight COVID-19: Calcutta HC to WB
Description: Calcutta High Court has directed West Bengal government to file a report on steps taken by it in the fight against the coronavirus outbreak through e-mail by April 16. Petitioner's lawyer had alleged that the doctors, nurses, paramedics and other healthcare staff, who are on the front lines of fighting the coronavirus pandemic, were not being given proper protective gears.
Text: Submit report on steps taken to fight COVID-19: Calcutta HC to WB Calcutta High Court has directed West Bengal government to file a report on steps taken by it in the fight against the coronavirus outbreak through e-mail by April 16. Petitioner's lawyer had alleged that the doctors, nurses, paramedics and other healthcare staff, who are on the front lines of fighting the coronavirus pandemic, were not being given proper protective gears.

Headline: Pak skips SAARC video conference on overcoming COVID-19's impact on trade
Description: Pakistan did not participate in the video conference of senior trade officials of SAARC held on Wednesday to discuss the impact of coronavirus pandemic on regional trade, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. The trade officials discussed that new ways should be identified to sustain and expand intra-regional trade until normal trade channels are restored, the MEA added.
Text: Pak skips SAARC video conference on overcoming COVID-19's impact on trade Pakistan did not participate in the video conference of senior trade officials of SAARC held on Wednesday to discuss the impact of coronavirus pandemic on regional trade, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. The trade officials discussed that new ways should be identified to sustain and expand intra-regional trade until normal trade channels are restored, the MEA added.

Headline: Gujarat govt to provide free ration to 60 lakh above poverty line families
Description: The Gujarat government on Wednesday said it'll provide free ration to around 60 lakh above poverty line (APL) families during the lockdown that are not covered under National Food Security Act. Each APL-1 card-holder family will get 10 kg wheat, three kg rice, one kg pulses and one kg sugar. This decision was taken during a cabinet meeting on Wednesday.
Text: Gujarat govt to provide free ration to 60 lakh above poverty line families The Gujarat government on Wednesday said it'll provide free ration to around 60 lakh above poverty line (APL) families during the lockdown that are not covered under National Food Security Act. Each APL-1 card-holder family will get 10 kg wheat, three kg rice, one kg pulses and one kg sugar. This decision was taken during a cabinet meeting on Wednesday.

Headline: IndiGo suspends international flights till April 30
Description: Amid the nationwide lockdown, IndiGo on Wednesday said it is suspending its international flights till April 30. Earlier, Air India had suspended domestic and international flights till April 30. Notably, Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said that India will remove restrictions on flight operations once the spread of coronavirus comes under control.
Text: IndiGo suspends international flights till April 30 Amid the nationwide lockdown, IndiGo on Wednesday said it is suspending its international flights till April 30. Earlier, Air India had suspended domestic and international flights till April 30. Notably, Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said that India will remove restrictions on flight operations once the spread of coronavirus comes under control.

Headline: Will face salary cut if attendance below 50%: BMC to non-essential staff
Description: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) staff from non-essential departments will face a salary cut if their attendance is less than 50%, the civic body said in a circular. "The employees should work in rotation as other work continues. However, this is not happening and in many departments, people are not reporting to work," a General Administration Department official said.
Text: Will face salary cut if attendance below 50%: BMC to non-essential staff The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) staff from non-essential departments will face a salary cut if their attendance is less than 50%, the civic body said in a circular. "The employees should work in rotation as other work continues. However, this is not happening and in many departments, people are not reporting to work," a General Administration Department official said.

Headline: India conducts 25,727 coronavirus tests in 2 days; total tests rise to 1,27,919
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has announced that 13,143 tests were conducted in India today, the highest number of tests conducted in one day so far. As many as 12,584 samples were tested in India on Tuesday. A total of 1,27,919 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India so far.
Text: India conducts 25,727 coronavirus tests in 2 days; total tests rise to 1,27,919 The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has announced that 13,143 tests were conducted in India today, the highest number of tests conducted in one day so far. As many as 12,584 samples were tested in India on Tuesday. A total of 1,27,919 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India so far.

Headline: PM replies to Arun Govil's fake Twitter account, Ramayan actor clarifies
Description: Arun Govil, who essayed the role of Lord Rama in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', responded to PM Narendra Modi after he retweeted a message on coronavirus from actor's fake Twitter account. "Thank you very much, sir! My genuine Twitter handle is @arungovil12," the actor replied to the tweet. Arun shared another video wherein he urged his followers to stop the impersonator.
Text: PM replies to Arun Govil's fake Twitter account, Ramayan actor clarifies Arun Govil, who essayed the role of Lord Rama in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', responded to PM Narendra Modi after he retweeted a message on coronavirus from actor's fake Twitter account. "Thank you very much, sir! My genuine Twitter handle is @arungovil12," the actor replied to the tweet. Arun shared another video wherein he urged his followers to stop the impersonator.

Headline: India 'responding positively' to drug needs of Australia, Spain: EAM
Description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said India is "responding positively" to the pharmaceutical requirements of Australia and Spain. Jaishankar held phone conversations with his Australian counterpart Marise Payne and Spanish counterpart Arancha González over their responses to the coronavirus pandemic. He added that India will make arrangements for Australians wishing to return home.
Text: India 'responding positively' to drug needs of Australia, Spain: EAM External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said India is "responding positively" to the pharmaceutical requirements of Australia and Spain. Jaishankar held phone conversations with his Australian counterpart Marise Payne and Spanish counterpart Arancha González over their responses to the coronavirus pandemic. He added that India will make arrangements for Australians wishing to return home.

Headline: 57-yr-old illegally stocks 180 litres of liquor to sell amid lockdown, booked
Description: The Pune City Police Crime Branch has seized 180 litres of 'hathbhatti' (country-made liquor) after raiding a spot in Lohegaon area and lodged an offence against 57-year-old Sopan Rakhpasare. The police said that the liquor bottles were being sold illegally amid the nationwide lockdown imposed in the view of the COVID-19 outbreak. In Maharashtra, 1135 coronavirus cases have been reported.
Text: 57-yr-old illegally stocks 180 litres of liquor to sell amid lockdown, booked The Pune City Police Crime Branch has seized 180 litres of 'hathbhatti' (country-made liquor) after raiding a spot in Lohegaon area and lodged an offence against 57-year-old Sopan Rakhpasare. The police said that the liquor bottles were being sold illegally amid the nationwide lockdown imposed in the view of the COVID-19 outbreak. In Maharashtra, 1135 coronavirus cases have been reported.

Headline: Face masks made compulsory for anyone stepping out in Delhi
Description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has announced that facial masks will be compulsory for anyone stepping out of their house amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that wearing of facial masks can reduce the spread of coronavirus substantially. He further said that people can also wear cloth masks. Delhi has reported over 550 cases of coronavirus so far.
Text: Face masks made compulsory for anyone stepping out in Delhi Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has announced that facial masks will be compulsory for anyone stepping out of their house amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that wearing of facial masks can reduce the spread of coronavirus substantially. He further said that people can also wear cloth masks. Delhi has reported over 550 cases of coronavirus so far.

Headline: Hotels, restaurants to not be closed till October 15, viral order not true: Govt
Description: An order attributing Ministry of Tourism claiming that hotels and restaurants will remain closed till October 15 due to coronavirus outbreak has gone viral on social media.  The government has said that the order is fake and has not been issued by Ministry of Tourism. "Do not believe in rumours!" the government added.
Text: Hotels, restaurants to not be closed till October 15, viral order not true: Govt An order attributing Ministry of Tourism claiming that hotels and restaurants will remain closed till October 15 due to coronavirus outbreak has gone viral on social media.  The government has said that the order is fake and has not been issued by Ministry of Tourism. "Do not believe in rumours!" the government added.

Headline: Hotspots in 15 UP districts with 6 or more COVID-19 cases to be under lockdown
Description: Uttar Pradesh Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi has said hotspots in 15 districts of the state with 6 or more coronavirus cases will be under lockdown. "Nobody would be allowed to enter these areas," he added. Earlier, UP's Chief Secretary said the districts, including Gautam Buddha Nagar and Lucknow, will be sealed and essentials will be delivered to homes.
Text: Hotspots in 15 UP districts with 6 or more COVID-19 cases to be under lockdown Uttar Pradesh Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi has said hotspots in 15 districts of the state with 6 or more coronavirus cases will be under lockdown. "Nobody would be allowed to enter these areas," he added. Earlier, UP's Chief Secretary said the districts, including Gautam Buddha Nagar and Lucknow, will be sealed and essentials will be delivered to homes.

Headline: 100% lockdown in hotspots of 15 UP districts imposed till April 15 morning: Govt
Description: Uttar Pradesh's Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi has said the 100% lockdown in the hotspots of the state's 15 districts has been imposed till the morning of April 15. The 100% lockdown has been imposed in hotspots in 15 districts with six or more coronavirus cases. This comes after the number of coronavirus cases in UP rose to 343.
Text: 100% lockdown in hotspots of 15 UP districts imposed till April 15 morning: Govt Uttar Pradesh's Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi has said the 100% lockdown in the hotspots of the state's 15 districts has been imposed till the morning of April 15. The 100% lockdown has been imposed in hotspots in 15 districts with six or more coronavirus cases. This comes after the number of coronavirus cases in UP rose to 343.

Headline: 773 new coronavirus cases, 32 deaths reported in last 24 hours, most in a day: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 773 new coronavirus cases and 32 deaths have been reported in India in the last 24 hours. It is the biggest single-day jump in both the number of coronavirus cases and deaths in India so far. Further, 402 COVID-19 patients have recovered in India so far.
Text: 773 new coronavirus cases, 32 deaths reported in last 24 hours, most in a day: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal today said that 773 new coronavirus cases and 32 deaths have been reported in India in the last 24 hours. It is the biggest single-day jump in both the number of coronavirus cases and deaths in India so far. Further, 402 COVID-19 patients have recovered in India so far.

Headline: Which 22 coronavirus hotspots will go under 100% lockdown in Noida till April 15?
Description: As many as 22 coronavirus hotspots which include 34 localities will be sealed in Gautam Buddha Nagar till April 15. They include Sectors 37, 44, 27, 28 and 41. The list also comprises Designer Park in Sector 62, Grand Omaxe in Sector 93B, Lotus Boulevard in Sector 100, Mehak Residency in Greater Noida and Ghodi Bacheda village.
Text: Which 22 coronavirus hotspots will go under 100% lockdown in Noida till April 15? As many as 22 coronavirus hotspots which include 34 localities will be sealed in Gautam Buddha Nagar till April 15. They include Sectors 37, 44, 27, 28 and 41. The list also comprises Designer Park in Sector 62, Grand Omaxe in Sector 93B, Lotus Boulevard in Sector 100, Mehak Residency in Greater Noida and Ghodi Bacheda village.

Headline: Situation akin to social emergency, states have suggested to extend lockdown: PM
Description: During an interaction with several floor leaders of political parties, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Situation in country is akin to a 'social emergency'; it has necessitated tough decisions and we must continue to remain vigilant." He added, "States, district administrations and experts have suggested extension of lockdown to contain spread of the virus."
Text: Situation akin to social emergency, states have suggested to extend lockdown: PM During an interaction with several floor leaders of political parties, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "Situation in country is akin to a 'social emergency'; it has necessitated tough decisions and we must continue to remain vigilant." He added, "States, district administrations and experts have suggested extension of lockdown to contain spread of the virus."

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India surge to 5,274, death toll at 149
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,274, while the death toll in the country stands at 149. Out of all the cases, 4,714 are active. Further, the number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 411. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India surge to 5,274, death toll at 149 The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,274, while the death toll in the country stands at 149. Out of all the cases, 4,714 are active. Further, the number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 411. Cases have been reported from 31 states and Union Territories so far.

Headline: Mandatory to wear masks, there can be legal action for not wearing masks: UP govt
Description: Uttar Pradesh Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi on Wednesday said wearing masks has been made mandatory in the state. He also added that there may be legal action against those not wearing masks. Awasthi had earlier stated that hotspots in 15 districts with six or more coronavirus cases will be put under lockdown.
Text: Mandatory to wear masks, there can be legal action for not wearing masks: UP govt Uttar Pradesh Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Kumar Awasthi on Wednesday said wearing masks has been made mandatory in the state. He also added that there may be legal action against those not wearing masks. Awasthi had earlier stated that hotspots in 15 districts with six or more coronavirus cases will be put under lockdown.

Headline: Only 2 Indian cities now in top 20 most polluted places compared to 14 last year
Description: Mumbai and Kolkata were the only Indian cities in the top 20 most polluted places in the world on Wednesday, data from IQAir showed. Pollution levels across India have dropped during the lockdown. India was home to 14 of the 20 most polluted cities in the world last year, according to the 2019 World Air Quality Report by IQAir AirVisual.
Text: Only 2 Indian cities now in top 20 most polluted places compared to 14 last year Mumbai and Kolkata were the only Indian cities in the top 20 most polluted places in the world on Wednesday, data from IQAir showed. Pollution levels across India have dropped during the lockdown. India was home to 14 of the 20 most polluted cities in the world last year, according to the 2019 World Air Quality Report by IQAir AirVisual.

Headline: Greater Mumbai Municipal Corporation makes wearing masks compulsory in public
Description: Greater Mumbai Municipal Corporation has made wearing face masks in public places compulsory in Mumbai to prevent the spread of coronavirus. "All persons moving in public places...must wear 3 ply mask or cloth mask compulsorily," Municipal Commissioner Praveen Pardeshi said in an order. Violators will be booked under Section 188 of IPC and will be penalised and may be arrested.
Text: Greater Mumbai Municipal Corporation makes wearing masks compulsory in public Greater Mumbai Municipal Corporation has made wearing face masks in public places compulsory in Mumbai to prevent the spread of coronavirus. "All persons moving in public places...must wear 3 ply mask or cloth mask compulsorily," Municipal Commissioner Praveen Pardeshi said in an order. Violators will be booked under Section 188 of IPC and will be penalised and may be arrested.

Headline: K'taka CM calls nurse after seeing video of her kid crying for her to come home
Description: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Wednesday called nurse Sugandha, who is on COVID-19 duty and has reportedly not gone home for 15 days. Yediyurappa's call came after news channels aired a video of Sugandha's three-year-old daughter crying outside the hospital for her to return home, which left her teary-eyed. "You will have better opportunities in the future," Yediyurappa told Sugandha.
Text: K'taka CM calls nurse after seeing video of her kid crying for her to come home Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa on Wednesday called nurse Sugandha, who is on COVID-19 duty and has reportedly not gone home for 15 days. Yediyurappa's call came after news channels aired a video of Sugandha's three-year-old daughter crying outside the hospital for her to return home, which left her teary-eyed. "You will have better opportunities in the future," Yediyurappa told Sugandha.

Headline: Govt releases advisory to deal with social stigma associated with COVID-19
Description: Government has released an advisory to address social stigma associated with coronavirus, containing a list of Dos and Don'ts. "Never spread names...of those affected or...their locality on...social media," it read. "Despite all precautions, if anybody catches the infection, it's not their fault. In situation of distress, the patient and the family need support," the advisory stated.
Text: Govt releases advisory to deal with social stigma associated with COVID-19 Government has released an advisory to address social stigma associated with coronavirus, containing a list of Dos and Don'ts. "Never spread names...of those affected or...their locality on...social media," it read. "Despite all precautions, if anybody catches the infection, it's not their fault. In situation of distress, the patient and the family need support," the advisory stated.

Headline: Not wrong to shoot Tablighi Jamaat members not coming for test: BJP MLA
Description: BJP MLA from Honnali constituency in Karnataka MP Renukacharya has said that the government should not ignore anyone who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi and is not coming out for medical checkups and is escaping detection. "Even if he is shot, it is not wrong. Otherwise, the virus will spread throughout the entire country," said Renukacharya.
Text: Not wrong to shoot Tablighi Jamaat members not coming for test: BJP MLA BJP MLA from Honnali constituency in Karnataka MP Renukacharya has said that the government should not ignore anyone who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi and is not coming out for medical checkups and is escaping detection. "Even if he is shot, it is not wrong. Otherwise, the virus will spread throughout the entire country," said Renukacharya.

Headline: Coronavirus tests should be free in both govt and private labs, orders Supreme Court
Description: The Supreme Court has directed the government to make coronavirus testing free of cost in both government and private laboratories. It added that tests relating to coronavirus must be carried out in NABL-accredited labs or any agencies approved by WHO or ICMR. This comes after an advocate filed a plea stating private labs were charging around ₹4,500 for such tests.
Text: Coronavirus tests should be free in both govt and private labs, orders Supreme Court The Supreme Court has directed the government to make coronavirus testing free of cost in both government and private laboratories. It added that tests relating to coronavirus must be carried out in NABL-accredited labs or any agencies approved by WHO or ICMR. This comes after an advocate filed a plea stating private labs were charging around ₹4,500 for such tests.

Headline: Don't stand for 5 min to honour me, instead take responsibility of a poor family: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi today tweeted that it has been brought to his attention that some people are campaigning to honour him by standing for five minutes. "If you really have so much love and want to honour Modi...then take the responsibility of a poor family during the coronavirus crisis...There can be no greater honour for me than this," he added.
Text: Don't stand for 5 min to honour me, instead take responsibility of a poor family: PM PM Narendra Modi today tweeted that it has been brought to his attention that some people are campaigning to honour him by standing for five minutes. "If you really have so much love and want to honour Modi...then take the responsibility of a poor family during the coronavirus crisis...There can be no greater honour for me than this," he added.

Headline: 12 people who went for morning walk booked for violating lockdown in Maharashtra
Description: Twelve people from Navi Mumbai were arrested on Wednesday for going out on morning walk in violation of the lockdown guidelines, police said. They were spotted by police on roads in Navi Mumbai's Panvel area early in the morning. They were booked under Indian Penal Code Section 188 and later released on bail.
Text: 12 people who went for morning walk booked for violating lockdown in Maharashtra Twelve people from Navi Mumbai were arrested on Wednesday for going out on morning walk in violation of the lockdown guidelines, police said. They were spotted by police on roads in Navi Mumbai's Panvel area early in the morning. They were booked under Indian Penal Code Section 188 and later released on bail.

Headline: Gujarat govt to get 1,000 indigenously made ventilators free of cost
Description: A Rajkot-based private company has prepared indigenously made ventilators and is giving the first 1,000 such ventilators free of cost to the Gujarat government. The machines have been set up at the Civil Hospital in Ahmedabad, where the 1,200-bed facility is undergoing preparations for being one of the four infection control centres to combat coronavirus spread.
Text: Gujarat govt to get 1,000 indigenously made ventilators free of cost A Rajkot-based private company has prepared indigenously made ventilators and is giving the first 1,000 such ventilators free of cost to the Gujarat government. The machines have been set up at the Civil Hospital in Ahmedabad, where the 1,200-bed facility is undergoing preparations for being one of the four infection control centres to combat coronavirus spread.

Headline: COVID-19 does not discriminate on basis of caste, religion: Mamata
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that COVID-19 does not discriminate on the basis of caste or religion. "We have been witnessing that some people are indulging in communal politics over Nizamuddin event. This is completely unacceptable," she said. "Why the gathering was not stopped when it was happening? This is not the time for communal politics," she added.
Text: COVID-19 does not discriminate on basis of caste, religion: Mamata West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that COVID-19 does not discriminate on the basis of caste or religion. "We have been witnessing that some people are indulging in communal politics over Nizamuddin event. This is completely unacceptable," she said. "Why the gathering was not stopped when it was happening? This is not the time for communal politics," she added.

Headline: There won't be any lack of hydroxychloroquine in India today or in future: Govt
Description: On being asked about the availability of hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) in India, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "It is ensured that not only today but even in future there will not be any lack of HCQ as and when needed." He reiterated that HCQ has been prescribed to "a particular set of people".
Text: There won't be any lack of hydroxychloroquine in India today or in future: Govt On being asked about the availability of hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) in India, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal said, "It is ensured that not only today but even in future there will not be any lack of HCQ as and when needed." He reiterated that HCQ has been prescribed to "a particular set of people".
