Headline: Medical staff protest at Mumbai hospital as woman dies of COVID-19
Description: Medical staff at Mumbai's KB Bhabha Municipal General Hospital staged a protest on Wednesday, demanding they be quarantined as there is a risk of spread of coronavirus at the facility. This comes after a woman undergoing treatment at the hospital died due to coronavirus. The staff also alleged that they have been provided with low-quality Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).
Text: Medical staff protest at Mumbai hospital as woman dies of COVID-19 Medical staff at Mumbai's KB Bhabha Municipal General Hospital staged a protest on Wednesday, demanding they be quarantined as there is a risk of spread of coronavirus at the facility. This comes after a woman undergoing treatment at the hospital died due to coronavirus. The staff also alleged that they have been provided with low-quality Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).

Headline: Radio operators ask Sonia to withdraw suggestion of ban on govt ads
Description: The Association of Radio Operators for India (AROI) has requested Congress President Sonia Gandhi to withdraw her recommendation to PM Narendra Modi to impose a two-year ban on government media advertisements. The AROI said, "The last year has been a very difficult one for radio, especially for radio stations in small towns, due to a huge drop in government advertising."
Text: Radio operators ask Sonia to withdraw suggestion of ban on govt ads The Association of Radio Operators for India (AROI) has requested Congress President Sonia Gandhi to withdraw her recommendation to PM Narendra Modi to impose a two-year ban on government media advertisements. The AROI said, "The last year has been a very difficult one for radio, especially for radio stations in small towns, due to a huge drop in government advertising."

Headline: Constable on lockdown duty attacked with stones in Indore; 6 held
Description: A video has surfaced online showing a mob chasing a police constable and pelting him with stones in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday. The incident took place when the constable stopped a vehicle carrying more than five persons who wanted to buy vegetables by defying lockdown restrictions. Six were arrested including two who would be booked under National Security Act.
Text: Constable on lockdown duty attacked with stones in Indore; 6 held A video has surfaced online showing a mob chasing a police constable and pelting him with stones in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday. The incident took place when the constable stopped a vehicle carrying more than five persons who wanted to buy vegetables by defying lockdown restrictions. Six were arrested including two who would be booked under National Security Act.

Headline: Financial censorship': Newspaper industry after Sonia suggests govt to stop ads
Description: The Indian Newspaper Society urged Congress President Sonia Gandhi to withdraw her suggestion to the government to impose a two-year ban on media advertisements by the government and state-run companies. "Such a proposal (is) tantamount to financial censorship. It's a very small amount as far as government spending is concerned, but it's a huge amount for newspaper industry," it said.
Text: Financial censorship': Newspaper industry after Sonia suggests govt to stop ads The Indian Newspaper Society urged Congress President Sonia Gandhi to withdraw her suggestion to the government to impose a two-year ban on media advertisements by the government and state-run companies. "Such a proposal (is) tantamount to financial censorship. It's a very small amount as far as government spending is concerned, but it's a huge amount for newspaper industry," it said.

Headline: Maharashtra CM lauds railway officer for sending grocery to farmers
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday called a railway officer in Nagpur and appreciated him for his social work. Khushroo Poacha, the office superintendent in the Central Railway's commercial department, sent 540 'grocery kits' in a truck for farmers and their widows in Vidarbha to help them for next 10-12 days. Poacha is also providing raw material to community kitchens.
Text: Maharashtra CM lauds railway officer for sending grocery to farmers Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday called a railway officer in Nagpur and appreciated him for his social work. Khushroo Poacha, the office superintendent in the Central Railway's commercial department, sent 540 'grocery kits' in a truck for farmers and their widows in Vidarbha to help them for next 10-12 days. Poacha is also providing raw material to community kitchens.

Headline: UP CM inaugurates 56 fire tenders for sanitisation work amid COVID-19 crisis
Description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has inaugurated 56 fire tenders in Phase-1 in Lucknow which will be used for sanitisation work amid the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, the CM gave ₹30 crore to the fire department from which they placed an order for fire brigades worth ₹20 crore and other equipment including chemical suits worth ₹10 crore, an official said.
Text: UP CM inaugurates 56 fire tenders for sanitisation work amid COVID-19 crisis Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has inaugurated 56 fire tenders in Phase-1 in Lucknow which will be used for sanitisation work amid the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, the CM gave ₹30 crore to the fire department from which they placed an order for fire brigades worth ₹20 crore and other equipment including chemical suits worth ₹10 crore, an official said.

Headline: COVID-19 hotspots in 15 UP districts to be sealed, essentials to be home delivered
Description: Uttar Pradesh Chief Secretary RK Tiwari has said that coronavirus hotspots in 15 districts of Uttar Pradesh including Gautam Buddha Nagar, Lucknow, Agra and Varanasi will be sealed with immediate effect. He added that no one will be allowed to move out in the areas, while the essential services will be delivered to homes by the government.
Text: COVID-19 hotspots in 15 UP districts to be sealed, essentials to be home delivered Uttar Pradesh Chief Secretary RK Tiwari has said that coronavirus hotspots in 15 districts of Uttar Pradesh including Gautam Buddha Nagar, Lucknow, Agra and Varanasi will be sealed with immediate effect. He added that no one will be allowed to move out in the areas, while the essential services will be delivered to homes by the government.

Headline: UP govt announces ₹50 lakh insurance cover for police personnel
Description: Uttar Pradesh government has announced insurance cover of ₹50 lakh for police personnel in the state amid the COVID-19 outbreak, Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Awasthi said on Wednesday. The CMO will soon release a written order about the same, Awasthi added. Recently, the Punjab government announced additional health insurance of ₹50 lakh to the state police personnel and sanitation workers.
Text: UP govt announces ₹50 lakh insurance cover for police personnel Uttar Pradesh government has announced insurance cover of ₹50 lakh for police personnel in the state amid the COVID-19 outbreak, Additional Chief Secretary Awanish Awasthi said on Wednesday. The CMO will soon release a written order about the same, Awasthi added. Recently, the Punjab government announced additional health insurance of ₹50 lakh to the state police personnel and sanitation workers.

Headline: Indian-origin Miss England returns to work as doctor in UK amid Covid-19 pandemic
Description: Indian-origin Miss England Dr Bhasha Mukherjee has returned to the UK to resume her work as a doctor amid coronavirus pandemic. The 24-year-old was in India when PM Narendra Modi announced a nation-wide lockdown and was allowed to fly back to the UK on Wednesday with the help of the British High Commission in Kolkata.
Text: Indian-origin Miss England returns to work as doctor in UK amid Covid-19 pandemic Indian-origin Miss England Dr Bhasha Mukherjee has returned to the UK to resume her work as a doctor amid coronavirus pandemic. The 24-year-old was in India when PM Narendra Modi announced a nation-wide lockdown and was allowed to fly back to the UK on Wednesday with the help of the British High Commission in Kolkata.

Headline: Invoke Essential Commodities Act to ensure uninterrupted supply: MHA to states
Description: Ministry of Home Affairs on Tuesday directed the state governments to invoke the Essential Commodities Act, 1955 to ensure supplies of essential commodities during the lockdown. The Centre warned that the offences committed under the EC Act will be criminal offences. The offences may result in imprisonment of 7 years or fine or both, MHA said in an official statement.
Text: Invoke Essential Commodities Act to ensure uninterrupted supply: MHA to states Ministry of Home Affairs on Tuesday directed the state governments to invoke the Essential Commodities Act, 1955 to ensure supplies of essential commodities during the lockdown. The Centre warned that the offences committed under the EC Act will be criminal offences. The offences may result in imprisonment of 7 years or fine or both, MHA said in an official statement.

Headline: Trump supports India's position on Hydroxychloroquine after 'retaliation' remark
Description: A day after US President Donald Trump said there may be "retaliation" if India doesn't supply Hydroxychloroquine to US amid coronavirus, he supported Indian government's position on the drug. "I bought...over 29 million doses...I spoke to PM Modi, a lot of it comes out of India," he said. "They put a stop because they wanted it for India," Trump added.
Text: Trump supports India's position on Hydroxychloroquine after 'retaliation' remark A day after US President Donald Trump said there may be "retaliation" if India doesn't supply Hydroxychloroquine to US amid coronavirus, he supported Indian government's position on the drug. "I bought...over 29 million doses...I spoke to PM Modi, a lot of it comes out of India," he said. "They put a stop because they wanted it for India," Trump added.

Headline: BSF distributes ration among daily wage labourers in J&K's Pulwama
Description: Personnel of the Border Security Force (BSF) have been distributing ration and other essential items among daily wage labourers in Pampore in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir. "We have identified 100 families of labourers who will be provided with ration till the lockdown continues," said Rajesh Mishra, BSF IG, Kashmir.
Text: BSF distributes ration among daily wage labourers in J&K's Pulwama Personnel of the Border Security Force (BSF) have been distributing ration and other essential items among daily wage labourers in Pampore in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir. "We have identified 100 families of labourers who will be provided with ration till the lockdown continues," said Rajesh Mishra, BSF IG, Kashmir.

Headline: Come forward within 24 hrs or face charges: MP CM to Tablighi Jamaat attendees
Description: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday night tweeted that the state residents who participated in Delhi's Tablighi Jamaat event should report to the authorities within 24 hours. "If they fail to do so, they'll face criminal charges for endangering the security of the state and the country," he said. The state has recorded 229 COVID-19 cases so far.
Text: Come forward within 24 hrs or face charges: MP CM to Tablighi Jamaat attendees Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday night tweeted that the state residents who participated in Delhi's Tablighi Jamaat event should report to the authorities within 24 hours. "If they fail to do so, they'll face criminal charges for endangering the security of the state and the country," he said. The state has recorded 229 COVID-19 cases so far.

Headline: Don't withdraw job offers: HRD Minister appeals to campus recruiters
Description: HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal issued a public appeal on Monday to all campus recruiters asking them not to withdraw jobs offered to the graduating students of technical education institutions. Pokhriyal said the present crisis is temporary and the government is taking measures to tackle the menace. Recently, IIT-Delhi's Director V Ramgopal Rao also made a similar appeal on social media.
Text: Don't withdraw job offers: HRD Minister appeals to campus recruiters HRD Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal issued a public appeal on Monday to all campus recruiters asking them not to withdraw jobs offered to the graduating students of technical education institutions. Pokhriyal said the present crisis is temporary and the government is taking measures to tackle the menace. Recently, IIT-Delhi's Director V Ramgopal Rao also made a similar appeal on social media.

Headline: Brazil requests India for Malaria drug, cites example of Hanuman getting Sanjivani
Description: Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi seeking help over supplies of the Malaria drug Hydroxychloroquine that's being used to treat coronavirus patients. Bolsonaro wrote, "Just as Lord Hanuman brought the holy medicine from the Himalayas to save the life of Lord Rama's brother Laksmana...India and Brazil will overcome this global crisis by joining forces."
Text: Brazil requests India for Malaria drug, cites example of Hanuman getting Sanjivani Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi seeking help over supplies of the Malaria drug Hydroxychloroquine that's being used to treat coronavirus patients. Bolsonaro wrote, "Just as Lord Hanuman brought the holy medicine from the Himalayas to save the life of Lord Rama's brother Laksmana...India and Brazil will overcome this global crisis by joining forces."

Headline: 2 coronavirus patients die in Pune, district toll rises to 10
Description: Two more people suffering from coronavirus have died in Pune, stated health officials. The deceased include a 44-year-old man who was suffering from diabetes and a patient who succumbed to the disease at the Sassoon Hospital. With this, the death toll due to the disease has risen to 10 in the district, the health officials added.
Text: 2 coronavirus patients die in Pune, district toll rises to 10 Two more people suffering from coronavirus have died in Pune, stated health officials. The deceased include a 44-year-old man who was suffering from diabetes and a patient who succumbed to the disease at the Sassoon Hospital. With this, the death toll due to the disease has risen to 10 in the district, the health officials added.

Headline: Govt allocated ₹200 crore for new COVID-19 projects: Science & Tech Dept
Description: The government has allocated funds of over ₹200 crore to scientific institutions, industries and startups to develop solutions to help fight coronavirus, Department of Science and Technology Secretary Ashutosh Sharma said. "At this moment we're not giving priority to long term research. We are focusing more on development – that is translating research into product or technology," Sharma added.
Text: Govt allocated ₹200 crore for new COVID-19 projects: Science & Tech Dept The government has allocated funds of over ₹200 crore to scientific institutions, industries and startups to develop solutions to help fight coronavirus, Department of Science and Technology Secretary Ashutosh Sharma said. "At this moment we're not giving priority to long term research. We are focusing more on development – that is translating research into product or technology," Sharma added.

Headline: Make all Covid-19 tests free for citizens, SC suggests Centre
Description: The Supreme Court on Wednesday suggested the Centre to ensure that testing facilities for Covid-19 are made available free of cost to citizens. The court suggested, "Don't allow private labs to charge high amount for tests. Create a mechanism for reimbursement (of private labs) from government." Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, representing the Centre, said he'll take instructions in this regard.
Text: Make all Covid-19 tests free for citizens, SC suggests Centre The Supreme Court on Wednesday suggested the Centre to ensure that testing facilities for Covid-19 are made available free of cost to citizens. The court suggested, "Don't allow private labs to charge high amount for tests. Create a mechanism for reimbursement (of private labs) from government." Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, representing the Centre, said he'll take instructions in this regard.

Headline: Covid-19 patient dies in Amritsar, family refuses to claim body
Description: The Amritsar district administration performed the last rites of a victim of coronavirus after his family refused to claim the body. Amritsar Deputy Commissioner Shivdular Singh Dhillon on Tuesday stated, "His family was informed but did not come forward for the last rites," and added that the deceased was a former employee of the civic body in Amritsar.
Text: Covid-19 patient dies in Amritsar, family refuses to claim body The Amritsar district administration performed the last rites of a victim of coronavirus after his family refused to claim the body. Amritsar Deputy Commissioner Shivdular Singh Dhillon on Tuesday stated, "His family was informed but did not come forward for the last rites," and added that the deceased was a former employee of the civic body in Amritsar.

Headline: 8 new cases of Covid-19 in Bhopal, total reaches 91 in city
Description: Eight more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Bhopal, taking the total number of Covid-19 cases in the city to 91, stated Bhopal Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr Sudhir Kumar Dehariya. He added, "While one person has died due to the disease, two others have been cured or discharged."
Text: 8 new cases of Covid-19 in Bhopal, total reaches 91 in city Eight more people have tested positive for coronavirus in Bhopal, taking the total number of Covid-19 cases in the city to 91, stated Bhopal Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr Sudhir Kumar Dehariya. He added, "While one person has died due to the disease, two others have been cured or discharged."

Headline: Delhi LG urges Muslim community not to step out on Shab-e-Barat
Description: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal appealed to the people from the Muslim community not to step out of their houses to pray on the occasion of Shab-e-Barat, which is scheduled to be held on April 9. He also urged them to follow the safety guidelines issued in view of coronavirus lockdown. Over 570 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Delhi.
Text: Delhi LG urges Muslim community not to step out on Shab-e-Barat Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal appealed to the people from the Muslim community not to step out of their houses to pray on the occasion of Shab-e-Barat, which is scheduled to be held on April 9. He also urged them to follow the safety guidelines issued in view of coronavirus lockdown. Over 570 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Delhi.

Headline: Lockdown may not end on April 14: Karnataka CM Yediyurappa
Description: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has said, "There's no guarantee that the lockdown will end on April 14." He also said, "Out of 30 districts, the virus is there in 19 districts. In the coming days, by making sure there's no trouble in these 19 districts, we can allow transportation and business within the other districts, if the Prime Minister agrees."
Text: Lockdown may not end on April 14: Karnataka CM Yediyurappa Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa has said, "There's no guarantee that the lockdown will end on April 14." He also said, "Out of 30 districts, the virus is there in 19 districts. In the coming days, by making sure there's no trouble in these 19 districts, we can allow transportation and business within the other districts, if the Prime Minister agrees."

Headline: 10 policemen and their 5 family members test +ve for Covid-19: Bhopal IG
Description: Ten policemen, as well as five of their family members, have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh. Bhopal Inspector General of Police Upendra Jain said, "There is a 99.99% chance that our policemen contracted the virus while conducting a search to locate those who attended the Tablighi Jamaat meeting in Delhi, in various mosques."
Text: 10 policemen and their 5 family members test +ve for Covid-19: Bhopal IG Ten policemen, as well as five of their family members, have tested positive for coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh. Bhopal Inspector General of Police Upendra Jain said, "There is a 99.99% chance that our policemen contracted the virus while conducting a search to locate those who attended the Tablighi Jamaat meeting in Delhi, in various mosques."

Headline: 576 +ve cases in Delhi so far, 35 in ICU and 8 on ventilator: Minister
Description: There are a total of 576 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 35 are in the ICU and eight are on the ventilator, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has stated. There have been 9 deaths in the capital city till now. Meanwhile, the Centre announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,194.
Text: 576 +ve cases in Delhi so far, 35 in ICU and 8 on ventilator: Minister There are a total of 576 cases of coronavirus in Delhi so far, of which 35 are in the ICU and eight are on the ventilator, Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has stated. There have been 9 deaths in the capital city till now. Meanwhile, the Centre announced that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,194.

Headline: Door-to-door screening to be held from tomorrow in Odisha's Ganjam district
Description: Odisha's Ganjam District Collector Vijay Amruta Kulange on Wednesday said that as a precautionary measure against COVID-19, the district administration will conduct door-to-door health screening of people from tomorrow. Around seven lakh families will be screened, Kulange added. As per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), Odisha has recorded 42 COVID-19 cases so far.
Text: Door-to-door screening to be held from tomorrow in Odisha's Ganjam district Odisha's Ganjam District Collector Vijay Amruta Kulange on Wednesday said that as a precautionary measure against COVID-19, the district administration will conduct door-to-door health screening of people from tomorrow. Around seven lakh families will be screened, Kulange added. As per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), Odisha has recorded 42 COVID-19 cases so far.

Headline: MP Chief Secy served notice as officials allegedly flout Covid-19 protocol
Description: The Madhya Pradesh Human Rights Commission has served a notice to state Chief Secretary Iqbal Singh Bains following claims that some IAS officers and health department staffers suffering from Covid-19 delayed their hospitalisation by up to two days. The MPHRC said it took note of the matter on the basis of a news report and Congress MP Vivek Tankha's tweets.
Text: MP Chief Secy served notice as officials allegedly flout Covid-19 protocol The Madhya Pradesh Human Rights Commission has served a notice to state Chief Secretary Iqbal Singh Bains following claims that some IAS officers and health department staffers suffering from Covid-19 delayed their hospitalisation by up to two days. The MPHRC said it took note of the matter on the basis of a news report and Congress MP Vivek Tankha's tweets.

Headline: 5 more test COVID-19 positive in Rajasthan, total cases in state rise to 348
Description: The Rajasthan Health Department on Wednesday said that the total COVID-19 cases in the state have increased to 348 after five more tested positive for the virus. The five people tested positive in Bikaner, Banswara and Jaipur, the state health department added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), Rajasthan has recorded three deaths due to COVID-19.
Text: 5 more test COVID-19 positive in Rajasthan, total cases in state rise to 348 The Rajasthan Health Department on Wednesday said that the total COVID-19 cases in the state have increased to 348 after five more tested positive for the virus. The five people tested positive in Bikaner, Banswara and Jaipur, the state health department added. According to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW), Rajasthan has recorded three deaths due to COVID-19.

Headline: Nurse working in Bihar hospital's isolation ward assaulted by neighbours
Description: A paramedic working at an isolation ward of a Bihar hospital alleged that she was beaten up by her neighbours, police said. She alleged that neighbours said they would be infected with coronavirus if she enters her house using a gate adjacent to theirs, police added. "They told me that I had brought the infection from the hospital," she said.
Text: Nurse working in Bihar hospital's isolation ward assaulted by neighbours A paramedic working at an isolation ward of a Bihar hospital alleged that she was beaten up by her neighbours, police said. She alleged that neighbours said they would be infected with coronavirus if she enters her house using a gate adjacent to theirs, police added. "They told me that I had brought the infection from the hospital," she said.

Headline: 8 foreigners linked to Jamaat event booked for violating visa in Nagpur
Description: At least eight foreigners linked to the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have been booked for violating the Foreigners Act and tourist visa norms in Maharashtra's Nagpur, said the police. The police added that the eight foreigners, who had taken shelter at a local mosque in the city, have been placed under isolation.
Text: 8 foreigners linked to Jamaat event booked for violating visa in Nagpur At least eight foreigners linked to the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have been booked for violating the Foreigners Act and tourist visa norms in Maharashtra's Nagpur, said the police. The police added that the eight foreigners, who had taken shelter at a local mosque in the city, have been placed under isolation.

Headline: Ready to write to PM to extend lockdown: Puducherry CM
Description: Puducherry Chief Minister V Narayanasamy has said, "My government is ready to write to the Prime Minister to extend the lockdown. People isolating themselves is the only cure to stop the spread of coronavirus infection." As per official government data, there have been five cases of coronavirus in Puducherry.
Text: Ready to write to PM to extend lockdown: Puducherry CM Puducherry Chief Minister V Narayanasamy has said, "My government is ready to write to the Prime Minister to extend the lockdown. People isolating themselves is the only cure to stop the spread of coronavirus infection." As per official government data, there have been five cases of coronavirus in Puducherry.

Headline: 12 injured in clash during ration distribution in Uttar Pradesh, 6 held
Description: At least 12 people were injured as two groups clashed over the issue of distribution of ration in Uttar Pradesh's Kamalpur village, police said on Wednesday. The police have arrested six people in connection with the clash that took place on Tuesday. The situation in the village is now fully under control, the police added.
Text: 12 injured in clash during ration distribution in Uttar Pradesh, 6 held At least 12 people were injured as two groups clashed over the issue of distribution of ration in Uttar Pradesh's Kamalpur village, police said on Wednesday. The police have arrested six people in connection with the clash that took place on Tuesday. The situation in the village is now fully under control, the police added.

Headline: Covering mouth and nose in public places made compulsory in Chandigarh
Description: Chandigarh has made it mandatory for people to cover their mouth and nose with mask or cloth in public places, the Union Territory's Department of Public Relations announced. This comes amid rising cases of coronavirus in the country. Earlier, Odisha had issued a similar directive to residents in the state.
Text: Covering mouth and nose in public places made compulsory in Chandigarh Chandigarh has made it mandatory for people to cover their mouth and nose with mask or cloth in public places, the Union Territory's Department of Public Relations announced. This comes amid rising cases of coronavirus in the country. Earlier, Odisha had issued a similar directive to residents in the state.

Headline: Govt releases immunity boosting measures for self-care during COVID-19 crisis
Description: The Ministry of AYUSH on Tuesday released immunity boosting measures for self-care during coronavirus crisis, which includes  drinking hot water throughout the day. It also recommended people to take Chyavanprash in the morning and golden milk (turmeric milk) once or twice a day. For those with dry cough or sore throat, the ministry suggested steam inhalation with fresh mint leaves.
Text: Govt releases immunity boosting measures for self-care during COVID-19 crisis The Ministry of AYUSH on Tuesday released immunity boosting measures for self-care during coronavirus crisis, which includes  drinking hot water throughout the day. It also recommended people to take Chyavanprash in the morning and golden milk (turmeric milk) once or twice a day. For those with dry cough or sore throat, the ministry suggested steam inhalation with fresh mint leaves.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 5,000; death toll reaches 149
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,194. Meanwhile, 149 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 4,643 cases are active, while 402 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 70 foreign nationals.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India cross 5,000; death toll reaches 149 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Wednesday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 5,194. Meanwhile, 149 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 4,643 cases are active, while 402 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 70 foreign nationals.

Headline: Delhi reports 25 new coronavirus cases today, total rises to 550; death toll at 9
Description: As many as 25 new coronavirus cases were reported in Delhi on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 550. The coronavirus death toll in Delhi stands at nine, while the number of patients who have been discharged or migrated is 20. Out of the 550 cases, 331 are related to Tablighi Jamaat.
Text: Delhi reports 25 new coronavirus cases today, total rises to 550; death toll at 9 As many as 25 new coronavirus cases were reported in Delhi on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 550. The coronavirus death toll in Delhi stands at nine, while the number of patients who have been discharged or migrated is 20. Out of the 550 cases, 331 are related to Tablighi Jamaat.

Headline: 33 new coronavirus cases reported in Haryana, total reaches 129
Description: Haryana has reported 33 new cases of coronavirus, bringing the total number of cases in the state to 129, the state government said on Tuesday. The total number of positive cases includes two deaths and 17 people who have been discharged after recovery. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 4,789.
Text: 33 new coronavirus cases reported in Haryana, total reaches 129 Haryana has reported 33 new cases of coronavirus, bringing the total number of cases in the state to 129, the state government said on Tuesday. The total number of positive cases includes two deaths and 17 people who have been discharged after recovery. The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 4,789.

Headline: Telangana reports 40 new coronavirus cases, number of active cases rises to 348
Description: Telangana on Tuesday reported 40 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of active cases in the state to 348. The state has reported 11 deaths due to COVID-19 so far, and 45 people have been cured/discharged. Out of the 348 active cases in the state, the most number of cases have been reported from capital Hyderabad (150).
Text: Telangana reports 40 new coronavirus cases, number of active cases rises to 348 Telangana on Tuesday reported 40 new cases of coronavirus, taking the total number of active cases in the state to 348. The state has reported 11 deaths due to COVID-19 so far, and 45 people have been cured/discharged. Out of the 348 active cases in the state, the most number of cases have been reported from capital Hyderabad (150).

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh rises to 314: Govt
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has risen to 314, including 22 people who have completely recovered and have been discharged, UP Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan said on Tuesday. Out of the total 314 cases, more than 50% are people who are related to the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi, he added.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh rises to 314: Govt The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has risen to 314, including 22 people who have completely recovered and have been discharged, UP Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan said on Tuesday. Out of the total 314 cases, more than 50% are people who are related to the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi, he added.

Headline: Tamil Nadu reports 69 new COVID-19 cases taking total to 690
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu jumped to 690 on Tuesday after 69 more people tested positive. Chennai has the most number of cases at 149, followed by Coimbatore (60), Dindigul (45), Tirunelveli (38) and Erode (32). Further, State Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said three doctors are among those who have contracted coronavirus in the state.
Text: Tamil Nadu reports 69 new COVID-19 cases taking total to 690 The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu jumped to 690 on Tuesday after 69 more people tested positive. Chennai has the most number of cases at 149, followed by Coimbatore (60), Dindigul (45), Tirunelveli (38) and Erode (32). Further, State Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said three doctors are among those who have contracted coronavirus in the state.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in J&K rises to 125
Description: A total of 125 coronavirus cases have been reported in the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir, its government confirmed on Tuesday. Of these, 118 are active cases, whereas four people have recovered in the Union Territory so far, the government has said. Three people have died of coronavirus in Jammu and Kashmir.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in J&K rises to 125 A total of 125 coronavirus cases have been reported in the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir, its government confirmed on Tuesday. Of these, 118 are active cases, whereas four people have recovered in the Union Territory so far, the government has said. Three people have died of coronavirus in Jammu and Kashmir.

Headline: Police at Maha CM's home to be tested for COVID-19 after tea seller tests +ve
Description: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Tuesday said that police personnel deployed at CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree' will be tested for coronavirus infection. This comes after owner of a tea stall near the bungalow tested positive. "The policemen may have consumed tea from the stall. We will screen them and other staffers who were deployed there," Deshmukh said.
Text: Police at Maha CM's home to be tested for COVID-19 after tea seller tests +ve Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh on Tuesday said that police personnel deployed at CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree' will be tested for coronavirus infection. This comes after owner of a tea stall near the bungalow tested positive. "The policemen may have consumed tea from the stall. We will screen them and other staffers who were deployed there," Deshmukh said.

Headline: Won't slow down training people for Industry 4.0: Union Minister
Description: Union Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship Mahendra Nath Pandey has said that sectors such as aviation and hospitality will see sluggish growth due to coronavirus. Pandey added, "However, we don't intend to slow down the process of training and readying people especially in skills for Industry 4.0 that will gain more in importance once we get over this crisis."
Text: Won't slow down training people for Industry 4.0: Union Minister Union Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship Mahendra Nath Pandey has said that sectors such as aviation and hospitality will see sluggish growth due to coronavirus. Pandey added, "However, we don't intend to slow down the process of training and readying people especially in skills for Industry 4.0 that will gain more in importance once we get over this crisis."

Headline: West Bengal government identifies 7 COVID-19 hotspots in the state
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said her government has identified seven COVID-19 hotspots in the state and was taking necessary measures to break the cycle of transmission. The CM, however, did not reveal the names of the COVID-19 hotspots. "We are mulling the idea of allowing limited relaxations in some unorganized sectors," she added.
Text: West Bengal government identifies 7 COVID-19 hotspots in the state West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said her government has identified seven COVID-19 hotspots in the state and was taking necessary measures to break the cycle of transmission. The CM, however, did not reveal the names of the COVID-19 hotspots. "We are mulling the idea of allowing limited relaxations in some unorganized sectors," she added.

Headline: In a first, SpiceJet flight carries cargo on passenger seats from Delhi to Chennai
Description: SpiceJet operated India's first cargo-on-seat flight carrying vital supplies in the passenger cabin and belly space from Delhi to Chennai on Tuesday. The airline said that it deployed a Boeing 737 NG aircraft after taking due approvals from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) and the Ministry of Civil Aviation. The  flight carried 11 tons of vital supplies.
Text: In a first, SpiceJet flight carries cargo on passenger seats from Delhi to Chennai SpiceJet operated India's first cargo-on-seat flight carrying vital supplies in the passenger cabin and belly space from Delhi to Chennai on Tuesday. The airline said that it deployed a Boeing 737 NG aircraft after taking due approvals from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) and the Ministry of Civil Aviation. The  flight carried 11 tons of vital supplies.

Headline: Lockdown decision after April 14: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said that an appropriate decision on extending or ending the lockdown would be taken after April 14 following a review of the situation. Meanwhile, Maharashtra Home Minister said policemen deployed at Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree' would be tested for coronavirus. This comes after owner of a tea stall near the bungalow tested positive.
Text: Lockdown decision after April 14: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said that an appropriate decision on extending or ending the lockdown would be taken after April 14 following a review of the situation. Meanwhile, Maharashtra Home Minister said policemen deployed at Thackeray's private residence 'Matoshree' would be tested for coronavirus. This comes after owner of a tea stall near the bungalow tested positive.

Headline: Indian-American journalist dies of coronavirus in New York; PM Modi pays tribute
Description: Indian-American journalist Brahm Kanchibotla passes away due to coronavirus in New York after being hospitalised for nine days. Paying tribute, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "He will be remembered for his fine work and efforts to bring India and USA closer. Condolences to his family and friends. Om Shanti." The US has reported nearly 4 lakh coronavirus cases.
Text: Indian-American journalist dies of coronavirus in New York; PM Modi pays tribute Indian-American journalist Brahm Kanchibotla passes away due to coronavirus in New York after being hospitalised for nine days. Paying tribute, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "He will be remembered for his fine work and efforts to bring India and USA closer. Condolences to his family and friends. Om Shanti." The US has reported nearly 4 lakh coronavirus cases.

Headline: IRCTC suspends bookings for its 3 pvt trains till April 30 over COVID-19
Description: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has announced suspension of bookings for all three of its private passenger trains till April 30 amid coronavirus spread. The Varanasi-Indore Kashi Mahakal Express, the Lucknow-New Delhi Tejas Express and the Ahmedabad-Mumbai Tejas Express are cancelled till month-end. Passengers will be automatically refunded for booked tickets, said IRCTC.
Text: IRCTC suspends bookings for its 3 pvt trains till April 30 over COVID-19 Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has announced suspension of bookings for all three of its private passenger trains till April 30 amid coronavirus spread. The Varanasi-Indore Kashi Mahakal Express, the Lucknow-New Delhi Tejas Express and the Ahmedabad-Mumbai Tejas Express are cancelled till month-end. Passengers will be automatically refunded for booked tickets, said IRCTC.

Headline: Gujarat's youngest coronavirus patient passes away after liver and kidney failure
Description: A 14-month-old boy, the youngest COVID-19 patient in Gujarat, passed away in Jamnagar hospital late on Tuesday night. "The boy died of multiple organ failure," Jamnagar Collector Ravi Shankar said. The source of infection in the boy is still not known as previous tests conducted on his parents were found to be negative, Shankar added.
Text: Gujarat's youngest coronavirus patient passes away after liver and kidney failure A 14-month-old boy, the youngest COVID-19 patient in Gujarat, passed away in Jamnagar hospital late on Tuesday night. "The boy died of multiple organ failure," Jamnagar Collector Ravi Shankar said. The source of infection in the boy is still not known as previous tests conducted on his parents were found to be negative, Shankar added.

Headline: Be infected with coronavirus: Lawyer to Calcutta HC judge after unfavourable verdict
Description: The Calcutta High Court has initiated contempt proceedings against lawyer Bijoy Adhikary for cursing Justice Dipankar Datta that he be infected with coronavirus. The incident took place after the judge turned down the lawyer’s petition for urgent hearing of his case. Justice Datta said that Bijoy kept on shouting despite being given multiple warnings.
Text: Be infected with coronavirus: Lawyer to Calcutta HC judge after unfavourable verdict The Calcutta High Court has initiated contempt proceedings against lawyer Bijoy Adhikary for cursing Justice Dipankar Datta that he be infected with coronavirus. The incident took place after the judge turned down the lawyer’s petition for urgent hearing of his case. Justice Datta said that Bijoy kept on shouting despite being given multiple warnings.

Headline: India conducts its most coronavirus tests in a day, 285 test +ve out of 12,584
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has announced that 12,584 samples were tested for coronavirus in India today, which is the highest number of tests conducted in one day so far. It added that out of all samples tested today, 285 turned out as positive. A total of 1,14,015 samples have been tested as on April 7, 9 pm.
Text: India conducts its most coronavirus tests in a day, 285 test +ve out of 12,584 The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has announced that 12,584 samples were tested for coronavirus in India today, which is the highest number of tests conducted in one day so far. It added that out of all samples tested today, 285 turned out as positive. A total of 1,14,015 samples have been tested as on April 7, 9 pm.

Headline: 2 Tablighi members booked under attempt to murder charge in Uttarakhand
Description: Two members of the Tablighi Jamaat were booked under attempt to murder charge in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Tuesday after they allegedly avoided getting themselves tested for coronavirus. "Their friend had tested COVID-19 positive. Still, they deliberately hid from the administration...despite repeated appeals and warnings," a police official said. Both had recently returned from Rajasthan's Alwar.
Text: 2 Tablighi members booked under attempt to murder charge in Uttarakhand Two members of the Tablighi Jamaat were booked under attempt to murder charge in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Tuesday after they allegedly avoided getting themselves tested for coronavirus. "Their friend had tested COVID-19 positive. Still, they deliberately hid from the administration...despite repeated appeals and warnings," a police official said. Both had recently returned from Rajasthan's Alwar.

Headline: Nurse, technician at Mumbai hospital test +ve, all staffers to be tested
Description: Authorities at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai have initiated testing for all staffers after a nurse and a technician tested positive for coronavirus. Officials from the BMC said they were awaiting test results before they decide to declare the hospital a containment zone. Notably, in the last week, Wockhardt hospital, Jaslok hospital and Sai hospital have been declared containment zones.
Text: Nurse, technician at Mumbai hospital test +ve, all staffers to be tested Authorities at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai have initiated testing for all staffers after a nurse and a technician tested positive for coronavirus. Officials from the BMC said they were awaiting test results before they decide to declare the hospital a containment zone. Notably, in the last week, Wockhardt hospital, Jaslok hospital and Sai hospital have been declared containment zones.

Headline: 5 cr of total 7.5 cr population of Rajasthan screened for COVID-19: CM
Description: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that five crore out of the state's total population of 7.5 crore people have been screened for COVID-19. "We've made control rooms at state-level for monitoring. I'm personally monitoring the situation," said Gehlot. "15,000 tests have been done in different districts," he said, adding that tests have been conducted on 66% population of the state.
Text: 5 cr of total 7.5 cr population of Rajasthan screened for COVID-19: CM Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that five crore out of the state's total population of 7.5 crore people have been screened for COVID-19. "We've made control rooms at state-level for monitoring. I'm personally monitoring the situation," said Gehlot. "15,000 tests have been done in different districts," he said, adding that tests have been conducted on 66% population of the state.

Headline: Coronavirus lockdown can only be lifted in phases: Rajasthan CM
Description: Addressing a Congress press conference through video conferencing, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said that the lockdown can only be withdrawn in phases and not in one go. Gehlot added, "Everything is shut because of the lockdown. You can understand where we are heading economically. The entire country is worried... but saving lives is also very important."
Text: Coronavirus lockdown can only be lifted in phases: Rajasthan CM Addressing a Congress press conference through video conferencing, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday said that the lockdown can only be withdrawn in phases and not in one go. Gehlot added, "Everything is shut because of the lockdown. You can understand where we are heading economically. The entire country is worried... but saving lives is also very important."

Headline: Super Pink Moon visible across several parts of India, pics surface
Description: The Super Pink Moon, the biggest and brightest full moon of 2020, was visible across several parts of India including Delhi and Ludhiana on Tuesday. Although full moons appear every month, this is particularly different as it coincides with a 'Supermoon', making it appear bigger than a usual full moon. The Super Pink Moon will appear till Thursday.
Text: Super Pink Moon visible across several parts of India, pics surface The Super Pink Moon, the biggest and brightest full moon of 2020, was visible across several parts of India including Delhi and Ludhiana on Tuesday. Although full moons appear every month, this is particularly different as it coincides with a 'Supermoon', making it appear bigger than a usual full moon. The Super Pink Moon will appear till Thursday.

Headline: Govt is not issuing any red tick marks on WhatsApp, viral message fake: PIB
Description: The Press Information Bureau has clarified that the government is not issuing any red tick marks on WhatsApp on the lines of blue tick marks. A message that had gone viral stated that three red tick marks would mean government has initiated action and the user will receive summons from court. The government called the viral message 'fake'.
Text: Govt is not issuing any red tick marks on WhatsApp, viral message fake: PIB The Press Information Bureau has clarified that the government is not issuing any red tick marks on WhatsApp on the lines of blue tick marks. A message that had gone viral stated that three red tick marks would mean government has initiated action and the user will receive summons from court. The government called the viral message 'fake'.

Headline: UP man claims he has found coronavirus cure, gets arrested
Description: A man was arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia for allegedly claiming to have found a cure for coronavirus, the police said on Tuesday. The man was claiming before villagers that he had made medicine to cure coronavirus. The police said a case was registered against him under relevant sections of IPC.
Text: UP man claims he has found coronavirus cure, gets arrested A man was arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia for allegedly claiming to have found a cure for coronavirus, the police said on Tuesday. The man was claiming before villagers that he had made medicine to cure coronavirus. The police said a case was registered against him under relevant sections of IPC.

Headline: Lockdown Dharavi to prevent it from becoming COVID-19 hotspot: Sena MP to CM
Description: Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale urged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to completely lockdown Mumbai's Dharavi in order to prevent it from becoming a COVID-19 hotspot. "The spread of COVID-19 can be very fast there due to the congestion," he said. Mumbai Police is making a good effort but no one is listening as they are less in number, Shewale added.
Text: Lockdown Dharavi to prevent it from becoming COVID-19 hotspot: Sena MP to CM Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale urged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to completely lockdown Mumbai's Dharavi in order to prevent it from becoming a COVID-19 hotspot. "The spread of COVID-19 can be very fast there due to the congestion," he said. Mumbai Police is making a good effort but no one is listening as they are less in number, Shewale added.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab rise to 99; 256 test results awaited
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab has risen to 99 after eight patients tested positive in Pathankot and Moga today. As many as 2,559 samples have been tested in Punjab, out of which 2,204 have returned negative and 256 results are awaited. There are 79 active cases in the state, while the death toll stands at eight.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab rise to 99; 256 test results awaited The total number of coronavirus cases in Punjab has risen to 99 after eight patients tested positive in Pathankot and Moga today. As many as 2,559 samples have been tested in Punjab, out of which 2,204 have returned negative and 256 results are awaited. There are 79 active cases in the state, while the death toll stands at eight.

Headline: What is 'Bhilwara Model' that led to a significant drop in COVID-19 cases?
Description: Rajasthan's Bhilwara, which reported over 25 coronavirus cases, has witnessed a significant drop in cases after the government adopted a strategy, now called 'Bhilwara Model'. Bhilwara was completely isolated and around 2,000 teams screened 28 lakh people via door-to-door campaign. 'Maha curfew' has been imposed from April 3-13, wherein people can't step out and essentials are sent to homes.
Text: What is 'Bhilwara Model' that led to a significant drop in COVID-19 cases? Rajasthan's Bhilwara, which reported over 25 coronavirus cases, has witnessed a significant drop in cases after the government adopted a strategy, now called 'Bhilwara Model'. Bhilwara was completely isolated and around 2,000 teams screened 28 lakh people via door-to-door campaign. 'Maha curfew' has been imposed from April 3-13, wherein people can't step out and essentials are sent to homes.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India rises to 124, total cases reach 4,789
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to 124, according to the latest update by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The total number of cases has risen to 4,789, while the number of active cases stands at 4,312. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 353.
Text: Coronavirus death toll in India rises to 124, total cases reach 4,789 The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to 124, according to the latest update by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The total number of cases has risen to 4,789, while the number of active cases stands at 4,312. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 353.

Headline: How does India's coronavirus growth curve compare to other countries?
Description: India's coronavirus growth curve has steepened over the last week. According to 'Our World in Data' website, India's curve is still flatter as compared to US, which has reported over 368,000 cases and nearly 11,000 deaths. India's curve is also flatter as compared to Italy and Spain. However, it is steeper than other Asian countries such as Singapore and Japan.
Text: How does India's coronavirus growth curve compare to other countries? India's coronavirus growth curve has steepened over the last week. According to 'Our World in Data' website, India's curve is still flatter as compared to US, which has reported over 368,000 cases and nearly 11,000 deaths. India's curve is also flatter as compared to Italy and Spain. However, it is steeper than other Asian countries such as Singapore and Japan.

Headline: Assam MLA held for alleged communal remarks on COVID-19 quarantine centres
Description: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA from Assam Aminul Islam was arrested for making communal and false remarks on coronavirus quarantine facilities in the state, said police on Tuesday. Islam made the alleged remarks in an audio clip that surfaced on social media. The MLA has admitted to making and forwarding the clip, said Gaurav Abhijit Dilip, SP, Nagaon.
Text: Assam MLA held for alleged communal remarks on COVID-19 quarantine centres All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA from Assam Aminul Islam was arrested for making communal and false remarks on coronavirus quarantine facilities in the state, said police on Tuesday. Islam made the alleged remarks in an audio clip that surfaced on social media. The MLA has admitted to making and forwarding the clip, said Gaurav Abhijit Dilip, SP, Nagaon.

Headline: No decision on extending lockdown as yet, please don't speculate: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said no decision on extending lockdown has been taken yet, adding that media should not speculate. "Honourable Supreme Court had earlier ordered media not to publish any information unless verified...Whatever decision will be taken based on available facts...we'll bring it to your notice," he further told media.
Text: No decision on extending lockdown as yet, please don't speculate: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said no decision on extending lockdown has been taken yet, adding that media should not speculate. "Honourable Supreme Court had earlier ordered media not to publish any information unless verified...Whatever decision will be taken based on available facts...we'll bring it to your notice," he further told media.

Headline: Amnesty urges Assam to free detention camp inmates amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Amnesty International India (AII) on Monday urged Assam government to immediately release those declared foreigners and held in six detention centres across the state, amid coronavirus spread. "Migration status is and must be irrelevant to every human being's dignity and their right to live," said AII Executive Director Avinash Kumar. Detainees face heightened risk of infection, said Kumar.
Text: Amnesty urges Assam to free detention camp inmates amid COVID-19 spread Amnesty International India (AII) on Monday urged Assam government to immediately release those declared foreigners and held in six detention centres across the state, amid coronavirus spread. "Migration status is and must be irrelevant to every human being's dignity and their right to live," said AII Executive Director Avinash Kumar. Detainees face heightened risk of infection, said Kumar.

Headline: Uttarakhand Police hire artist to dress as 'Yamraj' to ask people to stay home
Description: Uttarakhand Police have hired a theatre artist to dress up as 'Yamraj' to create awareness about coronavirus in Haridwar and to request people to stay inside their homes during lockdown. "Yamraj helps people to understand the seriousness of this crisis and why they should not venture out and flirt with the deadly virus," said Haridwar SSP Senthil Avoodai K Raj.
Text: Uttarakhand Police hire artist to dress as 'Yamraj' to ask people to stay home Uttarakhand Police have hired a theatre artist to dress up as 'Yamraj' to create awareness about coronavirus in Haridwar and to request people to stay inside their homes during lockdown. "Yamraj helps people to understand the seriousness of this crisis and why they should not venture out and flirt with the deadly virus," said Haridwar SSP Senthil Avoodai K Raj.

Headline: They threatened to pelt stones: Health staff allegedly abused in Ujjain
Description: A team of healthcare workers who went to conduct a medical survey amid coronavirus spread were allegedly threatened and verbally abused by residents in Ujjain, MP. "They told us they won't share information. When we told them it's for their own protection, they threatened to pelt stones at us if we come again," said one of the health professionals.
Text: They threatened to pelt stones: Health staff allegedly abused in Ujjain A team of healthcare workers who went to conduct a medical survey amid coronavirus spread were allegedly threatened and verbally abused by residents in Ujjain, MP. "They told us they won't share information. When we told them it's for their own protection, they threatened to pelt stones at us if we come again," said one of the health professionals.

Headline: IIT-G develops LED-based device for sanitising floors amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati (IIT-G) has created a UVC LED-based device to sanitise floors of homes, hospitals, buses etc. amid coronavirus spread. UVC is a technology to sanitise microorganism infected non-porous surfaces and can achieve 90% killing rate, said Dr Senthilmurugan Subbiah, who led the research. The device, when commercialised, may be available for ₹1,000, reported PTI.
Text: IIT-G develops LED-based device for sanitising floors amid COVID-19 spread Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati (IIT-G) has created a UVC LED-based device to sanitise floors of homes, hospitals, buses etc. amid coronavirus spread. UVC is a technology to sanitise microorganism infected non-porous surfaces and can achieve 90% killing rate, said Dr Senthilmurugan Subbiah, who led the research. The device, when commercialised, may be available for ₹1,000, reported PTI.

Headline: What is a rapid antibody test for coronavirus?
Description: When a person gets infected by a virus or any other pathogen, the body reacts to it and produces antibodies. Rapid antibody tests measure the level of certain immunoglobulins, or antibodies, in the blood and it can be done using a fingerprick. A patient who couldn't get tested earlier or self-recovered can be identified with an antibody test.
Text: What is a rapid antibody test for coronavirus? When a person gets infected by a virus or any other pathogen, the body reacts to it and produces antibodies. Rapid antibody tests measure the level of certain immunoglobulins, or antibodies, in the blood and it can be done using a fingerprick. A patient who couldn't get tested earlier or self-recovered can be identified with an antibody test.

Headline: What are the 3 types of 'COVID Dedicated Facilities' proposed by the govt?
Description: The government has proposed 3 types of 'COVID Dedicated Facilities'- COVID Care Centre (CCC), Dedicated COVID Health Centre (DCHC) and Dedicated COVID Hospital (DCH). CCCs are makeshift facilities proposed to offer care for cases clinically assigned as mild, very mild or COVID-19 suspect cases. DCHC shall offer care for 'moderate' cases, whereas DCH shall offer care primarily for 'severe' cases.
Text: What are the 3 types of 'COVID Dedicated Facilities' proposed by the govt? The government has proposed 3 types of 'COVID Dedicated Facilities'- COVID Care Centre (CCC), Dedicated COVID Health Centre (DCHC) and Dedicated COVID Hospital (DCH). CCCs are makeshift facilities proposed to offer care for cases clinically assigned as mild, very mild or COVID-19 suspect cases. DCHC shall offer care for 'moderate' cases, whereas DCH shall offer care primarily for 'severe' cases.

Headline: COVID-19 war can't be won by clapping, lighting lamps: Shiv Sena
Description: Shiv Sena on Tuesday said the war against coronavirus cannot be won by clapping, clanging of plates or lighting of lamps. An editorial in Sena's mouthpiece 'Saamana' said, "Citizens misconstrued the Prime Minister's appeal...either the PM cannot communicate with citizens or he himself wants such a festive atmosphere." It further said that those who don't obey orders should be punished.
Text: COVID-19 war can't be won by clapping, lighting lamps: Shiv Sena Shiv Sena on Tuesday said the war against coronavirus cannot be won by clapping, clanging of plates or lighting of lamps. An editorial in Sena's mouthpiece 'Saamana' said, "Citizens misconstrued the Prime Minister's appeal...either the PM cannot communicate with citizens or he himself wants such a festive atmosphere." It further said that those who don't obey orders should be punished.

Headline: CATastrophe' averted: HC allows man to go out to buy food for cats amid lockdown
Description: The Kerala High Court on Monday allowed a cat owner to go out to buy food for his cats amid the coronavirus lockdown. "We helped avoid a CATastrophe in the petitioner's home," said the court order. The cat-owner had filed a petition in the Kerala High Court, challenging the refusal by police to issue vehicle pass for buying pet food.
Text: CATastrophe' averted: HC allows man to go out to buy food for cats amid lockdown The Kerala High Court on Monday allowed a cat owner to go out to buy food for his cats amid the coronavirus lockdown. "We helped avoid a CATastrophe in the petitioner's home," said the court order. The cat-owner had filed a petition in the Kerala High Court, challenging the refusal by police to issue vehicle pass for buying pet food.

Headline: India's 1st drive-through COVID-19 testing facility opens in Delhi, test costs ₹4,500
Description: India's first drive-through coronavirus testing facility was opened on Monday in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area. A private lab, charging ₹4,500 per test, has turned a 30-40 metre-long stretch into drive-through premises and only one car is allowed inside at a time. The process takes less than 30 minutes and reports are made available online within 36 hours.
Text: India's 1st drive-through COVID-19 testing facility opens in Delhi, test costs ₹4,500  India's first drive-through coronavirus testing facility was opened on Monday in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area. A private lab, charging ₹4,500 per test, has turned a 30-40 metre-long stretch into drive-through premises and only one car is allowed inside at a time. The process takes less than 30 minutes and reports are made available online within 36 hours.

Headline: COVID-19 tracker app 'Aarogya Setu' is not a surveillance app, clarifies govt
Description: After a newspaper article claimed that the COVID-19 tracker app 'Aarogya Setu' is a surveillance app, government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) refuted the claim. "This is baseless, the app does not link user location & data with any sensitive personal data," PIB tweeted. "Also, it does not make users vulnerable to hacking," it added.
Text: COVID-19 tracker app 'Aarogya Setu' is not a surveillance app, clarifies govt After a newspaper article claimed that the COVID-19 tracker app 'Aarogya Setu' is a surveillance app, government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) refuted the claim. "This is baseless, the app does not link user location & data with any sensitive personal data," PIB tweeted. "Also, it does not make users vulnerable to hacking," it added.

Headline: 1 COVID-19 patient can infect 406 in 30 days if he doesn't follow lockdown: Govt
Description: Lav Agarwal, the Joint Secretary of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday said, "ICMR suggests that one COVID-19 patient can infect around 406 people in 30 days if he/she doesn't follow lockdown and social distancing rules." "If social exposure is reduced by 75% then the same person can infect only 2.5 people," he added.
Text: 1 COVID-19 patient can infect 406 in 30 days if he doesn't follow lockdown: Govt Lav Agarwal, the Joint Secretary of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Tuesday said, "ICMR suggests that one COVID-19 patient can infect around 406 people in 30 days if he/she doesn't follow lockdown and social distancing rules." "If social exposure is reduced by 75% then the same person can infect only 2.5 people," he added.

Headline: Maharashtra becomes first state to report over 1,000 coronavirus cases
Description: As many as 150 more coronavirus cases have been reported in Maharashtra on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,018. With this, Maharashtra became the first state to report over 1,000 cases. Out of the 150 cases today, 116 were reported in Mumbai alone, taking the city's total to 642.
Text: Maharashtra becomes first state to report over 1,000 coronavirus cases As many as 150 more coronavirus cases have been reported in Maharashtra on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 1,018. With this, Maharashtra became the first state to report over 1,000 cases. Out of the 150 cases today, 116 were reported in Mumbai alone, taking the city's total to 642.

Headline: Not an expert body on management of poor workers amid lockdown: SC
Description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that it is not an expert body on dealing with health and management issues of migrant workers arising out of the 21-day coronavirus lockdown. "We don't plan to supplant wisdom of the government with our wisdom," said SC. The government will be asked to create a helpline for complaints in this regard, it added.
Text: Not an expert body on management of poor workers amid lockdown: SC The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that it is not an expert body on dealing with health and management issues of migrant workers arising out of the 21-day coronavirus lockdown. "We don't plan to supplant wisdom of the government with our wisdom," said SC. The government will be asked to create a helpline for complaints in this regard, it added.

Headline: Dhoni hardly took business class, used to sit with TV crew in economy: Gavaskar
Description: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has revealed that MS Dhoni hardly used to take business class during India's home international season. He added, "The flight also carries technical TV crew who have to rig cables for the next game....Dhoni as a captain would prefer to sit with the real champs of the TV coverage, the cameramen and the sound engineers."
Text: Dhoni hardly took business class, used to sit with TV crew in economy: Gavaskar Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has revealed that MS Dhoni hardly used to take business class during India's home international season. He added, "The flight also carries technical TV crew who have to rig cables for the next game....Dhoni as a captain would prefer to sit with the real champs of the TV coverage, the cameramen and the sound engineers."

Headline: CBSE to introduce 3 new subjects including Artificial Intelligence for Class 11
Description: The CBSE will introduce Design-thinking, Physical Activity Trainer and Artificial Intelligence as new subjects for Class 11 from 2020-21 session. "The 21st century's requirement is of critical thinking and problem-solving," a CBSE official said on Design-thinking. Physical Activity Trainer will not only help in developing skills of a trainer but will also develop a life skill, the official added.
Text: CBSE to introduce 3 new subjects including Artificial Intelligence for Class 11 The CBSE will introduce Design-thinking, Physical Activity Trainer and Artificial Intelligence as new subjects for Class 11 from 2020-21 session. "The 21st century's requirement is of critical thinking and problem-solving," a CBSE official said on Design-thinking. Physical Activity Trainer will not only help in developing skills of a trainer but will also develop a life skill, the official added.

Headline: Rajasthan HC quashes FIR against Twitter CEO over pic with anti-Brahmin poster
Description: The Rajasthan High Court on Tuesday quashed the FIR filed against Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and disposed of the plea for his arrest that alleged he hurt the Brahmin community's sentiments by posing with an offensive poster. The picture of Twitter CEO with the poster, taken during his India visit in 2018, was criticised after it surfaced on social media.
Text: Rajasthan HC quashes FIR against Twitter CEO over pic with anti-Brahmin poster The Rajasthan High Court on Tuesday quashed the FIR filed against Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and disposed of the plea for his arrest that alleged he hurt the Brahmin community's sentiments by posing with an offensive poster. The picture of Twitter CEO with the poster, taken during his India visit in 2018, was criticised after it surfaced on social media.

Headline: What was the region-wise fall in power demand during Sunday's lights-off event?
Description: Preliminary data released by national grid operator POSOCO has shown that northern India's power demand fell almost twice as steeply as in the south during the lights-off event on April 5. Power demand fell as much as 26% in the western region. The country's overall power demand plunged as much as 26.6% during the period to 85,799 megawatts.
Text: What was the region-wise fall in power demand during Sunday's lights-off event? Preliminary data released by national grid operator POSOCO has shown that northern India's power demand fell almost twice as steeply as in the south during the lights-off event on April 5. Power demand fell as much as 26% in the western region. The country's overall power demand plunged as much as 26.6% during the period to 85,799 megawatts.

Headline: 8 from Kyrgyzstan booked in Karnataka for violating visa rules
Description: Karnataka police have booked a case under Section 14 of the Foreigners Act, 1946 against eight people from Kyrgyzstan for violating visa rules, said Bidar Superintendent of Police Nagesh DL on Tuesday. "They had come here on a tourist visa but they are reported to be engaged in religious activities here," said Nagesh DL.
Text: 8 from Kyrgyzstan booked in Karnataka for violating visa rules Karnataka police have booked a case under Section 14 of the Foreigners Act, 1946 against eight people from Kyrgyzstan for violating visa rules, said Bidar Superintendent of Police Nagesh DL on Tuesday. "They had come here on a tourist visa but they are reported to be engaged in religious activities here," said Nagesh DL.

Headline: Go Corona Go' has become world-famous slogan now: Ramdas Athawale
Description: Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale has claimed that 'Go Corona Go' slogan has now become world-famous. "I gave the slogan in February when COVID-19 situation wasn't [bad] in India," he added. "At that time people were saying, 'will this make corona go away?' Now we're seeing this slogan all across the world," Athawale further said.
Text: Go Corona Go' has become world-famous slogan now: Ramdas Athawale Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale has claimed that 'Go Corona Go' slogan has now become world-famous. "I gave the slogan in February when COVID-19 situation wasn't [bad] in India," he added. "At that time people were saying, 'will this make corona go away?' Now we're seeing this slogan all across the world," Athawale further said.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 27 new coronavirus cases, state total rises to 328
Description: Rajasthan reported 27 new coronavirus cases till 2 pm on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 328. Out of the 27 fresh cases reported today, Jodhpur reported nine cases, Jaisalmer and Banswara reported seven cases each, Jaipur reported three cases and one case was reported in Churu. Over 15,650 samples were collected in the state.
Text: Rajasthan reports 27 new coronavirus cases, state total rises to 328 Rajasthan reported 27 new coronavirus cases till 2 pm on Tuesday, taking the total number of cases in the state to 328. Out of the 27 fresh cases reported today, Jodhpur reported nine cases, Jaisalmer and Banswara reported seven cases each, Jaipur reported three cases and one case was reported in Churu. Over 15,650 samples were collected in the state.

Headline: Placed orders for rapid tests of 1 lakh people in Delhi: CM Arvind Kejriwal
Description: Announcing the strategy to contain the spread of coronavirus, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "We have placed orders for the rapid test of 1,00,000 people. The deliveries of kits will begin by Friday." The CM further added that random tests will be done at hotspots and detailed tests will also be done.
Text: Placed orders for rapid tests of 1 lakh people in Delhi: CM Arvind Kejriwal Announcing the strategy to contain the spread of coronavirus, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "We have placed orders for the rapid test of 1,00,000 people. The deliveries of kits will begin by Friday." The CM further added that random tests will be done at hotspots and detailed tests will also be done.

Headline: 5 countries have reported 62% of the global coronavirus cases
Description: Five countries including the US, Spain, Italy, Germany and France have reported 62% of the global coronavirus cases, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US has reported over 368,400 cases, while Spain and Italy have reported over 136,600 and 132,500 cases respectively. Germany has reported more than 103,300, and the number of cases in France stands at nearly 99,000.
Text: 5 countries have reported 62% of the global coronavirus cases Five countries including the US, Spain, Italy, Germany and France have reported 62% of the global coronavirus cases, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US has reported over 368,400 cases, while Spain and Italy have reported over 136,600 and 132,500 cases respectively. Germany has reported more than 103,300, and the number of cases in France stands at nearly 99,000.

Headline: 354 new coronavirus cases, 8 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said that 354 coronavirus cases and 8 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that a total of 4,421 cases of coronavirus and 117 deaths have been confirmed in India so far. Further, 326 COVID-19 patients in India have recovered till now.
Text: 354 new coronavirus cases, 8 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Tuesday said that 354 coronavirus cases and 8 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that a total of 4,421 cases of coronavirus and 117 deaths have been confirmed in India so far. Further, 326 COVID-19 patients in India have recovered till now.

Headline: ₹50L insurance cover for police, health workers fighting COVID-19: MP govt
Description: The Madhya Pradesh government has announced a ₹50 lakh insurance cover for all those engaged in the treatment of coronavirus infected persons. The state government will provide the insurance cover to all those personnel from the police, revenue, urban development departments and health department. So far, over 250 COVID-19 cases have been reported in the state.
Text: ₹50L insurance cover for police, health workers fighting COVID-19: MP govt The Madhya Pradesh government has announced a ₹50 lakh insurance cover for all those engaged in the treatment of coronavirus infected persons. The state government will provide the insurance cover to all those personnel from the police, revenue, urban development departments and health department. So far, over 250 COVID-19 cases have been reported in the state.

Headline: Sensex registers biggest single-day gain since 2009, rises 8.97%
Description: Indian equity benchmark Sensex registered its biggest single-day gain since 2009 surging 8.97% or 2,476 points on Tuesday led by gains in financial stocks. Sensex closed at 30,067 while Nifty 50 closed 8.76% higher at 8,792. IndusInd Bank was the top gainer on both the indices, jumping 25% after it reported a rise in retail deposits and advances on Monday.
Text: Sensex registers biggest single-day gain since 2009, rises 8.97% Indian equity benchmark Sensex registered its biggest single-day gain since 2009 surging 8.97% or 2,476 points on Tuesday led by gains in financial stocks. Sensex closed at 30,067 while Nifty 50 closed 8.76% higher at 8,792. IndusInd Bank was the top gainer on both the indices, jumping 25% after it reported a rise in retail deposits and advances on Monday.

Headline: 150 Tablighi Jamaat members booked for violating quarantine orders in Mumbai
Description: An FIR has been registered against 150 Tablighi Jamaat members for violating quarantine and official preventive orders in Mumbai, police said. The FIR was registered at Azad Maidan police station under Sections 271 and 188 of Indian Penal Code (IPC). The Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi emerged as COVID-19 hotspot after several cases from across India were linked to it.
Text: 150 Tablighi Jamaat members booked for violating quarantine orders in Mumbai An FIR has been registered against 150 Tablighi Jamaat members for violating quarantine and official preventive orders in Mumbai, police said. The FIR was registered at Azad Maidan police station under Sections 271 and 188 of Indian Penal Code (IPC).
