Description: The Cabinet today approved Ordinance amending the Salary, Allowances and Pension of Members of Parliament Act, 1954, reducing allowances and pension of MPs, PM and ministers by 30% with effect from April 1, 2020 for a year. The President, Vice President, Governors have also voluntarily decided to take a  30% pay cut for one year, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar announced.
Text: All MPs, PM, President, Vice President to take 30% salary cut for 1 year The Cabinet today approved Ordinance amending the Salary, Allowances and Pension of Members of Parliament Act, 1954, reducing allowances and pension of MPs, PM and ministers by 30% with effect from April 1, 2020 for a year. The President, Vice President, Governors have also voluntarily decided to take a  30% pay cut for one year, Union Minister Prakash Javadekar announced.

Headline: 5 soldiers martyred in operation against terrorists along LoC in J&K
Description: Two more soldiers of the Indian Army were martyred as the force foiled an infiltration bid along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district in an operation in which five terrorists were killed on Sunday. With the latest casualties, five soldiers have been martyred after three soldiers lost their lives on Sunday.
Text: 5 soldiers martyred in operation against terrorists along LoC in J&K Two more soldiers of the Indian Army were martyred as the force foiled an infiltration bid along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district in an operation in which five terrorists were killed on Sunday. With the latest casualties, five soldiers have been martyred after three soldiers lost their lives on Sunday.

Headline: PM Modi chairs meeting of Council of Ministers via video link
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday chaired a meeting of Council of Ministers via video conferencing. Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh were also in attendance at the meeting. This came shortly after the Prime Minister gave an address on the occasion of the 40th foundation day of the Bharatiya Janata Party earlier in the day.
Text: PM Modi chairs meeting of Council of Ministers via video link Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday chaired a meeting of Council of Ministers via video conferencing. Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh were also in attendance at the meeting. This came shortly after the Prime Minister gave an address on the occasion of the 40th foundation day of the Bharatiya Janata Party earlier in the day.

Headline: Anurag Srivastava replaces Raveesh Kumar as MEA spokesperson
Description: Diplomat Anurag Srivastava on Monday took charge as spokesperson of Ministry of External Affairs, succeeding Raveesh Kumar. Srivastava, a 1999-batch IFS officer, was serving as India's Ambassador to Ethiopia. "Honoured and privileged to take over as Official Spokesperson of @MEAIndia. I look forward to working closely with all to fulfil my responsibilities in this new role," Srivastava tweeted.
Text: Anurag Srivastava replaces Raveesh Kumar as MEA spokesperson Diplomat Anurag Srivastava on Monday took charge as spokesperson of Ministry of External Affairs, succeeding Raveesh Kumar. Srivastava, a 1999-batch IFS officer, was serving as India's Ambassador to Ethiopia. "Honoured and privileged to take over as Official Spokesperson of @MEAIndia. I look forward to working closely with all to fulfil my responsibilities in this new role," Srivastava tweeted.

Headline: I'm stuck in a village in Bihar amid lockdown: Actress Ratan
Description: Actress Ratan Raajputh recently revealed she is stuck in a village in Bihar due to nationwide lockdown. Ratan shared that she has to brush, bathe, wash clothes and utensils in a bathroom as it's the only place with water supply. Urging people to stay indoors amid coronavirus pandemic, Ratan said, "If I can [self-quarantine] in such conditions, so can you."
Text: I'm stuck in a village in Bihar amid lockdown: Actress Ratan Actress Ratan Raajputh recently revealed she is stuck in a village in Bihar due to nationwide lockdown. Ratan shared that she has to brush, bathe, wash clothes and utensils in a bathroom as it's the only place with water supply. Urging people to stay indoors amid coronavirus pandemic, Ratan said, "If I can [self-quarantine] in such conditions, so can you."

Headline: I am away from home, haven't seen dad in 3 weeks: Salman
Description: Salman Khan in a recent video revealed that he, along with his nephew, is away from home due to the nationwide lockdown and haven't seen their respective fathers for the last three weeks. He further advised people not to be brave but fear the coronavirus and stay indoors. "We are scared. And we bravely say that we're scared," Salman added.
Text: I am away from home, haven't seen dad in 3 weeks: Salman Salman Khan in a recent video revealed that he, along with his nephew, is away from home due to the nationwide lockdown and haven't seen their respective fathers for the last three weeks. He further advised people not to be brave but fear the coronavirus and stay indoors. "We are scared. And we bravely say that we're scared," Salman added.

Headline: Who gave permission for Nizamuddin Tablighi event?: Sharad Pawar
Description: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday asked who gave permission for the Tablighi Jamaat's March event at Nizamuddin in Delhi which is linked to a large number of coronavirus cases in India. Pawar pointed out that Maharashtra government earlier denied permission for a similar event. He also criticised 'media hype' of the Nizamuddin event, saying it targeted one community.
Text: Who gave permission for Nizamuddin Tablighi event?: Sharad Pawar NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday asked who gave permission for the Tablighi Jamaat's March event at Nizamuddin in Delhi which is linked to a large number of coronavirus cases in India. Pawar pointed out that Maharashtra government earlier denied permission for a similar event. He also criticised 'media hype' of the Nizamuddin event, saying it targeted one community.

Headline: Aurangabad doctors protest over masks, PPE amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Resident doctors of Government Medical College and Hospital, Aurangabad, Maharashtra protested outside Dean's office on Sunday demanding Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and N95 masks amid coronavirus spread. The doctors said they will stay quarantined in hostels if safety equipment is not provided. After the protest, the emergency ward doctors were provided PPE and N95 masks on Sunday.
Text: Aurangabad doctors protest over masks, PPE amid COVID-19 spread Resident doctors of Government Medical College and Hospital, Aurangabad, Maharashtra protested outside Dean's office on Sunday demanding Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and N95 masks amid coronavirus spread. The doctors said they will stay quarantined in hostels if safety equipment is not provided. After the protest, the emergency ward doctors were provided PPE and N95 masks on Sunday.

Headline: Announce packages to help farmers, working class: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM
Description: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Monday urged Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa over a telephonic conversation to announce a special package to help farmers, agriculture labourers and the working class affected by the lockdown. Yediyurappa responded that he will formulate a programme keeping in mind the suggestions, the CMO said. Over 150 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the state so far.
Text: Announce packages to help farmers, working class: Siddaramaiah to K'taka CM Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Monday urged Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa over a telephonic conversation to announce a special package to help farmers, agriculture labourers and the working class affected by the lockdown. Yediyurappa responded that he will formulate a programme keeping in mind the suggestions, the CMO said. Over 150 COVID-19 cases have been recorded in the state so far.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India cross 4,000; death toll surpasses 100
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Monday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 4,067. Meanwhile, 109 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 3,666 cases are active, while 292 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 66 foreign nationals.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India cross 4,000; death toll surpasses 100 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare announced on Monday that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 4,067. Meanwhile, 109 people have died due to coronavirus in the country. Out of the total cases, 3,666 cases are active, while 292 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated. The cases also include 66 foreign nationals.

Headline: 176 FIRs filed based on phone tracking for violating home quarantine: Delhi Police
Description: Delhi Police on Monday said around 198 FIRs have been registered over violation of home quarantine orders. These were filed on the basis of complaints by neighbours or family members as well as phone tracking. "At least 176 FIRs were lodged solely on the basis of phone tracking and surprise physical visits," the statement by Delhi Police further read.
Text: 176 FIRs filed based on phone tracking for violating home quarantine: Delhi Police Delhi Police on Monday said around 198 FIRs have been registered over violation of home quarantine orders. These were filed on the basis of complaints by neighbours or family members as well as phone tracking. "At least 176 FIRs were lodged solely on the basis of phone tracking and surprise physical visits," the statement by Delhi Police further read.

Headline: Students of classes 1 to 8 in Haryana to be promoted without final exams: CM
Description: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said school students from classes 1 to 8 will be promoted to next class without final examinations as the schools are closed due to lockdown. Class 10 science examination hasn't been conducted so the students will be promoted to Class 11 on the basis of average marks obtained in other subjects, Khattar added.
Text: Students of classes 1 to 8 in Haryana to be promoted without final exams: CM Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said school students from classes 1 to 8 will be promoted to next class without final examinations as the schools are closed due to lockdown. Class 10 science examination hasn't been conducted so the students will be promoted to Class 11 on the basis of average marks obtained in other subjects, Khattar added.

Headline: It is a long war, don't get tired as we have to win it: PM Modi on coronavirus
Description: Stating that the war against the coronavirus outbreak will be a long one, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said, "We do not have to get tired or take rest in this war." "We have to emerge victorious. Today, the country has only one goal and one resolve — to win this war," he further said.
Text: It is a long war, don't get tired as we have to win it: PM Modi on coronavirus Stating that the war against the coronavirus outbreak will be a long one, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said, "We do not have to get tired or take rest in this war." "We have to emerge victorious. Today, the country has only one goal and one resolve — to win this war," he further said.

Headline: India understood seriousness of COVID-19, approach appreciated by WHO: PM Modi
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said, "India's efforts have set an example before the world in tackling coronavirus." "India is one of the countries which understood seriousness of this disease and waged a timely war against it," he added. "India has worked rapidly with a holistic approach that is being appreciated by WHO," he further said.
Text: India understood seriousness of COVID-19, approach appreciated by WHO: PM Modi PM Narendra Modi on Monday said, "India's efforts have set an example before the world in tackling coronavirus." "India is one of the countries which understood seriousness of this disease and waged a timely war against it," he added. "India has worked rapidly with a holistic approach that is being appreciated by WHO," he further said.

Headline: Yesterday at 9 pm we saw strength of togetherness of 130 crore people: PM
Description: Speaking on the foundation day of BJP, PM Narendra Modi said, "We experienced yesterday at 9 pm, the strength of togetherness of 130 crore people of our country." "People from every section of society and age group demonstrated this unity and strengthened the resolve in fight against coronavirus." He also said that the world is going through a difficult time.
Text: Yesterday at 9 pm we saw strength of togetherness of 130 crore people: PM Speaking on the foundation day of BJP, PM Narendra Modi said, "We experienced yesterday at 9 pm, the strength of togetherness of 130 crore people of our country." "People from every section of society and age group demonstrated this unity and strengthened the resolve in fight against coronavirus." He also said that the world is going through a difficult time.

Headline: National power demand fell by 32,000 MW within 20 mins on Sunday: Government
Description: National power demand fell by 32,000 MW within 20 minutes on Sunday as people switched off lights, Power Minister RK Singh has said. "The frequency and voltage was maintained within the normal range. The drop...shows a huge response of the nation to the call of Prime Minister Narendra Modi," he wrote on Twitter.
Text: National power demand fell by 32,000 MW within 20 mins on Sunday: Government National power demand fell by 32,000 MW within 20 minutes on Sunday as people switched off lights, Power Minister RK Singh has said. "The frequency and voltage was maintained within the normal range. The drop...shows a huge response of the nation to the call of Prime Minister Narendra Modi," he wrote on Twitter.

Headline: Disinfection tunnel' installed at Karnataka market to sanitise people
Description: A 'disinfection tunnel' was installed at the entrance of the Agricultural Produce Market Committee market in Karnataka's Hubli on Sunday. The tunnel sprays people with a small percentage of Sodium hypochlorite solution through nozzles in order to sanitise them before they enter the market. "People who are allergic to chemicals should avoid going through this chamber," an official said.
Text: Disinfection tunnel' installed at Karnataka market to sanitise people A 'disinfection tunnel' was installed at the entrance of the Agricultural Produce Market Committee market in Karnataka's Hubli on Sunday. The tunnel sprays people with a small percentage of Sodium hypochlorite solution through nozzles in order to sanitise them before they enter the market. "People who are allergic to chemicals should avoid going through this chamber," an official said.

Headline: Govt asks BHU VC to explain absence from campus amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: The Union HRD Ministry has issued a show-cause notice to Banaras Hindu University's (BHU) Vice-Chancellor Rakesh Bhatnagar regarding his absence from the campus amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Bhatnagar has not been in BHU since March 14. The Ministry discovered his absence during a video-conference with all university heads on Saturday and issued him a notice on the same day.
Text: Govt asks BHU VC to explain absence from campus amid COVID-19 pandemic The Union HRD Ministry has issued a show-cause notice to Banaras Hindu University's (BHU) Vice-Chancellor Rakesh Bhatnagar regarding his absence from the campus amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Bhatnagar has not been in BHU since March 14. The Ministry discovered his absence during a video-conference with all university heads on Saturday and issued him a notice on the same day.

Headline: No one could've imagined Indians will abide by lockdown with such obedience: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing people on BJP's 40th Foundation Day today, praised India's maturity during the coronavirus lockdown. "The maturity shown by the people during lockdown, in a large country like India with 130 crore population, is unprecedented. No one could have imagined that the people will abide by this with such obedience and sense of service," he stated.
Text: No one could've imagined Indians will abide by lockdown with such obedience: PM PM Narendra Modi, while addressing people on BJP's 40th Foundation Day today, praised India's maturity during the coronavirus lockdown. "The maturity shown by the people during lockdown, in a large country like India with 130 crore population, is unprecedented. No one could have imagined that the people will abide by this with such obedience and sense of service," he stated.

Headline: Ahmedabad Police uses drones to monitor lockdown, arrests 48 violators
Description: Ahmedabad Police has deployed at least eight drones in the city to ensure the strict implementation of the coronavirus-induced lockdown, officials said. So far, drones have helped the police track down and arrest 48 people and lodge 13 FIRs for unlawful assembly or violating other notifications. Drones are also being used to make announcements regarding rules required to be followed.
Text: Ahmedabad Police uses drones to monitor lockdown, arrests 48 violators Ahmedabad Police has deployed at least eight drones in the city to ensure the strict implementation of the coronavirus-induced lockdown, officials said. So far, drones have helped the police track down and arrest 48 people and lodge 13 FIRs for unlawful assembly or violating other notifications. Drones are also being used to make announcements regarding rules required to be followed.

Headline: Govt orders 7 lakh rapid antibody test kits for coronavirus, to get them by April 8
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has ordered about 7 lakh rapid antibody test kits and will receive them by April 8. The kits will help in conducting antibody tests for coronavirus at hotspots or areas where large number of cases are being seen. ICMR will get the delivery in a phased manner.
Text: Govt orders 7 lakh rapid antibody test kits for coronavirus, to get them by April 8 The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) has ordered about 7 lakh rapid antibody test kits and will receive them by April 8. The kits will help in conducting antibody tests for coronavirus at hotspots or areas where large number of cases are being seen. ICMR will get the delivery in a phased manner.

Headline: Nagpur Police shares 'Chennai Express' meme for COVID-19 awareness
Description: Nagpur Police on Sunday shared a 'Chennai Express' meme for raising awareness among the people regarding social distancing amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Sharing a picture from a scene of the movie, they wrote on Twitter, "Don't underestimate the power of social distancing." Recently, Delhi Police shared Harry Potter meme to tell people to not spread rumours on April Fool's Day.
Text: Nagpur Police shares 'Chennai Express' meme for COVID-19 awareness Nagpur Police on Sunday shared a 'Chennai Express' meme for raising awareness among the people regarding social distancing amid the COVID-19 outbreak. Sharing a picture from a scene of the movie, they wrote on Twitter, "Don't underestimate the power of social distancing." Recently, Delhi Police shared Harry Potter meme to tell people to not spread rumours on April Fool's Day.

Headline: Come forward or face attempt to murder charge: U'khand DGP to Tablighi members
Description: Uttarakhand Police have asked Tablighi Jamaat members, who have recently attended any congregations and are in Uttarakhand, to report to authorities by April 6. If anybody is hiding and has spread infection, they'll face attempt to murder charge, DGP Anil K Raturi said. A murder case will be lodged if someone dies in that area due to COVID-19, he added.
Text: Come forward or face attempt to murder charge: U'khand DGP to Tablighi members Uttarakhand Police have asked Tablighi Jamaat members, who have recently attended any congregations and are in Uttarakhand, to report to authorities by April 6. If anybody is hiding and has spread infection, they'll face attempt to murder charge, DGP Anil K Raturi said. A murder case will be lodged if someone dies in that area due to COVID-19, he added.

Headline: 60-year-old COVID-19 positive man dies in Rajasthan
Description: A 60-year-old COVID-19 positive man died in Rajasthan's Kota on Sunday, the state's Health Department said. The man was admitted to hospital yesterday with the symptoms of pneumonia, fever and cough and he passed away last night at around 11, the Health Department added. The total number of positive cases in the state has increased to 274, it further said.
Text: 60-year-old COVID-19 positive man dies in Rajasthan A 60-year-old COVID-19 positive man died in Rajasthan's Kota on Sunday, the state's Health Department said. The man was admitted to hospital yesterday with the symptoms of pneumonia, fever and cough and he passed away last night at around 11, the Health Department added. The total number of positive cases in the state has increased to 274, it further said.

Headline: Mukesh Ambani, Ratan Tata light diyas at 9 pm on Sunday; pics surface
Description: RIL Chairman and India's richest person Mukesh Ambani and wife Nita Ambani on Sunday lit diyas and candles at 9 pm for 9 minutes to show solidarity towards India's fight against coronavirus pandemic. Industrialist Ratan Tata also lit a diya to show support. He tweeted, "This is the worst crisis we've faced...We must fight this with a spirit of solidarity".
Text: Mukesh Ambani, Ratan Tata light diyas at 9 pm on Sunday; pics surface RIL Chairman and India's richest person Mukesh Ambani and wife Nita Ambani on Sunday lit diyas and candles at 9 pm for 9 minutes to show solidarity towards India's fight against coronavirus pandemic. Industrialist Ratan Tata also lit a diya to show support. He tweeted, "This is the worst crisis we've faced...We must fight this with a spirit of solidarity".

Headline: Viral pic claims Amit Shah has been infected with COVID-19; govt says it's fake
Description: An image being shared on social media cites a Hindi news channel claiming Home Minister Amit Shah has been infected with coronavirus. Government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) on Sunday clarified that the image is fake. "The image is #Fake and aims to spread confusion. Please do not share or forward it," it wrote on Twitter.
Text: Viral pic claims Amit Shah has been infected with COVID-19; govt says it's fake An image being shared on social media cites a Hindi news channel claiming Home Minister Amit Shah has been infected with coronavirus. Government agency Press Information Bureau (PIB) on Sunday clarified that the image is fake. "The image is #Fake and aims to spread confusion. Please do not share or forward it," it wrote on Twitter.

Headline: Odisha's Ganjam district to penalise people with ₹1,000 for not wearing masks
Description: Odisha's Ganjam district has made it compulsory for everyone to wear masks as a preventive measure amid COVID-19 outbreak. "Anyone coming outside without mask will be penalised with ₹1,000 in the urban areas and ₹500 in the rural areas," Ganjam District Collector Vijay Amruta Kulange said. "Use cotton clothes mask, handkerchief or scarf to cover nose and mouth," Kulange added.
Text: Odisha's Ganjam district to penalise people with ₹1,000 for not wearing masks Odisha's Ganjam district has made it compulsory for everyone to wear masks as a preventive measure amid COVID-19 outbreak. "Anyone coming outside without mask will be penalised with ₹1,000 in the urban areas and ₹500 in the rural areas," Ganjam District Collector Vijay Amruta Kulange said. "Use cotton clothes mask, handkerchief or scarf to cover nose and mouth," Kulange added.

Headline: Wearing face masks made compulsory at Maharashtra secretariat
Description: Wearing a face mask has been made compulsory for all the staff, officers and visitors in Maharashtra secretariat 'Mantralaya' in Mumbai for the coming few months. The decision has been taken as a precautionary measure to contain the further spread of COVID-19. The state has recorded 690 COVID-19 cases as on April 5.
Text: Wearing face masks made compulsory at Maharashtra secretariat Wearing a face mask has been made compulsory for all the staff, officers and visitors in Maharashtra secretariat 'Mantralaya' in Mumbai for the coming few months. The decision has been taken as a precautionary measure to contain the further spread of COVID-19. The state has recorded 690 COVID-19 cases as on April 5.

Headline: India's first at-home testing kit for coronavirus not licensed: Government
Description: India's first at-home coronavirus screening kit, which has been launched by Bengaluru-based startup Bione, has not been licensed by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organization, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said. The startup claims the kit can deliver results in 5-10 minutes. "All are advised to follow guidance issued by the ICMR," the ministry said.
Text: India's first at-home testing kit for coronavirus not licensed: Government India's first at-home coronavirus screening kit, which has been launched by Bengaluru-based startup Bione, has not been licensed by the Central Drugs Standard Control Organization, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said. The startup claims the kit can deliver results in 5-10 minutes. "All are advised to follow guidance issued by the ICMR," the ministry said.

Headline: Hospital declared containment zone as some nurses, doctors declared COVID-19 suspects
Description: The Wockhardt Hospital in Mumbai has been declared a containment zone by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation after some nurses and doctors were suspected to have contracted coronavirus (COVID-19). The nurses and doctors have been reportedly shifted to another hospital in Mumbai, where they will be tested for the virus.
Text: Hospital declared containment zone as some nurses, doctors declared COVID-19 suspects The Wockhardt Hospital in Mumbai has been declared a containment zone by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation after some nurses and doctors were suspected to have contracted coronavirus (COVID-19). The nurses and doctors have been reportedly shifted to another hospital in Mumbai, where they will be tested for the virus.

Headline: Man who left from Mumbai on cycle to meet sick father in J&K gets CRPF's help
Description: Mohammed Arif, a man who left for J&K from Mumbai on a cycle to meet his critically ill father, has received help from CRPF. Arif's father has been airlifted for treatment to Jammu, CRPF said. Meanwhile, Gujarat Police personnel helped Arif after he reached the state on Sunday by putting him on a truck to cover his remaining journey.
Text: Man who left from Mumbai on cycle to meet sick father in J&K gets CRPF's help Mohammed Arif, a man who left for J&K from Mumbai on a cycle to meet his critically ill father, has received help from CRPF. Arif's father has been airlifted for treatment to Jammu, CRPF said. Meanwhile, Gujarat Police personnel helped Arif after he reached the state on Sunday by putting him on a truck to cover his remaining journey.

Headline: 3 men in TN die after consuming varnish with water as substitute for alcohol
Description: Three men died in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu after consuming varnish mixed with water due to non-availability of alcohol.  This is the second case of suspected alcohol withdrawal in Tamil Nadu that has resulted in the death of people. On Friday, three men in Pudukkottai district died after consuming after-shave lotion with cold drinks.
Text: 3 men in TN die after consuming varnish with water as substitute for alcohol Three men died in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu after consuming varnish mixed with water due to non-availability of alcohol.  This is the second case of suspected alcohol withdrawal in Tamil Nadu that has resulted in the death of people. On Friday, three men in Pudukkottai district died after consuming after-shave lotion with cold drinks.

Headline: 60-year-old woman in Punjab consumes poison fearing COVID-19 infection, dies
Description: A 60-year-old woman in Punjab committed suicide by consuming a poisonous substance, fearing she had contracted COVID-19 infection, police said on Sunday. She feared that she had contracted the virus after suffering from a throat problem. Doctors told her she was healthy and only suffered from a sore throat but she couldn't get rid of her fears, her family said.
Text: 60-year-old woman in Punjab consumes poison fearing COVID-19 infection, dies A 60-year-old woman in Punjab committed suicide by consuming a poisonous substance, fearing she had contracted COVID-19 infection, police said on Sunday. She feared that she had contracted the virus after suffering from a throat problem. Doctors told her she was healthy and only suffered from a sore throat but she couldn't get rid of her fears, her family said.

Headline: Arjun donates to PM CARES Fund, Maha CM's Relief Fund, FWICE
Description: Arjun Kapoor on Monday shared he has contributed to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund to help the administrations fight the coronavirus pandemic. Furthermore, he also contributed to Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) and non-profit organisations GiveIndia and The Wishing Factory. "As responsible citizens, we need to do our bit for [the needy]," Arjun wrote.
Text: Arjun donates to PM CARES Fund, Maha CM's Relief Fund, FWICE Arjun Kapoor on Monday shared he has contributed to PM CARES Fund and Maharashtra Chief Minister's Relief Fund to help the administrations fight the coronavirus pandemic. Furthermore, he also contributed to Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) and non-profit organisations GiveIndia and The Wishing Factory. "As responsible citizens, we need to do our bit for [the needy]," Arjun wrote.

Headline: B'wood celebs light candles, diyas at 9pm on Sun; share pics
Description: Bollywood celebrities including Akshay Kumar, Amitabh Bachchan and Alia Bhatt lit candles, diyas, etc on Sunday at 9 pm for 9 minutes to show solidarity towards India's fight against coronavirus pandemic. Sharing his picture on Instagram, Kartik Aaryan wrote, "Together, everything is possible." "I lit diyas with the whole [country] and we all prayed for each other," Anushka Sharma said.
Text: B'wood celebs light candles, diyas at 9pm on Sun; share pics Bollywood celebrities including Akshay Kumar, Amitabh Bachchan and Alia Bhatt lit candles, diyas, etc on Sunday at 9 pm for 9 minutes to show solidarity towards India's fight against coronavirus pandemic. Sharing his picture on Instagram, Kartik Aaryan wrote, "Together, everything is possible." "I lit diyas with the whole [country] and we all prayed for each other," Anushka Sharma said.

Headline: Rajinikanth, Big B, Alia to feature in short film on COVID-19
Description: Several actors including Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth, Chiranjeevi, Priyanka Chopra, Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will feature in short film 'Family' to create awareness about COVID-19. It will show that maintaining hygiene and social distance, staying home and working from home can be productive. 'Family' is conceptualised and virtually directed by Prasoon Pandey in collaboration with Bachchan.
Text: Rajinikanth, Big B, Alia to feature in short film on COVID-19 Several actors including Amitabh Bachchan, Rajinikanth, Chiranjeevi, Priyanka Chopra, Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will feature in short film 'Family' to create awareness about COVID-19. It will show that maintaining hygiene and social distance, staying home and working from home can be productive. 'Family' is conceptualised and virtually directed by Prasoon Pandey in collaboration with Bachchan.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 500; 320 related to Markaz Masjid
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 503 after 58 new cases were reported in the last 24 hours. Out of all the cases, 320 are linked with the Markaz Masjid. Further, 61 cases have foreign travel history, while 71 cases are under investigation. Delhi has reported 7 deaths due to coronavirus so far.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Delhi cross 500; 320 related to Markaz Masjid The total number of coronavirus cases in Delhi has risen to 503 after 58 new cases were reported in the last 24 hours. Out of all the cases, 320 are linked with the Markaz Masjid. Further, 61 cases have foreign travel history, while 71 cases are under investigation. Delhi has reported 7 deaths due to coronavirus so far.

Headline: People across India turn off lights, light candles after PM's appeal; pics surface
Description: Citizens all across India turned off lights of their houses and lit diyas, candles, torches and flashlights at 9 pm for nine minutes. PM Narendra Modi had requested people to do so as a mark of solidarity in India's fight against coronavirus. Pictures from around the country surfaced online and many celebrities also shared photos on their social media accounts.
Text: People across India turn off lights, light candles after PM's appeal; pics surface Citizens all across India turned off lights of their houses and lit diyas, candles, torches and flashlights at 9 pm for nine minutes. PM Narendra Modi had requested people to do so as a mark of solidarity in India's fight against coronavirus. Pictures from around the country surfaced online and many celebrities also shared photos on their social media accounts.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 3,577, death toll reaches 83
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 3,577, while the death toll has reached 83. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 275. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 3,219.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 3,577, death toll reaches 83 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Sunday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 3,577, while the death toll has reached 83. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 275. The number of active coronavirus cases in the country is 3,219.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Kerala reach 314; 1.5 lakh people under quarantine in state
Description: As many as eight new coronavirus cases have been confirmed in Kerala today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 314. Out of all the cases, 256 cases are active. Further, 10,221 people have been tested in the state so far, with 9,300 testing negative for the virus. Meanwhile, 1,58,617 people are under quarantine in Kerala.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Kerala reach 314; 1.5 lakh people under quarantine in state As many as eight new coronavirus cases have been confirmed in Kerala today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 314. Out of all the cases, 256 cases are active. Further, 10,221 people have been tested in the state so far, with 9,300 testing negative for the virus. Meanwhile, 1,58,617 people are under quarantine in Kerala.

Headline: PM lights diyas to show solidarity towards fight against coronavirus, shares pics
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share pictures of himself lighting diyas to show solidarity towards the country's fight against coronavirus. He also tweeted a Sanskrit shloka alongside the pictures. PM Modi had requested citizens of the country to switch off the lights of their houses and light candles, diyas, torches or flashlights at 9 pm tonight.
Text: PM lights diyas to show solidarity towards fight against coronavirus, shares pics Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share pictures of himself lighting diyas to show solidarity towards the country's fight against coronavirus. He also tweeted a Sanskrit shloka alongside the pictures. PM Modi had requested citizens of the country to switch off the lights of their houses and light candles, diyas, torches or flashlights at 9 pm tonight.

Headline: Viral message claiming WHO has released lockdown schedule is fake: Govt
Description: A message containing a lockdown schedule attributed to WHO which has been shared widely across social media and WhatsApp is fake, the government has said. "WHO has not issued any such protocols or procedures of lockdown," Press Information Bureau said. "Messages being circulated on social media as WHO protocol for lockdown are baseless and FAKE," WHO South-East Asia also clarified.
Text: Viral message claiming WHO has released lockdown schedule is fake: Govt A message containing a lockdown schedule attributed to WHO which has been shared widely across social media and WhatsApp is fake, the government has said. "WHO has not issued any such protocols or procedures of lockdown," Press Information Bureau said. "Messages being circulated on social media as WHO protocol for lockdown are baseless and FAKE," WHO South-East Asia also clarified.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in MP surge to 193; death toll in the state at 12
Description: The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh has risen to 193, said Pallavi Jain Govil, the state's Principal Secretary, Health on Sunday. One person died of the virus in Indore today, said Govil. There have been total 12 deaths due to coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh so far, she added.
Text: Coronavirus cases in MP surge to 193; death toll in the state at 12 The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh has risen to 193, said Pallavi Jain Govil, the state's Principal Secretary, Health on Sunday. One person died of the virus in Indore today, said Govil. There have been total 12 deaths due to coronavirus in Madhya Pradesh so far, she added.

Headline: Niti Aayog CEO writes to 92,000 NGOs for assistance in relief measures
Description: Niti Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant has written to over 92,000 NGOs and civil society organisations (CSOs) appealing them to assist the government in identifying COVID-19 hotspots and delivering services to vulnerable groups. Kant asked them to create awareness about prevention, social distancing, and combating stigma and to provide shelter to homeless, daily wage workers, and urban poor families.
Text: Niti Aayog CEO writes to 92,000 NGOs for assistance in relief measures Niti Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant has written to over 92,000 NGOs and civil society organisations (CSOs) appealing them to assist the government in identifying COVID-19 hotspots and delivering services to vulnerable groups. Kant asked them to create awareness about prevention, social distancing, and combating stigma and to provide shelter to homeless, daily wage workers, and urban poor families.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh reports 60 new coronavirus cases, state total reaches 252
Description: Andhra Pradesh on Sunday reported 60 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases from yesterday's 192 to 252 today. Out of the 60 new cases, Kurnool reported 49 cases, Chittoor reported seven cases and two cases each were reported in Ongole and Nellore. Five patients have been completely recovered and discharged, said Arja Srikanth, Andhra Pradesh Nodal Officer.
Text: Andhra Pradesh reports 60 new coronavirus cases, state total reaches 252 Andhra Pradesh on Sunday reported 60 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases from yesterday's 192 to 252 today. Out of the 60 new cases, Kurnool reported 49 cases, Chittoor reported seven cases and two cases each were reported in Ongole and Nellore. Five patients have been completely recovered and discharged, said Arja Srikanth, Andhra Pradesh Nodal Officer.

Headline: Railways develops low-cost ventilator prototype 'Jeevan', seeks ICMR approval
Description: Indian Railways' Rail Coach Factory (RCF) in Kapurthala has come out with a prototype of a low-cost ventilator 'Jeevan' that has an original design. The prototype is now awaiting ICMR clearance to go into production, the Railways said. "The cost will be under ₹10,000 without the compressor," Ravinder Gupta, general manager of the RCF and the ventilator's chief designer said.
Text: Railways develops low-cost ventilator prototype 'Jeevan', seeks ICMR approval Indian Railways' Rail Coach Factory (RCF) in Kapurthala has come out with a prototype of a low-cost ventilator 'Jeevan' that has an original design. The prototype is now awaiting ICMR clearance to go into production, the Railways said. "The cost will be under ₹10,000 without the compressor," Ravinder Gupta, general manager of the RCF and the ventilator's chief designer said.

Headline: Unbelievable but true: Water ministry on video of clean Yamuna amid lockdown
Description: Ministry of Jal Shakti has shared a video showing Delhi's Yamuna river with clean water amid lockdown to control the spread of coronavirus. "Unbelievable but it's true," said the ministry while sharing the video on Twitter. Reduced discharge of industrial effluents into the river during lockdown is behind improvement in Yamuna water quality, said social activist Gopeshwar Nath Chaturvedi.
Text: Unbelievable but true: Water ministry on video of clean Yamuna amid lockdown Ministry of Jal Shakti has shared a video showing Delhi's Yamuna river with clean water amid lockdown to control the spread of coronavirus. "Unbelievable but it's true," said the ministry while sharing the video on Twitter. Reduced discharge of industrial effluents into the river during lockdown is behind improvement in Yamuna water quality, said social activist Gopeshwar Nath Chaturvedi.

Headline: 8 coronavirus deaths reported in Mumbai today, patients were aged between 52-80
Description: As many as eight deaths due to coronavirus were reported in Mumbai today, the Municipal Corporation Greater Mumbai said. The deceased, who included seven men and one woman, were aged between 52 and 80. With this, the total death toll in Mumbai rose to 30. Further, 103 coronavirus cases were reported, taking the total number of cases to 433.
Text: 8 coronavirus deaths reported in Mumbai today, patients were aged between 52-80 As many as eight deaths due to coronavirus were reported in Mumbai today, the Municipal Corporation Greater Mumbai said. The deceased, who included seven men and one woman, were aged between 52 and 80. With this, the total death toll in Mumbai rose to 30. Further, 103 coronavirus cases were reported, taking the total number of cases to 433.

Headline: Death toll due to coronavirus in Maharashtra rises to 45, total cases reach 748
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 45 in Maharashtra, while the total number of cases has reached 748. As many as 13 new deaths were reported in Maharashtra today including 8 in Mumbai, 3 in Pune and 1 each in Kalyan, Dombivali and Aurangabad, Maharashtra Health Department said. Meanwhile, the number of people discharged stands at 56.
Text: Death toll due to coronavirus in Maharashtra rises to 45, total cases reach 748 The death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 45 in Maharashtra, while the total number of cases has reached 748. As many as 13 new deaths were reported in Maharashtra today including 8 in Mumbai, 3 in Pune and 1 each in Kalyan, Dombivali and Aurangabad, Maharashtra Health Department said. Meanwhile, the number of people discharged stands at 56.

Headline: Mumbai man claims coronavirus is a govt conspiracy on Facebook, gets arrested
Description: A 36-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly uploading a post on Facebook claiming the novel coronavirus outbreak was a government conspiracy. "His Facebook post claimed the virus does not exist and it was a conspiracy to target certain communities by the government," an official said. He had also asked people not to give information to authorities on coronavirus.
Text: Mumbai man claims coronavirus is a govt conspiracy on Facebook, gets arrested A 36-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly uploading a post on Facebook claiming the novel coronavirus outbreak was a government conspiracy. "His Facebook post claimed the virus does not exist and it was a conspiracy to target certain communities by the government," an official said. He had also asked people not to give information to authorities on coronavirus.

Headline: UP man allegedly blames Tablighi members for spreading COVID-19; shot dead
Description: A man was shot dead outside his house in Prayagraj, UP, after he reportedly blamed Tablighi Jamaat members for spreading coronavirus in India while talking to a group of people, said police on Sunday. The victim was standing outside his house when he was shot in the head, said a police official. He died on the spot, the official added.
Text: UP man allegedly blames Tablighi members for spreading COVID-19; shot dead A man was shot dead outside his house in Prayagraj, UP, after he reportedly blamed Tablighi Jamaat members for spreading coronavirus in India while talking to a group of people, said police on Sunday. The victim was standing outside his house when he was shot in the head, said a police official. He died on the spot, the official added.

Headline: IIT-M and Chennai firm 3D-prints face shields for COVID-19 responders
Description: A student team at IIT-M, Avishkar Hyperloop, along with a Chennai-based 3D printing company, NexGen 3D, are 3D printing face shields for COVID-19 responders such as medical and police staff. The face shield consists of two principal components, an acrylic sheet and a headband to hold it in place. They are providing the shields free of cost to government hospitals.
Text: IIT-M and Chennai firm 3D-prints face shields for COVID-19 responders A student team at IIT-M, Avishkar Hyperloop, along with a Chennai-based 3D printing company, NexGen 3D, are 3D printing face shields for COVID-19 responders such as medical and police staff. The face shield consists of two principal components, an acrylic sheet and a headband to hold it in place. They are providing the shields free of cost to government hospitals.

Headline: Maharashtra BJP MLA defies lockdown, gives free ration to people on his birthday
Description: A BJP MLA from Wardha district in Maharashtra allegedly violated coronavirus lockdown by distributing dry ration to people at his residence on his birthday. At least a hundred people had reportedly gathered outside MLA Dadarao Keche's residence to receive free ration. Keche will face action under the Epidemic Diseases Act, said Sub Divisional Officer Harish Dharmik.
Text: Maharashtra BJP MLA defies lockdown, gives free ration to people on his birthday A BJP MLA from Wardha district in Maharashtra allegedly violated coronavirus lockdown by distributing dry ration to people at his residence on his birthday. At least a hundred people had reportedly gathered outside MLA Dadarao Keche's residence to receive free ration. Keche will face action under the Epidemic Diseases Act, said Sub Divisional Officer Harish Dharmik.

Headline: Noida DM tells schools to not force parents to pay fees during lockdown
Description: District Magistrate of Gautam Buddha Nagar (which includes Noida) Suhas LY on Sunday ordered all educational institutions to not compel parents to pay students' fees during coronavirus lockdown. Students should not be barred from joining online classes based on non-payment of fees, said the order. The 21-day nationwide lockdown began on March 25 and will go on till April 14.
Text: Noida DM tells schools to not force parents to pay fees during lockdown District Magistrate of Gautam Buddha Nagar (which includes Noida) Suhas LY on Sunday ordered all educational institutions to not compel parents to pay students' fees during coronavirus lockdown. Students should not be barred from joining online classes based on non-payment of fees, said the order. The 21-day nationwide lockdown began on March 25 and will go on till April 14.

Headline: Delhi got nothing: Sisodia calls Centre's COVID-19 fund to states discriminatory
Description: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that he has written to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman asking for a disaster fund for the national capital amid coronavirus spread. "Centre released ₹17,000 crore to the states to fight corona(virus), but didn't give even a single rupee to Delhi," said Sisodia. "Such discrimination is unfortunate," he added.
Text: Delhi got nothing: Sisodia calls Centre's COVID-19 fund to states discriminatory Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday said that he has written to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman asking for a disaster fund for the national capital amid coronavirus spread. "Centre released ₹17,000 crore to the states to fight corona(virus), but didn't give even a single rupee to Delhi," said Sisodia. "Such discrimination is unfortunate," he added.

Headline: TN police book YouTuber Maridhas for communal videos on COVID-19
Description: Tamil Nadu police have booked YouTuber Maridhas for allegedly stoking communal sentiment based on a complaint against his videos about the coronavirus. Maridhas claimed that the coronavirus is being deliberately spread by terrorists to murder innocent people across the world in one such video uploaded on April 2 with the title 'Terrorism + Corona = India's new problem|Tablighi Jamaat Issue'.
Text: TN police book YouTuber Maridhas for communal videos on COVID-19 Tamil Nadu police have booked YouTuber Maridhas for allegedly stoking communal sentiment based on a complaint against his videos about the coronavirus. Maridhas claimed that the coronavirus is being deliberately spread by terrorists to murder innocent people across the world in one such video uploaded on April 2 with the title 'Terrorism + Corona = India's new problem|Tablighi Jamaat Issue'.

Headline: Andhra pastor held for hosting Mass with 150 people amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: A pastor in Rayavaram village in East Godavari district of Andhra Pradesh was arrested for defying coronavirus lockdown and conducting Sunday Mass at a local church. There were almost 150 people in attendance, reported ANI. The 53-year-old pastor has been booked under sections of IPC, Epidemic Diseases Act and Disaster Management Act, said a police official.
Text: Andhra pastor held for hosting Mass with 150 people amid COVID-19 lockdown A pastor in Rayavaram village in East Godavari district of Andhra Pradesh was arrested for defying coronavirus lockdown and conducting Sunday Mass at a local church. There were almost 150 people in attendance, reported ANI. The 53-year-old pastor has been booked under sections of IPC, Epidemic Diseases Act and Disaster Management Act, said a police official.

Headline: Rajasthan reports 54 new coronavirus cases, state total reaches 260
Description: A total of 54 new coronavirus cases were reported in Rajasthan on Sunday, taking the number of COVID-19 positive cases in the state to 260. State capital Jaipur reported 39 cases, Jodhpur reported three, Dausa reported two and one case each was reported from Jhunjhunu, Tonk, Pali, Jaisalmer and Nagaur. Five evacuees from Iran also tested positive in Rajasthan today.
Text: Rajasthan reports 54 new coronavirus cases, state total reaches 260  A total of 54 new coronavirus cases were reported in Rajasthan on Sunday, taking the number of COVID-19 positive cases in the state to 260. State capital Jaipur reported 39 cases, Jodhpur reported three, Dausa reported two and one case each was reported from Jhunjhunu, Tonk, Pali, Jaisalmer and Nagaur. Five evacuees from Iran also tested positive in Rajasthan today.

Headline: Not proud of my behaviour: Nehra on abusing Dhoni during ODI against Pakistan
Description: Recalling a 2005 ODI against Pakistan wherein he abused MS Dhoni for not taking Shahid Afridi's catch, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said, "I must admit I am not proud of my behaviour." He added, "I had been hit for six by Afridi off just the previous ball. Suddenly, I created a chance and it was missed. I lost my cool."
Text: Not proud of my behaviour: Nehra on abusing Dhoni during ODI against Pakistan Recalling a 2005 ODI against Pakistan wherein he abused MS Dhoni for not taking Shahid Afridi's catch, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said, "I must admit I am not proud of my behaviour." He added, "I had been hit for six by Afridi off just the previous ball. Suddenly, I created a chance and it was missed. I lost my cool."

Headline: Google Maps to show public food shelters, night shelters in 31 Indian cities
Description: Public food shelters and public night shelters can now be found on Google Maps for 31 cities, the government announced on Sunday. People can search on Google or Google Maps for 'Food Shelter Near Me' or 'Night Shelter Near Me' to find the closest shelter. More cities and shelters are being added to Google Maps, the government informed.
Text: Google Maps to show public food shelters, night shelters in 31 Indian cities Public food shelters and public night shelters can now be found on Google Maps for 31 cities, the government announced on Sunday. People can search on Google or Google Maps for 'Food Shelter Near Me' or 'Night Shelter Near Me' to find the closest shelter. More cities and shelters are being added to Google Maps, the government informed.

Headline: Exclusion of AIMIM from PM Modi's COVID-19 meeting an insult: Owaisi
Description: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said that his party being "denied" participation in the proposed interaction with PM Narendra Modi on COVID-19 was an insult to the people of Hyderabad and Aurangabad. This comes after Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Pralhad Joshi issued a release saying that PM Modi would interact with leaders of political parties with more than five MPs.
Text: Exclusion of AIMIM from PM Modi's COVID-19 meeting an insult: Owaisi AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has said that his party being "denied" participation in the proposed interaction with PM Narendra Modi on COVID-19 was an insult to the people of Hyderabad and Aurangabad. This comes after Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Pralhad Joshi issued a release saying that PM Modi would interact with leaders of political parties with more than five MPs.

Headline: Malicious OLX listing puts Statue of Unity 'for sale' for COVID-19 donations
Description: Statue of Unity - the world's tallest statue in Gujarat, was listed 'for sale' on OLX for ₹30,000 crore in a malicious post claiming to donate the money for medical and health care equipment for COVID-19. The listing was taken down by OLX. Statue of Unity authorities approached the police to file a complaint against an unknown person for listing.
Text: Malicious OLX listing puts Statue of Unity 'for sale' for COVID-19 donations Statue of Unity - the world's tallest statue in Gujarat, was listed 'for sale' on OLX for ₹30,000 crore in a malicious post claiming to donate the money for medical and health care equipment for COVID-19. The listing was taken down by OLX. Statue of Unity authorities approached the police to file a complaint against an unknown person for listing.

Headline: PM Modi's mother lights an earthen lamp at her residence at 9 pm
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben on Sunday lit an earthen lamp after turning off all lights at her residence at 9 pm. After PM Modi's appeal to the nation, citizens across the country switched off lights and lit diyas and candles for nine minutes at 9 PM today as a mark of solidarity in India's fight against the coronavirus.
Text: PM Modi's mother lights an earthen lamp at her residence at 9 pm Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother Heeraben on Sunday lit an earthen lamp after turning off all lights at her residence at 9 pm. After PM Modi's appeal to the nation, citizens across the country switched off lights and lit diyas and candles for nine minutes at 9 PM today as a mark of solidarity in India's fight against the coronavirus.

Headline: 55 more test positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra, total rises to 690
Description: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope today announced that 55 new cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in the state, taking the total number of cases to 690. He added the new cases have been reported from Mumbai (29), Pune (17), PCMC (4), Ahmednagar (3) and Aurangabad (2). He further said that 56 patients have been cured till date.
Text: 55 more test positive for coronavirus in Maharashtra, total rises to 690 Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope today announced that 55 new cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in the state, taking the total number of cases to 690. He added the new cases have been reported from Mumbai (29), Pune (17), PCMC (4), Ahmednagar (3) and Aurangabad (2). He further said that 56 patients have been cured till date.

Headline: 472 new coronavirus cases, 11 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Sunday said that 472 new cases of coronavirus and 11 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that a total of 79 people have died due to coronavirus in the country, while the number of people who have recovered has risen to 267.
Text: 472 new coronavirus cases, 11 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Sunday said that 472 new cases of coronavirus and 11 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. He added that a total of 79 people have died due to coronavirus in the country, while the number of people who have recovered has risen to 267.

Headline: Noida Police revises order, Section 144 to be extended in district till April 14
Description: Ashutosh Dwivedi, Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police, Gautam Buddha Nagar has said since lockdown has been declared by government till April 14, therefore imposition of Section 144 in the district will be till April 14 only. Earlier, he said it has been extended till April 30. Section 144 had been imposed in Gautam Buddha Nagar till April 5 amid coronavirus.
Text: Noida Police revises order, Section 144 to be extended in district till April 14 Ashutosh Dwivedi, Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police, Gautam Buddha Nagar has said since lockdown has been declared by government till April 14, therefore imposition of Section 144 in the district will be till April 14 only. Earlier, he said it has been extended till April 30. Section 144 had been imposed in Gautam Buddha Nagar till April 5 amid coronavirus.

Headline: COVID-19 doubling rate 4.1 days, would've been 7.4 if not for Nizamuddin event: Govt
Description: The government on Sunday said that the current doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India is 4.1 days. It added that the doubling rate would have been 7.4 days if cases would not have arisen from the Nizamuddin congregation. On Saturday, the government had said that 35.25% of all the cases in India are related to Tablighi Jamaat.
Text: COVID-19 doubling rate 4.1 days, would've been 7.4 if not for Nizamuddin event: Govt The government on Sunday said that the current doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India is 4.1 days. It added that the doubling rate would have been 7.4 days if cases would not have arisen from the Nizamuddin congregation. On Saturday, the government had said that 35.25% of all the cases in India are related to Tablighi Jamaat.

Headline: 2 patients in Chennai hospital die of COVID-19, death toll rises to 5 in Tamil Nadu
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in Tamil Nadu rose to five after two deaths were reported from Chennai's Stanley Medical College Hospital. A 71-year-old man from Ramanathapuram and a 60-year-old man from Chennai passed away. The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu has crossed 485 including eight patients who have recovered.
Text: 2 patients in Chennai hospital die of COVID-19, death toll rises to 5 in Tamil Nadu The death toll due to coronavirus in Tamil Nadu rose to five after two deaths were reported from Chennai's Stanley Medical College Hospital. A 71-year-old man from Ramanathapuram and a 60-year-old man from Chennai passed away. The total number of coronavirus cases in Tamil Nadu has crossed 485 including eight patients who have recovered.

Headline: Reopening of schools, colleges after April 14 depends on COVID-19 situation: Govt
Description: Minister of Human Resource Development Ramesh Pokhriyal has said that reopening of schools and colleges after April 14 depends on the coronavirus situation. "Safety of students and teachers is of utmost importance to government," he added. "We are prepared to ensure there is no academic loss to students if schools and colleges remain shut beyond April 14," he further said.
Text: Reopening of schools, colleges after April 14 depends on COVID-19 situation: Govt Minister of Human Resource Development Ramesh Pokhriyal has said that reopening of schools and colleges after April 14 depends on the coronavirus situation. "Safety of students and teachers is of utmost importance to government," he added. "We are prepared to ensure there is no academic loss to students if schools and colleges remain shut beyond April 14," he further said.

Headline: DRDO develops disinfection chambers, face shields for COVID-19 medical staff
Description: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Saturday said it has developed full-body sanitisation enclosures and face shields to protect primary healthcare providers amid coronavirus spread. The enclosure is fitted with an electrically operated pump which creates a disinfection mist, said DRDO. It is a portable system and can disinfect around 650 people until the next refill.
Text: DRDO develops disinfection chambers, face shields for COVID-19 medical staff Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Saturday said it has developed full-body sanitisation enclosures and face shields to protect primary healthcare providers amid coronavirus spread. The enclosure is fitted with an electrically operated pump which creates a disinfection mist, said DRDO. It is a portable system and can disinfect around 650 people until the next refill.

Headline: CRPF DG self-quarantines after doctor of his force tests COVID-19 +ve
Description: Director General of Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) Anand Prakash Maheshwari said on Sunday that he has gone into self-quarantine after a doctor of his force tested COVID-19 positive. The doctor was found to be infected on April 2, following which all the personnel he came in contact with, were quarantined. The doctor is isolated at AIIMS in Jhajjar, Haryana.
Text: CRPF DG self-quarantines after doctor of his force tests COVID-19 +ve Director General of Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) Anand Prakash Maheshwari said on Sunday that he has gone into self-quarantine after a doctor of his force tested COVID-19 positive. The doctor was found to be infected on April 2, following which all the personnel he came in contact with, were quarantined. The doctor is isolated at AIIMS in Jhajjar, Haryana.

Headline: There's no evidence of coronavirus being airborne yet: ICMR
Description: While answering a query on whether coronavirus is airborne or not during a press conference, Dr Raman R Gangakhedkar from Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said, "There's no evidence of coronavirus being airborne yet." "If it was airborne, then the entire family of a patient should've tested positive," he added. "Trust the evidence," Gangakhedkar further said.
Text: There's no evidence of coronavirus being airborne yet: ICMR While answering a query on whether coronavirus is airborne or not during a press conference, Dr Raman R Gangakhedkar from Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said, "There's no evidence of coronavirus being airborne yet." "If it was airborne, then the entire family of a patient should've tested positive," he added. "Trust the evidence," Gangakhedkar further said.

Headline: 6 Kanpur areas visited by COVID-19 +ve Tablighi members marked 'red zones'
Description: Six pockets in Kanpur district were declared 'red zones' after six Tablighi Jamaat members who attended Nizamuddin Markaz event before visiting several places in Kanpur, tested COVID-19 positive. "Red zone is marked in radius of one kilometre from the spot visited by Tablighi members," said Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari, DM, Kanpur Nagar. The areas will be sanitised, he added.
Text: 6 Kanpur areas visited by COVID-19 +ve Tablighi members marked 'red zones' Six pockets in Kanpur district were declared 'red zones' after six Tablighi Jamaat members who attended Nizamuddin Markaz event before visiting several places in Kanpur, tested COVID-19 positive. "Red zone is marked in radius of one kilometre from the spot visited by Tablighi members," said Dr Brahma Deo Ram Tiwari, DM, Kanpur Nagar. The areas will be sanitised, he added.

Headline: Kerala govt ropes in post offices to home deliver cash amid lockdown
Description: In order to reduce rush at ATMs, the Kerala government has allowed the Department of Posts to deliver cash to the homes of account owners whose bank accounts are linked with Aadhaar. The Hindu reported this facility is available for accounts in 119 participating banks and 24 non-banking finance companies. This service will be provided free of cost to customers.
Text: Kerala govt ropes in post offices to home deliver cash amid lockdown In order to reduce rush at ATMs, the Kerala government has allowed the Department of Posts to deliver cash to the homes of account owners whose bank accounts are linked with Aadhaar. The Hindu reported this facility is available for accounts in 119 participating banks and 24 non-banking finance companies. This service will be provided free of cost to customers.

Headline: Bengaluru's air quality has improved due to lockdown: K'taka Pollution Control Board
Description: The COVID-19 related lockdown has substantially improved the air quality of Bengaluru, taking it from satisfactory level to good, Karnataka State Pollution Control Board said. The board's member secretary Basavaraj Patil said that as per available records, there has been a 60-65% reduction in pollution during the lockdown. "It will improve the immune system of people," he added.
Text: Bengaluru's air quality has improved due to lockdown: K'taka Pollution Control Board The COVID-19 related lockdown has substantially improved the air quality of Bengaluru, taking it from satisfactory level to good, Karnataka State Pollution Control Board said. The board's member secretary Basavaraj Patil said that as per available records, there has been a 60-65% reduction in pollution during the lockdown. "It will improve the immune system of people," he added.

Headline: Won't spare those spreading fake news, communal messages on virus: Uddhav
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has warned that strict legal action would be taken against people spreading "fake news" and "communal hatred" amid coronavirus pandemic. "If anybody circulates fake news or videos with inflammatory content such as notes being smeared with saliva, law will catch up with them. They will not be spared. Don't do this even for fun," said Thackeray.
Text: Won't spare those spreading fake news, communal messages on virus: Uddhav Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has warned that strict legal action would be taken against people spreading "fake news" and "communal hatred" amid coronavirus pandemic. "If anybody circulates fake news or videos with inflammatory content such as notes being smeared with saliva, law will catch up with them. They will not be spared. Don't do this even for fun," said Thackeray.

Headline: 3 IAF personnel quarantined as 1 of them visited Nizamuddin in March: Report
Description: Three personnel of the Indian Air Force (IAF) are reportedly in precautionary quarantine after one of them visited Nizamuddin area in Delhi around the time of the Tablighi Jamaat event in March. An IAF spokesperson was quoted as saying by PTI, "Whether he attended Jamaat meeting or not is under investigation." All three personnel are asymptomatic, said the spokesperson.
Text: 3 IAF personnel quarantined as 1 of them visited Nizamuddin in March: Report Three personnel of the Indian Air Force (IAF) are reportedly in precautionary quarantine after one of them visited Nizamuddin area in Delhi around the time of the Tablighi Jamaat event in March. An IAF spokesperson was quoted as saying by PTI, "Whether he attended Jamaat meeting or not is under investigation." All three personnel are asymptomatic, said the spokesperson.

Headline: 274 districts across India have been affected due to coronavirus till date: Govt
Description: Lav Aggarwal, Joint Secretary of Union Health Ministry said on Sunday that 274 districts in the country have been affected due to coronavirus pandemic till now. A total of 3,374 confirmed cases have been reported so far, which includes 3,030 active cases. The cases have been reported from 29 states and Union Territories.
Text: 274 districts across India have been affected due to coronavirus till date: Govt Lav Aggarwal, Joint Secretary of Union Health Ministry said on Sunday that 274 districts in the country have been affected due to coronavirus pandemic till now. A total of 3,374 confirmed cases have been reported so far, which includes 3,030 active cases. The cases have been reported from 29 states and Union Territories.

Headline: Miscreant breaks into wine shop in Hyderabad, steals liquor worth ₹25,000
Description: Amid the lockdown to curb the spread of coronavirus pandemic, a miscreant looted liquor worth ₹25,000 and ₹8,000 in cash from a wine shop in Hyderabad, police said on Saturday. CCTV footage revealed that the accused had made an entry into the shop by removing a grill on the ceiling. A case has been registered and further investigation is underway.
Text: Miscreant breaks into wine shop in Hyderabad, steals liquor worth ₹25,000 Amid the lockdown to curb the spread of coronavirus pandemic, a miscreant looted liquor worth ₹25,000 and ₹8,000 in cash from a wine shop in Hyderabad, police said on Saturday. CCTV footage revealed that the accused had made an entry into the shop by removing a grill on the ceiling. A case has been registered and further investigation is underway.

Headline: CM Yogi announces 'UP COVID Care Fund' to strengthen state health services
Description: Yogi Adityanath led UP government on Saturday announced the launch of 'UP COVID Care Fund' to strengthen health services in the state amid spread of coronavirus. "This will help in the establishment of more testing labs," said Adityanath about the fund. "We also aim to start manufacturing units for PPE kits, N95 masks and ventilators," he added.
Text: CM Yogi announces 'UP COVID Care Fund' to strengthen state health services Yogi Adityanath led UP government on Saturday announced the launch of 'UP COVID Care Fund' to strengthen health services in the state amid spread of coronavirus. "This will help in the establishment of more testing labs," said Adityanath about the fund. "We also aim to start manufacturing units for PPE kits, N95 masks and ventilators," he added.

Headline: Lokpal member tests positive for COVID-19
Description: A retired Chief Justice of Chhattisgarh High Court and presently a member of Lokpal, Ajay Kumar Tripathi, has been admitted to Delhi's AIIMS trauma centre after he tested positive for COVID-19. "We're monitoring his health conditions. We're tracing his family members to understand the source of transmission," a doctor said. So far, 445 people have contracted the infection in Delhi.
Text: Lokpal member tests positive for COVID-19 A retired Chief Justice of Chhattisgarh High Court and presently a member of Lokpal, Ajay Kumar Tripathi, has been admitted to Delhi's AIIMS trauma centre after he tested positive for COVID-19. "We're monitoring his health conditions. We're tracing his family members to understand the source of transmission," a doctor said. So far, 445 people have contracted the infection in Delhi.

Headline: 8 Malaysian citizens who attended Tablighi Jamaat event caught at IGI airport
Description: At least eight Tablighi Jamaat members were on Sunday intercepted at Delhi's IGI Airport by the immigration department when they tried to board relief flight for Malaysia. The Malaysian nationals were reportedly hiding in different parts of Delhi. The Health Ministry on Saturday said 1,023 COVID-19 positive cases found in 17 states have been traced to the Tablighi Jamaat congregation.
Text: 8 Malaysian citizens who attended Tablighi Jamaat event caught at IGI airport At least eight Tablighi Jamaat members were on Sunday intercepted at Delhi's IGI Airport by the immigration department when they tried to board relief flight for Malaysia. The Malaysian nationals were reportedly hiding in different parts of Delhi. The Health Ministry on Saturday said 1,023 COVID-19 positive cases found in 17 states have been traced to the Tablighi Jamaat congregation.

Headline: ICMR issues advisory on setting up new COVID-19 testing labs in districts
Description: The ICMR has issued an advisory for setting up of COVID-19 testing labs in districts. The setting up of a new centre would be considered if the number of suspected cases is more than 100 per day in the district and the nearest testing laboratory is over 250 km away in plains and over 150 km away in hilly regions.
Text: ICMR issues advisory on setting up new COVID-19 testing labs in districts The ICMR has issued an advisory for setting up of COVID-19 testing labs in districts. The setting up of a new centre would be considered if the number of suspected cases is more than 100 per day in the district and the nearest testing laboratory is over 250 km away in plains and over 150 km away in hilly regions.

Headline: Villagers in West Bengal clash over setting up of quarantine centre, 1 killed
Description: A man was killed in a clash between two groups of villagers allegedly over setting up of a quarantine centre at a village school in West Bengal's Birbhum on Saturday. Prima facie the man succumbed to bomb injuries, an official said. Police forces have been deployed in the village where the situation is tense but under control, the official added.
Text: Villagers in West Bengal clash over setting up of quarantine centre, 1 killed A man was killed in a clash between two groups of villagers allegedly over setting up of a quarantine centre at a village school in West Bengal's Birbhum on Saturday. Prima facie the man succumbed to bomb injuries, an official said. Police forces have been deployed in the village where the situation is tense but under control, the official added.

Headline: PM made mistake by announcing lockdown without telling states: Veerappa Moily
Description: Congress leader M Veerappa Moily on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi and the Centre made a "grave mistake" by announcing the lockdown without notifying the states. Moily said, "States could have made more preparation. This was just imposed like a shock." He added that the Centre should now tell its plan after the lockdown period ends to avoid "chaos".
Text: PM made mistake by announcing lockdown without telling states: Veerappa Moily Congress leader M Veerappa Moily on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi and the Centre made a "grave mistake" by announcing the lockdown without notifying the states. Moily said, "States could have made more preparation. This was just imposed like a shock." He added that the Centre should now tell its plan after the lockdown period ends to avoid "chaos".

Headline: Ganga water quality improves by 40-50% amid lockdown: IIT (BHU) professor
Description: Dr PK Mishra, a professor at the Chemical Engineering department in IIT (BHU) has said that the water quality of river Ganga has improved significantly with the closing of the industries that polluted the river. "One-tenth of the pollution in Ganga river comes from industries. We have seen 40-50% improvement in the Ganga. It is a significant development," Mishra said.
Text: Ganga water quality improves by 40-50% amid lockdown: IIT (BHU) professor Dr PK Mishra, a professor at the Chemical Engineering department in IIT (BHU) has said that the water quality of river Ganga has improved significantly with the closing of the industries that polluted the river. "One-tenth of the pollution in Ganga river comes from industries. We have seen 40-50% improvement in the Ganga. It is a significant development," Mishra said.

Headline: 19-yr-old man arrested for rape and murder of 8-yr-old cousin in Noida
Description: Uttar Pradesh Police on Sunday arrested a 19-year-old man for allegedly raping and murdering his eight-year-old cousin sister in Noida's Salarpur. "The girl was admitted to the Child PGI Hospital for treatment. However, she could not survive," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Zone-1 Gautam Buddha Nagar Sankalp Sharma. The girl was the daughter of the accused's maternal uncle.
Text: 19-yr-old man arrested for rape and murder of 8-yr-old cousin in Noida Uttar Pradesh Police on Sunday arrested a 19-year-old man for allegedly raping and murdering his eight-year-old cousin sister in Noida's Salarpur. "The girl was admitted to the Child PGI Hospital for treatment. However, she could not survive," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Zone-1 Gautam Buddha Nagar Sankalp Sharma. The girl was the daughter of the accused's maternal uncle.

Headline: Pregnant Muslim woman loses child in Rajasthan as docs allegedly refuse treatment
Description: A 32-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Bharatpur lost her baby after doctors at a government hospital allegedly turned her away on learning she was a Muslim. The woman's husband, Irfan Khan, alleged his wife had to deliver their child in an ambulance and their baby died due to doctors' negligence. State Health Minister Subhash Garg said the matter is being investigated.
Text: Pregnant Muslim woman loses child in Rajasthan as docs allegedly refuse treatment A 32-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Bharatpur lost her baby after doctors at a government hospital allegedly turned her away on learning she was a Muslim. The woman's husband, Irfan Khan, alleged his wife had to deliver their child in an ambulance and their baby died due to doctors' negligence. State Health Minister Subhash Garg said the matter is being investigated.

Headline: More than actors, politicians need to be role models: Arshad
Description: Arshad Warsi in a recent interview said that people came out and started celebrating after Janata Curfew was obsereved despite many actors urging them not to. "The fact is people don't listen to actors, they listen to politicians," he opined. "More than actors, it is the politicians who need to be role models," Arshad added.
Text: More than actors, politicians need to be role models: Arshad Arshad Warsi in a recent interview said that people came out and started celebrating after Janata Curfew was obsereved despite many actors urging them not to. "The fact is people don't listen to actors, they listen to politicians," he opined. "More than actors, it is the politicians who need to be role models," Arshad added.

Headline: South African cleric who attended Nizamuddin Markaz dies of COVID-19
Description: An 80-year-old South African Muslim cleric, who recently returned to South Africa after attending the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at the Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi, passed away from COVID-19 on Tuesday. No members of the cleric's family tested positive for COVID-19 and they are in self-isolation for 14 days. Reportedly, the cleric had been advised not to attend the congregation.
