Text: South African cleric who attended Nizamuddin Markaz dies of COVID-19 An 80-year-old South African Muslim cleric, who recently returned to South Africa after attending the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at the Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi, passed away from COVID-19 on Tuesday. No members of the cleric's family tested positive for COVID-19 and they are in self-isolation for 14 days. Reportedly, the cleric had been advised not to attend the congregation.

Headline: Restrictions imposed during lockdown to continue in Gautam Buddha Nagar till Apr 30
Description: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has said restrictions under Section 144 have been extended in the district till April 30. Further, the police has ordered that all restrictions imposed during the 21-day lockdown period will continue in the district till April 30. All social, political, cultural, religious, sports-related, commercial exhibitions, processions and other programmes will remain banned.
Text: Restrictions imposed during lockdown to continue in Gautam Buddha Nagar till Apr 30 The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has said restrictions under Section 144 have been extended in the district till April 30. Further, the police has ordered that all restrictions imposed during the 21-day lockdown period will continue in the district till April 30. All social, political, cultural, religious, sports-related, commercial exhibitions, processions and other programmes will remain banned.

Headline: Govt releases COVID-19 containment plan for large outbreaks as cases cross 3,000
Description: With over 3,000 coronavirus cases, government has released a 'containment plan', which follows a scenario-based approach. Geographic quarantine, which involves "near absolute interruption of movement of people" will be applicable to areas reporting multiple clusters. Containment operations will be scaled down only if no new cases are reported for at least 4 weeks after the last confirmed test.
Text: Govt releases COVID-19 containment plan for large outbreaks as cases cross 3,000 With over 3,000 coronavirus cases, government has released a 'containment plan', which follows a scenario-based approach. Geographic quarantine, which involves "near absolute interruption of movement of people" will be applicable to areas reporting multiple clusters. Containment operations will be scaled down only if no new cases are reported for at least 4 weeks after the last confirmed test.

Headline: People in Tamil Nadu can buy essentials between 6 am to 1 pm: CM
Description: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami on Saturday announced that people in the state will be allowed to buy essentials only between 6 am and 1 pm. He said that all markets should strictly follow the prescribed physical distancing norms and advised against any type of religious congregation. Over 480 cases have been reported from Tamil Nadu so far.
Text: People in Tamil Nadu can buy essentials between 6 am to 1 pm: CM Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami on Saturday announced that people in the state will be allowed to buy essentials only between 6 am and 1 pm. He said that all markets should strictly follow the prescribed physical distancing norms and advised against any type of religious congregation. Over 480 cases have been reported from Tamil Nadu so far.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 3,374; death toll reaches 77
Description: The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 3,374, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Sunday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 77 in the country. Out of the total cases, 3,030 cases are active, while 267 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 3,374; death toll reaches 77 The number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 3,374, the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said on Sunday. Meanwhile, the death toll due to coronavirus has surged to 77 in the country. Out of the total cases, 3,030 cases are active, while 267 patients have been cured, discharged or migrated.

Headline: Govt releases advisory to start rapid antibody test for coronavirus at hotspots
Description: The government has decided to allow rapid antibody testing for all symptomatic individuals at coronavirus hotspots in the country. If the antibody test result is positive, the person must be treated in hospital or isolation as per protocol and contact tracing should be initiated. Coronavirus cases in India have risen to 3,374, while the death toll has reached 77.
Text: Govt releases advisory to start rapid antibody test for coronavirus at hotspots The government has decided to allow rapid antibody testing for all symptomatic individuals at coronavirus hotspots in the country. If the antibody test result is positive, the person must be treated in hospital or isolation as per protocol and contact tracing should be initiated. Coronavirus cases in India have risen to 3,374, while the death toll has reached 77.

Headline: Trump requests PM Modi to release Hydroxychloroquine ordered by US
Description: As coronavirus deaths in the US exceeded 8,400, President Donald Trump has said he has requested PM Narendra Modi to release the amount of Hydroxychloroquine ordered by the US after India banned its export. "They make large amounts of Hydroxychloroquine. India is giving it a serious consideration," he added. Trump spoke to PM Modi on Saturday.
Text: Trump requests PM Modi to release Hydroxychloroquine ordered by US As coronavirus deaths in the US exceeded 8,400, President Donald Trump has said he has requested PM Narendra Modi to release the amount of Hydroxychloroquine ordered by the US after India banned its export. "They make large amounts of Hydroxychloroquine. India is giving it a serious consideration," he added. Trump spoke to PM Modi on Saturday.

Headline: 3 Air India passengers from separate flights test positive for COVID-19
Description: Air India has informed that a passenger on AI661 which flew from Mumbai to Goa on March 19 has tested COVID-19 positive. Another passenger on AI883 from Mumbai to Goa on March 22 also tested positive. One on AI101 from Mumbai to Delhi on March 22 and was also onboard AI415 from Delhi to Patna on March 23 tested positive.
Text: 3 Air India passengers from separate flights test positive for COVID-19 Air India has informed that a passenger on AI661 which flew from Mumbai to Goa on March 19 has tested COVID-19 positive. Another passenger on AI883 from Mumbai to Goa on March 22 also tested positive. One on AI101 from Mumbai to Delhi on March 22 and was also onboard AI415 from Delhi to Patna on March 23 tested positive.

Headline: JNU student threatens to spread COVID-19 when stopped from leaving campus
Description: Police booked a JNU student for allegedly violating lockdown and threatening to cough up to spread COVID-19 when he was stopped from leaving campus. The student said he had warden's permission and wanted to go out because of an emergency. A scuffle broke out between security officials and the student after they tried to remove him from the university gate.
Text: JNU student threatens to spread COVID-19 when stopped from leaving campus Police booked a JNU student for allegedly violating lockdown and threatening to cough up to spread COVID-19 when he was stopped from leaving campus. The student said he had warden's permission and wanted to go out because of an emergency. A scuffle broke out between security officials and the student after they tried to remove him from the university gate.

Headline: Postman in Odisha tests COVID-19 +ve, govt asks thousands to self-quarantine
Description: The Odisha government on Saturday asked thousands of people in Bhubaneswar to quarantine themselves a day after a postman tested positive for COVID-19. The postman had returned from Delhi on March 10, an official said. He delivered letters in Goutam Nagar, Khurda district and sessions court area where many lawyers, litigants and policemen come daily, officials said.
Text: Postman in Odisha tests COVID-19 +ve, govt asks thousands to self-quarantine  The Odisha government on Saturday asked thousands of people in Bhubaneswar to quarantine themselves a day after a postman tested positive for COVID-19. The postman had returned from Delhi on March 10, an official said. He delivered letters in Goutam Nagar, Khurda district and sessions court area where many lawyers, litigants and policemen come daily, officials said.

Headline: 37-yr-old man, suspected to be COVID-19 patient, attempts suicide at Delhi hospital
Description: A 37-year-old man, suspected to be a patient of coronavirus, injured himself after he allegedly tried to commit suicide by jumping from the third floor of a hospital in Delhi. The police said the incident took place on Saturday at around 11:30 pm. "The doctors said he's stable now. The results of his coronavirus test are still pending," police added.
Text: 37-yr-old man, suspected to be COVID-19 patient, attempts suicide at Delhi hospital A 37-year-old man, suspected to be a patient of coronavirus, injured himself after he allegedly tried to commit suicide by jumping from the third floor of a hospital in Delhi. The police said the incident took place on Saturday at around 11:30 pm. "The doctors said he's stable now. The results of his coronavirus test are still pending," police added.

Headline: 7 out of 10 COVID-19 patients cured in Chhattisgarh: CM Bhupesh Baghel
Description: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday tweeted that seven out of 10 COVID-19 patients in the state have recovered. "Three more to go," Baghel wrote. The total number of COVID-19 cases in India has crossed 3,000 and the death toll due to the infection has reached 77, as per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.
Text: 7 out of 10 COVID-19 patients cured in Chhattisgarh: CM Bhupesh Baghel Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday tweeted that seven out of 10 COVID-19 patients in the state have recovered. "Three more to go," Baghel wrote. The total number of COVID-19 cases in India has crossed 3,000 and the death toll due to the infection has reached 77, as per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

Headline: COVID-19 test, treatment to be free for 50 crore Ayushman Bharat beneficiaries
Description: The central government will provide free coronavirus testing and treatment facilities to over 50 crore beneficiaries of Ayushman Bharat health insurance scheme, said the National Health Authority (NHA). Beneficiaries will be able to avail the free services at private labs and empanelled hospitals, NHA said. Testing and treatment for coronavirus is already free in public facilities, it added.
Text: COVID-19 test, treatment to be free for 50 crore Ayushman Bharat beneficiaries The central government will provide free coronavirus testing and treatment facilities to over 50 crore beneficiaries of Ayushman Bharat health insurance scheme, said the National Health Authority (NHA). Beneficiaries will be able to avail the free services at private labs and empanelled hospitals, NHA said. Testing and treatment for coronavirus is already free in public facilities, it added.

Headline: No plan to close border, Tamil Nadu people our brothers: Kerala CM Vijayan
Description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has rubbished reports that stated Kerala has closed its border with Tamil Nadu. Vijayan added that "the people of Tamil Nadu are not just Kerala's neighbours, but brothers". "Not just blocking roads with mud embankments, Kerala will not do any kind of blockades. It is fake news that has surfaced to mislead people," said Vijayan.
Text: No plan to close border, Tamil Nadu people our brothers: Kerala CM Vijayan Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has rubbished reports that stated Kerala has closed its border with Tamil Nadu. Vijayan added that "the people of Tamil Nadu are not just Kerala's neighbours, but brothers". "Not just blocking roads with mud embankments, Kerala will not do any kind of blockades. It is fake news that has surfaced to mislead people," said Vijayan.

Headline: PM talks to Trump, discusses India-US partnership to fight COVID-19
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that he had a telephone conversation with US President Donald Trump over the coronavirus pandemic. The PM said the two leaders agreed "to deploy the full strength of the India-US partnership to fight COVID-19". Coronavirus cases in the US crossed 2,70,000 with over 7,000 deaths while India confirmed over 3,000 cases with 75 deaths.
Text: PM talks to Trump, discusses India-US partnership to fight COVID-19 Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that he had a telephone conversation with US President Donald Trump over the coronavirus pandemic. The PM said the two leaders agreed "to deploy the full strength of the India-US partnership to fight COVID-19". Coronavirus cases in the US crossed 2,70,000 with over 7,000 deaths while India confirmed over 3,000 cases with 75 deaths.

Headline: Which 17 states and UTs have reported COVID-19 cases linked with Tablighi Jamaat?
Description: The government has said that 1,023 coronavirus cases have been linked with Tablighi Jamaat across 17 states and Union Territories. They include Tamil Nadu (437), Delhi (301), Andhra Pradesh (140), Assam (24), Himachal Pradesh (3), Arunachal Pradesh (1), Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, J&K, Telangana, Karnataka, Andaman and Nicobar, Uttarakhand, Haryana, Maharashtra, Kerala, and Jharkhand.
Text: Which 17 states and UTs have reported COVID-19 cases linked with Tablighi Jamaat? The government has said that 1,023 coronavirus cases have been linked with Tablighi Jamaat across 17 states and Union Territories. They include Tamil Nadu (437), Delhi (301), Andhra Pradesh (140), Assam (24), Himachal Pradesh (3), Arunachal Pradesh (1), Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, J&K, Telangana, Karnataka, Andaman and Nicobar, Uttarakhand, Haryana, Maharashtra, Kerala, and Jharkhand.

Headline: It's a daily battle: Health Secy on measures to control COVID-19 spread
Description: Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday responded to a question on whether India was successful in breaking the chain of COVID-19 transmission, by saying, "It's a daily battle". He emphasised on unity and coordination saying that one day's failure could ruin any progress made. "Only if all guidelines are properly followed, can we win this fight," said Agarwal.
Text: It's a daily battle: Health Secy on measures to control COVID-19 spread Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday responded to a question on whether India was successful in breaking the chain of COVID-19 transmission, by saying, "It's a daily battle". He emphasised on unity and coordination saying that one day's failure could ruin any progress made. "Only if all guidelines are properly followed, can we win this fight," said Agarwal.

Headline: Punjab govt launches 'COVA' app to let citizens order groceries, essential goods
Description: The Punjab government has launched an application that lets people request the delivery of groceries and other essential goods amid the lockdown due to coronavirus. Named "COVA", the app lets local vendors register themselves and enlist their delivery executives for passes. Initially, the service was available on calls, but several users reportedly complained that the number was busy or invalid.
Text: Punjab govt launches 'COVA' app to let citizens order groceries, essential goods The Punjab government has launched an application that lets people request the delivery of groceries and other essential goods amid the lockdown due to coronavirus. Named "COVA", the app lets local vendors register themselves and enlist their delivery executives for passes. Initially, the service was available on calls, but several users reportedly complained that the number was busy or invalid.

Headline: China must be boycotted for endangering the world: Ramdev on COVID-19
Description: Yoga guru Ramdev on Saturday blamed China for coronavirus pandemic, saying it should be boycotted politically and economically by the international community for the "inhuman, immoral" act of putting the world in "grave danger". India being the world's largest democracy "should take initiative" in this regard, he added. The virus first emerged in Wuhan city of Hubei province in China.
Text: China must be boycotted for endangering the world: Ramdev on COVID-19 Yoga guru Ramdev on Saturday blamed China for coronavirus pandemic, saying it should be boycotted politically and economically by the international community for the "inhuman, immoral" act of putting the world in "grave danger". India being the world's largest democracy "should take initiative" in this regard, he added. The virus first emerged in Wuhan city of Hubei province in China.

Headline: Proud of you: Pak ATC tells Air India pilots flying special flights
Description: Air India flew special flights to Germany with relief materials and evacuated Europeans. "We're proud of you that in a pandemic situation you're operating flights, Good Luck!" Pakistan Air Traffic Controller told pilots of one of the flights. "It was a proud moment for me as well as the entire Air India crew," a senior Air India captain told ANI.
Text: Proud of you: Pak ATC tells Air India pilots flying special flights Air India flew special flights to Germany with relief materials and evacuated Europeans. "We're proud of you that in a pandemic situation you're operating flights, Good Luck!" Pakistan Air Traffic Controller told pilots of one of the flights. "It was a proud moment for me as well as the entire Air India crew," a senior Air India captain told ANI.

Headline: Action against social media platforms allowing COVID-19 fake news: RS Prasad
Description: Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has warned of strict action against social media companies if they allow fake news on COVID-19 on their platforms. "We came across objectionable videos and news in these testing times on social media platforms," Prasad was quoted as saying by ANI. "We expect them to avoid allowing such content and act [responsibly]," he added.
Text: Action against social media platforms allowing COVID-19 fake news: RS Prasad Union IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad has warned of strict action against social media companies if they allow fake news on COVID-19 on their platforms. "We came across objectionable videos and news in these testing times on social media platforms," Prasad was quoted as saying by ANI. "We expect them to avoid allowing such content and act [responsibly]," he added.

Headline: 3 arrested for attacking policewoman on lockdown duty in Bengaluru
Description: Bengaluru Police arrested three men for assaulting a woman constable on lockdown duty when she stopped them for defying lockdown norms. The three men, who were riding triples on a bike, misbehaved with the constable and dragged her a few feet when she tried to catch them. The incident left the policewoman injured in the eyes, chin and legs.
Text: 3 arrested for attacking policewoman on lockdown duty in Bengaluru Bengaluru Police arrested three men for assaulting a woman constable on lockdown duty when she stopped them for defying lockdown norms. The three men, who were riding triples on a bike, misbehaved with the constable and dragged her a few feet when she tried to catch them. The incident left the policewoman injured in the eyes, chin and legs.

Headline: Indian Army kills 9 terrorists in J&K in last 24 hours; 1 soldier martyred
Description: As many as nine terrorists have been killed by the Indian Army in the last 24 hours in two separate operations in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. Four terrorists were killed in south Kashmir's Kulgam on Saturday and five others were killed in Kupwara on Sunday, they added. "In this operation, one soldier has been martyred," a senior official said.
Text: Indian Army kills 9 terrorists in J&K in last 24 hours; 1 soldier martyred As many as nine terrorists have been killed by the Indian Army in the last 24 hours in two separate operations in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. Four terrorists were killed in south Kashmir's Kulgam on Saturday and five others were killed in Kupwara on Sunday, they added. "In this operation, one soldier has been martyred," a senior official said.

Headline: SRK quotes Tagore as WB CM Mamata thanks him for contribution
Description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee took to Twitter to thank Shah Rukh Khan for his contribution amid coronavirus pandemic. "Your contribution will help...distressed people," she added. Khan replied to her in Bengali and quoted Rabindranath Tagore, "I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy."
Text: SRK quotes Tagore as WB CM Mamata thanks him for contribution West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee took to Twitter to thank Shah Rukh Khan for his contribution amid coronavirus pandemic. "Your contribution will help...distressed people," she added. Khan replied to her in Bengali and quoted Rabindranath Tagore, "I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy."

Headline: Let's light lamps, spread awareness on COVID-19 at 9 pm: Ram
Description: Sharing a video of himself on Twitter, south Indian actor Ram Charan urged people to light lamps for 9 minutes on Sunday at 9 pm. "I'm proud of everyone who has faithfully been abiding by the lockdown! My love to you all," he wrote. "With the same spirit, let's...come together to spread awareness [about coronavirus]...at 9 pm," Ram added.
Text: Let's light lamps, spread awareness on COVID-19 at 9 pm: Ram Sharing a video of himself on Twitter, south Indian actor Ram Charan urged people to light lamps for 9 minutes on Sunday at 9 pm. "I'm proud of everyone who has faithfully been abiding by the lockdown! My love to you all," he wrote. "With the same spirit, let's...come together to spread awareness [about coronavirus]...at 9 pm," Ram added.

Headline: Nayanthara donates ₹20L to FEFSI to help daily wage workers
Description: South Indian actress Nayanthara has donated ₹20 lakh to the Film Employees Federation of South India (FEFSI) to help daily wage workers who are affected by the nationwide lockdown. Earlier, other actors including Rajinikanth, Vijay Sethupathi, Nagarjuna Akkineni and Ram Charan had also donated funds to FEFSI. The lockdown, aimed to counter coronavirus pandemic, will be lifted on April 14.
Text: Nayanthara donates ₹20L to FEFSI to help daily wage workers South Indian actress Nayanthara has donated ₹20 lakh to the Film Employees Federation of South India (FEFSI) to help daily wage workers who are affected by the nationwide lockdown. Earlier, other actors including Rajinikanth, Vijay Sethupathi, Nagarjuna Akkineni and Ram Charan had also donated funds to FEFSI. The lockdown, aimed to counter coronavirus pandemic, will be lifted on April 14.

Headline: Pakistan has no locus-standi on any aspect related to J&K: India
Description: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has said Pakistan has "no locus-standi whatsoever" on any aspect pertaining to J&K and its repeated attempts to interfere in India's internal affairs won't make its claims acceptable. If Pakistan wants to contribute to the welfare of people of J&K, it could do so by ending cross-border terrorism and false propaganda, the MEA added.
Text: Pakistan has no locus-standi on any aspect related to J&K: India The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has said Pakistan has "no locus-standi whatsoever" on any aspect pertaining to J&K and its repeated attempts to interfere in India's internal affairs won't make its claims acceptable. If Pakistan wants to contribute to the welfare of people of J&K, it could do so by ending cross-border terrorism and false propaganda, the MEA added.

Headline: Total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh rises to 227: Govt
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has risen to 227, including 21 people who have been discharged, UP Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan said on Saturday. "Coronavirus cases have increased in the state after 94 people who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event were identified and tested positive," Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi said.
Text: Total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh rises to 227: Govt The total number of coronavirus cases in Uttar Pradesh has risen to 227, including 21 people who have been discharged, UP Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan said on Saturday. "Coronavirus cases have increased in the state after 94 people who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event were identified and tested positive," Additional Chief Secretary (Home) Awanish Awasthi said.

Headline: Govt responds amid concerns grid will fail if lights switched off over PM's request
Description: Amid concerns that power grid will fail if all lights are switched off at once over PM Narendra Modi's request to light candle or diya, the government said, "No need to worry, adequate protocols/arrangements are in place to handle the variation in demand." "There is no call to switch off either street lights or appliances at home," government added.
Text: Govt responds amid concerns grid will fail if lights switched off over PM's request Amid concerns that power grid will fail if all lights are switched off at once over PM Narendra Modi's request to light candle or diya, the government said, "No need to worry, adequate protocols/arrangements are in place to handle the variation in demand." "There is no call to switch off either street lights or appliances at home," government added.

Headline: Only 40 out of Delhi's 445 coronavirus cases are locally transmitted: Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal today said that 59 new cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Delhi in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 445. He further said that only 40 of the 445 cases are locally transmitted, adding that the rest are either foreign travel or Nizamuddin Markaz related cases.
Text: Only 40 out of Delhi's 445 coronavirus cases are locally transmitted: Kejriwal Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal today said that 59 new cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Delhi in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of cases in the national capital to 445. He further said that only 40 of the 445 cases are locally transmitted, adding that the rest are either foreign travel or Nizamuddin Markaz related cases.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in India rises to 75, total cases cross 3,000
Description: The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to 75, with Maharashtra reporting the most number of deaths so far, as per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Further, the total number of cases has risen to 3,072, out of which 2,784 cases are active. As many as 212 COVID-19 patients in India have recovered.
Text: Coronavirus death toll in India rises to 75, total cases cross 3,000 The death toll due to coronavirus in India has risen to 75, with Maharashtra reporting the most number of deaths so far, as per the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Further, the total number of cases has risen to 3,072, out of which 2,784 cases are active. As many as 212 COVID-19 patients in India have recovered.

Headline: TN reports 74 new COVID-19 cases today, 73 of them attended Tablighi event
Description: Tamil Nadu on Saturday reported 74 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 485. Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said 73 of them had attended the Tablighi Jamaat event. The state has recorded 3 deaths so far including 2 from Saturday. As many as 437 of the 485 cases are linked to Tablighi Jamaat event.
Text: TN reports 74 new COVID-19 cases today, 73 of them attended Tablighi event Tamil Nadu on Saturday reported 74 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 485. Health Secretary Beela Rajesh said 73 of them had attended the Tablighi Jamaat event. The state has recorded 3 deaths so far including 2 from Saturday. As many as 437 of the 485 cases are linked to Tablighi Jamaat event.

Headline: Total coronavirus cases in Maharashtra rises to 537; 50 patients recovered
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra has risen to 537. This comes after 47 new cases were identified in Mumbai, Thane, Amravati, Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune. Further, Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope revealed that 50 patients have recovered and have been discharged from the hospital. The total number of cases in India has crossed 3,000.
Text: Total coronavirus cases in Maharashtra rises to 537; 50 patients recovered The total number of coronavirus cases in Maharashtra has risen to 537. This comes after 47 new cases were identified in Mumbai, Thane, Amravati, Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune. Further, Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope revealed that 50 patients have recovered and have been discharged from the hospital. The total number of cases in India has crossed 3,000.

Headline: 108 Delhi hospital staff members quarantined after contact with Covid-19 patients
Description: As many as 108 staff members, including doctors and nurses, of Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital have been quarantined after they came in contact with two coronavirus patients, the hospital administration said. Of the 108 members, 85 are in home-quarantine and 23 members are in hospital. At least 386 people have tested coronavirus positive in Delhi, health ministry stated.
Text: 108 Delhi hospital staff members quarantined after contact with Covid-19 patients As many as 108 staff members, including doctors and nurses, of Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital have been quarantined after they came in contact with two coronavirus patients, the hospital administration said. Of the 108 members, 85 are in home-quarantine and 23 members are in hospital. At least 386 people have tested coronavirus positive in Delhi, health ministry stated.

Headline: What are the age groups of coronavirus cases reported in India so far?
Description: The Government on Saturday revealed age groups of coronavirus cases reported in India so far. It said that around 9% of the cases belong to 0-20 years age group, while nearly 42% are from 21-40 years age group. "Around 33% of the cases are aged between 41-60 years and nearly 17% cases are aged above 60 years," it added.
Text: What are the age groups of coronavirus cases reported in India so far? The Government on Saturday revealed age groups of coronavirus cases reported in India so far. It said that around 9% of the cases belong to 0-20 years age group, while nearly 42% are from 21-40 years age group. "Around 33% of the cases are aged between 41-60 years and nearly 17% cases are aged above 60 years," it added.

Headline: Shining torches won't help, need to test more: Rahul on PM's '9 pm 9 mins' appeal
Description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that India is "simply not testing enough to fight COVID-19 virus". Referring to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to people to light diyas, torches for nine minutes at 9 pm on April 5 to challenge darkness of coronavirus, Gandhi said, "Making people clap and shining torches in sky isn't going to solve the problem."
Text: Shining torches won't help, need to test more: Rahul on PM's '9 pm 9 mins' appeal Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that India is "simply not testing enough to fight COVID-19 virus". Referring to PM Narendra Modi's appeal to people to light diyas, torches for nine minutes at 9 pm on April 5 to challenge darkness of coronavirus, Gandhi said, "Making people clap and shining torches in sky isn't going to solve the problem."

Headline: Lifting of curbs depends on compliance to rules: Maha CM tells people
Description: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that lifting lockdown in the state after April 14 depends on people's compliance to government orders. "Coronavirus is playing a game of patience with us. There is no dearth of courage, discipline and confidence among people of [Maharashtra]," said Thackeray in a webcast. "Self-confidence is important (in this crisis)", he added.
Text: Lifting of curbs depends on compliance to rules: Maha CM tells people Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that lifting lockdown in the state after April 14 depends on people's compliance to government orders. "Coronavirus is playing a game of patience with us. There is no dearth of courage, discipline and confidence among people of [Maharashtra]," said Thackeray in a webcast. "Self-confidence is important (in this crisis)", he added.

Headline: Viral image of PM Modi announcing lockdown extended till May 4 is fake: Govt
Description: A picture of a video grab purportedly showing Prime Minister Narendra Modi announcing that the lockdown has been extended till May 4 is fake, the government has said. "There has been no such announcement of 'extension of lockdown'," Press Information Bureau said. Currently, India is under lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic till April 14.
Text: Viral image of PM Modi announcing lockdown extended till May 4 is fake: Govt A picture of a video grab purportedly showing Prime Minister Narendra Modi announcing that the lockdown has been extended till May 4 is fake, the government has said. "There has been no such announcement of 'extension of lockdown'," Press Information Bureau said. Currently, India is under lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic till April 14.

Headline: Doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India less than most of other countries: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday said that the doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India is less than most of the other countries. He added that it was made possible due to the government's proactive, preemptive and graded response. India has reported 2,902 coronavirus cases so far across 29 states and Union Territories.
Text: Doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India less than most of other countries: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday said that the doubling rate of coronavirus cases in India is less than most of the other countries. He added that it was made possible due to the government's proactive, preemptive and graded response. India has reported 2,902 coronavirus cases so far across 29 states and Union Territories.

Headline: COVID-19 +ve MP journo present at Kamal Nath's resignation presser, tests -ve
Description: A journalist in Bhopal, MP who tested positive for COVID-19 after attending the press conference where former CM Kamal Nath announced his resignation, has now tested negative for the virus. His daughter, who also tested positive earlier, has tested negative and the father-daughter duo has been discharged from the hospital. The journalist was booked for attending the press conference.
Text: COVID-19 +ve MP journo present at Kamal Nath's resignation presser, tests -ve A journalist in Bhopal, MP who tested positive for COVID-19 after attending the press conference where former CM Kamal Nath announced his resignation, has now tested negative for the virus. His daughter, who also tested positive earlier, has tested negative and the father-daughter duo has been discharged from the hospital. The journalist was booked for attending the press conference.

Headline: 40 on morning walk in Kerala arrested after drones catch them violating lockdown
Description: Forty people who ventured out for a morning walk in Ernakulam on Saturday were arrested by the police for breaking lockdown rules amid COVID-19. Police said they had been going for a morning walk for the last few days despite warning. They were spotted by drones installed by the police to identify people who gather by breaking the regulations.
Text: 40 on morning walk in Kerala arrested after drones catch them violating lockdown Forty people who ventured out for a morning walk in Ernakulam on Saturday were arrested by the police for breaking lockdown rules amid COVID-19. Police said they had been going for a morning walk for the last few days despite warning. They were spotted by drones installed by the police to identify people who gather by breaking the regulations.

Headline: Maharashtra man held for licking, wiping nose on currency notes in video
Description: A man was arrested in Malegaon, Maharashtra for making a video showing him licking and wiping his nose on currency notes amid coronavirus spread. Sayyad Jameel Sayyad Babu is heard saying in the video that "coronavirus has no remedy as it is divine punishment". Cyber Crime police took note of the video after it surfaced on social media.
Text: Maharashtra man held for licking, wiping nose on currency notes in video A man was arrested in Malegaon, Maharashtra for making a video showing him licking and wiping his nose on currency notes amid coronavirus spread. Sayyad Jameel Sayyad Babu is heard saying in the video that "coronavirus has no remedy as it is divine punishment". Cyber Crime police took note of the video after it surfaced on social media.

Headline: Over one-third of all coronavirus cases in India linked with Tablighi Jamaat: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday said that 1,023 coronavirus cases (over one-third) of all the 2,902 cases in India are linked with Tablighi Jamaat and have been found across 17 states. Around 22,000 people including Tablighi Jamaat workers and their contacts have been quarantined, the Ministry of Home Affairs said.
Text: Over one-third of all coronavirus cases in India linked with Tablighi Jamaat: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Saturday said that 1,023 coronavirus cases (over one-third) of all the 2,902 cases in India are linked with Tablighi Jamaat and have been found across 17 states. Around 22,000 people including Tablighi Jamaat workers and their contacts have been quarantined, the Ministry of Home Affairs said.

Headline: J&K Madarsa offers hostel building for setting up COVID-19 quarantine unit
Description: Madarsa Gunyat-Uloom Akhyar Pura in Doda district of Jammu and Kashmir has offered its hostel building for setting up a COVID-19 quarantine facility, said its management on Saturday. "We've kept 100 beds with washrooms, kitchen ready to be used," said the Madarsa's principal. The locality has a large population and no hospital for putting patients in quarantine, he added.
Text: J&K Madarsa offers hostel building for setting up COVID-19 quarantine unit Madarsa Gunyat-Uloom Akhyar Pura in Doda district of Jammu and Kashmir has offered its hostel building for setting up a COVID-19 quarantine facility, said its management on Saturday. "We've kept 100 beds with washrooms, kitchen ready to be used," said the Madarsa's principal. The locality has a large population and no hospital for putting patients in quarantine, he added.

Headline: Stop publicity of AYUSH-related claims for COVID-19: Press Council to media
Description: The Press Council of India has issued an advisory asking the print media to stop publicity and advertisement of AYUSH-related claims for coronavirus treatment. The council said this needs to be done to prevent spread of misleading information about AYUSH drugs in view of the "emerging threat". Earlier, the Ministry of AYUSH issued directions to stop publicity of such claims.
Text: Stop publicity of AYUSH-related claims for COVID-19: Press Council to media The Press Council of India has issued an advisory asking the print media to stop publicity and advertisement of AYUSH-related claims for coronavirus treatment. The council said this needs to be done to prevent spread of misleading information about AYUSH drugs in view of the "emerging threat". Earlier, the Ministry of AYUSH issued directions to stop publicity of such claims.

Headline: Aren't we done with posting cooking videos, food pics yet: Sania Mirza
Description: Tennis player Sania Mirza has criticised people for posting cooking videos and food pictures on various social media platforms amid the lockdown over coronavirus pandemic. She tweeted, "Just spare a thought - there are hundreds of thousands of people, specially in our side of the world starving to death and struggling to find food once a day if they're lucky."
Text: Aren't we done with posting cooking videos, food pics yet: Sania Mirza Tennis player Sania Mirza has criticised people for posting cooking videos and food pictures on various social media platforms amid the lockdown over coronavirus pandemic. She tweeted, "Just spare a thought - there are hundreds of thousands of people, specially in our side of the world starving to death and struggling to find food once a day if they're lucky."

Headline: Muzaffarnagar Police to home deliver FIRs to lockdown violators
Description: The police in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district have said they will "home deliver" FIRs registered against those violating the lockdown due to coronavirus. They have urged people to make videos of the violators and send it to them so that they can be booked. SSP Abhishek Yadav said offenders will be arrested if they violate lockdown for the second time.
Text: Muzaffarnagar Police to home deliver FIRs to lockdown violators The police in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district have said they will "home deliver" FIRs registered against those violating the lockdown due to coronavirus. They have urged people to make videos of the violators and send it to them so that they can be booked. SSP Abhishek Yadav said offenders will be arrested if they violate lockdown for the second time.

Headline: PM Modi to discuss COVID-19 with floor leaders of political parties on April 8
Description: PM Narendra Modi will interact with floor leaders of various political parties through video conferencing on April 8 to discuss issues related to coronavirus, said Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday. The video conference is scheduled for 11 am. This comes as coronavirus cases in India crossed 3,000 and the death toll rose to 75.
Text: PM Modi to discuss COVID-19 with floor leaders of political parties on April 8 PM Narendra Modi will interact with floor leaders of various political parties through video conferencing on April 8 to discuss issues related to coronavirus, said Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday. The video conference is scheduled for 11 am. This comes as coronavirus cases in India crossed 3,000 and the death toll rose to 75.

Headline: Haven't received even one PPE kit from Union govt so far: Delhi CM Kejriwal
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that there is a shortage of PPE kits for health workers in Delhi amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added, "We have written to the Centre to supply the kits, essential for our doctors and nurses. But we haven't received even one PPE kit from the Union government so far."
Text: Haven't received even one PPE kit from Union govt so far: Delhi CM Kejriwal Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that there is a shortage of PPE kits for health workers in Delhi amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added, "We have written to the Centre to supply the kits, essential for our doctors and nurses. But we haven't received even one PPE kit from the Union government so far."

Headline: 2 Tamil Nadu fishermen consume aftershave lotion as substitute for alcohol, die
Description: Two fishermen in Pudukkottai district in Tamil Nadu lost their lives after they consumed aftershave lotion mixed with cold drinks in a suspected case of alcohol withdrawal. The duo started vomiting and crying out due to pain after which some people rushed them to a nearby hospital, where they succumbed. One of their friends is critical.
Text: 2 Tamil Nadu fishermen consume aftershave lotion as substitute for alcohol, die Two fishermen in Pudukkottai district in Tamil Nadu lost their lives after they consumed aftershave lotion mixed with cold drinks in a suspected case of alcohol withdrawal. The duo started vomiting and crying out due to pain after which some people rushed them to a nearby hospital, where they succumbed. One of their friends is critical.

Headline: 2 men arrested for selling liquor during lockdown in B'luru, 100 bottles seized
Description: Bengaluru police have arrested two men for selling liquor illegally at high prices during the coronavirus lockdown. The duo, identified as Dhananjay and Sanjay, had stored the bottles in their flat in an apartment building in RT Nagar. The police raided the flat after receiving a tip-off and seized 100 bottles worth ₹1.25 lakh.
Text: 2 men arrested for selling liquor during lockdown in B'luru, 100 bottles seized Bengaluru police have arrested two men for selling liquor illegally at high prices during the coronavirus lockdown. The duo, identified as Dhananjay and Sanjay, had stored the bottles in their flat in an apartment building in RT Nagar. The police raided the flat after receiving a tip-off and seized 100 bottles worth ₹1.25 lakh.

Headline: Anurag says 'from where will we get diya' after PM's speech, gets trolled
Description: Anurag Kashyap was trolled for saying, "From where will we get candles or diyas?" after PM Narendra Modi's speech wherein he urged people to light candles, diyas or torches for nine minutes on Sunday. "Classic case of selective listening disorder," a user wrote, while another wrote, "You mean you're using such an outdated mobile which doesn't even have a torch?"
Text: Anurag says 'from where will we get diya' after PM's speech, gets trolled Anurag Kashyap was trolled for saying, "From where will we get candles or diyas?" after PM Narendra Modi's speech wherein he urged people to light candles, diyas or torches for nine minutes on Sunday. "Classic case of selective listening disorder," a user wrote, while another wrote, "You mean you're using such an outdated mobile which doesn't even have a torch?"

Headline: Empower states, give ₹1 lakh cr package to fight COVID-19: Cong to govt
Description: The Congress has asked the Centre to empower state governments by providing a ₹1 lakh crore package to fight the coronavirus, besides the release of pending GST dues of ₹42,000 crore. Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate raised the demand for providing loans to states at 0% interest and urged the RBI to enable such facilities in consultation with the government.
Text: Empower states, give ₹1 lakh cr package to fight COVID-19: Cong to govt The Congress has asked the Centre to empower state governments by providing a ₹1 lakh crore package to fight the coronavirus, besides the release of pending GST dues of ₹42,000 crore. Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate raised the demand for providing loans to states at 0% interest and urged the RBI to enable such facilities in consultation with the government.

Headline: 601 coronavirus cases reported on Friday: Government
Description: Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Aggarwal on Saturday said that 601 coronavirus cases were reported on Friday, adding that 12 people died yesterday. "We have released a containment plan for large outbreaks of coronavirus. The plan is available on our website," he further said. India has so far reported over 2,900 coronavirus cases.
Text: 601 coronavirus cases reported on Friday: Government Health Ministry's Joint Secretary Lav Aggarwal on Saturday said that 601 coronavirus cases were reported on Friday, adding that 12 people died yesterday. "We have released a containment plan for large outbreaks of coronavirus. The plan is available on our website," he further said. India has so far reported over 2,900 coronavirus cases.

Headline: Out of 386 Covid-19 patients in Delhi, 259 from Nizamuddin Markaz: Delhi Minister
Description: Delhi Health Minister Satyendra Jain on Saturday said there are 386 positive cases of Covid-19 in the national capital, of which 259 are from the religious congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz. Meanwhile, Jain added that 600 people linked to the event have been quarantined in Delhi in the past two days and efforts are underway to trace all their contacts.
Text: Out of 386 Covid-19 patients in Delhi, 259 from Nizamuddin Markaz: Delhi Minister Delhi Health Minister Satyendra Jain on Saturday said there are 386 positive cases of Covid-19 in the national capital, of which 259 are from the religious congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz. Meanwhile, Jain added that 600 people linked to the event have been quarantined in Delhi in the past two days and efforts are underway to trace all their contacts.

Headline: SRK offers 4-storey office space to BMC, to be used as Covid-19 quarantine centre
Description: Shah Rukh Khan and wife Gauri Khan have offered their four-storey personal office space in Mumbai's Bandra to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) amid the coronavirus pandemic. "[It will] help expand our quarantine capacity equipped with essentials for quarantined children, women & elderly," BMC tweeted. "We thank @iamsrk & @gaurikhan...Indeed a thoughtful & timely gesture!" BMC added.
Text: SRK offers 4-storey office space to BMC, to be used as Covid-19 quarantine centre Shah Rukh Khan and wife Gauri Khan have offered their four-storey personal office space in Mumbai's Bandra to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) amid the coronavirus pandemic. "[It will] help expand our quarantine capacity equipped with essentials for quarantined children, women & elderly," BMC tweeted. "We thank @iamsrk & @gaurikhan...Indeed a thoughtful & timely gesture!" BMC added.

Headline: Govt restricts diagnostic kits' export with immediate effect amid COVID-19 spread
Description: Central government on Saturday restricted the export of diagnostic kits with "immediate effect", said a Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) notification. The kits are required for testing of patients amid spread of coronavirus. This comes as coronavirus cases in India surged to nearly 3,000 and the death toll due to the virus reached 68.
Text: Govt restricts diagnostic kits' export with immediate effect amid COVID-19 spread Central government on Saturday restricted the export of diagnostic kits with "immediate effect", said a Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) notification. The kits are required for testing of patients amid spread of coronavirus. This comes as coronavirus cases in India surged to nearly 3,000 and the death toll due to the virus reached 68.

Headline: Agra reports 25 new cases of Covid-19
Description: Twenty-five new cases of coronavirus have been reported in Agra, taking the total tally to 45 in the district, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh stated on Saturday. Several of the recent Covid-19 cases have been linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event that took place in Delhi in mid-March. There are a total of 174 positive cases in UP.
Text: Agra reports 25 new cases of Covid-19 Twenty-five new cases of coronavirus have been reported in Agra, taking the total tally to 45 in the district, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh stated on Saturday. Several of the recent Covid-19 cases have been linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event that took place in Delhi in mid-March. There are a total of 174 positive cases in UP.

Headline: No plans yet to resume passenger services from April 15: Railways
Description: Ministry of Railways on Saturday clarified on reports that claimed issuance of a plan for resumption of services from April 15 after the lockdown ends. "No such plan regarding the resumption of passenger services has been issued," said the Ministry in a tweet. "All concerned would be duly informed about any further decision in this regard," it added.
Text: No plans yet to resume passenger services from April 15: Railways Ministry of Railways on Saturday clarified on reports that claimed issuance of a plan for resumption of services from April 15 after the lockdown ends. "No such plan regarding the resumption of passenger services has been issued," said the Ministry in a tweet. "All concerned would be duly informed about any further decision in this regard," it added.

Headline: Tablighi members spat, misbehaved with staff: UP medical college
Description: Dr Arati Dave Lalchandani, the Dean of GSVM Medical College in Kanpur, has stated that 22 attendees of the Tablighi Jamaat event misbehaved with medical staff and "defied all norms of social distancing" during the two days that they were admitted to the hospital. Lalchandani added, "The patients behaved rudely with the medical team, they misbehaved, spit here and there."
Text: Tablighi members spat, misbehaved with staff: UP medical college Dr Arati Dave Lalchandani, the Dean of GSVM Medical College in Kanpur, has stated that 22 attendees of the Tablighi Jamaat event misbehaved with medical staff and "defied all norms of social distancing" during the two days that they were admitted to the hospital. Lalchandani added, "The patients behaved rudely with the medical team, they misbehaved, spit here and there."

Headline: Switching off all lights together may lead to grid failure: Maha Energy Minister
Description: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said if all lights are switched off at once, it might lead to grid failure. "Our emergency services will fail and it might take a week's time to restore power," he stated. This comes after PM Narendra Modi asked citizens to switch off lights at 9 pm for 9 minutes on Sunday, amid coronavirus pandemic.
Text: Switching off all lights together may lead to grid failure: Maha Energy Minister Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said if all lights are switched off at once, it might lead to grid failure. "Our emergency services will fail and it might take a week's time to restore power," he stated. This comes after PM Narendra Modi asked citizens to switch off lights at 9 pm for 9 minutes on Sunday, amid coronavirus pandemic.

Headline: Government urges people to use homemade reusable face masks
Description: The Health Ministry on Saturday urged people to use homemade reusable face masks even if they do not show symptoms of coronavirus, and added, "This will help in protecting the community at large." However, the ministry said this will not be applicable for health workers or those in close contact with COVID-19 patients as they require specified protective gear.
Text: Government urges people to use homemade reusable face masks The Health Ministry on Saturday urged people to use homemade reusable face masks even if they do not show symptoms of coronavirus, and added, "This will help in protecting the community at large." However, the ministry said this will not be applicable for health workers or those in close contact with COVID-19 patients as they require specified protective gear.

Headline: Hyd Traffic Police wear 'coronavirus helmets' to raise awareness
Description: The Hyderabad Traffic Police held a rally in Malakpet while wearing coronavirus inspired helmets in an effort to raise awareness about the pandemic on Friday. The traffic police personnel held placards asking people not to leave their homes. Earlier, a policeman in Tamil Nadu had worn a helmet designed to look like coronavirus to raise awareness about the pandemic.
Text: Hyd Traffic Police wear 'coronavirus helmets' to raise awareness The Hyderabad Traffic Police held a rally in Malakpet while wearing coronavirus inspired helmets in an effort to raise awareness about the pandemic on Friday. The traffic police personnel held placards asking people not to leave their homes. Earlier, a policeman in Tamil Nadu had worn a helmet designed to look like coronavirus to raise awareness about the pandemic.

Headline: 6 Tablighi attendees test +ve for Covid-19 in UP's Maharajganj
Description: Six persons who attended the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have tested positive for Covid-19 in Maharajganj in Uttar Pradesh, said a senior official. The official added, "35 close contacts of the six positive cases have also been quarantined." Notably, multiple Covid-19 cases across India have been linked to the Markaz event.
Text: 6 Tablighi attendees test +ve for Covid-19 in UP's Maharajganj Six persons who attended the Tablighi Jamaat congregation at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have tested positive for Covid-19 in Maharajganj in Uttar Pradesh, said a senior official. The official added, "35 close contacts of the six positive cases have also been quarantined." Notably, multiple Covid-19 cases across India have been linked to the Markaz event.

Headline: Don't use alcohol-based sanitisers while lighting diyas on April 5: Prasar Bharati
Description: After PM Narendra Modi asked citizens to turn off all lights in their houses at 9pm on Sunday and light candles or diyas, Prasar Bharati advised people not to use alcohol-based sanitisers while lighting them. The sanitisers used for coronavirus have higher concentration of alcohol which is highly inflammable. PM Modi also said that people can use torch.
Text: Don't use alcohol-based sanitisers while lighting diyas on April 5: Prasar Bharati After PM Narendra Modi asked citizens to turn off all lights in their houses at 9pm on Sunday and light candles or diyas, Prasar Bharati advised people not to use alcohol-based sanitisers while lighting them. The sanitisers used for coronavirus have higher concentration of alcohol which is highly inflammable. PM Modi also said that people can use torch.

Headline: MP couple test Covid-19 +ve after organising function; 26k people home-quarantined
Description: A locality with 26,000 people in 3,000 homes in Madhya Pradesh's Morena has been sealed and people have been ordered to home-quarantine after a couple, who organised a function on March 20, tested positive for coronavirus. Sub Divisional Magistrate said the man returned from Dubai on March 17. Moreover, 10 people who came in contact with them also tested positive.
Text: MP couple test Covid-19 +ve after organising function; 26k people home-quarantined A locality with 26,000 people in 3,000 homes in Madhya Pradesh's Morena has been sealed and people have been ordered to home-quarantine after a couple, who organised a function on March 20, tested positive for coronavirus. Sub Divisional Magistrate said the man returned from Dubai on March 17. Moreover, 10 people who came in contact with them also tested positive.

Headline: More and more young people in ICUs, dying of coronavirus: WHO
Description: World Health Organization expert Maria Van Kerkhove has said, "We are seeing more and more individuals who are of the younger age...who are in ICUs and dying [of coronavirus]." "Overwhelmingly we do see a trend across countries that people who are older, people who have underlying conditions...have a higher risk of death," she further said.
Text: More and more young people in ICUs, dying of coronavirus: WHO World Health Organization expert Maria Van Kerkhove has said, "We are seeing more and more individuals who are of the younger age...who are in ICUs and dying [of coronavirus]." "Overwhelmingly we do see a trend across countries that people who are older, people who have underlying conditions...have a higher risk of death," she further said.

Headline: RWAs to be booked for imposing weird rules over COVID-19: Noida Police
Description: Administration and police of Gautam Buddha Nagar (which includes Noida) have decided to take action against Resident Welfare Associations (RWA) for imposing arbitrary and "weird" rules on residents to control coronavirus spread. If found guilty of imposing unnecessary restrictions on essentials like dairy, vegetables and newspapers, RWAs can be booked, said Commissioner of Police Alok Singh.
Text: RWAs to be booked for imposing weird rules over COVID-19: Noida Police Administration and police of Gautam Buddha Nagar (which includes Noida) have decided to take action against Resident Welfare Associations (RWA) for imposing arbitrary and "weird" rules on residents to control coronavirus spread. If found guilty of imposing unnecessary restrictions on essentials like dairy, vegetables and newspapers, RWAs can be booked, said Commissioner of Police Alok Singh.

Headline: PM Modi shares video of ex-PM Vajpayee reciting 'Aao Diya Jalayein'
Description: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday shared a video of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee reciting 'Aao Diya Jalayein'. This comes a day after PM Modi asked Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes. "Remember, none of us is alone in this fight against coronavirus," he had said.
Text: PM Modi shares video of ex-PM Vajpayee reciting 'Aao Diya Jalayein' PM Narendra Modi on Saturday shared a video of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee reciting 'Aao Diya Jalayein'. This comes a day after PM Modi asked Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes. "Remember, none of us is alone in this fight against coronavirus," he had said.

Headline: Police attacked with axes, sticks by group violating lockdown in UP
Description: Three policemen in UP's Kannauj were injured after being attacked with axes and sticks when they went to enforce lockdown at a home where over 30 people had gathered for Friday prayers. The police said that the situation was brought under control after back-up arrived and force was used to disperse the crowd. Ten people have been detained.
Text: Police attacked with axes, sticks by group violating lockdown in UP Three policemen in UP's Kannauj were injured after being attacked with axes and sticks when they went to enforce lockdown at a home where over 30 people had gathered for Friday prayers. The police said that the situation was brought under control after back-up arrived and force was used to disperse the crowd. Ten people have been detained.

Headline: Hospital gave him paracetamol, sent him back: Family of man with COVID-19 symptoms
Description: A man from Uttar Pradesh's Noida, who had developed coronavirus symptoms, was given paracetamol and sent back by a government hospital, his family said. "We have been trying to get help through the various helpline numbers over the last four-five days. We were told on the helpline that somebody would reach out to us, but nobody did," his family added.
Text: Hospital gave him paracetamol, sent him back: Family of man with COVID-19 symptoms A man from Uttar Pradesh's Noida, who had developed coronavirus symptoms, was given paracetamol and sent back by a government hospital, his family said. "We have been trying to get help through the various helpline numbers over the last four-five days. We were told on the helpline that somebody would reach out to us, but nobody did," his family added.

Headline: Deepika, Ranveer pledge to contribute to PM CARES Fund
Description: Deepika Padukone and husband Ranveer Singh on Saturday announced that they have pledged to donate to PM CARES Fund to help the administration in combating the coronavirus pandemic. "In times like these, every bit counts. We...hope that you will [contribute] too," their statement read. "We're all in this together, and we shall overcome. Jai Hind," it further read.
Text: Deepika, Ranveer pledge to contribute to PM CARES Fund Deepika Padukone and husband Ranveer Singh on Saturday announced that they have pledged to donate to PM CARES Fund to help the administration in combating the coronavirus pandemic. "In times like these, every bit counts. We...hope that you will [contribute] too," their statement read. "We're all in this together, and we shall overcome. Jai Hind," it further read.

Headline: Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine likely to begin human trials by July
Description: Biotechnology firm Bharat Biotech has partnered with the University of Wisconsin-Madison and US-based company FluGen to develop a vaccine against coronavirus called 'CoroFlu'. Based on FluGen's M2SR (a novel live influenza vaccine), the vaccine is expected to move to human trials by July. SARS-CoV-2 (which causes COVID-19) gene sequences will be inserted into M2SR for immunity against coronavirus.
Text: Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine likely to begin human trials by July Biotechnology firm Bharat Biotech has partnered with the University of Wisconsin-Madison and US-based company FluGen to develop a vaccine against coronavirus called 'CoroFlu'. Based on FluGen's M2SR (a novel live influenza vaccine), the vaccine is expected to move to human trials by July. SARS-CoV-2 (which causes COVID-19) gene sequences will be inserted into M2SR for immunity against coronavirus.

Headline: No religious congregations should be allowed: VP Naidu on COVID-19
Description: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Friday asked the governors and lieutenant governors to motivate spiritual and religious leaders to advise their followers to not hold any religious congregations amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Notably, this comes after the Tablighi Jamaat event held in Delhi's Nizamuddin area after which 14 states/UTs reported positive COVID-19 cases.
Text: No religious congregations should be allowed: VP Naidu on COVID-19 Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Friday asked the governors and lieutenant governors to motivate spiritual and religious leaders to advise their followers to not hold any religious congregations amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Notably, this comes after the Tablighi Jamaat event held in Delhi's Nizamuddin area after which 14 states/UTs reported positive COVID-19 cases.

Headline: ₹1,000 aid to ration card-holding families to be done quickly: Bihar CM
Description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that the process of providing financial aid of ₹1,000 to every ration card-holding family should be done quickly. This comes after Nitish launched a drive to extend the financial aid through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) system, amid coronavirus pandemic. A total of ₹184 crore was transferred earlier into bank accounts of about 18.40 lakh people.
Text: ₹1,000 aid to ration card-holding families to be done quickly: Bihar CM Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that the process of providing financial aid of ₹1,000 to every ration card-holding family should be done quickly. This comes after Nitish launched a drive to extend the financial aid through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) system, amid coronavirus pandemic. A total of ₹184 crore was transferred earlier into bank accounts of about 18.40 lakh people.

Headline: Resume newspaper distribution: Former Maha CM Chavan to Uddhav Thackeray
Description: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan has urged the Uddhav Thackeray-led state government to resume distribution of newspapers amid COVID-19 lockdown. "Give them (newspaper distributors) protection and with help of volunteers, newspaper distribution should be resumed," he wrote in a letter to Thackeray. Chavan further added that helpline number should be set up for distribution of meals.
Text: Resume newspaper distribution: Former Maha CM Chavan to Uddhav Thackeray Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan has urged the Uddhav Thackeray-led state government to resume distribution of newspapers amid COVID-19 lockdown. "Give them (newspaper distributors) protection and with help of volunteers, newspaper distribution should be resumed," he wrote in a letter to Thackeray. Chavan further added that helpline number should be set up for distribution of meals.

Headline: Delhi govt has set up 328 relief centres for 57,000 people: CM Kejriwal
Description: CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that Delhi government has prepared 328 relief centres to accommodate 57,000 people, amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Anyone can come to these relief centres and stay here. We will take care of them," he added. Delhi has witnessed a total of 386 confirmed coronavirus cases and six deaths so far.
Text: Delhi govt has set up 328 relief centres for 57,000 people: CM Kejriwal CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that Delhi government has prepared 328 relief centres to accommodate 57,000 people, amid the coronavirus pandemic. "Anyone can come to these relief centres and stay here. We will take care of them," he added. Delhi has witnessed a total of 386 confirmed coronavirus cases and six deaths so far.

Headline: No COVID-19 patient in Karnataka is on the ventilator: CM Yediyurappa
Description: Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa said on Saturday that no COVID-19 patient in Karnataka is on the ventilator. "There are enough Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits in the state," he added. "We have placed an order for 9 lakh PPE kits out of which 1 lakh have already been delivered," Yediyurappa further said. Karnataka has witnessed 128 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: No COVID-19 patient in Karnataka is on the ventilator: CM Yediyurappa Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa said on Saturday that no COVID-19 patient in Karnataka is on the ventilator. "There are enough Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) kits in the state," he added. "We have placed an order for 9 lakh PPE kits out of which 1 lakh have already been delivered," Yediyurappa further said. Karnataka has witnessed 128 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: 5 people killed in car-truck collision on highway in Gujarat
Description: Five people, including three members of a family, were killed and one person received injuries after a collision between a car and a truck in the Surendranagar district of Gujarat on Saturday, said the police. The accident occurred on the Limbdi-Ahmedabad Highway. The injured person is undergoing treatment in a hospital, while an investigation has been launched into the accident.
Text: 5 people killed in car-truck collision on highway in Gujarat Five people, including three members of a family, were killed and one person received injuries after a collision between a car and a truck in the Surendranagar district of Gujarat on Saturday, said the police. The accident occurred on the Limbdi-Ahmedabad Highway. The injured person is undergoing treatment in a hospital, while an investigation has been launched into the accident.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 2,902, death toll reaches 68
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,902, while the death toll has reached 68. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 184. On Friday, government announced release of ₹11,092 crore under State Disaster Risk Management Fund to all states.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 2,902, death toll reaches 68 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,902, while the death toll has reached 68. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 184. On Friday, government announced release of ₹11,092 crore under State Disaster Risk Management Fund to all states.

Headline: Don't thank me, give me an order: SRK as Delhi CM thanks him for contribution
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday took to Twitter to thank Shah Rukh Khan for his "generous contribution" amid coronavirus pandemic. "[It'll] touch many lives in this difficult hour," he added. "Sir, you're from Delhi, don't thank me, give me an order," Shah Rukh wrote while replying to Kejriwal. "More strength, resilience...power to your teams on ground sir," he added.
Text: Don't thank me, give me an order: SRK as Delhi CM thanks him for contribution Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday took to Twitter to thank Shah Rukh Khan for his "generous contribution" amid coronavirus pandemic. "[It'll] touch many lives in this difficult hour," he added. "Sir, you're from Delhi, don't thank me, give me an order," Shah Rukh wrote while replying to Kejriwal. "More strength, resilience...power to your teams on ground sir," he added.

Headline: SRK's fan page donates ₹1L to PM CARES fund, says 'following our idol's footsteps'
Description: A Twitter fan page of actor Shah Rukh Khan donated ₹1 lakh to PM CARES fund amid coronavirus pandemic. Sharing the donation slip, the page wrote, "Least we could do. Following our idol Shah Rukh Khan's footsteps, a small contribution from us to PM CARES fund." This comes after the actor announced several donations and initiatives to fight the pandemic.
Text: SRK's fan page donates ₹1L to PM CARES fund, says 'following our idol's footsteps' A Twitter fan page of actor Shah Rukh Khan donated ₹1 lakh to PM CARES fund amid coronavirus pandemic. Sharing the donation slip, the page wrote, "Least we could do. Following our idol Shah Rukh Khan's footsteps, a small contribution from us to PM CARES fund." This comes after the actor announced several donations and initiatives to fight the pandemic.

Headline: BMC releases map showing zones in Mumbai where patients tested COVID-19 +ve
Description: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has made public a Geographical Information System map of coronavirus containment zones on its official website. Containment zones, which show up as green dots on the website, are the ones where a patient has tested positive or close contacts of positive patients reside and are sealed by the BMC with help from the Mumbai Police.
Text: BMC releases map showing zones in Mumbai where patients tested COVID-19 +ve The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has made public a Geographical Information System map of coronavirus containment zones on its official website. Containment zones, which show up as green dots on the website, are the ones where a patient has tested positive or close contacts of positive patients reside and are sealed by the BMC with help from the Mumbai Police.

Headline: EC further postpones Rajya Sabha elections amid COVID-19 pandemic
Description: The Election Commission said it is using its constitutional powers to defer Rajya Sabha polls to 18 seats beyond the terms of the retiring members, amid coronavirus pandemic. Rajya Sabha elections were scheduled to be held on March 26. While 17 Rajya Sabha members from six states are retiring on April 9, one from Meghalaya is retiring on April 12.
Text: EC further postpones Rajya Sabha elections amid COVID-19 pandemic The Election Commission said it is using its constitutional powers to defer Rajya Sabha polls to 18 seats beyond the terms of the retiring members, amid coronavirus pandemic. Rajya Sabha elections were scheduled to be held on March 26. While 17 Rajya Sabha members from six states are retiring on April 9, one from Meghalaya is retiring on April 12.

Headline: NSA against 6 Tablighi Jamaat attendees for misbehaving with nurses in UP
Description: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday invoked National Security Act (NSA) against six Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees for allegedly misbehaving with nurses at Ghaziabad's MMG District Hospital. "The accused will not obey the law...will [not] accept the system as they are...enemies of humanity," Yogi said. Ghaziabad CMO has complained to police that men made vulgar signs at nurses.
Text: NSA against 6 Tablighi Jamaat attendees for misbehaving with nurses in UP UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday invoked National Security Act (NSA) against six Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees for allegedly misbehaving with nurses at Ghaziabad's MMG District Hospital. "The accused will not obey the law...will [not] accept the system as they are...enemies of humanity," Yogi said. Ghaziabad CMO has complained to police that men made vulgar signs at nurses.

Headline: Don't reduce our lives to 9 min gimmicks: Owaisi to PM on 'light diyas' appeal
Description: AIMIM Chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised PM Narendra Modi over his appeal to switch off electricity and light candles for nine minutes on April 5 to "challenge the darkness of coronavirus". "Don't reduce our lives to gimmicks of 9 mins [PM]," said Owaisi. "We wanted to know what relief poor will receive. Instead we got some new drama," he added.
Text: Don't reduce our lives to 9 min gimmicks: Owaisi to PM on 'light diyas' appeal AIMIM Chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised PM Narendra Modi over his appeal to switch off electricity and light candles for nine minutes on April 5 to "challenge the darkness of coronavirus". "Don't reduce our lives to gimmicks of 9 mins [PM]," said Owaisi. "We wanted to know what relief poor will receive. Instead we got some new drama," he added.

Headline: Railways produces 2.8L masks, 25,000 litres of sanitiser to fight COVID-19
Description: The Indian Railways has produced a total of 2,87,704 masks and 25,806 litres of sanitiser in its zones, as of April 1, to prevent the spread of coronavirus, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal said. The Central Railway produced 22,580 masks and 2,693 litres of sanitiser while Western Railway produced 46,313 masks and 700 litres of sanitiser, the minister added.
Text: Railways produces 2.8L masks, 25,000 litres of sanitiser to fight COVID-19 The Indian Railways has produced a total of 2,87,704 masks and 25,806 litres of sanitiser in its zones, as of April 1, to prevent the spread of coronavirus, Railway Minister Piyush Goyal said. The Central Railway produced 22,580 masks and 2,693 litres of sanitiser while Western Railway produced 46,313 masks and 700 litres of sanitiser, the minister added.

Headline: PM reaffirmed my belief that we can't let our guard down after April 14: Sachin
Description: Following PM Narendra Modi's video conference with 40-odd sportspersons amid the coronavirus pandemic, Sachin Tendulkar said, "PM highlighted and reaffirmed my belief that we shouldn't let our guard down after April 14." He added, "I also suggested that as much as possible, I'll use our way of greeting- saying 'Namaste' instead of shaking hands, even after we overcome this pandemic."
Text: PM reaffirmed my belief that we can't let our guard down after April 14: Sachin Following PM Narendra Modi's video conference with 40-odd sportspersons amid the coronavirus pandemic, Sachin Tendulkar said, "PM highlighted and reaffirmed my belief that we shouldn't let our guard down after April 14." He added, "I also suggested that as much as possible, I'll use our way of greeting- saying 'Namaste' instead of shaking hands, even after we overcome this pandemic."

Headline: Don't believe: Govt after msgs claim 'coronavirus will die at 9pm on April 5'
Description: The government asked the public not to believe rumours and unscientific forwards after PM Modi urged Indians to light candles/lamps/mobile torches at 9pm on Sunday for 9 minutes. Fake WhatsApp forwards claimed that 'coronavirus will die at 9pm on April 5'. "This initiative is to show solidarity and confidence in our collective fight against COVID-19," PIB Fact Check tweeted.
Text: Don't believe: Govt after msgs claim 'coronavirus will die at 9pm on April 5' The government asked the public not to believe rumours and unscientific forwards after PM Modi urged Indians to light candles/lamps/mobile torches at 9pm on Sunday for 9 minutes. Fake WhatsApp forwards claimed that 'coronavirus will die at 9pm on April 5'. "This initiative is to show solidarity and confidence in our collective fight against COVID-19," PIB Fact Check tweeted.

Headline: 364 out of total 411 coronavirus cases in TN linked to Tablighi event: Health Secy
Description: Out of the total 411 coronavirus cases that Tamil Nadu has reported so far, 364 cases spread across 20 districts are linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event that took place in March in Delhi, said State Health Secretary Beela Rajesh. The state reported 102 new coronavirus cases on Friday, out of which 100 are linked with the event, she said.
