Text: 364 out of total 411 coronavirus cases in TN linked to Tablighi event: Health Secy Out of the total 411 coronavirus cases that Tamil Nadu has reported so far, 364 cases spread across 20 districts are linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event that took place in March in Delhi, said State Health Secretary Beela Rajesh. The state reported 102 new coronavirus cases on Friday, out of which 100 are linked with the event, she said.

Headline: Hope people don't burn down own homes: Raut on PM's diya appeal
Description: After PM Narendra Modi asked Indians to light a candle or diya for 9 minutes on April 5, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut tweeted, "When people were asked to clap, they crowded the roads....I just hope now they don't burn down their own houses." Raut added, "'diya to jalalenge' but please tell us what the government is doing to improve condition".
Text: Hope people don't burn down own homes: Raut on PM's diya appeal After PM Narendra Modi asked Indians to light a candle or diya for 9 minutes on April 5, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut tweeted, "When people were asked to clap, they crowded the roads....I just hope now they don't burn down their own houses." Raut added, "'diya to jalalenge' but please tell us what the government is doing to improve condition".

Headline: 60-year-old woman passes away due to coronavirus in Bikaner
Description: A 60-year-old woman who was suffering from coronavirus passed away in Bikaner on Saturday morning, the Rajasthan health department has stated. The department added that 12 new coronavirus cases have been confirmed in Rajasthan, taking the total number of positive Covid-19 cases to 191. Notably, 41 of the 191 cases are linked to the event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi.
Text: 60-year-old woman passes away due to coronavirus in Bikaner A 60-year-old woman who was suffering from coronavirus passed away in Bikaner on Saturday morning, the Rajasthan health department has stated. The department added that 12 new coronavirus cases have been confirmed in Rajasthan, taking the total number of positive Covid-19 cases to 191. Notably, 41 of the 191 cases are linked to the event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi.

Headline: 11 CISF personnel posted at Mumbai airport test +ve for Covid-19
Description: At least 11 CISF personnel on duty at Mumbai airport have tested positive for COVID-19 in Maharashtra's Panvel, the city's Municipal Commissioner Ganesh Deshmukh has stated. The CISF personnel are believed to have contracted the virus at the airport. Four other people, including three international travellers, had also tested positive for coronavirus in Panvel but one of them has recovered.
Text: 11 CISF personnel posted at Mumbai airport test +ve for Covid-19 At least 11 CISF personnel on duty at Mumbai airport have tested positive for COVID-19 in Maharashtra's Panvel, the city's Municipal Commissioner Ganesh Deshmukh has stated. The CISF personnel are believed to have contracted the virus at the airport. Four other people, including three international travellers, had also tested positive for coronavirus in Panvel but one of them has recovered.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in Maharashtra near 500, most cases in Mumbai at 278
Description: As many as 67 coronavirus cases were reported in Maharashtra today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 490. Mumbai has reported the most number of cases in Maharashtra so far (278) followed by Pune (70). Out of the 26 deaths due to coronavirus in the state, 19 have taken place in Mumbai.
Text: Coronavirus cases in Maharashtra near 500, most cases in Mumbai at 278 As many as 67 coronavirus cases were reported in Maharashtra today, taking the total number of cases in the state to 490. Mumbai has reported the most number of cases in Maharashtra so far (278) followed by Pune (70). Out of the 26 deaths due to coronavirus in the state, 19 have taken place in Mumbai.

Headline: Allow certified vendors to sell essentials amid lockdown: Centre to states
Description: Central government on Friday issued an advisory to states and Union Territories to allow certified street vendors to sell essential items amid coronavirus lockdown. "Urban street vendors play an important role in supply of essential items such as groceries, fruits and vegetables at affordable prices," said the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs advisory addressed to state Principal Secretaries.
Text: Allow certified vendors to sell essentials amid lockdown: Centre to states Central government on Friday issued an advisory to states and Union Territories to allow certified street vendors to sell essential items amid coronavirus lockdown. "Urban street vendors play an important role in supply of essential items such as groceries, fruits and vegetables at affordable prices," said the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs advisory addressed to state Principal Secretaries.

Headline: Will sleep if I want to: Mamata on PM Modi's '9 pm 9 min' light up call
Description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that PM Narendra Modi's call to citizens to light a candle or diya for nine minutes at 9 pm on Sunday is a "personal matter". "I will sleep if I want to sleep," she said. "He will speak his mind...I will speak mine...you think he has said something good, follow it," Mamata further said.
Text: Will sleep if I want to: Mamata on PM Modi's '9 pm 9 min' light up call West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that PM Narendra Modi's call to citizens to light a candle or diya for nine minutes at 9 pm on Sunday is a "personal matter". "I will sleep if I want to sleep," she said. "He will speak his mind...I will speak mine...you think he has said something good, follow it," Mamata further said.

Headline: Woman having extra-marital affair with her cousin slits 22-yr-old husband's throat
Description: A woman has been arrested for allegedly killing her 22-year-old husband by slitting his throat in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. Police said that woman was allegedly having an extra-marital affair with her cousin and colluded with him to commit the crime. The victim, who worked in a firm in Noida, had recently returned to Agra with his wife and one-year-old son.
Text: Woman having extra-marital affair with her cousin slits 22-yr-old husband's throat A woman has been arrested for allegedly killing her 22-year-old husband by slitting his throat in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. Police said that woman was allegedly having an extra-marital affair with her cousin and colluded with him to commit the crime. The victim, who worked in a firm in Noida, had recently returned to Agra with his wife and one-year-old son.

Headline: 2 policemen help woman give birth on roadside as hospitals deny entry
Description: Two police officers helped a woman deliver a baby boy on the roadside in Punjab's Dharamkot after she and her husband found the government primary health centre closed and were turned away by two private hospitals. The officers, who were on night duty, said they arranged two benches for the woman and called a nurse who was their acquaintance.
Text: 2 policemen help woman give birth on roadside as hospitals deny entry Two police officers helped a woman deliver a baby boy on the roadside in Punjab's Dharamkot after she and her husband found the government primary health centre closed and were turned away by two private hospitals. The officers, who were on night duty, said they arranged two benches for the woman and called a nurse who was their acquaintance.

Headline: Centre amends April 1 order, reserves all jobs for domiciles in J&K
Description: After introducing a new domicile clause redefining residence and recruitment rules for J&K, the Centre on Friday amended its order to reserve all jobs in the Union Territory for only its domiciles. The previous order on April 1 opened up all government posts in J&K to everyone from rest of the country, while providing limited protections for level 4 jobs.
Text: Centre amends April 1 order, reserves all jobs for domiciles in J&K After introducing a new domicile clause redefining residence and recruitment rules for J&K, the Centre on Friday amended its order to reserve all jobs in the Union Territory for only its domiciles. The previous order on April 1 opened up all government posts in J&K to everyone from rest of the country, while providing limited protections for level 4 jobs.

Headline: Can't evacuate Indians stranded abroad due to COVID-19 lockdown: Centre to HC
Description: The Centre told the Delhi High Court that it cannot evacuate Indians abroad due to the lockdown to contain coronavirus pandemic spread but was taking proactive steps for their safety and welfare. "Missions/ Posts abroad have been advised to set up dedicated helpline numbers...A COVID-19 cell has been formed to ensure greater access and precision of information," the Centre said.
Text: Can't evacuate Indians stranded abroad due to COVID-19 lockdown: Centre to HC The Centre told the Delhi High Court that it cannot evacuate Indians abroad due to the lockdown to contain coronavirus pandemic spread but was taking proactive steps for their safety and welfare. "Missions/ Posts abroad have been advised to set up dedicated helpline numbers...A COVID-19 cell has been formed to ensure greater access and precision of information," the Centre said.

Headline: Tablighi event setback to efforts against coronavirus: Prez Kovind
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday had a video conference with Governors, Lieutenant Governors and administrators of states and Union Territories. Kovind expressed concern over the gathering of migrant workers and Tablighi Jamaat event, both of which took place in Delhi and caused a setback to efforts against coronavirus, said a statement issued by Rashtrapati Bhavan.
Text: Tablighi event setback to efforts against coronavirus: Prez Kovind President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday had a video conference with Governors, Lieutenant Governors and administrators of states and Union Territories. Kovind expressed concern over the gathering of migrant workers and Tablighi Jamaat event, both of which took place in Delhi and caused a setback to efforts against coronavirus, said a statement issued by Rashtrapati Bhavan.

Headline: Finance Ministry releases ₹17,287 cr to states to fight COVID-19
Description: Ministry of Finance released ₹17,287 crore to states to "enhance their financial resources" amid COVID-19 pandemic. Out of the total, ₹11,092 crore is for all the states as advance payment of Central government's share of the first instalment of Disaster Response Mitigation Fund. The rest ₹6,195 crore is the 'revenue deficit grant' under 15th Finance Commission recommendations to 14 states.
Text: Finance Ministry releases ₹17,287 cr to states to fight COVID-19 Ministry of Finance released ₹17,287 crore to states to "enhance their financial resources" amid COVID-19 pandemic. Out of the total, ₹11,092 crore is for all the states as advance payment of Central government's share of the first instalment of Disaster Response Mitigation Fund. The rest ₹6,195 crore is the 'revenue deficit grant' under 15th Finance Commission recommendations to 14 states.

Headline: Noida authority to give ₹1,000 to street vendors amid COVID-19 lockdown
Description: The Noida authority has decided to provide financial aid of ₹1000 each to street vendors who have lost their livelihoods after the 21-day nationwide lockdown was ordered by Prime Minister Narendra Modi to contain the spread of COVID-19. "We shall transfer the amount after a survey to identify the eligible vendors," Chief Executive Officer of Noida authority Ritu Maheshwari said.
Text: Noida authority to give ₹1,000 to street vendors amid COVID-19 lockdown The Noida authority has decided to provide financial aid of ₹1000 each to street vendors who have lost their livelihoods after the 21-day nationwide lockdown was ordered by Prime Minister Narendra Modi to contain the spread of COVID-19. "We shall transfer the amount after a survey to identify the eligible vendors," Chief Executive Officer of Noida authority Ritu Maheshwari said.

Headline: 2 militants killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Kulgam
Description: At least two militants were killed on Saturday in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam. This comes after a joint team of Indian Army's 34RR and J&K Police launched a cordon and search operation after getting a tip-off about militants' presence. The J&K Police said that the militants on Wednesday had killed two civilians in Kulgam.
Text: 2 militants killed in encounter with security forces in J&K's Kulgam At least two militants were killed on Saturday in an encounter with security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam. This comes after a joint team of Indian Army's 34RR and J&K Police launched a cordon and search operation after getting a tip-off about militants' presence. The J&K Police said that the militants on Wednesday had killed two civilians in Kulgam.

Headline: Goa bans import of chicken, egg due to bird flu outbreak
Description: In Goa, the state government has banned the entry of poultry and poultry products, including eggs from neighbouring states in view of the bird flu cases. "I appeal to the people my state to refrain from the consumption of chicken in the wake of bird flu cases reported in other states," Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said.
Text: Goa bans import of chicken, egg due to bird flu outbreak In Goa, the state government has banned the entry of poultry and poultry products, including eggs from neighbouring states in view of the bird flu cases. "I appeal to the people my state to refrain from the consumption of chicken in the wake of bird flu cases reported in other states," Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said.

Headline: Coronavirus death toll in Delhi rises to 5; three linked to Nizamuddin event
Description: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that the death toll in the national capital due to coronavirus has risen to five. Three of the five deaths are linked to the religious congregation that took place in Delhi's Nizamuddin. Further, the total number of cases in Delhi has surged to 384 after a rise of 91 in last 24 hours.
Text: Coronavirus death toll in Delhi rises to 5; three linked to Nizamuddin event Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that the death toll in the national capital due to coronavirus has risen to five. Three of the five deaths are linked to the religious congregation that took place in Delhi's Nizamuddin. Further, the total number of cases in Delhi has surged to 384 after a rise of 91 in last 24 hours.

Headline: Maharashtra govt launches online coronavirus self-assessment tool
Description: Maharashtra government has launched a coronavirus online self-assessment tool where citizens can evaluate their symptoms at home and contact authorities in case of doubts, said an official release. The tool has been launched in collaboration with Apollo 24x7 and is available at covid-19.maharashtra.gov.in. Maharashtra has reported over 400 coronavirus positive cases so far.
Text: Maharashtra govt launches online coronavirus self-assessment tool Maharashtra government has launched a coronavirus online self-assessment tool where citizens can evaluate their symptoms at home and contact authorities in case of doubts, said an official release. The tool has been launched in collaboration with Apollo 24x7 and is available at covid-19.maharashtra.gov.in. Maharashtra has reported over 400 coronavirus positive cases so far.

Headline: 647 coronavirus cases found in last 2 days linked to Tablighi Jamaat event: Govt
Description: The Health Ministry has said that 647 coronavirus cases found in last two days are linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event that was held in Delhi's Nizamuddin. Out of 12 deaths reported in last 24 hours some are related to the event, the ministry added. COVID-19 cases related to the event have been reported from 14 states/UTs, it further said.
Text: 647 coronavirus cases found in last 2 days linked to Tablighi Jamaat event: Govt The Health Ministry has said that 647 coronavirus cases found in last two days are linked to the Tablighi Jamaat event that was held in Delhi's Nizamuddin. Out of 12 deaths reported in last 24 hours some are related to the event, the ministry added. COVID-19 cases related to the event have been reported from 14 states/UTs, it further said.

Headline: Tamil Nadu reports 102 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 411
Description: Tamil Nadu on Friday reported 102 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 411 including 7 discharged and one dead, state Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said. The state has so far tested 3,684 samples, of which 484 are under process. Tamil Nadu had reported 75 new cases on Thursday and 110 on Wednesday.
Text: Tamil Nadu reports 102 new coronavirus cases, total rises to 411 Tamil Nadu on Friday reported 102 new coronavirus cases, taking the total number of cases in the state to 411 including 7 discharged and one dead, state Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said. The state has so far tested 3,684 samples, of which 484 are under process. Tamil Nadu had reported 75 new cases on Thursday and 110 on Wednesday.

Headline: Odisha to shut down Bhubaneswar, Bhadrak & Cuttack for 48 hrs from 8 pm tonight
Description: Odisha government has announced a 48-hour shutdown of Bhubaneswar, Bhadrak and Cuttack from 8 pm tonight. "All shops (like fruits, vegetables, meat and dairy) will remain closed. Medical services will operate under restrictions," Odisha DGP Abhay said. "We have reason to suspect community transmission. Our surveillance has to be taken one step forward," Odisha Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy said.
Text: Odisha to shut down Bhubaneswar, Bhadrak & Cuttack for 48 hrs from 8 pm tonight Odisha government has announced a 48-hour shutdown of Bhubaneswar, Bhadrak and Cuttack from 8 pm tonight. "All shops (like fruits, vegetables, meat and dairy) will remain closed. Medical services will operate under restrictions," Odisha DGP Abhay said. "We have reason to suspect community transmission. Our surveillance has to be taken one step forward," Odisha Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy said.

Headline: Total 161 COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan; 24 attended Tablighi Jamaat event
Description: Rajasthan reported 25 new COVID-19 positive cases till 2 pm on Friday, taking the total number of confirmed cases in the state to 161, said the state's health department. Among these, 21 patients are evacuees from Iran and 24 are those that attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi, the department added.
Text: Total 161 COVID-19 cases reported in Rajasthan; 24 attended Tablighi Jamaat event Rajasthan reported 25 new COVID-19 positive cases till 2 pm on Friday, taking the total number of confirmed cases in the state to 161, said the state's health department. Among these, 21 patients are evacuees from Iran and 24 are those that attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi, the department added.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India surge to 2,547, death toll rises to 62
Description: The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,547, while the death toll in the country has surged to 62. Out of all the cases, 2,322 are active. Further, the number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 163. Cases have been reported in 29 states and Union Territories so far.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India surge to 2,547, death toll rises to 62 The total number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,547, while the death toll in the country has surged to 62. Out of all the cases, 2,322 are active. Further, the number of patients who have been cured, discharged or migrated is 163. Cases have been reported in 29 states and Union Territories so far.

Headline: 336 coronavirus cases and 12 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt
Description: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Friday said that 336 coronavirus cases and 12 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. "In past two days, 647 confirmed positive coronavirus cases linked to Tablighi Jamaat found across 14 states and UTs," he added. India has reported a total of 2,301 cases so far.
Text: 336 coronavirus cases and 12 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours: Govt Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's Joint Secretary Lav Agarwal on Friday said that 336 coronavirus cases and 12 deaths have been reported in India in last 24 hours. "In past two days, 647 confirmed positive coronavirus cases linked to Tablighi Jamaat found across 14 states and UTs," he added. India has reported a total of 2,301 cases so far.

Headline: India tested 8,000 coronavirus samples on Thursday, highest in a single day: ICMR
Description: The Indian Council of Medical Research on Friday said that around 8,000 tests for coronavirus were conducted in India on Thursday, which is the highest number of tests done in the country so far. It further said that cumulatively, around 66,000 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India. There are currently 182 labs providing coronavirus diagnosis, it added.
Text: India tested 8,000 coronavirus samples on Thursday, highest in a single day: ICMR The Indian Council of Medical Research on Friday said that around 8,000 tests for coronavirus were conducted in India on Thursday, which is the highest number of tests done in the country so far. It further said that cumulatively, around 66,000 coronavirus tests have been conducted in India. There are currently 182 labs providing coronavirus diagnosis, it added.

Headline: No spraying of disinfectants on humans, animals: UP DG of Fire Services
Description: UP's Director General of Fire Services on Friday issued guidelines for sanitisation amid spread of coronavirus saying disinfectants shouldn't be sprayed on humans or animals. RK Vishwakarma was quoted as saying by ANI, "No spraying to be done inside houses or buildings due to presence of electrical equipment or wiring there." India has reported over 2,000 coronavirus cases so far.
Text: No spraying of disinfectants on humans, animals: UP DG of Fire Services UP's Director General of Fire Services on Friday issued guidelines for sanitisation amid spread of coronavirus saying disinfectants shouldn't be sprayed on humans or animals. RK Vishwakarma was quoted as saying by ANI, "No spraying to be done inside houses or buildings due to presence of electrical equipment or wiring there." India has reported over 2,000 coronavirus cases so far.

Headline: No vision, just a feel-good moment: Tharoor on PM Modi's video message
Description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Friday criticised PM Narendra Modi's appeal to switch off electric lights and light candles for nine minutes on April 5 amid coronavirus lockdown. Terming PM the "Pradhan Showman", Tharoor called his video message "just a feel-good moment curated by India's Photo-Op Prime Minister". There was no vision of the future in the message, he added.
Text: No vision, just a feel-good moment: Tharoor on PM Modi's video message Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Friday criticised PM Narendra Modi's appeal to switch off electric lights and light candles for nine minutes on April 5 amid coronavirus lockdown. Terming PM the "Pradhan Showman", Tharoor called his video message "just a feel-good moment curated by India's Photo-Op Prime Minister". There was no vision of the future in the message, he added.

Headline: MHA releases ₹11,092 crore to all states for fighting coronavirus
Description: The Union Home Ministry on Friday announced the release of ₹11,092 crore under State Disaster Risk Management Fund (SDRMF) to all states for setting up quarantine facilities and other relief measures amid coronavirus spread. "This is advance release of [Centre's] share of first instalment of SDRMF for 2020-21, to augment funds available with state governments," said MHA spokesperson.
Text: MHA releases ₹11,092 crore to all states for fighting coronavirus The Union Home Ministry on Friday announced the release of ₹11,092 crore under State Disaster Risk Management Fund (SDRMF) to all states for setting up quarantine facilities and other relief measures amid coronavirus spread. "This is advance release of [Centre's] share of first instalment of SDRMF for 2020-21, to augment funds available with state governments," said MHA spokesperson.

Headline: UP man shot at for asking people to abide by coronavirus lockdown
Description: A 30-year-old man, identified as Javed, was shot at in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district after he asked a group of people wandering outdoors to abide by the coronavirus lockdown restrictions, police said. The police registered a case against six people who are absconding, SHO Vijay Bahadur Singh said. The FIR alleged that the group beat up Javed and his brother.
Text: UP man shot at for asking people to abide by coronavirus lockdown A 30-year-old man, identified as Javed, was shot at in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district after he asked a group of people wandering outdoors to abide by the coronavirus lockdown restrictions, police said. The police registered a case against six people who are absconding, SHO Vijay Bahadur Singh said. The FIR alleged that the group beat up Javed and his brother.

Headline: Jharkhand Minister's son quarantined; father denies Nizamuddin Markaz visit
Description: Jharkhand Cabinet Minister Haji Hussain Ansari's son Tanveer allegedly attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi after which he was quarantined at an eye hospital for 14 days. Ansari however denied that his son attended the event that is linked to hundreds of coronavirus cases. The Minister and his family have also been put in home quarantine.
Text: Jharkhand Minister's son quarantined; father denies Nizamuddin Markaz visit Jharkhand Cabinet Minister Haji Hussain Ansari's son Tanveer allegedly attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi after which he was quarantined at an eye hospital for 14 days. Ansari however denied that his son attended the event that is linked to hundreds of coronavirus cases. The Minister and his family have also been put in home quarantine.

Headline: US Embassy employee in Delhi tests positive for coronavirus
Description: The US Embassy in Delhi has said that an employee has tested positive for the coronavirus. "We are working with Indian health authorities to ensure the employee receives proper treatment," the Embassy added. The mission didn't share additional information due to privacy concerns. Further, the statement said the Embassy continues to implement appropriate measures to control the spread of COVID-19.
Text: US Embassy employee in Delhi tests positive for coronavirus The US Embassy in Delhi has said that an employee has tested positive for the coronavirus. "We are working with Indian health authorities to ensure the employee receives proper treatment," the Embassy added. The mission didn't share additional information due to privacy concerns. Further, the statement said the Embassy continues to implement appropriate measures to control the spread of COVID-19.

Headline: IPL can surely wait as life is more important now: Suresh Raina
Description: Talking about the lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic, Chennai Super Kings batsman Suresh Raina said, "Life is most important at this point of time. IPL can surely wait." He added, "We all need to follow the government guidelines on lockdown else we all face the consequences. When life gets better, we can think about the IPL."
Text: IPL can surely wait as life is more important now: Suresh Raina Talking about the lockdown amid the coronavirus pandemic, Chennai Super Kings batsman Suresh Raina said, "Life is most important at this point of time. IPL can surely wait." He added, "We all need to follow the government guidelines on lockdown else we all face the consequences. When life gets better, we can think about the IPL."

Headline: COVID-19 Waste' label must on biomedical waste: Pollution board
Description: Central Pollution Control Board, which comes under the Ministry of Environment, has made it mandatory to put 'COVID-19 Waste' label on all biomedical waste generated during coronavirus treatment. Labelling would enable concerned facilities to identify the waste easily for priority disposal. Biomedical waste from coronavirus treatment should be considered 'domestic hazardous waste', the board said.
Text: COVID-19 Waste' label must on biomedical waste: Pollution board Central Pollution Control Board, which comes under the Ministry of Environment, has made it mandatory to put 'COVID-19 Waste' label on all biomedical waste generated during coronavirus treatment. Labelling would enable concerned facilities to identify the waste easily for priority disposal. Biomedical waste from coronavirus treatment should be considered 'domestic hazardous waste', the board said.

Headline: Mysuru installs 'disinfection tunnel' at market entrance to prevent COVID-19
Description: The Mysuru City Corporation has built a 'disinfection tunnel' at the entrance of the exhibition ground market to contain the spread of coronavirus. People entering the market have been asked to walk through the tunnel where nozzles spray a disinfectant solution, an official said. Earlier, the government identified Mysuru district among the 25 COVID-19 hotspots in India.
Text: Mysuru installs 'disinfection tunnel' at market entrance to prevent COVID-19 The Mysuru City Corporation has built a 'disinfection tunnel' at the entrance of the exhibition ground market to contain the spread of coronavirus. People entering the market have been asked to walk through the tunnel where nozzles spray a disinfectant solution, an official said. Earlier, the government identified Mysuru district among the 25 COVID-19 hotspots in India.

Headline: Kerala couple aged 93 & 88 discharged from hospital after recovering from COVID-19
Description: Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja took to Twitter to announce that the elderly couple, aged 93 and 88, who had tested positive for coronavirus, have now been discharged from the hospital after recovering. "It's a huge achievement for the state especially when COVID-19 patients above the age of 60 are considered in the high risk category across globe," she wrote.
Text: Kerala couple aged 93 & 88 discharged from hospital after recovering from COVID-19 Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja took to Twitter to announce that the elderly couple, aged 93 and 88, who had tested positive for coronavirus, have now been discharged from the hospital after recovering. "It's a huge achievement for the state especially when COVID-19 patients above the age of 60 are considered in the high risk category across globe," she wrote.

Headline: Delhi man files complaint against dad for breaking lockdown, says he goes out daily
Description: An FIR has been filed against a 59-year-old man in Delhi based on his son's complaint that he's violating lockdown rules and steps out of the house every day. The FIR stated that when police arrived at the complainant's residence, officials saw the complainant was repeatedly asking his father to get inside the house but he didn't listen to him.
Text: Delhi man files complaint against dad for breaking lockdown, says he goes out daily An FIR has been filed against a 59-year-old man in Delhi based on his son's complaint that he's violating lockdown rules and steps out of the house every day. The FIR stated that when police arrived at the complainant's residence, officials saw the complainant was repeatedly asking his father to get inside the house but he didn't listen to him.

Headline: Himachal's Dhauladhar mountain range visible from Jalandhar, Harbhajan shares pic
Description: The Dhauladhar mountain range in Himachal Pradesh has become visible in Punjab's Jalandhar following the improvement in air quality amid the nationwide lockdown over the coronavirus pandemic. Sharing a picture of the same, cricketer Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Never seen Dhauladhar range from my home rooftop in Jalandhar...clear indication of the impact the pollution has done by us to Mother Earth."
Text: Himachal's Dhauladhar mountain range visible from Jalandhar, Harbhajan shares pic The Dhauladhar mountain range in Himachal Pradesh has become visible in Punjab's Jalandhar following the improvement in air quality amid the nationwide lockdown over the coronavirus pandemic. Sharing a picture of the same, cricketer Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Never seen Dhauladhar range from my home rooftop in Jalandhar...clear indication of the impact the pollution has done by us to Mother Earth."

Headline: Guild, IFTPC, FWICE to help daily wage workers amid lockdown
Description: Producers Guild of India (Guild), Indian Film and Television Producers Council (IFTPC) and Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) have come together to raise funds and compensate daily wage workers who have been impacted by the lockdown. The funds will be made available to individuals through direct bank transfers. It will be disbursed in the first week of April.
Text: Guild, IFTPC, FWICE to help daily wage workers amid lockdown Producers Guild of India (Guild), Indian Film and Television Producers Council (IFTPC) and Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) have come together to raise funds and compensate daily wage workers who have been impacted by the lockdown. The funds will be made available to individuals through direct bank transfers. It will be disbursed in the first week of April.

Headline: Don't pelt stones at doctors, they are saving people: Rishi
Description: Rishi Kapoor on Thursday appealed to "all brothers and sisters from all social status and faiths" not to pelt stones or lynch any health professional or policeman. "[They] are endangering their lives to save you...We have to win this coronavirus war together," he tweeted. Rishi's tweet came after several instances of people getting violent with the authorities were reported.
Text: Don't pelt stones at doctors, they are saving people: Rishi Rishi Kapoor on Thursday appealed to "all brothers and sisters from all social status and faiths" not to pelt stones or lynch any health professional or policeman. "[They] are endangering their lives to save you...We have to win this coronavirus war together," he tweeted. Rishi's tweet came after several instances of people getting violent with the authorities were reported.

Headline: Light candles, torches but remember medical staff needs gear: Swara
Description: Swara Bhasker on Friday took to Twitter and wrote, "Clap...hands, bang bartans, light candles, torches but remember doctors...& medical staff needs...gear and a government that delivers these." "Please ask...government to make sure medical personnel in India are protected," she added. This comes after PM Narendra Modi urged people to light a candle or diya on April 5 for 9 minutes.
Text: Light candles, torches but remember medical staff needs gear: Swara Swara Bhasker on Friday took to Twitter and wrote, "Clap...hands, bang bartans, light candles, torches but remember doctors...& medical staff needs...gear and a government that delivers these." "Please ask...government to make sure medical personnel in India are protected," she added. This comes after PM Narendra Modi urged people to light a candle or diya on April 5 for 9 minutes.

Headline: Robots serve food, medicines to COVID-19 patients at Chennai hospital
Description: Robots have been deployed at Chennai's Government Stanley Medical College and Hospital to serve food and medicines to coronavirus patients or possibly infected persons. "This will limit the amount of direct contact doctors and nurses have with patients, thus reducing the risk of infection," Tamil Nadu Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said. The state has reported over 400 cases of coronavirus.
Text: Robots serve food, medicines to COVID-19 patients at Chennai hospital Robots have been deployed at Chennai's Government Stanley Medical College and Hospital to serve food and medicines to coronavirus patients or possibly infected persons. "This will limit the amount of direct contact doctors and nurses have with patients, thus reducing the risk of infection," Tamil Nadu Health Minister C Vijayabaskar said. The state has reported over 400 cases of coronavirus.

Headline: SC sends notice to govt on plea for payment of wages to migrant workers
Description: The Supreme Court has sent a notice to the Centre on a plea seeking direction for payment of minimum wages to migrant workers who have been left without work during coronavirus lockdown. The court has posted the matter for further hearing on April 7. The petition said lockdown led to mass exodus of migrant workers, potentially exposing them to coronavirus.
Text: SC sends notice to govt on plea for payment of wages to migrant workers The Supreme Court has sent a notice to the Centre on a plea seeking direction for payment of minimum wages to migrant workers who have been left without work during coronavirus lockdown. The court has posted the matter for further hearing on April 7. The petition said lockdown led to mass exodus of migrant workers, potentially exposing them to coronavirus.

Headline: PM Modi calls UK Prince Charles to wish him good health, discuss COVID-19
Description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a telephonic conversation with Britain's heir to the throne Prince Charles who recently recovered from coronavirus. PM Modi expressed satisfaction that the Prince of Wales had recovered and wished him lasting good health.  While discussing COVID-19, PM Modi also conveyed his condolences for the loss of life in the UK over the past few days.
Text: PM Modi calls UK Prince Charles to wish him good health, discuss COVID-19 Prime Minister Narendra Modi had a telephonic conversation with Britain's heir to the throne Prince Charles who recently recovered from coronavirus. PM Modi expressed satisfaction that the Prince of Wales had recovered and wished him lasting good health.  While discussing COVID-19, PM Modi also conveyed his condolences for the loss of life in the UK over the past few days.

Headline: Andhra Pradesh records its first COVID-19 death, 55-year-old Vijayawada man dies
Description: Andhra Pradesh recorded its first case of death due to COVID-19 as a 55-year-old man passed away at Vijayawada Government General Hospital (GGH). The man had visited the GGH around 11.30 am on March 30 for a check-up, and passed away within an hour, the state government said. The man had underlying health conditions including hypertension and diabetes.
Text: Andhra Pradesh records its first COVID-19 death, 55-year-old Vijayawada man dies Andhra Pradesh recorded its first case of death due to COVID-19 as a 55-year-old man passed away at Vijayawada Government General Hospital (GGH). The man had visited the GGH around 11.30 am on March 30 for a check-up, and passed away within an hour, the state government said. The man had underlying health conditions including hypertension and diabetes.

Headline: Doctor tests +ve for Covid-19 in Dharavi, family put in quarantine: BMC official
Description: A 35-year-old doctor, who has a clinic on the main road in Dharavi area of Mumbai, has tested positive for coronavirus, a BMC official said. "His family is put in quarantine, they'll be tested...for coronavirus. Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation is tracing his contacts. The building where he lives will be quarantined and all high-risk contacts will be traced," the official added.
Text: Doctor tests +ve for Covid-19 in Dharavi, family put in quarantine: BMC official A 35-year-old doctor, who has a clinic on the main road in Dharavi area of Mumbai, has tested positive for coronavirus, a BMC official said. "His family is put in quarantine, they'll be tested...for coronavirus. Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation is tracing his contacts. The building where he lives will be quarantined and all high-risk contacts will be traced," the official added.

Headline: Newborn twins in Raipur named Corona and Covid
Description: A couple in Chhattisgarh's Raipur has named their newborn twins as Corona and Covid. "The delivery happened after facing several difficulties and therefore, me and my husband wanted to make the day memorable," the mother said. Hospital staff started calling the twins as Corona and Covid soon after they were born - which helped the parents make their decision.
Text: Newborn twins in Raipur named Corona and Covid A couple in Chhattisgarh's Raipur has named their newborn twins as Corona and Covid. "The delivery happened after facing several difficulties and therefore, me and my husband wanted to make the day memorable," the mother said. Hospital staff started calling the twins as Corona and Covid soon after they were born - which helped the parents make their decision.

Headline: Ramayan' re-telecast gets highest ratings for a Hindi GEC since 2015
Description: The re-telecast of 'Ramayan' on DD National garnered 170 million viewers in four shows over the last weekend, Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) India said. It added that its rerun has earned the highest-ever rating for a Hindi General Entertainment Channel (GEC) show since 2015, when BARC started measuring TV audience. DD National has been rerunning 'Ramayan' since March 28.
Text: Ramayan' re-telecast gets highest ratings for a Hindi GEC since 2015 The re-telecast of 'Ramayan' on DD National garnered 170 million viewers in four shows over the last weekend, Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) India said. It added that its rerun has earned the highest-ever rating for a Hindi General Entertainment Channel (GEC) show since 2015, when BARC started measuring TV audience. DD National has been rerunning 'Ramayan' since March 28.

Headline: 3 Jamaat attendees test +ve for Covid-19 in Himachal's Una
Description: Three persons who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi have tested positive for coronavirus in Himachal Pradesh's Una, said Deputy Commissioner Sandeep Kumar. He added, "These people are from Mandi district but they were staying at a mosque in Nakroh village. All villagers have been home quarantined." The Jamaat event has been linked to multiple Covid-19 cases across India.
Text: 3 Jamaat attendees test +ve for Covid-19 in Himachal's Una Three persons who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event in Delhi have tested positive for coronavirus in Himachal Pradesh's Una, said Deputy Commissioner Sandeep Kumar. He added, "These people are from Mandi district but they were staying at a mosque in Nakroh village. All villagers have been home quarantined." The Jamaat event has been linked to multiple Covid-19 cases across India.

Headline: No new Covid-19 case reported in Gautam Buddha Nagar in 24hrs: DM
Description: No positive cases of coronavirus have been reported in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar in the last 24 hours, District Magistrate Suhas LY has stated. He added, "Total number of cases in Gautam Buddha Nagar is 48 till now, of which 6 have been cured and discharged." As per government data, there are a total of 113 Covid-19 cases in UP.
Text: No new Covid-19 case reported in Gautam Buddha Nagar in 24hrs: DM No positive cases of coronavirus have been reported in UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar in the last 24 hours, District Magistrate Suhas LY has stated. He added, "Total number of cases in Gautam Buddha Nagar is 48 till now, of which 6 have been cured and discharged." As per government data, there are a total of 113 Covid-19 cases in UP.

Headline: Migrant workers provided with LCD TV, yoga trainer at Haryana shelter
Description: Villagers in Haryana's Fatehabad district have arranged for a yoga trainer for 65 migrant labourers who were stopped from leaving for UP four days ago. The administration has provided an LCD TV and deployed eight policemen to prevent the labourers from fleeing the shelter. A labourer said, "The employees and village sarpanch keep asking us if we're facing any inconvenience."
Text: Migrant workers provided with LCD TV, yoga trainer at Haryana shelter Villagers in Haryana's Fatehabad district have arranged for a yoga trainer for 65 migrant labourers who were stopped from leaving for UP four days ago. The administration has provided an LCD TV and deployed eight policemen to prevent the labourers from fleeing the shelter. A labourer said, "The employees and village sarpanch keep asking us if we're facing any inconvenience."

Headline: Incorrect info: Prince Charles' spokesperson on Ayurveda treatment for COVID-19
Description: The spokesperson of Britain's Prince Charles has denied that the Prince took Ayurvedic medicine to cure himself of coronavirus, calling it "incorrect information". "The Prince of Wales followed medical advice of National Health Service in the UK and nothing more," the spokesperson said. Union Minister Shripad Naik had said that he was informed that Ayurvedic medicine had helped Prince Charles.
Text: Incorrect info: Prince Charles' spokesperson on Ayurveda treatment for COVID-19 The spokesperson of Britain's Prince Charles has denied that the Prince took Ayurvedic medicine to cure himself of coronavirus, calling it "incorrect information". "The Prince of Wales followed medical advice of National Health Service in the UK and nothing more," the spokesperson said. Union Minister Shripad Naik had said that he was informed that Ayurvedic medicine had helped Prince Charles.

Headline: Odisha reports 6th COVID-19 +ve case with travel history to Delhi
Description: The Health and Family Welfare Department of Odisha on Friday confirmed the sixth COVID-19 positive case in Cuttack. The patient has recent travel history to Delhi, added the department. Odisha Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy said that in view of the COVID-19 positive case in Cuttack, the city will be put under complete lockdown for 48 hours from 8 pm today.
Text: Odisha reports 6th COVID-19 +ve case with travel history to Delhi The Health and Family Welfare Department of Odisha on Friday confirmed the sixth COVID-19 positive case in Cuttack. The patient has recent travel history to Delhi, added the department. Odisha Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy said that in view of the COVID-19 positive case in Cuttack, the city will be put under complete lockdown for 48 hours from 8 pm today.

Headline: Lockdown violators should be booked under IPC, Disaster Management Act: Home Secy
Description: Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla on Thursday told states and union territories (UTs) to book anyone who violates lockdown rules under relevant provisions of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) (Section 188) and the Disaster Management Act, 2005 (Section 51 to 60). Anyone obstructing enforcement of lockdown could be punishable for a jail term of up to two years, Bhalla added.
Text: Lockdown violators should be booked under IPC, Disaster Management Act: Home Secy Union Home Secretary Ajay Bhalla on Thursday told states and union territories (UTs) to book anyone who violates lockdown rules under relevant provisions of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) (Section 188) and the Disaster Management Act, 2005 (Section 51 to 60). Anyone obstructing enforcement of lockdown could be punishable for a jail term of up to two years, Bhalla added.

Headline: 6 Jamaat attendees test +ve in Agra, total Covid-19 cases reach 18
Description: Six out of the 28 people from Agra who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have tested positive for coronavirus, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh has stated. Following this, the total number of positive cases in Agra has risen to 18, of which 8 have been discharged, Singh added.
Text: 6 Jamaat attendees test +ve in Agra, total Covid-19 cases reach 18 Six out of the 28 people from Agra who attended the Tablighi Jamaat event at Nizamuddin Markaz in Delhi have tested positive for coronavirus, Agra District Magistrate Prabhu N Singh has stated. Following this, the total number of positive cases in Agra has risen to 18, of which 8 have been discharged, Singh added.

Headline: There was shortage of safety gear: Gurugram doctor after recovering from Covid-19
Description: A doctor who worked at COVID-19 sample collection lab of a Civil Hospital in Gurugram and had tested positive on March 20 said after recovery that there was an inadequate supply of safety kits. The doctor, who is under 14-day home quarantine before she takes charge of the lab again, said the issue of safety kits has been resolved now.
Text: There was shortage of safety gear: Gurugram doctor after recovering from Covid-19 A doctor who worked at COVID-19 sample collection lab of a Civil Hospital in Gurugram and had tested positive on March 20 said after recovery that there was an inadequate supply of safety kits. The doctor, who is under 14-day home quarantine before she takes charge of the lab again, said the issue of safety kits has been resolved now.

Headline: Kolkata police officers sing song about Covid-19, applauded by locals
Description: Several police officers in Kolkata sang a song to raise awareness about coronavirus and asked people to stay indoors, amid the nationwide lockdown. Residents in the locality applauded the police officers, who were seen holding their phones with the flashlights turned on during the performance. Notably, there are a total of 53 positive cases of coronavirus in West Bengal.
Text: Kolkata police officers sing song about Covid-19, applauded by locals  Several police officers in Kolkata sang a song to raise awareness about coronavirus and asked people to stay indoors, amid the nationwide lockdown. Residents in the locality applauded the police officers, who were seen holding their phones with the flashlights turned on during the performance. Notably, there are a total of 53 positive cases of coronavirus in West Bengal.

Headline: Army goes door-to-door to distribute free ration in J&K's Poonch
Description: Amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic, Indian Army personnel went door-to-door to distribute free ration among needy people in the Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. A resident said, "We are thankful to the Army that they helped us... They also said that they have more ration and if required, they would help us."
Text: Army goes door-to-door to distribute free ration in J&K's Poonch Amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic, Indian Army personnel went door-to-door to distribute free ration among needy people in the Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir on Friday. A resident said, "We are thankful to the Army that they helped us... They also said that they have more ration and if required, they would help us."

Headline: 3 held for misbehaving with B'luru ASHA workers on COVID-19 duty
Description: At least three people were arrested on Thursday for allegedly misbehaving with ASHA workers in Sadiq Nagar, Bengaluru. The incident took place when the workers went to the area to collect details of suspected COVID-19 patients. Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao said that an investigation has been initiated and that ASHA workers will get police protection to do their jobs.
Text: 3 held for misbehaving with B'luru ASHA workers on COVID-19 duty At least three people were arrested on Thursday for allegedly misbehaving with ASHA workers in Sadiq Nagar, Bengaluru. The incident took place when the workers went to the area to collect details of suspected COVID-19 patients. Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao said that an investigation has been initiated and that ASHA workers will get police protection to do their jobs.

Headline: 78-year-old coronavirus patient passes away in Gujarat
Description: A 78-year-old man who had tested positive for coronavirus died late on Thursday night in Vadodara, Gujarat, said a state government official. The deceased, who was a resident of Panchmahal area in Godhra district, was undergoing treatment at a hospital in Vadodara. A day ago, a 52-year-old COVID-19 patient with travel history to Sri Lanka had passed away in Vadodara.
Text: 78-year-old coronavirus patient passes away in Gujarat A 78-year-old man who had tested positive for coronavirus died late on Thursday night in Vadodara, Gujarat, said a state government official. The deceased, who was a resident of Panchmahal area in Godhra district, was undergoing treatment at a hospital in Vadodara. A day ago, a 52-year-old COVID-19 patient with travel history to Sri Lanka had passed away in Vadodara.

Headline: Those attacking police during lockdown will be booked under NSA: UP govt
Description: In view of instances of attacks on policemen and health workers in the state, the Uttar Pradesh government has said those who target police personnel in the state during the coronavirus lockdown will be booked under National Security Act (NSA). Members of Tablighi Jamaat, who allegedly misbehaved with female nursing staff at a hospital, have also been booked under NSA.
Text: Those attacking police during lockdown will be booked under NSA: UP govt In view of instances of attacks on policemen and health workers in the state, the Uttar Pradesh government has said those who target police personnel in the state during the coronavirus lockdown will be booked under National Security Act (NSA). Members of Tablighi Jamaat, who allegedly misbehaved with female nursing staff at a hospital, have also been booked under NSA.

Headline: Female nurses, policewomen won't attend Tablighi Jamaat participants: UP govt
Description: Uttar Pradesh government has said that no female health workers and female police personnel will be deployed for medical services and security of Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees. This comes after attendees, quarantined at Ghaziabad's MMG Hospital, allegedly misbehaved with nurses. Ghaziabad CMO complained to police that men have been making vulgar signs at nurses.
Text: Female nurses, policewomen won't attend Tablighi Jamaat participants: UP govt Uttar Pradesh government has said that no female health workers and female police personnel will be deployed for medical services and security of Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees. This comes after attendees, quarantined at Ghaziabad's MMG Hospital, allegedly misbehaved with nurses. Ghaziabad CMO complained to police that men have been making vulgar signs at nurses.

Headline: Yay! New task is here: Taapsee on PM's 'light diyas' message
Description: Taapsee Pannu on Friday reacted to PM Narendra Modi's message wherein he urged people to switch off lights and light candles, diyas, etc for 9 minutes at 9 pm on Sunday to show solidarity and mark India's fight against coronavirus. "New task is here...yayy!" she tweeted. Meanwhile, filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "[Modi] knows how to lead Indians emotionally and spiritually."
Text: Yay! New task is here: Taapsee on PM's 'light diyas' message Taapsee Pannu on Friday reacted to PM Narendra Modi's message wherein he urged people to switch off lights and light candles, diyas, etc for 9 minutes at 9 pm on Sunday to show solidarity and mark India's fight against coronavirus. "New task is here...yayy!" she tweeted. Meanwhile, filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "[Modi] knows how to lead Indians emotionally and spiritually."

Headline: Modi is greatest leader in world, Trump pales in comparison: Hansal
Description: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta on Friday retweeted former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha's tweet which stated that PM Narendra Modi's message to light a candle on April 5 should not be limited to India alone. "He's (Modi) the greatest world leader today," Yashwant added. "I agree...Donald Trump pales in comparison. We must ensure every American, [Italian, Spaniard, Britisher] does same," Hansal wrote.
Text: Modi is greatest leader in world, Trump pales in comparison: Hansal Filmmaker Hansal Mehta on Friday retweeted former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha's tweet which stated that PM Narendra Modi's message to light a candle on April 5 should not be limited to India alone. "He's (Modi) the greatest world leader today," Yashwant added. "I agree...Donald Trump pales in comparison. We must ensure every American, [Italian, Spaniard, Britisher] does same," Hansal wrote.

Headline: Amritsar police distribute food to needy amid lockdown
Description: Police officers in Punjab's Amritsar distributed food items to the needy on Thursday, amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. While distributing the food items, the police personnel were seen maintaining and ensuring social distancing. Earlier, pictures of police personnel preparing food for the needy in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj had gone viral on social media.
Text: Amritsar police distribute food to needy amid lockdown Police officers in Punjab's Amritsar distributed food items to the needy on Thursday, amid the nationwide lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. While distributing the food items, the police personnel were seen maintaining and ensuring social distancing. Earlier, pictures of police personnel preparing food for the needy in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj had gone viral on social media.

Headline: 130 cr Indians united but Cong playing petty politics: Shah on COVID-19
Description: Home Minister Amit Shah said that 130 crore Indians are united to defeat COVID-19 but Congress party is playing "petty politics" amid the pandemic. "It's high time Congress think of national interest...stop misleading people," Shah added. This comes after Sonia Gandhi said that the way 21-day lockdown was imposed with few hours of prior information created problems for common people.
Text: 130 cr Indians united but Cong playing petty politics: Shah on COVID-19 Home Minister Amit Shah said that 130 crore Indians are united to defeat COVID-19 but Congress party is playing "petty politics" amid the pandemic. "It's high time Congress think of national interest...stop misleading people," Shah added. This comes after Sonia Gandhi said that the way 21-day lockdown was imposed with few hours of prior information created problems for common people.

Headline: Mumbai Muslim man who died of COVID-19 cremated after burial denied
Description: A 65-year-old Muslim man from Mumbai, who died of COVID-19, was cremated after officials at a cemetery denied burial, his family said. "This was despite...local civic authorities giving permission for the burial at 4 am," a family member added. "His family took his body directly to Malad Malwani Kabrastan without informing anyone...then demanded his burial," a local MLA said.
Text: Mumbai Muslim man who died of COVID-19 cremated after burial denied A 65-year-old Muslim man from Mumbai, who died of COVID-19, was cremated after officials at a cemetery denied burial, his family said. "This was despite...local civic authorities giving permission for the burial at 4 am," a family member added. "His family took his body directly to Malad Malwani Kabrastan without informing anyone...then demanded his burial," a local MLA said.

Headline: Lockdown can reduce COVID-19 pandemic peak by 43%: ICMR research
Description: An Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) study has suggested that lockdown is not the "final solution" to alleviate COVID-19 pandemic. "It'll reduce...highest number of new cases in a single day (peak) by 43%...total mortality (deaths) by 19%," it added. The research further stated that an aggressive test-and-quarantine strategy can bring down the peak by 71% and mortality by 40%.
Text: Lockdown can reduce COVID-19 pandemic peak by 43%: ICMR research An Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) study has suggested that lockdown is not the "final solution" to alleviate COVID-19 pandemic. "It'll reduce...highest number of new cases in a single day (peak) by 43%...total mortality (deaths) by 19%," it added. The research further stated that an aggressive test-and-quarantine strategy can bring down the peak by 71% and mortality by 40%.

Headline: We will light diyas but please listen to economists: Chidambaram to PM
Description: After PM Narendra Modi asked all Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for nine minutes, Congress' P Chidambaram tweeted, "We'll listen to you...in return, please listen to... wise counsel of...economists." "What we expected from you was...generous livelihood support package for...poor...who were totally ignored by FM Nirmala Sitharaman," he added.
Text: We will light diyas but please listen to economists: Chidambaram to PM After PM Narendra Modi asked all Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for nine minutes, Congress' P Chidambaram tweeted, "We'll listen to you...in return, please listen to... wise counsel of...economists." "What we expected from you was...generous livelihood support package for...poor...who were totally ignored by FM Nirmala Sitharaman," he added.

Headline: Railways offers on-demand parcel trains to e-commerce platforms
Description: Indian railways has offered to transport parcels of e-commerce platforms to different parts of the country. "State governments, local industries, e-commerce companies, interested groups, individuals can contact Railway officials at stations/divisions," it said. So far 30 parcel trains loaded by Indian Railways have been transporting essential items to various parts of the country.
Text: Railways offers on-demand parcel trains to e-commerce platforms Indian railways has offered to transport parcels of e-commerce platforms to different parts of the country. "State governments, local industries, e-commerce companies, interested groups, individuals can contact Railway officials at stations/divisions," it said. So far 30 parcel trains loaded by Indian Railways have been transporting essential items to various parts of the country.

Headline: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 2,301, death toll reaches 56
Description: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,301, while the death toll has reached 56. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 157. Meanwhile, the World Bank approved $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight coronavirus.
Text: Coronavirus cases in India rise to 2,301, death toll reaches 56 The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Friday said that the number of coronavirus cases in India has risen to 2,301, while the death toll has reached 56. The total number of people who have been cured, discharged or migrated stands at 157. Meanwhile, the World Bank approved $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight coronavirus.

Headline: World Bank approves $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight COVID-19
Description: The World Bank has approved an initial $1.9 billion in emergency funds for coronavirus response operations in 25 countries. India will receive $1 billion to "support better screening, contact tracing, and laboratory diagnostics; procure personal protective equipment; and set up new isolation wards". The bank said it's prepared to spend $160 billion over the next 15 months to combat COVID-19.
Text: World Bank approves $1 billion in emergency funds for India to fight COVID-19 The World Bank has approved an initial $1.9 billion in emergency funds for coronavirus response operations in 25 countries. India will receive $1 billion to "support better screening, contact tracing, and laboratory diagnostics; procure personal protective equipment; and set up new isolation wards". The bank said it's prepared to spend $160 billion over the next 15 months to combat COVID-19.

Headline: Let's switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes: PM
Description: Amid the nationwide lockdown, PM Narendra Modi has asked all Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes. "Don't go out on streets. Do it from your doors or balconies. Maintain social distancing," he said. "Remember, none of us is alone in this fight against coronavirus," he added.
Text: Let's switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes: PM Amid the nationwide lockdown, PM Narendra Modi has asked all Indians to switch off lights on April 5 at 9 pm and light a candle or diya for 9 minutes. "Don't go out on streets. Do it from your doors or balconies. Maintain social distancing," he said. "Remember, none of us is alone in this fight against coronavirus," he added.

Headline: Sorry on behalf of entire country: Sunil Chhetri to Northeast people facing racism
Description: Addressing Northeast people who faced racism amid the coronavirus pandemic, India football team captain Sunil Chhetri said, "I'm sorry on behalf of the whole country." In a message to the attackers, Chhetri said, "What if the virus originated from a place where people look like you and entire country turned against you. Just don't do it. Just put some brains."
Text: Sorry on behalf of entire country: Sunil Chhetri to Northeast people facing racism Addressing Northeast people who faced racism amid the coronavirus pandemic, India football team captain Sunil Chhetri said, "I'm sorry on behalf of the whole country." In a message to the attackers, Chhetri said, "What if the virus originated from a place where people look like you and entire country turned against you. Just don't do it. Just put some brains."

Headline: Locals in Bihar's Gaya shower flower petals on sanitation workers
Description: The residents of Gurudwara Road in Bihar's Gaya showed their appreciation toward sanitation workers on Thursday by showering flower petals on them as they passed through a lane, amid the lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, locals in Punjab's Nabha had showered flower petals on sanitation workers and offered a garland of currency notes to one of them.
Text: Locals in Bihar's Gaya shower flower petals on sanitation workers The residents of Gurudwara Road in Bihar's Gaya showed their appreciation toward sanitation workers on Thursday by showering flower petals on them as they passed through a lane, amid the lockdown due to the coronavirus pandemic. Earlier, locals in Punjab's Nabha had showered flower petals on sanitation workers and offered a garland of currency notes to one of them.

Headline: Lockdown in India was early, far-sighted and courageous: WHO envoy
Description: Speaking about India's approach to fight coronavirus, WHO envoy Dr David Nabarro said, "The lockdown in India was quite early on, when there was relatively a small number of cases detected. This was...a far-sighted decision." "To do it (lockdown) now...as opposed to waiting three or four weeks later when the virus is much more widespread, was very courageous," he added
Text: Lockdown in India was early, far-sighted and courageous: WHO envoy Speaking about India's approach to fight coronavirus, WHO envoy Dr David Nabarro said, "The lockdown in India was quite early on, when there was relatively a small number of cases detected. This was...a far-sighted decision." "To do it (lockdown) now...as opposed to waiting three or four weeks later when the virus is much more widespread, was very courageous," he added

Headline: Banks to deposit ₹500 in Jan Dhan accounts of women from today
Description: Banks will start depositing ₹500 per month in Jan Dhan accounts held by women from April 3 under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana, the Indian Banks' Association said. The relief measure was announced by the government last month to mitigate the impact of the 21-day nationwide lockdown. This is the first of the three monthly instalments, totalling to ₹1,500.
Text: Banks to deposit ₹500 in Jan Dhan accounts of women from today Banks will start depositing ₹500 per month in Jan Dhan accounts held by women from April 3 under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana, the Indian Banks' Association said. The relief measure was announced by the government last month to mitigate the impact of the 21-day nationwide lockdown. This is the first of the three monthly instalments, totalling to ₹1,500.

Headline: I've been told Ayurveda behind Prince Charles' recovery from Covid-19: MoS AYUSH
Description: Ayurvedic medicine helped Prince Charles, Britain's heir to the throne, to be cured of coronavirus, Union Minister of State for AYUSH Shripad Naik said. "I received a phone call from Dr Isaac Mathai...He told me his treatment of Prince Charles through Ayurveda and Homeopathy has been successful. This is just one example of how the system can work," Naik said.
Text: I've been told Ayurveda behind Prince Charles' recovery from Covid-19: MoS AYUSH Ayurvedic medicine helped Prince Charles, Britain's heir to the throne, to be cured of coronavirus, Union Minister of State for AYUSH Shripad Naik said. "I received a phone call from Dr Isaac Mathai...He told me his treatment of Prince Charles through Ayurveda and Homeopathy has been successful. This is just one example of how the system can work," Naik said.

Headline: WhatsApp group admin and member arrested over COVID-19 rumour
Description: Police said that a WhatsApp group admin, Yusuf Khan, and a member of the group, Firoz Khan, were arrested on Thursday in Greater Noida after Firoz posted a rumour about coronavirus. Police said the post could have triggered panic and led to communal violence. The WhatsApp group also included some local police officials who took note of the matter.
Text: WhatsApp group admin and member arrested over COVID-19 rumour Police said that a WhatsApp group admin, Yusuf Khan, and a member of the group, Firoz Khan, were arrested on Thursday in Greater Noida after Firoz posted a rumour about coronavirus. Police said the post could have triggered panic and led to communal violence. The WhatsApp group also included some local police officials who took note of the matter.

Headline: Prepare or suffer: CDS General Bipin Rawat on coronavirus pandemic
Description: Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat has said that India must break the Covid-19 virus chain by April 14, through the lockdown and social distancing, or be prepared to weather the long-term consequences of the pandemic. Rawat added, "The military dictum is 'prepare or perish', but in these times of Covid-19 we've refined it to 'prepare or suffer’."
Text: Prepare or suffer: CDS General Bipin Rawat on coronavirus pandemic Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) General Bipin Rawat has said that India must break the Covid-19 virus chain by April 14, through the lockdown and social distancing, or be prepared to weather the long-term consequences of the pandemic. Rawat added, "The military dictum is 'prepare or perish', but in these times of Covid-19 we've refined it to 'prepare or suffer’."

Headline: Delhi govt provides lunch, dinner to 6 lakh people amid lockdown
Description: The Delhi government said that it provided both lunch and dinner to nearly 6 lakh needy people on Thursday. CM Arvind Kejriwal added, "We'll feed 10-12 lakh people from tomorrow. We've found that people are crowding at food centres, hence we decided to create more centres." Earlier, the government had put up locations of hunger relief centres on Google Maps.
Text: Delhi govt provides lunch, dinner to 6 lakh people amid lockdown The Delhi government said that it provided both lunch and dinner to nearly 6 lakh needy people on Thursday. CM Arvind Kejriwal added, "We'll feed 10-12 lakh people from tomorrow. We've found that people are crowding at food centres, hence we decided to create more centres." Earlier, the government had put up locations of hunger relief centres on Google Maps.

Headline: MP govt slaps National Security Act on 4 accused who pelted stones at health workers
Description: The Madhya Pradesh government has slapped the National Security Act on the four accused who were involved in stone-pelting on healthcare workers in Indore's Tatpatti Bakhal area. The four accused include 28-year-old Mohammad Mustafa, 32-year-old Mohammad Gulrez, 36-year-old Shoaib and 50-year-old Majid. The workers had gone to the area for tracing contacts of a coronavirus positive patient.
Text: MP govt slaps National Security Act on 4 accused who pelted stones at health workers The Madhya Pradesh government has slapped the National Security Act on the four accused who were involved in stone-pelting on healthcare workers in Indore's Tatpatti Bakhal area. The four accused include 28-year-old Mohammad Mustafa, 32-year-old Mohammad Gulrez, 36-year-old Shoaib and 50-year-old Majid. The workers had gone to the area for tracing contacts of a coronavirus positive patient.

Headline: Way we thanked those fighting against Covid-19 is now model for other nations: PM
Description: PM Narendra Modi released a video message for the citizens of India, wherein he said, "The way you paid gratitude to people fighting against Covid-19 on March 22 has become a model that's being emulated by other countries." "Janata curfew and ringing of bells or clanging utensils, made the country aware of its unity amid this challenging time," he added.
Text: Way we thanked those fighting against Covid-19 is now model for other nations: PM PM Narendra Modi released a video message for the citizens of India, wherein he said, "The way you paid gratitude to people fighting against Covid-19 on March 22 has become a model that's being emulated by other countries." "Janata curfew and ringing of bells or clanging utensils, made the country aware of its unity amid this challenging time," he added.

Headline: Maharashtra had cancelled mid-March Tablighi meet of 50,000 people
Description: Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has stated that the state police had cancelled a Tablighi Jamaat event, which was to be held in mid-March and expected to have around 50,000 attendees. Stating that the organisers of the event refused to cancel it at first, Deshmukh added, "We told them if they went ahead, we will have to take legal action."
Text: Maharashtra had cancelled mid-March Tablighi meet of 50,000 people Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh has stated that the state police had cancelled a Tablighi Jamaat event, which was to be held in mid-March and expected to have around 50,000 attendees. Stating that the organisers of the event refused to cancel it at first, Deshmukh added, "We told them if they went ahead, we will have to take legal action."

Headline: Tablighi Jamaat patients making vulgar signs, roaming without pants: Ghaziabad CMO
Description: Ghaziabad CMO has complained to police saying that the Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees, who've been put under observation for coronavirus infection, have been misbehaving with a Ghaziabad hospital staff. The complaint stated the men have been roaming around without pants, making obscene signs at nurses and are listening to vulgar songs. They also asked staff for 'beedis', he added.
Text: Tablighi Jamaat patients making vulgar signs, roaming without pants: Ghaziabad CMO Ghaziabad CMO has complained to police saying that the Tablighi Jamaat Markaz event attendees, who've been put under observation for coronavirus infection, have been misbehaving with a Ghaziabad hospital staff. The complaint stated the men have been roaming around without pants, making obscene signs at nurses and are listening to vulgar songs. They also asked staff for 'beedis', he added.

Headline: Doctors visit Indore area again after being attacked, say 'We have to do our job'
Description: Doctors and health workers, who were attacked by locals in Indore's Tatpatti Bakhal, visited the same area on Wednesday to carry out coronavirus screening services. One of the doctors Zakiya Sayed said, "We have sustained injuries but we have to do our job and will not be scared." A video of the incident showed locals pelting stones at them.
Text: Doctors visit Indore area again after being attacked, say 'We have to do our job' Doctors and health workers, who were attacked by locals in Indore's Tatpatti Bakhal, visited the same area on Wednesday to carry out coronavirus screening services. One of the doctors Zakiya Sayed said, "We have sustained injuries but we have to do our job and will not be scared." A video of the incident showed locals pelting stones at them.

Headline: Punjab CM skips video-conference with PM to attend Congress meeting
Description: Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Thursday skipped PM Narendra Modi's video-conference with Chief Ministers to attend the Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting chaired by party chief Sonia Gandhi. Punjab was represented at the PM's meeting by Chief Secretary Karan Avtar Singh and DGP Dinkar Gupta, who said that 51 private labs had been engaged for coronavirus testing in the state.
Text: Punjab CM skips video-conference with PM to attend Congress meeting Punjab CM Amarinder Singh on Thursday skipped PM Narendra Modi's video-conference with Chief Ministers to attend the Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting chaired by party chief Sonia Gandhi. Punjab was represented at the PM's meeting by Chief Secretary Karan Avtar Singh and DGP Dinkar Gupta, who said that 51 private labs had been engaged for coronavirus testing in the state.

Headline: Social distancing will do wonders, not testing centres: Karnataka CM
Description: Amid rising coronavirus cases, CM BS Yediyurappa said Karnataka has seven testing centres and his government is buying more than one lakh rapid testing kits from abroad. "Isolation...physical distancing will do wonders...not the testing centres," he added. "More you isolate...distance the people from mingling...more we will be able to control the novel coronavirus," Yediyurappa further said.
Text: Social distancing will do wonders, not testing centres: Karnataka CM Amid rising coronavirus cases, CM BS Yediyurappa said Karnataka has seven testing centres and his government is buying more than one lakh rapid testing kits from abroad. "Isolation...physical distancing will do wonders...not the testing centres," he added. "More you isolate...distance the people from mingling...more we will be able to control the novel coronavirus," Yediyurappa further said.

Headline: Prez to hold 2nd video conference with governors, LGs over COVID-19
Description: President Ram Nath Kovind and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu will hold a second video-conference from Rashtrapati Bhavan on Friday with governors of all states and lieutenant governors (LGs) of union territories over COVID-19. The conference will witness discussions on the status of COVID-19 in the states, the role of voluntary organisations and private sector in containing the COVID-19 spread.
Text: Prez to hold 2nd video conference with governors, LGs over COVID-19 President Ram Nath Kovind and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu will hold a second video-conference from Rashtrapati Bhavan on Friday with governors of all states and lieutenant governors (LGs) of union territories over COVID-19. The conference will witness discussions on the status of COVID-19 in the states, the role of voluntary organisations and private sector in containing the COVID-19 spread.

Headline: 3 in Bihar booked for naming COVID-19 patient on social media
Description: Police on Thursday lodged an FIR against three people in Bihar's Begusarai for allegedly revealing the identity of a COVID-19 patient on social media. "The accused...revealed the identity of the patient in separate WhatsApp groups," Begusarai SP said. Union Ministry of Health had issued a directive to maintain strict confidentiality on the identity of confirmed and suspected COVID-19 patients.
Text: 3 in Bihar booked for naming COVID-19 patient on social media Police on Thursday lodged an FIR against three people in Bihar's Begusarai for allegedly revealing the identity of a COVID-19 patient on social media. "The accused...revealed the identity of the patient in separate WhatsApp groups," Begusarai SP said. Union Ministry of Health had issued a directive to maintain strict confidentiality on the identity of confirmed and suspected COVID-19 patients.

Headline: Virus knows no caste, creed or religion: Sadhguru amid lockdown
Description: Amid coronavirus pandemic, Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev tweeted a video and said that the virus knows no caste, creed or religion. "Let's not compound our problems by creating divisions in society on the basis of religion," he added. "Do not propagate ideas that...a particular religion is the basis of the spread of coronavirus," Sadhuguru can be heard saying in the video.
Text: Virus knows no caste, creed or religion: Sadhguru amid lockdown Amid coronavirus pandemic, Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev tweeted a video and said that the virus knows no caste, creed or religion. "Let's not compound our problems by creating divisions in society on the basis of religion," he added. "Do not propagate ideas that...a particular religion is the basis of the spread of coronavirus," Sadhuguru can be heard saying in the video.

Headline: Sonia's statements amid lockdown insensitive: BJP's JP Nadda
Description: BJP National President JP Nadda said that Congress' Sonia Gandhi's statements amid coronavirus lockdown are "insensitive" and "unnecessary politicisation of the crisis". "There will be time for politics after we defeat the coronavirus," he added. Sonia had said that 21-day nationwide lockdown was "necessary but unplanned" and it caused chaos and pain in the lives of migrant workers.
Text: Sonia's statements amid lockdown insensitive: BJP's JP Nadda BJP National President JP Nadda said that Congress' Sonia Gandhi's statements amid coronavirus lockdown are "insensitive" and "unnecessary politicisation of the crisis". "There will be time for politics after we defeat the coronavirus," he added. Sonia had said that 21-day nationwide lockdown was "necessary but unplanned" and it caused chaos and pain in the lives of migrant workers.

Headline: International flights may resume from April 15 on case-by-case basis: Govt
Description: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Puri said the government would like to ensure that international flights are resumed on a case by case basis after the ongoing 21-day nationwide lockdown ends on April 15. "Health and home ministries have to assess that the COVID-19 outbreak is under control in other affected countries before international flights become operational again," an official said.
Text: International flights may resume from April 15 on case-by-case basis: Govt Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Puri said the government would like to ensure that international flights are resumed on a case by case basis after the ongoing 21-day nationwide lockdown ends on April 15.
